hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַלּוֹקֵחַ עוּבַּר חֲמוֹרוֹ שֶׁל נָכְרִי, וְהַמּוֹכֵר לוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי, הַמִּשְׁתַּתֵּף לוֹ, וְהַמְקַבֵּל הֵימֶנּוּ, וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה — פָּטוּר מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״, אֲבָל לֹא בַּאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: one who purchases the fetus of a donkey that belongs to a gentile, and one who sells to although he is not permitted one who enters into a partnership with and one who receives from and one who gives to in receivership, exempt from the firstborn status, as it is stated: in Israel, but not upon others.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who acquires the unborn fetus of a non-Jew's donkey, and then sells it to another, even though he is not permitted to do so, the one who participates with him, and the one who receives it from him, and the one who gives it as a gift through acquisition - is exempt from the firstborn animal offering, as it is stated: "among the children of Israel," but not among others.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כׇּל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Why do I all these
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma, kol hanei l'mah li?" Translation: "Complete, all these to me why?"

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא לוֹקֵחַ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ לִקְדוּשָּׁה, אֲבָל מוֹכֵר דְּקָא מַפְקַע לַהּ מִקְּדוּשָּׁה — אֵימָא לִיקְנְסֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: are necessary. As, had taught purchases I would say because brings it to sanctity But sells where he abrogates sanctity, say should penalize him [ likneseih ] teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, for if a Tanna teaches that he acquires - I would have said that it is because he brings it into sanctity, but if he sells, which causes it to be removed from sanctity - say that he should acquire it, for this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: וְהַמִּשְׁתַּתֵּף לוֹ, לְמָה לִי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: שׁוּתָּפוּת גּוֹיִ חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דִּפְטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: And why do I one who enters into a partnership with to exclude of Rabbi Yehuda, who says: partnership a gentile is obligated, a firstborn. teaches us that is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: And one who partners with him, why do I need it? To go out from Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Partnership of a non-Jew is obligated in firstborn, it is heard to us that she is exempt from firstborn.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקַבֵּל, לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה.
human_translation: And why do I one who receives because wants to teach And one who gives to in receivership,
llm_translation: "And the one who receives, why do I need it? Because he wants to learn to give, and the one who gives to him in reception."

hebrew_text: וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְעִיקַּר בְּהֵמָה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא, לִיקְנְסֵיהּ, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בִּבְהֵמָה אַחֲרִיתִי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And why do I one who gives to in receivership was necessary, enter your mind to say since the primary animal belongs to the Jew, should penalize him lest be confused with another animal teaches us
llm_translation: And one who gives it to him as a gift, why do I need it? It is necessary, for I might have thought: Since the main part of the animal belongs to Israel, let him acquire it, lest he come to exchange it for another animal, it has been heard for us.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בַּשְּׁבוּרָה, בֶּן בְּתִירָא מַתִּיר בַּסּוּס.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere Rabbi Yehuda deems of a damaged permitted and ben Beteira deems of a horse permitted,
llm_translation: We learned there: Rabbi Yehuda permits with a shvurah, Ben B'tira permits with a sus.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עוּבָּר מָה לִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָתָם דְּשָׁרֵי, מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁבוּרָה, עוּבָּר נָמֵי שָׁבוּר הוּא. אוֹ דִלְמָא: שְׁבוּרָה לָאו הַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ, אֲבָל עוּבָּר, כֵּיוָן דְּהַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ, לָאו שָׁבוּר הוּא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a fetus, what Rabbi Yehuda say to me reason that Rabbi Yehuda deems permitted there because damaged and a fetus is also damaged Or, perhaps a damaged that is not its natural But a fetus, since that is its natural is not damaged,
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the difference, said Rabbi Yehuda? The reason of Rabbi Yehuda there is because it is permitted, due to it being broken, a limb is also broken. Or perhaps: Broken is not its way, but a limb, since it is its way, is not broken?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וְהַמּוֹכֵר לוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי. וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Come hear And one who sells to although is not permitted And Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: ve'hamocher lo, af al pi she'eino rashai. Ve'lo plig Rabbi Yehuda." English translation: "Come and hear: And the seller to him, even though he is not authorized. And Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree."

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הַמִּשְׁתַּתֵּף לוֹ, וְהַמְקַבֵּל מִמֶּנּוּ, וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, דְּלָא קָתָנֵי — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא פְּלִיג?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, one who enters into a partnership with and one who receives from and one who gives to in receivership, which does not teach so too that he does not disagree
llm_translation: "And to taste, one who participates with him, and one who receives from him, and one who gives to him in a kabbalah, for it is not taught — is it not so that he does not disagree?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא — פְּלִיג, וְלָא קָתָנֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי — פְּלִיג, וְלָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, does disagree, but does not teach Here too, he disagrees, but does not teach
llm_translation: Rather — he disputes, but it is not taught. Here too — he disputes, but it is not taught.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, הַמְקַבֵּל בְּהֵמָה מִן הַגּוֹי וְיָלְדָה — מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשׇׁוְויוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן חֲצִי דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן. וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי — קוֹנְסִים אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמָיו, וְנוֹתֵן כׇּל דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says one who receives an animal from a gentile and it gave birth they assess its value, and gives half of its value to the priest And one who gives in receivership even though he is not permitted penalize him up to ten its value, and he gives all of its value to the priest.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehuda says, one who receives an animal from a non-Jew and it gives birth - we elevate it with its equal value, and give half of its blood to the priest. And one who acquires it through a transaction, even though he is not permitted - we fine him up to ten times its value, and give all of its blood to the priest.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו אַעוּבָּר? לָא, אַבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: What, is it not to the fetus No, to the animal
llm_translation: What is "Lav A'uvbar"? Not, an animal.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״דָּמָיו״ קָתָנֵי! תְּנִי ״דָּמֶיהָ״. וְהָא ״נוֹתֵן כׇּל דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן״ קָתָנֵי, וְאִי בְּהֵמָה — כֹּהֵן מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ בְּהֵמָה מְעַבַּרְתָּא לְפַטּוֹמַהּ, דְּמִיגּוֹ דְּקָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ אַבְּהֵמָה, קָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ אַעוּבָּר.
human_translation: But doesn’t teach: its value [ damav ], Teach its value [ dameha ], But doesn’t it teach: He gives all of its value to the priest? And if the animal what is the relevance of Here we are dealing with where gave a pregnant animal to fatten it Since we penalize him for the animal we penalize him with regard to the fetus
llm_translation: The text reads: "And here it states 'its blood'! Teach 'her blood'. And here it states 'giving all his blood to the kohen', and if with an animal — what does the kohen do with it? Here we are dealing with what? For example, if one gives him an animal as a gift for its offspring, since we penalize him with the animal, we penalize him with its offspring."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בַּשְּׁבוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת. הָא יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת — אָסַר, וְהָא עוּבָּר נָמֵי כְּיָכוֹל לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת דָּמֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda deems a damaged permitted, because it is incapable of being cured. capable of being cured, deems prohibited. And a fetus also similar to able to be cured, Learn from it
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda permits a bandage, because it cannot heal. If it can heal - he prohibits it, and a wound near the eye is considered as if it can heal. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין, וְהַמּוֹכֵר לוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בַּשְּׁבוּרָה!
human_translation: And there are those who teach to the mishna: one who sells to although he is not permitted Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda deems of a damaged permitted
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her a matnitin, and the seller to him, even though he is not eligible. Let us say a matnitin that is not like Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda permits in the case of a broken one!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — שְׁבוּרָה, לָאו הַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ; עוּבָּר, הַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Yehuda, a damaged that is not its natural a fetus, since it is its natural
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda - it is broken, it is not its way; it is over, it is its way.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמְקַבֵּל בְּהֵמָה מִן הַגּוֹי וְיָלְדָה — מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן חֲצִי דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן. וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמָיו, וְנוֹתֵן כׇּל דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן. מַאי לָאו אַעוּבָּר? לָא, אַבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says one who receives an animal from a gentile and it gave birth they assess its value, and gives half of its value to the priest And one who gives in receivership even though he is not permitted penalize him up to ten its value, and he gives all of its value to the priest. What, is it not to the fetus No, to the animal
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who receives an animal from a non-Jew and it gives birth - we raise it in its value, and give half of its blood to the priest. And one who acquires it through a transaction, even though he is not permitted - we penalize him up to ten times its value, and give all of its blood to the priest. What is the reason? Is it not a case of crossing over? No, it is an animal.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דָּמָיו קָתָנֵי! תְּנִי ״דָּמֶיהָ״. וְהָא ״נוֹתֵן כָּל דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן״ קָתָנֵי, וְאִי בְּהֵמָה — כֹּהֵן מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּיָהֵיב בְּהֵמָה מְעַבַּרְתָּא לְפַטּוֹמַהּ, דְּמִיגּוֹ דְּקָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ אַבְּהֵמָה — קָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ אַעוּבָּר.
human_translation: But doesn’t teach: its value [ damav ], Teach its value [ dameha ], But doesn’t it teach: He gives all of its value to the priest? And if the animal what is the relevance of Here we are dealing with where gave a pregnant animal to fatten it Since we penalize him for the animal we penalize him with regard to the fetus
llm_translation: And this that its blood is small! It teaches "its blood." And this "gives all its blood to the kohen" it teaches, and if with an animal — what is the kohen's task? Here, with what are we dealing — for example, when one gives an animal as a trespass offering to his fellow, since we penalize him with an animal — we penalize him with a trespass offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בַּשְּׁבוּרָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת. הָא יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת — אָסוּר, וְהַאי נָמֵי כְּיָכוֹל לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת דָּמֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda deems a damaged permitted, because it is incapable of being cured. capable of being cured, deems prohibited. And this also similar to able to be cured, Learn from it
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehuda permits a bandage, because it cannot heal. If it can heal - it is prohibited, and this case is similar to one that can heal. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מָכַר בְּהֵמָה לְעוּבָּרֶיהָ, מַאי? תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before sold an animal to its fetuses, what Let the dilemma be raised according to Rabbi Yehuda, let the dilemma be raised according to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He asked them: If one sells an animal with its fetus, what is the law? Let him ask Rabbi Yehuda, let him ask the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עַד כָּאן לָא קָא שָׁרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּרָה, דְּלָא אָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי, אֲבָל שְׁלֵמָה דְּאָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי — אָסַר.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised according to Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda permits only of a damaged as will not come to confuse But an unblemished which come to confuse deems prohibited.
llm_translation: The students asked Rabbi Yehuda: Until here, Rabbi Yehuda does not permit except with a shvurah, for it does not come to interchange. But a complete one that comes to interchange - he prohibits.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, וּמָה שְׁבוּרָה דִּפְסַקָה מִינֵּיהּ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שְׁלֵמָה דְּלָא פְּסַקָה מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Or perhaps a damaged which is separated from him and all the more so an unblemished where is not separated from him,
llm_translation: Or perhaps, and what about the brokenness that has been separated from it, and all the more so the completeness that has not been separated from it?

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְרַבָּנַן: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָסְרִי רַבָּנַן אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּרָה, דִּפְסַקָה מִינֵּיהּ, אֲבָל שְׁלֵמָה דְּלָא פְּסַקָה מִינֵּיהּ — שָׁרוּ.
human_translation: the dilemma can be raised according to the Rabbis: the Rabbis deemed prohibited only in a damaged as is separated from him. But an unblemished where it is not separated from him, they deem permitted.
llm_translation: The sages asked: Until here, the sages did not decree except in a case of breakage, for it has been separated from it, but in the case of completeness that has not been separated from it — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: וּמָה שְׁבוּרָה דְּלָא אָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי — אָסְרִי, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שְׁלֵמָה דְּאָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי.
human_translation: Or perhaps a damaged which will not come to confuse deem prohibited, and all the more so an unblemished which come to confuse
llm_translation: Or perhaps: And what about a broken one that cannot come to be exchanged - it is forbidden, all the more so a whole one that can come to be exchanged.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא דְרַבָּנַן מִשּׁוּם הָכִי הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא מַרְבִּיעִין עָלֶיהָ וְיוֹלֶדֶת! אַלְמָא מִשּׁוּם עוּבָּרֶיהָ הוּא.
human_translation: And is the reason of the Rabbis due to that But isn’t it taught said to Rabbi Yehuda: But Don’t they breed it with and it gives birth Apparently, is due to fetuses.
llm_translation: The reason of the Rabbis is because of this? And it was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: But don't we fatten it and it gives birth! This implies that it is because of its fetus.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: טַעְמָא דִידַן מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתְיָא לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בִּבְהֵמָה, אֶלָּא אַתְּ, מַאי טַעְמָא שָׁרֵית? מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת, כְּמַאן דְּזַבְּנַהּ לִשְׁחִיטָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: this is what they were saying to Our reason because come to confuse with animal. But you, what is the reason you permit because incapable of being cured, similar to one who sold for slaughter,
llm_translation: So they said to him: Our reason is because it is possible for us to intercalate with an animal, but you, what is your reason that you permitted it? Because she cannot be healed, like one who sells her for slaughter, her blood is as if shed.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא מַרְבִּיעִין עָלֶיהָ וְיוֹלֶדֶת, וְכֵיוָן דְּמַרְבִּיעִין עָלֶיהָ וְיוֹלֶדֶת — מְשַׁהֵא לַהּ!
human_translation: But don’t they breed with and it gives birth? And since they breed it and it gives birth, delay
llm_translation: And aren't we allowed to feed her and she gives birth, and since we feed her and she gives birth - it is beneficial for her!

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: לִכְשֶׁתֵּלֵד, דְּלֹא מְקַבֶּלֶת זָכָר.
human_translation: And said to When gives birth, as cannot breed with a male.
llm_translation: And he said to them: When she gives birth, if she does not bear a male.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: ״אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי״!
human_translation: Come hear And one who gives to in receivership, and does not teach: Although he is not permitted
llm_translation: "Come and hear: And one who gives him as a gift, and it does not state: 'Even though he is not deserving'!"

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הַמִּשְׁתַּתֵּף לוֹ דְּלָא קָתָנֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּרַשַּׁאי? וְהָא אָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שׁוּתָּפוּת עִם הַגּוֹי, שֶׁמָּא יִתְחַיֵּיב לוֹ שְׁבוּעָה וְנִשְׁבָּע לוֹ בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״לֹא יִשָּׁמַע עַל פִּיךָ״!
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, One who enters into a partnership with where it does not teach: so too, that permitted But doesn’t Shmuel’s father say: It is prohibited for a person to enter a partnership with a gentile lest will be obligated to take an oath to him and he will take an oath in the name of his idol worship; and the Torah states: “Neither let it be heard out of your mouth”
llm_translation: And to taste, one who participates with him, that not it is taught, thus it is said of the Reish Galuta? And this said Abuh of Shmuel: It is forbidden for a person to enter into a partnership with a gentile, lest he incur an obligation to him and swear to him in the name of his foreign deity, and the Torah said: "Do not listen to his mouth!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תְּנָא מְכִירָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְשׁוּתָּפוּת. הָכִי נָמֵי, תְּנָא מְכִירָה וְהוּא הַדִּין לְקַבְּלָנוּת. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מְכִירָה דְּנָקֵט? דְּעִיקָּר מְכִירָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, taught a sale and the same is true for a partnership. So too, taught a sale and the same is true for receivership. And what is different selling that cited that primary is selling
llm_translation: Rather, a Tanna taught: sale, and it is the same for partnership. So it is stated: a Tanna taught sale, and it is the same for acceptance. And what is the difference between sale that is rejected? Because fundamentally it is a sale.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, הַמְקַבֵּל בְּהֵמָה מִן הַגּוֹי וְיָלְדָה — מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשׇׁוְויוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן חֲצִי דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן. וְהַנּוֹתֵן בְּקַבָּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמָיו, וְנוֹתֵן כָּל דָּמָיו לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says one who receives an animal from a gentile and it gave birth they assess its value, and gives half of its value to the priest And one who gives in receivership even though he is not permitted penalize him up to ten its value, and he gives all of its value to the priest.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehuda says, one who receives an animal from a non-Jew and it gives birth - we evaluate it at its current value, and give half of its value to the priest. And one who acquires through a transaction, even though he is not permitted - we penalize him up to ten times its value, and give all of its value to the priest.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיַּד הַגּוֹי בָּאֶמְצַע — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: As long as the ownership of the gentile is involved, is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: The sages say: "As long as the hand of the non-Jew is in the middle - exempt from the firstborn."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו אַבְּהֵמָה? לָא, אַעוּבָּר.
human_translation: What, is not to the animal No, to fetus,
llm_translation: What is not a behemah? No, a'ubar.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמָיו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as teaches: its value [ damav ], Learn from it
llm_translation: The precise wording of the Mishnah is: One may collect the lost item for him up to ten times its value, learn from it.

hebrew_text: מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַמּוֹכֵר בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה לְגוֹי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמֶיהָ.
human_translation: supports Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish says: one who sells large livestock to a gentile, penalize him, up to ten times its value.
llm_translation: Helper to him to Reish Lakish, for Reish Lakish said: One who sells an animal to a non-Jew at an inflated price - we penalize him up to tenfold its value.

hebrew_text: דַּוְקָא אוֹ לָאו דַּוְקָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְגוֹי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד מֵאָה בְּדָמָיו! שָׁאנֵי עֶבֶד, דְּכׇל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ מִמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: specifically or not specifically Come hear which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: one who sells his slave to a gentile, penalize him, up to one hundred times its value. A slave is different, as each day restricts him from mitzvot.
llm_translation: Specifically or not specifically? Come and hear, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sells his slave to a non-Jew - they penalize him up to one hundred of his value! This is different from a regular slave, as every day he exempts him from mitzvot.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַמּוֹכֵר בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה לְגוֹי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד מֵאָה בְּדָמֶיהָ. תְּנַן: וְהַנּוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּקַבָּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמֶיהָ!
human_translation: And there are who say Reish Lakish says one who sells large livestock to a gentile, penalize him, up to one hundred times its value. We learned And one who gives in receivership even though he is not permitted penalize him up to ten its value.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Reish Lakish said: One who sells an animal at an inflated price to a non-Jew — we penalize him up to one hundred of its value. We learned in a Mishnah: And one who gives it to him on credit, even though he is not permitted — we penalize him up to ten of its value!

hebrew_text: מְכִירָה — פָּסְקָה מִינֵּיהּ, קַבְּלָנוּת — לָא פָּסְקָה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a sale, separated from receivership, not separated from him,
llm_translation: Sale - he retracted from it, acceptance - he did not retract from it.

hebrew_text: דַּוְקָא אוֹ לָאו דַּוְקָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְגוֹי — קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ עַד עֲשָׂרָה בְּדָמָיו! שָׁאנֵי עֶבֶד, דְּלָא הָדַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: specifically or not specifically Come hear which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: one who sells his slave to a gentile, penalize him, up to ten times its value. A slave is different, since does not return to him.
llm_translation: Specifically or not specifically? Come and hear, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who sells his slave to a non-Jew - we penalize him up to ten of his value! This is different from a regular slave, as he does not return.

hebrew_text: בְּהֵמָה מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא הָדְרָא לֵיהּ, נִיקְנְסֵיהּ טְפֵי חַד! אֶלָּא, עֶבֶד — מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא הִיא, וְכׇל מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: what is the reason animal because that it returns to him? he should be penalized one additional Rather, a slave an uncommon matter, and the Sages did not issue a decree with regard to an uncommon matter.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Regarding an animal, what is the reason? Because it will return to him, he will be more careful with it! Rather, a slave - it is a matter that is not common, and any matter that is not common, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיַּד הַגּוֹי כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say as long as the ownership of the gentile Rabbi Yehoshua said: And both of them interpreted one verse all the firstborn,
llm_translation: The sages say: as long as the hand of the non-Jew is like. Rabbi Yehoshua said: And both of them expounded one verse, "Every firstborn."

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״בְּכוֹר״ — מִקְצָת בְּכוֹר מַשְׁמַע, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כׇּל״ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא כּוּלֵּיהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״בְּכוֹר״ — כּוּלֵּיהּ בְּכוֹר מַשְׁמַע, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כׇּל״ — דַּאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל דְּהוּא.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold “the firstborn, indicate part of the firstborn, the Merciful One wrote: “All unless the entire And Rabbi Yehuda holds “the firstborn, indicate the entire firstborn the Merciful One wrote “all” that even any amount
llm_translation: The sages say: "Firstborn" — some of the firstborn is implied, as the Merciful One wrote "all" — until there is all of it. And Rabbi Yehuda says: "Firstborn" — all of the firstborn is implied, as the Merciful One wrote "all" — even all that there is.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״בְּכוֹר״ רוּבָּא מַשְׁמַע, מָר סָבַר: ״כׇּל״ מַשְׁמַע לְמַלּוֹיֵי אֲתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: לְגָרוֹעֵי אֲתָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say that everyone “the firstborn, indicate majority Sage, holds “all” indicates comes to fill And Sage, holds comes to detract
llm_translation: If you wish, say: The term "firstborn" generally implies the majority. One Sage holds: "all" implies coming to include, and the other Sage holds: "all" implies coming to exclude.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה תְּהֵא שׁוּתָּפוּת שֶׁל גּוֹי, וּתְהֵא פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ אׇזְנוֹ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״שְׁקֵיל אׇזְנָךְ וְזִיל״!
human_translation: And how much should the gentile’s partnership be to be exempt from a firstborn? Rav Huna says: even its ear. Rav Naḥman objects to this: and let say to Take your ear and go,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much should the partnership of a gentile be, and be exempt from the firstborn? Rav Huna said: Even his ear. Rav Nachman objected to him: Let him say to him, 'Take your ear and go!'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ נְבֵלָה, וְרָבָא אָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ טְרֵיפָה.
human_translation: was stated Rav Ḥisda says an item, that renders a carcass, And Rava says an item that renders a tereifa ,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Ḥisda said: A matter that renders it a nevelah (carcass), and Rava said: A matter that renders it a treifah (animal with a fatal defect).

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בִּטְרֵיפָה חַיָּה. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ טְרֵיפָה — קָסָבַר טְרֵיפָה אֵינָהּ חַיָּה, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ נְבֵלָה — אֲבָל טְרֵיפָה חַיָּה.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? about a tereifa live According to the one who says an item that renders a tereifa he holds a tereifa cannot live, And according to the one who says an item that renders a carcass, but a tereifa can live
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Regarding a treifah animal. According to the one who says that an item that makes it a treifah animal — he holds that a treifah animal is not alive. And according to the one who says that an item that makes it a nevelah animal — but a treifah animal is alive.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְרַב חִסְדָּא וְרָבָא — לָא פְּלִיגִי, הָא בּוֹ, הָא בְּאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Pappa: That which Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda and Rava do not disagree. This to it, that to its mother.
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa: This is regarding Rav Huna, Rav Ḥisda, and Rava — they do not disagree, this one here, and this one there.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי שְׁנָא בּוֹ, דְּבָעֵינַן ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר״ וְלֵיכָּא? אִמּוֹ נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן ״כׇּל מִקְנְךָ תִּזָּכָר״ וְלֵיכָּא! אֶלָּא, לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to them: What is different because we require “all the firstborn,” and is not its mother as well we require “From all your livestock you shall take the males” and is not Rather, is no difference,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Papa: What is different about it, that we require "every firstborn" and it is not there? We also require "all your livestock you shall remember" and it is not there! Rather, it is not different.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מִנְּפָלִים, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו בְּנֵי חִיּוּתָא נִינְהוּ קָדְשִׁי, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״פֶּטֶר שֶׁגֶר בְּהֵמָה״ — שֶׁגֶר בִּבְהֵמָה!
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi objects to this: what is different from non-viable newborns, which are sacred even though they are not viable? As the Master said firstborn emerges from [ sheger ] an animal” that dwells [ shegar ] inside an animal,
llm_translation: Challenges him Mar son of Rav Ashi: What is different about miscarriages, that even though they are not the offspring of a living creature, they are considered holy? For Mar said: "The firstborn of an animal" - it is the firstborn of an animal!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא עָרִיבוּ בְּהוּ חוּלִּין — קָרֵינָא בְּהוּ בִּבְהֵמָה ״כָּל בְּכוֹר״, הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּעָרִיבוּ בְּהוּ חוּלִּין — לָא קָרֵינָא בְּהוּ ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר״.
human_translation: There, since there is no non-sacred mixed in with them, we apply to the animal “all the firstborn.” here, since a non-sacred is mixed in with them, we do not apply to them “all the firstborn.”
llm_translation: There, since they did not mix in them secular items - we read in them in an animal "every firstborn," here, since they mixed in them secular items - we do not read in them "every firstborn."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא עַל לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar did not enter the study hall. found Rabbi Asi, said to him: What did the Sages say the study hall? said to him:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar did not go to the study hall, he found Rabbi Assi, he said to him: What do the sages say in the study hall? He said to him:

hebrew_text: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ מוּם קַל. וְהָדִתְנַן: רָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז וְעֵז שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין רָחֵל — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיָּיב. מוּם קָבוּעַ הָוֵי לִשְׁחוֹט עָלָיו.
human_translation: This Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even a slight blemish And that which we learned A ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts and a goat that gave birth to a ewe of sorts are exempt firstborn. And if has some of the characteristics obligated, is a permanent blemish. to slaughter it
llm_translation: So said Rabbi Yochanan: Even a light blemish. And as it was taught: If Rachel gave birth to a kid from a goat, and a goat gave birth to a kid from Rachel, she is exempt from the firstborn, but if it has some distinguishing features, she is obligated. A permanent blemish is considered fit for slaughter.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מוּם קַל — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב הוּנָא, וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְרָבָא.
human_translation: Granted a slight blemish teaches us in accordance with of Rav Huna, and to the exclusion of Rav Ḥisda and Rava,
llm_translation: In peace, a minor blemish — it is heard to us like Rav Huna, and not like the teachings of Rav Ḥisdah and Rava.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מוּם קָבוּעַ — מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי הָוֵה לֵיהּ מוּמָא? תְּנֵינָא: וּפִיו דּוֹמֶה כְּשֶׁל חֲזִיר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם!
human_translation: But a permanent blemish, what is teaching us? that since it different is a blemish? We learned Or whose mouth is similar to that of a pig, that is a blemish
llm_translation: Rather, a permanent blemish - what does it indicate to us? Since when it was given to him, it was a blemish? We learned: "And his mouth is like that of a pig - this is a blemish!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, הָתָם נִשְׁתַּנָּה בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בְּמִינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה, הָכָא נִשְׁתַּנָּה בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמִינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה, הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: עֵינוֹ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: And if you would say there, was altered into a being in whose species there is no sanctity of the firstborn, here, was altered into a being in whose species sanctity of the firstborn, we learned this, too, one of its eyes large and one
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you will say, there it changed in a matter that is not of its kind holy in firstborn status, here it changed in a matter that is of its kind holy in firstborn status, but we also learned: one large eye and one small eye.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא גְּדוֹלָה — גְּדוֹלָה כְּשֶׁל עֵגֶל, וּקְטַנָּה — קְטַנָּה כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז. בִּשְׁלָמָא קְטַנָּה כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז, אֵין בְּמִינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה, אֶלָּא גְּדוֹלָה כְּשֶׁל עֵגֶל — יֵשׁ בְּמִינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי הָוֵה לֵיהּ מוּמָא?
human_translation: And taught A large large as that of a calf, and a small small as that of a goose. Granted, small as that of a goose there is no sanctity of the firstborn among its species, But large as that of a calf there is sanctity of a firstborn among its species. Rather, not because we say since it has changed it is a blemish?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'Large — large like that of a calf, and small — small like that of a goose.' Now, if you say that 'small like that of a goose,' there is no sanctity in its species regarding firstborn status, but 'large like that of a calf' — there is sanctity in its species regarding firstborn status! Rather, is it not because we say: 'Since it has been given, does it have a blemish?'"

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ ״שָׂרוּעַ״. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: מוּמִין אֵלּוּ, בֵּין קְבוּעִין בֵּין עוֹבְרִין — פּוֹסְלִין. יָתֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אָדָם: עֵינָיו שְׁתֵּיהֶן גְּדוֹלוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן קְטַנּוֹת.
human_translation: No, because is one that has a limb that is too large [ sarua ], This, too, stands to reason, as we learned these blemishes whether permanent or transient, Beyond those are a person, both of his eyes are large, both of them are small.
llm_translation: Not, because it is considered "sarua." So too it is logical, as we learned: "Blemishes" - whether permanent or temporary - disqualify. A person is more stringent than them: if both his eyes are large, both are small.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי אָדָם הוּא דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן״, דְּבָעֵינַן אִישׁ שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, אֲבָל בְּהֵמָה, שְׁתֵּיהֶן גְּדוֹלוֹת שְׁתֵּיהֶן קְטַנּוֹת — נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא.
human_translation: it is with regard to a person that it is written: “Any man from the offspring of Aaron” that we require a man who is equal to the seed of Aaron, but an animal, both are big both are small, it is also not a blemish.
llm_translation: Regarding a person, as it is written: "Each man from the seed of Aaron," we require a man who is equal in his seed to that of Aaron. But with an animal, whether both are large or both are small, it is not considered a blemish.

hebrew_text: אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה, מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי מִשּׁוּם שִׁינּוּי — אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן גְּדוֹלוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן קְטַנּוֹת נָמֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ ״שָׂרוּעַ״?
human_translation: one is big or one is small, what is the reason If due to deviation even both are big both are small Rather, is it not because it is with a limb that is too large?
llm_translation: One is large and one is small, what is the reason? If it is because of a change - even if both are large, both are small indeed! Rather, is it not because it is "sarua"?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ מִשּׁוּם שִׁינּוּי, שִׁינּוּי הָוֵי מוּמָא. וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן גְּדוֹלוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן קְטַנּוֹת? הָתָם, אִי מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא יַתִּירָא — תַּרְוַויְיהוּ בָּעֵי לְמִיבְרָא, אִי מֵחֲמַת כְּחִישׁוּתָא יַתִּירָא — תַּרְוַויְיהוּ בָּעֵי מִיכְחַשׁ.
human_translation: No, actually I will say to you because deviation, a deviation is a blemish. And that which is difficult for you, even both are big both are small there if is due to extreme health both should have been healthy, if is due to extreme weakness both should have been weak.
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you from reason of change, change is blemish. And it is difficult for you: even both are large, both are small? There, if because of the creature's weakness it is permitted — they both require clarification, if because of the strength's weakness it is permitted — they both require consideration.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא גִּיּוֹרְתָּא דַּהֲווֹ מָסְרִין לַהּ אַחֵי חֵיוְתָא לְפַטּוֹמַהּ, אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: לֵית דְּחַשׁ לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: שׁוּתָּפוּת גּוֹי חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה.
human_translation: a certain female convert whose brothers would give her animals to fatten She came before Rava said to her: There is no one who is concerned with this of Rabbi Yehuda, who says partnership a gentile is obligated, a firstborn.
llm_translation: That convert who they were giving to her brothers of her father's house, she came before Rava, he said to her: There is no concern for her regarding that which Rabbi Yehuda said: A partnership with a gentile is obligated in firstborn.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל הַוְיָא לֵיהּ הָהִיא חֵיוָתָא, הֲוָה מַקְנֶה לְאוּדְנַיְיהוּ לְגוֹי, וְאָסַר לְהוּ בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה, וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ לְכֹהֲנִים, וּכְלַאי חֵיוָתָא דְּרַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל.
human_translation: Rav Mari bar Raḥel had a certain animals. He would transfer ownership of the ears of to a gentile But prohibited them from sheared and labor, and gave them to the priests, And the animals of Rav Mari bar Raḥel died.
llm_translation: Rav Mari son of Rachel had a certain animal, he would acquire it for his sons for a gift, and he prohibited them from shearing and working with it, and he gave it to the priests, and the offspring of the animal of Rav Mari son of Rachel.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאָסַר לְהוּ בְּגִיזָה וַעֲבוֹדָה, וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ לְכֹהֲנִים, אַמַּאי מַקְנֶה לְהוּ לְאוּדְנַיְיהוּ לְגוֹי, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי בְּהוּ לִידֵי תַקָּלָה? אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא כְּלוֹ חֵיוָתָא דְּרַב מָרִי? מִשּׁוּם דְּמַפְקַע לְהוּ מִקְּדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But since he prohibited them from sheared and labor and gave them to the priests, why did he transfer ownership of their ears to the gentile, lest come to a mishap with them, If so, what is the reason the animals of Rav Mari died because he abrogated their sanctity
llm_translation: And when he prohibited them with a decree of theft and labor, and he gave to them to the priests, why did he acquire for them to their masters for a nation, perhaps it will come to them to a stumbling block? If so, what is the reason like the animal of Rav Mari? Because he removes from their sanctity.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מוּתָּר לָאָדָם לְהַטִּיל מוּם בִּבְכוֹר קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם! הָתָם מִקְּדוּשַּׁת מִזְבֵּחַ קָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ, מִקְּדוּשַּׁת כֹּהֵן לָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ. הָכָא אֲפִילּוּ מִקְּדוּשַּׁת כֹּהֵן קָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say it is permitted for a person to inflict a blemish on a firstborn before it emerges into the air of the world? There, he abrogates sanctity of the altar, but does not abrogate sanctity of the priest, Here, he abrogated even sanctity of the priest,
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Yehudah: It is permitted for a person to inflict a blemish on a firstborn before it emerges into the air of the world! There, from the sanctity of the altar, it is disqualified, but from the sanctity of a priest, it is not disqualified. Here, even from the sanctity of a priest, it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל יָדַע לְאַקְנוֹיֵי קִנְיַן גָּמוּר, וְחָזֵי לֵיהּ אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא, וְאָזֵיל וְעָבֵיד, וְסָבַר רַב מָרִי מִילְּתָא הוּא דַּעֲבַד, וְאָתֵי בָּהּ לִידֵי תַקָּלָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav Mari bar Raḥel knew to transfer a complete transaction. And another person would see him and would go and do and would think Rav Mari performed the matter and would come to a mishap with
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav Mari son of Rachel knew how to acquire complete ownership, and someone else saw him, and he went and did it, and Rav Mari thought that it was something he had done, and it led to a mishap.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם פְּטוּרִין, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: אִם פָּטְרוּ אֶת שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, דִּין הוּא שֶׁיִּפְטְרוּ אֶת שֶׁל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Priests and Levites are exempt from an a fortiori If rendered exempt of the Israelites in the wilderness it is logical that should render their own exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Kohanim and Leviim are exempt, from a fortiori reasoning: if they exempted the firstborn of Israel in the wilderness, it is logical that they should exempt their own.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִינְהוּ פָּטְרִי?! אָדָם — אָדָם פָּטַר, בְּהֵמָה — בְּהֵמָה פָּטְרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״קַח אֶת הַלְוִיִּם תַּחַת בְּכוֹר בִּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֶּהֱמַת הַלְוִיִּם תַּחַת בְּהֶמְתָּם״!
human_translation: Did they render exempt? a person, person, rendered exempt. an animal, animal, rendered exempt, as it is written: “Take the Levites in exchange for all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the animal of the Levites in exchange for their animals”
llm_translation: Gemara: Are they exempt?! A person - a person is exempt, an animal - an animal is exempt, as it is written: "Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of their cattle."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם פְּטוּרִין בְּהֶמְתָּם מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר — אִם הִפְקִיעָה בְּהֶמְתָּם שֶׁל לְוִיִּם בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, דִּין הוּא שֶׁתַּפְקִיעַ אֶת שֶׁל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Abaye said this is saying: animals of priests and Levites are exempt from an a fortiori If the animals of the Levites, rendered the animals of the Israelites in the wilderness abrogated, it is logical that should render own abrogated.
llm_translation: Abaye said, thus he said: Kohanim and Leviim exempt in their animals from kal v'chomer - if one redeemed the animal of a Levite with an animal of an Israelite in the desert, it is a judgment that he should redeem their own.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא ״פָּטְרוּ״ אִינְהוּ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: Rava said to him: But doesn’t teach: They, rendered exempt?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: But they "exempted" - they are minors!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, אִם אִיתָא, אֲפִילּוּ מִבְּכוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה נִפַּטְרוּ! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: לֹא נִפְטְרוּ מִבְּכוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה, אֶלָּא מִפִּדְיוֹן הַבֵּן וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר?
human_translation: Furthermore, if it is so should be exempt even from firstborn of a kosher animal, Why did we learn were not exempted from firstborn of a kosher animal; rather, from redemption of the son and the firstborn donkey?
llm_translation: And furthermore, if it is stated, even the firstborn of a clean animal were exempt! Why do we learn: They are not exempt the firstborn of a clean animal, but from the redemption of the son and the firstborn of a donkey?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם פָּטְרוּ הֵן עַצְמָן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, אִם הִפְקִיעָה קְדוּשָּׁתָן שֶׁל לְוִיִּם קְדוּשַּׁת שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, לֹא יַפְקִיעַ אֶת שֶׁל עַצְמָן?
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is teaching: Priests and Levites rendered themselves exempt, from an a fortiori If the sanctity of the Levites abrogated the sanctity of the Israelites in the wilderness, should it not abrogate of themselves?
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, thus it was taught: The Kohanim and Leviim exempted themselves with a kal vachomer; if the sanctity of the Leviim was annulled in the wilderness, the sanctity of Yisrael, will they not annul their own?

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן אָדָם, בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַךְ פָּדֹה תִפְדֶּה אֵת בְּכוֹר הָאָדָם וְאֵת בְּכוֹר הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּמֵאָה תִּפְדֶּה״, כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּבְכוֹר אָדָם — יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּבְכוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּבְכוֹר אָדָם — אֵינוֹ בִּבְכוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה.
human_translation: We have found personal from where do we non-kosher animals, the verse states: “Yet you shall redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of non-kosher animals you shall redeem” Anything that applies to firstborn son applies to the firstborn of a non-kosher animal, and anything that does not apply to firstborn son does not apply to a non-kosher animal.
llm_translation: We find, a person, from where is the law derived regarding an impure animal? The verse states: "Only you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of an impure animal you shall redeem." Whoever has a firstborn among humans - has a firstborn among impure animals, and whoever does not have a firstborn among humans - does not have a firstborn among impure animals.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּהֶמְתָּם, בֶּן לֵוִי דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ שֶׂה דְּאַפְקַע — לַיפְקַע, דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ שֶׂה דְּלַיפְקַע — לָא לַיפְקַע!
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Abaye: According to your that you say the animals of a Levite who had a lamb, which abrogated let be abrogated. who did not have a lamb that would abrogate should not be abrogated.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Abbaye: According to your opinion that you stated regarding their animals, if Levi's son had a sheep that was slaughtered — it should be considered slaughtered, but if he did not have a sheep that was slaughtered — it should not be considered slaughtered!

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְדִידָךְ, בֵּין לְרָבָא, בֶּן חֹדֶשׁ דְּאַפְקַע — לַיפְקַע, פָּחוֹת מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ דְּלָא אַפְקַע — לָא לַיפְקַע!
human_translation: According to both you and Rava, month old, who abrogated should abrogated. less than month old, who did not abrogate should not abrogated.
llm_translation: Between your opinion, between Rav, a month that has passed - to pass, less than a month that has not passed - not to pass!

hebrew_text: לְוִיָּה לָא תַּיפְקַע? אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: לְוִיָּה שֶׁיָּלְדָה — בְּנָהּ פָּטוּר מֵחֲמֵשׁ סְלָעִים?
human_translation: a female Levite should not be abrogated, Why, does Rav Adda bar Ahava say: a female Levite who gave birth,her son is exempt from five sela
llm_translation: Leviyah did not give birth? Why did Rav Adda bar Ahava say: Leviyah, when she gives birth - her son is exempt from five sela'im?

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״ בְּפֶטֶר רֶחֶם תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: That not difficult, as of Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, who says: “Firstborn of the womb” the Merciful One renders dependent on the firstborn of the womb,
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "This not difficult, as Mar son of Rav Yosef from the name of Rava, said: 'Petur Rechem' with 'Petur Rechem' He (the) Merciful One interprets."

hebrew_text: וְאַהֲרֹן שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּאוֹתוֹ מִנְיָן — לָא לַיפְקַע! דְּתַנְיָא: לָמָּה נָקוּד עַל ״אַהֲרֹן״ שֶׁבְּחוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים — שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּאוֹתוֹ מִנְיָן.
human_translation: And Aaron, who was not in that count should not abrogated. As it is taught Why dots over “Aaron” in the book of Numbers: that he was not in that count
llm_translation: "And Aaron that he was not in that count - not to be included! For it was taught: Why is a dot placed on 'Aaron' in the Torah of the five counts - that he was not in that count."

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״הַלְוִיִּם״, הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל הַלְוִיִּם זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: the verse states: “The Levites” all of the Levites were juxtaposed with each other.
llm_translation: The verse says: "Levites," all Levites were juxtaposed to one another.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֲנִים מְנָלַן? כִּדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מְקוֹמוֹת נִקְרְאוּ כֹּהֲנִים ״לְוִיִּם״, וְזֶה אֶחָד מֵהֶן: ״וְהַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם בְּנֵי צָדוֹק״.
human_translation: From where do we priests, in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: In twenty-four places the priests are called Levites, and this is one of them: “But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok”
llm_translation: The priests, from where do we derive this? Like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places the priests were called "Levites," and this is one of them: "And the priests, the Levites, the sons of Zadok."

hebrew_text: וּלְדוֹרוֹת מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיוּ לִי הַלְוִיִּם״, ״וְהָיוּ״ — בַּהֲוָויָיתָן יְהוּ.
human_translation: And from where do we for generations? the verse states: “And the Levites shall be Mine” “shall be” they shall be, in their state
llm_translation: "And for generations, from where do we derive this? The verse states: 'And the Levites shall be to Me,' 'and they shall be' - in their existence they shall be."

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דִּבְשֶׂה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נֶאֱמַר כֶּסֶף לְדוֹרוֹת, וְנֶאֱמַר שֶׂה לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: From where that with a lamb? Rav Ḥisda says: “silver” is stated for generations And “lamb” is stated for generations
llm_translation: From where is the honey? Rav Ḥisda said: It is stated "silver for generations," and it is stated "a sheep for generations."

hebrew_text: מָה כֶּסֶף הָאָמוּר לְדוֹרוֹת — בּוֹ פָּדוּ לְדוֹרוֹת, בּוֹ פָּדוּ לְאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, אַף שֶׂה הָאָמוּר לְדוֹרוֹת — בּוֹ פָּדוּ לְדוֹרוֹת, בּוֹ פָּדוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה.
human_translation: just as silver, which was mentioned with regard to generations, redeemed with it in generations they redeemed with it at that time, so too lamb, which was mentioned with regard to generations, they redeemed with it in generations, they redeemed with it at that time.
llm_translation: The silver that is designated for generations - with it they redeemed for generations, with it they redeemed at that time, just as the lamb that is designated for generations - with it they redeemed for generations, with it they redeemed at that time.

hebrew_text: מָה לְכֶסֶף — שָׁכֵן פּוֹדִין בּוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי!
human_translation: What about silver? in that one can redeem consecrated property and second-tithe with it,
llm_translation: What is the law regarding money - that it is a neighbor to redeem with it holy things and second tithe!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַךְ פָּדֹה תִפְדֶּה אֶת בְּכוֹר הָאָדָם וְאֵת בְּכוֹר הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּמֵאָה תִּפְדֶּה״, מָה בְּכוֹר אָדָם לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בֵּין לְדוֹרוֹת בֵּין לְאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה — בְּכֶסֶף, אַף בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין לְדוֹרוֹת בֵּין לְאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה — בְּשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rather, the verse states: “Yet you shall redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of non-kosher animals you shall redeem” just as a firstborn son you have not distinguished between for generations and for that time, with silver so too, a non-kosher animal, you should not distinguish between for generations and for that time, with a lamb
llm_translation: Rather, the verse states: "Only you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of the unclean animal you shall redeem." Just as the firstborn of man, you do not differentiate between generations or at that time - with money, so too with the unclean animal you shall not differentiate between generations or at that time - with a sheep.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׂה אֶחָד שֶׁל בֶּן לֵוִי פָּטַר כַּמָּה פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי מָנָה הַכָּתוּב עוֹדְפִים בְּאָדָם, וְלֹא מָנָה עוֹדְפִין בִּבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says one lamb of a Levite rendered several firstborn donkeys of the Israelites exempt Abaye says: Know as the verse enumerates the surplus of humans but does not enumerate surplus of animals.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: One sheep of the tribe of Levi exempted as many firstborn donkeys as there are among the Israelites. Abaye said: Know that the Torah counted the excess in man, but did not count the excess in animals.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא לָא הָוֵי נְפִישִׁי לְהוּ בְּהֵמוֹת טוּבָא? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ! דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִקְנֶה רַב הָיָה לִבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן וְלִבְנֵי גָד״.
human_translation: From where Perhaps did not have many animals, not enter your mind, as it is written: “Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock”
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it is not beneficial for them to have many good animals? It is not according to your opinion! As it is written: "And they had very many cattle, both the children of Reuben and the children of Gad."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, פְּשׁוּטִים דִּלְוִיִּם הֲווֹ קָיְימִי לְבַהֲדֵי בְּכוֹרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֶת בֶּהֱמַת הַלְוִיִּם תַּחַת בְּהֶמְתָּם״, בְּהֵמָה אַחַת תַּחַת בְּהֵמוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Perhaps even so, ordinary of the Levites corresponded to firstborn the Israelites. the verse states: and the animal of [ behemat ] the Levites in exchange for their animals [ behemtam ]” one animal in exchange for many animals
llm_translation: Perhaps even so, the Levite firstborns were standing by themselves! The verse says: "And the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock," one animal in place of many animals.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא בְּהֵמָה רַבָּה? אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא אוֹ ״בְּהֵמָה תַּחַת בְּהֵמָה״ אוֹ ״בְּהֶמְתָּם תַּחַת בְּהֶמְתָּם״! מַאי ״בֶּהֱמַת... תֵּחַת בְּהֶמְתָּם״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חַד פָּטַר טוּבָא.
human_translation: And say “And many animals [ uvhema rabba ]” If so, let the verse write either: Behema in exchange for behema , or: Behemtam in exchange for behemtam . What “ behemat in exchange for behemtam ”? Learn from it one rendered many exempt.
llm_translation: And why not a large animal? If so, let it be written "beast under beast" or "their beasts under their beasts"! What is "their beasts under their beasts"? Understand from it one, he exempted a goodly animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: וּפוֹדֶה בּוֹ פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא טַעְמָא דְמַתְנִיתִין מְפָרֵשׁ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא פּוֹדֶה בּוֹ פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה? מִשּׁוּם דְּשֶׂה אֶחָד שֶׁל בֶּן לֵוִי פּוֹטֵר כַּמָּה פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rava said: We learn as well, And redeem with it many times And Rabbi Ḥanina is explaining the reasoning of the mishna, and this is saying: What is the reason may redeem with many times? because one lamb of a Levite renders exempt several firstborn donkeys belonging to an Israelite.
llm_translation: Rava said, "We also learned: 'And he redeems it many times.' And Rabbi Chanina explains the reason of the Mishnah, and thus he says: What is the reason that he redeems it many times? Because one redemption of a firstborn son of Levi exempts many firstborn donkeys of Israel."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר.
human_translation: was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says firstborn in the wilderness were sanctified, and Reish Lakish says: firstborn in the wilderness were not sanctified.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said: They sanctified the firstborns in the wilderness, and Reish Lakish said: They did not sanctify the firstborns in the wilderness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר לִיקְדְּשׁוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״קַדֶּשׁ לִי כׇל בְּכוֹר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says firstborn in the wilderness were sanctified, since the Merciful One states they should be sanctified, as it is written “Sanctify to Me all the firstborn”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They sanctified the firstborns in the wilderness, for the Merciful One said to sanctify them, as it is written: "Sanctify to Me every firstborn."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר, מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יְבִיאֲךָ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא קְדוּשׁ.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: the firstborn in the wilderness were not sanctified, as it is written: “And it shall be when shall bring you and it is written afterward: “And you shall set apart By inference, that initially, were not sanctified.
llm_translation: Resh Lakish said: They did not sanctify the firstborns in the desert, as it is written: "And it shall be when the Lord brings you in," and it is written afterwards: "And you shall pass over," indicating that initially they were not sanctified.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: עַד שֶׁלֹּא הוּקַם הַמִּשְׁכָּן הָיוּ בָּמוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת וַעֲבוֹדָה בִּבְכוֹרוֹת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁיָּצְאוּ מִמִּצְרָיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish Until the Tabernacle was established, altars were permitted and service by the firstborn. said to him: to those who left Egypt,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: Until the Tabernacle was erected, high places were permitted, and the service was performed by firstborns! He said to him: In those days when they left Egypt.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, בֶּן שָׁנָה בַּר מֶיעְבַּד עֲבוֹדָה הוּא?
human_translation: This too stands to reason, as if you do not say so, is in its year capable of performing the service?
llm_translation: So it seems reasonable, for if you do not say so, is a one-year-old son capable of performing the service?

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ, מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ?
human_translation: And he who asked it, why did he ask it?
llm_translation: And they are calling to him, what are they calling to him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּלָא פָּסֵיק קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ — הָנָךְ דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי לָא פָּקְעָא קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּפָסֵק קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ — הָנָךְ דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי פָּקְעָא לֵיהּ קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: This was his difficulty: Granted, if you say that the sanctity of did not cease these who originally their sanctity also did not lapse. But if you say that the sanctity of ceased these that originally their sanctity also lapsed.
llm_translation: So difficult is the question for him: If you say that in the case where their holiness was not interrupted - there, from the outset, their holiness was also not interrupted, but if you say that their holiness was interrupted - there, from the outset, their holiness was also interrupted.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: דִּקְדוּשׁ — קְדוּשׁ, דְּלָא קְדוּשׁ — לָא קְדוּשׁ.
human_translation: And the other who were sanctified were sanctified who were not sanctified were not sanctified
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: regarding "k'dush" - it is k'dush, but if not regarding k'dush - it is not k'dush.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁהוּקַם הַמִּשְׁכָּן, קָרְבוּ בּוֹ לָהֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת, חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת, בְּכוֹרוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת. הָכִי נָמֵי — בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁיָּצְאוּ מִמִּצְרָיִם. וּמִינַּהּ: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם הוּא דִּקְרוּב, מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ לָא קְרוּב!
human_translation: raised an objection to the same day that the Tabernacle was established, were sacrificed by the Jewish people, vow and gift sin offerings and guilt offerings, firstborn and tithe also to those that left Egypt And from That day is when were sacrificed, beyond that they were not sacrificed.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: On that very day when the Tabernacle was erected, the Israelites brought forth to it vows and freewill offerings, sin offerings and guilt offerings, firstborn animals and tithes. Thus it is stated: On that day they came out of Egypt. And the resolution is: On that day it was a day of drawing near, from then on it is not a day of drawing near!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁהוּקַם הַמִּשְׁכָּן קָרְבוּ לָהֶם יִשְׂרָאֵל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת בְּכוֹרוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת. אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם — אִין, מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ — לָא! אֵימָא: מֵאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: There are who say Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan: the same day that the Tabernacle was established, were sacrificed by the Jewish people, vow and gift sin offerings and guilt offerings, firstborn and tithe that day, yes, beyond that not say from that day onward,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: On that day when the Tabernacle was erected, the Israelites brought near to them vows and freewill offerings, sin offerings, guilt offerings, firstborn animals, and tithes. On that day - yes, from then on - no! I would say: From that day and onward.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? מֵאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם — אִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא. אַלְמָא חוֹבוֹת בְּבָמָה לָא קְרוּב.
human_translation: And what, is teaching us? from that day yes, initially, not Evidently, obligatory were not sacrificed on altar;
llm_translation: "What is the inference for us? From that day - no, from the outset - no. This implies that debts are not collected at the altar."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — בְּמִצְרַיִם, וּבַמִּדְבָּר, וּבִכְנִיסָתָן יִשְׂרָאֵל לְאֶרֶץ. בְּמִצְרַיִם מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״קַדֶּשׁ לִי כׇל בְּכוֹר״. בַּמִּדְבָּר הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי לִי כׇל בְּכוֹר בִּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. בִּכְנִיסָתָם לָאָרֶץ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יְבִיאֲךָ... וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״.
human_translation: Come hear You are found saying the firstborn of the Jewish people were sanctified in three locations: In Egypt, and in the wilderness, and upon the entry of the Jewish people into Eretz In Egypt, what does state? “Sanctify to Me all the firstborn” In the wilderness, states: “For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are Mine” With regard to their entry into Eretz states: “And it shall be when shall bring you and you shall set apart
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: You say, 'In three places were the firstborn sanctified for Israel - in Egypt, in the wilderness, and upon their entry into the land.' What does it say in Egypt? 'Sanctify to Me every firstborn.' In the wilderness it says, 'For every firstborn among the children of Israel is Mine.' Upon their entry into the land it says, 'And it shall be when the Lord brings you... and you shall pass over.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הוּזְהֲרוּ עַל הַבְּכוֹרוֹת לִיקְדַּשׁ, וְלֹא קָדְשׁוּ. וּבְמִצְרַיִם נָמֵי לָא קְדוּשׁ? הָא קָאָמְרִינַן דִּקְדוּשׁ! הָכִי אָמַר: מֵהֶן קָדְשׁוּ, וּמֵהֶן לֹא קָדְשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: were commanded in three locations with regard to the firstborn, to sanctify but they did not sanctify But were they not sanctified in Egypt either? Didn’t we say that they were sanctified This is saying: of those they sanctified and of them, they did not sanctify
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: In three places, be cautious regarding the firstborns to sanctify, and they did not sanctify. And in Egypt, indeed they did not sanctify? This is what we say, that they sanctified! This is what he said: Some of them sanctified, and some of them did not sanctify.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: וּבַמִּדְבָּר לֹא קָדְשׁוּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״פְּקֹד כׇּל בְּכֹר זָכָר לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״! אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ וְלֹא פָּסְקוּ, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: And did they not sanctify in the wilderness? But isn’t it written: “Count all the firstborn males of the children of Israel Rather, if was stated was stated like this: Rabbi Yoḥanan says were sanctified and did not cease, and Reish Lakish says were sanctified
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges it: And in the wilderness, were they not sanctified? But it is written: "Redeem every firstborn among the sons of Israel"! Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rabbi Yochanan said: They were sanctified but did not cease, and Reish Lakish said: They were sanctified.

hebrew_text: וּפָסְקוּ.
human_translation: and ceased
llm_translation: And they ceased.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כִּדְאָמַר טַעַם, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, Reish Lakish, reason as he said, But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason,
llm_translation: In Sh'lama Reish Lakish, as it was said: "Reason." Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan - what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲזַאי בְּחֶילְמָא דְּמִילְּתָא מְעַלַּיְתָא אָמֵינָא, אָמַר קְרָא ״לִי יִהְיוּ״ — בַּהֲוָיָיתָן יְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: I saw Rabbi Yoḥanan in a dream, which I am saying a proper matter The verse states: Mine they shall be: they shall be, in their state
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yochanan Hazai in the strength of the word of the matter ascended higher, I say, he said, the verse says "they shall be to Me" - in their existence they shall be.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, ״וְהָיָה כִּי יְבִיאֲךָ... וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: עֲשֵׂה מִצְוָה זוֹ שֶׁבִּשְׁבִילָהּ תִּיכָּנֵס לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, “And it shall be when shall bring you and you shall set apart,” what does he do with it? That is necessary to that which the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Perform this mitzva on account of which you will enter into Eretz
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, "And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently... and thou shalt pass over" - what does he do with it? That one brings it in accordance with the teaching of the School of Rabbi Ishmael: "Perform this commandment so that you may enter the land."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַתּוּן הָכִי מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן אִיפְּכָא מַתְנִינַן לַהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: קָדְשׁוּ בְּכוֹרוֹת בַּמִּדְבָּר.
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: You teach in this manner, we teach it the opposite Rabbi Yoḥanan says the firstborn were not sanctified in the wilderness, and Reish Lakish says the firstborn were sanctified in the wilderness.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mordechai to Rav Ashi: You thus teach it to him, we teach it differently to him, Rabbi Yochanan said: They did not sanctify the firstborn in the wilderness, and Resh Lakish said: They sanctified the firstborn in the wilderness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאָפְכִית נָמֵי תְּיוּבָתָא, וְאָפְכִיתוּ לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא קָדְשׁוּ לְהוּ — לֹא הוּצְרְכוּ לִיקְדַּשׁ.
human_translation: said to him: And do you also reverse the objections and do you reverse that which Rabbi Elazar said to him: were not sanctified they did not need to be consecrated,
llm_translation: He said to him: "And you will turn the face of the table, and you will turn it to him for that of Rabbi Elazar?" He said to him: "They did not sanctify it for him - they did not need to sanctify."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דִּידַן! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: חַיָּיב אָדָם לוֹמַר בִּלְשׁוֹן רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: If so, that is our teaches us a person must say in the language his teacher.
llm_translation: So it is, that is our opinion! It is heard for us: A person is obligated to speak in the language of his teacher.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל קוּנְטְרוּקוּס הַשַּׂר אֶת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: בִּפְרָטָן שֶׁל לְוִיִּם אַתָּה מוֹצֵא עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁנַיִם אֶלֶף וּשְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת, בִּכְלָלָן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁנַיִם אֶלֶף, וּשְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת לְהֵיכָן הָלְכוּ?
human_translation: Kontrokos the officer asked Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai: In individual of Levites you find 22,300 in collective of you find 22,000, Where, did three hundred go?
llm_translation: He asked Kuntrokus the prince Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai: "In the particulars of the Levites, you find twenty-two thousand and three hundred, among them you find twenty-two thousand, and three hundred. Where did the three hundred go?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אוֹתָן שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת בְּכוֹרוֹת הָיוּ, וְאֵין בְּכוֹר מַפְקִיעַ בְּכוֹר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דַּיּוֹ לַבְּכוֹר שֶׁיַּפְקִיעַ קְדוּשַּׁת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: said to him: Those three hundred were firstborns, and a firstborn cannot abrogate a firstborn What is the reason? Abaye says: is sufficient for firstborn to abrogate his own sanctity.
llm_translation: He said to him: Those three hundred firstborns were, and a firstborn does not redeem a firstborn. What is the reason? Abaye said: It is sufficient for the firstborn to redeem his own holiness.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שְׁאָלוֹ: בְּגִיבּוּי כֶּסֶף אַתָּה מוֹצֵא מָאתַיִם וְאַחַת כִּכָּר וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה מָנֶה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בֶּקַע לַגֻּלְגֹּלֶת מַחֲצִית הַשֶּׁקֶל בְּשֶׁקֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״,
human_translation: Additionally, asked With regard to the collection of silver you find 201 talents and eleven maneh , as it is written “A beka a head, that is, half a shekel, of the shekel of the Sanctuary
llm_translation: And furthermore they asked: In the redemption of silver, do you find it from two hundred shekels and one talent and ten minas, as it is written: "A bekah for each head, half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary, etc."

hebrew_text: וּבִנְתִינַת הַכֶּסֶף אַתָּה מוֹצֵא מְאַת כִּכָּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי מְאַת כִּכַּר הַכֶּסֶף לָצֶקֶת וְגוֹ׳״. מֹשֶׁה רַבְּכֶם גַּנָּב הָיָה, אוֹ קוּבְיוּסְטוּס הָיָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ בָּקִי בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת? נָתַן מֶחֱצָה וְנָטַל מֶחֱצָה, וּמֶחֱצָה שָׁלֵם לֹא הֶחֱזִיר.
human_translation: But with regard to the giving of the silver you find one hundred talents, as it is written: “And the hundred talents of silver were for casting” was Moses your teacher a thief, or was he a gambler [ kuveyustus ], or not expert in accounting? He gave half and took half and he did not return a complete half
llm_translation: In the giving of the silver, you find a hundred talents, as it is written: "And there were a hundred talents of silver to cast, etc." Was Moses our teacher a thief, or was he a mathematician, or was he not proficient in calculations? He gave half and took half, but the half he took he did not return.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ גִּיזְבָּר נֶאֱמָן הָיָה, וּבָקִי בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת הָיָה, וּמָנֶה שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ כָּפוּל הָיָה.
human_translation: said to him: Moses, our teacher, was a trustworthy treasurer and was expert in accounting, but a maneh of the Sanctuary, was double
llm_translation: He said to him: Moses our teacher was faithful, and skilled in calculations, and he counted the shekel of the sanctuary as double.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי בַּהּ רַב אַחַאי: מַאי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, ״וַיְהִי מְאַת כִּכַּר הַכֶּסֶף לָצֶקֶת וְגוֹ׳״? הָנָךְ לָצֶקֶת, וְאִינָךְ בֵּי גַזָּא! כְּתַב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״וְכֶסֶף פְּקוּדֵי הָעֵדָה מְאַת כִּכָּר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai discusses it: What posed a difficulty for “And the hundred talents of silver were for casting these for casting and the other the treasury. another verse is written “And the silver of those that were numbered of the congregation was a hundred talents”
llm_translation: Be in it Rav Ahai: What is difficult for him, "And there was a hundred talents of silver for casting, etc."? That is for casting, and not for the Temple treasury! Another verse writes: "And the silver of those who were counted of the congregation was a hundred talents, etc."

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: מָנֶה שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ כָּפוּל הָיָה, מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And that which said to a maneh of the Sanctuary was double from where does he
llm_translation: And he said to him: If a maneh of consecrated property was doubled, how much is it counted as?

hebrew_text: אִילֵימָא מִינֵּיהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי כָּאן שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד מָנֶה — ״וְאֶת הָאָלֶף וּשְׁבַע מֵאוֹת וַחֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעִים עָשָׂה וָוִים לָעַמּוּדִים״, וְלֹא מְנָאָן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא בִּפְרוֹטְרוֹט, וְאִם אִיתָא — מֵאָה וְאֶחָד כִּכָּר וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה מָנֶה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If we say from itself as here seventy-one maneh , “And of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the pillars” and the verse counted them only of small coins, And if it is so should have 101 talents and eleven maneh .
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: If you say that from it, for here there are seventy-one mana - "And of the thousand seven hundred seventy-five he made hooks for the pillars," and the Scripture only counts them in detail, and if it is found - he requires one hundred and eleven kikar and eleven mana!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִדְּלֹא מְנָאָן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא בִּפְרוֹטְרוֹט, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מָנֶה שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ כָּפוּל הָיָה.
human_translation: Rather, since the verse counts only of small coins, learn from it a maneh of the Sanctuary was double
llm_translation: Rather, since the Scripture did not count except in "protrusions," learn from it: the measure of holy was doubled.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא כְּלָלֵי קָחָשֵׁיב בְּכַכְּרֵי, פְּרָטִי לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב בְּכַכְּרֵי!
human_translation: But perhaps calculates the general in talents, does not calculate the details, in talents,
llm_translation: Perhaps the general principles are considered in the circles, but the specifics are not considered in the circles!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וּנְחֹשֶׁת הַתְּנוּפָה שִׁבְעִים כִּכָּר וְאַלְפַּיִם וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁקֶל״, שֶׁהֲרֵי כָּאן תִּשְׁעִים וְשִׁשָּׁה מָנֶה, וְלֹא מְנָאָן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא בִּפְרוֹטְרוֹט, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מָנֶה שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ כָּפוּל הָיָה.
human_translation: Rather, the principle from here: “And the brass of the offering was seventy talents and 2,400 shekels” there are ninety-six maneh here, and the verse counts them only of small coins. Learn from it a maneh of the Sanctuary was double
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And the copper of the wave offering was seventy talents and two thousand and four hundred shekels," for here there are ninety-six mana, and the verse did not count except in prutrot, infer from it: the mana of the holy was doubled.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא פְּרָטָא רַבָּה קָא חָשֵׁיב בְּכַכְּרֵי, פְּרָטָא זוּטָא לָא קָחָשֵׁיב בְּכַכְּרֵי!
human_translation: But perhaps calculates a large unit, in talents, does not calculate a small unit, in talents.
llm_translation: Perhaps the specific matter Ravah is considering in large coins, the specific matter in small coins is not considered in large coins!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מֵהָכָא, ״וְהַשֶּׁקֶל עֶשְׂרִים גֵּרָה עֶשְׂרִים שְׁקָלִים חֲמִשָּׁה וְעֶשְׂרִים שְׁקָלִים עֲשָׂרָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה שֶׁקֶל הַמָּנֶה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda says from here: “And the shekel shall be twenty gera ; twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, ten, and five shekels, shall be your maneh ”
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: From here, "And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, ten and five shekels shall be your maneh."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מָאתַן וְאַרְבְּעִין הָוְיָין! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מָנֶה שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ מָנֶה כָּפוּל הָיָה.
human_translation: But is two hundred and forty Rather, learn from maneh of the Sanctuary was a maneh double
llm_translation: The Gemara: "And there were one hundred and forty! Rather, learn from it: If one designated a measure of holy items, it was a double measure."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, מוֹסִיפִין עַל הַמִּדּוֹת, וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין יָתֵר עַל שְׁתוּת, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שְׁתוּתָא מִלְּבַר.
human_translation: And learn from it increase measures, but they may not increase more than one-sixth. And learn from it the one-sixth from the outside,
llm_translation: And hear from it, we add upon the measures, and we do not add more than a sixth, and hear from it a sixth from the heart.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שָׁאַלְתִּי אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּבֵית מוֹתְבָא רַבָּא, מָה נִשְׁתַּנּוּ פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים מִפִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים? אָמַר לִי: גְּזֵירַת הַכָּתוּב הִיא, וְעוֹד שֶׁסִּיְּיעוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאָתָם מִמִּצְרַיִם, שֶׁאֵין לָךְ כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ עִמּוֹ תִּשְׁעִים חֲמוֹרִים לוּבִים טְעוּנִים מִכַּסְפָּהּ וּזְהָבָהּ שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: I asked Rabbi Eliezer in the great study hall: what are firstborn donkeys different from firstborn horses and camels, said to me: is a Torah edict. And furthermore, assisted the Jewish people at the time of their exodus from Egypt, as there was not one of the Jewish people that did not have ninety Nubian donkeys with him, laden with the silver and gold of the Egyptians.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: I asked Rabbi Eliezer in the house of Mothva Raba, what is the difference between the firstborn of donkeys and the firstborn of horses and camels? He said to me: It is a decree of the Scripture, and furthermore, the Israelites were assisted at the time of their departure from Egypt, for there was not a single one of the Israelites who did not have with him ninety laden donkeys of silver and gold vessels from Egypt.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שְׁאִלְתִּיו: מַאי לְשׁוֹן ״רְפִידִים״? וְאָמַר לִי: רְפִידִים שְׁמָהּ. כְּתַנָּאֵי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: רְפִידִים שְׁמָהּ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שֶׁרִיפּוּ עַצְמָן מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא הִפְנוּ אָבוֹת אֶל בָּנִים מֵרִפְיוֹן יָדָיִם״.
human_translation: And furthermore, I asked What the term: “Rephidim,” And he said to me Rephidim its name, like tanna’im : Rabbi Eliezer says its name Rephidim. Rabbi Yehoshua says: that became lax [ rippu ] with regard to the statements of the Torah and so it says: “The fathers look not back to their children because of feebleness [ rifyon ] of hands”
llm_translation: I asked him further: What is the meaning of "refidim"? And he said to me: Refidim is its name. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Refidim is its name, Rabbi Yehoshua says: They burned themselves with the words of Torah, and so he says: "The fathers did not turn to the children from the weakness of their hands."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שְׁאִלְתִּיו: מַאי לְשׁוֹן ״שִׁטִּים״? וְאָמַר לִי: שִׁטִּים שְׁמָהּ. כְּתַנָּאֵי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שִׁטִּים שְׁמָהּ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שֶׁנִּתְעַסְקוּ בְּדִבְרֵי שְׁטוּת.
human_translation: And furthermore, I asked him What the term “Shittim” And he said to me Shittim its name. like tanna’im : Rabbi Eliezer says: Shittim the name of Rabbi Yehoshua says: that they were engaged in matters of nonsense [ shetut ],
