llm_translation: I asked him further: What is the meaning of the term "שִׁטִּים"? And he said to me: Its name is "שִׁטִּים." As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Its name is "שִׁטִּים," Rabbi Yehoshua says: They engaged in matters of foolishness.

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּקְרֶאןָ לָעָם לְזִבְחֵי אֱלֹהֵיהֶן״ — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עֲרוּמּוֹת פָּגְעוּ בָּהֶן, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ כּוּלָּן בַּעֲלֵי קְרָיִין.
human_translation: “And they called [ vatikrena ] the people to the offerings of their gods” Rabbi Eliezer says: Naked women encountered them, Rabbi Yehoshua says that they all became those who experienced seminal emissions [ kerayyin ]
llm_translation: "And they called to the people for the sacrifices of their gods" — Rabbi Eliezer says: Naked ones encountered them, Rabbi Yehoshua says: They all became owners of a cemetery.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר, וַחֲמוֹר שֶׁיָּלְדָה כְּמִין סוּס — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַיּוֹלֵד חֲמוֹר וְהַנּוֹלָד חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: A cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts and a donkey that gave birth to a horse of sorts are exempt from a firstborn, as it is stated: firstborn of a donkey firstborn of a donkey twice, unless the birth mother is a donkey and the born is a donkey.
llm_translation: It was taught: A cow that gives birth to a donkey, and a donkey that gives birth like a horse - is exempt from the firstborn status, as it is stated: "The firstborn of a donkey" twice, until the one giving birth is a donkey and the one born is a donkey.

hebrew_text: וּמַה הֵם בַּאֲכִילָה? בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה כְּמִין בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה, וּטְמֵאָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה כְּמִין בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה — אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה, שֶׁהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּמֵא — טָמֵא, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּהוֹר — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And what with regard to consumption? a kosher animal that gave birth to a non-kosher animal of sorts, consumption is permitted. And a non-kosher that gave birth to a kosher animal of sorts, consumption is prohibited. because that which emerges from the non-kosher is non-kosher and that which emerges from the kosher is kosher.
llm_translation: And what are they in eating? A clean animal that gave birth like a species of an unclean animal — permitted in eating, and an unclean animal that gave birth like a species of a clean animal — forbidden in eating, that which comes out from the unclean — unclean, and that which comes out from the clean — clean.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: רָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז, וְעֵז שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין רָחֵל — פָּטוּר מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: We learned there A ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts and a goat that gave birth to a ewe of sorts are exempt firstborn. And if has some of the characteristics obligated,
llm_translation: We learned there: If Rachel gave birth to a kid from a goat, and a goat gave birth to a kid from Rachel - he is exempt from the firstborn status, and if it has some distinguishing features - he is obligated.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר״ — שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר, ״בְּכוֹר כֶּשֶׂב״ — שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא כֶּשֶׂב וּבְכוֹרוֹ כֶּשֶׂב, ״בְּכוֹר עֵז״ — שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא עֵז וּבְכוֹרוֹ עֵז.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda says as the verse states “But the firstborn of an ox, that it must be an ox and its firstborn an ox “the firstborn of a lamb” that it must be a lamb and its firstborn a lamb, “the firstborn of a goat” that it must be a goat and its firstborn a goat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rav Yehudah, de'amar kra: 'Ach bechor shor' — sheyehu hu shor u'vekoro shor, 'bechor keshev' — sheyehu hu keshev u'vekoro keshev, 'bechor ez' — sheyehu hu ez u'vekoro ez." English translation: "What are these words? Rav Yehudah said, as the verse says: 'But the firstborn of a cow' — that it should be a cow and its firstborn a cow, 'the firstborn of a sheep' — that it should be a sheep and its firstborn a sheep, 'the firstborn of a goat' — that it should be a goat and its firstborn a goat."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״ — חִלֵּק.
human_translation: might even has some of the characteristics the verse states: “But,” makes a distinction
llm_translation: He could even have some signs? The Talmud says: "But" - divide.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנָּא ״פֶּטֶר״ ״פֶּטֶר״ קָנָסֵיב לַהּ, לְפָרָה!
human_translation: But doesn’t the tanna cite “firstborn,” “firstborn,” with regard to a cow
llm_translation: And the Tanna taught: "Petur, Petur" - they acquired it for her, for the cow!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר״ — עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר, ״בְּכוֹר כֶּשֶׂב״ — עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא כֶּשֶׂב וּבְכוֹרוֹ כֶּשֶׂב, ״אוֹ בְכוֹר עֵז״ — עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא עֵז וּבְכוֹרוֹ עֵז.
human_translation: he says in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says “but the firstborn of an ox” unless it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox. “the firstborn of a lamb” unless it is a lamb and its firstborn is a lamb. “or the firstborn of a goat” unless it is a goat and its firstborn is a goat.
llm_translation: He who said like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: "But the firstborn of an ox" - until it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox, "or the firstborn of a sheep" - until it is a sheep and its firstborn is a sheep, "or the firstborn of a goat" - until it is a goat and its firstborn is a goat.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״ — חִלֵּק.
human_translation: might even has some of the characteristics the verse states: “But,” makes a distinction
llm_translation: He could even if there are some signs? The Talmud says: "However" - divide.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תַּנָּא דִידַן סָבַר: גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, וְהוּא הַדִּין בִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree, The tanna of our holds the Merciful One revealed to sanctity value and the same is true with regard to inherent sanctity
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Our Mishna holds: "Reveal mercy in the sanctity of blood," while he holds: "Reveal mercy in the sanctity of the body."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, וְהוּא הַדִּין בִּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, וְגָמַר קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים מִקְּדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei holds the Merciful One revealed to inherent sanctity, and the same is true with regard to sanctity value, and he derives sanctity value from inherent sanctity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: Reveal mercy in the sanctity of the body, and likewise in the sanctity of blood, and conclude the sanctity of blood from the sanctity of the body.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִידַן, הַאי ״בְּכוֹר״ ״בְּכוֹר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא.
human_translation: And the tanna of our what does he do with this “Firstborn,” “firstborn,” requires it to in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina.
llm_translation: Our Tanna teaches: What is our understanding of the term "bekhor" in the verse? It is necessary for it to be in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Hanina.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרוּ אֵימוּרִין בִּבְכוֹר שׁוֹר, אֵימוּרִין בִּבְכוֹר כֶּשֶׂב, אֵימוּרִין בִּבְכוֹר עֵז?
human_translation: As Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Why were sacrificial portions stated with regard to a firstborn ox, sacrificial portions with regard to a firstborn lamb, sacrificial portions with regard to a firstborn goat?
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Why were statements made regarding the firstborn of an ox, statements made regarding the firstborn of a sheep, and statements made regarding the firstborn of a goat?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בִּבְכוֹר שׁוֹר — שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בִּנְסָכִים.
human_translation: is necessary, as had the Merciful One written with regard to a firstborn ox, as has more libations
llm_translation: The matter is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote "firstborn ox" - it is because it has also increased in libations.

hebrew_text: כֶּשֶׂב — שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בְּאַלְיָה.
human_translation: a lamb, as it has more tail
llm_translation: Ke'sev - she'ken nitrabah be'alyah. Translation: "A sheep - for thus it multiplied in Aleyah."

hebrew_text: בְּעֵז — שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה אֵצֶל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: with regard to a goat, as it has an increased with regard to an individual idol worship,
llm_translation: Boaz - for thus he excelled in foreign worship in private.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי!
human_translation: one cannot be derived from one derive one from two?
llm_translation: One from one does not come, one from two comes!

hebrew_text: בְּהֵי לָא לִיכְתּוֹב? לָא לִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּשׁוֹר, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ — מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבּוּ אֵצֶל פְּסָחִים!
human_translation: With regard to which shall not write the Merciful One shall not write with regard to an ox, and derive from these What about these that they have an increased with regard to the Paschal offering,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Why was it not written? It was not written because the Merciful One wrote concerning an ox, and it is derived from here - just as by an ox, so too they multiplied by Pesachim!

hebrew_text: לָא לִכְתּוֹב בְּכֶשֶׂב, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ — מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבּוּ אֵצֶל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּצִיבּוּר!
human_translation: should not write with regard to a lamb, and derive from these What about these that they have an increased with regard to community idol worship,
llm_translation: Not to write with wool, and to place from there - just as from there they multiplied by idolatry in public worship!

hebrew_text: לָא נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּעֵז, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ — מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד רִבּוּי אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ! הִילְכָּךְ צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: the Merciful One shall not write with regard to a goat, and derive from these What about these that they have an element of increase with regard to the altar, Therefore, are necessary.
llm_translation: The Merciful One is not written with a letter "Ayin" in "Ez," and it is written with a "Tet" from "Hanach" - what is the "Hanach" that it has an aspect of excessiveness near the altar! Therefore, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, אִם כֵּן לִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר כֶּשֶׂב וְעֵז״, ״בְּכוֹר״ ״בְּכוֹר״ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili If so let the verse write: But a firstborn ox, lamb, or goat. Why do I “firstborn” “firstborn” Rather, isn’t it conclude from unless is an ox and its firstborn is an ox?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said, "If so, let it be written: 'But the firstborn of a cow, sheep, and goat,' 'firstborn,' 'firstborn,' why do I need it? Rather, it is not to learn from it: until it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, הַאי ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, what does he do with this “Firstborn of a donkey,” “firstborn of a donkey,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili, this "Petur Chamor," what does he do with "Petur Chamor"?

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״אַךְ פָּדֹה תִפְדֶּה אֶת בְּכוֹר הָאָדָם וְאֵת בְּכוֹר הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּמֵאָה תִּפְדֶּה״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ — פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים.
human_translation: he requires for that which is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says since it is stated: “Yet you shall redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of non-kosher animals you shall redeem” I derive even firstborn horses and camels the verse states: “Firstborn of a donkey,” I said to you a firstborn donkey, but not firstborn horses or camels.
llm_translation: He asked him according to the teaching: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says, since it is stated "Only you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of the unclean animal you shall redeem," do I hear even the firstborn of horses and camels? The verse teaches us to say "the redemption of a donkey" - I have told you the redemption of a donkey, and not the redemption of horses and camels.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹר בְּשֶׂה, פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים בְּכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: And still I can say firstborn donkeys by means of a lamb, firstborn horses and camels by means of any item.
llm_translation: And still I say: The offspring of a donkey with a sheep, the offspring of horses and camels in all matters.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים — פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים.
human_translation: the verse states “Firstborn of a donkey” “firstborn of a donkey” two times. I said to you firstborns of donkeys, but not firstborns of horses or camels.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Petur chamor" "Petur chamor" twice - I told you the exemptions of donkeys, not the exemptions of horses and camels.

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחַאי: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא חַד, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל, וְיָצָא מִן הַכְּלָל לְלַמֵּד, לֹא לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמוֹ יָצָא אֶלָּא לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ יָצָא, וּלְעוֹלָם בְּשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai refutes If the Merciful One had written once, I would say an item that was included in a generalization but emerged from the generalization to teach emerged to teach not about itself, but emerged to teach about the entire generalization. And actually by means of a lamb
llm_translation: Rav Ahai posed a question: If the Merciful One wrote one thing, I would have said that it was included, and it came out from the inclusion to teach, not to teach about itself it came out, but to teach about the entire inclusion it came out, and forever in the lamb.

hebrew_text: כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר״ אַחֲרִינָא, פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים וְלֹא פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים, וְאֵימָא: מַעֲטִינְהוּ מֹשֶׁה, וּלְעוֹלָם בְּכׇל דָּבָר!
human_translation: the Merciful One writes: “Firstborn of a donkey,” another firstborn donkeys but not firstborn horses or camels. And I can say excluded from a lamb, but actually, by means of any item.
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote, "The firstborn of a donkey," another animal, the firstborn of donkeys and not the firstborn of horses and camels. And why? Moses diminished them, but in all things forever!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר תִּפְדֶּה בְשֶׂה״ וַ״חֲמוֹר תִּפְדֶּה בְשֶׂה״. ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר תִּפְדֶּה בְשֶׂה״, ״פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר תִּפְדֶּה בְשֶׂה״ לְמָה לִי? פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא פִּטְרֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים.
human_translation: If so let the Merciful One write: Firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, and: A donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, Why do I “A firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb,” “a firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb,” I said to you firstborns of donkeys, but not firstborns of horses or camels.
llm_translation: "If so, let the Merciful One write: 'The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb' and 'A donkey you shall redeem with a lamb.' 'The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb,' 'The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb,' why do I need it? I told you about the redemption of donkeys, not the redemption of horses and camels."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִידַן, לְמַעוֹטֵי סוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים, מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And the tanna of our from where does he excludes horses and camels
llm_translation: And it was taught in our Mishnah: to exclude horses and camels, how do we count it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כׇּל מִקְנְךָ תִּזָּכָר — כָּלַל, שׁוֹר וָשֶׂה וַחֲמוֹר — פָּרַט, כְּלָל וּפְרָט — אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט, שׁוֹר וָשֶׂה וַחֲמוֹר — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said “From all your livestock you shall take the males” a generalization, an ox and a lamb and a donkey a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization only that which in the detail. an ox and a lamb and a donkey, yes, anything else, no,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "All your livestock you shall remember" - this is a generalization; "ox, sheep, and donkey" - this is a specification. Generalization and specification - in the generalization there is only what is in the specification. Ox, sheep, and donkey - yes; other things - no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? ״פֶּטֶר״ הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן, וְרַבָּנַן? וָי״ו הֲדַר עָרְבֵיהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, “firstborn” interrupts the matter, And the Rabbis, vav , the verse returns combines
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? "Petur" interrupted the matter, and the Rabbis? And the letter "Vav" he then read.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? לָא לִכְתּוֹב לָא וָי״ו וְלָא ״פֶּטֶר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, would write neither vav nor “firstborn,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? Not to write "vav" and not "peter."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? אַיְּידֵי דְּהָא קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, וְהָא קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף — פָּסֵיק לְהוּ וַהֲדַר עָרֵיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, Since this, sanctity value and that, inherent sanctity interpose them, and combine them again
llm_translation: The sages? Because of the holiness of blood, and the holiness of the body - it interrupts for them and then joins together for them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — מַהוּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts, and it has some of the characteristics what is
llm_translation: He asked them: A cow that gave birth to a donkey, and it has some signs - what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: עֵז שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין רָחֵל, וְרָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז, דְּכִי יֵשׁ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה, דְּהָא טְהוֹרָה וְהָא טְהוֹרָה, הָא קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף וְהָא קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף.
human_translation: a goat that gave birth to a ewe of sorts and a ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts, that when it has some of the characteristics is obligated, of firstborn as this a kosher and that a kosher this inherent sanctity and that inherent sanctity.
llm_translation: A goat that gave birth from a sheep, and a sheep that gave birth from a goat, for when there are some signs — she is obligated in firstborn status, for this one is pure and this one is pure, this one is the sanctity of the body and this one is the sanctity of the body.

hebrew_text: הָכָא, דְּהָא טְמֵאָה וְהָא טְהוֹרָה, הָא קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף וְהָא קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים — לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּנֵי מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה — קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: here, as this, a non-kosher and that, a kosher this inherent sanctity, and that sanctity value. not Or perhaps since this and that sanctified with firstborn sanctified
llm_translation: Here, that one impure and this one pure, this sanctity of the body and this sanctity of blood - no, or perhaps: since both are in the sanctity of the Temple in the firstborn - holy?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה קָדוֹשׁ, חֲמוֹר שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי לָא בַּת מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה הוּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּמִין טְמֵאָה הוּא קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: And if you say since this and that sanctified with firstborn sanctified what is a donkey that gave birth to a horse of sorts? here certainly is not sanctified with firstborn Or perhaps since is a non-kosher species, sanctified
llm_translation: And if you might say: Since both this one and that one sanctify with firstborn sanctity, a donkey that gave birth to a foal, what is it? Here, surely it is not a daughter of sanctity with firstborn sanctity, or perhaps since it is from an impure species, is it holy?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּמִין טְמֵאָה הוּא קָדוֹשׁ, פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי הָא טְהוֹרָה וְהָא טְמֵאָה, הָא בַּת מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה וְהָא לָא בַּת מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא סִימָנִין מִילְּתָא הִיא?
human_translation: If you say since it is a non-kosher species sanctified, what is a cow that gave birth to a horse of sorts? Here, certainly this kosher and that non-kosher. this sanctified with firstborn and that not sanctified with firstborn Or perhaps characteristics is matter
llm_translation: If you might say: Since a female animal that gives birth to a hybrid offspring is considered holy, what about a cow that gives birth to a horse? Here, certainly one is pure and one is impure, one is a daughter of a consecrated animal in the firstborn status and one is not a daughter of a consecrated animal in the firstborn status, or perhaps these are merely signs of the matter?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה. מַאי לָאו אֲפִילּוּ פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס? לֹא, פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: Come hear A kosher animal that gave birth to a non-kosher animal of sorts is exempt from a firstborn. If has some of the characteristics is obligated, firstborn What, not even a cow that gave birth to a horse of sorts? No, a cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A pure animal that gave birth to an impure animal - exempt from the firstborn, if it has some signs - obligated in the firstborn. What if not even a cow that gave birth to a horse? No, a cow that gave birth to a donkey.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר, וַחֲמוֹר שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה. מַאי לָאו אַתַּרְוַיְיהוּ? לָא, אַפָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: Come hear a cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts or a donkey that gave birth to a horse of sorts, exempt from a firstborn. If has some of the characteristics obligated, to firstborn What, not to both No, to a cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A cow that gives birth to a donkey, and a donkey that gives birth to a horse - is exempt from the firstborn status. If it has some distinguishing features - it is obligated in the firstborn status. What is the reason they are not considered? Because a cow that gives birth to a donkey is not considered.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲמוֹר שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס, לְמַאי קָתָנֵי לַהּ? לִפְטוּרָא? פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה פָּרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין חֲמוֹר, דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּנֵי מִיקְדָּשׁ בִּבְכוֹרָה נִינְהוּ, אָמְרַתְּ: אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — אִין, וְאִי לָא — לָא, חֲמוֹר שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין סוּס מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: But for what teach a donkey that gave birth to a horse of sorts? to exempt obvious And now, a cow that gave birth to a donkey of sorts, where this and that are sanctified with firstborn you said if has some of the characteristics yes, and if not no, a donkey that gave birth to a horse of sorts, is necessary
llm_translation: But a donkey that gave birth to a horse, for what purpose is it teaching her? To exempt her? Obviously! Now, regarding a cow that gave birth to a donkey, since both are fit for offerings in the Temple, you say: If it has some signs - no, and if not - yes, does a donkey that gave birth to a horse require inquiry?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ: הָתָם הוּא דְּיֵשׁ לָהּ קַרְנַיִם, וְהָא אֵין לָהּ קַרְנַיִם; הָא פַּרְסוֹתֶיהָ סְדוּקוֹת, וְהָא פַּרְסוֹתֶיהָ קְלוּטוֹת.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind there, as has horns, and this does not have horns. that its hooves are split, but this its hooves are closed [ kelutot ].
llm_translation: It is necessary, it is necessary for your understanding: there, where it has two horns, and here, where it does not have two horns; there, its hoofs are split, and here, its hoofs are whole.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי אֵין לָהּ קַרְנַיִם, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי פַּרְסוֹתֶיהָ קְלוּטוֹת, אֵימָא חֲמוֹר אָדוֹם בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But here, as this and that do not have horns, this and that its hooves are closed, I can say is merely a red donkey, teaches us
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "But here, where both sides do not have horns, both sides have their hooves split, perhaps it is a regular red donkey, let us hear."

hebrew_text: וּמָה הֵן בַּאֲכִילָה כּוּ׳. לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי ״שֶׁהַיּוֹצֵא״?
human_translation: And what with regard to consumption? Why do I to teach because that which emerges
llm_translation: And what are the laws regarding eating, etc.? Why do I need to teach "one who goes out"?

hebrew_text: סִימָנָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, דְּלָא תִּיחַלַּף לָךְ, דְּלָא תֵּימָא: זִיל בָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ, וְהַאי טָהוֹר מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְהַאי טָמֵא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, אֶלָּא זִיל בָּתַר אִימֵּיהּ.
human_translation: is merely a mnemonic that you do not reverse that you do not say: Follow its and this a full-fledged kosher and that is a full-fledged non-kosher Rather, follow its mother.
llm_translation: The sign is merely a general indication, that it should not change for you, that you should not say: Go after his opinion, and this one is pure above, and this one is impure above, rather go after his mother.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אַךְ אֶת זֶה לֹא תֹאכְלוּ מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה״ — יֵשׁ לְךָ שֶׁהוּא מַעֲלֵה גֵרָה וּמַפְרִיס פַּרְסָה וְאִי אַתָּה אוֹכְלוֹ, וְאֵיזֶה זֶה? טָהוֹר שֶׁנּוֹלַד מִן הַטָּמֵא. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא טָמֵא הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַטָּהוֹר, וּמַאי ״מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה״?
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “Nevertheless these shall you not eat, of them that chew the cud, or of them that split the hoof” you have that chews the cud and has split hooves, but you may not eat it. And which is this? a kosher that was born from a non-kosher Or only a non-kosher that was born from a kosher and what “of them that chew the cud, or of them that split the hoof”?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words? For the Rabbis taught: 'But you shall not eat of these: the camel, the hare, and the rock badger' — you have here something that chews the cud and has a cloven hoof, yet you do not eat it. And what is this? A pure animal born from an impure one. Or is it rather an impure animal born from a pure one? And what is meant by 'from above the cud and from above the hoof'?" English translation:

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: דָּבָר הַבָּא מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה לָא תֵּיכוּל, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גָּמָל... טָמֵא הוּא״ — הוּא טָמֵא, וְאֵין טָמֵא הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַטָּהוֹר טָמֵא אֶלָּא טָהוֹר.
human_translation: This is saying: You shall not eat a being that comes from chew their cud and have split hooves the verse states: “The camel…is impure is non-kosher, but a non-kosher that is born from a kosher is not non-kosher; rather, kosher.
llm_translation: So it is stated: A matter that comes from above the throat and from the splitting of the hoof cannot be considered impure. The Talmud says: "It is impure..." — It is impure, and that which is born from the pure animal is not impure, but rather pure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״גָּמָל״ ״גָּמָל״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים, אֶחָד גָּמָל הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַגְּמַלָּה, וְאֶחָד גָּמָל הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says “Camel” “camel” two times both a camel that is born from a camel and a camel that is born from a cow
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Gamel, gamel" two times, one gamel born from a female gamel, and one gamel born from a female parah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״גָּמָל״ ״גָּמָל״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? חַד לֶאֱסוֹר עַצְמוֹ, וְחַד לֶאֱסוֹר חֲלָבוֹ. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לֶאֱסוֹר חֲלָבוֹ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אֶת הַגָּמָל״. וְרַבָּנַן, ״אֶתִּים״ לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis what do they do with this “camel,” “camel”? one to prohibit itself and one to prohibit milk. And Rabbi Shimon, from where does he milk is forbidden? He derives it from “the camel [ et hagamal ].” And the Rabbis do not interpret instances of “ et ”
llm_translation: The sages, this "camel," what does it do with "camel"? One to prohibit itself, and one to prohibit its milk. And Rabbi Shimon, how does he derive to prohibit its milk? He derives it from "from the hair of the camel." And the sages did not interpret "goats."

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: שִׁמְעוֹן הָעַמְסוֹנִי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ כׇּל ״אֵת״ וָ״אֵת״ שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְ״אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא״ פֵּירַשׁ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, כׇּל ״אֶתִּין״ שֶׁדָּרַשְׁתָּ מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶם? אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁקִּבׇּלְתִּי שָׂכָר עַל הַדְּרִישָׁה, כָּךְ אֲנִי מְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר עַל הַפְּרִישָׁה.
human_translation: As it is taught Shimon HaAmasoni would interpret each and every “ et ” in the Torah, Once he reached “You shall fear the Lord your God” he withdrew His students said to him: Our teacher, what will be with all “ ” that you interpreted said to them: Just as I received reward for the exposition, so I receive reward for withdrawal
llm_translation: As it was taught: Shimon the Emsonite would expound every "et" and "ve'et" in the Torah. Once he reached "et Hashem Elohecha tira," he explained it. His disciples said to him: Rabbi, for all the "etin" that you have expounded, what will be their reward? He said to them: Just as I received reward for expounding, so too I receive reward for explaining.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְלִימֵּד: ״אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא״ — לְרַבּוֹת תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: until Rabbi Akiva came and taught: “You shall fear the Lord your God”; to include Torah scholars,
llm_translation: Until Rabbi Akiva came and taught: "You shall fear the Lord your God" - to include the students of the sages.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, טַעְמָא דְרַבָּנַן מִ״גָּמָל״ ״גָּמָל״, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מֵ״אֶת הַגָּמָל״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא חָלָב דִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה שְׁרֵי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, the reason of the Rabbis from “camel,” “camel,” and Rabbi Shimon from “the camel [ et hagamal ],” that not this I would say milk of a non-kosher animal is permitted?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, the reason of the Sages is from "camel" "camel," and Rabbi Shimon is from "the camel's teat," was it not thus that I would say, the milk of an impure animal is permitted?

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״הַטְּמֵאִים״ — לֶאֱסוֹר צִירָן, וְרוֹטְבָן, וְקֵיפֶה שֶׁלָּהֶן?
human_translation: what is different from that which is taught that are impure [ hateme’im ] to prohibit their juice and their gravy and sediments their
llm_translation: What is different about that which is taught: "the impure" - to prohibit their dough, and their liquid, and their bowl?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל דִּבְהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה נָמֵי חִידּוּשׁ הוּא, דְּאָמַר מַר: דָּם נֶעְכָּר וְנַעֲשֶׂה חָלָב, וְכֵיוָן דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא — בִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה נָמֵי לִישְׁתְּרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say since of a kosher animal is also a novelty. as the Master said the blood is spoiled and becomes milk. Since it is a novelty with regard to a non-kosher animal it should also be permitted. teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded, I say: Since a kosher animal is also a novelty, as the Master said: "The blood becomes spoiled and turns into milk," and since it is a novelty - it is inferred that even with an unclean animal, it is permitted, this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּם נֶעְכָּר וְנַעֲשֶׂה חָלָב, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵיבָרֶיהָ מִתְפָּרְקִין הֵימֶנָּה וְאֵין נַפְשָׁהּ חוֹזֶרֶת עָלֶיהָ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says the blood is spoiled and becomes milk. But according to the one who says her limbs become disjointed and her soul, does not return to her until twenty-four months what is there to say?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for the one who says that the blood congeals and turns into milk, but for the one who says that its limbs decompose from it and its soul does not return to it until twenty-four months, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְלֵיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּאָתֵי מֵחַי וְשַׁרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, וְהַאי חָלָב כִּי אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי הוּא, וּשְׁרֵי, וְהִילְכָּךְ אֲפִילּוּ בִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה לִישְׁתְּרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say since there is nothing that comes from a living that the Merciful One permits, and this milk is similar to a limb from the living and is permitted, And consequently even of a non-kosher animalshould be permitted teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, I would say: since there is no prohibition from the Torah for the fat and the sinew of the thigh-vein, and this fat is from a living animal, and it is permitted, and therefore even with an unclean animal it is permitted to eat, this is what we can infer.

hebrew_text: וְחָלָב דִּבְהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה מְנָלַן דִּשְׁרֵי? אִילֵימָא מִדַּאֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא ״בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב״, הָא לְחוּדֵיהּ שְׁרֵי, וְאֵימָא: חָלָב לְחוּדֵיהּ אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה, בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב — בַּהֲנָאָה נָמֵי אָסוּר!
human_translation: And from where do we that the milk of a kosher animal is permitted? If we say from that the Merciful One prohibits meat in milk, that by itself is permitted, and say milk alone is forbidden for consumption but permitted with regard to benefit meat in milk is forbidden with regard to benefit as well.
llm_translation: And milk of a kosher animal from where do we derive that it is permitted? If you say it is derived from the fact that the Merciful One prohibited "meat cooked in milk," then let it be permitted for its own sake. And if you say: milk is prohibited for consumption but permitted for benefit, meat cooked in milk - even for benefit it is also prohibited!

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּשָׁרֵי בַּהֲנָאָה, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְמִילְקֵי עַל בִּישּׁוּלֵיהּ!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who deems permitted with regard to benefit you find to receive lashes for cooking them
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon, who permits deriving benefit, you forget to bring him milk for his coffee!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא דְּבִפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, ״תִּזְבַּח״ — וְלֹא גִּיזָּה, ״בָּשָׂר״ — וְלֹא חָלָב, הָא דְּחוּלִּין שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, since the Merciful One revealed that with regard to disqualified consecrated (Deuteronomy 12:15). “You may slaughter,” but not shearing. “meat,” but not milk. of non-sacred permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, from the merciful one of those disqualified from the holy things, "you shall slaughter" — and not shear, "flesh" — and not milk, for the mundane are permissible.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: דְּחוּלִּין אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּשְׁרֵי בַּהֲנָאָה, דְּקָדָשִׁים בַּהֲנָאָה נָמֵי אָסוּר!
human_translation: But say of non-sacred is forbidden for consumption but is permitted with regard to benefit of sacrificial forbidden with regard to benefit as well.
llm_translation: And why? Regular items are forbidden in consumption and permitted in benefit, but consecrated items are also forbidden in benefit!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וְדֵי חֲלֵב עִזִּים לְלַחְמְךָ לְלֶחֶם בֵּיתֶךָ וְחַיִּים לְנַעֲרוֹתֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rather, from that it is written: “And there will be goats’ milk enough for your food, for the food of your household, and maintenance for your maidens”
llm_translation: Rather, as it is written: "And the best of the milk of sheep, for your food, for the food of your household, and sustenance for your maidens."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא לִסְחוֹרָה? אֶלָּא מִדִּכְתִיב ״וְאֵת עֲשֶׂרֶת חֲרִיצֵי הֶחָלָב״.
human_translation: But perhaps to merchandise Rather, from that it is written “And these ten cheeses
llm_translation: Perhaps for trade? Rather, as it is written, "And the ten curtains of fine twined linen."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לִסְחוֹרָה? אַטּוּ דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל מִלְחָמָה לִסְחוֹרָה?!
human_translation: But perhaps as merchandise. Is that to say the norm during war to commerce?
llm_translation: Perhaps for commerce? Is her way that of war for commerce?!

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״אֶרֶץ זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ״, וְאִי לָא דִּשְׁרֵי, מִשְׁתַּבַּח לַן קְרָא בְּמִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי? וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״לְכוּ שִׁבְרוּ וֶאֱכֹלוּ, וּלְכוּ שִׁבְרוּ בְּלֹא כֶסֶף וּבְלֹא מְחִיר יַיִן וְחָלָב״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say from here: “A land flowing with milk and honey” and if was not permitted, would the verse praise to us with an item that is not suitable And if you wish, say from here: “Come, buy, and eat; and come, buy wine and milk without money and without price”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say from here: "A land flowing with milk and honey," and if it is not permitted, let the verse be praised for us in matters that are not seen? And if you wish, say from here: "Come, buy and eat, come, buy without money and without price wine and milk."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״שָׁפָן״ ״שָׁפָן״, ״אַרְנֶבֶת״ ״אַרְנֶבֶת״, ״חֲזִיר״ ״חֲזִיר״, לְהָנֵי הוּא דְּאָתוּ?
human_translation: But if that is so, “Hare,” “hare,” “rock badger,” “rock badger,” “swine,” “swine” do come to these
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, "shafan" "shafan," "arnevet" "arnevet," "chazir" "chazir," for what purpose did they come?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְכִדְתַנְיָא: לָמָּה נִשְׁנוּ בַּבְּהֵמָה — מִפְּנֵי ״הַשְּׁסוּעָה״, וּבָעוֹפוֹת — מִפְּנֵי ״הָרָאָה״.
human_translation: only for that which is taught Why were repeated With regard to the animals, because of the shesua and with regard to the birds, because of the ra’a
llm_translation: Rather, according to the teaching: Why were they distinguished in the case of animals? - Because of "the cloven hoof," and in the case of birds - because of "the ruminant."

hebrew_text: ״גָּמָל״ ״גָּמָל״ נָמֵי לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמִידְרָשׁ דָּרְשִׁינַן.
human_translation: “camel,” “camel,” also comes for this anywhere that it is to interpret we interpret
llm_translation: "Gemal, gemal, namei lehakhi hu da'ata! Kol heicha de'ikka lemidrash darshinan." "Camel, camel, it is so named because of this reason! Wherever there is a place for Midrash, we expound."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז, וְעֵז שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין רָחֵל — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִים — חַיֶּיבֶת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ דּוֹמֶה לְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught a ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts and a goat that gave birth to a ewe of sorts, is exempt from a firstborn. And if it has some of the characteristics is obligated, Rabbi Shimon says: unless its head and the majority of are similar to its mother.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If Rachel gave birth to a kid, and a kid gave birth to a Rachel - she is exempt from the firstborn, and if it has some signs - she is obligated. Rabbi Shimon says: Until its head and majority resemble its mother.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לַאֲכִילָה, מִי בָּעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before With regard to eating does Rabbi Shimon require its head and most of or not,
llm_translation: He inquired of them: For eating, does Rabbi Shimon require its head and majority, or not?

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן בְּכוֹרָה, כְּתִיב: ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר״, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר. אֲבָל לַאֲכִילָה, גָּמָל הוּא דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא דַּאֲסִיר, הָא
human_translation: With regard to firstborn it is written: “But the firstborn of an ox” unless it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox. But with regard to consumption, is camel that the Merciful One states is forbidden, but
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of firstborn status, it is written: "But the firstborn of a cow," until it is both a cow and its firstborn is a cow. But for consumption, it is a camel, as the Merciful One said it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתַּנִּי מִגָּמָל שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: is different from camel permitted Or perhaps is no difference,
llm_translation: A man who received a camel, is it a good price, or perhaps not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה — אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה, וְאִם דּוֹמֶה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ לְאִמּוֹ — חַיָּיב בִּבְכוֹרָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לַאֲכִילָה נָמֵי בָּעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ!
human_translation: Come hear a kosher animal that gave birth to a non-kosher animal of sorts, is forbidden for consumption, but if its head and the majority of similar to its mother, it is obligated in, firstborn Learn from it with regard to consumption, Rabbi Shimon also requires its head and the majority of
llm_translation: Listen and hear: a kosher animal that gives birth to a non-kosher animal — it is forbidden for consumption, and if its head and the majority of its body resemble its mother — it is obligated in the laws of firstborn. Listen to its species: for consumption alone does Rabbi Shimon require that its head and the majority of its body resemble its mother!

hebrew_text: לָא, לִבְכוֹרָה דַּוְקָא. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָא שָׁבְקַהּ לַאֲכִילָה וְקָם לֵיהּ אַבְּכוֹר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לִבְכוֹרָה הוּא דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ, אֲבָל לַאֲכִילָה — לָא.
human_translation: No, specifically with regard to firstborn is also precise, as leaves consumption and addresses firstborn Learn from it is with regard to firstborn that Rabbi Shimon requires its head and the majority of but with regard to consumption not
llm_translation: Not for the firstborn specifically. Specifically, because she left it for eating and it became a firstborn. Learn from it: It is the firstborn that Rabbi Shimon requires, both its head and its majority, but for eating - no.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: לַאֲכִילָה נָמֵי בָּעֵי, וּבְכוֹרָה אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר״, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר, וְלֹא תִּיסְגֵּי לֵיהּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ עַד דְּאִיכָּא כּוּלֵּיהּ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Actually, I will say to you with regard to consumption he also requires But was necessary firstborn enter your mind to say since it is written: “But the firstborn of an ox” unless it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox, and of the head and the majority of does not suffice unless its whole has teaches us
llm_translation: Forever say to you: for eating needs, and firstborn requires, since your mind I say: since it is written "But the firstborn of a cow," until it is a cow and its firstborn a cow, and do not mix it with its head and majority until there is all of it, it is established for us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אַךְ אֶת זֶה לֹא תֹאכְלוּ מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה״, זֶה — אִי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אַתָּה אוֹכֵל הַבָּא בְּסִימָן אֶחָד.
human_translation: Come hear “Nevertheless these shall you not eat from them that only chew the cud, or from them that only have a split hoof: these you may not eat but you may eat that comes with one characteristic
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: 'Ach et ze lo tochlu mimalei hagerah umimaprisei haparsah,' ze — i atah ochel, aval atah ochel haba besiman echad." English translation: "Come and hear: 'But you shall not eat of these: the gerah and the parsa,' this — you do not eat, but you eat the one that comes with a sign."

hebrew_text: וְאִי זֶה זֶה הַבָּא בְּסִימָן אֶחָד? זֶה טָמֵא הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַטָּהוֹר, וְעִבּוּרוֹ מִן הַטָּהוֹר.
human_translation: And which is this that comes with one characteristic This is a non-kosher that is born from a kosher and its impregnation from a kosher
llm_translation: "And if this one is the one that comes with one sign? This is the impure one born from the pure, and its offspring from the pure."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ עִבּוּרוֹ מִן הַטָּמֵא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֵׂה כְשָׂבִים וְשֵׂה עִזִּים״, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אָבִיו כֶּבֶשׂ וְאִמּוֹ כִּבְשָׂה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: might even its conception from a non-kosher the verse states: the sheep [ seh kesavim ], and goat [ veseh izzim ]” unless its father is a male lamb and its mother is a female lamb. the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: I am able even his father from the impure? Scripture to say: "a sheep and a goat", until his father a sheep and his mother a goat, the words of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב לְהַתִּיר אֶת הַמּוּתָּר, אֶלָּא לְהוֹסִיף עַל הַמּוּתָּר, וְאֵיזֶה זֶה? טָמֵא הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַטָּהוֹר וְעִבּוּרוֹ מִן הַטָּמֵא. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא עִבּוּרוֹ מִן הַטָּהוֹר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שׁוֹר שֵׂה כְשָׂבִים וְשֵׂה עִזִּים״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: this verse does not come to permit that which is permitted, rather to add to that which is permitted; and which is this? a non-kosher that is born from a kosher and its conception from a non-kosher Or only conception from a kosher The verse states: “The ox, the sheep [ seh kesavim ], and goat [ veseh izzim ].” in any case,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The verse did not come to permit the permitted, but to add onto the permitted. And what is this? The impure offspring born from the pure and its crossing over from the impure. Or is it only its crossing over from the pure? The verse teaches: "An ox, a sheep, and a goat" in any case.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״טָמֵא״, כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְקָאָמַר: אֲבָל אַתָּה אוֹכֵל הַבָּא בְּסִימָן אֶחָד!
human_translation: refers to non-kosher, in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, and he says: But you may eat that comes with one characteristic
llm_translation: He reads it as "tamei," like Rabbi Shimon, and he says: But you may eat the one that comes with a single sign!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּוָותֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: this tanna holds in accordance with with regard to one and disagrees with his with regard to one
llm_translation: This Tanna holds according to his reasoning in one matter, and disagrees with him in one matter.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַקְשֵׁי וּמוֹתֵיב: עִבּוּרוֹ מִן הַטָּמֵא — מִי מִעַבְּרָא?
human_translation: there are those who raise a difficulty and resolve impregnation from a non-kosher Can become pregnant
llm_translation: And there is one who challenges and responds: "His crossing from the impure - who crossed over?"

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לְעוֹלָם אֵין מִתְעַבֶּרֶת לֹא טְמֵאָה מִן הַטָּהוֹר, וְלֹא טְהוֹרָה מִן הַטָּמֵא, וְלֹא גַּסָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה, וְלֹא דַּקָּה מִן הַגַּסָּה, וְלֹא בְּהֵמָה מִן חַיָּה, וְלֹא חַיָּה מִן בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: A non-kosher never becomes pregnant from a kosher nor a kosher from a non-kosher nor a large from a small nor a small from a large nor a domesticated animal from an undomesticated animal, nor an undomesticated animal from a domesticated animal,
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Always not passes over not impure from the pure, and not pure from the impure, and not coarse from the fine, and not fine from the coarse, and not beast from wild animal, and not wild animal from beast.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מֵרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּמַחְלוּקְתּוֹ, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים חַיָּה מִתְעַבֶּרֶת מִבְּהֵמָה!
human_translation: except for Rabbi Eliezer and his disputants, who would say an undomesticated animal can become pregnant from a domesticated animal
llm_translation: Outside of Rabbi Eliezer and his dispute, for they would say: "A wild animal is more severe than a domestic animal!"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: דְּאִיעַבַּר מִקָּלוּט בֶּן פָּרָה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קָאָמַר, וְקָאָמַר: אֲבָל אַתָּה אוֹכֵל הַבָּא בְּסִימָן אֶחָד!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya says where became pregnant from with closed hooves the offspring of a cow. And said in accordance with of Rabbi Shimon, and he says: But you may eat that which comes with one characteristic
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yirmeya: that he passed through a thicket, son of a cow, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon he said, and he said: but you eat that which comes with one sign!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָותֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: This tanna holds in accordance with with regard to one and disagrees with his with regard to one
llm_translation: This scholar thought to her according to his opinion in one way, and he disagreed with her in one way.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם — מוּתָּר, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם — אָסוּר?
human_translation: Is this to say that Rabbi Eliezer holds this and that cause permitted, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds this and that cause forbidden?
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Eliezer, he holds: "This and that causes - permitted," and Rabbi Yehoshua holds: "This and that causes - forbidden?"

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ: וְלַד טְרֵיפָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִקְרַב לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יִקְרַב לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ!
human_translation: But we have heard them the opposite: the offspring of an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] Rabbi Eliezer says: may not be sacrificed upon the altar and Rabbi Yehoshua says: may be sacrificed upon the altar
llm_translation: And the opposite we heard from them: And a young animal that is a treifah, Rabbi Eliezer says: It shall not come near the altar, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: It shall come near the altar!

hebrew_text: בְּעָלְמָא סָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם — אָסוּר, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״שֵׂה כְשָׂבִים וְעִזִּים״, ״שֵׂה״ ״וְשֵׂה״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שֶׂה — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Generally, Rabbi Eliezer holds this and that cause forbidden. But is different here because if so, let the verse write: Sheep and goats [ seh kesavim ve’izzim ]. Why do I “ seh veseh Learn from it a seh in any case,
llm_translation: In the world, Rabbi Eliezer thought: this and this cause — forbidden, and the difference here, for if so it was written in the verse: "Set aside sheep and goats," "set aside" "and set aside" why do I need? Learn from it: "set aside" — from everywhere.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר לְךָ: בְּעָלְמָא זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם — מוּתָּר, וְהָכָא אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״שׁוֹר כֶּשֶׂב וָעֵז״, ״כְּשָׂבִים וְעִזִּים״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אָבִיו כֶּבֶשׂ וְאִמּוֹ כִּבְשָׂה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua, said to you: Generally, this and that cause permitted. But here if so, let the verse write: An ox, a lamb, and a goat. Why do I “ Seh kesavim veseh izzim ,” Learn from it unless its father is a male lamb and its mother is a female lamb.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to you: In general, this and that cause - permitted, and here if so to write scripture: "An ox, a sheep, and a goat," "sheep and goats" why do I need? Learn from it that it is valid until his father is a sheep and his mother is a ewe.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, ״גָּמָל״ ״גָּמָל״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים — אֶחָד גָּמָל הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַגָּמָל, וְאֶחָד גָּמָל הַנּוֹלָד מִן הַפָּרָה, וְאִם רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ דּוֹמֶה לְאִמּוֹ — מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Shimon says “Camel” “camel” two times both a camel that is born from a camel and a camel that is born from a cow And if its head and the majority of are similar to its mother, it is permitted for consumption.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: Rabbi Shimon omer, 'gamal' 'gamal' shnei pe'amim — echad gamal hanolad min hagamal, ve'echad gamal hanolad min haparah, ve'im rosho ve'rubo domeh le'immo — mutar ba'achilah." English translation: "Come and hear: Rabbi Shimon says, 'camel' 'camel' two times — one camel born from a camel, and one camel born from a cow, and if its head and majority resemble its mother — it is permitted for consumption."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, לַאֲכִילָה נָמֵי בָּעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Learn from it with regard to consumption as well Rabbi Shimon requires its head and the majority of learn from it
llm_translation: Listen to its type, for eating, yes, requires Rabbi Shimon's head and majority, listen to its type.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּמֵא וְכוּ׳. בְּעוֹ מִינַּהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מֵי רַגְלַיִם שֶׁל חֲמוֹר, מַהוּ?
human_translation: because that which emerges from the non-kosher raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: the urine of a donkey, what is
llm_translation: The one who emerges from the impure, etc. In its kind from Rav Sheshet: the water of a donkey's feet, what is it?

hebrew_text: וְתִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ דְּסוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים? דְּסוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, דְּלָא עֲכִירִי וְלָא דָּמוּ לְחָלָב, מַיָּא עוּל מַיָּא נְפוּק. כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ דַּחֲמוֹר, דַּעֲכִירִי וְדָמוּ לְחָלָב, מַאי? מִגּוּפֵיהּ קָא מִימַּצְצִי וַאֲסִירִי, אוֹ דִלְמָא מַיָּא עוּל מַיָּא נְפוּק, וְהַאי דַּעֲכִירִי — הַבְלָא דְּבִישְׂרָא הוּא?
human_translation: And raise the dilemma with regard to of horses and camels? of horses and camels they did not raise the dilemma, as is not turbid and is not similar to milk. water enters water exits When they raised the dilemma of a donkey, which is turbid and is similar to milk. What Does it get excreted from its body, and it is forbidden, or perhaps water enters water exits, and that it is turbid is the heat of the flesh?
llm_translation: And does he require horses and camels? Horses and camels he does not require for them, for they do not recognize and do not produce milk, water impure water comes out. When he requires a donkey for them, for it recognizes and produces milk, what? From its body it is sucking and forbidden, or perhaps impure water comes out, and this donkey that recognizes — is it a mere waste of flesh?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּה: שֶׁהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּמֵא — טָמֵא, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּהוֹר — טָהוֹר. ״מִטָּמֵא״ לָא קָאָמַר, אֶלָּא ״מִן
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned because that which emerges from the non-kosher is non-kosher and that which emerges from the kosher is kosher. does not state: from a non-kosher rather From
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet, you taught: that which comes out of the impure — is impure, and that which comes out of the pure — is pure. He did not say "from the impure," but rather "from."

hebrew_text: הַטָּמֵא״, וְהָנֵי נָמֵי מִינָא דְּטָמֵא הוּא.
human_translation: the non-kosher And these are also a type of non-kosher
llm_translation: "The impure one," and these are the words of the sect of the impure one.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, דְּסוּסִים וּגְמַלִּים לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, דְּלָא שָׁתוּ אִינָשֵׁי. כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ דַּחֲמוֹר, דְּשָׁתוּ אִינָשֵׁי וּמְעַלּוּ לְיַרְקוֹנָא, מַאי?
human_translation: And there are who say of horses and camels, did not raise the dilemma, because people do not drink When they raised the dilemma of a donkey, which people drink and is beneficial for jaundice. What,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, that horses and camels are not needed for them, because people did not drink. When they needed a donkey, for people drank and ascended to the vegetable garden, what is the law?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּמֵא טָמֵא, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַטָּהוֹר טָהוֹר — וְהָנֵי נָמֵי מִטָּמֵא קָאָתֵי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned That which emerges from the non-kosher is non-kosher and that which emerges from the kosher is kosher, and these also come from non-kosher.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet, you taught: One who comes out from the impure is impure, and one who comes out from the pure is pure - and these are the words of impurity.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ דְּבַשׁ דְּבוֹרִים מוּתָּר? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּכְנִיסוֹת אוֹתוֹ לְגוּפָן, וְאֵין מְמַצּוֹת אוֹתוֹ מִגּוּפָן.
human_translation: raises an objection For what say the honey of bees is permitted? because they bring into their body, but they do not excrete it from their body
llm_translation: Challenger: Why did they say that honey of bees is permitted? Because they bring it into their bodies, and do not extract it from their bodies.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמַר: דּוּבְשָׁא רַחֲמָנָא שַׁרְיֵיהּ.
human_translation: stated in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, who says honey, the Merciful One permits it
llm_translation: He who said as Rabbi Yaakov said: Dubsheh, the Merciful One will release it.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: ״אַךְ אֶת זֶה תֹּאכְלוּ מִכֹּל שֶׁרֶץ הָעוֹף״ — זֶה אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, וְאִי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל שֶׁרֶץ עוֹף טָמֵא.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Ya’akov says “Yet these may you eat of all winged creatures” you may eat these, but you may not eat a non-kosher winged creature.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yaakov says: "But these you may eat from all that swarm in the water" - this you may eat, but you may not eat any unclean swarming creature.

hebrew_text: שֶׁרֶץ עוֹף טָמֵא בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא שֶׁרֶץ עוֹף טָמֵא אִי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אַתָּה אוֹכֵל מַה שֶּׁעוֹף טָמֵא מַשְׁרִיץ, וְאֵיזֶה זֶה? זֶה דְּבַשׁ דְּבוֹרִים.
human_translation: a non-kosher winged creature is written explicitly: Rather, You may not eat a non-kosher winged creature, but you may eat that which a non-kosher winged creature discharges and what is that? That is the honey of bees.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "A creeping thing of unclean birds is written in the Torah! Rather, if you eat a creeping thing of unclean birds, but you eat what the unclean bird excretes, and what is this? This is honey of bees."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף דְּבַשׁ הַגַּזִּין וְהַצִּירְעִין? אָמַרְתָּ: לֹא. וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת דְּבוֹרִים, וּלְהוֹצִיא הַגַּזִּין וְהַצִּירְעִין? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי דְּבַשׁ דְּבוֹרִים שֶׁאֵין לוֹ שֵׁם לְוַוי, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי דְּבַשׁ הַגַּזִּין וְהַצִּירְעִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שֵׁם לְוַוי.
human_translation: might even the honey of gizzin and wasps you say no. And what did you see to include bees and to exclude gizzin and wasps I include the honey of bees, as does not have a modifier, And I exclude the honey of gizzin and wasps, which have a modifier,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible even for honey of bees and wasps? You said: No. And what did you see to include bees, and to exclude wasps and hornets? I increase honey of bees that has no specific name, and I exclude honey of wasps and hornets that have a specific name.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: דְּבַשׁ הַגַּזִּין וְהַצִּירְעִין טָהוֹר וּמוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught The honey of gizzin and wasps is not susceptible to ritual impurity and is permitted for consumption? not in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov.
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is what was taught: Honey of bees and wasps is pure and permitted for consumption? Not like Rabbi Yaakov.

hebrew_text: טָהוֹר — אַלְמָא בָּעֵי מַחְשָׁבָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: דְּבַשׁ בְּכַוַּורְתּוֹ מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּמַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: Is not susceptible ritual impurity, apparently, requires intention This is also taught honey in its hive is susceptible ritual impurity food without intent.
llm_translation: Pure - this implies it requires intent. It was taught similarly: Honey in its comb imparts ritual impurity of foodstuffs unintentionally.

hebrew_text: חָלֵי דְּיַחְמוּרְתָּא, סְבוּר רַבָּנַן לְמֵימַר: בֵּיעֵי נִינְהוּ וַאֲסִירָן. אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: זַרְעָא דְּאַיָּלָא הוּא, דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר אַיָּלְתָּא, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּרַחְמָהּ צַר לָא מִזְדַּקְקָא, וְאָזֵיל בָּתַר יַחְמוּרְתָּא וְנָתְרִי.
human_translation: chunks of fallow deer, the Sages thought to say they are egg cells, and are forbidden Rav Safra said: It is the semen of a hart, which pursues the hind, but since womb is narrow it does not mate and pursues the fallow deer and fall out
llm_translation: Illnesses of jaundice, the sages thought to say: they are due to the offspring of the female deer and are forbidden. Rav Safra said: it is the seed of the male deer, for it goes after the female deer, and because its mercy is not aroused, it goes after the jaundice and is thrown off.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עוֹר הַבָּא כְּנֶגֶד פָּנָיו שֶׁל חֲמוֹר — מוּתָּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? פִּירְשָׁא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: The skin that emerges opposite the face of a donkey permitted What is the reason? It is merely a secretion,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The skin that comes in front of the face of a donkey - permitted. What is the reason? It is simply a separation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּע לָךְ: עוֹר הַבָּא כְּנֶגֶד פָּנָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, בֵּין חַי בֵּין מֵת — טָהוֹר. מַאי לָאו בֵּין הוּא חַי וְאִמּוֹ חַיָּה, בֵּין הוּא מֵת וְאִמּוֹ מֵתָה?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to him: is taught supports your The skin that emerges opposite the face of a person, whether alive or dead, ritually pure What, is it not whether it is alive and its mother is alive whether it is dead and its mother is dead,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥisda: A Baraita that supports you was taught: The skin that comes in contact with the face of a person, whether the person is alive or dead — it is pure. What is the reason? Is it not because whether he is alive and his mother is alive, or he is dead and his mother is dead?

hebrew_text: לָא, בֵּין הוּא חַי וְאִמּוֹ מֵתָה, בֵּין הוּא מֵת וְאִמּוֹ חַיָּה. וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין הוּא חַי וְאִמּוֹ חַיָּה, בֵּין הוּא מֵת וְאִמּוֹ מֵתָה! אִי תַּנְיָא, תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: No, whether it is alive and its mother is dead whether it is dead and its mother is alive, But isn’t it taught whether it is alive and its mother is alive whether it is dead and its mother is dead, If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: Not, whether he alive and his mother dead, or he dead and his mother alive. And it was taught: whether he alive and his mother alive, or he dead and his mother dead! If it was taught, it was taught.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דָּג טָמֵא שֶׁבָּלַע דָּג טָהוֹר, מוּתָּר בַּאֲכִילָה, וְטָהוֹר שֶׁבָּלַע דָּג טָמֵא, אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ גִּידּוּלוֹ.
human_translation: a non-kosher fish that swallowed a kosher fish, consumption permitted. And a kosher that swallowed a non-kosher fish, consumption prohibited due to that is not its development.
llm_translation: It was taught: If a ritually impure fish swallowed a ritually pure fish, the impure one is permitted for consumption, while the pure one that was swallowed by an impure fish is forbidden for consumption, because it is not its natural growth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דַּחֲזֵינֵיהּ דִּבְלַע, הָא לָא חֲזֵינֵיהּ דִּבְלַע — אָמְרִי: אַשְׁרוֹצֵי אַשְׁרֵיץ.
human_translation: The reason that we saw that swallowed But we did not see it swallow we say spawned
llm_translation: The taste of the fig: we see that of the swallow, we do not see that of the swallow - they said: "The swallows of the swallows."

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: דָּג טָמֵא מַשְׁרִיץ, דָּג טָהוֹר מֵטִיל בֵּיצִים. אִי הָכִי, כִּי חָזֵינָא דִּבְלַע אָמְרִינַן: הַאי אִיעַכַּלָא, וְהַאי אַשְׁרוֹצֵי אַשְׁרֵיץ!
human_translation: From where do we As it is taught A non-kosher fish spawns a kosher fish lays eggs If so, when we saw it swallowing we say that was digested, and this spawned,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive this? For it was taught: An impure fish spawns, a pure fish lays eggs. If so, when we see it swallow, do we say: This is a glutton, and that is a spawner of spawn!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ דֶּרֶךְ הָרֶיעִי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ דֶּרֶךְ בֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ שָׁלֵם.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: where found the digestive tract, Rav Pappa says where found the passageway of the gullet. Rav Naḥman says: where found it whole
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: For example, if he found it on the path of a shepherd. Rav Papa said: For example, if he found it on the path to the cesspit. Rav Nachman said: For example, if he found it intact.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רוֹב דָּגִים בְּמִינָן מַשְׁרִיצִין, וּכְמִי שֶׁבָּלַע לְפָנֵינוּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: the majority of fish spawn of their species, and is considered as if swallowed in our presence.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Most fish of our kind are permitted, and like one who swallows before us, it is as if he has spilled blood.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דָּג טָמֵא — מַשְׁרִיץ, דָּג טָהוֹר — מֵטִיל בֵּיצִים, כָּל הַמּוֹלִיד — מֵנִיק, וְכׇל הַמֵּטִיל בֵּיצִים — מְלַקֵּט, חוּץ מֵעֲטַלֵּף שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמֵּטִיל בֵּיצִים — מֵנִיק.
human_translation: The Sages taught a non-kosher fish spawns a kosher fish lays eggs. Any that gives birth nurses and any that lays eggs gathers except for a bat [ atallef ], as although it lays eggs, it nurses
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A ritually impure fish - it breeds, a ritually pure fish - lays eggs, anyone who gives birth - nurses, and anyone who lays eggs - gathers them, except for the bat which even though it lays eggs - nurses.

hebrew_text: הַדּוֹלְפָנִין פָּרִין וְרָבִין כִּבְנֵי אָדָם. מַאי דּוֹלְפָנִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּנֵי יַמָּא.
human_translation: The dulfanin reproduce like people. What are dulfanin ? Rav Yehuda says: sons of the sea.
llm_translation: The protruding ones are like human children. What are the protruding ones? Rav Yehudah said: The sons of the sea.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁבֵּיצָיו מִבַּחוּץ — מוֹלִיד, וְכֹל שֶׁבִּפְנִים — מֵטִיל בֵּיצִים.
human_translation: any whose testicles are external, gives birth and any whose testicles are internal, lays eggs.
llm_translation: All that in its eggs from outside — gives birth, and all that inside — lays eggs.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲוָוז וַאֲוָוז בָּר כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה, וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זֶה בֵּיצָיו מִבַּחוּץ, וְזֶה בֵּיצָיו מִבִּפְנִים, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מְטִילֵי בֵּיצִים!
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Shmuel say goose and a wild goose are diverse kinds, with each other. And we discussed it: What is the reason? Abaye said: this its testicles are external, and that its testicles are internal. And both lay eggs.
llm_translation: I? But didn't Shmuel say: "A goose and a goose with two kidneys, one against the other, and we learn from it: What is the reason? Abaye said: This one's eggs from the outside, and this one's eggs from the inside, and both lay eggs!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כֹּל שֶׁזַּכְרוּתוֹ מִבַּחוּץ — מוֹלִיד, מִבִּפְנִים — מֵטִיל בֵּיצִים.
human_translation: Rather, any whose male organ external, gives birth, internal, lays eggs.
llm_translation: Rather, all that its memory is from the outside - it begets, from the inside - it lays eggs.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם — יוֹלֵד בַּיּוֹם, בַּלַּיְלָה — יוֹלֵד בַּלַּיְלָה, כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה — יוֹלֵד בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Any whose sexual intercourse during the daytime gives birth during the daytime; at night gives birth at night; any whose intercourse both during the daytime and at night gives birth both during the daytime and at night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kol she'tashmisho bayom - yoled bayom, balaylah - yoled balaylah, kol she'tashmisho bein bayom bein balaylah - yoled bein bayom bein balaylah. English translation: Anyone whose intercourse is during the day - gives birth during the day, at night - gives birth at night, anyone whose intercourse is both during the day and at night - gives birth both during the day and at night.

hebrew_text: תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם יוֹלֵד בַּיּוֹם — תַּרְנְגוֹל, בַּלַּיְלָה יוֹלֵד בַּלַּיְלָה — עֲטַלֵּף, תַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה יוֹלֵד בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה — אָדָם וְכֹל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: intercourse during the daytime gives birth during the daytime a chicken. at night gives birth at night a bat. intercourse both during the daytime and at night gives birth both during the daytime and at night a human and any that is similar to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: His use during the day, born during the day - a rooster, born at night - a bat, his use both during the day and at night, born both during the day and at night - a human and all similar to it.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְכִדְרַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: בָּדַק בְּקִינָּה שֶׁל תַּרְנְגוֹלִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְלֹא מָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצָה, וּלְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא בָהּ בֵּיצָה — מוּתֶּרֶת בַּאֲכִילָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֵימַר: לֹא בָּדַק יָפֶה.
human_translation: What difference is with regard to that which Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, As Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said: examined a chicken’s nest on a Festival eve and did not find an egg in it, and the following day, he rose early, and found an egg in it, consumption permitted on the Festival. say he did not examine carefully.
llm_translation: Regarding what does it come out? According to Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, for Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana said: If one checked a hen's nest on Erev Yom Tov and did not find an egg in it, and the next day he woke up and found an egg in it - it is permitted to eat it on Yom Tov, lest one say: He did not check properly.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא בָּדַק יָפֶה! אֵימַר: יָצְתָה רוּבָּהּ וְחָזְרָה הֲוָה, וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֵּיצָה שֶׁיָּצְתָה רוּבָּהּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְחוֹזֶרֶת — מְוֻתֶּרֶת לְאוֹכְלָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: But he did examine carefully, say was most of emerged and returned And in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: most of the egg emerged on the eve of the Festival and returned permitted to eat it on the Festival,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And did he not properly check! Say: If its majority emerged and then returned, it is as Rabbi Yochanan said, for Rabbi Yochanan said: An egg that its majority emerged on Erev Yom Tov and then returned — it is permitted to eat it on Yom Tov."

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ וְעִיבּוּרוֹ שָׁוֶה — יוֹלְדִים וּמְגַדְּלִים זֶה מִזֶּה. הַכֹּל מְשַׁמְּשִׁין פָּנִים כְּנֶגֶד עוֹרֶף, חוּץ מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁמְּשַׁמְּשִׁין פָּנִים כְּנֶגֶד פָּנִים, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: דָּג, וְאָדָם, וְנָחָשׁ.
human_translation: Any whose intercourse and gestation are identical can have offspring and raise, of each other. all engage in intercourse the face opposite the back of the neck except for three that engage in intercourse face-to-face, and they are these: Fish, and humans, and snake.
llm_translation: All whose use and waste are equal - they generate and nurture each other. All serve with their face opposite the back, except for three that serve with their face opposite the face, and these are: fish, man, and snake.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי תְּלָתָא? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: הוֹאִיל וְדִיבְּרָה עִמָּהֶם שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: And what is different these three? When Rav Dimi came they say in the West, because the Divine Presence spoke with them.
llm_translation: And what is the difference between these three? When Rav Dimi came, they said in the West: Since the Divine Presence spoke with them.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: גָּמָל — אָחוֹר כְּנֶגֶד אָחוֹר.
human_translation: taught: A camel back to back
llm_translation: Mishnah: Gamal - Achor k'neged achor.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת — לְעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם, וּכְנֶגְדָּהּ בָּאִילָן — לוּז, כֶּלֶב — לַחֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם, וּכְנֶגְדּוֹ בָּאִילָן — תְּאֵינָה, חָתוּל — לַחֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁנַיִם יוֹם, וּכְנֶגְדּוֹ בָּאִילָן — תּוּת, חֲזִיר — לְשִׁשִּׁים יוֹם, כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בָּאִילָן — תַּפּוּחַ, שׁוּעָל וְכׇל מִינֵי שְׁרָצִים — שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וּכְנֶגְדָּם בָּאִילָן — תְּבוּאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught a chicken after twenty-one days, and corresponding to it with regard to trees is the almond, A dog after fifty days, and corresponding to it with regard to trees is the fig. A cat after fifty-two days, and corresponding to it with regard to trees is the mulberry. A pig after sixty days, corresponding to it with regard to trees is the apple. A fox and all types of creeping animals six months, and corresponding to them with regard to trees, is grain.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A chicken — for twenty-one days, and corresponding to it in the tree — hazel, a dog — for fifty days, and corresponding to it in the tree — fig, a cat — for fifty-two days, and corresponding to it in the tree — mulberry, a pig — for sixty days, and corresponding to it in the tree — apple, a fox and all types of vermin — for six months, and corresponding to them in the tree — gourd.

hebrew_text: בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה טְהוֹרָה — לַחֲמִשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וּכְנֶגְדָּן בָּאִילָן — גֶּפֶן. בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה טְמֵאָה — לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, וּכְנֶגְדּוֹ בָּאִילָן — דֶּקֶל. טְהוֹרָה — לְתִשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים, וּכְנֶגְדָּהּ בָּאִילָן — זַיִת. הַזְּאֵב וְהָאֲרִי וְהַדּוֹב וְהַנָּמֵר וְהַבַּרְדְּלָס וְהַפִּיל וְהַקּוֹף וְהַקִּיפוֹף — לְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּכְנֶגְדָּן בָּאִילָן — בְּנוֹת שׁוּחַ.
human_translation: Small kosher livestock, after five months, and corresponding to them with regard to trees is the grapevine. Large non-kosher livestock, after twelve months, and corresponding to them with regard to trees is the date palm. kosher after nine months, and corresponding to them with regard to trees is the olive. The wolf, and the lion, and the bear, and the leopard, and the bardelas , and the elephant, and the monkey, and the long-tailed ape after three years, and corresponding to them with regard to trees is the white fig.
llm_translation: Livestock, small and pure — for five months, and corresponding to them in the tree — grapevine. Livestock, large and impure — for twelve months, and corresponding to it in the tree — palm tree. Pure — for nine months, and corresponding to it in the tree — olive tree. The wolf, the lion, the bear, the leopard, the hyena, the elephant, the ape, and the chameleon — for three years, and corresponding to them in the tree — sycamore.

hebrew_text: אֶפְעֶה לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, וּכְנֶגְדּוֹ בָּאִילָן — חָרוּב. חָרוּב זֶה, מִשְּׁעַת נְטִיעָתוֹ עַד שְׁעַת גְּמַר פֵּירוֹתָיו — שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, וִימֵי עִיבּוּרוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים. נָחָשׁ לְשֶׁבַע שָׁנִים, וּלְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע לֹא מָצִינוּ חָבֵר. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: מוֹכְסָסִים.
human_translation: A viper after seventy years, and corresponding to it with regard to trees is the carob. this carob, from the time of its planting until the time of the ripening of its fruit is seventy years, and the length of its gestation is three years. A snake after seven years, and for that wicked we have not found a counterpart And some say mukhsasim
llm_translation: A willow for seventy years, and opposite it a carob tree. This carob tree, from the time of its planting until the time of the completion of its fruits - seventy years, and the days of its decline are three years. A snake for seven years, and for that wicked one we did not find a companion. And some say: they are sweetened.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָרוּר אַתָּה מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״. אִם מִבְּהֵמָה נִתְקַלְּלָה, מֵחַיָּה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: From where is this matter, Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and determined it in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: that is stated “Cursed are you from among all animals, and from among all beasts of the field” If was cursed than the domesticated animals, all the more so not than the undomesticated animals?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and they came to it because of the teaching of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananya, as it is stated: "Cursed are you from all livestock and from all wild animals." If from livestock it was cursed, all the more so from wild animals?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לוֹמַר לָךְ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּתְקַלְּלָה הַבְּהֵמָה מֵחַיָּה, אֶחָד לְשִׁבְעָה, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? חֲמוֹר מֵחָתוּל, כָּךְ נִתְקַלֵּל הוּא מִבְּהֵמָה, אַחַת לְשֶׁבַע, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ שַׁב שְׁנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, to tell you: Just as the domesticated animals were cursed than the undomesticated animals by one to seven; And what is that? a donkey, to a cat, So too, was cursed than domesticated animals, one to seven, which is seven years.
llm_translation: Rather, to say to you: Just as the animal was cursed from the wild beast, one in seven, and what is it? A donkey from a catamite, so he is cursed from an animal, one in seven, for he has two reasons.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּתְקַלְּלָה חַיָּה מִבְּהֵמָה, אַחַת לְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? אֲרִי מֵחֲמוֹר, כָּךְ נִתְקַלֵּל הוּא מֵחַיָּה אַחַת לְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Say Just as the undomesticated animals were cursed than the domesticated animals one to three years; And what is that? a lion, to a donkey, So too, was cursed than the undomesticated animals, one to three years, which is nine years.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: k'shem shenitkalelah chayah mibehemah,achat leshalosh shanim, u'mai ni'hu? ari me'chamor, kach nitkalel hu me'chayah achat leshalosh shanim, dehaveh leih tesha shanim. English translation: Say: Just as a wild animal is cursed from a domestic animal, one for three years, what is it? A lion from a donkey, so he is cursed from one animal for three years, it will be nine years for him.

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב ״מִכׇּל הַחַיָּה וּמִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה״? ״מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל הַחַיָּה״ כְּתִיב! אָרוּר הוּא מִבְּהֵמָה שֶׁנִּתְקַלְּלָה מֵחַיָּה.
human_translation: Is it written: from among all beasts, and from among all animals? it is written: “From among all animals, and from among all beasts,” it is cursed from among the domesticated animals, which were cursed from among the undomesticated animals.
