llm_translation: Who is it written "from all the living creatures and from all the animals"? "From all the animals and from all the living creatures" is written! Cursed is he from an animal that is cursed from a living creature.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּתְקַלְּלָה בְּהֵמָה מֵחַיָּה אֶחָד לְשָׁלֹשׁ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? עֵז מֵחָתוּל, כָּךְ נִתְקַלֵּל הוּא מִבְּהֵמָה אֶחָד לְשָׁלֹשׁ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ חֲמֵיסַר יַרְחֵי!
human_translation: But say just as the domesticated animals were cursed than the undomesticated animals one to three; And what is that? a goat, to a cat, So too, was cursed than the domesticated animals, one to three, which is fifteen months.
llm_translation: And why? A goat with a cleft lip, so too he is cursed by one animal to three, for he will have thirteen months!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה״ כְּתִיב. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: קְלָלָה הוּא, קְלָלָה שְׁדִי עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say it is written: from among all animals,” If you wish, say it is a curse imposes upon it curse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iba'it Eima: 'mikol habeheima' ketiv. Iba'it Eima: 'k'lalah hu, k'lalah shedai ilaveih." English translation: If you wish, say: "Of all the animals" is written. If you wish, say: It is a curse, a curse of the Almighty is upon it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: נָחָשׁ לְכַמָּה מִיעַבַּר וּמוֹלֵיד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְשַׁב שְׁנֵי. וְהָא סָבֵי דְּבֵי אַתּוּנָא אַרְבְּעִינְהוּ, וְאוֹלִיד לִתְלָת! הָנְהוּ מִיעַבְּרִי הֲווֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא אַרְבַּע. וְהָא קָמְשַׁמְּשִׁי שַׁמּוֹשֵׁי! אִינְהוּ נָמֵי מְשַׁמְּשִׁי כְּאָדָם.
human_translation: the emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: a snake, after how long gestation does it give birth? said to him: After seven years. But the elders, of the school of Athens bred and they gave birth after three Those were pregnant from beforehand four But they engaged in intercourse, also engage in intercourse like people,
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: A snake, after how many times does it become pregnant and give birth? He said to him: After seven times. But the elders of the house of Atunah say forty, and it gives birth after three! Those snakes are originally forty. But they are like the servants of the servants! They too serve like humans.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חַכִּימֵי אִינְהוּ? אֲנַן חֲכִימִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ. אִי חֲכִימַתְּ, זִיל זַכִּינְהוּ וְאַיְתִינְהוּ לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כַּמָּה הָווּ? שִׁיתִּין גַּבְרֵי.
human_translation: But Aren’t they wise? We are wiser than they. If you are wiser go defeat them and bring them to me. said to him: How many are there? Sixty men.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And are they wise? We are wiser than they. If they are wise, let them go and acquire wisdom for me!" He said to him: "How many were there?" Sixty men.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲבֵיד לִי סְפִינְתָּא דְּאִית בַּהּ שִׁיתִּין בָּתֵּי, וְכֹל בֵּיתָא אִית בַּהּ שִׁיתִּין בִּיסְתַּרְקֵי. עֲבַד לֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם לְבֵי טַבָּחָא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא פָשֵׁיט חֵיוְתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רֵישָׁךְ לְזַבּוֹנֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּכַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּפַלְגָא דְּזוּזָא. יְהַב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Construct a ship that has sixty rooms for me, and each room have sixty mattresses [ bistarkei ] in it. constructed for him. When arrived there, a butcher shop found a certain man, flaying an animal. said to him: Is your head for sale? said to him: Yes said to him: For how much said to him: For half a dinar. gave him
llm_translation: He said to him: Make for me a ship that has in it sixty houses, and every house has in it sixty rooms. He made it for him. When he came there to the slaughterhouse, he found that man who was skinning a beast. He said to him: Is your head for sale? He said to him: No. He said to him: For how much? He said to him: For half a zuz. He gave it to him.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא רֵישָׁא דְּחֵיוְתָא אֲמַרִי לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בָּעֵית דְּאֶשְׁבְּקָךְ סַגִּי אַחְוִי לִי פִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי אַתּוּנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתְּפֵינָא דְּכֹל דְּמַחְוֵי קָטְלִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּרִי כְּרִיכָא דִּקְנֵיא, וְכִי מָטֵית לְהָתָם זִקְפֵהּ כְּמַאן דְּקָא מִתְּפַח.
human_translation: After he said to him: I say to you the head of the animal? said to him: If you wish for me to let you be, go show me the entrance to the school of Athens. said to him: I am afraid, as they kill anyone who shows said to him: Carry a bundle of reeds, and when you arrive there, stand it up like one who is resting,
llm_translation: At the end, he said to him: "Did I not tell you the beginning of the reed?" He said to him: "If you want me to leave you, give me the key to the house of Atuna." He said to him: "I am afraid of anyone who kills you." He said to him: "Tie a knot like a reed, and when you go there, stand it up like someone who is blowing."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכַּח דַּרְבְּנָאֵי מִגַּוַּאי וְדַרְבְּנָאֵי מִבָּרַאי, דְּאִי חָזוּ כַּרְעָא דְּעָיְילָא — קָטְלִי לְהוּ לְבָרַאי, וּדְנָפְקָא — קָטְלִי לְהוּ לְגַוַּאי.
human_translation: found guards on the inside and guards on the outside If they saw footsteps that were entering kill the outer and that were exiting kill the inner
llm_translation: I found that Rav Nachman from Gaza and Rav Nachman from Bira'ei, if they see the foot of the upper one, they kill him from the lower one, and if it is revealed, they kill him from the upper one.

hebrew_text: אַפְכֵהּ לְסַנְדָּלֵיהּ — קָטְלִי לְהוּ לְגַוָּאֵי, אַפְכֵהּ לְסַנְדָּלֵיהּ — קָטְלִי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: reversed his sandal they killed the inner reversed his sandal, killed all
llm_translation: I will strike his sandals - kill him to the bodyguards, I will strike his sandals - kill him to all of them.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכַּח יָנוֹקֵי מִלְּעֵיל, סָבֵי מִלְּתַחַת. אֲמַר: אִי יָהֵיבְנָא שְׁלָמָא לְהָנֵי, קָטְלִי לִי הָנֵי, סָבְרִי: אֲנַן עֲדִיפִינַן, דַּאֲנַן קַשִּׁינַן טְפֵי וְאִינְהוּ דַּרְדַּקֵּי.
human_translation: found the younger upper, the elder lower He said if I greet these those kill me, they maintain: We are better, because we are older and they are children.
llm_translation: I found young ones from above, elders from below. He said: If we give the offering to them, they will kill us. We think: We are preferable, for we are more severe than they are.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: שְׁלָמָא לְכוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי עֲבִידְתָּיךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא חַכִּימָא דִיהוּדָאֵי אֲנָא, בָּעֵינָא לְמִיגְמַר חֻכְמְתָא מִינַּיְיכוּ. אִי הָכִי, נִיבְעֵי לָךְ! אֲמַר לְהוּ: לְחַיֵּי, אִי זָכֵיתוּ — כֹּל דְּבָעֵיתוּ עֲבִידוּ בִּי, וְאִי זָכֵינָא בְּכוּ — אִיכְלוּ גַּבַּאי בִּסְפִינְתָּא.
human_translation: said: Greetings to you, They said to him: What are you doing said to them: I am a Sage of the Jews, I desire to learn wisdom from you. If so, we will ask you said to them: Very well. If you win, you may do to me anything you wish, and if I defeat you, eat with me on my ship.
llm_translation: He said: "Peace be upon you." They said to him: "What is your occupation?" He said to them: "I am a Judean sage, I desire to learn wisdom from you." If so, we will sell it to you! He said to them: "By my life, if you are successful - all that you need, do through me, and if I am successful - eat my bread on the ship."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאָזֵיל וּבָעֵי אִתְּתָא וְלָא יָהֲבוּ לֵיהּ, מַאי חֲזֵי לֵיהּ דְּאָזֵיל הֵיכָא דְּמִדְּלוּ מִינָּיהּ? שְׁקַל סִיכְּתָא, דָּצַהּ לְתַתַּאי — לָא עָאל, לְעִילַּאי — עָאל. אֲמַר: הַאי נָמֵי מִיתְרְמֵי בַּת מַזָּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: a certain man who goes and asks a woman and does not give to him, why would he see to go to that is greater than took a peg stuck it lower not go in. into the upper went in. He said this too, find the girl destined
llm_translation: They said to him: That man who goes and seeks a wife but they do not give him one, what does he see that he goes to a place where they despise him? He took a pouch, he looked below — it did not go up, he looked above — it went up. He said: This is like the leftovers of the daughter of his constellation.

hebrew_text: גַּבְרָא דְּאוֹזֵיף וְטָרֵיף, מַאי חֲזָא דַּהֲדַר אוֹזֵיף? אֲמַר לְהוּ: גַּבְרָא אֲזַל לְאַגְמָא, קְטַל קַמָּא טוּנָא וְלָא מָצֵי בֵּיהּ, קָטֵיל וּמַנַּח עִילָּוֵיהּ, עַד (דְּאִיתְרְמִי) [דְּמִיתְרְמֵי] אִינִישׁ מַדְלֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a man who lends and repossesses why would see to lend again? said to them: a man goes to the pond, initially cuts a bundle but cannot it, cuts and places upon until a person happens raise it
llm_translation: A man who was hunting and trapping, what does he see that he goes back to hunting? He said to them: A man went to the marsh, he killed a large fish and did not find it in it, he cut it open and found its tail, until a person came and showed it to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לַן מִילֵּי דִּבְדִיאִי! אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֲוָה הַהִוא כּוּדַנְיְתָא דִּילִידָא, וַהֲוָה תְּלֵי לֵיהּ פִּיתְקָא, וּכְתַב בֵּיהּ דְּמַסֵּיק בְּבֵי אַבָּא מְאָה אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְכוּדַנְיְתָא מִי יָלְדָה? אֲמַר לְהוּ: (הֵי נִיהוּ) [הָנֵי נִינְהוּ] מִילֵּי דִבְדִיאִי.
human_translation: said to him: Say to us a matter of nonsense. said to them: There was a certain mule that gave birth, and a note was hanging on and on it was written that it is owed 100,000 dinars by its father’s household. They said to him: But can a mule give birth? said to them: This is a matter of nonsense,
llm_translation: They said to him: "Tell us the words of the Torah!" He said to them: There was a certain Kutandita of the village, and he had a scroll hanging on his wall, and it was written in it that he would inherit a hundred thousand gold coins from the house of Abba. They said to him: And did Kutandita have a child? He said to them: Those are the words of the Torah.

hebrew_text: מִילְחָא כִּי סָרְיָא, בְּמַאי מָלְחִי לַהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּסִילְתָּא דְכוּדַנְיְתָא. וּמִי אִיכָּא סִילְתָּא לְכוּדַנְתָּא? וּמִילְחָא מִי סְרֵי?
human_translation: When salt is spoiling, with what does one salt it said to them: With the placenta of a mule. But is there a placenta of a mule? And does salt spoil?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "The salt, when it becomes spoiled, with what shall one salt it?" He said to them: "With the salt of the village of Kudna." "But is there salt of the village of Kudna?" "And is there salt when it becomes spoiled?"

hebrew_text: בְּנִי לַן בֵּיתָא בַּאֲוִירָא דְּעָלְמָא! אָמַר שֵׁם, תְּלָא בֵּין רְקִיעָא לְאַרְעָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַסִּיקוּ לִי לִיבְנֵי וְטִינָא. מְצִיעֲתֵיהּ דְּעָלְמָא הֵיכָא? זַקְפַהּ לְאֶצְבַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וּמִי יֵימַר? אַיְיתוֹ אַשְׁלֵי וּמְשַׁחוּ.
human_translation: Build us a house in the air of the world. uttered a Name hovered between the sky and the earth. He said to them: Bring up to me bricks and mortar Where is the center of the world? raised his finger said to them: Here. They said to him: And who says Bring ropes and measure.
llm_translation: Our house is in the air of the world! Shem said, "Hang a thread between the sky and the earth." He said to them: "Bring me bricks and mortar." Where in the world can it be found? He placed it on his finger, and said to them: "Here." They said to him: "Who can say? Bring a worm and smear it."

hebrew_text: אִית לַן בֵּירָא בְּדַבְרָא, עַיְילֵאּ לְמָתָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַפְשִׁילוּ לִי חַבְלֵי מִפָּארֵי וַאֲעַיְּילֵיהּ. אִית לַן רִיחְיָא דִּתְבִירָא, חַיְּיטַיהּ. אֲמַר: כְּרוּכוּ לִי מִינַּיהּ גַּרְדֵי וְאִיחַיְּיטַיהּ.
human_translation: We have a pit in the field; bring it to the city. said to them: Braid ropes of bran for me and I will bring it We have a mill that broke; sew it said Pull out threads from for me and I will sew them
llm_translation: We have a well in the field, let's go down to the town! He said to them: Bring me ropes of palm fibers and I will descend. We have a scent of spices in the oven, he smelled it. He said: Twist for me bundles of myrrh and I will smell it.

hebrew_text: מְשָׁרָא דְּסַכִּינֵי בְּמַאי קָטְלִי? בְּקַרְנָא דַּחֲמָרָא. וּמִי אִיכָּא קַרְנָא לַחֲמָרָא? וּמִי אִיכָּא מְשָׁרָא דְּסַכִּינֵי?
human_translation: With what does one harvest a field of knives? With the horn of a donkey. But is there a horn of a donkey? But is there a field of knives?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "What is the knife of the Sukkot made of? Of the horn of a ram. But is there a horn for the ram? And is there a knife for the Sukkot?"

hebrew_text: אַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ תְּרֵי בֵּיעֵי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הֵי דְּזַגְתָּא אוּכַּמְתִּי וְהֵי דְּזַגְתָּא חִיוַּורְתִּי? אַיְיתִי לְהוּ אִיהוּ תְּרֵי גְּבִינֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֵי דְּעִיזָּא אוּכַּמְתִּי וְהֵי דְּעִיזָּא חִיוַּורְתִּי?
human_translation: They brought him two eggs said to him: Which is of a black hen and which is of a white hen? brought them two cheeses, said to them: Which from the black goat and which from the white goat?
llm_translation: They brought him two cups, they said to him: "Be like the black one and be like the white one?" He brought them two cheeses, he said to them: "Be like the goat one and be like the sheep one?"

hebrew_text: וַרְצוּצָא דְּמִית, מֵהֵיכָא נָפֵיק רוּחֵיהּ? מֵהֵיכָא דְּעָל נְפַק. אַחְוִי לַן מָנָא דְּלָא שָׁוֵי חֲבִילֵיהּ! אַיְיתִי (כֹּל חַד וְחַד) בּוּדְיָא, פַּשְׁטֵיהּ. לָא הֲוָה עָיֵיל בְּתַרְעָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַיְיתוֹ מָרֵי סִיתְרוּהּ. הַיְינוּ מָנָא דְּלָא שָׁוֵי חֲבִילֵיהּ.
human_translation: And a chick that dies from where does its spirit exit? From where it enters, it departs. Show us a utensil that is not worth the damage Each one of you bring a mat spread it out. did not enter the gate said to them: Bring axes break This is a utensil that is not worth its damage.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "And the fetus that died, from where did its spirit depart? From where it came out. Let us bring a vessel that does not hold its contents! Bring (each and every) vessel, examine it. It did not go into the other. He said to them: Bring the masters of astrology. That is the vessel that does not hold its contents."

hebrew_text: אַיְתִינְהוּ כֹּל חַד וְחַד, כִּי חָזֵי שִׁיתִּין בִּיסְתַּרְקֵי, אָמַר: כּוּלְּהוּ חַבְרַאי לְהָכָא אָתוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְסָפוֹנָא: שְׁרִי סְפִינְתָּךְ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָתוּ שְׁקַל עַפְרָא מֵעַפְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: he brought them When each one saw the sixty mattresses he said All of my colleagues are coming here, said to the sailor: Release your ship, While they were coming he took dirt from the dirt of
llm_translation: They brought each and every one, for they saw six in the marketplace. He said: All my companions have come here. He said to the sailor: Untie your ship. While they were untying, he took dust from their dust.

hebrew_text: כִּי מָטֵי לְבֵי בְלִיעֵי, מְלָא כּוּזָא דְּמַיָּא מִבֵּי בְלִיעֵי. כַּד אֲתוֹ, אוֹקְמִינְהוּ קַמֵּי קֵיסָר. חֲזָנְהוּ דַּהֲווֹ מְעַנִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי לָאו נִינְהוּ. שְׁקַל מֵעַפְרַיְיהוּ וּשְׁדָא עִילָּוַיְיהוּ, אַקְשׁוֹ לְאַפֵּי מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל דְּבָעֵית עֲבֵיד בְּהוּ.
human_translation: When they reached the House of the Swallowed, filled up a small jug of water from the House of the Swallowed. When they arrived, he presented before the emperor. saw that were suffering said to These cannot be took of the dirt and threw upon them. they spoke with arrogance before the king. said to do with them whatever you wish.
llm_translation: When the stomach of the glutton is filled with water, it is like a vessel filled with water. As they came, they stood before Caesar. He saw that they were suffering, and he said to them: "These are not they." He took off their chains and lifted them up, and he kissed them on the head. He said to them: "Whatever you desire, do with them."

hebrew_text: אַיְיתִינְהוּ מַיָּא דְּאַיְיתִי מִבֵּי בְלִיעֵי, שְׁדִינְהוּ בְּתִיגְדָּא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַלְיוּהּ לְהוּ וְאֵיזִילוּ לְכוּ. מְלוֹ וּשְׁדוֹ בֵּיהּ קַמָּאֵי קַמָּאֵי, וּבְלַע לְהוּ, מְלוֹ עַד דְּשָׁמֵיט כַּתְפַּיְיהוּ, וּבְלוֹ לְהוּ וַאֲזוּל.
human_translation: brought the water that he had brought from the House of the Swallowed poured it into a utensil [ betigada ]. He said to Fill it up and go on your They filled and poured one by one, and swallowed fill until their shoulders became disjointed. were defeated.
llm_translation: Bring them water that I bring from the house of Bilie, evaluate it with a jug, he said to them: fill it for them and let them go. Fill and evaluate it in front of them, and swallow it, fill until they release their shoulders, and let them go and depart.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲמוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן טָלֶה אֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן, זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — מַפְרִישׁ טָלֶה אֶחָד לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: a female donkey that had not given birth and gave birth to two male gives one lamb to the priest a male and a female he designates one lamb for himself.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If a donkey that has not yet been redeemed gives birth to two males, one should give one lamb to the Kohen. If it gives birth to a male and a female, one should separate one lamb for itself.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי חֲמוֹרָיו שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרוּ וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵי טְלָאִים לַכֹּהֵן. זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, אוֹ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבָה — נוֹתֵן טָלֶה אֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן. שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת וְזָכָר, אוֹ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּשְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת — אֵין לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: his two donkeys had not given birth and they gave birth to two males, gives two lambs to the priest. a male and a female or two males and a female, he gives one lamb to the priest, two females and a male or two males and two females, the priest receives nothing,
llm_translation: Two of his donkeys that have not been recognized and they give birth to two males - he gives two lambs to the priest. Male and female, or two males and a female - he gives one lamb to the priest. Two females and a male, or two males and two females - the priest receives nothing.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בִּיכְּרָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה, וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן טָלֶה אֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן; זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — מַפְרִישׁ טָלֶה אֶחָד לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: one had given birth and one had not given birth and gave birth to two males, gives one lamb to the priest a male and a female he designates one lamb for himself,
llm_translation: One in the flock, and one not in the flock, and she gave birth to two males - he gives one lamb to the priest; male and female - he separates one lamb for himself.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר תִּפְדֶּה בְשֶׂה״, מִן הַכְּבָשִׂים וּמִן הָעִזִּים, זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, גָּדוֹל וְקָטָן, תָּמִים וּבַעַל מוּם, פּוֹדֶה בּוֹ פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה, נִכְנָס לְדִיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, וְאִם מֵת — נֶהֱנִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: as it is stated: “And you shall redeem the firstborn of a donkey with a lamb [ seh ]” from sheep or from goats; males or females, older or younger unblemished or blemished may redeem with it many times. it enters the pen in order to be tithed and if it dies, one may derive benefit from its
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "But the firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb" (Exodus 13:13), from sheep and from goats, male and female, large and small, unblemished and blemished, one redeems it many times, it enters the pen to become wealthy, and if it dies — one benefits from it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי — הָאָמַר אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם!
human_translation: Who taught Rabbi Yirmeya says: not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. As if Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, doesn’t he say it is possible that coincided precisely,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Maan tana? Amar Rabbi Yirmeya: D'lo k'Rabbi Yosei hagalili, d'ei Rabbi Yosei hagalili - ha'amar efshar l'tzamtzem! English translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Yirmeya said: Not like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, for if it were Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, he would say it is possible to restrict!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דִּכְתִיב ״הַזְּכָרִים לַה׳״.
human_translation: Abaye says: You even say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, is different there as it is written: the males shall be the Lord’s”
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it was Rabbi Yosei Hagalili, it is different there because it is written, "those who fear the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ! הָא מַיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״הַזְּכָרִים״.
human_translation: But let him derive from The Merciful One restricted “The males
llm_translation: And to finish from it! This is a limitation of the Merciful One, "the males."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי — הָאָמַר אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דִּכְתִיב ״הַזְּכָרִים לַה׳״.
human_translation: Some say Let us say that not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as if Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, doesn’t he say it is possible that coincide precisely, Abaye says: You even say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, is different there, as it is written: “The males shall be the Lord’s.”
llm_translation: There are those who say: Let us say that it is not like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, for if it were Rabbi Yosei the Galilean — who said it is possible to restrict! Abaye said: Even if you were to say it is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, it is different there, as it is written, "those who remember the Lord."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, דְּלָא מוֹקֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי — הַיְינוּ דְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״וְיָצְאוּ שְׁנֵי רָאשֵׁיהֶן כְּאֶחָד״, אֶלָּא לְאַבָּיֵי — לִיתְנֵי ״וְיָצְאוּ שְׁנֵי רָאשֵׁיהֶן כְּאֶחָד״!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yirmeya, who does not interpret in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, that is that it does not teach: And both of their heads emerged as one, But according to Abaye, let teach: And both of their heads emerged as one,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yirmiyah, who does not hold like Rabbi Yosei HaGalili — that is, who does not hold that "and their two heads shall go out as one," but according to Abbaye — it should be taught that "and their two heads shall go out as one!"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: חֲמוֹרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים, וְיָצְאוּ שְׁנֵי רָאשֵׁיהֶן כְּאֶחָד, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן לַכֹּהֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הַזְּכָרִים לַה׳״.
human_translation: Furthermore, it is taught donkey had not given birth and gave birth to two males, and both of their heads emerged as one, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: Both of them to the priest, as it is stated: “The males shall be the Lord’s.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And furthermore, it was taught: If one's donkey gave birth not in its usual manner and it gave birth to two males, and both their heads emerged together, Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: Both of them belong to the Kohen, as it is stated, "The males belong to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב הַאי, בִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף הוּא דִּכְתִיב! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הַזְּכָרִים לַה׳״, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But when this is written, isn’t it written with regard to inherent sanctity, Rather, because it is stated “The males shall be the Lord’s,” the refutation of Abaye a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: And this, for it is written this, in the holiness of the body it is written! Rather, because it is stated "the males to the Lord," the inference of Abbaye, the inference.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, לֵימָא קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן מִקְצָת רֶחֶם מַקְדֵּישׁ? דְּאִי כּוּלֵּיהּ רֶחֶם מַקְדֵּישׁ — נְהִי דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, חֲצִיצָה מִיהָא אִיכָּא!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, let us say the Rabbis hold a portion of the womb sanctifies As, if the entire womb sanctifies granted it is impossible to coincide precisely in any event there is an interposition,
llm_translation: The Sages, let us say, do the Sages hold that one can sanctify a partial womb? For if one were to sanctify the entire womb, it would be possible to retract, but if only a part is sanctified, is there anything left to retract from it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מִין בְּמִינוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ.
human_translation: Rav says: a substance with same substance does not interpose.
llm_translation: Rav said: A species within its own species does not create a separation.

hebrew_text: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — מַפְרִישׁ טָלֶה כּוּ׳. וְכֵיוָן דִּלְעַצְמוֹ הוּא, לְמָה לִי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי? לְאַפְקוֹעֵי לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a male and a female, designates a lamb But since it for himself, why do I to designate in order to abrogate its forbidden status.
llm_translation: Male and female - separates the young lamb. And since it is by itself, why do I need to separate it? To prevent it from mating with its own species.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מַפְקַע לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ, אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: Apparently, since is not abrogated, it is prohibited to benefit whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught is prohibited to benefit a firstborn donkey, and Rabbi Shimon deems permitted.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it not so that since he does not remove his prohibition, it is forbidden to derive benefit from it? The Mishnah teaches this, as Rabbi Yehuda taught: The firstborn of a donkey is forbidden to derive benefit from, and Rabbi Shimon permits it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר עוּלָּא: יֵשׁ לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ פְּדִיָּיה וּמוּתָּר? וְלָא?! וַהֲרֵי בְּכוֹר אָדָם שֶׁצָּרִיךְ פְּדִיָּיה וּמוּתָּר! אֶלָּא, יֵשׁ לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁהִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה בְּשֶׂה וּמוּתָּר?
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? Ulla says: Do you have an item that requires redemption and permitted And no But doesn’t firstborn son require redemption and permitted Rather, Do you have an item about which the Torah was particular with a lamb, and permitted
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? Ula said: Do you have a matter that requires redemption and is permitted? No! But behold, the firstborn of a person requires redemption and is permitted! Rather, you have a matter that the Torah was particular about it being permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי הִקְפִּידָה?! וְהָא רַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף פָּרֵיק לֵיהּ בְּשִׁילְקֵי בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ! בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ לָא קָאָמְרִינַן, כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן שֶׁלֹּא בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁהִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה לְאַפְקוֹעֵי לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ בְּשֶׂה?
human_translation: And is particular But didn’t Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, redeem with boiled vegetables its value? is not saying, at its value. when we say not at its value, and this is saying: Do you have an item about which the Torah was particular to abrogating its forbidden status with a lamb,
llm_translation: "And who was meticulous?! But Rav Nechemyah, son of Rav Yosef, answered him with a question: 'With a shilkei beshavvyo!' We do not say 'with beshavvyo,' for we say 'not with beshavvyo,' and thus he said: Do you have something that the Torah was meticulous about to forbid with a sheep?"

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁהִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה בְּכֶסֶף צוֹרִי, וּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּמֵזִיד — קִידֵּשׁ!
human_translation: But tithe which the Torah was particular about its with a minted coin, and we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: intentionally, he has betrothed
llm_translation: And behold, regarding tithe, that the Torah was stringent upon it with Tyrian silver, and we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: intentionally - sanctified!

hebrew_text: בְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר נָמֵי מִיקַּדְּשָׁא, כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִשָּׁה יוֹדַעַת שֶׁאֵין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מִתְחַלֵּל עַל יָדָהּ, וְעוֹלָה וְאוֹכַלְתּוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: with a firstborn donkey, she is also betrothed. This applies in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar. As Rabbi Elazar says: a woman knows that second-tithe is not desacralized by her and she ascend and consume it in Jerusalem,
llm_translation: In the redemption of a donkey is a statement from Mikadesh, as Rabbi Elazar said: A woman knows that the second tithe is not being desecrated by her, and she goes up and eats it in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, אִשָּׁה יוֹדַעַת דְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר אִיסּוּרָא אִית בֵּיהּ, וּפָרְקָא לֵיהּ בְּשֶׂה, וּמַקְדְּשָׁא בְּהָךְ דְּבֵינֵי וּבֵינֵי.
human_translation: Here too, a woman knows that a firstborn donkey has a forbidden status and she redeem it with a lamb. And she is betrothed with that of between and
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Here it is taught, a woman who knows that a donkey has a forbidden mixture in it, and she redeems it with a sheep, and sanctifies it with that which is between them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַאי טַעְמֵאּ? אָמַר עוּלָּא: יֵשׁ לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁפִּדְיוֹנוֹ מוּתָּר וְהוּא אָסוּר?
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason Ulla says: Do you have an item whereby its redemption, is permitted, but is forbidden?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason? Ula said: Do you have a thing that its redemption is permitted and it is forbidden?

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית, דְּפִדְיוֹנָהּ מוּתָּר, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה!
human_translation: And not But isn’t Sabbatical As its redemption, is permitted. But is prohibited
llm_translation: And no? But behold the seventh year, its redemption is permitted, yet it is prohibited!

hebrew_text: שְׁבִיעִית נָמֵי פִּדְיוֹנָהּ אָסוּר, דְּאָמַר מָר: הָאַחֲרוֹן אַחֲרוֹן אָסוּר.
human_translation: the Sabbatical as well, its redemption is forbidden, as the Master says: the very last forbidden
llm_translation: Seventh year, the produce of its redemption is forbidden, as the Master said: "The last, the last is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תַעֲבֹד בִּבְכוֹר שׁוֹרֶךָ״ — אֲבָל אַתָּה עוֹבֵד בְּשֶׁלְּךָ וּבְשֶׁל אֲחֵרִים, ״וְלֹא תָגֹז בְּכוֹר צֹאנֶךָ״ — אֲבָל אַתָּה גּוֹזֵז שֶׁלְּךָ וְשֶׁל אֲחֵרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon disagree with regard to verse, as it is taught “You shall do no work with the firstborn of your ox” but you may perform labor with your own and that of others, “Nor shear the firstborn of your flock,” but you may shear yours and that of others. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon disagree in this verse, as it was taught: "You shall not work with your firstborn ox" - but you may work with your own and with others', "and you shall not shear your firstborn sheep" - but you may shear your own and others', the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא תַעֲבֹד בִּבְכוֹר שׁוֹרֶךָ״ — אֲבָל אַתָּה עוֹבֵד בִּבְכוֹר אָדָם, ״לֹא תָגֹז בְּכוֹר צֹאנֶךָ״ — אֲבָל אַתָּה גּוֹזֵז בְּכוֹר חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says “You shall do no work with the firstborn of your ox,” but you may do work with firstborn son, “Nor shear the firstborn of your flock,” but you may shear a firstborn donkey,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "You shall not work with the firstborn of your ox" - but you may work with the firstborn of a person. "You shall not shear the firstborn of your flock" - but you may shear the firstborn of a donkey.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמַעוֹטֵי שֶׁלְּךָ וְשֶׁל אֲחֵרִים לְמָה לִי? וְתוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, בְּכוֹר אָדָם נָמֵי נֵימָא דַּאֲסִיר!
human_translation: Granted, according to of Rabbi Shimon, that is that two verses, are written, But according to Rabbi Yehuda, why do I two verses to exclude yours and that of others, And furthermore, according to Rabbi Yehuda, shall we say firstborn son also be forbidden,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Shimon, that is what is written, "two verses." Rather, according to Rabbi Yehuda, "two verses" to exclude yours and others. Why do I need them? And go according to Rabbi Yehuda, the firstborn of a person is like a firstborn animal that is prohibited!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״שׁוֹרֶךָ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי בְּכוֹר אָדָם הוּא דַּאֲתָא, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּ״צֹאנֶךָ״. דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: שׁוּתָּפוּת גּוֹי חַיֶּיבֶת בִּבְכוֹרָה, וְכִי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמִישְׁרֵי בְּגִזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: Rather, everyone “your ox” comes to exclude firstborn son, When they disagree, with regard to “your flock.” As Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he says partnership a gentile is obligated in a firstborn, and the verse was necessary to permit shearing and labor.
llm_translation: Rather, the entire world, "your ox," comes to exclude the firstborn of a person, as it is stated, for they differ regarding "your flocks." For Rabbi Yehuda comes with his reasoning, as he said: A partnership of a non-Jew is obligated in the firstborn, and is it necessary to have a verse for the straightforward in shearing and labor.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: שׁוּתָּפוּת גּוֹי פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וּלְעִנְיַן גִּזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds partnership a gentile exempt from a firstborn, and with regard to shearing and labor, no verse was necessary. the verse was necessary to a firstborn donkey
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: Partnership of a non-Jew is exempt from the firstborn, and regarding shearing and labor, a verse is not necessary, for a verse is necessary to exempt a donkey.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״צֹאנֶךָ״ וְ״שׁוֹרֶךָ״, אַטּוּ ״צֹאנֶךָ״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, ״שׁוֹרֶךָ״ וְ״צֹאנֶךָ״ לְמָה לִי? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, this is that “your flock” is written, And “your ox,” because of “your flock,” But according to Rabbi Shimon, Why do I “your ox” and “your flock”? difficult.
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yehuda, that is as it is written "your flock" and "your herd," they come to "your flock." Rather, to Rabbi Shimon, "your herd" and "your flock," why do I need? A difficulty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה, שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabba says: And Rabbi Shimon concedes that following breaking neck it is forbidden
llm_translation: Rabba said: And Rabbi Shimon agrees with regard to after the offering, that it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? גָּמַר ״עֲרִיפָה״ ״עֲרִיפָה״ מֵעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה.
human_translation: What is the reason He derives between “Breaking the neck,” “Breaking the neck,” the heifer whose neck is broken
llm_translation: What is the reason? He concluded "Arifah," "Arifah" from the calf that is to be decapitated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ דְּתַנְיָא: הָעׇרְלָה וְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, וְשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, וְצִיפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע, וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, וּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב — כּוּלָּן מִטַּמְּאִין טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say As it is taught The fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ], and diverse kinds in a vineyard, and an ox that stoned and a heifer whose neck broken and the birds a leper and a firstborn donkey and meat with milk, are all susceptible to the ritual impurity of food,
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say it to him that it teaches: the foreskin, and mixtures of the vineyard, and the ox that is stoned, and the heifer whose neck is broken, and the birds of the leper, and the firstborn of a donkey, and meat cooked in milk - all of them render ritual impurity of foods.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן אֵין מִטַּמְּאִין טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין, הוֹאִיל וְהָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: All of them are not susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, And Rabbi Shimon concedes with regard to meat with milk that it is susceptible to the impurity of food, since had a period of susceptibility
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: All of them do not become impure with the impurity of food, and Rabbi Shimon admits regarding meat cooked with milk that it imparts impurity of food, since it was in a state of permissibility.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּכְתִיב: ״מִכׇּל הָאֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל״, אוֹכֶל שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַאֲכִילוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים — קָרוּי אוֹכֶל, שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַאֲכִילוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים — אֵינוֹ קָרוּי אוֹכֶל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon as it is written: “All food therein that may be eaten [ ha’okhel asher ye’akhel ], food that you are able to feed to others, is called food that you are not able to feed to others is not called food.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? As it is written: "Of all food which may be eaten," food that you can feed to others is called food, but food that you cannot feed to others is not called food.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב מַאי אִירְיָא דְּהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר? תִּיפּוֹק לִי דְּאוֹכֶל שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַאֲכִילוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים הוּא!
human_translation: If so, why, specifically meat in milk because it had a period of susceptibility Derive that it is food that you can feed to others,
llm_translation: If so, meat in milk, what is the status of its kashrut? Bring me proof that one who eats, you can feed to others!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם קָדוֹשׁ אַתָּה לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַנְשֵׁי קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיוּן לִי״, מָה לְהַלָּן אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה, אַף כָּאן אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה!
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: meat in milk, eating is forbidden and benefit as it is stated: “For you are a holy people to the Lord your God; you shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk” And elsewhere states: “And you shall be holy men to Me; therefore you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by animals in the field” Just as there, eating is forbidden but benefit so too here, eating is forbidden but benefit
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Meat cooked in milk is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit, as it is stated: "For you are a holy people to the Lord your God," and elsewhere it says: "And you shall be men of holiness to Me." Just as there it is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit, so too here it is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא — דְּאוֹכֶל שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַאֲכִילוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים הוּא, וְעוֹד — לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי הֲרֵי הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר.
human_translation: states one and another. One because is food that you can feed to others. And another even for him, it had a time fit
llm_translation: One and furthermore he said: One - that if you can feed him, he is for others, and furthermore - according to his opinion, he also had a time of fitness.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא דִּלְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה שָׁרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לִיתְנֵי: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר וּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב שֶׁמִּטַּמְּאִין טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין!
human_translation: And if it is so, that after breaking the neck Rabbi Shimon deems it permitted let teach: And Rabbi Shimon concedes with regard to a firstborn donkey and meat in milk, that they are susceptible to the impurity of food.
llm_translation: "And if it is stated that after the throwing of the blood it is permissible, Rabbi Shimon permits, let it be taught: 'And Rabbi Shimon concedes in the case of the exemption of a donkey and meat cooked in milk that they do not impart ritual impurity to food!'"

hebrew_text: אִי דְּחַשֵּׁיב עֲלֵיהּ — הָכִי נָמֵי; הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּלָא חַשֵּׁיב עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: If where intended it, so too Here we are dealing with where he did not intend it
llm_translation: If he thought about it - so it is; here, with what are we dealing? - that he did not think about it.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי מְטַמְּאִי רַבָּנַן? אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הוֹאִיל וְאִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ.
human_translation: But what is the reason the Rabbis deem susceptible to impurity The Sages said before Rav Sheshet: because the prohibition intent it
llm_translation: The reason why do the Rabbis render it impure? The Rabbis said before Rav Sheshet: Since its prohibition is stringent.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן מִי אָמַר הוֹאִיל וְאִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ? וְהָא תְּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר דְּבָרִים אָמְרוּ בְּנִבְלַת עוֹף טָהוֹר, וְזוֹ אַחַת מֵהֶן — צְרִיכָה מַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֶכְשֵׁר.
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, did say since its prohibition its intent? But didn’t we learn stated thirteen matters concerning the unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird, and this is one of them: It requires intent but it does not require rendered
llm_translation: The Sages: Who said that its prohibition is its examination? But didn't we learn: Thirteen matters were stated regarding the carcass of a kosher bird, and one of them - it requires intent, and it does not require examination.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ, לְמָה לִּי מַחְשָׁבָה? הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: And if Its prohibition its intent, why do I intent whose is this? It is Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: And if his prohibition is his intent, why do I need his thought? Is it a count? It is Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִבְלַת בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וְנִבְלַת עוֹף טָהוֹר וְהַחֵלֶב בַּכְּפָרִים — צְרִיכִים מַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵינָם צְרִיכִים הֶכְשֵׁר. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ, לְמָה לִּי מַחְשָׁבָה? הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: Come hear A carcass of a non-kosher animal, in any location; or an unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird or the fat in the villages, require intent but they do not require rendered And if you say its prohibition its intent, why do I intent? whose is this? It is Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The carcass of an unclean animal is impure in every place, and the carcass of a pure bird and the fat in the intestines - require intent, and do not require proper preparation. And if you say its prohibition is due to its fermentation, why do I need intent? It is a kind of min? It is Rabbi Shimon's opinion.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִבְלַת בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, וְנִבְלַת עוֹף הַטָּהוֹר וְהַחֵלֶב בַּשְּׁוָוקִים — אֵינָן צְרִיכִין מַחְשָׁבָה וְלֹא הֶכְשֵׁר. הָא טְמֵאָה בָּעֲיָא מַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: Come hear An unslaughtered carcass of a kosher animal in any location, or the unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird or the fat in the marketplaces, do not require intent nor rendered but a non-kosher requires intent.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The carcass of a kosher animal is impure in every place, and the carcass of a kosher bird and the fat in the markets - they do not require intent and not ritual fitness. If it is impure, it requires intent.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא — הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָוֵי, רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף הַגָּמָל וְהָאַרְנֶבֶת וְהַשָּׁפָן וְהַחֲזִיר אֵינָן צְרִיכִין לֹא מַחְשָׁבָה וְלֹא הֶכְשֵׁר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן סִימָנֵי טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: And if you would say: whose is this, it is Rabbi Shimon; since the latter clause is Rabbi Shimon the former clause, is not Rabbi Shimon. As the latter clause teaches: Rabbi Shimon says even the camel, and the hare, and the rock badger, and the pig do not require intent or rendered And Rabbi Shimon said: What reason? that they have characteristics of kosher
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you will say: This is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon — this is from the latter part, Rabbi Shimon is, the beginning is not Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught in the latter part: Rabbi Shimon says: Even the camel, the hare, the hyrax, and the pig do not require either calculation or inspection. And Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Because they have signs of purity.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא אָמְרִינַן אִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ, וְאִי דְּעַרְפֵיהּ מִיעְרָף — הָכִי נָמֵי,
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: Everyone, we do not say its prohibition its intent. And if broke its neck, so too,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Concerning all the world, we do not say his prohibition is his concern, and if his prohibition is removed, so too his concern is removed.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ לְהִתְלַמֵּד בּוֹ, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּנִימוֹס וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Here, we are dealing with where he slaughtered to teach himself And with regard to the dispute between Nimos and Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if one slaughtered it to learn from it, and in the dispute between Nimos and Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: סָח לִי נִימוֹס, אָחִיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הַגַּרְסִי, שֶׁהַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הָעוֹרֵב לְהִתְלַמֵּד בּוֹ — דָּמוֹ מַכְשִׁיר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: דַּם שְׁחִיטָה לְעוֹלָם מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Nimos, the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua HaGarsi, related to me that one who slaughters a crow to teach himself its blood renders Rabbi Eliezer says: blood slaughter always renders
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: "If a Nimos was slaughtered, the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua the Garsi, who slaughters a raven in order to study it - its blood is valid." Rabbi Eliezer says: "The blood of slaughter always validates."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אֶלָּא לָאו אִיסּוּרוֹ חִישּׁוּבוֹ אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Isn’t this Rabbi Eliezer the first tanna , Rather, isn’t between them its prohibition its intent
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, that is the first Tanna! Rather, it is not his prohibition, but his rebuke that is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: דָּמוֹ מַכְשִׁיר לְעָלְמָא, אֲבָל לְגוּפֵיהּ בָּעֵי מַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: the first tanna holds its blood renders in general but to itself intent required,
llm_translation: The first Tanna holds: that its blood renders it fit for the world, but for itself, it requires intent.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר: דַּם שְׁחִיטָה לְעוֹלָם מַכְשִׁיר, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְגוּפֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵי מַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer comes to say the blood of slaughter always renders and even with regard to itself, intent not required,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer came to say: The blood of slaughter always validates, and even for itself does not require intent.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם — דְּשָׁאנֵי עוֹרֵב, הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ סִימָנֵי טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: From where Perhaps the reason of Rabbi Eliezer there that a crow is different, since it has indicators of a kosher
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps the reason of Rabbi Eliezer there - because it differs, a raven, since it has signs of purity.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּסִימָנֵי טׇהֳרָה מִילְּתָא הִיא? דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ דְּהַהִיא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ סִימָנֵי טׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: And from where do we that indicators of a kosher are matter As teaches with regard to Rabbi Shimon says: What is the reason because they have indicators of kosher
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that signs of purity are a matter? For it was taught regarding that leaf, Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Because it contains signs of purity.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי מִשּׁוּם סִימָנֵי טׇהֳרָה, מַאי אִירְיָא לְהִתְלַמֵּד? אֲפִילּוּ לְהִתְעַסֵּק נָמֵי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם נִימוֹס.
human_translation: And if you would say if because of kosher indicators, why specifically to teach oneself Even acted unawares, yes, this is indeed so and because of Nimos,
llm_translation: And if you will say: If it is for the sake of signs of purity, what is the relevance to study? Even to engage in idle talk! Not so, but for the sake of pleasantness.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לֹא רָצָה לִפְדּוֹתוֹ — עוֹרְפוֹ בְּקוֹפִיץ מֵאֲחוֹרָיו וְקוֹבְרוֹ, וְאָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר!
human_translation: raises an objection to does not want to redeem he breaks neck from behind with a cleaver and buries and it is prohibited to benefit the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Shimon deems permitted
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If he does not want to redeem it - he breaks its neck with a hatchet from behind and buries it, and it is forbidden to derive benefit from it, the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon permits!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: וּמֵחַיִּים אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: Say And while alive prohibited to benefit And Rabbi Shimon deems permitted.
llm_translation: Concerning what? And from living, prohibited in benefit, and Rabbi Shimon permits.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא מֵחַיִּים הָוֵי, רֵישָׁא לָאו מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: But from that the latter clause is while alive the first clause, not while alive.
llm_translation: "And this is from the latter part, it is considered from the living; the beginning part is not from the living."

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לֹא יְמִיתֶנּוּ, לֹא בְּקָנֶה וְלֹא בְּמַגָּל וְלֹא בְּקַרְדּוֹם וְלֹא בִּמְגֵירָה, וְלֹא יַכְנִיסֶנּוּ לַחֶדֶר וְיִנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת לְפָנָיו בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיָּמוּת, וְאָסוּר בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר!
human_translation: As the latter clause teaches: One may not kill with a reed, nor with a sickle, nor with an ax, nor with a saw; nor may one put it in a room and close the door so that it will die And shearing or labor is prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Shimon deems permitted
llm_translation: The text teaches in its conclusion: one may not kill him, neither with a lance, nor with a sword, nor with a dagger, nor with a stone, and one may not bring him into a room and lock the door before him so that he will die. And it is forbidden to shear him or perform labor, the words of Rabbi Yehuda, but Rabbi Shimon permits it!

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא מֵחַיִּים, רֵישָׁא — בַּהֲנָאַת דָּמָיו, סֵיפָא — בַּהֲנָאַת גּוּפוֹ.
human_translation: The first clause and the latter clause alive, the first clause to benefit its value the latter clause to benefit itself
llm_translation: The beginning and the end are from the living, the beginning - in benefit of his money, the end - in benefit of his body.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא הֲנָאַת דָּמָיו — בְּהָהוּא קָא שָׁרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אֲבָל בַּהֲנָאַת גּוּפוֹ אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְאִי תְּנָא בַּהֲנָאַת גּוּפוֹ — בְּהָהִיא קָאָסַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֲבָל בַּהֲנָאַת דָּמָיו אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary as had taught benefit its value in that Rabbi Shimon deems permitted; but in benefit itself, say concedes to Rabbi Yehuda And had taught benefit itself in that Rabbi Yehuda deems forbidden; but in benefit its value, say concedes to Rabbi Shimon. necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, if one taught regarding the benefit of his blood - in that case Rabbi Shimon permits it, but regarding the benefit of his body, why not concede to Rabbi Yehuda. And if one taught regarding the benefit of his body - in that case Rabbi Yehuda prohibits it, but regarding the benefit of his blood, why not concede to Rabbi Shimon. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר.
human_translation: And similarly, Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: Rabbi Shimon concedes that after breaking neck it is prohibited
llm_translation: And so said Rav Nachman said Rabbah bar Avuh: Rabbi Shimon concedes to after the back of the neck that it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וַעֲרַפְתּוֹ״, נֶאֱמַר כָּאן עֲרִיפָה, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן עֲרִיפָה, מָה לְהַלָּן אָסוּר — אַף כָּאן אָסוּר.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say it? As it is taught then you shall break its neck” breaking the neck is stated here, and breaking the neck is stated there Just as there, prohibited so too here, it is prohibited
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to her? As it was taught: "And you shall burn it," it is stated here as burning, and it is stated there as burning, just as there it is prohibited — so too here it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — מֵחַיִּים מֵיסָר אָסַר! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא?
human_translation: Who is If we say Rabbi Yehuda, prohibited while alive. Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Who is the author of this teaching? Perhaps it is Rabbi Yehuda - from the living, he prohibited! Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: סָפְרָא חַבְרָיךְ תַּרְגּוּמַהּ: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: עֲרִיפָה בִּמְקוֹם פְּדִיָּיה עוֹמֶדֶת, מָה פְּדִיָּיה מַתֶּרֶת — אַף עֲרִיפָה מַתֶּרֶת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to Safra, your colleague, interpreted it Actually, Rabbi Yehuda and it was necessary enter your mind to say breaking the neck stands in place of redeeming just as redemption permits so too, breaking the neck permits teaches us
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sheshet: "Sapra, your colleague, translate it: Always Rabbi Yehuda, and it is necessary, since your mind has changed, I say: A widow standing in the place of redemption, just as redemption permits - so too a widow permits, this is what we have heard."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? מִדְּתָנֵי לֵוִי: הוּא הִפְסִיד מָמוֹנוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן, לְפִיכָךְ יוּפְסַד מָמוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say from that which Levi teaches He, caused a loss of the money of a priest Therefore, his money shall be lost.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to her? As Levi taught: He caused a loss to the money of the Kohen, therefore his money shall be lost.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הָא מַיפְסַד וְקָאֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא?
human_translation: Whose If we say Rabbi Yehuda, is already lost, Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If you say it is Rabbi Yehudah - but he is refuted and stands! Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, and if you wish, say Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Rabbi Yehuda, and if you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אַפְּסֵידָא דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yehuda, the loss of between and
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Rabbi Yehuda, the boundary between the two.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לִפְחַת מִיתָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Shimon, a depreciation death
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon, to avoid death.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֲמַר: עֲדַיִין הִיא מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish similarly says Rabbi Shimon concedes that after breaking of neck is prohibited, But Rabbi Yoḥanan, and some say Rabbi Elazar, says: is still dispute,
llm_translation: And so said Reish Lakish: Rabbi Shimon agrees to after the reaping that it is forbidden, and Rabbi Yochanan, and if you will say Rabbi Elazar said: it is still a dispute.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אַהָא: ״הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: There are those who teach that which Rav Naḥman with regard to this, one who betroths with a firstborn donkey, is not betrothed, Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: after breaking of the neck, and all agree,
llm_translation: There is one who teaches about Rav Nachman, thus: "One who sanctifies with the firstborn of a donkey does not sanctify it." Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Shimon? Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: after it has been castrated, and this is the view of all.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הָא מַנִּי? לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — תִּיקְדַּשׁ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ, אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — תִּיקְדַּשׁ בְּהָךְ דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי!
human_translation: There are who say whose is this? neither Rabbi Yehuda nor Rabbi Shimon. If Rabbi Shimon, should be betrothed with the entire If Rabbi Yehuda, she should be betrothed with that difference and
llm_translation: There are those who say: Is this a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon? If it is Rabbi Shimon - it should be sanctified in its entirety, if it is Rabbi Yehuda - it should be sanctified in this matter between them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה אֶלָּא שֶׁקֶל, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — תִּפְדֶּה מִיָּד, תִּפְדֶּה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין פְּדִיָּיה פְּחוּתָה מִשֶּׁקֶל.
human_translation: Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: Actually, Rabbi Yehuda, and where is worth only a shekel, And holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda as it is taught “You shall redeem,” you shall redeem immediately, you shall redeem any amount. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: There is no redemption less than a shekel.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: Always follow the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah, and for example, even if it is only a shekel, and he holds like Rabbi Yosei bar Yehudah. As it was taught: "You shall redeem" "You shall redeem" - you shall redeem immediately, you shall redeem anything. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehudah says: Redemption is valid even for less than a shekel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — תִּפְדֶּה מִיָּד, תִּפְדֶּה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: The Master said “You shall redeem,” you shall redeem immediately, you shall redeem any amount. obvious?
llm_translation: Master said: "Tifdeh, tifdeh" - redeem immediately, redeem anything. It is obvious!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ לִבְכוֹר אָדָם, מָה בְּכוֹר אָדָם אַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ, הַאי נָמֵי אַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say since is juxtaposed with firstborn son just as firstborn son after thirty and five this too after thirty and five
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has raised: Since the firstborn of a man is significant, what is the status of a firstborn after thirty-five years, is it also significant after thirty-five years.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — מִיָּד, ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — כׇּל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: teaches us: “You shall redeem,” immediately you shall redeem any amount.
llm_translation: We have heard: "Tifdeh" - immediately, "Tifdeh" - anything that is.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין פְּדִיָּיה פְּחוּתָה מִשֶּׁקֶל. מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי מַקֵּישׁ לִבְכוֹר אָדָם — חָמֵשׁ לִיבְעֵי, וְאִי לָא מַקֵּישׁ — שֶׁקֶל מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: There is no redemption less than a shekel. Whichever you If compares to firstborn son, he should require five and if does not compare from where a shekel
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A redemption is not less than a shekel. From where do you know this? If one compares it to the redemption of a firstborn son - five shekels are required. And if one does not compare it - what is the value of a shekel to him?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לָא מַקֵּישׁ, אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְכׇל עֶרְכְּךָ יִהְיֶה בְּשֶׁקֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, כׇּל עֲרָכִין שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲרִיךְ לֹא יְהוּ פְּחוּתִין מִשֶּׁקֶל.
human_translation: Actually, does not compare Rava says: The verse states “And all your valuations shall be with the shekel of the Sanctuary” all valuations that you assess should not be less than a shekel.
llm_translation: Always not juxtapose, said Rava: Scripture says, "And all your valuations shall be in the holy shekel," all valuations that you evaluate shall not be less than a shekel.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הַהוּא
human_translation: And the Rabbis that
llm_translation: The sages said: "That one."

hebrew_text: בְּהֶשֵּׂג יָד כְּתִיב.
human_translation: is written with regard to affordability,
llm_translation: In the attainment of the hand it is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ פַּטְרוֹזָא בַּר דַּנְקָא, אָמַר רָבָא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא גָּדוֹל וְקָטָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis And how much Rav Yosef says: Even a lean lamb [ patruza ] worth a ma’a [ danka ] Rava says: We learn as well a big or a small
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halakha is in accordance with the words of the sages, and how much so? Rav Yosef said: Even if a patroza, son of a Danaka, said, Rava said: We too have learned, both great and small.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא? אִי נָמֵי, פַּטְרוֹזָא לָא? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious Lest you say such not Alternatively, a lean lamb not teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita! Mahu d'teima kulei hai la? Iy namei, patroza la? Ka mashma lan. English translation: Simple! What is the reasoning that all this is not so? If not, is it a dismissal? It is implied to us.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר, שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כַּמָּה בָּעֵינָא לְמִיתַּב לְכֹהֵן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ: עַיִן יָפָה בְּסֶלַע, עַיִן רָעָה בְּשֶׁקֶל, בֵּינוֹנִית בְּרִגְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia had a firstborn donkey. He sent it before Rabbi Tarfon, said to him: How much do I need to give a priest said to Didn’t say: a generous disposition with a sela , a miserly disposition with a shekel, an intermediate with a ragya ?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah Nasi had a pregnant donkey, he sent it to Rabbi Tarfon. He said to him: How much do I need to give to the Kohen? He said to him: Behold they said: A good eye in a rock, a bad eye in a shekel, an average eye in a rag.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא בְּרִגְיָא. וְכַמָּה? תְּלָתָא זוּזֵי. רְגִיל הָכָא וְרָגִיל הָכָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha with a ragya . And how much three dinars, close to [ ragil ] here and close to there,
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in Rigya. And how much? Three zuzim. He is accustomed here and he is accustomed here.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא! לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן — בְּבָא לִימָּלֵךְ, כָּאן — בְּעוֹשֶׂה מֵעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: halakha , and halakha a difficulty. not difficult, here to one who comes to consult; There, to one who acts on his own,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Kashya hilchata ahilchata! La kashya, kan - beba limmalech, kan - be'oseh me'atzmo."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר וְאֵין לוֹ שֶׂה לִפְדּוֹתוֹ — פּוֹדֵהוּ בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ. לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הָא אָמַר: הִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה בְּשֶׂה! אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says Reish Lakish says: One who has a firstborn donkey but does not have a lamb to redeem it may redeem with value In accordance with whose If we say in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, doesn’t he say the Torah is particular with a lamb Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said, Reish Lakish said: One who has a firstborn donkey but does not have a sheep to redeem it - he redeems it with a lamb. According to whom? If you say according to Rabbi Yehuda - but didn't he say: The Torah insisted on a sheep for him! Rather, according to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא מַתְנִי הָכִי, רָבִינָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa teaches in this way, Ravina difficult, Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa taught thus: Ravina raised an objection against him: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon — the halakha follows Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: וּסְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן?!
human_translation: And the tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And you say the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: And concealed to us, we learned like Rabbi Yehuda, and you said the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, לֹא יְהֵא חָמוּר מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְלֹא אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״בְּשֶׂה״ לְהַחְמִיר עָלָיו אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלָיו. רַב נַחְמָן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף פָּרֵיק לֵיהּ בְּשִׁילְקֵי בְּשׇׁוְיוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, even you say Rabbi Yehuda, as should not be more stringent than consecrated items. And the Torah did not state with a lamb to be stringent with but to be lenient with Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Yosef, redeemed with boiled vegetables its value.
llm_translation: Rather, even if you say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda, it should not be more stringent than the hekdesh, and the Torah did not say "in a sheep" to be stringent upon it, but to be lenient upon it. Rav Nachman, the son of Rav Yosef, explained it to him with the example of a cooked dish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַפּוֹדֶה פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, פִּדְיוֹנוֹ פָּדוּי. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פִּדְיוֹנוֹ לַפּוֹדֶה, אוֹ דִלְמָא פִּדְיוֹנוֹ לַבְּעָלִים?
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi says Rav Huna says: one who redeems the firstborn donkey of another, his redemption, is redeemed, A dilemma was raised before his redemption to the one who redeems or perhaps his redemption to the owner?
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rav Huna: One who redeems the firstborn donkey of his fellow, its redemption is valid. They asked him: Is its redemption for the redeemer, or perhaps its redemption is for the owners?

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה — מָמוֹנָא דִבְעָלִים הוּא, כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Shimon you should not raise the dilemma, since he says permitted to benefit the property of the owner, When you raise the dilemma, according to of Rabbi Yehuda, who says prohibited to benefit
llm_translation: The courtyard of Rabbi Shimon does not agree with you, since it says it is permitted to derive benefit - it is the property of the owners. When you seek the courtyard of Rabbi Yehuda, who says it is forbidden to derive benefit.

hebrew_text: לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״, אוֹ דִלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּקָנֵי לְהוּ בְּבֵינֵי וּבֵינֵי, לָא דָּמֵי לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ?
human_translation: is compared to consecrated and the Merciful One says “And he will give the money and it will be assured to him” Or perhaps since he owns the difference it is not similar to consecrated
llm_translation: To sanctify his money to him, and the Merciful One said: "And he shall give the money and it shall be his," or perhaps, since he acquires it with something in between, is it not considered as sanctified?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַגּוֹנֵב פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ — מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל לַבְּעָלִים, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עַכְשָׁיו — יֵשׁ לוֹ לְאַחַר מִכָּאן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Come hear one who steals the firstborn donkey of another he pays the payment of double to the owner And even though does not have now, he does have afterward,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, "Come and hear: One who steals the foal of his fellow's donkey — he must pay double restitution to the owners, even though he does not currently possess it — he has it for later from here."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אַמַּאי אֵין לוֹ עַכְשָׁיו? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Whose If we say Rabbi Shimon, why does not have now? Rather, obvious Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If you say it is Rabbi Shimon, why does he not have it now? Rather, it is obvious that it is Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ, ״וְגֻנַּב מִבֵּית הָאִישׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא מִבֵּית הֶקְדֵּשׁ! וְתוּ לָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind we compare it to consecrated the Merciful One state “And it be stolen from the man’s house” But not from the Temple treasury? And nothing more
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind to sanctify, we say to him, "And stolen from the house of the man," said the Merciful One, and not from the house of the Sanctuary! And if not, from his own.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בִּיכְּרָה וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה [כּוּ׳]. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ נִכְנַס לְדִיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר?
human_translation: one had given birth and one had not given birth, the Sages taught In what case did say enters the pen in order to be tithed?
llm_translation: One in a recognized manner and one not in a recognized manner Ko. The Rabbis taught: How did they say one should enter a chamber to become wealthy?

hebrew_text: אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר בְּבָא לְיַד כֹּהֵן, שֶׁהֲרֵי שָׁנִינוּ: הַלָּקוּחַ וְשֶׁנִּיתַּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה פָּטוּר מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, אֶלָּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ עֲשָׂרָה סְפֵק פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁמַּפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲשָׂרָה שֵׂיִין, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן, וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: You cannot say where entered the possession of a priest, as we learned that was purchased or that was given to him as a present is exempt from animal tithe, Rather, to an Israelite who has ten donkeys in his house firstborn uncertain, who designates ten lambs for them and he tithes and they are his.
llm_translation: If you cannot say "through a Kohen" to exempt from Ma'aser Behemah, for we have learned: "One who buys an animal and it was given to him as a gift is exempt from Ma'aser Behemah," rather it must be referring to in Israel, where he had ten doubtful firstborn donkeys in his house, for which he separates ten se'ahs of produce upon them, and he tithes them, and they are his.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ עֲשָׂרָה סְפֵק פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים — מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲשָׂרָה שֵׂיִין, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן, וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: supports of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: An Israelite who has ten donkeys firstborn uncertain designates ten lambs and tithes and they belong to him,
llm_translation: Assists him to Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: If a Jew had ten doubtful firstborn donkeys - he separates upon them ten lambs, and tithes them, and they are his.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ עֲשָׂרָה פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹרִים וַדָּאִין בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁנָּפְלוּ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן, וְאוֹתוֹ אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן נָפְלוּ לוֹ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: an Israelite who has ten certain firstborn donkeys in his house that were bequeathed from the household of his mother’s father, a priest but that mother’s father a priest bequeathed to him from the household of his mother’s father, an Israelite,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: If a Jew had ten foals of donkeys and they were found in his house, for they fell from the house of his father's mother who was a Kohen, and that father's mother who was a Kohen fell from the house of his father's mother who was a Jew.

hebrew_text: מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲשָׂרָה שֵׂיִין, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן, וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: designates ten lambs for them and tithes them and they are his,
llm_translation: He separates upon them ten se'ah of wine, and he tithes them, and they are his.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ טְבָלִים מְמוֹרָחִין בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁנָּפְלוּ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן, וְאוֹתוֹ אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן נָפְלוּ לוֹ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְעַשְּׂרָן וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: an Israelite who has smoothed untithed produce in his house, that was bequeathed from the household of his mother’s father, a priest, and that mother’s father a priest bequeathed to him from the household of his mother’s father, an Israelite, he separates tithes and it is his,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: If a Jew had tevulim that were smeared inside his house, which fell from the house of his father, his mother being a Kohen, and that father of his mother being a Kohen, they are his tithes and they belong to him.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מַפְרַישׁ וְקָאֵי.
human_translation: necessary. Because had he taught us the first because stand separated.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the argument - because he is separating and standing.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא — מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: But here, gifts that were not separated are as if they were not separated, say not
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "But here - gifts that were not designated are like gifts that were not designated, say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָכָא — דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְעַשּׂוֹרֵי מִינֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ, דְּהָא מַנַּח, אֲבָל הָתָם — כֵּיוָן דְּשֶׂה מֵעָלְמָא בָּעֵי אֵתוֹיֵי, וּמַפְרַישׁ וְקָאֵי, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us here, because it is possible to tithe from itself, as lie But there, since one needs to bring a lamb from elsewhere say the lamb stands separated not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here - that it is possible for the creditors and the debtor to be involved, for he is resting, but there - since he needs to come from elsewhere, and separates and stands, say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נָתָן אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ טְבָלִים
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Natan says Rabbi Ḥanina says: one who purchases untithed produce
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nathan said Rabbi Chanina: One who takes tevilin.

hebrew_text: מְמוֹרָחִין מִן הַגּוֹי, מְעַשְּׂרָן וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: smoothed from a gentile, he tithes but they are his,
llm_translation: M'morachin min hagoy, m'asrin v'hen shelo.

hebrew_text: דְּמָרְחִינְהוּ מַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּמָרְחִינְהוּ גּוֹי — ״דְּגָנְךָ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא דְּגַן גּוֹי!
human_translation: Who smoothed If we say that a gentile smoothed them, the Merciful One state: “Your grain” but not the grain of a gentile?
llm_translation: They asked: Who is it that we should feed? If you say we should feed a non-Jew - "Your grain" the Merciful One said, not the grain of a non-Jew!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּמָרְחִינְהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵרְשׁוּת גּוֹי. מְעַשְּׂרָן, דְּאֵין קִנְיָן לְגוֹי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִיַּד מַעֲשֵׂר, וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ — דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: קָאָתֵינָא מִכֹּחַ גַּבְרָא דְּלָא מָצֵית (אִישְׁתַּעֵית) [אִישְׁתַּעוֹיֵי] דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, a Jew smoothed them in the possession of the gentile he tithes them, as a gentile has no acquisition in Eretz Yisrael that would cause the abrogation from tithe But are as says to I have come on the basis of a man with whom you cannot engage in litigation,
llm_translation: Rather, the Israelites exempted them from the domain of a gentile. Their tithes, for a gentile does not acquire land in the land of Israel to exempt immediately from his hand a tithe, and they are his - for he said to him: "We are coming from the power of a man who does not find (his) judgment in his presence."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹתָיו אֵצֶל הַכּוּתִי וְאֵצֶל עַם הָאָרֶץ, בְּחֶזְקָתָן לַמַּעֲשֵׂר וְלַשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere one who deposits his produce with a Samaritan or with one who is unreliable with regard to tithes [ am ha’aretz ], its presumptive status with regard to tithe and Sabbatical
llm_translation: We learned there: One who entrusts his produce to a Kutite or to an Am Haaretz, it is assumed to be for tithing and for the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: אֵצֶל הַגּוֹי — כְּפֵירוֹתָיו, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: דְּמַאי.
human_translation: with a gentile, as the produce of Rabbi Shimon says: doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ],
llm_translation: Next to the non-Jew - his pockets, Rabbi Shimon says: Demai.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְהַפְרִישׁ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — לִיתְּנָן לְכֹהֵן. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: וַדַּאי חַלְּפִינְהוּ, וּבָעֵי מִיתְּנַנְהוּ לְכֹהֵן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: דְּמַאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Everyone agrees to separate When they disagree with regard to giving it to the priest The first tanna holds certainly exchanged and needs to give to the priest. And Rabbi Shimon holds demai ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: to separate - everyone in the world does not disagree, when they disagree - to give to the Kohen. The first Tanna thought: and surely they exchanged it, and he wants to give it to the Kohen, and Rabbi Shimon thought: demai.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: טַעְמָא דִּמְסַפְּקָא לַן אִי חַלְּפִינְהוּ אִי לָא חַלְּפִינְהוּ, הָא וַדַּאי חַלְּפִינְהוּ — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְּבִינְהוּ לְכֹהֵן, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ טְבָלִים מִן הַגּוֹי מְמוֹרָחִין — מְעַשְּׂרָן וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: Rav Dimi sat and stated this halakha Abaye said to him: The reason that we are uncertain whether exchanged it whether he did not exchange it. But he definitely exchanged it, everyone that required to give to a priest.
