human_translation: I will exclude the firstborn but I will not exclude from the gifts. the verse states: hart.” just as a hart is exempt firstborn and from the gifts, so too, disqualified consecrated are exempt firstborn and from the gifts.
llm_translation: I will bring out the firstborn, and not bring out the gifts? The Talmud teaches: "ayyal," just as an ayyal is exempt from both the firstborn and the gifts, so too disqualified consecrated items are exempt from both the firstborn and the gifts.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה צְבִי וְאַיָּל חֶלְבָּן מוּתָּר, אַף פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין חֶלְבָּן מוּתָּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״ — חִלֵּק.
human_translation: If just as the fat of a gazelle and a hart is permitted, so too, the fat of disqualified consecrated permitted. the verse states: “However, differentiates,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If deer and gazelle are permitted, are disqualified offerings also permitted? The Talmud says: "However" - distinguish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אוֹצִיא אֶת הַבְּכוֹר, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת. מַאי שְׁנָא אוֹצִיא אֶת הַבְּכוֹר — שֶׁאֵין שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת — שֶׁשָּׁווֹת בַּכֹּל. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַיָּל״.
human_translation: The Master said: I will exclude the firstborn but I will not exclude the gifts. What is different that I exclude the firstborn, that does not apply equally and I do not exclude the gifts, as they do apply equally to all the verse states “a hart”
llm_translation: Master said: "Bring out the firstborn, but do not bring out the gifts." What is the difference between bringing out the firstborn - that they are not equal in everything, and not bringing out the gifts - that they are equal in everything. The Talmud teaches: "A ram."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי מָה צְבִי וְאַיָּל, אֵין אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ נוֹהֵג בָּהֶן, אַף פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין אֵין אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ נוֹהֵג בּוֹ!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If Just as itself and its offspring does not apply to a gazelle and a hart, so too, itself and its offspring not apply to disqualified consecrated
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: If the deer and the ram, it and its son behave in that manner, so too disqualified sacrificial animals, it and its son behave in it!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְמַאי מְדַמֵּית לְהוּ? אִי לְחוּלִּין — ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ נוֹהֵג בּוֹ, וְאִי לְקָדָשִׁים — ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ נוֹהֵג בּוֹ!
human_translation: said to To what are you comparing If to non-sacred a mother and its offspring applies to them. And if to sacrificial itself and its offspring applies to them.
llm_translation: He said to him: For what do you compare it? If for mundane matters - "he and his son" is applicable to it, and if for holy matters - "he and his son" is applicable to it!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי חֶלְבּוֹ נָמֵי נֵימָא הָכִי: לְמַאי מְדַמֵּית לְהוּ? אִי לְחוּלִּין — חֶלְבָּן אָסוּר, וְאִי לְקָדָשִׁים — חֶלְבָּן אָסוּר!
human_translation: said to him: If so, with regard to its fat as well, let us state like this: To what are you comparing If to non-sacred their fat is forbidden. And to sacrificial their fat is forbidden.
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, regarding its fat, say it like this: For what is it compared to them? If for common use — its fat is forbidden, and if for holy use — its fat is forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָאו מִי אָמְרַתְּ ״אַךְ״ וְלֹא חֶלְבָּן? אֵימַר נָמֵי ״אַךְ״ וְלֹא אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, didn’t you say “However,” but not their fat? Say also: “However,” but not a mother and its offspring.
llm_translation: Rather, did you not say "only" and not "Chevban"? Say also "only" and not him and his son.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: ״אַךְ״ לְאוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא, וְחֶלְבּוֹ מִ״דָּמוֹ״ נָפְקָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק אֶת דָּמוֹ לֹא תֹאכֵל״.
human_translation: Rava says: “however” comes to a mother and its offspring and its fat is derived from “its blood.” As it is written Only you shall not eat its blood”
llm_translation: Rava said: "Ach" to indicate him, and it is his son who came, and his fat from "his blood" came out, as it is written: "Only his blood you shall not eat."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּמוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא דָּמוֹ מַמָּשׁ, לָא יְהֵא אֶלָּא דָּמָן דִּצְבִי וְאַיָּל, אַטּוּ דָּמָן דִּצְבִי וְאַיָּל מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא ״דָּמוֹ״ — חֶלְבּוֹ.
human_translation: What “its blood” If we say its actual blood, it were merely the blood of a gazelle and a hart, is that to say anyone permits the blood of a gazelle and a hart? Rather, “its blood” its fat.
llm_translation: What is "its blood"? If you say that its blood is literal, it should only be the blood of a deer and a ram. But is the blood of a deer and a ram permitted? Rather, "its blood" refers to its fat.

hebrew_text: וְלִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֶלְבּוֹ״! אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֵלֶב״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַהֲנִי הֶיקֵּישָׁא וְאַהֲנִי קְרָא.
human_translation: But let the Merciful One write: Its fat, If the Merciful One had written fat, I would say: The juxtaposition is effective and the verse is effective,
llm_translation: And to write, the Merciful One "his fat"! If the Merciful One had written "fat," I would have said: here it is compared and here it is written.

hebrew_text: אַהֲנִי הֶיקֵּישָׁא לְמַעוֹטֵי מִכָּרֵת, דְּכִי כְּתַב כָּרֵת — אַאוֹכֵל חֵלֶב בְּהֵמָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי כׇל אוֹכֵל חֵלֶב מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: The juxtaposition is effective in excludes from excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ]. that when writes “ karet ,” it is written with regard to one who eats the fat of a domesticated animal, as it is stated: “For anyone who eats the fat of the domesticated animal…
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ahani heikeisha lema'utei mikareit, deki k'tav kareit - a'okhel heleiv behemah hu dikhtiv, she'ne'emar: 'Ki kol okhel heleiv min habehemah.'" Translation: "This is analogous to the cases of excision, for when it is written 'excision' - it refers to consuming animal fat, as it is written, 'For anyone who eats fat from an animal.'"

hebrew_text: וְאַהֲנִי קְרָא לְמֵיקַם עֲלֵיהּ בְּלָאו בְּעָלְמָא, לְהָכִי אַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן ״דָּמוֹ״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה דָּמוֹ בְּכָרֵת — אַף חֶלְבּוֹ בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: And the verse effective, as, establish as a prohibition merely For this the Merciful One expresses the language “its blood,” to tell you just as its blood by karet , so too, its fat by karet .
llm_translation: And I will give a place for it without in the world, so the Merciful One established it with the language of "its blood," to say to you: Just as its blood is in the karet penalty, so too its fat is in the karet penalty.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנָא ״אַךְ״, וְלֹא חֶלְבּוֹ, קָאָמַר!
human_translation: But didn’t tanna say “however” but not its fat?
llm_translation: And the Tanna taught "only," and not his fat, he is saying!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִילּוּ לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״דָּמוֹ״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר ״אַךְ״ — וְלֹא חֶלְבּוֹ, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״דָּמוֹ״, לְאוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: this is saying: Had “its blood” not been stated, I would have said “however” But not its fat. now that it is stated: “Its blood,” comes to a mother and its offspring
llm_translation: So it is stated: If it had not said "his blood," I would have said "only" — and not his fat. Now that it says "his blood," it is he and his son who come.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָן יוֹצְאִין לְחוּלִּין. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״תִּזְבַּח״ — וְלֹא גִּיזָּה, ״בָּשָׂר״ — וְלֹא חָלָב, ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — וְלֹא לִכְלָבֶיךָ, מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: And do not emerge non-sacred From where are these matters as the Sages taught “you may slaughter” but not shearing flesh” but not milk. “you may eat” but not to your dogs. From here that one may not redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And they do not fulfill their obligation for secular purposes. From where do we derive these matters? For the Rabbis taught: 'You shall sacrifice' — and not shear, 'flesh' — and not milk, 'and you shall eat' — and not feed to your dogs. From here it is derived that one may not redeem consecrated items in order to feed them to dogs."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״תִּזְבַּח וְאָכַלְתָּ״ — אֵין לָךְ בָּהֶן הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת זְבִיחָה וְאֵילָךְ, אֲבָל פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאָמַר.
human_translation: Some say “You may slaughter and eat,” you have permission to eat them only from the time of slaughter onward. But so too, said one may redeem sacrificial to feed them to dogs,
llm_translation: There are those who say: "Sacrifice and eat" - you have no permission to eat them except from the time of slaughter and onwards, but one may redeem the consecrated items to feed them to dogs, as it is also stated.

hebrew_text: וּוְלָדָן וַחֲלָבָן אָסוּר לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיעַבַּר וְאִיתְיְלִיד לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — אַמַּאי? וְלַד צְבִי וְאַיָּל נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא דְּאִיעַבַּר לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן וְאִיתְיְלִיד לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן. הָא לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן — מִיקְדָּשׁ נָמֵי קָדְשִׁי.
human_translation: And their offspring and their milk are prohibited after their redemption. What are the circumstances If we say that was conceived and born after redemption, why they are the offspring a gazelle or a hart, Rather, where was conceived prior to redemption and born after redemption. But before their redemption, they are also imbued with sanctity.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And their offspring, V'ladan and Chalban, are forbidden after their redemption. How so? If you say that it was conceived and born after their redemption - why? They are offspring of a deer and a ram! Rather, it was conceived before their redemption and born after their redemption. This is considered before their redemption - consecrated, my consecrated ones." English translation: "And their offspring, V'ladan and Chalban, are forbidden after their redemption. How so? If you say that it was conceived and born after their redemption - why? They are offspring of a deer and a ram! Rather, it was conceived before their redemption and born after their redemption. This is considered before their redemption - consecrated, my consecrated ones."

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זָכָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַוָּלָד, וּ״נְקֵבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַתְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: From where is this matter, as the Sages taught “male” to include the offspring “or female” to include the a substitute
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "What are these words? For the Rabbis taught: 'male' - to include the offspring, and 'female' - to include the substitute."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא וְלַד תְּמִימִין וּתְמוּרַת תְּמִימִים, וְלַדי בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין וּתְמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין מִנַּיִן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִם זָכָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת וְלַד בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, ״אִם נְקֵבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת תְּמוּרַת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין.
human_translation: And I have only the offspring of unblemished and the substitute of unblemished From where the offspring of blemished and the substitute of blemished When states: “Whether male,” to include the offspring of blemished “Or female,” to include the substitute of blemished
llm_translation: And I have only a firstborn of the unblemished and a substitute of the unblemished, and my firstborn of the blemished and a substitute of the blemished, from where? When it says "if male" - to include a firstborn of the blemished, "if female" - to include a substitute of the blemished.

hebrew_text: אוֹתָן וְלָדוֹת שֶׁלְּאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן, מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶן? לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן — מִיפְלָג פְּלִיגִי בְּהוּ, אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: קָדְשִׁי לִיקְרַב, וְאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: קָדְשִׁי לִרְעִיָּיה.
human_translation: those offspring that after their redemption, what will be with them, before their redemption, disagree with regard to There is one who says: They are consecrated, be sacrificed, and there is one who says: They are consecrated to graze
llm_translation: Those who give birth after their redemption, what is to be done with them? Before their redemption - there is a dispute between them, there is for the one who says: "My holy things to be brought near," and there is for the one who says: "My holy things for my own use."

hebrew_text: דִּלְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן, מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כּוֹנְסָן לַכִּיפָּה, וְהֵן מֵתִין. דְּהֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לִיקְרְבִינְהוּ — מִכֹּחַ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָה קָאָתוּ, לִיפְרְקִינְהוּ — לָא אַלִּימִי לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנָן.
human_translation: that after their redemption, what will be with them? Rav Huna says: One gathers them into a chamber, and they die that what to do? Shall we sacrifice them? they received from deferred sanctity Shall we redeem them? is not strong to be transferable their redemption.
llm_translation: After their redemption, what should be done with them? Rav Huna said: Gather them for the Temple treasury, and they die. How should this be done? To bring them close - they come from the power of the Holy One, blessed be He; to separate them - it is not proper to delay their redemption.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: סָמוּךְ לְפִדְיוֹנָן מַתְפִּיסָן לְשֵׁם אוֹתוֹ זֶבַח. סָמוּךְ לְפִדְיוֹנָן? לְמֵימְרָא דִּבְנֵי פְּדִיָּיה נִינְהוּ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: סָמוּךְ לְפִדְיוֹן אִמָּן מַתְפִּיסָן לְשֵׁם אוֹתוֹ זֶבַח. טַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְגַדֵּל מֵהֶן עֲדָרִים עֲדָרִים.
human_translation: They said in the West, in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina: before their redemption, one dedicates them for the sake of the same offering before their redemption? to say that they are fit to be redeemed? Rather, say: before their mother’s redemption, one dedicates them for the sake of the same offering. What is the reason Rabbi Levi says: decree, lest one raise flocks and flocks of them.
llm_translation: They said in the West in the name of Rabbi Chanina: If one is adjacent to their redemption money, they acquire it for the sake of that sacrifice. Adjacent to their redemption money? Are they from the town of Pidyon? Rather say: If one is adjacent to redemption money, they acquire it for the sake of that sacrifice. What is the reason? Rabbi Levi said: It is a decree lest they raise flocks, flock by flock.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבִינָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַהוּ שֶׁמַּתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מַתְפִּיסָן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גָּמַר ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״ ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״ מִבְּכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר אֵין מַתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר יְבֻכַּר לַה׳ בִּבְהֵמָה וְגוֹ׳ לֹא יַקְדִּישׁ אִישׁ אֹתוֹ״, אַף הָנֵי אֵין מַתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Ravina raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: what is Can one dedicate as any offering he desires? said to him: He may not dedicate them What is the reason? said to him: derived “Within your gates” “Within your gates” with regard to a firstborn. Just as one cannot dedicate a firstborn as any offering he desires, as it is written: “But the firstborn among animals, which is born as a firstborn to the Lord, no man shall sanctify it” so too, one cannot dedicate these as any offering he desires.
llm_translation: Ravina asked Rav Sheshet: What about those that one designates for any sacrifice that he desires? He said to him: They are not designated. What is the reason? He said to him: It is derived from "in your gates" - "in your gates" is referring to the firstborn. Just as the firstborn is not designated for any sacrifice that he desires, as it is written: "However, the firstborn that is born to the Lord among your cattle, etc., no man shall consecrate it," so too these are not designated for any sacrifice that he desires.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: קֳדָשִׁים שֶׁקָּדַם מוּם קָבוּעַ לְהֶקְדֵּישָׁן וְנִפְדּוּ — חַיָּיבִין בַּבְּכוֹרָה וּבַמַּתָּנוֹת, בֵּין לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן בֵּין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — הַגּוֹזֵז וְהָעוֹבֵד בָּהֶן אֵינוֹ סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים, בֵּין לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן בֵּין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav Sheshet: Sacrificial whose permanent blemish preceded their consecration and were redeemed, are obligated in a firstborn, and in the gifts. Whether before their redemption or after their redemption, one who shears or utilizes them for labor does not incur the forty whether before their redemption or after their redemption, they do not render a substitute
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Sheshet: Consecrated animals that had a blemish before they were sanctified and were redeemed - are obligated in the laws of firstborn animals and gifts to the priests, whether before their redemption or after their redemption. One who shears or works with them does not incur the penalty of lashes until they have reached forty days, whether before their redemption or after their redemption. A substitution is not made for them.

hebrew_text: וְלִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן — מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וּלְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וּוַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן — חוֹל, וְנִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים, וּמַתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הֵן כְּחוּלִּין לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, אֵין לְךָ בָּהֶם אֶלָּא מִצְוַת עִלּוּי בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: And before their redemption, them misuse and after their redemption, them is not misuse And their offspring are non-sacred and they may be redeemed unblemished and one can dedicate as any offering he desires. The principle of the matter are like non-sacred in all matters, you have only the mitzva of value alone,
llm_translation: Before their redemption - they are considered as uncircumcised, and after their redemption - they are not considered as uncircumcised, and their offspring are common, and they are redeemed as complete. And they can be used for any sacrifice that one desires. The general principle is: they are considered as common in all their matters, and you have nothing in them except the commandment of elevation alone.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קָדַם הֶקְדֵּישָׁן אֶת מוּמָן, אוֹ מוּם עוֹבֵר לְהֶקְדֵּישָׁן, וּלְאַחַר מִכָּאן נוֹלַד מוּם קָבוּעַ וְנִפְדּוּ — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה וּמִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת, בֵּין לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן בֵּין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן. הַגּוֹזֵז וְהָעוֹבֵד בָּהֶן סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים, וּבֵין לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן בֵּין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — עוֹשִׂין תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: But their consecration preceded their blemish, or a temporary blemish to their consecration and afterward developed a permanent blemish, and they were redeemed, they are exempt firstborn and from the gifts. whether before their redemption or after their redemption, one who shears or utilizes them for labor incurs the forty And whether before their redemption or after their redemption, they render a substitute
llm_translation: But if they consecrated their blemished animal, or if a blemish developed in their consecrated animal, and thereafter a permanent blemish was born and redeemed - they are exempt from the firstborn and from the gifts, whether before its redemption or after its redemption. The one who shears or works with them absorbs the forty days, whether before its redemption or after its redemption - they make an exchange.

hebrew_text: לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנָן — מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וּלְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן — אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וּוַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן קוֹדֶשׁ, וְאֵין נִיפְדִּין תְּמִימִין, וְאֵין מַתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, וְאֵין לָךְ בָּהֶן אֶלָּא הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Before their redemption, them misuse and after their redemption, them is not misuse And their offspring are sacred and may not be redeemed unblemished, and one may not dedicate them as any offering he desires. The principle of the matter are like sacrificial in all matters, and you have only the permission of consumption alone,
llm_translation: Before their redemption - they are considered as having been consecrated, and after their redemption - they are not considered as having been consecrated. Their offspring are holy, and they are not redeemed as unblemished, and they do not acquire any offering that they may desire. The general principle of the matter: They are considered as consecrated for all their matters, and you have nothing in them except for the permissibility of consumption alone.

hebrew_text: ״כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר״ דְּרֵישָׁא — לְאֵתוֹיֵי שׁוֹחֲטָן בְּחוּץ דְּפָטוּר, ״כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר״ דְּסֵיפָא —
human_translation: The principle of the matter, in the former clause to add one who slaughters outside that he is exempt. The principle of the matter, in the latter clause,
llm_translation: "The principle of a matter" - the first clause - to include those who slaughter outside the Temple are exempt. "The principle of a matter" - the latter clause -

hebrew_text: לְאֵתוֹיֵי חֲלָבוֹ.
human_translation: to include its milk
llm_translation: For the purpose of his fat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵין נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִין, וְאֵין מַתְפִּיסָן לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה. תְּמִימִים הוּא דְּלָא מִיפַּרְקִי, הָא בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין — מִיפַּרְקִי. לְכׇל שֶׁיִּרְצֶה הוּא דְּאֵין מַתְפִּיסָן, הָא לְאוֹתוֹ זֶבַח — מַתְפִּיסָן.
human_translation: The Master said may not be redeemed unblemished, and one may not dedicate them as any offering he desires. It is unblemished that one may not redeem, one may redeem blemished it is for any offering he desires that he may not dedicate but for the same offering one may dedicate
llm_translation: Master said: The unblemished cannot be redeemed, and one cannot designate them for any sacrifice that he desires. It is the unblemished that cannot be redeemed, for they do not become disqualified, whereas those with blemishes become disqualified. As for any sacrifice that he desires, it is that they cannot be designated, but for that specific sacrifice, they can be designated.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? דְּמַתְפִּיסָן לְאוֹתוֹ זֶבַח, וְנִפְדִּין בְּמוּמָן. נֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא?
human_translation: How can you find where one dedicates as the same offering and may be redeemed after a blemish. Shall we say this is a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna,
llm_translation: How do you find her? For she is apprehended with that sacrifice, and they are redeemed with its blemish. Should it be said that this is the response of Rav Huna?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין אֵין נִפְדִּין, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים״ — תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״אֵין נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים״, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה״ — תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״לְכׇל זֶבַח שֶׁיִּרְצֶה״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you: the same is true as even blemished cannot be redeemed. And since the former clause taught They may be redeemed unblemished, the latter clause also taught They may not be redeemed unblemished. And since the former clause taught: As any offering he desires, the latter clause also taught: As any offering he desires.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: The same applies even to blemished animals, they are not redeemed. And the proof is that the first Tanna teaches in the beginning "blemished animals are redeemed" — the second Tanna teaches in the end "blemished animals are not redeemed." And the proof is that the first Tanna teaches in the beginning "for any sacrifice that he will choose" — the second Tanna teaches in the end "for any sacrifice that he will choose."

hebrew_text: וְהַשּׁוֹחֲטָן בַּחוּץ פָּטוּר. רַב הוּנָא מַתְנֵי חַיָּיב, וּמוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּדוּקִין שֶׁבְּעַיִן, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אִם עָלוּ לֹא יֵרְדוּ.
human_translation: And one who slaughters them outside exempt Rav Huna taught is liable and he interprets it on the cornea of the eye. And in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, who says: if they ascended they shall not descend
llm_translation: The one slaughtering outside is exempt. Rav Huna teaches: liable, and they establish for her meticulousness of the eyes, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva who said: "If they ascended, they shall not descend."

hebrew_text: בֵּין לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנוֹ בֵּין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנוֹ עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: וּתְמוּרָתוֹ לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנוֹ מֵתָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? הֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לַיקְרְבַיהּ — מִכֹּחַ קְדוּשָּׁה דְּחוּיָה קָאָתְיָא, לִיפְרְקַהּ — לָא אַלִּימָא לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנָהּ, הִלְכָּךְ מֵתָה.
human_translation: Whether before its redemption or after its redemption, renders a substitute Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: And its substitute after its redemption die. What is the reason? What are we to do? Shall we sacrifice it? it received from deferred sanctity Shall we redeem it? is not strong to be transferable its redemption. Therefore, it die.
llm_translation: Between before his redemption and after his redemption he makes an exchange. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: And his exchange after his redemption is nullified. What is the reason? How should he conduct himself? If he brings it closer - it is considered as if it is from the power of a rejected holiness, if he distances it - it is not proper to diminish his redemption, therefore it is nullified.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב עַמְרָם: וְתִיתְּכִיל בְּמוּמָהּ לַבְּעָלִים! וְכִי מָה בֵּין זוֹ לִתְמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר? דִּתְנַן: תְּמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר, הֵן וּוְלָדָן וּוְלַד וְלָדָן עַד סוֹף כׇּל הָעוֹלָם — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּבְכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר, וְיֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן לַבְּעָלִים!
human_translation: Rav Amram objects to this: But let be eaten in its blemished by the owners. what is between this and the substitute of a firstborn or tithe As we learned the substitute of a firstborn and tithe they, and their offspring, and the offspring of their offspring, forever, are like firstborn and tithe and they are eaten in their blemished by the owners.
llm_translation: Rav Amram objects to her: "And you would permit her blemish to the owners! But what is the difference between this and the exchange of the firstborn and tithe? For we learned: The exchange of the firstborn and tithe, their offspring and the offspring of their offspring until the end of all time — they are like the firstborn and tithe, and may be eaten with their blemish by the owners!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: זֶה שֵׁם אִמּוֹ עָלָיו וְזֶה שֵׁם אִמּוֹ עָלָיו, זֶה כּוּלּוֹ תְּמוּרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר מִיקַּרְיָא, מָה בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר בְּמוּמָן מִיתְאַכְלָן לַבְּעָלִים, אַף תְּמוּרָתָן מִיתְאַכְלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to This one bears its mother’s name and that one bears its mother’s name, This is entirely called a substitute of a firstborn or tithe Just as a firstborn and tithe are eaten in their blemished by the owners, so too, their substitute is eaten
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: This is the name of his mother upon him, and this is the name of his mother upon him, this is all a substitution of the firstborn and tithe is called. Just as the firstborn and tithe with a blemish are eaten by the owners, so too their substitution is eaten.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה שֵׁם אִמּוֹ עָלָיו, תְּמוּרַת קָדָשִׁים מִיקַּרְיָא, מָה קָדָשִׁים לָא מִיתַּכְלִי אֶלָּא בְּפִדְיוֹן — אַף תְּמוּרָתָן נָמֵי לָא מִיתַּכְלִי אֶלָּא בְּפִדְיוֹן, וְהָא לָא אַלִּימָא לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנַהּ.
human_translation: And this bears its mothers name, it is called the substitute of a sacrificial Just as sacrificial are eaten only through redemption, so too, their substitutes are also eaten only through redemption. But this is not strong to be transferable its redemption,
llm_translation: And this is the name of his mother upon him, the redemption of holy things from the flock, just as holy things are not consumed except through redemption - so too their redemption is not consumed except through redemption, and this is not to say that its redemption is not effective.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: מִנַּיִן לִתְמוּרַת פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין שֶׁמֵּתָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִמַּעֲלֵי הַגֵּרָה... טָמֵא״, הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְחָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת! הָהוּא מִ״מַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה טָמֵא״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: it is taught in accordance with of Rav Naḥman: From where with regard to the substitute of disqualified consecrated that it die? the verse states: of them that chew the cud, impure that necessary for the five sin offerings die, that is derived “Of them that have a split hoof impure.”
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Nachman: From where do we derive that the exchange of disqualified consecrated items is effective after the death of the original item? The verse teaches: "From the top of the pile... it is impure." This teaching is necessary to include cases where five dead sin-offerings are exchanged. That ruling is derived from the verse "from the one who divides the hair, it is impure."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִנַּיִן לְחָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה... טָמֵא״. חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת, הִילְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא קְרָא לִתְמוּרַת אָשָׁם.
human_translation: this is also taught From where that five sin offerings die? The verse states: “Of them that have a split hoof impure five sin offerings die a halakha learned Rather, when verse came, to substitute of a guilt offering
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that for five deadly sins one is liable to bring a sin-offering? The verse teaches: "From those who spread the bed... unclean." The conclusion regarding the five deadly sins is learned from it. However, when the verse came to address the substitution for a guilt-offering...

hebrew_text: תְּמוּרַת אָשָׁם נָמֵי הִילְכְתָא הִיא, כֹּל שֶׁבַּחַטָּאת מֵתָה — בָּאָשָׁם רוֹעֶה!
human_translation: a substitute for a guilt offering is also a halakha learned In any where a sin offering die, a guilt offering graze.
llm_translation: Exchange of guilt is the essence of the matter, all that in a sin offering is dead - in a guilt offering it grazes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת, וְאִצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא וְאִצְטְרִיךְ הִילְכְתָא, דְּאִי מִקְּרָא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לִרְעִיָּיה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הִילְכְתָא לְמִיתָה. וְאִי מֵהִילְכְתָא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דַּעֲבַד אִיקְּרִי וַאֲכַל מֵהָנֵי חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת — אִיסּוּרָא אִיכָּא, לָאו לֵיכָּא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִיכָּא לָאו.
human_translation: Rather, actually five sin offerings die. And a verse is necessary and halakha is necessary If from the verse I would say to graze. the halakha teaches us that to die. And if on the halakha I would say: where one happened to eat from these five sin offerings, there is a prohibition but not a negative mitzva, teaches us that there is a negative mitzva
llm_translation: Rather, always five sins are fatal, and it requires a verse and it requires a halakha, for if there was a verse, I would say to my friend, it implies to us a halakha of death. And if there was no halakha, I would say: where one performs the act and eats from the five sins - there is a prohibition, not a permission, it implies to us that there is no permission.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי דָּבָר הַבָּא מִמַּעֲלֵי גֵּרָה לְדָבָר הַבָּא ״מִמַּפְרִיסֵי הַפַּרְסָה״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה — אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say to juxtapose an item that comes, from who chew their cud, with an item that comes from who have a split hoof, Just as there, to die, so too here, to die.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For those who are liable for a matter that comes from above the roof to a matter that comes from "those who spread the sheet," just as there it is punishable by death - so too here it is punishable by death.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹי —
human_translation: one who receives a guaranteed investment from a gentile,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who acquires a flock with iron from a non-Jew—

hebrew_text: וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן פְּטוּרִין, וַלְדֵי וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן חַיָּיבִין. הֶעֱמִיד וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן תַּחַת אִמּוֹתֵיהֶן — וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין, וּוַלְדֵי וַולְדֵי וְולָדוֹת חַיָּיבִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה פְּטוּרִים, שֶׁאַחְרָיוּתָן לַנׇּכְרִי.
human_translation: their offspring are exempt the offspring of their offspring are obligated established their offspring in place of their mothers the offspring of offspring are exempt and the offspring of the offspring of offspring are obligated. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even until ten exempt, as they as a guarantee for the gentile,
llm_translation: Their daughters are exempt, and the daughters of their daughters are obligated. If one establishes the daughters of their daughters in place of their mothers - the daughters of the daughters' daughters are exempt, but the daughters of the daughters' daughters' daughters are obligated. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even up to ten generations are exempt, because they belong to the foreigner.

hebrew_text: רָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז, וְעֵז שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין רָחֵל — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: A ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts and a goat that gave birth to a ewe of sorts are exempt firstborn. And if has some of the characteristics obligated
llm_translation: Rachel who gave birth from a goat, and a goat that gave birth from Rachel - exempt from the firstborn status, and if it has some signs - obligated.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָא נָקֵט מָרָא זוּזֵי — בִּרְשׁוּתָא דְּמָרָא קָיְימָא?
human_translation: to say that since the owner did not take the money stands in the owner’s possession,
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the statement, since he did not acquire the vinegar for a zuz — is the owner of the vinegar still liable?

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֵין מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא רִבִּית, אַלְמָא בִּרְשׁוּתָא דִּמְקַבֵּל קָיְימָא!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction One may not accept from a Jew a guaranteed investment, because it is interest. Evidently, stands in the possession of the recipient,
llm_translation: And they asked: Do we not accept sheep of iron from a Jew because it is usury? This implies that if it is in the domain of one who accepts, it is permissible!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, וְהָא דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. This where accepts upon himself an accident or depreciation that where did not accept upon himself an accident or depreciation.
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is not difficult, this one who accepted upon himself Ones and Zola, and this one who did not accept upon himself Ones and Zola.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, ״צֹאן בַּרְזֶל״ קָרֵית לֵיהּ? וְעוֹד, מַאי פַּסְקָא?
human_translation: Rava said to If the owner accepted upon himself an accident or depreciation, you call it a guaranteed investment? And furthermore, why without qualification
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: that he accepted upon himself the obligation of Ones and Zola, "a flock of iron" did you call it? And furthermore, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא אֲבָל מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹי — לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, אֲבָל קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי!
human_translation: And furthermore, Instead of teaching the latter clause But one may accept a guaranteed investment from gentiles, let distinguish and teach within the itself, In what is this statement, said? when did not accept upon himself an accident or depreciation, but the owner accepted upon himself an accident or depreciation, well
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught in the latter clause: But if one receives iron sheep from a gentile — to separate and to give them individually: In what case are these matters spoken? When he did not accept upon himself liability and depreciation, but if he accepted upon himself liability and depreciation — the price is good!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, וְהָכָא גַּבֵּי בְּכוֹרָה הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּאִילּוּ אָתֵי גּוֹי בָּעֵי זוּזֵי וְלָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ — תָּפֵיס לַהּ לִבְהֵמָה, וְאִי לָא מַשְׁכַּח לַהּ לִבְהֵמָה — תָּפֵיס וְלָדוֹת דִּידַהּ, וַהֲרֵי יַד גּוֹי בָּאֶמְצַע, וְכֹל יַד גּוֹי בָּאֶמְצַע — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: this and that the owner did not accept upon himself responsibility for an accident or depreciation. And here, with regard to the firstborn, this is the reason Since, if gentile comes wants money, and does not give to him, seize the animal, and if he does not find the animal he will seize the offspring, the hand of a gentile is in the middle, And every the hand of a gentile is in the middle, exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Both parties, who did not accept upon themselves the responsibility of the ox and the lamb, and here in the case of the firstborn, that is the reason, for if a non-Jew comes and demands payment and he does not give it to him — he should take it from the animal, and if he forgets to take it from the animal — he should take it from its offspring. And behold, the hand of a non-Jew is in the middle, and any hand of a non-Jew that is in the middle — exempts from the firstborn.

hebrew_text: הֶעֱמִיד וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן תַּחַת אִמּוֹתֵיהֶן — וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִים. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין, וַולְדֵי (ולדותיהן) [וְלָדוֹת] חַיָּיבִין. וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת נָמֵי פְּטוּרִין, וַולְדֵי וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: established their offspring in place of their mothers the offspring of offspring are exempt. Rav Huna says: offspring are exempt, but the offspring of their offspring are obligated. And Rav Yehuda says: The offspring of offspring are also exempt, and the offspring of the offspring of offspring are obligated.
llm_translation: He established their offspring under their mothers - the offspring of offspring are exempt. Rav Huna said: The offspring are exempt, but the offspring of offspring are obligated. And Rav Yehudah said: The offspring of offspring are also exempt, but the offspring of the offspring of offspring are obligated.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הֶעֱמִיד וְלָדוֹת תַּחַת אִמּוֹתֵיהֶן — וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין. טַעְמָא דְּהֶעֱמִיד, הָא לֹא הֶעֱמִיד — לָא. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: We learned established their offspring in place of their mothers the offspring of offspring are exempt. The reason that he established but he did not establish not a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: We learned: If he established the offspring under their mothers - the offspring of the offspring are exempt. The reason for establishing, if he did not establish - no. The contradiction of Rav Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַב יְהוּדָה: הוּא הַדִּין, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הֶעֱמִיד, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אֲפִילּוּ הֶעֱמִיד נָמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to you: the same is true even though he did not establish And this is teaching us Even he established
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Yehudah: It is the same, even though he did not establish, and this is what he implies to us: even if he did establish, it is the same.

hebrew_text: דְּאוֹרְחֵיהּ דְּגוֹי לְמִיתְפַּס בְּנָהּ, וְהָוֵי כְּמִי דְּלֹא הֶעֱמִיד — וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין, וַולְדֵי וַלְדֵי וְלָדוֹת חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: as it is the manner of the gentile to seize her young And is like one who did not establish the offspring of offspring are exempt, but the offspring of the offspring of offspring are obligated.
llm_translation: In the way of the nations to cause a miscarriage in her, and it is as one who did not establish — and for the offspring of the offspring she is exempt, but for the offspring of the offspring of the offspring she is liable.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת פְּטוּרִין, שֶׁאַחְרָיוּתָן לַנׇּכְרִי. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: נָחֵית תַּנָּא קַמָּא לְדָרֵי —
human_translation: We learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even until ten generations are exempt, as they serve as a guarantee for the gentile, Granted, according to Rav Yehuda, who says the first tanna descended to generational
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even up to ten generations are exempt, as their lineage belongs to a non-Jew. According to the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah, who said: "You have descended to the first generations" —

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת פְּטוּרִין. אֶלָּא לְרַב הוּנָא דְּאָמַר: לָא נָחֵית תַּנָּא קַמָּא לְדָרֵי, מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת״? אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַ״הֶעֱמִיד״ קָאֵי דְּנָחֵית לְדָרֵי.
human_translation: this is what Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to him: Even until ten generations, are exempt. But according to Rav Huna, who says the first tanna did not descend to generational what Even until ten generations? Rav Huna said to you Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is referring to established as descends to generational
llm_translation: That is what Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to him: Even up to ten generations are exempt. But Rav Huna said: You have not reached the first Tanna of the generations, what is "even up to ten generations"? Rav Huna said to you: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel stands for "he established" when you have not reached the generations.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְקַבֵּל צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹי — וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין, וַולְדֵי וְלָדוֹת לֹא. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב יְהוּדָה! אָמַר לָךְ רַב יְהוּדָה, אֵימָא: הֵן וּוַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Come hear one who accepts a guaranteed investment from a gentile, the offspring are exempt, and the offspring of the offspring not a conclusive refutation of Rav Yehuda, Rav Yehuda said to you: I will say they, and their offspring
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: hamkabel tzon barzel min hagoy - veladot peturin, voldai veladot lo. Teivata deRav Yehuda! Amar lakh Rav Yehuda, eima: hein uvaldotaihen." English translation: "Come and hear: One who acquires a flock from a non-Jew - the offspring are exempt, but the offspring of the offspring are not. The objection of Rav Yehuda! Rav Yehuda said to you, say: 'Behold, and their offspring.'"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הֵן וּוַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן פְּטוּרִין, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא! אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא: אֵימָא הֵן וְולָדוֹת — פָּטוּר, וַולְדֵי וְלָדוֹת — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: there are who say They, and their offspring are exempt, a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna. Rav Huna said to you: say they, and offspring are exempt. But the offspring of their offspring obligated.
llm_translation: There are those who say: "Yes, their daughters are exempt, the reasoning of Rav Huna!" Rav Huna said to you: "If their daughters and their offspring - exempt, but the offspring of their offspring - liable."

hebrew_text: רָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז כּוּ׳. אֲתָא רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, וְאַיְיתִי מַתְנִיתָא בִּידֵיהּ: רָחֵל בַּת עֵז, וְעֵז בַּת רָחֵל — רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: A ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts Rav Oshaya came from Neharde’a and brought a baraita in his hand: a ewe born to a goat, or a goat born to a ewe, Rabbi Meir deems obligated, and the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: Rachel who gave birth from a goat, etc. Rav Oshaya came from Nehardea, and he brought a teaching in his hand: Rachel the daughter of a goat, and a goat the daughter of Rachel - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the Sages exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא לְרַבָּה: כִּי עָיְילַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לִבְכוֹרָה — וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר ״אַךְ בְּכוֹר שׁוֹר״ עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הוּא שׁוֹר וּבְכוֹרוֹ שׁוֹר?
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya said to Rabba: When you go before Rav Huna, ask him: to what Rabbi Meir deem obligated? If we say with regard to a firstborn, But doesn’t Rabbi Meir “But the firstborn of an ox” only if it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hoshaya to Rabbah: When you went to stand before Rav Huna, did you ask him: "Rabbi Meir obligates for what? If you say for the firstborn - but Rabbi Meir does not hold 'only the firstborn ox' until it is an ox and its firstborn is an ox?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז, וְלֵית לֵיהּ הָא דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כְּבָשִׂים שֶׁצַּמְרָן קָשֶׁה פְּטוּרִין מֵרֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִגֵּז כְּבָשַׂי יִתְחַמָּם״?
human_translation: Rather, with regard to the first of wool But doesn’t that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Lambs whose fleece is tough are exempt from, the first of wool as it is stated: “And warmed with the fleece of my sheep”
llm_translation: Rather, for the beginning of shearing, and there is not to it that which was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Sheep whose wool is difficult are exempt from the beginning of shearing, as it is stated: "And from the shearing of my sheep they shall warm themselves."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִיחְזֵי אֲנַן, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּרָחֵל שֶׁיָּלְדָה מִין עֵז, וְאָבִיו תַּיִישׁ, וּבְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לְזֶרַע הָאָב לְעִנְיַן אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְזֶרַע הָאָב, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְזֶרַע הָאָב.
human_translation: said to Let us see; what are we dealing with here? with a ewe that gave birth to a goat of sorts and its father a goat. And they disagree one to be concerned with paternity the matter of itself and its offspring As Rabbi Meir holds one to be concerned with its paternity, and the Rabbis hold one not be concerned with its paternity.
llm_translation: He said to him: Let us see, what are we dealing with here? With a case where Rachel gave birth from a goat, and the father is timid, and we are concerned about the father's seed regarding him and his son. Rabbi Meir holds: we are concerned about the father's seed, and the Rabbis hold: we are not concerned about the father's seed.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיפַּלְגוּ בְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין לְזֶרַע הָאָב בְּעָלְמָא, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דַּחֲנַנְיָה וְרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: if that is so, they disagree one to be concerned with paternity in general, of the dispute of Ḥananya and the Rabbis
llm_translation: Thus, they should argue regarding the concern for the seed of the father in the world, in the dispute of Hananiah and the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם לִבְכוֹרָה, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּרָחֵל בַּת רָחֵל בַּת עֵז. מָר סָבַר: זִיל בָּתַר אִימֵּיהּ, וְהַאי לָאו נִדְמֶה הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, actually with regard to a firstborn, and here we are dealing with a ewe born to a ewe born to a goat, Sage, holds: Follow mother and this it not resembles
llm_translation: Rather, always regarding the firstborn, and here with what are we dealing? - with Rachel the daughter of Rachel the daughter of Eiz. Mar thought: Go after her mother, but this is not similar.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: זִיל בָּתַר אִימַּיהּ דְּאִימֵּיהּ, וְהַאי נִדְמֶה הוּא.
human_translation: And Sage, holds: Follow mother of its mother and this it resembles
llm_translation: And Mar said: Go after the mother of your mother, and this is similar to that.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, בְּרָחֵל בַּת עֵז בַּת רָחֵל, מָר סָבַר: חָזְרוּ שֵׂיֻיוֹת לִמְקוֹמָן, וּמָר סָבַר: לֹא חָזְרוּ שֵׂיֻיוֹת לִמְקוֹמָן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say with a ewe born to a goat born to a ewe. Sage, holds: Its ovine nature was restored to its state. And Sage, holds: Its ovine nature was not restored to its state,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the case of Rachel, daughter of Eiz, daughter of Rachel, Master holds: the goats returned to their place, and Master holds: the goats did not return to their place.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מִקְצָת סִימָנִין, וּמַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ דּוֹמֶה לְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: where has some of the characteristics And who are the Rabbis Rabbi Shimon, who says: unless its head and the majority of are similar to its mother.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: For example, if it has some signs, and who are the sages? Rabbi Shimon, who said: Until his head and most of his body resemble his mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשָׂעִיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ דְּבָעֵינַן בֶּן שְׂעִירָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֶחָד״ הַמְיוּחָד וּבָא מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir concedes with regard to the goat of the New Moon that we require son of a female goat. What is the reason? the verse states: one particularly has been since the six days of Creation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Meir acknowledges regarding the goat of Rosh Chodesh that we require a male goat, what is the reason? The verse says: "one" - unique and comes from the six days of Creation.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא — ״שׁוֹר אוֹ כֶשֶׂב״ — פְּרָט לְכִלְאַיִם, ״אוֹ עֵז״ — פְּרָט לְנִדְמֶה.
human_translation: But this derived from here? derived from there: “a bull, or a sheep” to exclude diverse kinds, “or a goat” to exclude resembles
llm_translation: And this question arises from here? It arises from there - "an ox or a sheep" - to exclude hybrids, "or a goat" - to exclude similar cases.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא נְחַת לְדָרֵי, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דִּנְחַת — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי מֵהָכָא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְגַבֵּי קׇרְבַּן חוֹבָה, אֲבָל נְדָבָה — לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary, as, had from there, I would say: That statement where not trace back to generations, but where it does trace back, say: No, And had from here, I would say: That statement with regard to an obligatory offering, but a gift not necessary.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if from there, I would say: these matters where they do not descend to generations, but where they do descend — I would say no. And if from here, I would say: these matters regarding obligatory sacrifices, but voluntary ones — no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים דְּאֵין לוֹקִין עַל צַמְרוֹ מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז״, מָה פִּשְׁתָּן שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה — אַף צֶמֶר שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Yaakov says: Everyone concedes that one is not flogged due to diverse kinds for its wool as it is stated: “You shall not wear diverse kinds, Just as linen that has not changed, so too, wool that has not changed,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ahah bar Yaakov: All agree that one is not liable for wearing linen and wool together, as it is stated: "You shall not wear sha'atnez." Just as flax, which has not changed, so too wool that has not changed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁצַּמְרוֹ פָּסוּל לִתְכֵלֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז... גְּדִילִים תַּעֲשֶׂה לָךְ״, מָה פִּשְׁתָּן שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה — אַף צֶמֶר שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Everyone concedes that wool is unfit to sky-blue wool as it is stated: “You shall not wear diverse kinds…you shall make yourself twisted cords” Just as linen that has not changed, so too, wool that has not changed
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Everyone agrees that wool is invalid for tekhelet, as it is stated: "You shall not wear sha'atnez... You shall make tassels for yourself." Just as linen, which has not changed, so too wool, which has not changed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין צַמְרוֹ מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּבֶגֶד צֶמֶר אוֹ בְּבֶגֶד פִּשְׁתִּים״, מָה פִּשְׁתִּים שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה — אַף צֶמֶר שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: Everyone concedes that its wool does not become ritually impure with marks, as it is stated: in a woolen garment, or a linen garment” Just as linen has not changed, so too, wool that has not changed
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Everyone agrees that wool does not transmit impurity in cases of skin afflictions, as it is stated: "in woolen garments or linen garments." Just as linen that has not changed - so too wool that has not changed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַף אָנוּ נֹאמַר, הִדְלָה הַגֶּפֶן עַל גַּבֵּי תְּאֵינָה — יֵינוֹ פָּסוּל לִנְסָכִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״זֶבַח וּנְסָכִים״ — מָה זֶבַח שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה, אַף נְסָכִים שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנּוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: we can say also one trellised a grapevine over a fig its wine is unfit for libations. What is the reason? “An offering, and libations” Just as an offering that has not changed, so too, libations that were not changed.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: We also say, if the vine has spread over the fig tree - its wine is disqualified for libations. What is the reason? "Sacrifice and libations" - just as a sacrifice that has not changed, so too libations that have not changed.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: הִדְלָה פִּשְׁתָּן עַל גַּבֵּי הִיגָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלִישְׁתַּנֵּי? אִם כֵּן לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ ״מָה פִּשְׁתָּן שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּנָּה״, דְּהָא פִּשְׁתָּן נָמֵי מִשְׁתַּנֵּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זֶה נִשְׁתַּנָּה רֵיחוֹ, וְזֶה לֹא נִשְׁתַּנָּה רֵיחוֹ.
human_translation: Ravina objects to this one trellised flax over a shrub, also a changed if so, you cannot say Just as linen that has not changed, as linen also changes said to this its scent has changed, but that its scent has not changed,
llm_translation: Ravina objects to her: If a flaxen garment is spread over a vessel, is it thus stated that it has not changed? If so, you did not find it stated, "What flaxen garment has not changed," for indeed a flaxen garment does change! He said to her: This one has changed its scent, while this one has not changed its scent.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָחֵל שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים, וְיָצְאוּ שְׁנֵי רָאשֵׁיהֶן כְּאַחַת — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן לַכֹּהֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַזְּכָרִים לַה׳״, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, אֶלָּא אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: a ewe that had not given birth, and it gave birth to two males and both their heads emerged as one, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: Both of them to the priest, as it is stated the males shall be to the Lord” And the Rabbis say: impossible to coincide precisely, Rather, one to and one to the priest.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If Rachel was not recognized and gave birth to two males, and both their heads emerged simultaneously - Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: Both are for the priest, as it is stated: "The males belong to the Lord." But the Sages say: It is impossible to limit the ruling except that one belongs to him the father and one belongs to the priest.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּהֵן בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶת הַיָּפֶה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מְשַׁמְּנִין בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the better Rabbi Akiva says: They assess between them And the second must graze until it becomes blemished,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: The kohen chooses for himself the beautiful one. Rabbi Akiva says: They mix between them, and the second one grazes until it becomes satiated.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב בַּמַּתָּנוֹת, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי פּוֹטֵר. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן — רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And obligated to the gifts And Rabbi Yosei deems exempt one of died, Rabbi Tarfon says: divide Rabbi Akiva says: the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. a male and a female the priest has nothing here.
llm_translation: And obligated in gifts, and Rabbi Yosei exempts. If one of them dies — Rabbi Tarfon says: they should divide, Rabbi Akiva says: the one who brings evidence from his fellow bears the burden of proof. Male and female — here there is nothing for the priest.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְרַבָּנַן — בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, בִּידֵי אָדָם מַאי?
human_translation: They said in the school of Rabbi Yannai: According to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, we heard that he says: possible in the hands of Heaven to coincide precisely, and all the more so in human hands But the Rabbis, impossible in the hands of Heaven to coincide precisely, in human hands, what
llm_translation: Gemara: The house of Rabbi Yannai said: We heard regarding Rabbi Yosei the Galilean that he said, "It is possible to restrict rainfall by the hands of Heaven, and all the more so by the hands of man. And the Rabbis - if it is impossible to restrict rainfall by the hands of Heaven, what about by the hands of man?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חוּט שֶׁל סִיקְרָא חוֹגְרוֹ בָּאֶמְצַע, לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין דָּמִים הָעֶלְיוֹנִים וּבֵין דָּמִים הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם בִּידֵי אָדָם, זִימְנִין דְּקָא יָהֵיב עֶלְיוֹנִים לְמַטָּה וְתַחְתּוֹנִים לְמַעְלָה! דְּמַרְוַוח בָּהּ פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear A red line encircled in the middle, to separate between the blood the upper and the blood the lower And if you say impossible in human hands to coincide precisely, times when puts upper lower and lower above. that one widens a little
llm_translation: Come and hear: a thread of silk, its spinner is in the middle, to distinguish between the upper blood and the lower blood. And if you say, it is impossible for a person to constrict, there are times when the upper is given below and the lower above! For it is spacious in it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִמִּדַּת כֵּלִים, מִמִּדַּת מִזְבֵּחַ. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר עֲבֵיד, וּבְכֹל הֵיכִי דְּמָצֵית לְמִיעְבַּד נִיחָא לֵיהּ, ״הַכֹּל בִּכְתָב מִיַּד ה׳ עָלַי הִשְׂכִּיל״.
human_translation: Come hear from the measurements of vessels from the measurements of altar It is different there, as the Merciful One says: Do and to whatever extent you can fulfill finds favor “All this in writing, as the Lord has made me wise by His hand upon me,
llm_translation: Come and hear: from the law of vessels, from the law of the altar. The difference there is that the Merciful One said to do, and in every way that you find to do it is pleasing to Him, "All this, in writing from the hand of the Lord upon me, He made me understand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: חִלְּקוֹ לִשְׁנַיִם וְהֵן שָׁוִין — שְׁנֵיהֶן טְמֵאִים, לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: שָׁאנֵי כְּלִי חֶרֶס הוֹאִיל וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ גּוּמּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: Come hear one divided into two and they are equal both are ritually impure, because impossible to coincide precisely, Rav Kahana said, An earthenware vessel is different, since it has indentations in it,
llm_translation: Rav Katina said, "Come and hear: If it was divided into two and they are equal - both of them are impure, because it is impossible to diminish." Rav Kahana said: "It is different with an earthenware vessel since it has holes."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִמְצָא מְכוָּּון בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן מְבִיאוֹת שְׁתֵּי עֲגָלוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Come hear was found precisely between two towns, the two bring two heifers the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. What is the reason
llm_translation: Come and hear: It was found situated between two cities, both bringing two calves, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר בִּידֵי אָדָם אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וּקְרוֹבָה — וַאֲפִילּוּ קְרוֹבוֹת?
human_translation: not because holds: in human hands, possible to coincide precisely? And nearest even to nearest
llm_translation: Not because he thought it possible to contract in the hands of man, and it is close - even if they are close?

hebrew_text: לָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר
human_translation: No, Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: Not so, Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּידֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: possible in the hands of Heaven to coincide precisely, and all the more so in human hands.
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: It is possible to restrict in the hands of Heaven, and all the more so in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: נִמְצָא מְכוָּּון בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת — לֹא הָיוּ עוֹרְפִין, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּיהֶן מְבִיאוֹת שְׁתֵּי עֲגָלוֹת. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם?
human_translation: Let us say is subject tanna’im , was found precisely between two towns, they would not break the neck Rabbi Eliezer says: The two bring two heifers What, is it not they disagree with regard to that the first tanna holds impossible to coincide precisely and Rabbi Eliezer holds possible to coincide precisely?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei: nimtza mechuvan bein shtei aiyarot - lo hayu orfin, Rabbi Eliezer omer: shtehem mevi'ot shtei agalot. Mai lav baha kamifalgi, d'tanna kama savar: ei efshar letzamtzem, v'Rabbi Eliezer savar: efshar letzamtzem?" English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita: If one is found equidistant between two cities - they do not turn him back. Rabbi Eliezer says: Both cities bring two calves. What is the reason they do not turn him back? The first Tanna holds: It is impossible to shorten the distance, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: It is possible to shorten the distance."

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרַאּ? אִי קָסָבַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, אַמַּאי לֹא הָיוּ עוֹרְפִים? יָבִיאוּ עֶגְלָה אַחַת בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת, וְיִתְּנוּ!
human_translation: And you understand If the first tanna holds impossible to coincide precisely, why they would not break the neck? them bring one heifer in partnership and stipulate
llm_translation: And was it created? If he holds like the first Tanna, if it is impossible to restrict, why were they not napeless? Let them bring one calf in partnership, and let them give!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וְהָכָא בִּ״קְרוֹבָה״ וְלֹא קְרוֹבוֹת קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: ״קְרוֹבָה״ וְלֹא קְרוֹבוֹת, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: ״קְרוֹבָה״ וַאֲפִילּוּ קְרוֹבוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, with regard to these tanna’im , everyone possible to coincide precisely. And here they disagree nearest [ kerova ]” and not the nearest [ kerovot ] as the first tanna holds “ kerova ” and not kerovot ; and Rabbi Eliezer holds “ kerova ,” even kerovot .
llm_translation: Rather, for those Mishnaic sages of the entire world it is possible to narrow down, and here in this case with "kerovah" and not close relatives did they disagree, for a Tanna in the first part holds: "kerovah" and not close relatives, and Rabbi Eliezer holds: "kerovah" even close relatives.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: תָּנָא נִמְצָא מְכוָּּון בֵּין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּיהֶן מְבִיאוֹת שְׁתֵּי עֲגָלוֹת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיאוּ עֶגְלָה אַחַת בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת וְיַתְנוּ.
human_translation: What was about Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rav Amram says: taught was found precisely between two towns, Rabbi Eliezer says: The two bring two heifers and the Rabbis say: They bring one heifer in partnership and stipulate
llm_translation: What is the law regarding it? Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said in the name of Rav Amram: It was taught in a baraita: If a corpse is found equidistant between two cities, Rabbi Eliezer says: Both cities should bring a calf each, and the Sages say: They should bring one calf together and give it.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן? אִי קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וּקְרוֹבָה — וַאֲפִילּוּ קְרוֹבוֹת, לַיְיתֵי תַּרְתֵּי! וְאִי ״קְרוֹבָה״ וְלֹא קְרוֹבוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָא לָא לַיְיתֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּידֵי אָדָם. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What do the Rabbis hold If the Rabbis hold that possible in human hands to coincide precisely, and “ kerova ” even kerovot , they should bring two And if “ kerova ” But not kerovot , they should not bring even one Rather, not conclude from the Rabbis hold: impossible to coincide precisely, and even in human hands? conclude from it
llm_translation: What do the Rabbis hold? If the Rabbis hold that it is possible to narrow down, and it is close - even if it is close, let it bring two! And if "close" and not "closeness," even one should not bring! Rather, do the Rabbis hold that it is impossible to narrow down, even in the hands of a person. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶת הַיָּפֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן? קָא סָבַר: הָהוּא דְּבָרִיא נָפֵק בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the better What is the reasoning of Rabbi Tarfon? He holds the healthier emerged first,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: One selects for himself the beautiful. What is the reason for Rabbi Tarfon's statement? He holds: The matter of health comes first.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״מְשַׁמְּנִין״ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּהֵן נוֹטֵל כְּחוּשָׁה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהָא אֲנַן ״מְשַׁמְּנִין בֵּינֵיהֶן״ תְּנַן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד דַּאֲכַלְתְּ כַּפְנְיָיתָא בְּבָבֶל, תַּרְגֵּימְנָא מִסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: They assess Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the priest takes the leaner Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: But didn’t we learn they assess between them, said to him: While you were eating dates in Babylonia, we explained it on the latter clause
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Meshamnin" etc. Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: The priest takes with caution. Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yohanan: But don't we learn "Meshamnin between them" in the Mishnah? He said to him: Until you eat a palmful in Babylon, I will explain it from the end.

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״מְשַׁמְּנִין בֵּינֵיהֶן״ דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי פְּלִיגִי, הָכִי נָמֵי (לִיפַּלְגִי) [לִיפְלוֹג] גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי! אֶלָּא מַאי ״מְשַׁמְּנִין״ — שׁוֹמֶן יְהֵא בֵּינֵיהֶן, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דִּבְכוֹר הוּא וּשְׁקֹיל.
human_translation: As the latter clause teaches: one of died, Rabbi Tarfon says: divide Rabbi Akiva says: the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. And if it enters your mind they assess that they divide between them, too, let them divide between them Rather, what does: They assess [ meshammenin ] fat [ shumman ] will be between them, as says to the priest: Bring a proof that is the firstborn, and take it.
llm_translation: The latter clause teaches: If one of them dies, Rabbi Tarfon says: they should divide the estate; Rabbi Akiva says: the one who brings proof against his fellow has the burden of proof. And if you should suggest, "they should divide," for when they argue with each other, they should divide concerning each other! Rather, what is "they should divide" - oil should be between them, for he says to the priest: Bring proof that he is the firstborn and take.

hebrew_text: וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְחַיָּיב בְּמַתָּנוֹת, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי פּוֹטֵר. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹאִיל וְכֹהֵן בָּא עָלָיו מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּכוֹר הוּא — כּוּלֵּיהּ דִּידִי הוּא, אִי לָא בְּכוֹר הוּא — הַב לִי מַתָּנוֹת מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And the second must graze until it becomes blemished, and obligated to the gifts and Rabbi Yosei deems exempt What is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: since the priest comes upon him from two sides, as says to him: If is firstborn, it is mine entirety, and if it is not firstborn, give me the gifts from it.
llm_translation: The second one shall graze until it becomes blemished, and is obligated in gifts, and Rabbi Yosei exempts. What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Rabbi Yochanan said: Since the priest comes from both sides to him, saying to him: If he is a firstborn — he is all mine, if he is not a firstborn — give me his gifts.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רָבָא: עָשׂוּ שֶׁאֵינוֹ זוֹכֶה כְּזוֹכֶה, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מְטָא לִידֵיהּ כְּמַאן דִּמְטָא לִידֵיהּ, וְזַבְּנֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמוּמֵיהּ.
human_translation: And what is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, Rava says: rendered one who did not acquire like one who acquired And even though did not enter possession, as it entered possession and he sold it to the Israelite in its blemished
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, what is the reason? Rava said: They did the act that one who is not meritorious like one who is meritorious, and even though it did not come into his hands like one who it came into his hands, and they sold it to a Jew with its blemishes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּסְפֵק בְּכוֹר, שֶׁאֵין חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן, שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּמַתָּנוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Everyone concedes uncertain firstborn replacement is not in the possession of the priest, that it is obligated to gifts
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Everyone agrees in a case of doubt regarding the firstborn, that there is no exchange in the hand of the Kohen, as he is obligated in gifts.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים מַאן? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? פְּשִׁיטָא! עַד כָּאן לָא קָא פָטַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָתָם, אֶלָּא דַּחֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן, דְּעָשׂוּ שֶׁאֵינוֹ זוֹכֶה כְּזוֹכֶה, אֲבָל אֵין חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן — לָא!
human_translation: everyone concedes, whom Rabbi Yosei? obvious. Rabbi Yosei deemed exempt only there, where the replacement is in the possession of the priest, as rendered one who did not acquire like one who acquired But the replacement is not in the possession of the priest, not
llm_translation: All agree who? Rabbi Yosei? Obviously! Until here, Rabbi Yosei did not exempt there, rather they exchange in the hand of a priest, for they did something that one does not acquire like one acquires, but they do not exchange in the hand of a priest - no!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּקָסָבַר דְּאִי מְחַיְּיבַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנוֹת — אָתֵי לֵיהּ לִידֵי גִּיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵין חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say reason Rabbi Yosei that he holds that if you deem him obligated in the gifts, he come to shearing and labor. even though there is no replacement in the hands of the priest, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason you might say: The reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, who holds that if she is obligated to him in gifts, she is also subject to divorce and levirate marriage, even though there are no exchanges in the hand of a priest, he informs us.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ הָכִי? וְהָתָנֵי סֵיפָא, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: And how can you say this? But doesn’t the latter clause teach: As Rabbi Yosei says:
llm_translation: And who found that you said so? And it was taught in the latter part: Rabbi Yosei used to say:

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלִיפָיו בְּיַד כֹּהֵן פָּטוּר מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב. חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן — אִין, אֵין חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן — לָא!
human_translation: any whose replacements in the possession of the priest, is exempt from the gifts, and Rabbi Meir deems obligated replacement is in the possession of the priest, yes, replacement is not in the possession of the priest, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kol she'chalifav b'yad kohen patur min ha'matanot, v'Rabbi Meir me'chayev. Chalifin b'yad kohen - ein, ein chalifin b'yad kohen - la!" English translation: "Anyone whose substitutions are done by a Kohen's hand is exempt from the gifts, and Rabbi Meir obligates. Substitutions by a Kohen's hand - no, no substitutions by a Kohen's hand - yes!"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ — לְדִידִי, אֲפִילּוּ אֵין חֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן, דְּאִי מְחַיְּיבַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנוֹת אָתֵי לֵיהּ לִידֵי גִּיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה; לְדִידָךְ, אוֹדִי לִי מִיהָא הֵיכָא דַּחֲלִיפִין בְּיַד כֹּהֵן, דְּעָשׂוּ שֶׁאֵינוֹ זוֹכֶה כְּזוֹכֶה; וְאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לָא.
human_translation: lest you say Rabbi Yosei stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Meir, In my even replacement is not in the possession of the priest, as, if you deem him obligated in the gifts, come to shearing and labor. according to your at least concede to me where the replacement is in the possession of the priest, that rendered one who did not acquire like one who acquired And Rabbi Meir said to No,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabbi Yosei, according to the words of Rabbi Meir, is saying to him - according to my opinion, even if there are no exchanges in the hand of the priest, for if it obligates him in gifts, it will come to the matter of shearing and labor; according to your opinion, I will admit to you from there where exchanges are in the hand of the priest, for they did it that he is not successful like one who is successful; and Rabbi Meir said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּסְפֵק מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁפָּטוּר מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת. ״הַכֹּל מוֹדִים״ — מַאן? רַבִּי מֵאִיר? פְּשִׁיטָא! עַד כָּאן לָא קָמְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם אֶלָּא בִּסְפֵק בְּכוֹר, הוֹאִיל וּבָא עָלָיו כֹּהֵן מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין, אֲבָל סָפֵק מַעֲשֵׂר — לָא.
human_translation: And Rav Pappa says Everyone concedes of tithe uncertain that is exempt from the gifts. everyone concedes, whom Rabbi Meir? obvious. Rabbi Meir deemed obligated only there, of firstborn uncertain, since comes upon from two sides. But tithe uncertain not
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said: Everyone agrees regarding a doubtful tithe that one is exempt from the gifts. "Everyone agrees" - who? Rabbi Meir? Obviously! Until here Rabbi Meir was not obligated there except in the case of a doubtful firstborn, since a priest came upon it from both sides, but in the case of a doubtful tithe - no.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּלֹא תִּשְׁתַּכַּח תּוֹרַת מַתָּנוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ סְפֵק מַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say reason that Rabbi Meir that the category of the gifts should not be forgotten; even tithe uncertain. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? The reason of Rabbi Meir is that the Torah of gifts should not be forgotten, even in the case of doubtful tithes? This is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ הָכִי? וְהָקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלִיפָיו בְּיַד כֹּהֵן — פָּטוּר מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב!
human_translation: And how can you say this? But doesn’t the latter clause teach: As Rabbi Yosei says: any whose replacements are in the possession of a priest, is exempt from the gifts, and Rabbi Meir deems obligated
llm_translation: And who found that you said so? And the later authorities taught, that Rabbi Yosei used to say: Anyone who substitutes it with the hand of a priest - exempt from the gifts, and Rabbi Meir obligates!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲפִילּוּ סְפֵק מַעֲשֵׂר מְחַיַּיב, וְהָא דְּמִיפַּלְגִי בַּחֲלִיפִין — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּפָטַר אֲפִילּוּ הֵיכָא דְּכֹהֵן בָּא עָלָיו מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say: Rabbi Meir deems obligated tithe uncertain, And that disagreement with regard to replacement to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yosei, who deems exempt even where comes upon from two sides. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabbi Meir even in a case of doubt regarding tithes is liable, and this that he disputes in the case of exchanges - to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yosei, who exempted even in a case where a priest comes upon him from two sides, he teaches us.

hebrew_text: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ. אַמַּאי יַחְלוֹקוּ? נִיחְזֵי: אִי שָׁמֵן מִית — דְּכֹהֵן הוּא, וְהַאי דְּאִיכָּא דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת; וְאִי כָּחוּשׁ מִית — דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת מִית, וְהַאי דְּאִיכָּא דְּכֹהֵן הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: חָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: one of died, Rabbi Tarfon says: divide Why divide Let us see: if fatter died that it to the priest, and this that is to the owner. And if the leaner died, of the owner died, and this that is to the priest. Ami said: Rabbi Tarfon retracted
llm_translation: One of them dies, Rabbi Tarfon says: they should divide. Why should they divide? It is logical: if the deceased is a priest, and the surviving one is the homeowner; and if the deceased is the homeowner, the homeowner dies, and the surviving one is a priest! Rabbi Ammi said: Rabbi Tarfon retracted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִשְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה, שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ רוֹעֶה בֵּינֵיהֶם וּמִסְתַּלֵּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. Rabbi Ḥiyya stated a parable of Rabbi Tarfon, To what is this matter comparable? to two who deposited with a shepherd that shepherd places between them and withdraws,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: One who takes out from his fellow, the responsibility is upon him. Rabbi Hiyya said: What is the matter comparable to? To two people who deposited by a shepherd, who leaves the shepherd between them and departs.

hebrew_text: וּמָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאֶחָד שֶׁהִפְקִיד אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, שֶׁהַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: And a parable of Rabbi Akiva: To what is this matter comparable? to one who deposited with a homeowner, that the burden of proof rests upon the claimant.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a parable of Rabbi Akiva: What is this matter similar to? To one who deposited by the homeowner, who brings proof against his fellow upon him the appearance. English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא פְּלִיג בִּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה, שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ רוֹעֶה וּמִסְתַּלֵּק? וְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן פְּלִיג בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהִפְקִיד אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת? אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה — שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ רוֹעֶה בֵּינֵיהֶם וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, וּבְאֶחָד שֶׁהִפְקִיד אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — שֶׁהַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
