human_translation: But with regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Akiva disagree of two who deposited with a shepherd, that shepherd places and withdraws? And Rabbi Tarfon disagree of one who deposited with a homeowner Rava says, and some say Rav Pappa Everyone concedes of two who deposited with a shepherd that shepherd places between them and withdraws, and of one who deposited with a homeowner that the burden of proof rests upon the claimant.
llm_translation: Rather, with what do they argue? Rabbi Akiva argues regarding two people who appointed someone by a shepherd, who leaves the shepherd and departs? And Rabbi Tarfon argues regarding one person who appointed by the homeowner? Rava said, and it is stated by Rav Papa: Everyone agrees regarding two people who appointed someone by a shepherd — who leaves the shepherd among them and departs, and regarding one person who appointed by the homeowner — the burden of proof is upon him who brings a claim against his fellow.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בַּחֲצַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְרוֹעֶה כֹּהֵן. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן סָבַר: אַקְנוֹיֵי קָא מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ בַּחֲצֵירוֹ, וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיתְעֲבִיד מִצְוָה, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה, שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ רוֹעֶה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק.
human_translation: disagree only in the courtyard of the homeowner, and shepherd is a priest Rabbi Tarfon holds: transfers to of his courtyard suitable for him that mitzva should be performed. And this is to two who deposited with a shepherd where shepherd places between them and withdraws,
llm_translation: They only argued regarding the courtyard of the homeowner, and the shepherd-priest. Rabbi Tarfon holds: The acquisitions he acquires for him in his courtyard, and it is preferable for him not to perform a mitzvah, and it will be like two that were entrusted to a shepherd, who places the shepherd between them and departs.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא — לָא מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ מִידַּעַם, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּאֶחָד שֶׁהִפְקִיד אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, שֶׁהַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds: Since there is a loss he does not transfer anything And is to one who deposited with a homeowner that the burden of proof rests upon the claimant.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: Since he has a loss — he does not acquire it from their knowledge, and it is to him like one who has deposited with the homeowner, for the one who brings forth from his fellow upon him the proof.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי רְחֵילָיו שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרוּ וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — שְׁנֵיהֶם לַכֹּהֵן. זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — הַזָּכָר לַכֹּהֵן. שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבָה — אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּהֵן בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶת הַיָּפֶה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מְשַׁמְּנִין בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב.
human_translation: one’s two ewes had not given birth and they gave birth to two males, both of them to the priest, a male and a female, the male to the priest, two males and a female, one by him and one to the priest. Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the better Rabbi Akiva says: They assess between them, And the second graze until it becomes blemished,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man marries two women who are not recognized, and they both give birth to male children - both children belong to the priest. If one is male and one is female - the male belongs to the priest. If there are two male children and one female - one belongs to him and one to the priest. Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the more beautiful one for himself. Rabbi Akiva says: They should draw lots between them, and the second one should graze until it becomes blemished.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב בַּמַּתָּנוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי פּוֹטֵר. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת וְזָכָר אוֹ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּשְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And obligated to gifts Rabbi Yosei deems exempt one of died, Rabbi Tarfon says: divide Rabbi Akiva says: the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. two females and a male or two males and two females, the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: And obligated in gifts, Rabbi Yosei exempts. If one of them dies, Rabbi Tarfon says: they should divide, Rabbi Akiva says: the one who brings evidence from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him. Two females and one male, or two males and two females - here the priest has nothing.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בִּיכְּרָה, וְאַחַת לֹא בִּיכְּרָה, וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים, אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לַכֹּהֵן. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּהֵן בּוֹרֵר אֶת הַיָּפֶה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מְשַׁמְּנִין בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב.
human_translation: one had given birth and one had not given birth, and they gave birth to two males, one by him and one to the priest. Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the better Rabbi Akiva says: They assess between them And the second graze until it becomes blemished,
llm_translation: One in the city, and one not in the city, and she gave birth to two males, one for him and one for the priest. Rabbi Tarfon says: The priest chooses the more beautiful one. Rabbi Akiva says: We apply a partition between them, and the second one grazes until it grows a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב בַּמַּתָּנוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלִיפָיו בְּיַד כֹּהֵן פָּטוּר מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And is obligated to gifts Rabbi Yosei deems exempt as Rabbi Yosei says: any whose replacements are in the possession of a priest, is exempt from the gifts. And Rabbi Meir deems obligated one of died, Rabbi Tarfon says: divide Rabbi Akiva says: the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. a male and a female the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: "And obligated in gifts. Rabbi Yosei exempts, for Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone whose exchange was done by a Kohen's hand is exempt from gifts. And Rabbi Meir obligates. If one of them dies, Rabbi Tarfon says: They should divide. Rabbi Akiva says: One who produces evidence from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him. Male and female - here the Kohen has no responsibility."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דִּתְרֵי מֵחֲדָא.
human_translation: necessary as, had taught the first Rabbi Akiva stated in that as two from one
llm_translation: Gemara needs, for if we would hear in front, in that Rabbi Akiva said, that two from one.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל רְחֵילָיו שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרוּ, דִּתְרֵי מֵחֲדָא וְחַד מֵחֲדָא — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, דְּהָךְ דִּילִידָא חַד שְׁבִיחַ טְפֵי.
human_translation: But his two ewes had not given birth where two from one and one from one say concedes to of Rabbi Tarfon, that superior this that gave birth to a single
llm_translation: But his footprints that were not recognized, two from one and one from one - say we should agree with Rabbi Tarfon, for the one who created one created two.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ לֹא בִּיכְּרוּ, אֲבָל אַחַת בִּיכְּרָה וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן,
human_translation: And had taught that Rabbi Akiva stated in that as both had not given birth. But one had given birth and one had not given birth, and gave birth to two male say concedes to
llm_translation: And if we would hear this - in that case Rabbi Akiva said, that both of them are not recognized, but if one is recognized and one is not recognized, and they gave birth to two males - let Rabbi Tarfon agree with him.

hebrew_text: דְּהָךְ דְּלָא בִּיכְּרָה שְׁבִיחַ טְפֵי צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: that this that had not given birth is superior. necessary
llm_translation: The one who does not recognize the value of a dish, needs a lot of seasoning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן וְהַבָּא אַחֲרָיו, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶם יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן לַבְּעָלִים. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵיהֶן אֵינָן בְּכוֹר, הָרִאשׁוֹן — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינוֹ ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״, וְהַשֵּׁנִי — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדָמוֹ אַחֵר.
human_translation: born by caesarean section and that follows it, Rabbi Tarfon says: Both of them must graze until they become unfit, and they may be eaten in their blemished by their owner. Rabbi Akiva says: Neither of them is firstborn; the first because it is not that opens the womb and the second because other preceded it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: if the firstborn emerges breach first, and the one that follows after him, Rabbi Tarfon says: both should graze until they develop a blemish, and then they should be eaten by their owners. Rabbi Akiva says: neither of them is considered a firstborn, the first one - because it is not "the opener of the womb," and the second one - because another one preceded him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ: בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד, אִי הָוֵי בְּכוֹר אִי לָא הָוֵי בְּכוֹר, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ: בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד לָא הָוֵי בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rabbi Tarfon is uncertain a firstborn in one aspect, whether it is firstborn or whether it is not a firstborn. And obvious to Rabbi Akiva a firstborn in one aspect is not a firstborn.
llm_translation: Gemara: With what issue do they disagree? Rabbi Tarfon is uncertain about it: If a firstborn applies to one matter, then whether it is a firstborn or not is uncertain. And Rabbi Akiva is clear about it: If a firstborn applies to one matter, then it is not a firstborn.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִכְּלָל הַצָּרִיךְ לִפְרָט וּמִפְּרָט הַצָּרִיךְ לִכְלָל, כֵּיצַד? ״קַדֶּשׁ לִי כׇל בְּכוֹר״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ נְקֵבָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״זָכָר״.
human_translation: the Sages taught From a generalization that requires a detail, and from a detail that requires a generalization. How so? “Sanctify to Me all the firstborn,” might even a female is included the verse states male
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From a general statement, one must derive specifics, and from specifics, one must derive the general statement. How so? "Sanctify to Me every firstborn," could it include even a female? The Torah teaches: "male."

hebrew_text: אִי ״זָכָר״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ יָצְתָה נְקֵבָה לְפָנָיו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״. אִי ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ יָצָא אַחַר יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכוֹר״.
human_translation: had male,” might even a female emerged before it. the verse states: “That which opens womb,” had “That which opens womb,” might even emerged after born by caesarean section the verse states: firstborn,”
llm_translation: If "male," could even a female have preceded him? The Scripture teaches: "opening of the womb." If "opening of the womb," could even one born after a miscarriage precede him? The Scripture teaches: "firstborn."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא לְאַבָּיֵי: רֵישָׁא לָא קָנָסֵיב לַהּ תַּלְמוּדָא ״בְּכוֹר״, אַלְמָא בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד הָוֵי בְּכוֹר. סֵיפָא קָנָסֵיב לַהּ תַּלְמוּדָא ״בְּכוֹר״, אַלְמָא בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד לָא הָוֵי בְּכוֹר!
human_translation: Rav Sherevya said to Abaye: the first clause, the baraita does not cite “firstborn” Apparently, a firstborn in one aspect is a firstborn, the last clause, the baraita does cite “firstborn” Apparently, a firstborn in one aspect is not a firstborn.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sheravya to Abbaye: The beginning did not acquire for it the Talmud "bechor," implying that a firstborn is for one thing a firstborn. The end acquired for it the Talmud "bechor," implying that a firstborn is not for one thing a firstborn!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְעוֹלָם בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד לָא הָוֵי בְּכוֹר, וְרֵישָׁא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי זָכָר, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״.
human_translation: said to Actually, a firstborn in one aspect is not a firstborn, and this the first clause is saying: Had male,” might even born by caesarean section the verse states: “That which opens womb,”
llm_translation: He said to him: Always a firstborn for one thing is not a firstborn, and the beginning is thus saying: If male, can even be a twin? Scripture says "the opening of the womb."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד הָוֵי בְּכוֹר, וְסֵיפָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יָצָא אַחֵר יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן קָדוֹשׁ, ״בְּכוֹר״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Ravina said Actually, a firstborn in one aspect is a firstborn, And this the last clause is saying: If it enters your mind emerged after born by caesarean section is sanctified, why do I “firstborn” that the Merciful One wrote?
llm_translation: Ravinah said: Always, firstborn for one thing be firstborn, and the end of the statement thus he said: If it enters your mind, another comes out similar to holy, "firstborn" that the Merciful One wrote, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אִי לְמַעוֹטֵי הֵיכָא דְּיָצְתָה נְקֵבָה לְפָנָיו — מִ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״ נָפְקָא! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״בְּכוֹר״ לְמַעוֹטֵי הֵיכָא דְּיוֹצֵא אַחַר יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן.
human_translation: If to exclude where a female emerged before it, is derived from “that which opens womb.” Rather, conclude from it “firstborn” to exclude where emerged after born by caesarean section.
llm_translation: If for the purpose of exclusion, where a female came before him - "from the opening of the womb" is derived! Rather, understand from it "firstborn" for the purpose of exclusion, where one who comes after the one who comes out first.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד הָוֵי בְּכוֹר, תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּיָצָא זָכָר יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן וְזָכָר דֶּרֶךְ רֶחֶם, דְּלָא קָדוֹשׁ, דְּאִימַּעוּט לֵידָה מִ״בְּכוֹר״, דִּבְכוֹר לִרְחָמִים אִיכָּא, בְּכוֹר לִזְכָרִים לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: If it enters your mind a firstborn in one aspect is a firstborn works out well where a male emerged by caesarean section and male through the womb. that it is not sanctified, as birth is excluded by “firstborn,” as it is firstborn of the womb, it is not firstborn of the males.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha from Difti to Ravina: If your intention is for one matter to be considered a firstborn, let it be where a male emerges, whether it is a male that comes out in the normal way or a male that comes out through the side, for it is not holy, so as to avoid the issue of "firstborn." For in the case of a firstborn related to mercy, there is a place, but there is no place for a firstborn related to males.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּיָצְתָה נְקֵבָה דֶּרֶךְ דּוֹפֶן וְזָכָר דֶּרֶךְ רֶחֶם — לִיקְדַּשׁ, דְּהָא אִיכָּא בְּכוֹר לִזְכָרִים וּבְכוֹר לְרֶחֶם! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: But where a female emerged by caesarean section and a male through the womb, let it be sanctified, as it is firstborn of the males and firstborn of the womb. Rather, it is clear in accordance with Abaye,
llm_translation: Rather, here where a female is born in the manner of a male and a male in the manner of a female — they are fit to be sanctified, for there is a firstborn for males and a firstborn for females! Rather, it is a matter of the womb, as Abaye said.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַלּוֹקֵחַ עוּבַּר פָּרָתוֹ.
llm_translation: The one who acquires the fetus of his cow, we will return to you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה מִן הַגּוֹי, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אִם בִּיכְּרָה אִם לֹא בִּיכְּרָה. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: עֵז בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — סָפֵק. רָחֵל בַּת שְׁתַּיִם — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — סָפֵק. פָּרָה וַחֲמוֹר בְּנוֹת שָׁלֹשׁ — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — סָפֵק.
human_translation: one who purchases animal from a gentile and does not know whether it had given birth whether it had not given birth, Rabbi Yishmael says: a goat within its first year certainly to the priest, From that forward, uncertain. a ewe within its second year certainly to the priest; from that forward uncertain. a cow or a donkey within its third year certainly to the priest; from that forward uncertain.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who purchases an animal from a non-Jew, and does not know whether it is pregnant or not pregnant. Rabbi Yishmael says: If it is a goat that is one year old - it is definitely for the Kohen; from here on - it is uncertain. If it is a sheep that is two years old - it is definitely for the Kohen; from here on - it is uncertain. If it is a cow or a donkey that is three years old - it is definitely for the Kohen; from here on - it is uncertain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִילּוּ בְּוָולָד בִּלְבַד הַבְּהֵמָה נִפְטֶרֶת כִּדְבָרֶיךָ, אֶלָּא אָמְרוּ: סִימָן הַוָּולָד בִּבְהֵמָה דַּקָּה — טִינּוּף, וּבַגַּסָּה — שִׁילְיָא, וּבָאִשָּׁה — שָׁפִיר וְשִׁילְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: Were an animal exempted only by an offspring in accordance with your statement. But said: An indication of the offspring in a small animal a murky discharge in a large an afterbirth, and in a woman a fetal sac or an afterbirth.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: If only by the womb alone the animal would be exempt as you say, but they said: A sign that the offspring is from an animal that is thin - it is a miscarriage, and from a fat one - it is a stillbirth, and from a woman - it is beautiful and a stillbirth.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיָּדוּעַ שֶׁבִּיכְּרָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם, וְכֹל שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה — הֲרֵי זֶה לַכֹּהֵן, וְאִם סָפֵק — יֵאָכֵל בְּמוּמוֹ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: this is the principle: any where it is known that had given birth, the priest has nothing here. And any where it is known that had not given birth, that to the priest. And if it is uncertain, it may be eaten in its blemished by the owner.
llm_translation: This is the principle: anyone known to be from the womb - there is nothing here for the priest, and anyone not from the womb - this is for the priest, and if there is doubt - he may eat with his blemish for the owners.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ, אַמַּאי סָפֵק? הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב בְּהֵמוֹת, וְרוֹב בְּהֵמוֹת מִתְעַבְּרוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָן נִינְהוּ, וְהָא וַדַּאי מֵילָד אוֹלֵיד! לֵימָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא?
human_translation: From that forward, why is it uncertainty? follow the majority of animals, and the majority of animals are impregnated and give birth within their year, this certainly gave birth. Shall we say Rabbi Yishmael holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who one must be concerned for the minority,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From here and onwards, why is it a doubt? Follow the majority of animals, and most animals are impregnated and give birth within their year, and this one certainly gave birth or will give birth! Let us say Rabbi Yishmael agrees with Rabbi Meir, that he is concerned about the minority?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כִּי אָזְלִי בָּתַר רוּבָּא בְּרוּבָּא דְּאִיתֵיהּ קַמַּן, כְּגוֹן תֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת וְסַנְהֶדְרִין, אֲבָל רוּבָּא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ קַמַּן — לָא אָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא.
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis. When follow the majority, of an evident majority, For example, nine stores And the Sanhedrin But a non-evident majority, the Rabbis do not follow the majority.
llm_translation: Even if you say the sages, when they go after the majority in the majority that is before them, such as nine stores and courts, but the majority that is not before them, the sages do not go after the majority.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה, דְּרוּבָּא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ קַמַּן, וְקָאָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא, דִּתְנַן: קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יָפֶה אָמַרְתָּ שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְצִין, ״אִישׁ״ כָּתוּב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וּמַקְּשִׁינַן אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ.
human_translation: But a male minor or a female minor is upon a non-evident majority, and the Rabbis follow the majority As we learned A male minor or a female minor may not perform the ritual through which a yavam frees a yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ], nor enter into levirate marriage; the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to You have aptly stated that they may not perform ḥalitza , “man,” is written in the section we juxtapose the woman to the man
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the case of a minor male and a minor female, where there is no adult male before them, and the Rabbis are going after the majority of the male, as we learned: A minor male and a minor female do not perform chalitzah nor do they perform levirate marriage, the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to him: You have said well that they do not perform chalitzah, for 'man' is written in the portion, and we connect a woman to a man."

hebrew_text: מָה טַעַם אֵין מְיַיבְּמִין? אָמַר לָהֶם: קָטָן — שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא סָרִיס, קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּמָּצֵא אַיְילוֹנִית, וְנִמְצְאוּ פּוֹגְעִין בְּעֶרְוָה.
human_translation: what is the reason they may not enter into levirate marriage, said to them: a male minor lest he is found a eunuch, a female minor lest she is found a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ], and they be found encountered a forbidden relative
llm_translation: What is the reason that we do not perform levirate marriage? He said to them: A minor - lest he be found to be a eunuch, a minor girl - lest she be found to be a hermaphrodite, and they will be engaging in forbidden relations.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא קְטַנִּים, וְרוֹב קְטַנִּים לָאו סָרִיסִים נִינְהוּ; זִיל בָּתַר קְטַנּוֹת, וְרוֹב קְטַנּוֹת לָאו אַיְילוֹנִית נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: And the Rabbis Follow the majority of male minors, and most male minors are not eunuchs; follow the majority of female minors, and most female minors are not sexually underdeveloped women.
llm_translation: The scholars, go after the majority of the young, and most young are not eunuchs; go after the majority of the young girls, and most young girls are not sterile!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rather, Rava says:
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said:

hebrew_text: מְחַוַּורְתָּא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא.
human_translation: It is clear, Rabbi Yishmael in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who one must be concerned for the minority.
llm_translation: The interpretation of Rabbi Yishmael is like that of Rabbi Meir, he is likely to be concerned about the minority opinion.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כִּי אָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא — בְּרוּבָּא דְּלָא תְּלֵי בְּמַעֲשֶׂה, אֲבָל רוּבָּא דִּתְלֵי בְּמַעֲשֶׂה — לָא.
human_translation: Ravina says: You even say the Rabbis. When the Rabbis follow the majority, with regard to a majority that is not dependent upon an action But a majority that is dependent upon an action, not
llm_translation: Ravina said: Even if you say they are scholars, when scholars go after the majority, in a majority that does not involve action, but in a majority that does involve action - no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֵז בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִיכָּן וּלְהַלָּן — סָפֵק. רָחֵל בַּת שְׁתַּיִם — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִיכָּן וּלְהַלָּן — סָפֵק. פָּרָה בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ — וַדַּאי לַכֹּהֵן, מִיכָּן וּלְהַלָּן — סָפֵק. חֲמוֹרָה — כְּפָרָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֲמוֹרָה בַּת אַרְבַּע שָׁנִים. עַד כָּאן דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: The Sages taught a goat within its first year certainly to the priest; from that forward uncertain. a ewe within its second year certainly to the priest; from that forward uncertain. a cow within its third year certainly to the priest; from that forward uncertain. a donkey as a cow. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a donkey within its fourth year Until here is the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A goat in its first year - certainly for the priest, here and there - uncertain. A ewe in its second year - certainly for the priest, here and there - uncertain. A cow in its third year - certainly for the priest, here and there - uncertain. A donkey - like a cow. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A donkey in its fourth year. Up to this point are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁנֶּאְמְרוּ דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר לָהֶן: צְאוּ אִמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: טָעִיתָ! אִילּוּ בְּוָולָד בִּלְבַד הַבְּהֵמָה נִפְטֶרֶת — הָיָה כִּדְבָרֶיךָ, אֶלָּא סִימַן הַוָּולָד בִּבְהֵמָה דַּקָּה — טִינּוּף, וּבַגַּסָּה — שִׁלְיָא, וּבָאִשָּׁה — שָׁפִיר וְשִׁלְיָא.
human_translation: When these matters were stated before Rabbi Yehoshua, he said to them: Go out say to Rabbi Yishmael: You erred. Were an animal exempted only by an offspring in accordance with your statement. But An indication of the offspring in a small animal a murky discharge And in a large an afterbirth, and in a woman a fetal sac or an afterbirth.
llm_translation: When they said words before Rabbi Yehoshua, he said to them: Go, say to Rabbi Yishmael: You have erred! If only with the fetus alone the animal would be exempt — it would be according to your words, but a sign of a thin fetus in an animal is a miscarriage, and in a fat one — a stillbirth, and in a woman — beauty and stillbirth.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנִי אֵין אֲנִי אוֹמֵר כֵּן, אֶלָּא: עֵז שֶׁטִּינְּפָה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה — יוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ, רָחֵל שֶׁטִּינְּפָה בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ — יוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁתַּיִם. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲנִי לֹא בָּאתִי לִידֵי מִדָּה זוֹ, אֶלָּא: כֹּל שֶׁיָּדוּעַ שֶׁבִּיכְּרָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם, וְכֹל שֶׁלֹּא בִּיכְּרָה — הֲרֵי זוֹ לַכֹּהֵן, סָפֵק — יֵאָכֵל בְּמוּמוֹ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: but I myself do not say so. Rather, a goat that expelled a murky discharge at six give birth within its first year, a ewe that expelled a murky discharge in its first year give birth within its second year. Rabbi Akiva says: I have not arrived at this method Rather, any where it is known that had given birth, the priest has nothing here. And any where it is known that had not given birth, that to the priest. And if it is uncertain, it may be eaten in its blemished by the owner.
llm_translation: I, however, do not say so, but: a goat that miscarried at six months - gives birth within its year, a ewe that miscarried at its year - gives birth within two. Rabbi Akiva said: I did not come to this measure, but: anyone known to be from the priestly family - the priest has no claim here, and anyone not known to be from the priestly family - this one belongs to the priest, in a doubtful case - it may be eaten with its blemish by the owners.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? לֵימָא בְּטִינּוּף פּוֹטֵר קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר טִינּוּף אֵינוֹ פּוֹטֵר, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר טִינּוּף פּוֹטֵר?
human_translation: With regard to what do Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Yehoshua disagree? Shall we say they disagree with regard to a murky discharge exempts Rabbi Yishmael holds a murky discharge does not exempt and Rabbi Yehoshua holds a murky discharge exempts
llm_translation: With what do Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Yehoshua disagree? Let us say, with regard to "tinuf" (a type of impurity) - Rabbi Yishmael holds that tinuf does not exempt, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds that tinuf does exempt.

hebrew_text: אִי דַּחֲזֵינָא דְּטַינִּוף — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּטִינּוּף פּוֹטֵר, וְהָכָא בְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין לְטִינּוּף קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְטִינּוּף, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְטִינּוּף.
human_translation: If we see a murky discharge, everyone agrees that murky discharge exempts And here, it is one is concerned a murky discharge that they disagree. Rabbi Yishmael holds we are not concerned about a murky discharge, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds one is concerned about a murky discharge,
llm_translation: If we see that the city of Tinnuf - everyone does not argue that Tinnuf exempts, and here we are concerned about Tinnuf, they are arguing: Rabbi Yishmael holds: we are not concerned about Tinnuf, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds: we are concerned about Tinnuf.

hebrew_text: וְלָא חָיֵישׁ? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: מְחַוַּורְתָּא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּט! כִּי חָיֵישׁ — לְחוּמְרָא, לְקוּלָּא — לָא חָיֵישׁ.
human_translation: And not concerned But doesn’t Rava say: It is clear Rabbi Yishmael holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who one must be concerned for the minority? Where is concerned to a stringency. to a leniency, not concerned.
llm_translation: "And is he not concerned? But didn't Rava say: The teaching of Rabbi Yishmael from Mechavarta is like that of Rabbi Meir, he is of the opinion that he is concerned for a minority! When he is concerned — it is for stringency, when he is not concerned — he is not concerned."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בֵּין לְקוּלָּא בֵּין לְחוּמְרָא חָיֵישׁ, וְהָכָא בִּמְטַנֶּפֶת וְחוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: מְטַנֶּפֶת אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ, וְהָא מִדְּאוֹלִיד — וַדַּאי לָא טַנִּיף. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: מְטַנֶּפֶת חוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Whether to a leniency whether to a stringency is concerned, and here they disagree with regard to expel a murky discharge and return and give birth within its first year. As Rabbi Yishmael holds: expels a murky discharge does not return and give birth within its first year, and from that this gave birth certainly did not expel a murky discharge And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: expels a murky discharge returns and give birth within its first year.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: whether for leniency or for stringency, one should be concerned. And here, in the case of a miscarriage and she conceives and gives birth within her year, Rabbi Yishmael holds: a miscarriage does not return and give birth within her year, and if she gives birth - surely she did not miscarry. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: a miscarriage does return and give birth within her year.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנִי אֵינִי אוֹמֵר כֵּן, אֶלָּא עֵז שֶׁטִּינְּפָה בַּת שִׁשָּׁה — יוֹלֶדֶת תּוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ, רָחֵל שֶׁטִּינְּפָה בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ — יוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁתַּיִם. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין גְּמָרֵיהּ לִסְבָרֵיהּ?
human_translation: but I myself do not say so. Rather, a goat that expelled a murky discharge at six gives birth within its first year, a ewe that expelled a murky discharge in its first year gives birth within its second year. what is there between tradition and his reasoning?
llm_translation: I do not say so, but a goat that miscarried at six months - gives birth within its year, a ewe that miscarried at six months - gives birth within two. What is the practical difference between his conclusion and his reasoning?

hebrew_text: שֶׁטִּינְּפָה בְּסוֹף שִׁשָּׁה, וְאִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּזְעֵירִי, דְּאָמַר זְעֵירִי: אֵין טִינּוּף פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: where expelled a murky discharge at the end of six And there is between of Ze’eiri, as Ze’eiri says: a murky discharge, no less than thirty days.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it was swept at the end of six days, and there is a difference between them of Zeri, for Zeri said: 'The sweep is not less than thirty days.'"

hebrew_text: לִגְמָרֵיהּ — אִית לֵיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי, לִסְבָרֵיהּ — לֵית לֵיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי.
human_translation: tradition, accept of Ze’eiri, According to reasoning, he does not accept of Ze’eiri,
llm_translation: To complete it - there is one who holds it is necessary, according to his opinion - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּזְעֵירִי, וְהָכָא — בְּיוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין קָמִיפַּלְגִי;
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone accepts of Ze’eiri; and here, they disagree gives birth after incomplete
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the entire world there is one who is insignificant, and here — in the case of a woman giving birth, they disagree.

hebrew_text: לִגְמָרֵיהּ — לָא אָמְרִינַן יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, לִסְבָרֵיהּ — אָמְרִינַן יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין.
human_translation: According to tradition we do not say gives birth after incomplete According to reasoning, we say gives birth after incomplete
llm_translation: To complete it - we do not say "a woman who gives birth to severed limbs"; according to his opinion - we say "a woman who gives birth to severed limbs."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא אָמְרִינַן יוֹלֶדֶת, וְהָכָא בְּמִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. לִסְבָרֵיהּ — אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, לִגְמָרֵיהּ — לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say we do not say gives birth and here, they disagree part of the day is like an entire to reasoning we say part of the day is like an entire to tradition we do not say part of the day is like an entire
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: We do not say a woman giving birth, and here in part of the day as the whole it split. According to his opinion - we say part of the day as the whole, according to the conclusion - we do not say part of the day as the whole.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲנִי לֹא בָּאתִי לִידֵי מִדָּה זוֹ, אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁיָּדוּעַ כּוּ׳. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: I have not arrived at this method Rather, any where it is known What is there between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yehoshua?
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I did not come to this measure, rather everything is known before Him. What is the difference between Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yehoshua?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא: חָלָב פּוֹטֵר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: חָלָב פּוֹטֵר, הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב בְּהֵמוֹת, וְרוֹב בְּהֵמוֹת אֵין חוֹלְבוֹת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹלְדוֹת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: הָא אִיכָּא מִיעוּטָא דְּחוֹלְבוֹת אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין יוֹלְדוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura says: between them milk is exempt Rabbi Akiva holds: Milk exempts follow the majority of animals, and the majority of animals do not produce milk unless they given birth. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: there is a minority that produce milk even though they not given birth,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina of Sepphoris said: Milk exempts, there is a difference between them. Rabbi Akiva holds: Milk exempts, follow the majority of animals, and the majority of animals only produce milk if they have given birth. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: There is a minority of animals that produce milk even though they have not given birth.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְמִיעוּט? וְהָתְנַן: הָיְתָה לָהּ חֲמוֹת — אֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת, יָצְאָה מְלֵיאָה — חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: And is Rabbi Yehoshua concerned for a minority? Didn’t we learn she has a mother-in-law she does not to be concerned left full, be concerned Rabbi Yehoshua says: She does not to be concerned.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is concerned? Rabbi Yehoshua for a minority? And we learned: If she had a mother-in-law - she is not concerned, if she left full - she is concerned. Rabbi Yehoshua says: She is not concerned.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? קָסָבַר: רוֹב מְעוּבָּרוֹת יוֹלְדוֹת, וּמִיעוּט מַפִּילוֹת, וְכׇל הַיּוֹלְדוֹת — מֶחֱצָה זְכָרִים וּמֶחֱצָה נְקֵבוֹת. סְמוֹךְ מִיעוּטָא דְּמַפִּילוֹת לְמֶחֱצָה דִּנְקֵבוֹת, וְהָווּ לְהוּ זְכָרִים מִיעוּטָא, וּלְמִיעוּטָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן!
human_translation: And we say: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehoshua? He holds the majority of pregnant women give birth and a minority miscarry. And all who give birth, half males and half females. Combine the minority of those who miscarry with the half to females, and males are a minority, and we are not concerned for a minority.
llm_translation: And we say: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua's opinion? He holds: Most are born with a full formation, and few are born with a deficient formation, and all those born are half males and half females. Since the deficiency of those born with a deficient formation is close to half of the females, they will be considered males due to the slight deficiency, and for a slight deficiency, we are not concerned!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ, וְהָתַנְיָא: חָלָב פּוֹטֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חָלָב אֵינוֹ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rather, reverse And it is taught milk exempts the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Akiva says: milk does not exempt
llm_translation: Rather, the opposite, and it was taught: milk exempts, the words of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Akiva says: milk does not exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גְּדִיָּיה שֶׁיָּלְדָה שָׁלֹשׁ בָּנוֹת, וְכׇל בְּנוֹתֶיהָ יָלְדוּ שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ — כּוּלָּן נִכְנָסוֹת לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי שֶׁעִישְּׂרָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ. לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ? תּוֹלֵיד חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ תְּלָת, וְאִינָךְ תַּרְתֵּי תַּרְתֵּי!
human_translation: The Sages taught a kid that gave birth to female triplets and all her offspring each gave birth to female triplets, all of them, enter the pen to be tithed. Rabbi Shimon says: I saw that tithe within its first year Why do I to teach each three one of them give birth to three, and the other two each,
llm_translation: The sages taught: A goat that gave birth to three daughters, and all her daughters gave birth to three each - all of them entered the pen to become wealthy. Rabbi Shimon said: I saw that she conceived within her year. Why do I need to say three by three? She gives birth to one of each kind, three, and not two by two!

hebrew_text: אַיְּידֵי דְּאִיכָּא חֲדָא דְּלָא סַגִּיא בְּלָא שָׁלֹשׁ, תְּנָא כּוּלְּהוּ דְּיָלְדוּ שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ. וּלְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי שָׁלֹשׁ כְּלָל? לֵילְדוּ כּוּלְּהוּ תַּרְתֵּי, וְתִיהְדַּר אִיהִי וְתוֹלֵיד בַּהֲדַיְהִי!
human_translation: Since there is one that would not a sufficient without three, taught all gave birth to three each, But why do I to teach three at all? Let all give birth to two and let her, give birth again together with them.
llm_translation: Through that there is one that does not reach three, it was taught: all of them that gave birth three by three. And why do I need to teach three at all? They all give birth two, and she becomes pregnant and gives birth at the same time!

hebrew_text: לֵימָא קָסָבַר: מְטַנֶּפֶת אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ. אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר: מְטַנֶּפֶת חוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ — יוֹלֶדֶת וַדַּאי אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת וְיוֹלֶדֶת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתָהּ.
human_translation: Shall we say holds expels a murky discharge does not return and give birth within its first year? if you say expels a murky discharge returns and gives birth within its first year, that gave birth certainly does not return and give birth within its first year.
llm_translation: Let us say: One who miscarries does not return and give birth within her year. If you might suggest: One who miscarries returns and gives birth within her year - surely she does not return and give birth within her year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי גְּדִיָּיה כּוּ׳. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין תַּנָּא קַמָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּזְעֵירִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: I saw kid What is there between the first tanna and Rabbi Shimon? between of Ze’eiri,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: I saw herds of goats like this. What is the difference between the first Tanna and Rabbi Shimon? The difference between them is small.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא אִית לֵיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּזְעֵירִי, וְהָכָא בְּיוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. לְתַנָּא קַמָּא אֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן יוֹלֶדֶת.
human_translation: The first tanna accepts of Ze’eiri, And Rabbi Shimon does not accept of Ze’eiri; And if you wish, say that everyone accepts of Ze’eiri, and here they disagree gives birth after incomplete According to the first tanna , does not give birth after incomplete according to Rabbi Shimon, gives birth
llm_translation: The first Tanna holds that there is a concept of "Dizreiri," while Rabbi Shimon does not hold of the concept of "Dizreiri." And if you wish, say: Everyone in the world has a concept of "Dizreiri," and here, in the case of a woman who gives birth to detached limbs, they disagree. According to the first Tanna, she is not considered a woman who gives birth to detached limbs, but according to Rabbi Shimon, she is considered as such.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, וְהָכָא בְּמִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי: לְתַנָּא קַמָּא — לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone agrees does not give birth after incomplete and here they disagree part of the day is like an entire According to the first tanna , we do not say part of the day is like an entire According to Rabbi Shimon, we do say part of the day is like an entire
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: that the entire world does not give birth to miscarriages, and here in a part of the day it is as if the entire day is divided: according to the first Tanna - we do not say a part of the day is like the whole day, according to Rabbi Shimon - we say a part of the day is like the whole day.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, וְהָכָא בִּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן נִכְנָס לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר קָמִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone agrees part of the day is like an entire and here they disagree whose time has not yet enters the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For we say that in general, part of the day is like the whole day, and here, due to lack of time, he entered the chamber to become rich, and he stumbled.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מְחוּסַּר זְמַן נִכְנָס לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, וַהֲרֵי הֵן כִּבְכוֹר — מָה בְּכוֹר קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ, אַף מְחוּסַּר זְמַן קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: whose time has not yet enters the pen to be tithed. And are like a firstborn: Just as a firstborn consecrated before its time and sacrificed after its time, so too, whose time has not yet consecrated before its time and sacrificed after its time.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: One who is lacking time may enter the chamber to become wealthy, and they are like firstborns — just as a firstborn is holy before its time and close after its time, so too, one lacking time is holy before its time and close after its time.

hebrew_text: וְאַדְּיָלֵיף מִבְּכוֹר, נֵילַיף מִקֳּדָשִׁים? מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִבְּכוֹר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן: גּוֹאֵל, מוּם, תְּמוּרַת, אֲכִילָה.
human_translation: But than deriving from the firstborn let one derive from sacrificial it is reasonable it would be for one to derive from the firstborn, as redeem a blemish a substitute consumed
llm_translation: And Adyaleif from the firstborn, we separate from the holy things? It is logical that from the firstborn he should separate, as it is written: redeemer, blemish, exchange, consumption.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִקֳּדָשִׁים הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן זָכָר, קָדוֹשׁ, בְּמַתָּנוֹת, פָּשׁוּט. אֶלָּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן ״הַעֲבָרָה״ ״הַעֲבָרָה״ גְּמִיר.
human_translation: On the contrary, it would be for one to derive from sacrificial as males. consecrated. gifts regular Rather, Rabbi Shimon derives pass” passes
llm_translation: The great Rabbi, it was for him to say, that so he remembered, holy, in gifts, it is simple. Rather, Rabbi Shimon "transgression" "transgression" he learned.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי טִינּוּף? אָמַר רָבָא, כִּדְאָמְרִי רָעֲוָתָא: דְּצָלְתָּא אֲצַר חֵיוְתָא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בַּעְבּוּעֵי דִּדְמָא. וְצָרִיךְ לְהַרְאוֹתוֹ לְחָכָם. חָכָם מְנָא יָדַע? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: רוֹעֶה חָכָם.
human_translation: What is considered a murky discharge Rava says: As the shepherds say: A murky [ detzalta ] the animal suppressed And Shmuel says: bubbles of blood. And one must show to a Sage [ ḥakham ] A Sage? From where would he know Rav Pappa says: a knowledgeable [ ḥakham ] shepherd,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of tithing determined? Rava said, as the people of Rehavta say: 'The shadow of a palm tree is a sign for the livelihood of an animal.' And Shmuel said: 'By the color of blood.' And it is necessary to show it to a wise person. How does one recognize a wise person? Rav Pappa said: 'A wise shepherd.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ יְצִירַת הַוָּולָד בָּאִשָּׁה אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם. בָּעֵי רַב חִסְדָּא: בִּבְהֵמָה בְּכַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לָאו הַיְינוּ דִּזְעֵירִי, דְּאָמַר זְעֵירִי: אֵין טִינּוּף פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם? הַהוּא לְקַבֵּל אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: They said the formation of a fetus in a woman forty days. Rav Ḥisda asks: In an animal, how many Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Isn’t this which Ze’eiri said, as Ze’eiri said: A murky discharge no less than thirty days that was stated with regard to show receptivity to
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: Behold, they said the formation of the embryo in a woman is forty days. Rav Chisda asked: In an animal, how many? Rav Papa said to Abaye: Is it not the same as that which Zeriri said: The weaning is not less than thirty days? That statement was established.

hebrew_text: מָצִינוּ לוֹקֵחַ מִגּוֹי, לוֹקֵחַ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל מַאי? אָמַר רַב: בְּכוֹר וַדַּאי, דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּבִכְּרָה — אִישְׁתַּבּוֹחֵי הֲוָה מִישְׁתַּבַּח לֵיהּ.
human_translation: We found who purchases from a gentile. What one who purchases from a Jew Rav says: a definite firstborn, as if it is so that it had given birth to a firstborn, would have boasted to
llm_translation: We found that he buys from a non-Jew, and he buys from a Jew, what is the law? Rav said: If it is a firstborn, it is certainly valid, for if it comes to be of a firstborn — his wife is established, he establishes it for him.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּכוֹר סָפֵק, סָבַר לִשְׁחִיטָה קָא בָעֵי לֵיהּ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חוּלִּין וַדָּאִין, מַאי טַעְמָא? אִם אִיתָא דְּלֹא בִּכְּרָה, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא, אוֹדוֹעֵי הֲוָה מוֹדַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: firstborn uncertain, thinks wants it for slaughter, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: certainly a non-sacred What is the reason? If it is so that it had not given birth, since there is a prohibition would have notified
llm_translation: Samuel said: Regarding a doubtful firstborn, he intends for slaughter. And Rabbi Yohanan said: Whether definite or doubtful, what is the reason? If it comes that it is not a firstborn, since there is a prohibition, it is known that he was aware of it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר חוּלִּין: אִם לֹא הוֹדִיעוֹ — הוֹלֵךְ וְשׁוֹחֵט וְאֵינוֹ נִמְנָע. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל? הָתָם בְּמוֹכֵר תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, הָכָא בְּלוֹקֵחַ תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says non-sacred: if did not inform go and slaughter the animal and he not refrain Shall we say this a conclusive refutation of Rav and Shmuel? There, the matter is dependent upon the seller, Here, the matter is dependent upon the buyer,
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan, who said in the Mishnah: If they did not inform him, he may go and slaughter and he is not prevented. Should we say that this is the dispute between Rav and Shmuel? There, it concerns the seller being dependent on the matter; here, it concerns the buyer being dependent on the matter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה שֶׁשָּׁפְעָה חֲרָרַת דָּם, הֲרֵי זוֹ תִּקָּבֵר, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: a large animal that expelled a mass of blood, that must be buried. and is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: An animal that is large and has an abundance of blood clots, it should be buried, and it is exempt from the laws of firstborn.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה לֹא בְּמַגָּע וְלֹא בְּמַשָּׂא. וּמֵאַחַר דְּאֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה לֹא בְּמַגָּע וְלֹא בְּמַשָּׂא, אַמַּאי תִּקָּבֵר?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: does not impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying But since does not impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying, why buried?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Rabbi Chiya taught: It does not render impure neither through contact nor through carrying. And since it does not render impure neither through contact nor through carrying, why should it be buried? English translation:

hebrew_text: כְּדֵי לְפַרְסְמָהּ שֶׁנִּפְטְרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: in order to publicize that is exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: In order to publicize it that she has been exempt from the firstborn status.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּוָלָד מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְאַמַּאי אֵין מְטַמֵּא לֹא בְּמַגָּע וְלֹא בְּמַשָּׂא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל בְּרוֹב נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: to say that is a full-fledged offspring. But why doesn’t it impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: due to nullification in a majority touched upon it,
llm_translation: In the matter of a miscarriage, it is superior, and why does it not render impure neither through contact nor through carrying? Rabbi Yochanan said: Due to the nullification by the majority of those who touched it.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and Rabbi Shimon said the same thing, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov that which we said
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan would then go according to his reasoning, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and Rabbi Shimon said one thing, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - this is what we said.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן: הַשִּׁלְיָא בַּבַּיִת — הַבַּיִת טָמֵא. לֹא שֶׁהַשִּׁלְיָא וָלָד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין שִׁלְיָא בְּלֹא וָלָד. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: וָלָד נִימּוֹק עַד שֶׁלֹּא יָצָא.
human_translation: what is Rabbi Shimon as we learned the afterbirth in the house, the house is impure. not that the afterbirth offspring, but that there is no afterbirth without an offspring Rabbi Shimon says: offspring disintegrated before it emerged
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, what is it? For it was taught: If there is a miscarriage in the house - the house is unclean. Not because of the miscarriage itself, but because there is no miscarriage without a birth. Rabbi Shimon says: A birth is considered a liquid until it has emerged.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין לִנְפָלִים פְּתִיחַת הַקֶּבֶר, עַד שֶׁיַּעֲגִילוּ רֹאשׁ כְּפִיקָּה. מַאי כְּפִיקָּה? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כְּפִיקָּה שֶׁל צֶמֶר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב לְרַב הוּנָא: רַבִּי, פָּרֵישׁ שֶׁל שְׁתִי אוֹ שֶׁל עֵרֶב?
human_translation: We learned elsewhere deceased fetuses do not the opening of the womb, until the head round like a skein [ pika ] What is Like a skein? Rav Huna said: like a skein of woolen Ḥiyya bar Rav said to Rav Huna: My teacher, explain of warp or of woof
llm_translation: We learned there: The Nefalim do not have the opening of the grave until they roll their head like a spindle. What is a spindle? Rav Huna said: A spindle of wool. Hiyya the son of Rav said to Rav Huna: Rabbi, is it a spindle of linen or of mixed fibers?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנְיָא: פִּיקָּה שֶׁל שְׁתִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל עֵרֶב. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיֵּרָאוּ טְפִיפִיּוֹת. מַאי טְפִיפִיּוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: כָּךְ הָיוּ מְפָרְשִׁין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: כִּפְרֵידָה שֶׁכּוֹרַעַת לְהַטִּיל מֵימֶיהָ, וְנִרְאֵית פִּיקָּה מִתּוֹךְ פִּיקָּה.
human_translation: said to him: is taught a skein of warp the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: of woof Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: from tefifiyot are seen What tefifiyot ? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok: This how they would explain it in Jerusalem: like a mule bends down to urinate, and appears a skein from within a skein.
llm_translation: He said to him: It was taught: The opening of the two, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Of the evening. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok says: From when drops are seen. What are drops? Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok: This is how they would explain in Jerusalem: A cow that crouches to give birth, and it appears that there are openings within openings.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שָׁמַעְתִּי שְׁתֵּי פִּיקוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל שְׁתִי וְאַחַת שֶׁל עֵרֶב, וְאֵין לִי לְפָרֵשׁ. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁלֹשׁ פִּיקוֹת שָׁמַעְתִּי, אַחַת שֶׁל שְׁתִי וְאַחַת שֶׁל עֵרֶב וְאַחַת שֶׁל פִּיקָּה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁל סַקָּאִין, וְאֵין לִי לְפָרֵשׁ. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין פֵּירְשַׁהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁל אִשָּׁה כְּשֶׁל שְׁתִי, שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה כְּשֶׁל עֵרֶב.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: I heard two skeins: One of warp and one of woof and I do not have to explain When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: skeins, I heard three One of warp and one of woof and one a large skein sack makers, and I do not have to explain When Ravin came he explained this in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: of a woman of of warp of an animal of of woof
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: I heard of two openings, one of a woman and one of an animal, and I do not know how to distinguish between them. When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: I heard of three openings, one of a woman, one of an animal, and one of a large opening of Sakain, and I do not know how to distinguish between them. When Ravin came, he explained it in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The opening of a woman is like that of a woman, the opening of an animal is like that of an animal.

hebrew_text: פִּיקָּה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁל סַקָּאִין, כְּדִתְנַן: גּוּשׁ הַבָּא מִבֵּית הַפְּרָס, מֵאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים — שִׁיעוּרוֹ כְּפִיקָּה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁל סַקָּאִין, שֶׁהוּא כְּחוֹתַם הַמַּרְצוּפִין, וְיֶשְׁנוֹ בְּצַד הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁל מְגוּפַת הֶחָבִית הַלַּחְמִית.
human_translation: a large skein sack makers, as we learned a clod that comes from an area in which uncertainty exists concerning the location of a grave or a corpse [ beit haperas ], from the land of the nations, measure of a large skein by sack makers, which is like the seal of large sacks [ martzofin ]. And this is found on the top side of the seal of a Bethlehem jug.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A large pomegranate of sakain, as we learned: A lump that comes from the house of Persia, from the land of the nations — its measure is like a large pomegranate of sakain, which is like the seal of marble slabs, and it is on the upper side of the body of the bread barrel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה: הַלּוֹקֵחַ צִיר מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ — מַשִּׁיקוֹ בְּמַיִם, וְטָהוֹר.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: One who purchases brine from one who is unreliable with regard to ritual impurity [ am ha’aretz ], brings it into contact with water and pure.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehudah Nesi'ah: One who buys wine from an am ha'aretz - he should rinse it with water, and it is pure.

hebrew_text: מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ, אִי מַיָּא רוּבָּא נִינְהוּ — כֵּיוָן דְּעָבֵיד לְהוּ הַשָּׁקָה טָהֲרִי לְהוּ, וְאִי רוּבָּא צִיר נִינְהוּ — צִיר לָא בַּר קַבּוֹלֵי טוּמְאָה הוּא. מַאי אִיכָּא — מִשּׁוּם הָנָךְ מִיעוּטָא דְּמַיָּא, הָנָךְ בָּטְלוּ לְהוּ בְּרוּבָּא.
human_translation: whichever you If water is majority once he brought into contact became pure And if the majority is brine brine is not susceptible to ritual impurity. what is there? due to that minority of water that is nullified by the majority
llm_translation: From what is your soul, if water is the majority of them — since he made for them a libation, they are pure for him, and if they are mostly wine — wine is not a receptacle for impurity. What is the reason? Because of the small amount of water, they are nullified in the majority.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִטְבּוֹל בָּהֶן פִּיתּוֹ, אֲבָל לִקְדֵירָה — לֹא, מָצָא מִין אֶת מִינוֹ וְנֵיעוֹר. יָתֵיב רַב דִּימִי וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכִי טוּמְאָה שֶׁבָּטְלָה חָזְרָה וְנֵיעוֹרָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרַהּ? וְהָתְנַן: סְאָה תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: taught only to dip his bread in But for a pot not type found its type, and is revived Rav Dimi was sitting and saying this halakha . Abaye said to But does nullified impurity return and revive said to him: And you, do you not hold But didn’t we learn a se’a of impure teruma that fell
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: They only taught that one may immerse bread in them, but for cooking - no, if one found its kind, it is shaken off. Rav Dimi was sitting and saying this teaching. Abaye said to him: And impurity that was nullified, can it return and be shaken off? He said to him: And don't you agree? And we learned: A contaminated measure of terumah that fell...

hebrew_text: לְמֵאָה חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִין, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תֵּירוֹם וְתֵרָקֵב, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: הִיא סְאָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה הִיא סְאָה שֶׁעָלְתָה.
human_translation: into one hundred pure, non-sacred Rabbi Eliezer says: Let be lifted and rot as I say: The se’a that fell is the se’a that arose?
llm_translation: From one hundred pure grains, Rabbi Eliezer says: "Separate and sift." For I say: "It is a se'ah that fell, it is a se'ah that rose."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: תַּעֲלֶה, וְתֵיאָכֵל נִיקּוּדִים, אוֹ קְלָיוֹת, אוֹ תִּילּוֹשׁ בְּמֵי פֵירוֹת, אוֹ תִּתְחַלֵּק לְעִיסּוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Let arise and be eaten dry or roasted. Or it may be kneaded with fruit juice, Or it may divided small batches, provided that not an egg-bulk in a single
llm_translation: The sages say: one may soak and eat pickled vegetables, or beets, or dip bread in fruit juice, or divide it into pieces, as long as it does not resemble a loaf in one place.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אוֹתָן חוּלִּין
human_translation: And it is taught in that regard: those non-sacred
llm_translation: And he taught about it: those profane.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶן? יֹאכְלוּ נִקּוּדִין, אוֹ קְלָיוֹת, אוֹ יִלּוֹשׁוּ בְּמֵי פֵירוֹת, אוֹ תִּתְחַלֵּק לְעִיסּוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כְּבֵיצָה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד. וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: מָה טַעַם? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יָבִיא קַב חוּלִּין טְמֵאִים מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר וְקַב וְעוֹד מִמִּין זֶה, סָבַר אֱיבַטְּלִינְהוּ בְּרוּבָּא, וְכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא הַאי מַשֶּׁהוּ — מָצָא מִין אֶת מִינוֹ וְנֵיעוֹר.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Eliezer, what will be with them? Let them be eaten dry or roasted, or kneaded with fruit juice, or divided small batches, provided that not an egg-bulk in a single And Ulla says: What is the reason decree, lest one bring a kav of non-sacred, impure from other place and a kav and more from this think I will nullify with the majority But since there is some amount type found its type and is revived
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer, what should be done with them? They may eat pickled vegetables, or boiled vegetables, or be soaked in fruit juices, or be divided into doughs, as long as there is not an egg's worth in one place. And Ula said: What is the reason? It is a decree lest one bring a kab of impure common produce from another place and a kab and more from this kind. He thought to nullify them in the majority, but since there is some of this kind — he found its kind and separated it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם טוּמְאָה עוֹרֶרֶת טוּמְאָה, טׇהֳרָה עוֹרֶרֶת טוּמְאָה?
human_translation: said to if impurity revives impurity, purity revives impurity,
llm_translation: He said to him: If impurity awakens impurity, does purity awaken impurity?

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אֵפֶר כָּשֵׁר שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בְּאֵפֶר מִקְלֶה, הוֹלְכִין אַחַר הָרוֹב לְטַמֵּא, וְאִי רוּבָּא אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה הוּא — לָא מְטַמֵּא. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ: טוּמְאָה כְּמַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, נְהִי דִּבְמַגָּע לָא מְטַמֵּא — לְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא!
human_translation: raised an objection to ashes fit became intermingled with burned ashes, we follow the majority to impure. And if majority is burned ashes, not impart impurity. And if you say impurity is considered like an item that is although does not impart impurity through contact let it impart impurity through carrying
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Ashes that became mixed with the ashes of a stick, we follow the majority to render impure. And if the majority is ashes of a stick, it does not render impure. And if you say: "Impurity is like someone who has blood," even though through contact it does not render impure, it renders impure through carrying!

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: טָהוֹר מִלְּטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע, אֲבָל מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא.
human_translation: it was stated with regard to that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: pure impart impurity through contact, but it impart impurity through carrying.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: If it was said about it, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: Pure from defilement by contact, but defiles through carrying.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נְבֵילָה בְּטֵילָה בִּשְׁחוּטָה, שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לִנְבֵילָה שֶׁתֵּיעָשֶׂה שְׁחוּטָה. נְהִי דִּבְמַגָּע לָא מְטַמֵּא, לְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא!
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: carcass is nullified by slaughtered animal that it is impossible for a carcass to become a slaughtered Granted that it does not impart impurity through contact, let impart impurity through carrying.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Ḥisdah: A neveilah that is nullified in a slaughtered animal, because it is impossible for a neveilah to become slaughtered. Even though through contact it does not impart impurity, it imparts impurity through carrying!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתּוּן בִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן בִּדְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: נְבֵילָה וּשְׁחוּטָה בְּטֵילוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, וְאִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: טָהוֹר מִלְּטַמֵּא בְּמַגָּע, אֲבָל מְטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא.
human_translation: said to You learned according to Rav Ḥisda, we learned it according to Rabbi Ḥiyya, Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: an animal carcass and a slaughtered one nullifies the other, And it was stated with regard to this Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: pure impart impurity through contact, but it impart impurity through carrying.
llm_translation: He said to him: You with Rab Ḥisdah, you teach him his Mishnah, we with Rabbi Ḥiyya, we teach him his Mishnah. Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: A neveilah and a properly slaughtered animal that are mixed together, one nullifies the other, and it was stated about it, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Pure from causing impurity through contact, but causes impurity through carrying.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה שֶׁשָּׁפְעָה חֲרָרַת דָּם — הֲרֵי זוֹ תִּקָּבֵר, וְנִפְטְרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה. וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה לֹא בְּמַגָּע וְלֹא בְּמַשָּׂא. אַמַּאי? דִּנְהִי בְּמַגָּע לָא מְטַמֵּא, תְּטַמֵּא בְּמַשָּׂא! אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: And that which we learned Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: a large animal that expelled a mass of blood, that must be buried, and is exempt from a firstborn. And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches does not impart impurity, through contact nor through carrying. why? granted it does not impart impurity through contact, let it impart impurity through carrying. was silent
llm_translation: The one we learned: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: An animal that is large and has an abundance of hot blood - it shall be buried, and it is exempt from the firstborn. And Rabbi Chiya teaches: It does not render impure neither through touching nor through carrying. Why? Because if it does not render impure through touching, it should render impure through carrying! He remained silent.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא, וַדַּאי שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ טוּמְאָה סְרוּחָה. הָנִיחָא לְבַר פְּדָא, דְּאָמַר: טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה עַד לְגֵר, וְטוּמְאָה קַלָּה עַד לְכֶלֶב, הָא לָא חַזְיָא לְגֵר. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר:
human_translation: Perhaps is different here, as it is decayed impurity, This works out well according to bar Padda, who says: severe impurity, until by a gentile but light impurity, until by a dog. this not fit by a ger But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says:
llm_translation: Perhaps, and certainly there is a difference here, for it would be considered a dangling impurity. It is preferable for Bar Peda, who said: "Severe impurity extends up to a convert, and light impurity extends up to a dog," as it is not seen for a convert. Rather, according to Rabbi Yochanan who said:

hebrew_text: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ עַד לְכֶלֶב, הָא חַזְיָא לְכֶלֶב! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: this one and that one, until by a dog, this is fit for a dog. difficult.
llm_translation: One this and one this until to dog, behold to dog! Difficult.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, בַּר פְּדָא אָמַר: טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה עַד לְגֵר, וְטוּמְאָה קַלָּה עַד לְכֶלֶב. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ עַד לְכֶלֶב. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבַר פְּדָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ כׇל נְבֵלָה לְגֵר וְגוֹ׳״, הָרְאוּיָה לַגֵּר קְרוּיָה ״נְבֵילָה״, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לַגֵּר אֵינָהּ קְרוּיָה ״נְבֵילָה״.
human_translation: the itself. Bar Padda says: severe impurity until by a ger but light impurity until by a dog. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: this one and that one until by a dog. What is the reason for bar Padda? As it is written: “You shall not eat of any animal carcass; to the ger fit for a ger is called an animal carcass, and that which is not fit for a ger is not called an animal carcass.
llm_translation: The body, Bar Pedah said: Severe impurity until convert, and light impurity until dog. And Rabbi Yohanan said: One this and one this until dog. What is the reason of Bar Pedah's statement? As it is written: "You shall not eat any carcass to the convert, etc." - that which is fit for the convert is called "carcass," and that which is not fit for the convert is not called "carcass."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? לְמַעוֹטֵי הֵיכָא דְּהִסְרִיחָה מֵעִיקָּרָא. וְאִידַּךְ? הִסְרִיחָה מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי, עַפְרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And the other to exclude that was decayed from the outset, And the other A verse is not necessary to exclude was decayed from the outset, it is merely dust
llm_translation: And the other opinion? To exclude the case where it became putrid from the outset. And the other opinion? It is not necessary to exclude the case where it became putrid from the outset, for it is mere dust.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה שֶׁשָּׁפְעָה חֲרָרַת דָּם, הֲרֵי זוֹ תִּקָּבֵר, וְנִפְטֶרֶת מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה. וְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה לֹא בְּמַגָּע וְלֹא בְּמַשָּׂא. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל בְּרוֹב נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: a large animal that expelled a mass of blood, that must be buried, and is exempt from firstborn. And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: does not impart impurity, neither through contact nor through carrying. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: due to nullification in a majority touched upon it,
llm_translation: We learned: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: An animal with a severe flow of blood, it shall be buried, and it is exempt from the firstborn. And Rabbi Chiya teaches: It does not render impure through contact or carrying. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Due to the nullification by the majority who touched it.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִירְיָא מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל בְּרוֹב? תִּיפּוֹק לִי דְּלָא אִיתְחֲזִי כְּלָל! הָא נָמֵי אִיתְחֲזִי מֵעִיקָּרָא אַגַּב אִימֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Why due specifically nullification by majority derive that is not fit at all, This too initially fit by virtue of its mother,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "bitul b'rov"? Come out to me that it is not seen at all! Indeed, it is seen from the outset because of its mother.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: צִיר טָהוֹר שֶׁנָּפַל לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — טָמֵא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת נֶחְשְׁדוּ עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ לְעָרֵב מֶחֱצָה בַּצִּיר. וּלְמָה לִי מֶחֱצָה? אֲפִילּוּ בְּצִיר מִמֶּחֱצָה נָמֵי! וְהָנֵי מַשֶּׁהוּ — הָוֵה לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא, וּפַלְגָא לָא בְּטִיל.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Ritually pure brine, into which any amount water fell impure. Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: That is to say amei ha’aretz are suspected of mixing half in the brine, But why do I half Even less than half, also that amount constitutes half and half is not nullified
llm_translation: We learned there: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A pure vessel into which water fell, any amount — it is impure. Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: This means that the people of the land suspected mixing half with half in the vessel. And why do I need half? Even mixing less than half in the vessel is also impure! And these are something — it has a half, and a half is not nullified.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: עַד מֶחֱצָה. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: טוּמְאַת עַם הָאָרֶץ דְּרַבָּנַן, טוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּרַבָּנַן. בְּרוּבָּא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן, בְּפַלְגָא וּפַלְגָא לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Say until half And if you wish, say The impurity am ha’aretz by rabbinic law the impurity of liquids by rabbinic law. Where the majority the Sages decreed where half and half the Sages did not decree
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: ad mechatzah. Iba'eita eima: tum'at am ha'aretz derabanan, tum'at mashkin derabanan. Berubba gezaru rabanan, bepalga upalga lo gezaru bah rabanan. English translation: Eima: until halfway. If you say Eima: the impurity of the common people is Rabbinic, the impurity of liquids is Rabbinic. In a majority, the Rabbis decreed; in a half and half case, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה מְנִיקָה מִן הַגּוֹי — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל אַחֶרֶת הָיָה. נִכְנָס לְתוֹךְ עֶדְרוֹ וְרָאָה אֶת הַמַּבְכִּירוֹת מְנִיקוֹת, וְשֶׁאֵינָן מַבְכִּירוֹת מְנִיקוֹת — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who purchases a nursing animal from a gentile, he not to be concerned, perhaps it was the offspring of another enters amid his flock and sees that gave birth for the first time nursing, and that gave birth not for the first time nursing, he not to be concerned perhaps the offspring of this came to that perhaps the offspring of that came to this
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who buys an animal for nursing from a non-Jew - we are not concerned that perhaps its offspring belonged to another. If he entered into his herd and saw the older ones nursing, and the younger ones not nursing - we are not concerned that perhaps the offspring of this one comes to that one, or perhaps the offspring of that one comes to this one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הִלְכְתָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ פִּירְקִין, בַּר מִפְּלוּגְתָּא. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמֵינָא כִּי נָיֵים וְשָׁכֵיב רַב אָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא! אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא — (מפליגי) [מִיפְלָג פְּלִיגִי] רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said in the name of Rav: The halakha throughout the whole chapter, except a difference Rav Sheshet says: I say Rav was dozing or sleeping when he said this halakha . to which If we say to the first Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva disagree
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Amar Rav Nachman mishmei d'Rav: Hilchata b'kullei pirkin, bar miplugta. Amar Rav Sheshet: Ameina ki nayim v'shacheiv Rav amar l'ha shema'ta! Aheya? Ileima areisha - (mifligi) miflag p'ligi Rabbi Yishmael v'Rabbi Akiva! English translation: Gemara, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: The halacha follows the majority of opinions, in a case of dispute. Rav Sheshet said: I agree that it is fitting and Rav said to him, "Did you hear that?" Is it so? If you say the first - (they dispute) Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב ״קַב וְנָקִי״.
human_translation: Rather, to of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov a kav but is clean
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - from the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, "a kab and clean."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִפְלָג פְּלִיג בְּבָרַיְיתָא! אֶלָּא אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם — הָא אָמַר רַב חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם! אֶלָּא אַשְּׂעַר בַּעַל מוּם מִיפְלָג פְּלִיגִי עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל וְרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Rather, to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel disagrees, in the baraita Rather, to of Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam didn’t Rav say one time? As Rav said: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam. Rather, of the hair of a blemished Akavya ben Mahalalel and the Rabbis disagree
llm_translation: Rather, Adravan Shimon ben Gamliel disputes in the Baraita! Rather, Adrabi Yosei ben Hamshulam - as Rav said once, as Rav said: the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei ben Hamshulam! Rather, Ashsar Baal Mum disputes in the Pliga, Akavya ben Mahalalel and the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אַדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּבָרַיְיתָא לָא פְּלוּגְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Actually, to of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and teaches us this: That a baraita is not a dispute,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Always follow the opinion of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, for here we have heard: The matter is not subject to dispute."

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר רַב: הִלְכְתָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ פִּירְקִין בַּר מִפְּלוּגְתָּא,
human_translation: But once Rav said the halakha throughout the whole chapter except a difference
llm_translation: And since Rav said: the halakha follows the entire chapter of Bar Peliugta,

hebrew_text: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: why do I halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam?
llm_translation: Halakha according to Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אִי אָמַר הִלְכְתָא דְּכוּלֵּיהּ פִּירְקִין, וְלָא אָמַר הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם קָאֵי, וּמַאי ״בְּכוּלֵּיהּ פִּירְקִין״? דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי תַּרְתֵּי אָמַר, וּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּבָרַיְיתָא פְּלוּגְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Had said the halakha throughout the whole chapter, but did not say the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam, I would say: is referring to Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam. And what Throughout the whole chapter, Rabbi Yosei said two And a dissenting a baraita , is a dispute.
llm_translation: If one says the entire chapter, and does not say the chapter like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam, I would say: On the contrary, Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam is standing, and what is "the entire chapter"? For Rabbi Yosei said two things, and a dispute in words is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּאַדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָאֵי, וּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּבָרַיְיתָא לָאו פְּלוּגְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: taught halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei to teach us that is referring of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and a dissenting a baraita , is not a dispute.
llm_translation: We hear the halakha like Rabbi Yosei — to hear that the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, and a dispute in matters of halakha is not a dispute.

hebrew_text: מַאי בָּרַיְיתָא? דְּתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה מְנִיקָה מִן הַגּוֹי, הַבָּא אַחֲרָיו בְּכוֹר מִסָּפֵק, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּרַחֶמֶת אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: דָּבָר בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ.
human_translation: What baraita As it is taught one who purchases a nursing animal from a gentile, that after a firstborn due to uncertainty because be merciful even though it has not given birth Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: matter in its presumptive status,
llm_translation: What is the source of this teaching? For it was taught: One who purchases an animal from a gentile that is nursing, and afterwards a firstborn animal comes from it in doubt, the firstborn is considered a result of compassion, even though she is not giving birth. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A matter in its presumption.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַנִּכְנָס לְתוֹךְ עֶדְרוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה וְרָאָה כְּעֶשֶׂר כַּחֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה, מַבְכִּירוֹת וְשֶׁאֵינָן מַבְכִּירוֹת, יוֹלְדוֹת, לְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא זְכָרִים (תְּלוּיוֹת) [תְּלוּיִין] בְּשֶׁאֵין מַבְכִּירוֹת, וּנְקֵבוֹת תְּלוּיוֹת בְּמַבְכִּירוֹת — אֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel would say: One who enters amid his flock at night and sees about ten about fifteen whose offspring is a firstborn and whose offspring is not a firstborn, giving birth, on the next day he arose and found male were nursing from whose offspring is not a firstborn, and female were nursing from whose offspring is a firstborn, he does not need to be concerned perhaps the young of this came to that
llm_translation: And so was Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel saying: One who enters his flock at night and sees about ten or fifteen, the firstborn and those that are not firstborn, giving birth, the next day he should rise early and find males (hanging) suspended with those that are not firstborn, and females suspended with the firstborn — he need not be concerned that the offspring of this one belongs to that one.
