hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: דָּבָר בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ דְּקָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאֵינָהּ מְרַחֶמֶת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹלֶדֶת — הָא הֵיכָא דְּאוֹלִיד חָיְישִׁינַן לְרַחוֹמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: דִּידַהּ מְרַחֲמָא, דְּלָא דִּידַהּ לָא מְרַחֲמָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before matter in its presumptive status, which Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel stated? that does not show mercy unless it has given birth, consequently, where given birth we are concerned for be merciful Or perhaps be merciful its own it does not mercy that is not its own?
llm_translation: He asked them: a matter in its presumption that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said, that it does not have compassion unless it gives birth - here where it gives birth, do we suspect for compassion, or perhaps: her compassion, that she does not have compassion for it?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִלְקֵא עֲלַהּ מִשּׁוּם ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״. אִי אָמְרַתְּ דִּידַהּ מְרַחֲמָא, דְּלָא דִּידַהּ לָא מְרַחֲמָא — לָקֵי, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא דִּידַהּ נָמֵי מְרַחֲמָא — לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: What difference is with regard to is flogged for it due to a mother and its offspring If you say is merciful its own is not merciful that is not its own, one is flogged But if you say is also merciful that is not its own, is not flogged
llm_translation: For what does it come out? To take the mother bird on account of "the same and its young." If you say that hers is compassion, for not hers is not compassion — it is taken, and if you say that not hers is also compassion — it is not taken.

hebrew_text: מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה מִן הַגּוֹי — אֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל אַחֶרֶת הָיָה. מִי קָתָנֵי ״הוּא״? ״הָיָה״ קָתָנֵי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל אַחֶרֶת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה לָהּ וָלָד מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What Come hear Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who purchases animal from a gentile, he not to be concerned lest was the offspring of another Does teach it is teaches it was this is saying: one not to be concerned perhaps it the offspring of another unless it had an offspring initially.
llm_translation: What? Come and hear. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who buys an animal from a non-Jew - he is not concerned that perhaps it was the offspring of another. Who is the tanna that teaches "he"? It teaches "was"! This is what it means to say: He is not concerned that perhaps it was the offspring of another, unless it was already pregnant from the beginning.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִכְנַס בְּתוֹךְ עֶדְרוֹ וְרָאָה אֶת הַמַּבְכִּירוֹת מְנִיקוֹת, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינָן מַבְכִּירוֹת מְנִיקוֹת — אֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁמָּא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear enters amid his flock and sees that gave birth for the first time nursing, and that gave birth not for the first time nursing, he not to be concerned perhaps the offspring of this came to that perhaps the offspring of that came to this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: If one entered into his flock and saw the firstborns nursing, and those who are not firstborns nursing - he is not concerned lest the son of this one come to this one, or lest the son of this one come to this one.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא רַחוֹמֵי רַחֵים! בִּמְקוֹם דִּידַהּ, לָא שָׁבְקָא דִּידַהּ וּמְרַחֲמָא דְּלָא דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: why Let us be concerned perhaps is merciful a place where its own it does not set aside its own and mercy that is not its own.
llm_translation: Why? To be concerned lest perhaps the Merciful One is not merciful! In a place where there is concern, one should not leave concern and rely on mercy that is not concern.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּבָר בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ כּוּ׳. מַאי לָאו רֵישָׁא דּוּמְיָא דְּסֵיפָא? מָה סֵיפָא וַדַּאי דִּידַהּ, אַף רֵישָׁא וַדַּאי דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: Come hear matter in its presumptive status. What, is it not the first clause is similar to the latter clause? Just as the latter clause certainly own so too, the first clause certainly own
llm_translation: Come and hear: a matter in its presumption, like what? What, is it not the beginning similar to the end? Just as the end is certain for itself, so too the beginning is certain for itself.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? הַאי כִּדְאִיתֵאּ, וְהַאי כִּדְאִיתֵאּ. וּמַאי ״וְכֵן״? אַפְּטוּרָה דִּבְכוֹרָה.
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is and that as it is, But And similarly? is exempt from a firstborn,
llm_translation: From the city of Irya? This one as it is, and this one as it is. And what is "and so"? The exemption of the firstborn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רָאָה חֲזִיר שֶׁכָּרוּךְ אַחַר רָחֵל, פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְאָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה ״עַד יָבֹא וְיוֹרֶה צֶדֶק לָכֶם״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: saw a pig that trailing after a ewe, exempt from a firstborn. And is forbidden for consumption “until he comes and instructs righteousness to you”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: If a pig saw its mate after Rachel, it is exempt from the firstborn, and forbidden for consumption, "until he comes and teaches you righteousness."

hebrew_text: פָּטוּר מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה — כְּמַאן? כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה — כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: exempt from a firstborn, in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel But is forbidden for consumption, in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: Exempt from the firstborn — like whom? Like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and prohibited in eating — like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, אִי כְּרַבָּנַן, מַאי ״עַד יָבֹא וְיוֹרֶה צֶדֶק לָכֶם״? ״עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לְךָ דָּבָר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And furthermore, if in accordance with the Rabbis, what “Until he comes and instructs righteousness to you”? it should have Until the matter becomes known to you,
llm_translation: And come, if according to the Rabbis, what is "until he comes and teaches you righteousness"? "Until it is known to you as a matter" is what he requires!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אִי כְּרַבָּנַן, אִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ — אַמַּאי פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה? וְתוּ: מִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ — הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב, וְצַיְדָן, וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה!
human_translation: And if you would say it is uncertain whether the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel or in accordance with the Rabbis, If is uncertain, why is ewe exempt from a firstborn? And furthermore, is an uncertainty But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Wherever Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our Mishna halakha in accordance with his except for guarantor and Tzaidan and evidence final
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is in doubt for him whether the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel or like the Rabbis, if it is in doubt for him - why is she exempt from the firstborn? And if you will say: Who is in doubt for him? But didn't Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah say in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Any place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed in our Mishnah - the halakha is like him, except for Eruv, and hunting, and the last sighting!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִיהוּ מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי סָבַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל יוֹלֶדֶת מְרַחֶמֶת, אוֹ אֵינָהּ מְרַחֶמֶת. אִי הָכִי, עַד דְּאַשְׁמְעִינַן חֲזִיר, לַישְׁמְעִינַן טָלֶה, וּלְמִילְקֵי עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״!
human_translation: Actually, obvious to halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. But it is uncertain if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds an animal that has given birth be merciful or is not merciful If that is so, instead of teaching a pig, should have taught lamb. And to flogged for it due to a mother and its offspring
llm_translation: Always the halakha follows Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, but if there is a doubt whether Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds that a fetus is considered part of its mother's body or not, until we hear a pig, we should hear a lamb, and to circumcise it because of "him and his son"!

hebrew_text: חֲזִיר אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן טָלֶה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר דְּסָבַר יוֹלֶדֶת מְרַחֲמָא — דְּמִינַהּ, דְּלָא מִינַהּ — לָא. אַשְׁמְעִינַן חֲזִיר, דִּמְרַחֶמֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ דְּלָאו מִינַהּ נָמֵי, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דִּלְמָא מְרַחֲמָא.
human_translation: was necessary for a pig, as, had he taught a lamb, I would say: if you say that holds an animal that has given birth be merciful with regard to its species, that is not its species, not teaches us a pig, that be merciful, and also even where is not its species, as it could be said perhaps merciful
llm_translation: A pig requires mercy, for if we were to hear that a lamb was born, I would say: If you find it to say that the mother has compassion — consider it, but do not consider it — no. We hear that a pig is born, which has compassion, and even if it is not its kind, there is room to say that perhaps it has compassion.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בָּעֵי
human_translation: And this is that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A dilemma was raised
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yochanan said: "Ba'ei"

hebrew_text: אַחַאי בְּרִיבִּי: רָאָה חֲזִיר שֶׁכָּרוּךְ אַחַר רָחֵל, מַהוּ? מַאי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא לִבְכוֹרָה, וְקָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ אִי הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אִי הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּנַן, תִּיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ טָלֶה!
human_translation: Aḥai the Distinguished [ beribbi ]: one saw a pig that trailing after a ewe, what is What is the dilemma he is raising? If we say with regard to firstborn and he is asking if the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel or if the halakha is in accordance with the Rabbis, let the dilemma be raised a lamb,
llm_translation: Achai son of Ribi: Saw a pig that was tied after Rachel, what? What is he seeking from her? If you say for the firstborn, and he is seeking from her whether the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel or like the Rabbis, he should ask about a lamb!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, לִבְכוֹרָה וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, לַאֲכִילָה וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: when raised the dilemma with regard to firstborn and in accordance with of the Rabbis. with regard to consumption, and in accordance with of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: When he came to him, regarding the firstborn and according to the opinion of the sages, for eating and according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: לִבְכוֹרָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְאָמְרִי מְרַחֲמָא, כִּי מְרַחֲמָא דְּמִינַהּ, דְּלָא מִינַהּ — לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא דְּלָא מִינַהּ נָמֵי מְרַחֲמָא?
human_translation: with regard to firstborn and even according to the Rabbis, who say be merciful when is merciful that its species, that is not its species not Or perhaps also be merciful that is not its species.
llm_translation: Firstborn status, and even according to the Rabbis who say "mercy," for the mercy of her kind, if not her kind - no, or perhaps even if not her kind, is it still mercy?

hebrew_text: לַאֲכִילָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר סָבַר: יוֹלֶדֶת מְרַחֲמָא דְּמִינַהּ, דְּלָאו מִינַהּ — לָא; אוֹ דִלְמָא: דְּלָאו מִינַהּ נָמֵי מְרַחֲמָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: with regard to consumption, and even according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: If you say holds an animal that has given birth be merciful that its species, that is not its species not Or perhaps also be merciful that is not its species, shall stand
llm_translation: For eating, and even for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel - if you find him saying: "A woman gives birth according to her own species, not another species" - no; or perhaps: "Not another species, but the same species?" - let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם אוֹמֵר: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַבְּכוֹר, עוֹשֶׂה מָקוֹם בְּקוֹפִיץ מִיכָּן וּמִיכָּן, וְתוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְזִיזֶנּוּ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ, וְכֵן תּוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר לִרְאוֹת מְקוֹם מוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: one who is slaughtering a firstborn, clears space with a cleaver [ bekofitz ] from here and from there, plucks the hair. provided that he does not move from its place; And likewise, one plucks the hair to examine the place of a blemish
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: One who slaughters the firstborn, he makes a place with a knife from here and from here, and he peels the hair, but only so that he does not move it from its place, and likewise he peels the hair to see the blemish.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר תּוֹלֵשׁ לָאו הַיְינוּ גּוֹזֵז, וּבְיוֹם טוֹב אָסוּר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ עוֹקֵר דָּבָר מִגִּידּוּלוֹ.
human_translation: Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam. raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: What is the parallel on a Festival? the reason of Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam: because he holds plucking is not shearing, and it is prohibited on the Festival, as this is uprooting an item from its growth?
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav: Halacha like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam. He asked from Rav Huna: What about on a festival day opposite him? The reason of Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam is because he holds that twisting is not the same as cutting, and on a festival day it is prohibited, as it involves uprooting something from its growth.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּעָלְמָא סָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם תּוֹלֵשׁ הַיְינוּ גּוֹזֵז, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּשְׁרֵי, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, וּבְיוֹם טוֹב דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר?
human_translation: Or perhaps in general Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam holds plucking is shearing. And this is the reason that it is permitted as it is an unintentional act, and on a Festival an unintentional act is permitted.
llm_translation: Or perhaps in general, Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam holds that extracting is like cutting, and the reason it is permitted is because it involves an unintended consequence, and on a festival, an unintended consequence is permitted?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ שַׁיְילוּהּ לְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל, אִי אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם, אֶיפְשׁוֹט לְכוּ. אֲתוֹ שַׁיְילוּהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב מוּתָּר. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְיָה בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב
human_translation: said to them: Go ask Rav Ḥananel, if said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam, I will explain to you They went asked he said to them this is what Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam. They came before Rav Huna, he said to them: the parallel on a Festival, permitted It was also stated Rav Ḥananya bar Shelamya says in the name of Rav: the parallel on a Festival,
llm_translation: He said to them: Go inquire of Rav Hananel, if he says the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam, you may act accordingly. They went and inquired of him, he said to them: Thus said Rav: the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam. They came before Rav Huna, he said to them: It is permitted to oppose him on a festival day. It was also stated: Rav Hananya bar Shelemya said in the name of Rav: It is permitted to oppose him on a festival day.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר.
human_translation: permitted
llm_translation: Permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: מְסוֹכַרְיָא דְּנַזְיָיתָא אָסוּר לְהַדּוֹקַיהּ בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא!
human_translation: And does Rav say this? But doesn’t Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi say in the name of Rav: this stopper of a barrel [ mesokhrayya denazyata ], prohibited to it tightly on a Festival,
llm_translation: And who said so, Rav Haki? But didn't Rav Hiyya son of Ashe say in the name of Rav: "The palm branches of the city of Natzayta are forbidden to be beaten on a good day!"

hebrew_text: בְּהָהִיא, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֶה, דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּפְסִיק רֵישֵׁיהּ וְלָא יְמוּת.
human_translation: In that even Rabbi Shimon, concedes as Rava and Abaye both say: Rabbi Shimon concedes Cut off its head and will it not die,
llm_translation: In that case, even Rabbi Shimon agrees, as Abbaye and Rava both said: Rabbi Shimon agrees in a case of "p'sik reishei" and he does not die.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מַתְנֵי בְּלָא גַּבְרֵי: רַב אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן!
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi say Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Rav Ḥanan bar Ami Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin teaches without man, Rav says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And this, Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And Rav Ḥanan bar Ammi said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin teaches without specifying individuals: Rav said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם סָבַר רַב: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין אָסוּר, וְתוֹלֵשׁ לָאו הַיְינוּ גּוֹזֵז, וּבְיוֹם טוֹב הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּשְׁרֵי — דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ עוֹקֵר דָּבָר מִגִּידּוּלוֹ כִּלְאַחַר יָד.
human_translation: Rather, actually Rav holds an unintentional act is prohibited, and plucking is not shearing. And this reason permits on a Festival, because it is uprooting an item from its growth in an unusual manner,
llm_translation: Rather, always Rav thought: a matter that is not intended is forbidden, and removing is not the same as cutting, and on a festival, that is the reason it is permitted - because it is considered uprooting a matter from its growth, as an afterthought.

hebrew_text: וְתוֹלֵשׁ לָאו הַיְינוּ גּוֹזֵז? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַתּוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַכָּנָף, וְהַקּוֹטְמוֹ, וְהַמּוֹרְטוֹ — חַיָּיב שָׁלֹשׁ חַטָּאוֹת. וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: תּוֹלֵשׁ — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם גּוֹזֵז, קוֹטֵם — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם מְחַתֵּךְ, מְמָרֵט — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם מְמַחֵק! שָׁאנֵי כָּנָף, דְּהַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: And plucking is not shearing? But isn’t it taught One who plucks the wing and one who snips and one who pulls out obligated three sin offerings, And Reish Lakish says, plucks liable due to shearing. snips liable due to cutting. pulls out liable due to smoothing. a wing is different as that is the normal
llm_translation: And one who plucks out, is that not the same as shearing? And it was taught: One who plucks out the wing, and the crop, and the gizzard — is liable for three sin-offerings. And Reish Lakish said: Plucking out — liable due to shearing, cutting — liable due to cutting, scraping — liable due to scraping! This is different from the wing, which is its normal way.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּרַב סָבַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב, וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין אָסוּר?
human_translation: And from that Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam holds in accordance with Rav And Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam hold an unintentional act is prohibited?
llm_translation: From Rav who holds like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam, Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam holds like Rav, and Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam holds that something that is not intended is prohibited?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — עִיקָּרָן מַאֲדִים, וְרֹאשָׁן מַשְׁחִיר, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם אוֹמֵר: גּוֹזֵז בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught two hairs whose roots were red but whose tops were black, Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: One shears with scissors, and not concerned
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Two hairs - their main part is red, and their tip is black. Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: One may cut them with scissors and there is no concern.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה, דְּלָאו בַּת גִּיזָּה הִיא. וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תַעֲבֹד בִּבְכֹר שׁוֹרֶךָ וְלֹא תָגֹז בְּכוֹר צֹאנֶךָ״, וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא שׁוֹר בַּעֲבוֹדָה וְצֹאן בְּגִיזָּה, מִנַּיִן לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְאֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲבֹד... וְלֹא תָגֹז״!
human_translation: heifer is different, as it is not subject to shearing But isn’t it taught “You shall do no work with the firstborn of your ox, and you shall not shear the firstborn of your flock” I have only ox for labor and sheep for shearing. From where to apply what is said about that to this and about this to that The verse states: “You shall do no work…and you shall not shear.”
llm_translation: The Mishnah states: "A cow that has not given birth before is not considered the firstborn of a cow." And it was taught in a Baraita: "You shall not work with the firstborn of your ox, nor shear the firstborn of your sheep." I only have an ox for labor and a sheep for shearing, how do I know to apply what is said about one to the other and what is said about the other to the one? The Talmud teaches: "You shall not work... nor shear!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הִיא. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת אֲסוּרִין בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה! מִדְּרַבָּנַן. וְהָאִיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא דְּרַבָּנַן! אֶלָּא, שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: Rather, heifer is different, as of consecrated for Temple maintenance, But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say prohibited to shear or labor consecrated for Temple maintenance? by rabbinic law. But there is a prohibition by rabbinic law. Rather, heifer is different, as it is uncommon,
llm_translation: Rather, the case is different regarding the ashes of the red heifer, for they are considered sacred items of the Temple courtyard. And didn't Rabbi Elazar say: The sacred items of the Temple courtyard are prohibited for personal use and labor! By Rabbinic decree. But where is the Rabbinic prohibition here! Rather, the case is different regarding the ashes of the red heifer, for they are not commonly found.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחַלַּהּ וְלַפְּקַהּ לְחוּלִּין, וְלִיגֻזַּהּ וַהֲדַר לַיקְדְּשַׁהּ! דָּמֶיהָ יְקָרִין. וְלֶיעְבַּד לָהּ כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מְחוּלָּל! אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ, לְכִתְחִלָּה מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: But let desacralize and render it non-sacred, and shear it, and then consecrate it its price is expensive, But let him act in of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: A consecrated worth one hundred dinars that one desacralized upon the value of one peruta is desacralized. say that Shmuel said that he has desacralized did he say ab initio ?
llm_translation: To desecrate and to redeem for mundane purposes, and to cut off and then sanctify it! Its blood is precious. And to work for her as Shmuel said, for Shmuel said: Sanctifying something equivalent to a Maneh that was desecrated is equivalent to desecrating something equivalent to a Perutah! Say, did Shmuel say that it was desecrated in the first place?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם לָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam, Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam does not hold in accordance with Rav.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Rav holds like Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam, and Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam does not hold like Rav.

hebrew_text: וְתוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְזִיזֶנּוּ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בַּיָּד, אֲבָל בִּכְלִי — אָסוּר. וְהָקָתָנֵי: עוֹשֶׂה מָקוֹם בְּקוֹפִיץ מִיכָּן וּמִיכָּן! תְּנִי: ״לְקוֹפִיץ״.
human_translation: plucks the hair. provided that he does not move from its place. Rav Ashi says Reish Lakish says: They taught only by hand, but with a tool prohibited, But isn’t it taught clear space with a cleaver from here and from there Teach for a cleaver,
llm_translation: And he shall untangle the hair, but only without moving it from its place. Rav Ashe said Reish Lakish said: They only taught this regarding the hand, but with a utensil - it is prohibited. And it was taught: One may make a space with a fist from here and from here! Teach: "with a fist."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן תּוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר לִרְאוֹת מוּם. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְכַתְּחִלָּה אוֹ דִיעֲבַד? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: תָּא שְׁמַע, צֶמֶר הַמְסוּבָּךְ בָּאוֹזֶן — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם אוֹמֵר: תּוֹלְשׁוֹ וּמַרְאֶה אֶת מוּמוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And likewise, one plucks the hair to examine the place of a blemish. A dilemma was raised before ab initio , or after the fact? Rabbi Yirmeya said: Come hear wool that is entangled in ear, Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: One plucks and shows blemish conclude from ab initio . conclude from it
llm_translation: And so one untangles the hair to see the blemish. It was asked: initially or after the fact? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: Come and hear, wool that is intertwined in the ear - Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: Untangle it and see its blemish. Hear from it initially, hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, וְכֵן הַתּוֹלֵשׁ אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר לִרְאוֹת מְקוֹם מוּם. מַאי ״וְכֵן״? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא (יָזִיזוּ אֶת) [יְזִיזֶנּוּ מִ]מְּקוֹמוֹ — הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה שׁוֹחֵט, דִּשְׁחִיטָתוֹ מוֹכַחַת עָלָיו, לֹא יְזִיזֶנּוּ — לִרְאוֹת מְקוֹם מוּם מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Rav Mari said: We learn as well: And likewise, one plucks the hair to examine the place of a blemish. What And likewise? If we say that may not move from its place, Now if, one slaughter where its slaughter renders it evident he may not is necessary to examine the place of a blemish?
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: We also learn, and so too one who removes hair to see a blemish. What is the meaning of "so too"? If you say that they should not move it from its place — now, regarding one who slaughters, since his slaughtering is evident upon him, should he not move it — to see a blemish, is it necessary?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו אַתּוֹלֵשׁ? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t to pluck Conclude from it conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, is he not misleading? Learn from it initially, learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׂעַר בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁנָּשַׁר, וְהִנִּיחוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ שְׁחָטוֹ — עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר,
human_translation: the hair of a blemished firstborn that shed and which one placed in a compartment and thereafter he slaughtered Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The firstborn animal with a blemish that was removed, and it was left by the window, and then it was slaughtered - Akavya ben Mahalalel permits it."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא בָּזֶה הִתִּיר עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל, אֶלָּא שְׂעַר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁנָּשַׁר וְהִנִּיחוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת — בָּזֶה עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: and the Rabbis deem prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei said to him: not with regard to that that Akavya ben Mahalalel deemed Rather, the hair of a blemished that shed which one placed in a compartment and thereafter died. in that Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted, and the Rabbis deem prohibited
llm_translation: The sages prohibit, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei said to him: Akavya ben Mahalalel did not permit this, but a blemished animal's hair that fell out and was left by the window, and afterwards it died - in this case Akavya ben Mahalalel permits it, and the sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: צֶמֶר הַמְדוּלְדָּל בַּבְּכוֹר, אֶת שֶׁנִּרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה — מוּתָּר, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: wool that is dangling from a firstborn that which appears of the fleece permitted and that which does not appear of the fleece prohibited.
llm_translation: Wool that is mixed in the first shearing, that which is visible with the fleece - permitted, and that which is not visible with the fleece - forbidden.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּלָל דְּאָסַר, הַשְׁתָּא בְּמֵת — שָׁרֵי, שְׁחָטוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: by inference that deemed prohibited Now a dead is permitted, is it necessary one slaughtered
llm_translation: Gemara: From the general principle that it is prohibited, now in the case of a dead animal — is it permitted, for one must slaughter it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לֹא בָּזֶה הִתִּיר עֲקַבְיָא וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין, שְׁחָטוֹ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שְׁרֵי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמֵת.
human_translation: Rather, not in that Akavya deemed permitted the Rabbis deem prohibited, he slaughtered everyone agrees permitted. They disagree where a dead
llm_translation: Rather, Akavya and the sages did not permit this, that if one slaughters, everyone agrees it is permitted, for they argue in the case of a dead animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁהִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה, דְּמָר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְשַׁהוֹיֵיהּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן, אֲבָל לֹא הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Reish Lakish says: dispute where an expert deemed permitted as Sage, holds we decree lest one come to postpone And Sage, holds we do not a decree. But an expert did not deem permitted all agree prohibited,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said, Reish Lakish said: Dispute when they permitted a blemished animal, for Mar holds: we decree lest it might come to be left, and Mar holds: we do not decree, but they did not permit a blemished animal - the words of all are forbidden.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין אוֹסְרִין בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יְבַקֵּר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection Blemished render prohibited in any And Rabbi Yosei says: Let be investigated.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raises a contradiction: Those with blemishes prohibit in anything, and Rabbi Yosei says: One should inspect.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי ״יְבַקֵּר״? אִלֵּימָא דְּבַעַל מוּם הוּא, וְלִישְׁקְלֵיהּ — מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא אָמַר לָאו?
human_translation: And we discussed it, What Let be investigated? Shall we say that the blemished animal and remove it by inference, the first tanna said not
llm_translation: And we inquire in it: What is "yevaker"? Perhaps it means that it is a blemished animal, and we should weigh it - is this not what the first Tanna said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הָכָא בְּגִיזַּת בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ בְּגִיזֵּי חוּלִּין. וּמַאן תַּנָּא קַמָּא? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: נִשְׁחֲטוּ — אָסְרִי רַבָּנַן. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: נִשְׁחֲטוּ — שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: Here we are dealing with of shearings of a blemished firstborn, whose became intermingled with non-sacred wool. And who is the first tanna , It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says were slaughtered, the Rabbis deem prohibited. And Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning, as he says: were slaughtered, the Rabbis deem permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Here we are dealing with the case of the thigh of a firstborn animal with a blemish, which became mixed with the thighs of non-consecrated animals. And who is the first tanna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: If they were slaughtered — the Rabbis prohibit. And Rabbi Yosei, according to his reasoning, said: If they were slaughtered — the Rabbis permit.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי: ״יְבוּקַּר״, מַאי ״יְבוּקַּר״? לָאו אִי ״מוּם קָבוּעַ״ אִי ״מוּם עוֹבֵר״ הוּא, אַף עַל גַּב שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה.
human_translation: And it is taught Let be investigated. What be investigated? not whether a permanent blemish, whether it is a temporary blemish even though expert deemed permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it is taught: 'Yevukar,' what is 'Yevukar'? Whether it is a 'permanent blemish' or a 'passing blemish,' even though they did not permit a blemish that is concealed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא; יְבוּקַּר, אִי הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה — אִין, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rava said No, should be investigated if an expert had deemed permitted yes, and if not, not
llm_translation: Rava said: No; whether they permitted him or not, if he is a blemished one — no, and if not — no.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רָבִין, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה. אֲמַר: בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּיָתְבִי בְּאַרְעָא דַּחֲשׁוֹכָא אָמְרִי שְׁמַעְתָּא דִּמְחַשְּׁכָן! לָא שְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁבָּדַק וְלֹא מָצָא.
human_translation: When Ravin ascended he stated this halakha , in the presence of Rabbi Yirmeya. said: Foolish Babylonians! Because they dwell in a dark land, they state halakhot that are dim. Did they not hear that which Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute with regard to where one examined and did not find
llm_translation: When Ravin ascended, she said in the presence of Rabbi Yirmeya. He said: In the foolish Babylonians, because they dwell in a land of darkness, they say, "Let us hear the sound of those who darken!" Did they not hear what Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A dispute in a window and did not find.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בְּחֶזְקַת טוּמְאָה — לְעוֹלָם הוּא בְּטוּמְאָתוֹ, עַד שֶׁתִּיוָּודַע הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to the dispute Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis. As we learned that Rabbi Meir would say: Any object that was in the presumptive status of ritual impurity, forever in its ritual impurity, until it becomes known to you the ritual impurity,
llm_translation: And there was a disagreement in the dispute of Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, as we learned: Rabbi Meir used to say, "Anything that was in a state of impurity - it always remains in its impurity until the impurity is acknowledged."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: חוֹפֵר עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְסֶלַע אוֹ לִבְתוּלָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: digging until he reaches bedrock or virgin
llm_translation: The sages say: One may dig until reaching bedrock or a virgin soil.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת כְּשֶׁבָּדַק וּמָצָא, וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan dispute where he examined and found and they disagree with regard to the dispute Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: A dispute like that of Badak and Matza, and they divided in the dispute of Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: שָׂדֶה שֶׁאָבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר, נִכְנָס בְּתוֹכָהּ — טָמֵא. נִמְצָא בְּתוֹכָהּ קֶבֶר, נִכְנָס לְתוֹכָהּ — טָהוֹר, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: הוּא קֶבֶר שֶׁאָבַד הוּא קֶבֶר שֶׁנִּמְצָא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: תִּיבָּדֵק כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: as it is taught a field in which a grave was lost, one who enters it impure If a grave was found in it, one who enters pure, as I say: The grave that was lost is the grave that was found. the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Let the entire field be examined
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A field in which a grave was lost, if one enters it - impure. If a grave is found within it, if one enters it - pure. For I say: It is a grave that was lost, it is a grave that was found, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The entire field should be thoroughly examined.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא? אָמַר לָךְ: בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי טוּמְאָה, אֵימַר בָּא עוֹרֵב וּנְטָלָהּ, בָּא עַכְבָּר וּנְטָלָהּ, אֶלָּא הָכָא — בַּעַל מוּם לְהֵיכָא אָזֵיל? וְאִידַּךְ? אֵימַר מוּם עוֹבֵר הֲוָה וְאִיתַּסִּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Asi, what is the reason he did not state of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba? said to you: Granted, with regard to impurity a raven came and took it a mouse came and took it. But here, where blemished gone? And the other say was a temporary blemish and it was healed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi, what is the reason that he did not say like Rabbi Chiya bar Abba? He said to you: In the case of impurity, one might say a raven came and took it, a mouse came and took it. But here, where does a blemished animal go? And the other? One might say a passing blemish was there and it was removed.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי אַסִּי? אָמַר לָךְ: בִּשְׁלָמָא שָׂדֶה, דִּרְכַּהּ לְמִיקְבַּר בַּהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּקְבַר בָּהּ הַאי — קְבַר אִינָשׁ אַחֲרִינָא. אֶלָּא קָדָשִׁים, כֵּיוָן דִּבְדִקִי לַן וְקָיְימִי, דִּרְכַּיְיהוּ לְמִיפַּל בְּהוּ מוּמָא? וְאִידַּךְ — אַגַּב דִּמְנַגְּחִי אַהֲדָדֵי, שְׁכִיחַ בְּהוּ מוּמָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, what is the reason he did not state of Rabbi Asi? said to you: Granted, a field it is normal be buried in it, just as this was buried in it, another person buried But sacrificial once they were examined and they are normal for them to develop a blemish? And the other Since they gore each other, a blemish is common among them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: What is the reason he did not say like Rabbi Assi? He said to you: In the case of a field, its way is to be buried in it, so that when one is buried in it, another person cannot be buried in it. Rather, with regards to consecrated items, since they are examined and found to be valid, their way is to be buried with a blemish? And the other opinion is: Even though they may collide with each other, a blemish is common in them.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַתּוֹלֵשׁ צֶמֶר מִבְּכוֹר תָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם וּשְׁחָטוֹ — אָסוּר. טַעְמָא דְּתָם,
human_translation: raises an objection one who plucks the wool from an unblemished firstborn, even though it developed a blemish and slaughtered it, prohibited. reason that unblemished.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who shears wool from a firstborn unblemished animal, even though it was born with a defect and he slaughtered it - it is forbidden. The reason is because it is unblemished.

hebrew_text: הָא בַּעַל מוּם שְׁרֵי, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּ מוּמְחֶה! תַּנָּא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלֹא הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה — תָּם קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But a blemished permitted, even though an expert did not deem permitted tanna of calls unblemished wherever an expert did not deem permitted
llm_translation: The one with a blemish is permitted, even though they did not permit the blemished one! It was taught: In every case where they did not permit the blemished one - he is called complete.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַתּוֹלֵשׁ צֶמֶר מִבְּכוֹר תָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם וּשְׁחָטוֹ — אָסוּר. בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁתָּלַשׁ מִמֶּנּוּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת — עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא בָּזֶה הִתִּיר עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל, אֶלָּא בִּשְׂעַר בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁנָּשַׁר וְהִנִּיחוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ שְׁחָטוֹ — בָּזֶה עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , one who plucks the wool from an unblemished firstborn, even though it developed a blemish and slaughtered it, prohibited. a blemished firstborn from which one plucked and it subsequently died, Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted and the Rabbis deem prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda said: not with regard to that that Akavya ben Mahalalel deemed permitted. Rather, of the hair of a blemished firstborn that shed and one placed in a compartment, and thereafter one slaughtered In that Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted, and the Rabbis deem prohibited.
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: One who removes wool from a firstborn unblemished animal, even though a blemish was born in it and it was subsequently slaughtered — it is prohibited. If a firstborn with a blemish was detached from it, and then it died — Akavya ben Mahalalel permits, and the sages prohibit. Rabbi Yehuda said: Akavya ben Mahalalel did not permit in this case, but rather in the case of a firstborn with a blemish whose hair fell out and was left in the window, and then it was slaughtered — in this case Akavya ben Mahalalel permits, and the sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מוֹדֶה אַבָּא חֲלַפְתָּא בְּזֶה שֶׁהוּא מוּתָּר, אֲבָל בְּיִיחוּד אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יַנִּיחֶנּוּ בַּחַלּוֹן, שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ תִּקְוָה. שְׁחָטוֹ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר, מֵת — עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: father, Ḥalafta, concedes in this that is permitted. Indeed [ aval ], the Rabbis said explicitly: One places it in a compartment, perhaps there is a hope he slaughters all agree permitted. dies Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted and the Rabbis deem prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Abba Chalifta agrees that this is permissible, but regarding separation, the sages said: Let him leave it by the window, perhaps there is hope. If it was slaughtered — everyone agrees it is permissible; if it died — Akavya ben Mahalalel permits it, but the sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי — הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אֶלָּא לָאו הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei is the first tanna Rather, is it not between them an expert deem permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei - that is the first Tanna! Rather, did they not permit a blemished one between them?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה — אִין, וְאִי לָא — לָא, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה!
human_translation: As the first tanna holds: an expert deemed permitted yes, but if not, not And Rabbi Yosei comes to say even where an expert did not deem permitted
llm_translation: The first Tanna holds: If they permitted him, it is not valid, and if not, it is not valid. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: Even though they did not permit him, it is still not valid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִי הִתִּירוֹ מוּמְחֶה — אִין, אִי לֹא הִתִּירוֹ — לָא, וְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: פְּלִיגִי בְּמֵת, וְהוּא הַדִּין לִשְׁחָטוֹ, וְהַאי דְּקָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּמֵת — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דַּעֲקַבְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: No, as everyone agrees that if an expert deemed permitted yes, if did not deem permitted not And there are three disputes concerning matter, as the first tanna holds: disagree died, and the same is true, he slaughtered it. And that they disagree died to convey to you the far-reaching of Akavya,
llm_translation: Rava said: No, for the whole world, if they permitted a blemished animal - no; if they did not permit it - no. And there are three disputes on the matter, as the first Tanna holds: they argue about an animal that died, and it is the same to slaughter it, and this one who argues about an animal that died - to inform you of the strength of his reasoning.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בְּמֵת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בִּשְׁחָטוֹ, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: בִּשְׁחָטוֹ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר, כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּמֵת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: died, all, agree prohibited, when they disagree slaughtered And Rabbi Yosei comes to say: Where he slaughtered it, all agree permitted, when they disagree died.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: In the case of a dead animal - the words of everyone are forbidden, for they dispute - in its slaughter. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: In its slaughter - the words of everyone are permitted, for they dispute - in the case of a dead animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן בִּבְחִירָתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: שְׂעַר בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁנָּשַׁר וְהִנִּיחוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ שְׁחָטוֹ — עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מַתִּיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, since we learned in our preferred in accordance with his As we learned the hair of a blemished firstborn that shed and one placed in a compartment, and thereafter he slaughtered Akavya ben Mahalalel deems permitted and the Rabbis deem prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, since we learned in the choice of his words, as we learned: "The hair of a firstborn animal with a blemish that was shorn and left by the window, and then it was slaughtered — Akavya ben Mahalalel permits, and the sages prohibit."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דִּתְנַן: צֶמֶר הַמְדוּלְדָּל בַּבְּכוֹר, אֶת שֶׁנִּרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה — מוּתָּר, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: The mishna is also precisely as we learned wool which is dangling from a firstborn that which appears of the fleece permitted and that which does not appear prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The Mishnah also supports this, as we learned: Wool that is mixed in with the firstborn's fleece, if it is visible with the shearing - it is permitted, but if it is not visible - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי; וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בִּשְׁחָטוֹ — בֵּין עֲקַבְיָא בֵּין רַבָּנַן, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִשְׁרָא שָׁרֵי!
human_translation: whose If we say Rabbi Yosei, But in what If we say where he slaughtered it whether Akavya whether the Rabbis, this and that permitted.
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If you say Rabbi Yosei; And with what? If you say with its slaughter — whether according to the opinion of Akavya or the Rabbis, both are permitted!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בְּמֵת? וְאִי רַבָּנַן — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מֵיסָר אָסְרִי, וְאִי עֲקַבְיָא — אִיפְּכָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: נִרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה — אָסוּר, דְּמִיתָה קָאָסְרָה לֵיהּ; אֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה — מוּתָּר, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא תְּלִישׁ!
human_translation: Rather, where died, But if the Rabbis, this and that prohibited. And if Akavya, should have opposite appears of the fleece prohibited, as death renders it prohibited does not appear of the fleece permitted, as it was detached from the beginning,
llm_translation: But what about with a dead animal? And if it's according to the Rabbis - both are forbidden, and if it's according to Akavya - the opposite is required of him: if it appears with the sinew - it is forbidden, because it resembles it; if it does not appear with the sinew - it is permitted, because fundamentally it is detached!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּמֵת — בֵּין לַעֲקַבְיָא בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מֵיסָר אָסְרִי!
human_translation: Rather, obvious Rabbi Yehuda. And in what If we say to died, whether Akavya whether the Rabbis, this and that prohibited.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious, Rabbi Yehuda, and with what? If you say with a dead animal — whether for the heel or for the Sages, both are forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בִּשְׁחָטוֹ? וְאִי עֲקַבְיָא — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִשְׁרָא שָׁרֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן הִיא? וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בִּשְׁחָטוֹ פְּלִיגִי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not to he slaughtered And if Akavya, this and that is permitted. Rather, is it not is the Rabbis? And conclude from it disagree in he slaughtered conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, is it not referring to its slaughter? And if Akavya, both this and that are permitted! Rather, is it not a Rabbinic decree? And learn from it: They dispute regarding its slaughter. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: הַתּוֹלֵשׁ צֶמֶר מֵעוֹלָה תְּמִימָה, מַהוּ? תּוֹלֵשׁ? מִי אִיכָּא מַאן דְּשָׁרֵי? אֶלָּא, צֶמֶר שֶׁנִּתְלַשׁ מֵעוֹלָה תְּמִימָה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai raises a dilemma: one who plucks wool from an unblemished burnt offering what is plucks is there anyone who deems permitted? Rather, wool that was torn out from an unblemished burnt offering, what is
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Yannai: one who plucks wool from a live, unblemished animal, what is the ruling? Plucking? Who is the one who permits it? Rather, wool that was plucked from a live, unblemished animal, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: דְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּכֵיוָן דִּלְכַפָּרָה אָתוּ — לָא מְשַׁהוּ לְהוּ. דִּבְכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי, דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָאו לְכַפָּרָה אָתוּ — מְשַׁהוּ לְהוּ. כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּעוֹלָה, מַאי? כֵּיוָן
human_translation: Do not raise the dilemma of a sin offering and a guilt offering. Since come for atonement does not keep them of a firstborn and tithe also Since they do not come for atonement one keep them when you raise the dilemma, of a burnt offering. What since
llm_translation: Sin and guilt offering do not require for you, for since they come for atonement - they do not delay for him. But firstborn and tithe, since they do not come for atonement - they delay for him. When you require for yourself a debt, what is it? Since

hebrew_text: דְּעִיקַּר לָאו לְכַפָּרָה אָתֵי — מְשַׁהֵי לַהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּעוֹלָה נָמֵי מְכַפְּרָא אַעֲשֵׂה — לָא מְשַׁהֵי לַהּ?
human_translation: being brought for atonement not primary one keep it? Or perhaps, since a burnt offering also effects atonement for a positive one does not keep
llm_translation: The primary purpose is not for atonement - it comes to it, or perhaps, since it also achieves atonement, should I not do it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַתּוֹלֵשׁ צֶמֶר מִבְּכוֹר תָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם, שְׁחָטוֹ — אָסוּר. טַעְמָא דְּתוֹלֵשׁ, הָא נִתְלַשׁ — שָׁרֵי, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן עוֹלָה דְּלָא מְשַׁהֵי לַהּ!
human_translation: Come hear one who plucks the wool from an unblemished firstborn, even though it developed a blemish slaughtered it, prohibited. reason because he plucks But it was torn out permitted. And all the more so a burnt offering, where one does not keep
llm_translation: Listen: One who plucks wool from a firstborn unblemished animal, even though a blemish was born in it, if he slaughters it — it is forbidden. The reason for plucking is that when it is detached, it is permitted, and all the more so an offering that is not left for it!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין אֲפִילּוּ נִתְלַשׁ נָמֵי אָסוּר, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״תּוֹלֵשׁ״ לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דַּעֲקַבְיָא, דִּבְבַעַל מוּם אֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹלֵשׁ נָמֵי שָׁרֵי.
human_translation: the same is true even was torn out also prohibited. And that teaches plucks, is to convey to you the far-reaching of Akavya as a blemished even one plucks permitted.
llm_translation: He, the same, even if detached, prohibited. And this that is taught "detached" to inform you of its strength, for in a blemished animal even if detached, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן ״נָשַׁר״ תְּנַן! תְּנָא ״נָשַׁר״ לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן, תְּנָא ״תּוֹלֵשׁ״ לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דַּעֲקַבְיָא.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn was shed taught was shed to convey to you the far-reaching of the Rabbis, taught one plucks to convey to you the far-reaching Akavya.
llm_translation: And we, "Nashar," we learned! It was taught, "Nashar" to inform you of the strength of the Rabbis. It was taught, "Tolesh" to inform you of the strength of Akavya.

hebrew_text: צֶמֶר הַמְדוּלְדָּל כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי ״אֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה עִם הַגִּיזָּה״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּל שֶׁעִיקָּרוֹ הָפוּךְ כְּלַפֵּי רֹאשׁוֹ. רַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְמַעֵךְ עִם הַגִּיזָּה.
human_translation: wool that is dangling What is considered: That which does not appear of the fleece? Rabbi Elazar says Reish Lakish says: any whose root is overturned toward the top, Rav Natan bar Oshaya says: any that is not compressed with the fleece,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tzemer hamduldal ku. Heichi damei 'einu nireh im hagizah'? Amar Rabbi Elazar amar Reish Lakish: Kol she'ikaro hafuch kelapei rosho. Rav Natan bar Oshaya amar: Kol she'eino mitma'ekh im hagizah." English translation: "The fine wool is like this. How is it similar to 'it does not appear with the shearing'? Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Reish Lakish: Everything whose main part is turned towards its head. Rav Natan bar Oshaya said: Everything that does not cling to the shearing."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: קָסָבַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַגִּיזָּה בְּלֹא נִימִין הַמְדוּלְדָּלוֹת.
human_translation: And what is the reason Reish Lakish did not state in accordance with Rav Natan bar Oshaya, Rabbi Ile’a says: Reish Lakish holds because it is impossible for fleece without dangling hairs.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, what is the reason he did not say like Rav Natan bar Oshaya? Rabbi Ilai said: Reish Lakish holds that it is impossible to shear without sharp, dangling teeth.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה.
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who acquires an animal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַד כַּמָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיבִין לִיטַּפֵּל בִּבְכוֹר? בַּדַּקָּה — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּבַגַּסָּה — חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּדַּקָּה — שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. אָמַר לוֹ הַכֹּהֵן בְּתוֹךְ הַזְּמַן: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתְּנֶנּוּ לוֹ. וְאִם בַּעַל מוּם הוּא, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי שֶׁאוֹכְלֶנּוּ״ — מוּתָּר. וּבִשְׁעַת הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אִם הָיָה תָּמִים, אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן [לִי] וְאַקְרִיבֶנּוּ״ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Until when must an Israelite tend to a firstborn With regard to a small animal, thirty days, and with regard to a large animal, fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: With regard to a small animal, three months. the priest said to within that period: Give it to me, that may not give it to him. And if it is a blemished and said to him: Give it to me so I may eat it, permitted And at the time the Temple if it is unblemished said to him: Give it to me and I will sacrifice it, permitted
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Until when are the Israelites obligated to redeem the firstborn? In a small animal — thirty days, and in a large animal — fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: In a small animal — three months. If the priest said to him within the proper time, "Give it to me," he may not give it to him. But if it has a blemish, and he said to him, "Give it to me so that I may eat it," it is permitted. And in the time of the Temple, if it was unblemished, and he said to him, "Give it to me and I will offer it," it is permitted.

hebrew_text: הַבְּכוֹר נֶאֱכָל שָׁנָה בְּשָׁנָה, בֵּין תָּם בֵּין בַּעַל מוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״. נוֹלַד לוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ — רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: The firstborn is eaten year by year, whether blemished whether unblemished, as it is stated: “You shall eat it before the Lord your God year by year” a blemish developed within its year, to maintain entire twelve months. after twelve months to maintain only thirty days.
llm_translation: The firstborn is eaten year by year, whether perfect or blemished, as it is stated: "Before the Lord your God, you shall eat it year by year." If a blemish is born in it during its year, one is permitted to maintain it for a full twelve months. After twelve months, one is only permitted to maintain it for thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּתֶּן לִּי״, ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְצֹאנֶךָ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Kahana said: as the verse states: you shall give to Me your firstborn sons. So you shall do with your sheep;
llm_translation: Gemara: What are the benefits of words? Rav Kahana said: As the verse says, "You shall give Me the firstborn of your sons," "So you shall do with your sheep."

hebrew_text: ״מְלֵאָתְךָ וְדִמְעֲךָ לֹא תְאַחֵר״, ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְשׁוֹרְךָ״.
human_translation: “You shall not delay the fullness of your harvest, and of the outflow of your presses…So you shall do with your oxen”
llm_translation: "Your fullness and your tears you shall not delay," "So shall you do to your ox."

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּמַקְדַּם לְמַקְדַּם, דִּמְאַחַר לְדִמְאַחַר. אַדְּרַבָּה, דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ!
human_translation: reverse It stands to reason that is earlier to that is earlier that is later to that is later On the contrary, that is closer to to that is closest to it.
llm_translation: Opposite I! It is arranged from ancient to ancient, from later to later. On the contrary, that it is adjacent to be adjacent!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״, הוֹסִיף לְךָ הַכָּתוּב עֲשִׂיָּיה אַחֶרֶת בְּשׁוֹרְךָ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says the verse states: “So you shall do the verse adds an extra doing for you in your oxen.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The verse says "you shall make," the Scripture added for you to make another one with your ox.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: שִׁיתִּין! לֹא מְסָרְךָ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַחֲכָמִים.
human_translation: But say sixty the verse was given only to the Sages,
llm_translation: And why? Sixty! The verse did not deliver to you except to the sages.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּתֶּן לִי״, ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְצֹאנֶךָ״ — יָכוֹל אַף לְשׁוֹרְךָ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ — הוֹסִיף לְךָ הַכָּתוּב עֲשִׂיָּיה אַחֶרֶת בְּשׁוֹרְךָ, לֹא מְסָרְךָ הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַחֲכָמִים.
human_translation: This is also taught you shall give to Me your firstborn sons. So you shall do with your sheep; might also to your oxen. the verse states: “You shall do.” The verse adds an extra doing for you in your oxen, the verse was given only to the Sages.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me," "So you shall do with your sheep" — Can it also apply to your ox? The verse teaches: "You shall do" — the Scripture added for you another action with your ox, the Scripture only handed you over to the sages.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: עַד כַּמָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיבִין לְהִטַּפֵּל בִּבְכוֹר? בִּבְהֵמָה דַּקָּה — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, בְּגַסָּה — חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּדַּקָּה — שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁטִּפּוּלָהּ מְרוּבָּה. תָּנָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׁינֶּיהָ דַּקּוֹת.
human_translation: From here stated: Until when must an Israelite tend to a firstborn With regard to a small thirty days, and with regard to a large fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: With regard to a small three months, because its tending is extensive, taught because its teeth are small
llm_translation: From here they said: Until how much are the Israelites obligated to redeem a firstborn? In a small animal - thirty days, in a large animal - fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: In a small animal - three months, because its redemption is more frequent. It was taught: Because its teeth are sharp.

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר לוֹ הַכֹּהֵן בְּתוֹךְ הַזְּמַן ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתֵּן לוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּכֹהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: the priest said to within that period: Give it to me, that may not give it to him. What is the reason? Rav Sheshet says: Because appears like a priest who assists at the threshing floor
llm_translation: If he said to him within the time, "Give it to me," behold, this he shall not give to him. What is the reason? Rav Sheshet said: Because it appears as if he is a priest assisting in the granary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם וְהָעֲנִיִּים הַמְסַיְּיעִים בְּבֵית הָרוֹעִים, וּבְבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת, וּבְבֵית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִם — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהֶם תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר בִּשְׂכָרָן, וְאִם עוֹשִׂין כֵּן חִילֵּלוּ, וַעֲלֵיהֶן הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״שִׁחַתֶּם בְּרִית הַלֵּוִי״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת קׇדְשֵׁי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא תְחַלְּלוּ וְלֹא תָמוּתוּ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught the priests, the Levites, and the poor who assist in the home of the shepherd, or at the threshing floor, or in the slaughterhouse, one may not give them teruma or tithe as their wages. And if one did so, he desecrated And with regard to them the verse states: you have corrupted the covenant of Levi, And states: and you shall not desecrate the sacred items of the children of Israel, that you shall not die”
llm_translation: The sages taught: Kohanim, Leviim, and poor people who assist in the upkeep of the flock, in the granaries, and in the kitchens - one does not give them terumah and ma'aser from their wages. And if they do so, they profane the sanctity of these gifts, and regarding them the verse says: "You have corrupted the covenant of Levi" and it says: "And you shall not desecrate the holy things of the children of Israel, lest you die."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִיתָה לָא — תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְאֶת קׇדְשֵׁי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא תְחַלְּלוּ וְלֹא תָמוּתוּ״.
human_translation: What And states? And if you would say not death, come hear “And you shall not desecrate the sacred items of the children of Israel, that you shall not die”
llm_translation: What is "and he shall say"? And if you say: "It does not involve death" - come and hear: "And you shall not profane My holy name, but I will be sanctified among the children of Israel."

hebrew_text: וּבִקְּשׁוּ חֲכָמִים לְקוֹנְסָן, וְלִהְיוֹת מַפְרִישִׁין עֲלֵיהֶן תְּרוּמָה מִשָּׁלֵם, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא קְנָסוּם? דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מִן הַפְּטוּר עַל הַחִיּוּב.
human_translation: And the Sages wished to penalize and to separate in their complete teruma , And for what not penalize them? Perhaps come to separate from exempt on obligation
llm_translation: The sages sought to penalize them, and to separate from them a contribution from the payment, and why did they not penalize them? Perhaps it will come to exempt from the obligation.

hebrew_text: וּבְכוּלָּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן
human_translation: And in all of there is
llm_translation: And in all of them there is.

hebrew_text: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: benefit of discretion for the owners
llm_translation: Good is the benefit for the owners.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ תְּרוּמָה מִכִּרְיוֹ, וּמְצָאוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״הֵא לְךָ סֶלַע זֶה, וּתְנֵהוּ לְבֶן בִּתִּי כֹּהֵן״ — מוּתָּר. אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן — אָסוּר.
human_translation: How so? an Israelite who separated teruma from his pile and another Israelite found him and said to him: Take this sela for yourself and give to my daughter’s son a priest, permitted. if it was a priest to priest, prohibited.
llm_translation: How so? If a Israelite separated terumah from his produce, and another Israelite found it, and he said to him: "Here, take this rock and give it to the son of my daughter, the Kohen" — it is permitted. If the Kohen was a Kohen to a Kohen — it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָאָמַר מַתְּנוֹת כְּהוּנָּה? אָמַר לָךְ: תְּרוּמָה, דִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף הִיא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָא מִתַּחֲלָא — לָא אָתֵי לְמִיטְעֵי בַּהּ.
human_translation: And tanna what is the reason he does not state gifts of the priesthood, he said to you: teruma , which has inherent sanctity, which cannot be redeemed, will not come to err with it
llm_translation: And it was taught: What is the reason that he did not say "gifts of priesthood"? He said to you: Terumah, for it is the sanctity of the body, since if it is not redeemed, it does not come to be mixed with it.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי, כֵּיוָן דִּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים נִינְהוּ, אָתֵי לְמִיטְעֵי בְּהוֹן, דְּבַר מִיתַּחַל קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ אַאַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי, וְאָתֵא לְמִינְהַג בְּהֹן מִנְהָג דְּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: these since they have sanctity value, come to err with them that sanctity can be redeemed with four zuz , and come to treat them in the manner that non-sacred
llm_translation: These, since holiness of blood they are, come to mix with them, a matter of holiness of theirs four zuz, and comes to conduct with them the conduct of mundane matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תְּרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם כֹּהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגְּרָנוֹת. רַב חָמָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava says: Teruma from outside of Eretz does not have due to a priest assisting at the threshing floor. Rav Ḥama gave to his servant,
llm_translation: Rava said: An offering outside the land - it does not have the status of a priest assisting in the granary. Rav Hama gave it to his attendants.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — בְּטֵילָה בְּרוֹב. רַבָּה מְבַטְּלָהּ בְּרוֹב, וְאוֹכֵל לָהּ בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: Teruma from outside of Eretz is nullified in a majority, Rabba, nullify in a majority and eat it during his days of impurity.
llm_translation: Samuel said: A contribution outside the land - nullified by the majority. Rabbah nullifies it by the majority, and he may eat it during his impurity days.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, כִּי מִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ חַמְרָא דִּתְרוּמָה, הֲוָה רָמֵי תְּרֵי נַטְלֵי דְּחוּלִּין וַחֲדָא נַטְלָא דִּתְרוּמָה, וְשָׁקֵיל חַד. מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ, רָמֵי חֲדָא וְשָׁקֵיל חֲדָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, when he would happen wine of teruma would pour two jugs of non-sacred and one jug of teruma and take out one from here onward pour one and take out one
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua, when they would tithe wine for him, would lift two baskets of common wine and one basket of tithe wine, and take one. From then on, he would lift one and take one.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַפְרִישׁ.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: Teruma from outside of Eretz proceed to eat and afterward separate
llm_translation: And said Shmuel: "Terumat chutzah to the land, eating and walking, and afterwards separates."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין תְּרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ אֲסוּרָה אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁהַטּוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ, וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בַּאֲכִילָה, אֲבָל בִּנְגִיעָה — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: Teruma from outside of Eretz is prohibited only whose impurity comes from his body, And this statement, with regard to eating But with regard to touching we have no with it.
llm_translation: And Samuel said: The terumah of the courtyard is not forbidden to the land except for one upon whom impurity has emanated from his body, and these matters are regarding eating, but regarding touching - we do not have it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הִילְכָּךְ, נִדָּה קוֹצָה חַלָּה, וְאוֹכֵל לָהּ כֹּהֵן קָטָן, וְאִי לֵיכָּא כֹּהֵן קָטָן — שָׁקְלָה לַהּ בְּרֵישׁ מַסָּא, וְשָׁדְיָא בְּתַנּוּרָא, וַהֲדַר מַפְרְשָׁא חַלָּה אַחֲרִיתִי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֹא תִּשְׁתַּכַּח תּוֹרַת חַלָּה, וְאוֹכֵל לָהּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Ravina says: Therefore, a menstruating woman, may separate ḥalla and a minor priest, may eat it. And if there is no minor priest she takes with the top of a skewer [ massa ] and throws it in the oven, and then separates another ḥalla , so that the category of ḥalla should not be forgotten. And an adult priest eat it,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Therefore, if a menstruating woman baked a loaf of bread, and a young priest ate from it, and if there is no young priest available — she should take it to the head of the tax collectors, and throw it into the oven, and then separate another loaf, so that the law of separating challah should not be forgotten, and a high priest may eat from it.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן וְרַב עַמְרָם וְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאַרְבָּא, סְלֵיק רַב עַמְרָם לְאִפְּנוֹיֵי, אֲתַאי הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא עַלַּת קַמַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: טְמֵא מֵת מַהוּ שֶׁיִּטְבּוֹל וְאוֹכֵל תְּרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman, Rav Amram, and Rami bar Ḥama were traveling in a ferry. Rav Amram went to relieve himself. A certain woman came before said to them: impure a corpse, what is with regard to he may immerse and partake of teruma from outside of Eretz Rav Naḥman said to Rami bar Ḥama:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman and Rav Amram and Ramei bar Hama were walking in the evening. Rav Amram went ahead of them, a certain woman came before them, she said to them: "One who is impure due to contact with a corpse, what should he do to immerse and eat Terumah outside the land?" Rav Nachman said to Ramei bar Hama:

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַזָּאָה יֵשׁ לָנוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לָא לֵיחוּשׁ לֵיהּ לְסָבָא. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא רַב עַמְרָם, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: טְמֵא מֵת טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: But do we have sprinkling Rami bar Ḥama said to him: Shouldn’t be concerned for of the old man, Meanwhile, Rav Amram came He said to them this Rav says: impurity a corpse may immerse and partake of teruma from outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And do we have the concept of 'hazah'? Ramei bar Ḥama said to him: We should not be concerned about an elder. Meanwhile, Rav Amram came and said to them: So said Rav: One who is impure due to contact with a corpse may immerse and eat terumah outside the land."

hebrew_text: וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: טְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ טוֹבֵל וְאוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמַת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ.
human_translation: But the halakha not in accordance with his Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Sheshet: impure a creeping animal may immerse and partake of teruma from outside of Eretz But the halakha not in accordance with his
llm_translation: And there is no halakha like his, for Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Sheshet: A person who is impure due to contact with a creeping thing may immerse and eat terumah outside the land, and there is no halakha like his.

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר נֶאֱכָל שָׁנָה בְּשָׁנָה כּוּ׳. מִדְּקָאָמַר ״נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ״, לְמֵימְרָא דִּלְשָׁנָה דִּידֵיהּ מָנֵינַן. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: The firstborn animal is eaten year by year, From that says: If a blemish developed within its year, to say that we count to its year, From where is this matter
llm_translation: Firstborn is eaten year by year. From where is it stated "if a blemish is born in it within its year," to say that we count according to its own year. From where are these matters?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״, אֵיזוֹהִי שָׁנָה שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת בַּחֲבֶרְתָּהּ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: שָׁנָה שֶׁל בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: as Rav Yehuda says Rav says that the verse states: “You shall eat it before the Lord your God, year by year [ shana beshana ] Which year enters another You must say year of the firstborn
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״, אֵיזוֹהִי שָׁנָה שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת בַּחֲבֶרְתָּהּ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: שָׁנָה שֶׁל בְּכוֹר." English translation: "As Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, as the verse states: 'Before the Lord your God you shall eat it year by year,' which year enters with its companion? One should say: the year of the firstborn."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַב תָּנָא: ״שָׁנָה בְּשָׁנָה״ — יוֹם אֶחָד בְּשָׁנָה זוֹ, וְיוֹם אֶחָד בְּשָׁנָה זוֹ, לִימֵּד עַל הַבְּכוֹר שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: The school of Rav taught “year by year.” one day of this year and one day of that year. taught with regard to firstborn that it is eaten for two days and one night,
llm_translation: In the academies of Rav, it was taught: "Year by year" - one day in this year, and one day in this year, to teach regarding the firstborn that it is eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַב, מְנָא לְהוּ? יָלְפִי מִקֳּדָשִׁים, וְקָדָשִׁים גּוּפַיְיהוּ מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא ״כֶּבֶשׂ בֶּן שְׁנָתוֹ״ — שְׁנָתוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְלֹא שָׁנָה שֶׁל מִנְיַן עוֹלָם.
human_translation: From where the school of Rav They derive it from sacrificial And sacrificial themselves, from where do we Rav Aḥa bar Yaakov says the verse states: a lamb in its first year its year, and not a year of the counting of the world.
llm_translation: In the study hall of Rav, how do they count? According to the sanctuaries, and from where do they derive the sanctuaries themselves? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The verse states "a one-year-old lamb" - its own year, and not a year from the count of the world.

hebrew_text: וְרַב, נֶאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד, מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״וּבְשָׂרָם יִהְיֶה לָּךְ כַּחֲזֵה הַתְּנוּפָה וּכְשׁוֹק הַיָּמִין״ — הִקִּישׁוֹ הַכָּתוּב לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק שֶׁל שְׁלָמִים: מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד, אַף כָּאן שְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד.
human_translation: And Rav, from where does he is eaten for two days and one night? He derives it from “And their flesh shall be yours, as the breast of waving and as the right thigh, it shall be yours” The verse juxtaposed with the breast and thigh of a peace offering. Just as there, two days and one night, so too here, two days and one night.
llm_translation: Rav, was eaten for two days and one night, how does he count it? It was derived for him from "their flesh shall be for you like the breast of the waving and like the right thigh" — the Scripture juxtaposed the breast and the right thigh of the peace offerings: just as there, two days and one night, so too here, two days and one night.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, אִי מֵהָתָם אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק שֶׁל תּוֹדָה.
human_translation: And the other if from there, it be to say breast and thigh of a thanks offering,
llm_translation: And the other opinion - if not from there, it is possible to say: "A vision and a thigh of thanksgiving."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְךָ יִהְיֶה״ — הוֹסִיף לְךָ הַכָּתוּב הֲוָיָה אַחֶרֶת בִּבְכוֹר.
human_translation: And the other The verse states: it shall be yours” The verse adds another being that a firstborn
llm_translation: And the other one, said the verse: "To you shall be" - the Scripture added to you another entity in the firstborn.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, הָא מֵהָתָם אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: הַאי ״יִהְיֶה לָּךְ״ — לִימֵּד עַל בְּכוֹר בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁנּוֹתְנוֹ לְכֹהֵן, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ לוֹ בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: And the other from there, it is to say this “It shall be yours,” teaches with regard to a blemished firstborn that give it to the priest. as we have not found this anywhere in the entire Torah.
llm_translation: And the other opinion, from there we can infer, there is to say: this "shall be for you" — teaches about a firstborn with a blemish that is given to a priest, for we did not find for him in the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, אָמַר ״וּבְשָׂרָם״ — אֶחָד תָּם וְאֶחָד בַּעַל מוּם, וְאִידַּךְ — ״וּבְשָׂרָם״ דְּהָנֵי בְּכוֹרוֹת דְּכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And the other states: “And their flesh both an unblemished and a blemished And the other “and their flesh” is said to those firstborn of all the Israelites.
llm_translation: And the other one said, "And in their flesh" - one unblemished and one with a blemish, and the other one - "And in their flesh" refers to the firstborn of all the Israelites.

hebrew_text: נוֹלַד לוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ, רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר? נוֹלַד לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ, רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וּלְאַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ נָמֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים? אוֹ דִלְמָא: הֵיכָא דְּנוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ, רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ וְתוּ לָא, וְהֵיכָא דְּנוֹלַד לוֹ אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ, אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים?
human_translation: a blemish developed within its year, permitted to maintain for the entire twelve months; A dilemma was raised before what is speaking? a blemish developed within year, permitted to maintain for the entire twelve months, and after year also thirty Or perhaps where the blemish developed within year permitted to maintain for the entire twelve months, but nothing more; and where it developed after year, he is permitted to maintain it for only thirty
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a blemish was born within his year, he is fit to fulfill it for twelve months. The question was asked: What is he saying? If a blemish was born within his year, he is fit to fulfill it for twelve months, and after his year, even thirty? Or perhaps: where a blemish was born within his year, he is fit to fulfill it for twelve months and not more, and where it was born after his year, he is fit to fulfill it only for thirty? English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: בְּכוֹר בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה לְהַרְאוֹתוֹ לֶחָכָם — רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּמִשֶּׁנִּרְאָה לְהַרְאוֹתוֹ לֶחָכָם, נוֹלַד לוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ — רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear, as it is taught a firstborn in the present until can be shown to an expert, permitted to maintain for two or three years. But once that can be shown to an expert, the blemish developed within its year, permitted to maintain it for the entire twelve months.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for it was taught: Regarding a firstborn in our time, until he is shown to a sage — it is permissible to fulfill the commandment of redeeming him for two or three years, and once he is shown to a sage and a blemish is found in him within his first year — it is permissible to fulfill the commandment every twelve months.

hebrew_text: אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד, וַאֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת. אֲבָל מִפְּנֵי הֲשָׁבַת אֲבֵידָה לַבְּעָלִים, אָמְרוּ: רַשַּׁאי לְקַיְּימוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: After year, does not have permission to maintain it even one day, or even one hour. But due to returning a lost item to the owners, said: is permitted to maintain thirty days.
