llm_translation: After his year, he is not permitted to fulfill it even one day, and even one hour. But due to Shabbat, a lost object is returned to its owners, they said: he is permitted to fulfill it for thirty days.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין תִּיבְּעֵי לִי: שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ, אוֹ דִלְמָא קוֹדֶם שְׁנָתוֹ?
human_translation: But still, let the dilemma be raised thirty days after its year? Or perhaps before its year.
llm_translation: And still you ask me: Thirty days after his year, or perhaps before his year?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נוֹלַד לוֹ מוּם בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ, מַשְׁלִימִין לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, מְסַיַּיע לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: Come hear developed a blemish on the fifteenth day within its year, one completes for it fifteen days after its year. Conclude from this supports of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: one gives thirty days from the time that developed a blemish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: Nolad lo mum baḥamishah asar yom betokh shenato, mashlimin lo ḥamishah asar yom aḥar shenato. Shema minah, mesayai'a leRabbi El'azar, de'amar Rabbi El'azar: Notnin lo shloshim yom misha'ah shenolad bo mum." English translation: "Come and hear: If a blemish was born to him on the fifteenth day within his year, they complete for him fifteen days after his year. Learn from it, it supports Rabbi El'azar, for Rabbi El'azar said: They give him thirty days from the hour in which the blemish was born."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִנַּיִן לִבְכוֹר שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תֹאכְלֶנּוּ שָׁנָה בְשָׁנָה״, (אֵיזוֹ) [אֵילּוּ] הֵן יָמִים הַחֲשׁוּבִין שָׁנָה — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר אֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: There are who say Rabbi Elazar says: From where to a firstborn that developed a blemish during its year that one gives thirty days after its year? as it is stated: “You shall eat it before the Lord your God year by year Which are days that are considered a year? You must say these are thirty days,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we derive that a firstborn in whom a blemish is born within his first year, we give him thirty days after his first year? As it is stated: "Before the Lord your God you shall eat it year by year," (Deuteronomy 15:20) which means what are the days considered a year — one would say these are thirty days.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נוֹלַד לוֹ מוּם בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנָתוֹ — מַשְׁלִימִין לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם אַחַר שְׁנָתוֹ. הַשְׁלָמָה — אִין, מֵיהֲבָא — לָא! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection: developed a blemish on the fifteenth day within its year, one completes for it fifteen days after its year. completing yes, not give him The refutation of Rabbi Elazar a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Challenger: If a blemish is born to him on the fifteenth day within his year - we add fifteen days after his year. Completion - no, from the father - no! The contradiction of Rabbi Elazar, the contradiction.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַבְּכוֹר וּמַרְאֶה אֶת מוּמוֹ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁחַט שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי מוּמְחֶה — אָסוּר. מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּמְחֶה וְרוֹאֶה אֶת הַבְּכוֹר, וְנִשְׁחַט עַל פִּיו — הֲרֵי זֶה יִקָּבֵר, וִישַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: one who slaughters the firstborn and shows its blemish Rabbi Yehuda deems permitted Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered not according to an expert, prohibited. one who is not an expert, and he examined the firstborn and it was slaughtered on the basis of his that must be buried, must pay from his property.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who slaughters the firstborn animal and reveals its blemish - Rabbi Yehuda permits it, Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered without the approval of the inspector - it is forbidden. One who is not an inspector and sees the firstborn animal, and it is slaughtered with his approval - this one shall be buried, and payment shall be made from his own property.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מִשְׁתַּנִּין. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף אַטּוּ דּוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף אַטּוּ דּוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: on the cornea of the eye. everyone agrees that is prohibited, because change They disagree only with regard to blemishes that on the body, As Rabbi Meir holds we issue a decree blemishes that on the body due to on the cornea, and Rabbi Yehuda holds we do not issue a decree blemishes that on the body due to on the cornea.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Regarding the inspection of the eyes - the people of the world do not disagree that it is prohibited, because they change. They only disagreed regarding bodily blemishes, as Rabbi Meir holds: We decree regarding bodily blemishes, then certainly regarding the inspection of the eyes, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not decree regarding bodily blemishes, then certainly regarding the inspection of the eyes.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַבְּכוֹר וּמַרְאֶה אֶת מוּמָיו — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבְּעַיִן אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מִשְׁתַּנִּין, בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף מוּתָּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין מִשְׁתַּנִּין. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מִשְׁתַּנִּין. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מִשְׁתַּנִּין סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף מִי מִשְׁתַּנִּין?! אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי הַמִּשְׁתַּנִּין.
human_translation: This is also taught one who slaughters a firstborn and shows its blemishes Rabbi Yehuda says: on the cornea of the eye prohibited, because change. in blemishes on its body permitted, because do not change. Rabbi Meir says: Both this, and that, are prohibited because they change. enter your mind because they change? Do blemishes on the body change Rather, due to which change.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one slaughters the firstborn animal and examines its blemishes - Rabbi Yehuda says: The scrutinized blemishes in the eyes are forbidden, because they change. But blemishes in the body are permitted, because they do not change. Rabbi Meir says: Both the scrutinized blemishes and the blemishes in the body are forbidden, because they change. Is it your opinion that blemishes in the body change?! Rather, it is because they change.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁחַט שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי מוּמְחֶה אָסוּר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קְנָסָא קָא קָנֵיס רַבִּי מֵאִיר, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: The mishna is also precisely Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered not according to an expert, prohibited. Conclude from Rabbi Meir penalizes Conclude from
llm_translation: Mishnah: Before the court of Daika, Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered not in accordance with the opinion of the inspector, it is forbidden. Learn from it that Rabbi Meir imposed a penalty; learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִפְּנֵי הַמִּשְׁתַּנִּין — דְּכוּלְּהוּ מִשְׁתַּנִּי, אוֹ דִלְמָא אִיכָּא דְּמִשְׁתַּנֵּי וְאִיכָּא דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּנֵּי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Due to which change. But all on change Or perhaps there are that change and there are that do not change.
llm_translation: He asked them: because they change - do they all change, or perhaps there are some that change and some that do not change?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְאַכְחוֹשֵׁי סָהֲדִי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ: כּוּלְּהוּ מִשְׁתַּנִּי — שַׁקָּרֵי נִינְהוּ, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ: אִיכָּא דְּמִשְׁתַּנֵּי וְאִיכָּא דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּנֵּי — סָמְכִינַן עֲלַיְיהוּ. מַאי?
human_translation: What is the difference with regard to contradicting witnesses If you say all change they are liars. But if you say there are that change and there are that do not change, relies on what
llm_translation: For what is this derived? To discredit the witnesses. If you say: they all differ - they are considered false witnesses. And if you say: there are some who differ and some who do not differ - we rely on them. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: שָׂח לִי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּמִן אוּשָׁא, בֹּא וְאַרְאֶךָּ בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁהֵן מִשְׁתַּנִּים. מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״בֹּא וְאַרְאֶךָּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא דְּמִשְׁתַּנֵּי וְאִיכָּא דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּנֵּי.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: Rabbi Yoshiya from Usha told me: Come and I will show you the corneas that change. Since he said to him: Come and I will show you by inference there are that change and there are that do not change.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: "I have conversed with Rabbi Yoshiyah from Usha, come and I will show you examples that change." From the fact that he said to him, "Come and I will show you," it can be inferred that there are examples that change and there are examples that do not change.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּמְחֶה, וְרָאָה אֶת הַבְּכוֹר וְנִשְׁחַט עַל פִּיו, הֲרֵי זֶה יִקָּבֵר, וִישַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ. לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? דִּלְמָא בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: one who is not an expert, and he examined the firstborn and it was slaughtered on the basis of his that must be buried, must pay from his property. Shall we say we learned unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Meir, perhaps the cornea of the eye, and everyone agrees
llm_translation: One who is not an expert, and saw the firstborn and slaughtered it according to his judgment, he shall be buried, and he shall pay from his own property. Let us say: Do we not learn a general principle like Rabbi Meir? Perhaps in cases of sharpness of the eyes, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְשַׁלֵּם — מְשַׁלֵּם רְבִיעַ לַדַּקָּה, וּמֶחֱצָה לַגַּסָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זֶה הֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה, וְזֶה הֶפְסֵד מוּעָט.
human_translation: taught When one pays he pays one-quarter of a small or half of a large What is the reason Rav Pappa says: this is great loss, and that is a small loss.
llm_translation: Mishna: When he pays - he pays a quarter for the fine, and half for the penalty. What is the reason? Rav Papa said: This is a loss of much, and this is a loss of little.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְפוּם פְּסֵידָא לִישַׁלֵּם! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר אִיקָא: מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירַת מְגַדְּלֵי בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: If so, let him pay in accordance with the loss Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ says in the name of Rav Aḥa bar Ika: touched upon it due to the decree raise small livestock
llm_translation: So it is, according to the loss, he shall pay! Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Ika: Because of the decree of the cattle breeders, a thin animal touched it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דָּן אֶת הַדִּין, זִיכָּה אֶת הַחַיָּיב וְחִיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי, טִימֵּא אֶת הַטָּהוֹר וְטִיהֵר אֶת הַטָּמֵא — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, וִישַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ. וְאִם הָיָה מוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין — פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: issued a judgment exempted a liable found an innocent liable, ruled a pure impure ruled an impure pure, what he did is done, and must pay from his home, And if was an expert for court, exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: one who judges a case, if he acquitted the guilty party and found the innocent party guilty, if he declared the impure pure and the pure impure — what he did is done, and he must pay from his own pocket. But if he was appointed by the court — he is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּדָאֵין דִּינָא דִּגְרָמֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא וְנָתַן בַּיָּד.
human_translation: Shall we say we learned unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who rules liability indirect Rabbi Ile’a says Rav says: where took and gave with hand,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Gemara, let us say we learned a simple case like Rabbi Meir, for the law of those who cause? Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rav: For example, one who lifts and places in the hand." (

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חִיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי — כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא וְנָתַן בַּיָּד, אֶלָּא זִיכָּה אֶת הַחַיָּיב הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״פָּטוּר אַתָּה״ — וְהָא לֹא נָשָׂא וְנָתַן בַּיָּד! אָמַר רָבִינָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ מַשְׁכּוֹן וּנְטָלוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Granted, finds an innocent liable where took and gave with hand. But what are the circumstances He exempts a liable if said to You are exempt but did not take and give with hand. Ravina said: where had collateral and took it from him
llm_translation: In truth, he obligated the innocent — for example, if he gave and received by hand, but how did he acquire the liability? If he said to him, "You are exempt" — but he did not give and receive by hand! Ravina said: For example, if he had collateral and he took it from him.

hebrew_text: טִימֵּא אֶת הַטָּהוֹר — דְּאַגַּע בְּהוּ שֶׁרֶץ, טִיהֵר אֶת הַטָּמֵא — שֶׁעֵירְבָן עִם פֵּירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: ruled a pure impure, where had touch a creeping animal ruled an impure pure, where mixed with produce,
llm_translation: Tahor the pure — for he touched a creeping thing, tamei the impure — for he mixed with his fruits.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּפָרָה שֶׁנִּיטְּלָה הָאֵם שֶׁלָּהּ, וְהֶאֱכִילָהּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לִכְלָבִים, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים בְּיַבְנֶה, וְהִתִּירוּהָ.
human_translation: an incident involving a cow whose womb was removed, And Rabbi Tarfon, fed it to the dogs. And the incident came before the Sages in Yavne, and they ruled permitted
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: And there was an incident involving a cow whose calf was taken away from her, and Rabbi Tarfon fed her to the dogs. And the matter came before the sages in Yavneh, and they permitted it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר תּוֹדוֹס הָרוֹפֵא: אֵין פָּרָה וַחֲזִירָה יוֹצְאָה מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם, שֶׁאֵין חוֹתְכִין הָאֵם שֶׁלָּהּ, בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלֵד.
human_translation: And Theodosius [ Todos ] the doctor said: A cow or pig does not emerge from Alexandria of Egypt unless sever its womb so that it will not give birth
llm_translation: And Tudos the physician said: A cow and a pig do not come out from the Alexandrian marketplace of Egypt, because they do not cut the mother so that she will not give birth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: הָלְכָה חֲמוֹרְךָ טַרְפוֹן! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, אַתָּה מוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין, וְכׇל הַמּוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: Your donkey is gone, Tarfon, Rabbi Akiva said to him: Rabbi Tarfon, you are an expert for court, and any expert for court is exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: "The law is as strict as you, Tarfon!" Rabbi Akiva said to him: "Rabbi Tarfon, you are a member of the court, and anyone who is a member of the court is exempt from paying."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ, דְּטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה, וְטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר!
human_translation: But let derive that erred concerning a matter Mishna, and erred concerning a matter Mishna, is revoked,
llm_translation: Gemara: And it should emerge for him, that he erred in a matter of Mishnah, and erred in a matter of Mishnah returns!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא — דְּטָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר, וְעוֹד — אִי נָמֵי בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת טָעִיתָה, מוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין אַתָּה, וְכׇל הַמּוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: states one and another One who errs in a matter Mishna, revoked. Another even if you erred in a deliberation, you are an expert for the public, and any an expert for the public exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: One and furthermore he said: One - that if she erred in a matter of Mishnah she may retract, and furthermore - if indeed in the weighing of the mind you erred, you are a blemisher to the court, and anyone who is a blemisher to the court is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹטֵל שָׂכָר לִהְיוֹת רוֹאֶה אֶת הַבְּכוֹרוֹת — אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עַל פִּיו, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה מוּמְחֶה.
human_translation: who takes payment to be one who examines firstborn one may not slaughter on the basis of his unless he was an expert
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who takes payment to witness the birth of firstborn animals— we do not slaughter based on his testimony, unless he was an expert.

hebrew_text: כְּאִילָא בְּיַבְנֶה, שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ (בְּיַבְנֶה) חֲכָמִים לִהְיוֹת נוֹטֵל אַרְבַּע אִיסָּרוֹת לִבְהֵמָה דַּקָּה, וְשִׁשָּׁה לְגַסָּה, בֵּין תָּם וּבֵין בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: like Ila in Yavne, whom the Sages in Yavne permitted to take four issar for a small animal and six for a large animal. whether unblemished or whether blemished.
llm_translation: Like in Yavneh, where the sages permitted him (in Yavneh) to take four Isarot for a thin animal, and six for a fat one, whether it is unblemished or blemished.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? הַאי נְפִישׁ טִירְחֵיהּ, וְהַאי לָא נְפִישׁ טִירְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason this great effort; but that not great effort.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? This one's argument is strong, and this one's argument is not strong.

hebrew_text: בֵּין תָּם וּבֵין בַּעַל מוּם. בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּעַל מוּם — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא שָׁרֵי לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא תָּם אַמַּאי? דְּאִם כֵּן, אָתֵי לְמִיחְשְׁדֵיהּ, וְאָמְרִי: הַאי בַּעַל מוּם תָּם הוּא, וְהַאי דְּקָא שָׁרֵי לֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם אַגְרָא.
human_translation: whether unblemished or whether blemished. Granted, blemished because he deems permitted but an unblemished why that if so, would come to suspect him and say this blemished unblemished, and deemed it permitted due to wages.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Between tam and ba'al mum. Bislama ba'al mum - mishum deka sharei lei, ela tam amai? De'im ken, atei le'michshedei, ve'amri: hai ba'al mum tam hu, ve'hai deka sharei lei - mishum agra.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תָּם נָמֵי אָמְרִי: בַּעַל מוּם הוּא, וְהַאי דְּלָא קָשָׁרֵי לֵיהּ סָבַר כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִשְׁקוֹל אַגְרֵיהּ זִימְנָא אַחֲרִיתִי! חַד זִימְנָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן, תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי לָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: If so, also state an unblemished this blemished, and this did not deem it permitted he holds so that he can collect his wages another time, The Sages instituted once, the Sages did not institute twice
llm_translation: So it is, the innocent ones said: he is blemished, and this one who does not tie him, he thinks that by doing so, he will weigh his wages at another time! One time the Rabbis established it for him, two times the Rabbis did not establish it for him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹטֵל שְׂכָרוֹ לָדוּן — דִּינָיו בְּטֵילִים, לְהָעִיד — עֵדוֹתָיו בְּטֵילִין, לְהַזּוֹת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ — מֵימָיו מֵי מְעָרָה, אֶפְרוֹ אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה.
human_translation: one who takes his wages to judge his rulings are void. to testify, his testimonies are void. to sprinkle and to sanctify his water is cave water, and his ashes is burnt ashes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who takes his wages to court - his judgments are nullified, to testify - his testimonies are nullified, to sprinkle and sanctify - his water is water of a cave, his ashes are ashes of a stove.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן, מְטַמְּאֵהוּ מִתְּרוּמָתוֹ — מַאֲכִילוֹ וּמַשְׁקוֹ וְסָכוֹ, וְאִם הָיָה זָקֵן — מַרְכִּיבוֹ עַל הַחֲמוֹר, וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ כְּפוֹעֵל.
human_translation: if was a priest, rendered him impure from his teruma , must provide with food, drink, and smearing And likewise if was an elderly person, transports him on a donkey. And gives him his wages like a laborer,
llm_translation: If there was a kohen, they defile him from his terumah — they feed him and give him drink and anoint him, and if he was elderly — they place him on a donkey, and give him his wage as a laborer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״רְאֵה לִמַּדְתִּי אֶתְכֶם וְגוֹ׳״, מָה אֲנִי בְּחִנָּם — אַף אַתֶּם בְּחִנָּם.
human_translation: From where is this matter, Rav Yehuda says Rav says as the verse states: “Behold, I have taught you just as I, for free, so too, you for free,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: "Gemar menahanei milei?" Amar Rav Yehudah Amar Rav, de'amar kra: "Re'eh limadeti etkhem vego." Mah ani bechinam — af atem bechinam. English translation: Gemara: "Have I not taught you something?" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, as it is stated in the verse: "See, I have taught you." Just as I am teaching for free — so too, you should teach for free.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוַּנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהָי״ — מָה אֲנִי בְּחִנָּם, אַף אַתֶּם בְּחִנָּם. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם לֹא מָצָא בְּחִנָּם שֶׁיְּלַמֵּד בְּשָׂכָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱמֶת קְנֵה״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁלְּמַדְתִּיהָ בְּשָׂכָר כָּךְ אֲלַמְּדֶנָּה בְּשָׂכָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱמֶת קְנֵה וְאַל תִּמְכֹּר״.
human_translation: This is also taught as the Lord my God commanded me” Just as I for free, so too, you for free. And from where that if cannot find for free that he should learn by payment? The verse states: “Buy the truth, And from where that should not say: Just as I learned by payment, so too, I will teach it by payment? The verse states: “Buy the truth, and do not sell it.”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "As the Lord my God commanded me" — just as I am teaching for free, so too you should teach for free. And from where do we know that if one did not find teaching for free, that he should learn for payment? The Torah teaches: "Acquire truth." And from where do we know that one should not say: Just as I learned it for payment, so too I will teach it for payment? The Torah teaches: "Acquire truth and do not sell."

hebrew_text: לְהַזּוֹת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ — מֵימָיו מֵי מְעָרָה, אֶפְרוֹ אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה. וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמֵי חַטָּאת בְּאֵפֶר חַטָּאת — הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא יִשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: to sprinkle and to sanctify his water is cave water, and his ashes is burnt ashes. And raises a contradiction one who betroths with the water of purification, or with the ashes of purification, she is betrothed, and even if an Israelite,
llm_translation: To sprinkle and to sanctify - its water is water of a cave, its ashes are ashes of a branch. And they raised a dilemma: one who sanctifies with the water of a sin offering with the ashes of a sin offering - behold, this one is sanctifying, even though he is an Israelite!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא — כָּאן בִּשְׂכַר הֲבָאָה וּמִלּוּי, כָּאן בִּשְׂכַר הַזָּאָה וְקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult, there, with the payment for bringing and filling Here, to payment for sprinkling and sanctifying
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is not difficult - here regarding the reward for coming and escorting, and here regarding the reward for the cup of blessing and sanctification.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי הָכָא ״לְהַזּוֹת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ״, וְהָתָם קָתָנֵי ״הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמֵי חַטָּאת וּבְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: also precise, as it teaches here: To sprinkle, or: To sanctify, and it teaches there, with the water of purification or with the ashes of purification, Learn from it
llm_translation: It is precise, for it is taught here "to sprinkle and to sanctify," and there it is taught "who sanctifies with the water of purification and with the ashes of the red heifer," infer from it.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן מְטַמְּאֵהוּ מִתְּרוּמָתוֹ כּוּ׳. אִיהוּ גּוּפֵיהּ הֵיכִי אָזֵיל?
human_translation: if was a priest, rendered him impure from his teruma , he himself, how go
llm_translation: If a Kohen renders himself impure, his terumah is permitted. How can he himself go?

hebrew_text: לְבֵית הַפְּרָס דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ.
human_translation: to an area in which uncertainty exists concerning the location of a grave or a corpse [ beit haperas ], by rabbinic law As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A person a beit haperas may blow and walk.
llm_translation: To the house of the Persians of the sages, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person may measure out a house of the Persians and walk.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּידַּשׁ טָהוֹר.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda bar Ami says in the name of Rav Yehuda: A beit haperas that has been trodden pure,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Ammi, from the name of Rav Yehudah, said: "The Beis HaPars that was sanctified is pure."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: בִּשְׁאָר טוּמְאוֹת, דְּלָא מַזְהַר עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Alternatively, with other impurity, which are not admonished.
llm_translation: Statement: If so, in other impurities, that he does not take care of them.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה זָקֵן — מַרְכִּיבוֹ עַל הַחֲמוֹר. תְּנָא: כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: If was an elderly person, transports him on a donkey. taught gives him his wage as an idle laborer. Abaye says: as a laborer idle from that labor
llm_translation: If he was old - he places him on the donkey. It was taught: as a worker is nullified. Abaye said: as a worker is nullified in that work.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַבְּכוֹרוֹת, אֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ בְּשַׂר צְבָאִים, וְלֹא עוֹרוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן עֲבוּדִים. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ עוֹרוֹת שֶׁל נְקֵבָה, וְאֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ צֶמֶר מְלוּבָּן וְצוֹאִי, אֲבָל לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ טְוִי וּבְגָדִים.
human_translation: one who is suspect with regard to firstborn one may neither purchase from him, even deer meat, nor hides that are not tanned. Rabbi Eliezer says: One purchase hides of female animals from him, And one not purchase bleached or dirty wool from him. But one purchase spun from him, and garments
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is suspected regarding firstborn animals, we do not take from him the flesh of sacrifices, nor non-consecrated hides. Rabbi Eliezer says: We take from him the hides of female animals, but we do not take from him wool of mixed colors or wool and linen, but we do take from him spun wool and garments.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּשַׂר צְבָאִים. דְּמִיחַלַּף בִּדְעֶגְלָה.
human_translation: deer meat. that confused with of a calf,
llm_translation: "Gema in the flesh of the sacrifices. Demichalaf in the cartilage."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹרוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן עֲבוּדִים. הָא עֲבוּדִים זָבְנִינַן. אִם אִיתָא דִּבְכוֹר הֲוָה — לָא הֲוָה טָרַח בֵּיהּ, סָבַר: אִי שָׁמְעוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן מַפְסְדוּ לֵיהּ מִינַּאי.
human_translation: Nor hides that are not tanned. we purchase tanned if it is so that it is of a firstborn, he would not make an effort with it think: If the Sages hear that cause me a loss from me.
llm_translation: And not skins that are not processed. The, processed, we buy. If it comes that it was a firstborn - it was not a trouble in it, he thought: if the Rabbis heard in it, they would cause him losses.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ עוֹרוֹת שֶׁל נְקֵבָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִידָּע יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One purchase hides of female animals from him, What is the reason? know
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: We may take from it the skins of a female. What is the reason? Because of a known knowledge.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, אִם כֵּן, זָכָר נָמֵי חָיֵיק לְזַכְרוּתֵיהּ וְאָמַר ״עַכְבָּרִים אַכְלוּהּ״, וְאִידַּךְ — בֵּי עַכְבָּרִים מִידָּע יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: But the first tanna , If so, also male sever the male and say mice ate And the other, place of mice is known,
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna, if so, a male is certainly clinging to his memory, and he said, "Mice ate it." And the other opinion is, in the house of mice is immediate knowledge.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ צֶמֶר מְלוּבָּן וְצוֹאִי, הַשְׁתָּא צֶמֶר מְלוּבָּן לָא זָבְנִינַן, צוֹאִי מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא, חֲדָא קָתָנֵי: צֶמֶר מְלוּבָּן מִצּוֹאָתוֹ.
human_translation: And one not purchase bleached or dirty wool from him. Now we not purchase bleached from him, is necessary dirty Rather, is teaching one wool bleached from its dirt.
llm_translation: And one does not take from it wool of melubban and zoi, now wool of melubban we do not buy, zoi is needed? Rather, one teaching: wool of melubban from its teats.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ טְוִי וּבְגָדִים. הַשְׁתָּא טְוִי זָבְנִינַן, בְּגָדִים מִיבַּעְיָא? מַאי בְּגָדִים? נַמְטֵי.
human_translation: But one purchase spun from him, and garments Now we may purchase spun is necessary garments? What Garments? felt [ namtei ]
llm_translation: But we may take from it straw and garments. Now, straw we acquire, but garments are needed? What are garments? They are worn.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית — אֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ פִּשְׁתָּן, וַאֲפִילּוּ סְרָק, אֲבָל לוֹקְחִין מֵהֶם טְוִי וְאָרִיג.
human_translation: one who is suspect with regard to the Sabbatical one may not purchase flax from him, and even combed But one purchase spun and woven from
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is suspected regarding the seventh year produce - we do not take linen from him, even if it is coarse. But we do take from him spun linen and woven linen.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַשְׁתָּא טְוִי זָבְנִינַן, אָרִיג מִיבַּעְיָא? מַאי ״אָרִיג״? תִּיכֵּי.
human_translation: Now we may purchase spun is necessary woven fabric? What Woven? chains,
llm_translation: Gemara: Now, at this time, we are purchasing linen garments. What is "linen garments"? Fine linen.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָשׁוּד לִהְיוֹת מוֹכֵר תְּרוּמָה לְשׁוּם חוּלִּין — אֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ אֲפִילּוּ מַיִם וָמֶלַח, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ זִיקַּת תְּרוּמָה וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת אֵין לוֹקְחִין מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: one who is suspect with regard to selling teruma under the guise of non-sacred one not purchase even water and salt from him; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: One not purchase from him any that has relevance to teruma and tithes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is suspected of selling terumah for common produce - we do not buy anything from him, not even water or salt, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who has a suspicion of terumah and tithes in him, we do not buy anything from him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי קִרְבֵי דָגִים, דִּמְעָרְבִי בְּהוּ שֶׁמֶן זַיִת.
human_translation: What is added to add fish innards as mix olive oil with them,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is meant by "gemar"? To bring close the fish organs, for they become mixed with olive oil.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא טַבָּחָא דַּהֲוָה חָשׁוּד לְזַבּוֹנֵי
human_translation: a certain butcher who was suspected of selling
llm_translation: That butcher who was suspected by the tax collectors.

hebrew_text: תַּרְבָּא דְּאַטְמָא בְּמַר דְּכַנְתָּא, קַנְסֵיהּ רָבָא לְזַבּוֹנֵי אֲפִילּוּ אַמְגּוֹזֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֲפִילּוּ מַיִם וָמֶלַח נָמֵי!
human_translation: fat of the thigh, of fat of the intestines, Rava penalized him even from selling nuts. Rav Pappa said to Rava: In accordance with in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. If it is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, even water and salt.
llm_translation: The increase of impurity in the bitter sap of the kantah plant, Rava penalizes the buyers even if they are experts. Rav Papa said to Rava: According to whom? According to Rabbi Yehuda? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, even water and salt are forbidden!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּבְאִיסּוּרָא דְּגוּפֵיהּ קָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ. סְתָם דַּרְדְּקֵי גְּרוּ בְּאַמְגּוֹזֵי, וְאָזֵיל וּמְשַׁבֵּשׁ לִבְנֵי טַבָּחֵי, וְגָרֵי לְהוּ בְּאַמְגּוֹזֵי, וּמַיְיתוּ לֵיהּ תַּרְבָּא דְּאַטְמָא, וּמְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ בְּמַר דְּכַנְתָּא.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Shimon, And we are penalizing him with regard to the prohibition itself. Ordinary children are enticed by nuts, and went and misled the children of butchers and enticed them with nuts, and they brought him fat of the thigh, and he sold it as fat of the intestines.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Shimon, and in a matter of its own prohibition we penalize him. A case of green lentils in a mortar, and he goes and grinds them for the sons of butchers, and converts them into a mortar, and they bring him a measure of teruma, and they immerse it in a bitter liquid.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית — אֵינוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת, הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת — אֵינוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית. הֶחָשׁוּד עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה — חָשׁוּד עַל הַטְּהָרוֹת, וְיֵשׁ שֶׁהוּא חָשׁוּד עַל הַטְּהָרוֹת — וְאֵינוֹ חָשׁוּד לֹא עַל זֶה וְלֹא עַל זֶה. זֶה הַכְּלָל: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל דָּבָר — לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ.
human_translation: One who is suspect with regard to the Sabbatical is not suspect with regard to tithes; one who is suspect with regard to tithes is not suspect with regard to the Sabbatical One who is suspect with regard to this, or with regard to that, suspect with regard to ritually pure But there are those who are suspect with regard to ritually pure who are not suspect with regard to this, nor with regard to that, This is the principle who is suspect with regard to matter neither adjudicate nor testify
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One suspected of violating the laws of the seventh year produce is not suspected regarding tithes. One suspected of violating tithes is not suspected regarding the seventh year produce. One suspected regarding both is suspected regarding matters of ritual purity. And if one is suspected regarding matters of ritual purity, they are not suspected regarding either. This is the principle: One who is suspected of something is neither judged nor testified against.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? שְׁבִיעִית לָא בָּעֲיָא חוֹמָה, מַעֲשֵׂר — כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֵי חוֹמָה, חֲמִיר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason? not required Sabbatical wall tithe, since required wall stringent for him, Sabbatical
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? The seventh year does not require a wall, but ma'aser — since it requires a wall, it is stringent with it.

hebrew_text: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. מַאי טַעְמָא? מַעֲשֵׂר אִית לֵיהּ פִּדְיוֹן, שְׁבִיעִית — כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מִיתַּסְרָא לֵיהּ וְלֵית לֵיהּ פִּדְיוֹן — חֲמִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: One who is suspect with regard to tithe What is the reason? there is redemption tithes, Sabbatical since it is prohibited to him and there is no redemption stringent for him,
llm_translation: The suspected one regarding the tithe. What is the reason? There is redemption for the tithe, but for the seventh year - since it is forbidden to him and there is no redemption for it - it is stringent for him.

hebrew_text: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲשִׁיד אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: One who is suspect with regard to this, or with regard to that, Since he is suspect by Torah law, all the more so that he by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: The suspected one on this and on this. Since he is suspected of a Torah violation, all the more so of a Rabbinic violation.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ חָשׁוּד עַל הַטְּהָרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? נְהִי אַדְּרַבָּנַן חֲשִׁיד, אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא חֲשִׁיד. וּרְמִינְהִי: נֶאֱמָן עַל הַטְּהָרוֹת — נֶאֱמָן עַל שְׁבִיעִית, הָא חֲשִׁיד — חֲשִׁיד!
human_translation: But there are those who are suspect with regard to ritually pure What is the reason? Granted, suspect by rabbinic law, he is not suspect by Torah law. And raises a contradiction trusted with regard to ritually pure trusted with regard to Sabbatical suspect suspect
llm_translation: And there is suspicion regarding purities. What is the reason? If the Rabbis are suspicious, the Torah is not suspicious. And raise a contradiction: "Trustworthy regarding purities" - trustworthy regarding the seventh year, isn't it suspicious - suspicious!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַי: מַתְנִיתִין כְּשֶׁרְאִינוּהוּ שֶׁנּוֹהֵג בְּצִינְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ilai says: The mishna where they saw him practicing privately, within his home.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said: "Mishnah, when we saw him, that he used to frequent in Tzine'a within his house."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַנַּאי בְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דַּהֲוָה חֲשִׁיד לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ, וַאֲתָא קַמֵּי רַבָּנַן וְקַבֵּיל אַתַּרְוַיְיהוּ, וַהֲדַר אִיחֲשַׁד אַחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, דְּאָמְרִינַן: מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַהָא — חֲשִׁיד נָמֵי אַאִידַּךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, said where one was suspect with regard to both and he came before the Sages and accepted that both of them, and afterward he was suspected with regard to one of them. that we say: Since he is suspect with regard to this he is also suspect with regard to the other
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, said: For example, if he was suspicious of both of them, and he came before the Rabbis and they confirmed one of them, then he should be suspicious of the other, as we say: From the place where he was suspicious here - he should also be suspicious there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית — חָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, the unattributed. But the Rabbis say: suspect with regard to the Sabbatical is suspect with regard to tithe.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the words of Rabbi Akiva, a closed matter; but the Sages say: Suspicion regarding the seventh year produce is suspicion regarding the tithe.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּבְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שְׁבִיעִית חֲמִירָא לְהוּ, דְּהָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָרֵי לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ ״דַּיָּירָא בַּר דַּיָּירְתָּא״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תֵּיתֵי לִי דְּלָא אֲכַלִי פֵּירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית כְּוָותָךְ.
human_translation: Who the Rabbis? Rabbi Yehuda, as in Rabbi Yehuda’s locale they Sabbatical stringent As a certain would call another: A convert, son of convert, say to him I have coming to me, as I do not eat produce of the Sabbatical like you
llm_translation: Who is the Sage? Rabbi Yehuda, who in the place of Rabbi Yehuda the Seventh was stringent with him, for that one who was calling him "Daiyara bar Daiyarta," he said to him: Give me that I not eat Seventh-year fruits like you.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: חָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית. וּמַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: חָשׁוּד לְדָבָר אֶחָד הָוֵי חָשׁוּד לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, the unattributed. But the Rabbis say: suspect with regard to tithe is suspect with regard to Sabbatical And who the Rabbis? It is Rabbi Meir, who says: suspect with regard to one matter is suspect with regard to the entire Torah.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the hidden words of Rabbi Akiva, but the Sages say: Suspicion regarding tithes is suspicion regarding the seventh year. And who are the Sages? It is Rabbi Meir, who said: Suspicion for one matter is suspicion for the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָה וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה תַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי זְעֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹנָה וְרַבִּי זְעֵירָא תַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, חַד אָמַר: אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית
human_translation: Rabbi Yona and Rabbi Yirmeya, students of Rabbi Zeira, And some say Rabbi Yona and Rabbi Zeira, students of Rabbi Yoḥanan, One said: But the Rabbis say suspect with regard to Sabbatical
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonah and Rabbi Yirmeyah, disciples of Rabbi Zeira, and they said to him: Rabbi Yonah and Rabbi Zeira, disciples of Rabbi Yochanan, one said: But the sages say it is forbidden on the seventh year.

hebrew_text: חָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וּמַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְחַד אָמַר: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית, וּמַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: suspect with regard to tithe. And who the Rabbis? Rabbi Yehuda, And one says: One who is suspect with regard to tithe is suspect with regard to Sabbatical And who the Rabbis? Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Accused regarding the tithe, and who are the sages? Rabbi Yehuda, and one said: The accused regarding the tithe is accused regarding the seventh year, and who are the sages? Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת, וְנֶחְשַׁד לְדָבָר אֶחָד — נֶחְשַׁד לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נֶחְשָׁד אֶלָּא לְאוֹתוֹ דָּבָר בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: As it is taught an am ha’aretz , who accepts upon himself the matters ḥaver status, but was suspected with regard to one matter he is suspected with regard to the entire Torah. statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He is suspected only with regard to that particular matter.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: An Am Ha'aretz who accepted upon himself the words of his colleague, and was suspected regarding one matter - he is suspected regarding the entire Torah, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: He is suspected only regarding that specific matter alone.

hebrew_text: הַגֵּר שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲפִילּוּ נֶחְשַׁד לְדָבָר אֶחָד — הָוֵי חָשׁוּד לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, וַהֲרֵי הוּא כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּמָּד. נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ, דְּאִי קַדֵּישׁ — קִידּוּשָׁיו קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: a convert who accepted upon himself matters of Torah, even if he is suspect with regard to one matter he is suspect with regard to the entire Torah, and he is like a Jewish transgressor [ meshummad ], difference that if he betroths his betrothal is betrothal,
llm_translation: The convert who accepted upon himself the words of Torah, even if he is suspected regarding one matter - he is suspected regarding the entire Torah, and he is like a rebellious Israelite. The practical difference is, if he sanctified - his sanctifications are valid.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת, חוּץ מִדָּבָר אֶחָד — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ. גּוֹי שֶׁבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, חוּץ מִדָּבָר אֶחָד — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ דִּקְדּוּק אֶחָד מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who comes to accept upon himself the matters ḥaver status except for one matter, he is not accepted, a gentile who comes to accept the words of Torah except for one matter, he is not accepted Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even one detail of rabbinic law,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who comes to accept the words of his fellow, except for one matter - they do not accept him. A gentile who comes to accept the words of Torah, except for one matter - they do not accept him. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even if it is just one meticulous detail from the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בֶּן לֵוִי שֶׁבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי לְוִיָּה, וְכֹהֵן שֶׁבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי כְהוּנָּה, חוּץ מִדָּבָר אֶחָד — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַמַּקְרִיב אֶת דַּם הַשְּׁלָמִים וְגוֹ׳״, הָעֲבוֹדָה הַמְּסוּרָה לִבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן, כׇּל כֹּהֵן שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹדֶה בָּהּ — אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק בַּכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: And similarly, a Levite who comes to accept the matters of a Levite, or a priest who comes to accept the matters of priesthood, except for one matter, he is not accepted. As it is stated: that sacrifices the blood of the peace offerings, the service, which is handed to the sons of Aaron, any priest who does not admit to it has no share in the priesthood.
llm_translation: And so too, Ben Levi who came to receive the words of Leviyah, and a Kohen who came to receive the words of Kehunah, except for one matter - they do not accept him, as it is stated: "He who offers the blood of the peace offerings, etc." The service entrusted to the sons of Aharon, any Kohen who does not acknowledge it - he has no portion in the priesthood.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת, אִם רְאִינוּהוּ שֶׁנּוֹהֵג בְּצִינְעָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ — מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתוֹ. וְאִם לָאו — מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ, וְהוּא לָמֵד כְּדַרְכּוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who comes to accept upon himself the matters ḥaver status, if we have seen that he practices in private, within his home, he is accepted, and afterward he is taught But if not he is taught and afterward accepted. Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: Whether this or that he is accepted, and he continues to learn in usual manner,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who comes to receive the words of companionship, if we have seen that he is accustomed to be modest within his home - we accept him, and afterwards we teach him. But if not - we teach him, and afterwards we accept him. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: In either case, we accept him, and he learns in his own way and progresses.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְקַבְּלִין לִכְנָפַיִם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְקַבְּלִין לִטְהָרוֹת, וְאִם אָמַר: ״אֵינִי מְקַבֵּל אֶלָּא לִכְנָפַיִם״ — מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ. קִיבֵּל לַטְּהָרוֹת וְלֹא קִיבֵּל לַכְּנָפַיִם — אַף לַטְּהָרוֹת לֹא קִיבֵּל.
human_translation: The Sages taught is accepted with regard to hands, and afterward he is accepted for purity And if he says: I accept only with regard to hands, he is accepted accept with regard to ritual purity but he does not accept with regard to hands, he is not accepted even for purity
llm_translation: The Sages taught: They receive for the wings, and afterwards they receive for the purifications. And if one says, "I only receive for the wings" - they receive him. If he received for the purifications but did not receive for the wings - he did not even receive for the purifications.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַד כַּמָּה מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לְמַשְׁקִין — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, לִכְסוּת — שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Until when is he accepted, Beit Shammai say: With regard to liquids, thirty days. With regard to clothing, twelve months. And Beit Hillel say: Both this, and that, for twelve months
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Until when do they accept him? Beit Shammai says: for immersion - thirty days, for clothing - twelve months. And Beit Hillel says: either this one or that one - for twelve months.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, הָוֵה לֵיהּ מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה לִשְׁלשִׁים.
human_translation: If so, this is of the leniencies of Beit Shammai and of the stringencies of Beit Hillel, Rather, Beit Hillel say: Both this, and that, for thirty
llm_translation: If so, he would have the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel. Rather, Beit Hillel says: "Both this and that are valid for thirty."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: חָבֵר, תַּלְמִיד, תְּכֵלֶת, מֶכֶס, חָזַר, גַּבַּאי, בְּעַצְמוֹ).
human_translation: a mnemonic Ḥaver ; student; sky-blue dye [ tekhelet ]; tax; return; collector; by himself.
llm_translation: Section: Companion, disciple, techelet, covering, returned, treasurer, by himself.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת — צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים, וּבָנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ אֵינָן צְרִיכִין לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ צְרִיכִין לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה חָבֵר שֶׁקִּיבֵּל לְבֶן חָבֵר שֶׁקִּיבֵּל.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who comes to accept upon himself the matters ḥaver status must accept in the presence of three ḥaverim . But his children and members of his household are not required to accept in the presence of three ḥaverim . Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even his children and members of his household must accept in the presence of three ḥaverim , because a ḥaver , who accepted it is not comparable to the son of a ḥaver , accepted
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who comes to accept the words of his fellow must accept them in the presence of three companions, but his sons and the members of his household do not need to accept them in the presence of three companions. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even his sons and the members of his household must accept them in the presence of three companions, because a companion who accepted from his fellow is not comparable to a son of a companion who accepted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת — צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים, וַאֲפִילּוּ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים. זָקֵן וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים, שֶׁכְּבָר קִיבֵּל עָלָיו מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁיָּשַׁב. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף תַּלְמִיד חָכָם אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲבֵירִים, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁאֲחֵרִים מְקַבְּלִין לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who comes to accept upon himself the matters ḥaver status must accept in the presence of three ḥaverim , and even a Torah scholar must accept in the presence of three ḥaverim . an elder who sits in a yeshiva is not required to accept in the presence of three ḥaverim , as he already accepted it upon himself from the moment he sat Abba Shaul says: Even a Torah scholar is not required to accept in the presence of three ḥaverim ; and not only but others accept in his presence.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who comes to accept the words of his colleague - he must accept in the presence of three colleagues, and even a Torah scholar must accept in the presence of three colleagues. An elder who sits in the study hall - he does not need to accept in the presence of three colleagues, for he has already accepted upon himself from the moment he sat. Abba Saul says: Even a Torah scholar does not need to accept in the presence of three colleagues, and not only that, but others accept before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּימֵי בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס נִשְׁנֵית מִשְׁנָה זוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִיסְתַּפַּק לְהוּ מִילְּתָא בִּטְהָרוֹת, שַׁדַּרוּ רַבָּנַן לְגַבֵּי בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס, אֵזִילוּ אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לְעַיֵּין בַּהּ. אַשְׁכְּחוּהּ דְּקָא טָעֵין טְהָרוֹת, אוֹתֵיב רַבָּנַן מִדִּידֵיהּ לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, וְקָאֵי אִיהוּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This mishna, was taught in the days of the son of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei were uncertain about matter of ritual purity. The Sages sent to the son of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus go tell him to examine found him while he was carrying pure. seated Sages from his own next to And he stood and examined
llm_translation: Rabbi Yohanan said: In the days of the son of Rabbi Hanina ben Antigonus, this Mishnah was repeated. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei were in doubt about a matter of purities, so the sages sent to the son of Rabbi Hanina ben Antigonus, they went and said to him: "Examine it." They found that he was mistaken about the purities, so the sages sat opposite him, and he stood to examine it.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ אָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אָבִיו שֶׁל זֶה בִּיזָּה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, אַף הוּא מְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים!
human_translation: came and told Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei Rabbi Yehuda said to them This one’s father, degraded Torah scholars he too, degrades Torah scholars.
llm_translation: They came and said to Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yehuda said to them: "The father of this one was a disgrace to Torah scholars, and he too disgraces Torah scholars!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כְּבוֹד זָקֵן יְהֵא מוּנָּח בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, אֶלָּא מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נָהֲגוּ כֹּהֲנִים סִילְסוּל בְּעַצְמָן, שֶׁאֵין מוֹסְרִין אֶת הַטְּהָרוֹת לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to him: Let the honor of the elder, be left in its place. Rather, from the day the Temple was destroyed, the priests were accustomed to act with a higher standard for themselves, that they will not pass ritually pure to any person.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yosei: The honor of an elder should be placed in its proper place, but since the destruction of the Temple, the priests have accustomed themselves to negligence, for they do not maintain the laws of purity for everyone.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָבֵר שֶׁמֵּת — אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ הֲרֵי הֵן בְּחֶזְקָתָן, עַד שֶׁיֵּחָשֵׁדוּ. וְכֵן חָצֵר שֶׁמּוֹכְרִין בָּהּ תְּכֵלֶת — הֲרֵי הִיא בְּחֶזְקָתָהּ, עַד שֶׁתִּיפָּסֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught a ḥaver that died, his wife and children and members of his household retain their presumptive until they are suspected And similarly, a courtyard in which one sells sky-blue dye, it retains its presumptive until it is disqualified
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A fellow whose wife died—his wife and his sons and the members of his household, behold they are in their presumption, until they are suspected. And similarly, a courtyard in which they sell indigo—behold it is in its presumption, until it becomes disqualified.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵשֶׁת עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְחָבֵר, וְכֵן בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְחָבֵר, וְכֵן עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁנִּמְכַּר לְחָבֵר — כּוּלָּן צְרִיכִין לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת בַּתְּחִלָּה. אֲבָל אֵשֶׁת חָבֵר שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְעַם הָאָרֶץ, וְכֵן בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל חָבֵר שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְעַם הָאָרֶץ, וְכֵן עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל חָבֵר שֶׁנִּמְכַּר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ — אֵין צְרִיכִין לְקַבֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught The wife an am ha’aretz who marries a ḥaver , and likewise the daughter of an am ha’aretz who marries a ḥaver , and likewise the slave of an am ha’aretz who is sold to a ḥaver , must all accept the matters ḥaver status. But the wife of a ḥaver who marries an am ha’aretz , and likewise the daughter of a ḥaver who marries an am ha’aretz , and likewise the slave of a ḥaver who was sold to an am ha’aretz , need not accept the matters ḥaver status ab initio ,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The wife of an Am Ha'aretz who marries a scholar, and similarly the daughter of an Am Ha'aretz who marries a scholar, and likewise the slave of an Am Ha'aretz who is sold to a scholar—all of them must accept the words of camaraderie initially. However, the wife of a scholar who marries an Am Ha'aretz, and similarly the daughter of a scholar who marries an Am Ha'aretz, and likewise the slave of a scholar who is sold to an Am Ha'aretz—they do not need to accept the words of camaraderie initially.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הֵן צְרִיכִין לְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוּת לְכַתְּחִלָּה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְחָבֵר וְהָיְתָה קוֹמַעַת לוֹ תְּפִילִּין עַל יָדוֹ, נִשֵּׂאת לְעַם הָאָרֶץ וְהָיְתָה קוֹשֶׁרֶת לוֹ קִשְׁרֵי מוֹכֵס עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: They too must accept the matters ḥaver status ab initio . And similarly, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar would say in the name of Rabbi Meir: an incident involving a certain woman who married a ḥaver and would tie [ koma’at ] for him phylacteries on his hand, married a tax collector and would tie for him tax seals on his hand,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Even they require to accept upon them words of companionship initially. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: There was an incident with a certain woman who married a fellow and she would tie tefillin on his hand, she married an am ha'aretz and she would tie for him knots of merchants on his hand.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁחָזְרוּ בָּהֶן אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן עוֹלָמִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָזְרוּ בְּמַטְמוֹנִיּוֹת — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן, בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן.
human_translation: the Sages taught And all of them, when they retract they are never accepted the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: they retracted in private, they are not accepted, in public [ befarheseya ], they are accepted,
llm_translation: The sages taught: And all those who review them, they do not accept them for eternity, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: If they review them in secret, they do not accept them; if in public, they accept them.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אִם עָשׂוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן בְּמַטְמוֹנִיּוֹת — מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן, בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן.
human_translation: There are who say they performed their actions in private, they are accepted in public, they are not accepted.
llm_translation: There are those who say: If they did their matters with coins - they accept them, with promissory notes - they do not accept them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa say: Both this and that they are accepted, as it is stated: “Return, you backsliding children; Rabbi Yitzḥak of the village of Akko says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The halakha in accordance with that pair,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha say: Both in this case and in that case they receive them, because it is stated: "Return, O backsliding children." Rabbi Yitzchak of Kfar Akko said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha is in accordance with that pair.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: חָבֵר וְנַעֲשָׂה גַּבַּאי — דּוֹחִין אוֹתוֹ מֵחֲבֵירָתוֹ, פֵּירַשׁ — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ. חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר: פֵּירַשׁ — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught Initially, would say a ḥaver and became collector he is rejected from his a ḥaver . resigns he is not accepted. they went back to saying he resigns he is like any other person
llm_translation: The sages taught: Initially they used to say, "A fellow and it was done by the treasurer - we push him away from his fellow." He explained - we do not accept him. They came back to say: He explained - he is like any other person.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ שַׁעְתָּא, הֲוָה עָיֵיל גַּבֵּיהּ רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף וְאַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּגֵא דְּרַבָּנַן. שְׁמַע דְּאָתוּ, קְטַיר לְהוּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה תַּכְתָּקֵי. לְסוֹף שְׁמַעוּ דְּנַעֲשָׂה גַּבַּאי, שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל לַחֲשִׁיבוּתֵיהּ, זִיל לְקַדְמוּתֵיהּ. שְׁלַח לְהוּ: הֲדַרִי בִּי. רַב יוֹסֵף לָא אֲזַל, רַבָּה אֲזַל.
human_translation: time needed Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya Rabba and Rav Yosef and four hundred pairs of Sages ascended to his he heard that they were coming, tied them four hundred chairs [ takhtekei ] Eventually heard that he had become collector. They sent him Go to your go to your former He sent to them I have repented Rav Yosef did not go Rabba went
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Chiya needed him an hour, he went to Rabba and Rav Yosef and four hundred pairs of scholars. He heard that they came, he brought them four hundred plates. At the end, he heard that his body was made, they sent to him: Go to his accounting, go to his precedence. He sent to them: Return to me. Rav Yosef did not go, Rabba went.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תְּנֵינָא, פֵּירַשׁ — אֵין מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ; רַבָּה אָמַר: תְּנֵינָא, חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר: פֵּירַשׁ — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said We learn resigns he is not accepted. Rabba said: We learn they went back to saying he resigns he is like any other person
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: We learned, he explained - they do not accept him; Rabbah said: We learned, they returned to say: he explained - he is like all people.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַבְּכוֹרוֹת אָדָם רוֹאֶה, חוּץ מִשֶּׁל עַצְמוֹ, וְרוֹאֶה אֶת קֳדָשָׁיו, וְאֶת מַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו, וְנִשְׁאָל עַל טׇהֳרוֹתָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may inspect all firstborns except for his own And inspect his own sanctified animals and his tithes and may ask with regard to his ritually pure
llm_translation: The sages taught: All firstborns a person sees, except for his own, and he sees his holy things, and his tithes, and he is asked about his purities.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כׇּל הַבְּכוֹרוֹת אָדָם רוֹאֶה חוּץ מִשֶּׁל עַצְמוֹ. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחַד — מִי מְהֵימַן? אֶלָּא בִּתְלָתָא, וּמִי חֲשִׁידִי? וְהָתְנַן: מֵיאֲנָה אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצָה בְּפָנָיו — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: The Master said: A person may inspect all firstborns except for his own What are we dealing with If we say of one is he trusted Rather, of three And is he suspect But didn’t we learn performed refusal or before whom she performed ḥalitza , may marry her,because the court,
llm_translation: Master said: All firstborns a person sees except for his own. With what are we dealing? If you say with one - who is trustworthy? Rather, with three, and who are they? And we learned: Whether she refuses or he redeems her before him - he should marry her, because he is the court!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּחַד, וְכִדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּיָחִיד מוּמְחֶה, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּיָחִיד מוּמְחֶה.
human_translation: Actually, of a single and as Rav Ḥisda says Rabbi Yoḥanan says by a single expert, Here too, with a single expert
llm_translation: Always in one, as Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "In a unique case of blemish," here too, it is in a unique case of blemish.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹאֶה אֶת קֳדָשָׁיו, דְּאִי בָּעֵי מִיתְּשִׁיל עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And inspect his own sanctified animals. that if he wants issue a request
llm_translation: And one who sees his holy ones, for if he wants to stumble upon them.

hebrew_text: וּמַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו, דְּאִי בָּעֵי שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ עֶדְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And his tithes that if he wants inflict a blemish upon his entire herd
llm_translation: And his tithes, for if he wants to check them for a blemish in all of them, his flocks.

hebrew_text: וְנִשְׁאָל עַל טׇהֳרוֹתָיו, דְּהָא חֲזוּ לֵיהּ בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: And may ask with regard to his ritually pure as is fit for him in his days of impurity.
llm_translation: And asked about his purities, for they saw him in his days of impurity.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ עַד כַּמָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיבִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you, how much Israel are obligated.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כָּל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין , הֲנָאָתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, נִמְכָּרִין בָּאִיטְלִיז, וְנִשְׁחָטִין בָּאִיטְלִיז, וְנִשְׁקָלִין בְּלִיטְרָא,
human_translation: all disqualified consecrated benefit their to the Temple are sold in the butchers’ market [ ba’itliz ] and slaughtered in the butchers’ market, And is weighed by the litra ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All disqualified consecrated items, their benefit is given to the Temple treasury, they are sold in the marketplace, slaughtered in the marketplace, and weighed with a litra.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וְהַמַּעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁהֲנָיָיתָן לַבְּעָלִים. פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין — הֲנָיָיתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: except for the firstborn and tithe that benefit their to the owner, disqualified consecrated benefit their to the Temple
llm_translation: Outside of the firstborn and the tithe, which are given to the owners. Disqualified consecrated items - are given to be consecrated.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוֹקְלִין מָנָה כְּנֶגֶד מָנָה בַּבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: And one may weigh one portion against one portion of the firstborn,
llm_translation: And we weigh a maneh against a maneh in the case of the firstborn.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כָּל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין הֲנָאָתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנוֹ — הֲנָאָתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ? הֲנָאָתָן דִּבְעָלִים הוּא!
human_translation: all disqualified consecrated benefit their to the Temple When If we say after its redemption, benefit to the Temple? benefit to the owner.
llm_translation: Gemara: All disqualified consecrated items, their benefit goes to the Temple treasury. When? If you say after their redemption - their benefit goes to the Temple treasury? Their benefit is that of the owners!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי פִּדְיוֹנוֹ. נִשְׁחָטִין? הָא בָּעֵי הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה!
human_translation: Rather, before its redemption, may be slaughtered requires standing and valuation,
llm_translation: Rather, for his redemption. Shall we slaughter? This requires standing and evaluation!

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says consecrated altar were not included in standing and valuation. But according to the one who says altar were included in standing and valuation, what is there to say
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said, the holy things of the altar were not included in the standing and valuation, but for the one who said they were included in the standing and valuation, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹן, וּמַאי הֲנָאָתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ? אַדְּמֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rather, actually after their redemption And what benefit their to the Temple to initial
llm_translation: Rather, forever after redemption, and what benefit is there for the consecrated? Initially.

hebrew_text: דְּכֵיוָן דְּשָׁרֵי לְהוּ מָר, נִמְכָּרִין בָּאִיטְלִיז וְנִשְׁחָטִין בָּאִיטְלִיז וְנִשְׁקָלִין בְּלִיטְרָא, טָפֵי וּפָרֵיק מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Since the Sage deems permitted sold in the butchers’ market and slaughtered in the butchers’ market, and weighed by the litra , redeem more initially.
llm_translation: As they are permitted by the Master, they are sold in Italy, slaughtered in Italy, and weighed in Litra, young and tender from the outset.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הַבְּכוֹר וּמִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר שֶׁהֲנָיָיתָן לַבְּעָלִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּכוֹר — בָּאִיטְלִיז הוּא דְּלָא מִיזְדַּבַּן, הָא בְּבֵיתֵיהּ מִיזְדַּבַּן, אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר — בְּבֵיתֵיהּ מִי מִיזְדַּבַּן?
human_translation: except for the firstborn and tithe as benefit their to the owner. Granted, a firstborn it is in the butchers’ market that it may not be sold, it may be sold in its house. But tithe may it be sold in its house?
llm_translation: Outside of the firstborn and outside of the tithe that were designated for the owners. Granted, the firstborn — it is like a found object, as it is not designated, but in his house it is designated. But the tithe — in his house, is it not designated?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: בִּבְכוֹר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא תִפְדֶּה״ וְנִמְכָּר חַי, בְּמַעֲשֵׂר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ וְאֵינוֹ נִמְכָּר, לֹא חַי וְלֹא שָׁחוּט, לֹא תָּם וְלֹא בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught With regard to a firstborn is stated: “You shall not redeem” But it can be sold alive. with regard to tithe is stated: “It shall not be redeemed” and it cannot be sold not alive and not slaughtered, not unblemished and not blemished.
llm_translation: And it was taught: In the case of a firstborn, it is stated "it shall not be redeemed," and it may be sold while alive. In the case of tithe, it is stated "it shall not be redeemed," and it may not be sold, neither alive nor slaughtered, neither whole nor blemished.

hebrew_text: הָא מִילְּתָא אִיקַּשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּאוּרְתָּא, וְשַׁנְּיַיהּ בְּקַדְמוּתָא מִבָּרַיְיתָא, בְּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם הֲשָׁבַת אֲבֵידָה נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: At night, Rav Sheshet found this matter difficult, and he resolved it in the morning from a baraita . we are dealing with an animal tithe belonging to orphans and due to returning a lost item they touched upon it,
llm_translation: The matter was difficult for Rav Sheshet in the city, and its repetition was from the Mishnah, regarding tithing the livestock of orphans, and due to the concern for the prohibition of lost property, they touched it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִידִי סַרְסְיֵהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת הֲוָה שַׁמְעַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אֲזַל אַמְרַהּ בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא וְלָא אַמְרַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ, שְׁמַע רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיקְּפַד, אֲמַר: מַאן דְּעָקֵיץ לִיעְקְצֵיהּ עַקְרַבָּא, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אָגוּרָה בְּאׇהׇלְךָ עוֹלָמִים״? וְכִי אִיפְשָׁר לְאָדָם לָגוּר בִּשְׁנֵי עוֹלָמִים?
human_translation: Rav Idi, the attendant [ saraseih ] of Rav Sheshet, heard from went and stated in the study hall, but did not say it in his name. Rav Sheshet heard was annoyed. said: The one who stung me, let him be stung by a scorpion. And Rav Sheshet, what difference does it make to him as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: What which is written: “I will dwell in Your tent forever [ olamim ]” But is it possible for a person to live in two worlds [ olamim ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Idi of Sarsia, a student of Rav Sheshet, heard something from him, she went and said it in the study hall without attributing it to him by name. When Rav Sheshet heard about it, he became upset and said: "Whoever belittles himself, a scorpion will bite him." What benefit did Rav Sheshet derive from her statement? As Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of the verse, "I will dwell in your tent forever"? Can a person really dwell in two worlds?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר דָּוִד: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יֹאמְרוּ דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּי בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁאוֹמְרִים דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּיו בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — שִׂפְתוֹתָיו דּוֹבְבוֹת בַּקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: Rather, David, said Master of the Universe, let say a matter of halakha in my name in this world As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: any Torah scholar in whose name a matter of halakha is stated in this world, his lips mouth in the grave,
llm_translation: Rather, David said: Master of the world, may they say a matter heard from Your mouth in this world. As Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Any Torah scholar from whom they say a matter heard from his mouth in this world — his lips move in the grave.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר זְעֵירִי: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״וְחִכֵּךְ כְּיֵין הַטּוֹב הוֹלֵךְ לְדוֹדִי לְמֵישָׁרִים דּוֹבֵב שִׂפְתֵי יְשֵׁנִים״, כְּכוֹמֶר שֶׁל עֲנָבִים, מָה כּוֹמֶר שֶׁל עֲנָבִים כֵּיוָן דְּאָדָם נוֹגֵעַ בּוֹ – דּוֹבֵב, אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָדָם אוֹמֵר דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּיו – דּוֹבְבוֹת שְׂפָתָיו בַּקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Ze’eiri says: What is the verse “And the roof of your mouth is like the best wine that glides down smoothly for my beloved, moving gently the lips of those who are asleep” to a pile [ kekhomer ] of grapes Just as a pile of grapes, when a person touches it, it moves so too Torah scholars, when a matter of halakha is stated in their name, their lips mouth in the grave.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak bar Zeiri said: What is the verse? "And your palate like good wine going to my beloved smoothly, causing the lips of the sleeping to speak." Like a cluster of grapes, just as a cluster of grapes, once a person touches it - it exudes, so too the disciples of the sages, once a person speaks a word of tradition from his mouth - his lips exude in the grave.

hebrew_text: מַאי בָּרַיְיתָא? דְּתַנְיָא: מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים — מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ, וּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ — מַבְלִיעוֹ בְּעוֹרוֹ, בְּחֶלְבּוֹ, וּבְגִידוֹ, וּבְקַרְנָיו.
human_translation: What baraita As it is taught an animal tithe of orphans, one may sell it. And an animal tithe that one has slaughtered, one may include in hide, its fat, its sinews, and its horns,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the Baraita? For it was taught: The tithe of an orphan's animal - one may sell it, and the tithe of an animal that was slaughtered - one may swallow it with its skin, with its fat, with its sinew, and with its horns.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכִי קָאָמַר — מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּהַבְלָעָה.
human_translation: What is saying? Abaye said: this is saying: an animal tithe of orphans, it may be sold, by inclusion.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Abaye said: This is what he is saying - the tithe of an orphan's animal may be sold through consumption.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּגָדוֹל בְּהַבְלָעָה לָא? מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ לוּלָב מֵחֲבֵירוֹ בִּשְׁבִיעִית — נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶתְרוֹג בְּמַתָּנָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְלוֹקְחוֹ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: by inference that an adult, not by inclusion. What is different from that which is taught one who purchases a lulav from another, during the Sabbatical gives him an etrog as a gift, as it is not permitted for one to purchase during the Sabbatical
llm_translation: From the principle of "gadol behablaha" not? What is different from that which was taught: One who buys a lulav from his fellow on the seventh year of the Shemittah cycle — he gives him the etrog as a gift, since he is not permitted to buy it on the seventh year.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: לֹא רָצָה לִיתֵּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה מַאי? וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַבְלִיעַ לוֹ דְּמֵי אֶתְרוֹג בַּלּוּלָב!
human_translation: And we discussed this did not want to give him as a gift, what And Rav Huna said: includes the value of the etrog in the lulav .
llm_translation: We were in it: he did not want to give it to him as a gift, what is it? And Rav Huna said: He swallows the money for an etrog with a lulav!

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, הָכָא מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: There, the matter is not evident, here, the matter is evident.
llm_translation: There, not proven the matter, here proven the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, ״מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה״ תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי קָאָמַר, מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה דְּגָדוֹל שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ מַבְלִיעוֹ בְּעוֹרוֹ בְּחֶלְבּוֹ בְּגִידוֹ וּבְקַרְנָיו.
human_translation: Rava said If so, why do I Animal tithe twice? Rather, Rava said this is saying: an animal tithe of orphans, one may sell it in its manner, but an animal tithe belonging to an adult that was slaughtered, including its in hide, its fat, its sinews, and its horns.
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, "tithe of an animal" why do I need two times? Rather Rava said: This is what he meant to say, the tithe of an orphan's animal is sold in its usual manner, and the tithe of a grown animal that was slaughtered, one may consume its skin, its fat, its sinew, and its horns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הוּא וּתְמוּרָתוֹ יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ לֹא יִגָּאֵל״.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say As it is written “Then both it and that for which it is substituted shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed”
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her? As it is written: "And if it is not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be established forever to him that bought it throughout his generations; it shall not go out in the jubilee."

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה — מֵחַיִּים, אֵימָתַי אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל — מֵחַיִּים, הָא לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — נִגְאָל, וְרַבָּנַן (ההוא) [הוּא] דִּגְזַרוּ לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה, אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: When render a substitute when alive, when may not be redeemed, When alive. it may be redeemed, after slaughter. The Sages decreed after slaughter, due to before slaughter.
llm_translation: "When does the exchange take effect? — From when it is alive. When does it not take effect? — From when it is alive. This is in the case after slaughter — it takes effect. And the Rabbis decreed that in the case after slaughter, it should not take effect before slaughter."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר הַנִּישּׁוֹם מֵחַיִּים — גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי שְׁחִיטָה,
human_translation: an item that is appraised when alive, the Sages decreed after slaughter, due to before slaughter.
llm_translation: The matter of an animal that was found dead — the Rabbis decreed after slaughter, it is considered as if it was before slaughter.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִישּׁוֹם מֵחַיִּים — לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן, וּבְיַתְמֵי אוֹקְמוּהָ רַבָּנַן אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: an item that is not appraised when alive, the Sages did not decree And with regard to orphans, the Sages established as by Torah law,
llm_translation: A matter that is not essential for life - the Rabbis did not decree, and in the days of the early sages, they established it based on the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק סָבַר לַהּ לְהָא דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים שֶׁמּוֹכְרִים אוֹתוֹ כְּדַרְכּוֹ?
human_translation: And even Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak holds that of Rava, As Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: From where that one may sell animal-tithe of orphans in its manner,
llm_translation: And even Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak holds for her for that of Rava, for Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: From where for tithe of animal of orphans that they sell it as its way?

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַק בְּכׇל אַוַּת נַפְשְׁךָ תִּזְבַּח וְאָכַלְתָּ בָשָׂר״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ בְּרָכָה מֵחַיִּים אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: as it is stated “Notwithstanding, after all the desire of your soul, you may slaughter and eat flesh, which is the item that has no blessing when alive, but after slaughter, You must say this is animal tithe
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "Only be sure that you do not eat the blood, for the blood is the life, and you shall not eat the life with the flesh." What is the thing that does not have a blessing of life until after slaughter? One should say: This is the tithe of an animal.
