hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהַבְלִיעוֹ בַּעֲצָמוֹת? רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי, חַד אָמַר: מַבְלִיעוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין מַבְלִיעוֹ.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before What is with regard to including in the bones? Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi One says include and one says not include
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the ruling regarding swallowing it with the bones? Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, one said: he swallows it, and one said: he does not swallow it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי — הָא בְּדַקָּה, הָא בְּגַסָּה.
human_translation: And they do not disagree. This to a small, domesticated animal, That to a large, domesticated animal,
llm_translation: And they do not argue - this one in a case of examination, this one in a case of arrogance.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּגַסָּה, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי — מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ, וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that to a large, domesticated animal, and do not disagree. Sage in accordance with his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Both this and that are in a strong manner, and they do not disagree - one master when he is present, and the other master when he is present.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: בִּבְכוֹר הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יִפְדֶּה״, וְנִמְכָּר; בְּמַעֲשֵׂר נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״, וְאֵינוֹ נִמְכָּר, לֹא חַי וְלֹא שָׁחוּט, וְלֹא תָּם וְלֹא בַּעַל מוּם. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: the itself, With regard to a firstborn states: “You shall not redeem” but it may be sold with regard to tithe it is stated: “It shall not be redeemed” and it cannot be sold, not alive and not slaughtered, not unblemished and not blemished. From where is this matter
llm_translation: Body: In the case of a firstborn, it says, "he shall not redeem," and he is sold; regarding tithes, it is stated, "he shall not redeem," and he is not sold, neither alive nor slaughtered, neither whole nor blemished. From where are these matters derived?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא אָמַר רַב, וְכֵן אָמַר רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, וְנֶאֱמַר ״וְלֹא יִגָּאֵל״ בַּחֲרָמִים, מָה לְהַלָּן מְכִירָה עִמּוֹ, אַף כָּאן מְכִירָה עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana says Rav says, and similarly, Rav Dimi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is stated: “It shall not be redeemed,” with regard to tithe and it is stated: “And it shall not be redeemed,” with regard to dedications [ baḥaramim ], Just as there, selling is with so too here, selling is with
llm_translation: Rav Chinana said in the name of Rav, and so said Rav Dimi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: It is stated "he shall not redeem" regarding tithes, and it is stated "and he shall not redeem" regarding consecrated property. Just as there it is a sale with him, so too here it is a sale with him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַפְנֵי, דְּאִי לָא מַפְנֵי, אִיכָּא לְמִפְרַךְ: מָה לַחֲרָמִים, שֶׁכֵּן חָלִים עַל הַכֹּל!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: free, As, if not free, can be refuted: What about dedications, that apply to all
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: "Because, if not because, there is room to refute: 'What about cherem (excommunication)?' for thus it is effective against all!"

hebrew_text: לָאיֵי אַפְנוֹיֵי מַפְנֵי, לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״וְלֹא יִגָּאֵל״ בַּחֲרָמִים, וְיִגְמַר מִמַּעֲשֵׂר: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל, אַף חֲרָמִים קְדוֹשִׁים וְאֵינָם נִגְאָלִין. ״וְלֹא יִגָּאֵל״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: not so [ la’ai ], as free. Let not state: “It shall not be redeemed,” with regard to dedications, and derive from tithe Just as tithe is sacred and may not be redeemed, so too, dedications are sacred and may not be redeemed. Why do I “It shall not be redeemed” that the Merciful One writes, to free
llm_translation: To the question of redemption due to neglect, it should not be said "and it shall not be redeemed" regarding consecrated items, and it should be concluded from tithes: Just as tithes are holy and not redeemed, so too consecrated items are holy and not redeemed. "And it shall not be redeemed" - why did the Merciful One write this? For neglect.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר, שֶׁכֵּן קָדוֹשׁ לְפָנָיו וּלְאַחֲרָיו!
human_translation: can be refuted: What is about tithe in that sanctity before it and after it.
llm_translation: There is room to refute: What is the case with tithing, that it is holy before Him and after Him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ בַּחֲרָמִים, וְיִגְמַר מִבְּכוֹר: מָה בְּכוֹר קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל, אַף חֲרָמִים קְדוֹשִׁין וְאֵינָן נִגְאָלִין. ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rather, let not state: “It shall not be redeemed,” with regard to dedications, and derive from firstborn Just as firstborn is sacred and may not be redeemed, so too, dedications are sacred and may not be redeemed. Why do I “It shall not be redeemed” that the Merciful One writes to free
llm_translation: Rather, it should not be said "it shall not be redeemed" regarding items designated for destruction, and it should be concluded from the law of the firstborn: just as the firstborn is holy and not redeemed, so too items designated for destruction are holy and not redeemed. "It shall not be redeemed" - why did the Merciful One write this? For the purpose of exclusion.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לִבְכוֹר, שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם!
human_translation: can be refuted: What about firstborn in that its sanctity is from the womb,
llm_translation: There is room to differentiate: What is a firstborn, for his holiness is from the womb!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, וְיִגְמַר הַעֲבָרָה הַעֲבָרָה מִבְּכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל. ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר לְמָה לִי? לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rather, let not say: “It shall not be redeemed,” with regard to tithe and derive from a verbal analogy passing stated there passing Just as firstborn is sacred and may not be redeemed, so too, tithe is sacred and may not be redeemed. Why do I “It shall not be redeemed” that the Merciful One writes to free
llm_translation: Rather, it should not be said, "It shall not be redeemed" regarding tithe, and the transgression is concluded from firstborn to firstborn. Just as firstborn is holy and not redeemed, so too tithe is holy and not redeemed. "It shall not be redeemed," as the Merciful One wrote regarding tithe, why do I need it? For postponement.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, בְּמַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי לָא, מַפְנֵי דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ כִּדְפָרְכִינַן!
human_translation: But still, with regard to tithe not free, as can be refuted as we refuted
llm_translation: And yet, in tithing, it is not so, because there is room to distinguish, as we explain!

hebrew_text: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: “And you shall cause to pass,” is a superfluous verse,
llm_translation: "And 'veha'avarta' the verse permits it."

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר נָמֵי נֵילַף ״גְּאוּלָּה״ ״גְּאוּלָּה״ מֵחֲרָמִים! דְּמַעֲשֵׂר מַפְנֵי, דִּבְכוֹר לָא מַפְנֵי.
human_translation: a firstborn as well, let us derive redemption redemption of dedications. of tithe free of a firstborn is not free,
llm_translation: Firstborn, Naḥmei Neilaḥ, "redemption," "redemption," from ẖaramim! Because of tithing, for firstborn not because of.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חָזֵית דְּלֹא תִפְדֶּה דִּבְכוֹר — לְגוּפֵיהּ, וּדְמַעֲשֵׂר — לְאַפְנוֹיֵי? וְאֵימָא: דְּמַעֲשֵׂר — לְגוּפֵיהּ, דִּבְכוֹר — לְאַפְנוֹיֵי!
human_translation: And what did you see that “you shall not redeem” of a firstborn for itself, and with regard to tithe is free But say that of tithe for itself, that with regard to a firstborn free.
llm_translation: And what do you see that one should not redeem the firstborn — for itself, and tithe — for adornment? But say: tithe — for itself, firstborn — for adornment!

hebrew_text: דָּנִין גְּאוּלָּה מִגְּאוּלָּה, וְאֵין דָּנִין פְּדִיָּיה מִגְּאוּלָּה.
human_translation: We derive redemption [ geula ] from redemption [ geula ] but we do not derive redemption [ pediya ] from redemption [ geula ]
llm_translation: Judging redemption from redemption, and not judging ransom from redemption.

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? הָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״ ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״ — זוֹ הִיא שִׁיבָה זוֹ הִיא בִּיאָה!
human_translation: What difference Didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ] “And the priest shall come [ uva ] This returning this coming
llm_translation: What is derived from it? This is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return" and "the priest shall come" - this is both returning and coming!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, אֲבָל אִיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ — מִדְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: This statement, where there are no terms equivalent to it. But where there are terms that equivalent to it, we derive from that equivalent to it,
llm_translation: These matters, where there is no blood akin to it, but where there is blood akin to it - we may infer from the blood.

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף בְּכוֹר ״הַעֲבָרָה״ ״הַעֲבָרָה״ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, דְּהָא מַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי גָּמַר ״גְּאוּלָּה״ ״גְּאוּלָּה״ מֵחֲרָמִים!
human_translation: But let one derive firstborn passing passing, from tithe as tithe also derived redemption redemption with regard to dedications,
llm_translation: And Leilaf, the firstborn, "Ha'avara" "Ha'avara" from Ma'aser, for Ma'aser also completes "Ge'ulah" "Ge'ulah" from Cherem!

hebrew_text: מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי חֲרָמִים, ״הוּא״ — ״הוּא״ וְלֹא בְּכוֹר. וְאֵימָא ״הוּא״ וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר! מַעֲשֵׂר גְּאוּלָּה כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: The Merciful One limits with regard to dedications “it” “it” but not a firstborn say “it” but not tithe tithe redemption just like
llm_translation: The Merciful One is stringent regarding cherem, "he" — "he" and not firstborn. And why not "he" and not tithe! Tithe redemption is like its death.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ דַּחֲרָמִים לָא צְרִיךְ, דְּאִיתַנְהוּ הֵיכָא? אִי בֵּי בְעָלִים — הֶקְדֵּשׁ נִינְהוּ, אִי בֵּי כֹהֵן — חוּלִּין נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rava says “It may not be redeemed,” with regard to dedications, is unnecessary As where are If in the owner’s possession, they are consecrated And if they are in the priest’s possession, they are non-sacred
llm_translation: Rava said, "One does not redeem items that are under a ban, for what purpose would they be redeemed? If they are in the possession of a homeowner, they are considered consecrated; if they are in the possession of a priest, they are considered mundane."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: חֲרָמִים, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהֵן בְּבֵית בְּעָלִים — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם קֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים הוּא לַה׳״. נְתָנָן לְכֹהֵן — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּחוּלִּין לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל חֵרֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לְךָ יִהְיֶה״. ״לֹא
human_translation: as it is taught Dedications, as long as they are in the owner’s possession, are like consecrated in all respects, as it is stated: “Every dedicated item is most holy to the Lord” gave them to the priest, they are like non-sacred property in all respects, as it is stated: “Every dedicated item in Israel shall be for You” “It may not
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Cherem, as long as they are in the possession of the owner - behold, they are like consecrated items for all their matters, as it is stated: "Every cherem is most holy to the Lord." If they are given to a Kohen - behold, they are like mundane items for all their matters, as it is stated: "Every cherem in Israel shall be yours." "Not

hebrew_text: יִגָּאֵל״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַחֲרָמִים — תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר. אֵימָא תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לִבְכוֹר? מַעֲשֵׂר גְּאוּלָּה כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: be redeemed” that the Merciful One writes, why do I If it is not to matter of dedications, apply it to the matter of tithe say apply it to the matter of a firstborn tithe redemption just like
llm_translation: The text reads: "If the Merciful One wrote, 'Why do I need redemption?' If it is not a matter for cherem - give it as a matter for tithe. Perhaps give it as a matter for firstborn? Tithing is redemption, like its own."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ דְּמַעֲשֵׂר — לֹא יִמָּכֵר הוּא. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הוּא וּתְמוּרָתוֹ יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ לֹא יִגָּאֵל״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says “It may not be redeemed,” with regard to tithe It may not be sold. Rav Ashi says: From where do I say this? As it is written: “Then both it and that for which it is substituted shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Not to be redeemed" of tithe — it shall not be sold. Rav Ashi said: From where do I say this? As it is written: "But he shall not redeem it, nor exchange it, the good for the bad or the bad for the good; and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed."

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה — מֵחַיִּים, אֵימָתַי אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל — מֵחַיִּים, הָא לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה — נִגְאָל, הָא בָּעֵי הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה!
human_translation: When render a substitute? when alive. when may not be redeemed when alive, it may be redeemed after slaughter. it requires standing and valuation,
llm_translation: "When does a substitution take effect? — From when it is alive. When does it not take effect? — From when it is alive. This ruling applies after slaughter — it takes effect. This ruling applies when there is a need for standing and evaluation!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ — לֹא יִמָּכֵר הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, conclude from “it may not be redeemed” is It may not be sold.
llm_translation: Rather, infer from it, "he shall not redeem" — he shall not be sold.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לֹא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says consecrated altar were included in standing and valuation. But according to the one who says consecrated to altar were not included in standing and valuation, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for the one who says, 'The holy items of the altar were included in the standing and arranging.' But for the one who says, 'The holy items of the altar were not included in the standing and arranging,' what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: מִי אִיכָּא דְּמֵחַיִּים לָא מִיפְּרִיק, וּלְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה מִיפְּרִיק? אַלְּמָה לָא מֵחַיִּים דְּאַלִּימָא קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ — לָא מִיפְּרִיק, לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה דְּאַקֵּיל לֵיהּ קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ — מִיפְּרִיק!
human_translation: This is what we said, is there where may not be redeemed when alive, and may be redeemed after slaughter? why not when alive, since its sanctity is strong, may not be redeemed. after slaughter, when its sanctity is weak, it may be redeemed.
llm_translation: We thus say: Is there anyone who, if he does not separate the animal while alive, will separate it after slaughter? Why, if he does not separate it while alive because its sanctity is weak — he does not separate it, after slaughter when its sanctity is strengthened — he separates it!

hebrew_text: וְלָא כֹּל דְּכֵן הוּא? וּמָה מֵחַיִּים דְּאַלִּים לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנוֹ — לָא מִיפְּרִיק, לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה דְּלָא אַלִּים לְמִיתְפָּס פִּדְיוֹנוֹ — מִיפְּרִיק? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ — לֹא יִמָּכֵר הוּא.
human_translation: But isn’t an a fortiori If, when alive and is strong to transfer its redemption it may not be redeemed, after slaughter, when is not strong to transfer its redemption be redeemed? Rather, conclude from this “It may not be redeemed” is it may not be sold.
llm_translation: "And not all this is so? And what about from a living animal that is designated for its redemption — it does not break the neck, after slaughter of an animal that is not designated for its redemption — it breaks the neck? Rather, learn from it: 'It shall not be redeemed' — it shall not be sold."

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יִמָּכֵר״! אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יִמָּכֵר״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִיזְדַּבּוֹנֵי הוּא דְּלָא מִזְדַּבַּן, דְּקָא עָבֵיד עוֹבָדִין דְּחוֹל, אֲבָל אִיפְּרוֹקֵי — מִיפְּרִיק, דְּהָא עָיְילִי דָּמָיו לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ. לְהָכִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״, דְּלָא אִיזְדַּבּוֹנֵי מִיזְדַּבַּן וְלָא אִיפְּרוֹקֵי מִיפְּרִיק.
human_translation: But let the Merciful One write It may not be sold. Had the Merciful One written: It may not be sold, I would say may not be sold, as one performs an act a non-sacred But it may be redeemed, as its value becomes consecrated. Therefore, the Merciful One writes: “It may not be redeemed,” that may not be sold and may not be redeemed.
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote, "He shall not be sold!" If the Merciful One had written, "He shall not be sold," I would have said: It is the cunning ones who do not sell, for they engage in secular work, but the redeemers — they redeem, for they use the money for consecration. Therefore, the Merciful One wrote, "He shall not be redeemed," to indicate that the cunning ones do not redeem, and the redeemers do not redeem.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִמָּנֶה יִשְׂרָאֵל עִם הַכֹּהֵן לַבְּכוֹר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: An Israelite cannot be counted with the priest to firstborn. And Beit Hillel deem permitted and even a gentile
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: A Israelite may not be appointed with the priest for the firstborn, and Beit Hillel permit it, even a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: בְּכוֹר אֵין נִמְנִין עָלָיו אֶלָּא חֲבוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ כֹּהֲנִים, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ זָרִים. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַתִּיר אֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught firstborn only a group entirely of priests may be counted to it; the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: even non-priests. Rabbi Akiva deem permitted even a gentile
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, matnitin mani? Rabbi Akiva hi, detanya: bechor ein nimnin alav ela chavurah shekulah kohanim, divrei Beit Shammai. U'beit Hillel omerim: afilu zarim. Rabbi Akiva matir afilu goy. English translation: Gemara, from where is this Mishnah? It is Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: "A firstborn is counted only with a group whose entire lineage is of priests," the words of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel says: "Even with strangers." Rabbi Akiva permits even with a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְשָׂרָם יִהְיֶה לָךְ וְגוֹ׳״, מָה הָתָם כֹּהֲנִים — אִין, יִשְׂרָאֵל — לָא, אַף הָכָא כֹּהֲנִים — אִין, יִשְׂרָאֵל — לָא.
human_translation: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? As it is written and their flesh shall be yours, Just as there, priests may an Israelite, not, so too here, priests may an Israelite not.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Beit Shammai? As it is written, "And their flesh shall be yours," just as there the priests - no, Israel - no, so too here the priests - no, Israel - no.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: הָנֵי מִילֵּי תָּם, אֲבָל בַּעַל מוּם כְּתִיב ״הַטָּמֵא וְהַטָּהוֹר יַחְדָּיו יֹאכְלֶנּוּ״, וּמָה טָמֵא שֶׁאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים אוֹכֵל בִּבְכוֹר, זָר שֶׁאוֹכֵל בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיֹּאכַל בִּבְכוֹר.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel This statement unblemished But a blemished it is written: the impure and the pure may eat it alike” And if a ritually impure who may not eat of offerings of lesser sanctity, may eat of firstborn a non-priest, who may eat offerings of lesser sanctity, is it not logical that he may eat of firstborn
llm_translation: House of Hillel: These are matters of a complete animal, but with a blemish it is written, "The impure and the pure shall eat it together." And just as the impure person who does not eat of the holy things may eat of the firstborn, a non-priest who eats of the holy things may not necessarily eat of the firstborn.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְטָמֵא, שֶׁכֵּן הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ בַּעֲבוֹדַת צִבּוּר!
human_translation: can be refuted: What about a ritually impure that its general was permitted with regard to the communal service.
llm_translation: There is room to refute: What about for one who is impure, that he is nevertheless permitted from the general rule in communal service!

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל, אַטּוּ בַּעֲבוֹדָה קָאָמַר? בַּאֲכִילָה קָאָמְרִינַן, אֲכִילַת זָר עֲדִיף.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel Is that to say stated with regard to service, we state with regard to eating eating of a non-priest is superior
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And Beit Hillel, are they speaking about service? They are speaking about eating, the eating of a stranger is preferable."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַתִּיר, וַאֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? ״כַּצְּבִי וְכָאַיָּל״ — מָה צְבִי וְאַיָּל מוּתָּר לְגוֹי, אַף פְּסוּלִין מוּתָּר לְגוֹי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva, deems permitted and even gentiles, What is the reason of Rabbi Akiva? “Like the gazelle and like the deer” Just as a gazelle and a deer permitted to a gentile, so too, disqualified permitted to a gentile.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva permits, even a non-Jew. What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva's ruling? "Like the deer and the gazelle" - just as deer and gazelle are permitted to a non-Jew, so too disqualified animals are permitted to a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? תְּלָתָא ״צְבִי וְאַיָּל״ כְּתִיבִי, חַד לְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, וְחַד לְכִדְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, וְחַד לְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר.
human_translation: And the other one, “gazelle” and “hart” are written three One for of Rabbi Yitzḥak and Rabbi Oshaya, and one for of Rabbi Elazar HaKappar.
llm_translation: The other opinion? Three "deer and ram" are written, one according to Rabbi Yitzchak, one according to Rabbi Oshaya, and one according to Rabbi Elazar HaKappar.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? מָה צְבִי וְאַיָּל פְּטוּרִים מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה, אַף פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין פְּטוּרִין מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: And the other just as a gazelle and a deer are exempt from a firstborn, so too, disqualified consecrated are exempt from a firstborn
llm_translation: And the other opinion? What is the case with deer and gazelle being exempt from the firstborn offering? So too, disqualified consecrated animals are exempt from the firstborn offering.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוֹר אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לְנִדּוֹת, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לְנִדּוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְשָׂרָם יִהְיֶה לָךְ״, מָה הָתָם נִדּוֹת לָא, אַף הָכָא נִדּוֹת לָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not give firstborn to menstruating women to eat; the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: One may give it to menstruating women to eat. What is the reason of Beit Shammai? It is written “And their flesh shall be yours, Just as there, menstruating women not so too here, menstruating women not
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding a firstborn, Beit Shammai says: one does not feed him to menstruating women. And Beit Hillel says: one feeds him to menstruating women. What is the reason for Beit Shammai? As it is written: "And their flesh shall be yours." Just as there, menstruating women are not involved, so too here, menstruating women are not involved.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: הָנֵי מִילֵּי תָּם, אֲבָל בַּעַל מוּם — ״הַטָּמֵא וְהַטָּהוֹר יֹאכְלֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel This statement, an unblemished But a blemished the impure and the pure may eat it
llm_translation: House of Hillel: those words are complete, but with a blemish - "the impure and the pure may eat it."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאֵין טוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּטוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ — לָא.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai This statement, where the impurity does not issue upon him from his body But where the impurity issues upon him from his body, not
llm_translation: House of Shammai, those matters where impurity does not emanate from his body, but where impurity emanates from his body - no.

hebrew_text: דְּאַשְׁכְּחַן דְּפַלֵּיג רַחֲמָנָא בֵּין טוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ, לְבֵין שֶׁאֵין טוּמְאָה יוֹצְאָה עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ, דִּתְנַן: הַפֶּסַח שֶׁבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ זָבִים וּמְצוֹרָעִין וְזָבוֹת וְנִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת.
human_translation: as we find that the Merciful One distinguishes between impurity issues upon from his body between impurity does not issue upon him from his body. As we learned the Paschal offering is sacrificed in ritual impurity, zavim and lepers and zavot and menstruating women and women after childbirth may not eat from it.
llm_translation: We found that the Merciful One distinguishes between a case where impurity emanates from his body and a case where impurity does not emanate from his body, as we learned: The Paschal lamb that came in a state of impurity - those who are afflicted with a discharge, lepers, menstruating women, and women who have given birth may not eat from it.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: הָתָם הוּא דְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״טְמֵא נֶפֶשׁ״, אֲבָל הָכָא ״טָמֵא״ סְתָמָא כְּתִיב, לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel It is there, as the Merciful One revealed “Impure a dead body” But here, “impure” is written unspecified: is no difference
llm_translation: House of Hillel: There, where the Merciful One has revealed "impure soul," but here "impure" is simply written, it does not differ.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מַרְגִּילִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ אֵין מַרְגִּילִין בַּבְּכוֹר, וְלֹא בִּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not skin an animal from its feet [ margilin ] on a Festival. Similarly, one may not skin a firstborn from its feet, nor in disqualified consecrated
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One does not accustom on a festival, as one does not accustom on a firstborn, and not with disqualified sacrificial items.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא יוֹם טוֹב — דְּקָא טָרַח טִירְחָא דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא בְּכוֹר — מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמַר אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לְנִדּוֹת.
human_translation: Granted, a Festival, as one is performing an effort whose is not needed for But a firstborn who taught Rav Ḥisda says: It is Beit Shammai, who say one may not feed to menstruating women.
llm_translation: In peace a festival — for he exerted effort that he not see it. Rather, a firstborn — who is the Tanna? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Beit Shammai, who said: One does not feed him to menstruating women.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בִּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הָיוּ לְפָנָיו שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת, אַחַת תְּמִימָה וְאַחַת בַּעֲלַת מוּם — תְּמִימָה תִּקְרַב, בַּעֲלַת מוּם תִּיפָּדֶה.
human_translation: Nor in disqualified consecrated Who taught Rav Ḥisda says: It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as we learned had before him two sin offerings One unblemished and one blemished unblemished should be sacrificed, blemished should be redeemed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not with disqualified sacrifices. Who is the Tanna? Rav Hisda said: It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: If there were before him two sin offerings, one unblemished and one blemished - the unblemished one is brought near, the blemished one is redeemed.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁחֲטָה בַּעֲלַת מוּם, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִזְרַק דָּמָהּ שֶׁל תְּמִימָה — מוּתֶּרֶת, אִם מִשֶּׁנִּזְרַק דָּמָהּ שֶׁל תְּמִימָה — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: If blemished was slaughtered before the blood of unblemished was sprinkled permitted if the blood of the unblemished was already sprinkled prohibited
llm_translation: The animal with a blemish was slaughtered, if until its blood of perfection was not sprinkled - it is permitted, if once its blood of perfection was sprinkled - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּשָׂר בִּקְדֵירָה, וְנִזְרַק דָּמָהּ שֶׁל תְּמִימָה — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Even meat in the pot, and blood of the unblemished sprinkled prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Even if meat is in a pot, and its blood of innocence is spilled — it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא, לוֹקְמַהּ כּוּלַּהּ כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי! דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אֶלָּא בִּבְכוֹר, דִּקְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם, אֲבָל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין דְּאֵין קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם — לָא.
human_translation: But let Rav Ḥisda establish the entire in accordance with Beit Shammai. Perhaps Beit Shammai say only in a firstborn as its sanctity is from the womb. But a disqualified consecrated whose sanctity is not from the womb, not
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda, he holds entirely like Beit Shammai! Perhaps until here they were not saying Beit Shammai except regarding a firstborn, whose sanctity is from the womb, but disqualified consecrated items whose sanctity is not from the womb — no.

hebrew_text: וְלוֹקְמַהּ כּוּלַּהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן! דִּילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָתָם אֶלָּא פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, דְּאַלִּימִי לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנוֹ, אֲבָל בְּכוֹר דְּלָא אַלִּים לְמִיתְפַּס פִּדְיוֹנוֹ — לָא.
human_translation: But let establish the entire in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. Perhaps Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says only there, disqualified consecrated because strong to transfer redemption But firstborn whose not strong to transfer its redemption not
llm_translation: And the entire assembly is like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon! Perhaps Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon did not say this until here, rather there specifically regarding disqualified consecrated items, which are eligible for redemption, but regarding a firstborn, which is not eligible for redemption - no.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ כׇּל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין נִמְכָּרִין בָּאִיטְלִיז וְנִשְׁקָלִין בְּלִיטְרָא? אַלְמָא דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא רַוְוחָא לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁרֵי לֵהּ!
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, all disqualified consecrated are sold in the butchers’ market and weighed by the litra , Evidently, since there is a benefit to Temple deems this permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon has no objection to all disqualified items of the Temple being sold in Italy and weighed in Litra? This implies that since there is a benefit to sanctifying the proceeds, it is permitted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: מַה שֶּׁמַּשְׁבִּיחַ בָּעוֹר — פּוֹגֵם בַּבָּשָׂר. בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא אָמְרִי: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said the benefit gained to the hide detriment to the flesh. In the West, they say in the name of Ravina because it appears as though performing work with sacrificial
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said: "One who whitens the skin - damages the flesh." In the West, in the name of Ravina, they say: "Because he appears like one who performs service in the Holy Temple."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין אוֹמֵר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְגַדֵּל מֵהֶן עֲדָרִים עֲדָרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin says decree, lest one raise many herds from them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin says: A decree lest one come to increase the number of flocks, flock by flock.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּכוֹר שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ דָּם, אֲפִילּוּ מֵת — אֵין מַקִּיזִין לוֹ דָּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַקִּיז, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה בּוֹ מוּם, וְאִם עָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּם — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִשְׁחַט עָלָיו. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יַקִּיז, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה בּוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: a firstborn that was congested with blood, even die one may not let its blood, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: One may let provided that he will not cause a blemish and if he caused a blemish, the animal may not be slaughtered on that Rabbi Shimon says: One may let even if he causes a blemish
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The firstborn animal that has blood in its grasp, even if it dies - we do not sprinkle its blood, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Sages say: Sprinkle, but only if it does not have a blemish, and if it has a blemish - it shall not be slaughtered upon it. Rabbi Shimon says: Sprinkle, even though it has a blemish."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוֹר שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ דָּם — מַקִּיזִין לוֹ אֶת הַדָּם בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂים בּוֹ מוּם, וְאֵין מַקִּיזִין לוֹ אֶת הַדָּם בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בּוֹ מוּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught a firstborn that was congested with blood, one may let blood in a place where does not cause blemish. But one may not let blood in a place where causes blemish, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding a firstborn animal that has blood in it - we sprinkle the blood for it in a place where a blemish is not made, and we do not sprinkle the blood for it in a place where a blemish is made. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה בּוֹ מוּם, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁחַט עַל אוֹתוֹ הַמּוּם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף נִשְׁחָט עַל אוֹתוֹ הַמּוּם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵת — אֵין מַקִּיזִין לוֹ אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: One may even let in a place where causes blemish, provided that he does not slaughter on of that blemish, Rabbi Shimon says: may even be slaughtered on of that blemish. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even die one may not let its blood
llm_translation: The Sages say: Even in a case where a blemish is found in it, provided that it does not slaughter upon that blemish. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if it slaughters upon that blemish. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if it is dead - we do not sprinkle its blood.

hebrew_text: מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לִבְרֵיהּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לִבְרֵיהּ: כַּמַּחְלוֹקֶת כָּאן, כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּחָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, דִּתְנַן: חָבִית שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד בָּהּ סְפֵק טוּמְאָה — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה — יַנִּיחֶנָּה בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע, אִם הָיְתָה מְגוּלָּה — יְכַסֶּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar taught his son, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya his son: as a dispute here so a dispute with regard to a barrel of teruma . As we learned a barrel of teruma with regard to which uncertainty developed ritual impurity, Rabbi Eliezer says if was resting in a vulnerable location, should place it in a concealed location, and if it was exposed, he should cover it.
llm_translation: Rebbe Elazar taught it to his son, and some say it was Rebbe Hiyya who taught it to his son: Just as there is a dispute here, so too there is a dispute regarding a barrel of terumah, as we learned: A barrel of terumah in which there is doubt of impurity — Rebbe Eliezer says: If it was in a place of concealment, leave it in a hidden place; if it was exposed, cover it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בְּמָקוֹם הַמּוּצְנָע — יַנִּיחֶנָּה בִּמְקוֹם הַתּוּרְפָּה, אִם הָיְתָה מְכוּסָּה — יְגַלֶּנָּה. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא יְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ דָּבָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: if it was placed in a concealed location, may place it in a vulnerable location. If it was covered he may expose it, Rabban Gamliel says: should do nothing new with it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If it was placed in a hidden place - let it remain in a hidden place, if it was covered - he should uncover it. Rabban Gamliel says: One should not innovate in it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְרַבָּנַן כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, And the Rabbis, in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, And Rabbi Yehuda, in accordance with Rabban Gamliel,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir like Rabbi Eliezer, and the sages like Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Yehuda like Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם, דְּקָא עָבֵיד בְּיָדַיִם, אֲבָל הָכָא דִּגְרָמָא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Meir states only there, as causing by action. But here, where from an indirect he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps until here not saying Rabbi Meir there, that doing with hands, but here that cause - like Rabbi Yehoshua thinks!

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם, אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ מָיֵית — כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer states only here, perhaps Elijah will come and deem it ritually pure. But there, where if one leaves it will die, he holds in accordance with the the Rabbis,
llm_translation: And until here not said Rabbi Eliezer there, but perhaps Elijah will come and purify it, but here, if he leaves it, it is like the Rabbis hold!

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָכָא, דְּאִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ מָיֵית, אֲבָל הָתָם — שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סְבִירָא לְהוּ! וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָכָא, דְּקָא עָבֵיד בְּיָדַיִם, אֲבָל הָתָם דִּגְרָמָא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And perhaps the Rabbis state only here, as if one leaves it, will die. But there, perhaps Elijah will come and deem it ritually pure, they hold in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehuda states only here, as causing by action. But there, where indirect he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Until here the Rabbis did not say, here, for if he left it, he would die, but there — perhaps Elijah will come and purify it, as Rabbi Eliezer holds! Until here Rabbi Yehuda did not say, here, for he is doing it with his hands, but there, where it is indirect causation — Rabbi Yehoshua holds!

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם, דְּשֶׁמָּא יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ מָיֵית, כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel states only there, perhaps Elijah will come and deem it ritually pure. But here, where if one leaves it, it will die, he holds in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And until here not said Rabbi Gamliel there, that perhaps will come Elijah and will purify her, but here, that if he leaves her, he will die, as the Rabbis hold!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָכָא בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי וְהָכָא בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּמְחַמֵּץ אַחַר מְחַמֵּץ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תֵאָפֶה חָמֵץ״ וְ״לֹא תֵעָשֶׂה״.
human_translation: And furthermore, here disagree with regard to verses, and there they disagree with regard to verses. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All concede that one who leavens after leavened liable as it is written: “It shall not be baked with leaven” and shall be made
llm_translation: And furthermore, here it is in the verses where they disagree, and here it is in the verses where they disagree, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Everyone agrees regarding leaven after leaven that one is liable, as it is written, "You shall not bake leaven" and "You shall not make leaven."

hebrew_text: בִּמְסָרֵס אַחֵר מְסָרֵס שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת וְנָתוּק וְכָרוּת״, אִם עַל כּוֹרֵת חַיָּיב, עַל נוֹתֵק לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אֶלָּא לְהָבִיא נוֹתֵק אַחַר כּוֹרֵת, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב.
human_translation: that one who castrates after one who has castrated is liable, as it is written: “Those whose testicles are bruised or crushed or detached or cut If one is liable are cut, are detached not all the more so Rather, include detaches after cuts that he is liable.
llm_translation: In one who castrates another, who is liable, as it is written: "And crushed and torn and cut off and excised." If for excision one is liable, surely for tearing as well? Rather, to bring tearing after excision, for which one is liable.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּמֵטִיל מוּם בְּבַעַל מוּם, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״כׇּל מוּם לֹא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ״, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״תָּמִים יִהְיֶה לְרָצוֹן״.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to one who causes a blemish in blemished As Rabbi Meir maintains there shall be no blemish in it” And the Rabbis maintain “It shall be perfect to be accepted”
llm_translation: They did not disagree except regarding one who casts a blemish on one who already has a blemish, for Rabbi Meir holds: "There shall not be any blemish in him," and the Rabbis hold: "He shall be perfect for acceptance."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַאי ״תָּמִים יִהְיֶה לְרָצוֹן״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, what does he do with this “It shall be perfect to be accepted”? That to exclude blemished from the outset,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: This "tamim yihyeh l'ratzon," what does he do with it? He requires it to exclude a blemished animal from the outset.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם מֵעִיקָּרוֹ — פְּשִׁיטָא, דִּיקְלָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: blemished from the outset, it is merely like a palm tree,
llm_translation: The one with a blemish from his very inception - it is obvious, a palm tree in general it is!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַעוֹטֵי פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין לְאַחַר פִּדְיוֹנָן, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וַאֲסִירִי בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה — בְּמוּמִין נָמֵי לִיתַּסְרוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, to exclude disqualified consecrated after their redemption, enter your mind to say since prohibited shear or labor, let also be prohibited a blemish upon them. teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude disqualified consecrated items after their redemption, is it not logical to say: Since they are bound by both shearing and labor - they are considered blemished and should be disqualified, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״כׇּל מוּם לֹא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ״! לִגְרָמָא הוּא דְּאָתֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מוּם לֹא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ״ — אֵין לִי
human_translation: And the Rabbis as well, isn’t it written: “There shall not be any blemish in it,” That comes that an indirect As it is taught “There shall not be blemish in it” I have
llm_translation: The sages also say, as it is written, "No blemish shall be in him!" It is due to the cause that it comes, as it was taught: "No blemish shall be in him" — I do not have.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא יִתֵּן בּוֹ מוּם, מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיא דְּבֵילָה וּבָצֵק וְיַנִּיחֶנָּה עַל הָאוֹזֶן כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּבֹא כֶּלֶב וְיֹאכְלֶנָּה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כׇּל מוּם״ — אֶחָד מוּם וְאֶחָד כׇּל מוּם.
human_translation: only that one may not cause a blemish. From where that one may not bring figs or dough and place it on the ear so that a dog will come and eat it, The verse states: any blemish both blemish and any blemish,
llm_translation: Rather, that he should not place a blemish on it, from where do we derive that he should not bring a cake and dough and place them on the ear so that a dog may come and eat them? The Torah teaches "any blemish" - whether a blemish or any blemish.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בִּקְרָאֵי פְּלִיגִי, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְכֵן אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: ״וַאֲנִי הִנֵּה נָתַתִּי לְךָ אֶת מִשְׁמֶרֶת תְּרוּמֹתָי״.
human_translation: here, disagree with regard to verses. As Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says, and Reish Lakish likewise says, and Rav Naḥman likewise says Rabba bar Avuh says: “And I, behold, I have given you the charge of My terumot [ terumotai ]”
llm_translation: Here in the verses they dispute, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and so said Reish Lakish, and so said Rav Nachman in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: "And I, behold, I have given you the charge of My heave-offerings."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: בִּשְׁתֵּי תְּרוּמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אַחַת תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה וְאַחַת תְּרוּמָה תְּלוּיָה, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: עֲבֵיד לַהּ שִׁימּוּר. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״תְּרוּמָתִי״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, holds that the verse is speaking of two terumot : Both teruma that is ritually pure and teruma that is in abeyance, And the Merciful One states: Make a protection for it, And Rabbi Yehoshua, written terumati ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer holds: In two contributions the Scripture speaks, one pure contribution and one dependent contribution, and the Merciful One said: "Do it for its safekeeping." And Rabbi Yehoshua: "My contribution" is written.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא? וּרְמִינְהִי: ״בְּבִגְדוֹ בָּהּ״ — כֵּיוָן שֶׁפֵּירַשׂ טַלִּיתוֹ עָלֶיהָ, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְמוֹכְרָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: to say that Rabbi Eliezer holds the vocalization is authoritative, And raises a contradiction seeing that he has dealt deceitfully with her [ bevigdo bah ]” once has spread his garment over her, may no longer sell her. the statement of Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Eliezer, does he hold that there is a mother to the Scripture? And they asked: "In his garment in it" - once he explained his cloak on it, he is no longer permitted to sell it, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁבָּגַד בָּהּ, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְמוֹכְרָהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: since dealt deceitfully [ bagad ] with her he may not sell her again.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Once he has worn it, he is no longer permitted to sell it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: הָרְאוּיָה לָךְ שְׁמוֹר, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לָךְ לָא תִּשְׁמוֹר, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הָא נָמֵי רְאוּיָה הִיא, שֶׁמָּא יָבוֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה.
human_translation: Rather, here, disagree with regard to this: Rabbi Yehoshua holds that is fit for you safeguard. But that is not fit for you, you not safeguard. And Rabbi Eliezer this also fit perhaps Elijah will come and deem it ritually pure.
llm_translation: Rather, here in this case they disagree: Rabbi Yehoshua holds: If it is fitting for you, keep it, but if it is not fitting for you, do not keep it. And Rabbi Eliezer holds: Indeed, it is fitting, lest Elijah come and declare it pure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּמַתְנִיתִין, עַד הַשְׁתָּא לָא אַשְׁמְעִינַן שְׁמוּאֵל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak objects to this: which Rabbi Shimon If we say Rabbi Shimon in the mishna, hasn’t Shmuel taught us until now an unintentional act, permitted?
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objected to him: Is it Rabbi Shimon? If you say Rabbi Shimon who is in the Mishnah, until now we have not heard that Shmuel said a matter that is not precise is permissible.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַב חָנִין בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מַתְנֵי בְּלָא גַּבְרֵי — רַב אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן!
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi say Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Rav Ḥanin bar Ashi says Shmuel halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin teaches without men Rav says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The Gemara: And Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And Rav Chanin bar Ashe said in the name of Shmuel: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And Rav Chiya bar Avin taught without specifying the individuals. Rav said: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and Shmuel said: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּבָרַיְיתָא, וְרַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי מַתְנֵי לַהּ בְּהֶדְיָא: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּבָרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon in the baraita And Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, teaches this explicitly: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon in the baraita .
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon's words, and Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, teaches it to him directly: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon's words.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַצּוֹרֵם אוֹזֶן בַּבְּכוֹר — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט עוֹלָמִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם אַחֵר — יִשְׁחוֹט עָלָיו.
human_translation: one who slits [ hatzorem ] the ear of a firstborn that may never slaughter the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: another blemish develops in he may slaughter on
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who pierces the ear of a firstborn animal - this one shall not be slaughtered as an offering forever, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Sages say: If another blemish is born in it - it shall be slaughtered upon it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי קָנֵיס רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְעוֹלָם? וּרְמִינְהִי: מִי שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ בַּהֶרֶת
human_translation: But does Rabbi Eliezer penalize forever? And raises a contradiction one who had a snow-white leprous mark [ baheret ]
llm_translation: Gemara: And who acquired the status of Rabbi Eliezer forever? And it was asked: Who had leprosy.

hebrew_text: וְנִקְצְצָה — טָהוֹר, קְצָצָה מִתְכַּוֵּין — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לִכְשֶׁיִּוָּלֵד לוֹ נֶגַע אַחֵר יִטְהַר הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: and it got excised, ritually pure. he excised it intentionally, Rabbi Eliezer says: When he will develop another leprous mark, he will become ritually pure from
llm_translation: "And if it is cut - it is pure, if it is cut intentionally - Rabbi Eliezer says: when another affliction is born for him, he shall be purified from it."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁתִּפְרַח בְּכוּלּוֹ, אוֹ עַד שֶׁתִּמְעַט בַּהַרְתּוֹ מִכִּגְרִיס!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: until spreads over his entire or unless his baheret shrunk smaller than of a split bean
llm_translation: The sages say: Until it blossoms completely, or until it diminishes from its size like a dried fig!

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: כִּי קָנֵיס רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּמָמוֹנוֹ, בְּגוּפוֹ לָא קָנֵיס.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say, when Rabbi Eliezer penalizes in his property, in his body, he does not penalize
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef said together: When Rabbi Eliezer acquired something with his money, he did not acquire it with his body.

hebrew_text: מָמוֹנוֹ — אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּאָתֵי לְמֶיעְבַּד, גּוּפוֹ — מִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּאָתֵי לְמֶיעְבַּד?
human_translation: his property, there is to say that he might come to perform his body, is there to say that he will come to perform
llm_translation: His money - is there to say that it comes to be used, his body - is there to say that it comes to be used?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא?
human_translation: Rava said: of Rabbi Eliezer difficult in light of of Rabbi Eliezer of the Rabbis not difficult in light of of the Rabbis
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Eliezer, is Rabbi Eliezer difficult, but regarding the Rabbis, are the Rabbis not difficult?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן. רַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי דַּעֲבַד קַנְסוּהּ, הָכָא בְּמַאי דַּעֲבַד קַנְסוּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, of Rabbi Eliezer not difficult in light of of Rabbi Eliezer as we answered. of the Rabbis not difficult in light of of the Rabbis Here, penalized him for what he did, and there, penalized him for what he did.
llm_translation: Rather, regarding Rabbi Eliezer, regarding Rabbi Eliezer it is not difficult, as we learn. The Rabbis, regarding the Rabbis, also it is not difficult, here with what does he perform the penalty, here with what does he perform the penalty.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אִיכַּוֵּין לְמִישְׁרְיֵיהּ בְּהַאי מוּמָא? בְּהַאי מוּמָא קַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן, דִּבְהַאי מוּמָא לָא לִישְׁתְּרֵי לֵיהּ. וְהָכָא, בְּמַאי דַּעֲבַד קַנְסוּהּ — אִיכַּוֵּין לְטַהוֹרֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּהַאי קְצִיצָה, בְּהַאי קְצִיצָה קַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: by what did he intend to permit it? By means of this blemish. the Rabbis penalized him with regard to this blemish, that will not become permitted to him by means of this blemish And here, penalize him for what he did. He intended to render himself ritually pure by means of this excising the Rabbis penalized him with regard to this excision.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what are they effective to rectify it with this blemish? With this blemish, the Rabbis penalized it, for with this blemish it cannot be rectified. And here, with what do they do to penalize it - they are effective for the purification of the soul with this excision, with this excision the Rabbis penalized it.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: ״יִטְהַר״ תְּנַן, אוֹ ״וְיִטְהָר״ תְּנַן?
human_translation: Rav Pappa asks: Did we learn: Yit’har , or did we learn: Veyit’har ,
llm_translation: The question of Rav Papa: "Yit'har" we teach, or "ve-yit'har" we teach?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְחָתָן שֶׁנִּרְאָה בּוֹ נֶגַע.
human_translation: What is the difference of a bridegroom upon whom leprous mark appeared
llm_translation: For what did it come out? For a groom who was seen with a blemish.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: חָתָן שֶׁנִּרְאָה בּוֹ נֶגַע — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שִׁבְעָה יָמִים, לוֹ וּלְאִצְטְלִיתוֹ וְלִכְסוּתוֹ, וְכֵן בָּרֶגֶל — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כׇּל יְמֵי הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: As we learned a bridegroom upon whom a leprous mark appeared, grants him seven days on him, or on his cloak, or on garment of his. And similarly, during a pilgrimage Festival, grants him all the days of the pilgrimage Festival
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If a groom is seen with a blemish - they give him seven days, for him and for his garments and for his covering. And similarly with regard to the festival - they give him throughout all the days of the festival.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״יִטְהַר״ תְּנַן — מִקַּמַּיְיתָא טְהַר לֵיהּ, לְבָתְרָיְיתָא נָטְרִין לֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי מִשְׁתֶּה.
human_translation: If you say we learned yit’har , he has become ritually pure from the first for the latter we wait the seven days of feasting for him,
llm_translation: If you say "he shall be pure," we learn - from the outset he is considered pure, and after that, we guard him for seven days of festivity.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: ״וְיִטְהַר״ תְּנַן — סוֹף סוֹף, כִּי לָא מְטַמֵּית לְבָתְרָיְיתָא, הָא מִיטַּמֵּא וְקָאֵי מִקַּמַּיְיתָא. מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: But if you say we learned veyit’har , ultimately, does not contract ritual impurity from the latter he remains ritually impure on the first What shall stand
llm_translation: Rather, if you say: "And he shall be clean," we learn - ultimately, because it does not render impure for later, but it renders impure and stands before it. What? Let it stand unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: צוֹרֵם אוֹזֶן בַּבְּכוֹר וָמֵת, מַהוּ לִקְנוֹס בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: one who slits the ear of a firstborn and dies, what is with regard to penalizing his son after
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ba'ei mineih Rabbi Yirmeyah meRabbi Zeira: Tzorem ozen babekhor vamet, mah lekhnos bno akharav?" English translation: "Rabbi Yirmeyah from Rabbi Zeira asked: If one pierces the ear of a firstborn and he dies, what is the law regarding acquiring another son after him?"

hebrew_text: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר: מוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לַגּוֹיִם וָמֵת — קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו, דְּכֹל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ מִמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: If you say one who sells his slave to gentiles and dies, penalized his son after as each day prevents from mitzvot.
llm_translation: If you would say: "One who sells his slave to the Gentiles and he dies - his son inherits after him, for every day he is exempt from mitzvot.

hebrew_text: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר: כִּוֵּון מְלַאכְתּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד וָמֵת — לֹא קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא עַבְדֵהּ לְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: if you say one who planned his labor on the a Festival, he died they did not penalize his son after since did not perform a prohibited act,
llm_translation: If you might say: Since his work was during a festival and he died - his sons were not penalized after him, because he did not perform it for prohibition.

hebrew_text: הָכָא מַאי? לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, וְהָא לֵיתֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא לְמָמוֹנֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, וְהָא אִיתֵיהּ?
human_translation: here, what the Sages penalized him, and he is no longer Or perhaps the Sages imposed penalty upon his property, and that exists
llm_translation: Here what? According to his opinion the Rabbis imposed a penalty, and he does not have it, or perhaps they imposed a penalty on his possessions, and he does have it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, שָׂדֶה שֶׁנִּתְקַוְּוצָה בִּשְׁבִיעִית — תִּזָּרַע לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית, נִיטַּיְּיבָה נִידַּיְּירָה — לֹא תִּזָּרַע לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית. וְאָמַר רַב אַסִּי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: נָקְטִינַן, הֱטִיבָהּ וָמֵת — בְּנוֹ זוֹרְעָהּ. אַלְמָא לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, לִבְרֵיהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to You learned A field whose thorns were removed during the Sabbatical may be sown at the conclusion of the Sabbatical it had been improved it had been enclosed it may not be sown at the conclusion of the Sabbatical And Rav Asi, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: We have a tradition improved and died, his son may sow it. Apparently, the Sages penalized him, the Sages did not penalize his son.
llm_translation: He said to him: "You should give it, a field that was uprooted in the Sabbatical year - you should sow for the coming of the Sabbatical year, if it was plowed and cleared - you should not sow for the coming of the Sabbatical year." And Rav Assi, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "We have learned, if he improved it and died - his son should sow it." This implies that the Rabbis penalized him for his own sake, but did not penalize for the sake of his son.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן
human_translation: Abaye says: We have a tradition
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We have learned.

hebrew_text: טִימֵּא טְהָרוֹת וָמֵת — לֹא קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו. מַאי טַעְמָא? הֶיזֵּק שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיכָּר לָא שְׁמֵיהּ הֶיזֵּק, קְנָסָא דְּרַבָּנַן — לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, לִבְרֵיהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: one rendered impure ritually pure items and died did not penalize his son after his What is the reason damage that is not evident, is not considered damage a penalty by rabbinic law, the Sages penalized him; the Sages did not penalize his son.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Timmei teharot vameit - lo kansu bno acharei. Mai ta'ama? Heizek she'eino nikar la shmei heizek, kenasa d'rabanan - l'didei kansu rabanan, livrei lo kansu rabanan. English translation: Ritual impurities and a corpse - his son is not penalized after him. What is the reason? Damage that is not recognizable, is not called damage. A penalty of the Rabbis - they penalized him, but they did not penalize his son.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּזָכָר שֶׁל רְחֵלִים זָקֵן, וּשְׂעָרוֹ מְדוּלְדָּל, וְרָאָהוּ קַסְטוֹר אֶחָד וְאָמַר: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל זֶה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: בְּכוֹר הוּא, וְאֵינוֹ נִשְׁחָט אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה בּוֹ מוּם. נָטַל (פיגום) [פִּיגְיוֹם] וְצָרַם אׇזְנוֹ, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים וְהִתִּירוּ, וְאַחַר שֶׁהִתִּירוּ הָלַךְ וְצֵירֵם בְּאׇזְנֵי בְכוֹרוֹת אֲחֵרִים וְאָסְרוּ.
human_translation: an incident involving an old ram whose hair was dangling, And one quaestor [ kastor ] saw it and said What is the status [ tivo ] of this They said to him: is a firstborn and it may be slaughtered only if it has a blemish. took a dagger [ pigom ] and slit its ear. And the incident came before Sages and they deemed permitted. And after deemed permitted, went and slit the ears of other firstborn but deemed prohibited,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There was an incident involving an old ram of the ewes, and its wool was tangled. A butcher saw it and said: "What is the quality of this one?" They said to him: "It is a firstborn, and it may not be slaughtered unless it has a blemish." He took a pair of shears and trimmed its ear, and the matter came before the sages, and they permitted it. After they permitted it, he went and trimmed the ears of other firstborn rams and they prohibited it.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת מְשַׂחֲקִין בַּשָּׂדֶה, וְקָשְׁרוּ זַנְבֵי טְלָאִים זֶה בָּזֶה, וְנִפְסְקָה זְנָבוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וַהֲרֵי הוּא בְּכוֹר, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים וְהִתִּירוּ. רָאוּ שֶׁהִתִּירוּ, הָלְכוּ וְקָשְׁרוּ זַנְבוֹת בְּכוֹרוֹת אֲחֵרִים, וְאָסְרוּ. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא לְדַעְתּוֹ — אָסוּר, שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתּוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: One time children were playing in the field and they tied the tails of lambs to each other, and the tail of one of them was severed, and it was a firstborn And the incident came before the Sages and they deemed permitted. saw that they deemed permitted went and tied the tails of other firstborn and deemed prohibited. This the principle: any that is intentionally, prohibited; unintentionally, permitted.
llm_translation: Once there were children playing in the field, and they tied tails of lambs one to another, and the tail of one of them was severed, and he is a firstborn, and the matter came before the sages and they permitted it. They saw that they permitted it, they went and tied the tails of other firstborns, and they prohibited it. This is the principle: Anything that is done intentionally — is prohibited, if it is not intentional — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פַּעַם אַחֶרֶת הָיָה כּוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גּוֹי — דְּלָא אָתֵי לְמִיסְרַךְ, אֲבָל קָטָן דְּאָתֵי לְמִיסְרַךְ — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: one time were And necessary. As, had taught us gentile, as not will acquire the habit But minor, that he to acquire the habit say not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, pa'am acheret haya ku. U'tzricha, de'i ashmeinan goy - de'lo atei lemisrach, aval katan de'atei lemisrach - eima la." English translation: "The Gemara, another time it was thus. And it is necessary, for if we hear of a non-Jew - that he does not come to deceive, but a minor who comes to deceive - we say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן קָטָן, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּגָדוֹל, אֲבָל גּוֹי דְּאָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּגָדוֹל — אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us a minor, since no will come to confuse with an adult. But a gentile that come to confuse with adult, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a case of a minor, it is because he does not come to exchange with an adult, but a non-Jew who comes to exchange with an adult - say no. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ ״אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה בּוֹ מוּם״, אֲבָל אִם אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ ״אִם נַעֲשָׂה בּוֹ מוּם״ — כְּמַאן דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ ״זִיל עֲבֵיד בֵּיהּ מוּמָא״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Rav Ketina says: They taught only where said to unless it has a blemish, But if they said to him if a blemish was caused upon it, it is considered as though they told him: Go and cause a blemish on it,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav Qatina: They only taught this when they said to him, "Unless there was a blemish in it," but if they said to him, "If a blemish occurs in it," it is like one who says to him, "Go and make a blemish in it" - it is comparable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי מִמֵּילָא הוּא, מָה לִי ״הָיָה״, מָה לִי ״נַעֲשָׂה״? אֶלָּא ״נַעֲשָׂה״ נָמֵי מִמֵּילָא הוּא, וְלָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Now by itself, what to me had was caused Rather, Was caused, also by itself, and is no difference
llm_translation: Rava said: From the outset it is so, what do I need "was," what do I need "will be done"? Rather, "will be done" is also from the outset, and not different.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא לְדַעַת — אָסוּר. לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי גְּרָמָא.
human_translation: this the principle: any that is with intent, prohibited. What to add? to add an indirect
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that is intentional is prohibited. What is the reason? To establish causation.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת — לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מֵסִיחַ לְפִי תוּמּוֹ.
human_translation: without intent, to add speaks offhandedly.
llm_translation: Not for knowledge - for the purpose of idle talk, one should open his mouth.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה בְּכוֹר רֹדְפוֹ, בְּעָטוֹ, וְעָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּם — הֲרֵי זֶה שׁוֹחֲטִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: firstborn was pursuing him, he kicked and caused a blemish in it, he may slaughter on that
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the firstborn is pursuing him, with a stick, and he causes a blemish in him - this one may slaughter upon him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּעָטוֹ בִּשְׁעַת רְדִיפָה, אֲבָל לְאַחַר רְדִיפָה — לָא. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: They taught only where he kicked it at the time of its pursuit. But after pursuit, not obvious
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Amar Rav Papa: Lo Shanu Ela Shev'ato Bish'at Redifah, Aval Le'achar Redifah - La. Peshita! English translation: The Gemara, Rav Papa said: They only taught this regarding his staff during the pursuit, but after the pursuit - no. It is obvious!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: צַעְרֵיהּ הוּא דְּמִדְּכַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say he recalls his distress teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? It is because of his distress, as it is stated for us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא בִּשְׁעַת רְדִיפָה — אִין, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת רְדִיפָה — לָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר רְדִיפָה נָמֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא? צַעֲרֵיהּ [הוּא] דְּמִדְּכַר.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Pappa says: Do not say at the time of pursuit, yes, but not at the time of pursuit, not Rather, even after pursuit also What is the reason? he recalls his distress
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Papa said: Do not say that in a time of pursuit — no, but that not in a time of pursuit — yes, rather even after the pursuit also. What is the reason? His distress that is remembered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מוּתָּר לְהַטִּיל מוּם בִּבְכוֹר קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם. אָמַר רָבָא: גַּדְיָא בְּאוּדְנֵיהּ, אִימְּרָא בְּשִׂפְוָותֵיהּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אִימְּרָא נָמֵי בְּאוּדְנֵיהּ, אֵימוֹר דֶּרֶךְ צְדָעָיו נְפַק.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: It is permitted to cause a blemish in a firstborn before it emerges into the air of the world, Rava said: a kid, on its ear. a lamb, on its lip. There are who say a lamb as well, on its ear, say it emerges through its temples,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: It is permitted to inflict a blemish on a firstborn animal before it emerges into the air of the world. Rava said: A kid in its womb, a lamb in its wool. Some say: A lamb also in its womb, say that it comes out with its hooves first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָכֵל וְלָא מִיחֲזֵי, פָּעֵי וּמִיחֲזֵי — הָוֵי מוּמָא. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הַחוּטִין הַחִיצוֹנוֹת — שֶׁנִּפְגְּמוּ וְשֶׁנִּגְמְמוּ, הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת — שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּכִי פָּעֵי מִיחְזֵי?!
human_translation: Rava says: eats, is not visible, cries out, it is visible, is a blemish, What is teaching us? We learn The external gums that were damaged that were scratched, the internal that were extracted, What is the reason not because when cries out, it is visible?
llm_translation: Rava said: One who eats and does not appear, drinks and appears - is considered a blemish. What does this teach us? We learned: The outer threads - whether they are torn or tangled, the inner threads - if they are uprooted. What is the reason? Is it not because when one eats, it is visible?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: רָבָא נָמֵי טַעְמָא דְמַתְנִיתִין מְפָרֵשׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא נֶעְקְרוּ הָוֵי מוּמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּכִי פָּעֵי מִיחְזֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says Rava is explaining the reason of the mishna: What is the reason were extracted it is a blemish? that when cries out, is visible.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Rava also explains the reason of the Mishnah. What is the reason? If they were uprooted, it would be a blemish - because when they are uprooted, they are visible.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַמּוּמִין הָרְאוּיִין לָבֹא בִּידֵי אָדָם, רוֹעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֱמָנִין, רוֹעִים כֹּהֲנִים אֵינָן נֶאֱמָנִין. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָן הוּא עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן עַל שֶׁל עַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַדֶּבֶר, לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ.
human_translation: all the blemishes that are capable of being brought about by a person, Israelite shepherds are deemed credible priest-shepherds are not deemed credible, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: deemed credible about of another, but is not deemed credible about to him. Rabbi Meir says: who is suspect about the matter neither adjudicate nor testify
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All blemishes that are fit to be assessed by human hands, the shepherds of Israel are trusted, but the shepherds of priests are not trusted. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One is trusted regarding the property of his fellow, but not trusted regarding his own property. Rabbi Meir says: If one is suspected of a matter, do not judge him and do not testify against him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, חַד אָמַר: ״רוֹעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ בֵּי כֹהֲנִים — נֶאֱמָנִין, לִלְגִימָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar One says Israelite shepherds the house of priests, deemed credible we are not concerned for a swallow [ lilegima ]
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar, one said: "Shepherds of Israel" in the house of Kohanim - are trustworthy, to suspect them we do not.

hebrew_text: רוֹעֵי כֹּהֲנִים בֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין, מֵימָר אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא טָרַחְנָא בֵּיהּ, לָא שָׁבֵיק לְדִידִי וְיָהֵיב לְאַחֲרִינֵי.
human_translation: priest-shepherds the house of an Israelite, are not deemed credible can say: Since I have toiled with will not forsake me and give to another
llm_translation: Those who tend to the needs of the priests in the households of Israel - they are not trustworthy. For it was stated: Since he has exerted himself in it, he did not leave it for me and gave it to others.

hebrew_text: וְהוּא הַדִּין כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְגוֹמְלִין.
human_translation: And the same is true a priest for priest. as we are concerned about reciprocal
llm_translation: And the same applies to a Kohen to a Kohen, for we are concerned for theft.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמֵימַר: נֶאֱמָן הוּא עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן עַל שֶׁל עַצְמוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְמֵימַר: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַדֶּבֶר לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel comes to say about of another is deemed credible, he is not deemed with regard to his own And Rabbi Meir comes to say who is suspect about the matter neither adjudicate nor testify
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel came to say: One is trusted regarding the property of his fellow, but he is not trusted regarding his own property. And Rabbi Meir came to say: Suspicion about a matter, we do not judge it and we do not testify about it.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: ״רוֹעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ וְהֵן כֹּהֲנִים — נֶאֱמָנִין,
human_translation: And one says: Israelite shepherds are priests are deemed credible
llm_translation: And one said: "Shepherds of Israel" and they are priests - trustworthy.

hebrew_text: מֵימָר אָמַר: לָא שָׁבֵיק צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְיָהֵיב לְדִידִי. ״רוֹעֵי כֹהֲנִים״ וְהֵן יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינָן נֶאֱמָנִין, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִלְגִימָא.
human_translation: say: will not forsake a Torah scholar and give to me, priest-shepherds are Israelites not deemed credible as we are concerned for a swallow
llm_translation: Maimar said: He did not leave a Zarba from the Rabbis and gave it to me. "The shepherds of the priests" and they are Israelites - they are not trusted, for we are concerned about theft.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְגוֹמְלִין, וְחָיְישִׁינַן לִלְגִימָא. וַאֲתָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן לְמֵימַר: נֶאֱמָן עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן עַל שֶׁל עַצְמוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְמֵימַר: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַדָּבָר, לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ.
human_translation: And all the more so a priest for priest as we are concerned that reciprocal and we are concerned for a swallow And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel comes to say is deemed credible with regard to of another but is not deemed credible with regard to himself. And Rabbi Meir comes to say who is suspect about the matter neither adjudicate nor testify
llm_translation: And all the more so, a Kohen to a Kohen, we are concerned for theft, and we are concerned for deception. And Rabban Shimon came to say: One is trusted regarding that of his fellow, but he is not trusted regarding his own. And Rabbi Meir came to say: One who is suspected of a matter, we do not judge him and we do not testify against him.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: רוֹעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהֵן כֹּהֲנִים נֶאֱמָנִין — הַיְינוּ דַּאֲתָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְמֵימַר: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַדָּבָר לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says Israelite shepherds are priests are deemed credible this is that Rabbi Meir comes to say who is suspect about the matter neither adjudicate nor testify
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says: Shepherds of Israel and they are priests trustworthy - this is what Rabbi Meir came to say: If there is suspicion regarding the matter, do not judge it and do not testify about it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: רוֹעֵי כֹהֲנִים בֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין — מַאי אֲתָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: But according to the one who says priest-shepherds an Israelite’s house, are not deemed credible what is Rabbi Meir coming to teach us? This is first tanna
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: "The shepherds of the priests among the children of Israel are not trustworthy" — what does Rabbi Meir come to teach us? That is the same as the first Tanna!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹסַאי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹסַאי אוֹמֵר: בְּכוֹר בֵּי כֹהֵן צָרִיךְ שְׁנַיִם מִן הַשּׁוּק לְהָעִיד עָלָיו.
human_translation: There is between with regard to of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefusai. As it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefusai says: a firstborn in the house of a priest two from the marketplace, required to testify about it
llm_translation: There is a dispute between Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kapposai, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kapposai says: "The firstborn of a Kohen requires two witnesses from the marketplace to testify about him."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּנוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ בִּתּוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה וְהֵן בְּנֵי בֵיתוֹ אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even son even his daughter Rabbi Yosei says: Even ten they are members of his household, they may not testify about it.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even his son, even his daughter. Rabbi Yosei says: Even ten, and his household members do not testify against him.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: סְפֵק בְּכוֹר שֶׁנּוֹלַד בֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל, צָרִיךְ שְׁנַיִם מִן הַשּׁוּק לְהָעִיד עָלָיו?
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Ḥisda says Rav Ketina says: firstborn uncertain that was born house, of an Israelite, two from the marketplace required to testify about it?
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This one, as Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav Kattina: In the case of doubt regarding a firstborn that was born in the house of Israel, do we require two witnesses from the marketplace to testify about it?

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹסַאי.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefusai.
llm_translation: As whom? As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kapposai.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּעָלִים מְעִידִין עָלָיו, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, מַעֲשֵׂר לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִי מֵעִיד עָלָיו?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: owners may testify about it. As, if you do not say so, tithe According to Rabbi Meir, who can testify about it?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The owners testify about it, for if you do not say so, who testifies about the tithe to Rabbi Meir?

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר וַדַּאי מְהֵימַן, דְּאִי בָּעֵי שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ עֶדְרֵיהּ. אֶלָּא סְפֵק בְּכוֹר, לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִי מֵעִיד עָלָיו?
human_translation: tithe certainly deemed credible because if he wants, cause a blemish in his entire flock Rather, firstborn uncertain, according to Rabbi Meir, who can testify about it?
llm_translation: Tithe and certain trustworthy, for if he wants to throw in it blemish in all its limbs. Rather, doubt regarding firstborn, according to Rabbi Meir who testifies about him?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא, וְהָתְנַן, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחֲלִיפָיו בְּיַד כֹּהֵן פָּטוּר מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב!
human_translation: And if you would say indeed, has no remedy But didn’t we learn that Rabbi Yosei would say: Any whose replacements in the possession of a priest is exempt from, the gifts, and Rabbi Meir deems obligated
