llm_translation: And if you will say, so it is indeed that there is no remedy for it, yet we have learned, for Rabbi Yosei used to say: Anyone whose exchange was done by a Kohen's hand is exempt from the gifts, but Rabbi Meir obligates!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּעָלִים מְעִידִין עָלָיו, כֹּהֲנִים הוּא דַּחֲשִׁידִי אַמּוּמֵי, יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא חֲשִׁידִי אַמּוּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, learn from this owners may testify about it is priests who are suspected of blemishes; Israelites are not suspected of blemishes.
llm_translation: Rather, hear a conclusion: Owners testify about him, Kohanim are suspected of blemishes, Israelites are not suspected of blemishes.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, רָבָא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: was stated: Rav Naḥman says halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, Rava says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Nachman said: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rava said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: בְּעָלִים עוֹמְדִים עִמָּנוּ בַּחוּץ, נִכְנַס שָׁלֵם וְיָצָא חָבוּל — מְעִידִין עָלָיו! אֵימָא: כׇּל בְּעָלִים עוֹמְדִים, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: And does Rava say this? But doesn’t Rava say: owner standing outside with us, entered whole and emerged injured, may testify about it say all the owners, are standing outside, and we are not concerned
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Rava? But didn't Rava say: If the owners are standing with us outside, and the animal goes in whole and comes out damaged - they testify against him! I might say: All owners are standing, and we are not concerned."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵיחוּשׁ לַחֲשָׁדָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְדַוְקָא בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ, אֲבָל אִשְׁתּוֹ לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִשְׁתּוֹ כְּגוּפוֹ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: If so, what of stating lest you say we should entertain a suspicion teaches us And the halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, And specifically his son and daughter, but his wife not What is the reason? One’s wife is as oneself.
llm_translation: So what is there to say? What might one say? Perhaps to suspect, he is listening to our conversation. And the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, specifically his son and daughter, but not his wife. What is the reason? His wife is considered like himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַדָּבָר לֹא דָּנוֹ וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ, וְקָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הֶחָשׁוּד לְדָבָר אֶחָד חָשׁוּד לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, כֹּהֲנִים הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא דָּיְינִי דִּינָא? וְהָכְתִיב ״וְעַל פִּיהֶם יִהְיֶה כׇּל רִיב וְכׇל נָגַע״!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: According to Rabbi Meir, who says that who is suspect about the matter neither adjudicate nor testify and Rabbi Meir says one who is suspected of one matter, is suspected of the entire Torah, priests also not administer judgment But isn’t it written “And according to their word shall every controversy and every stroke be”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: According to Rabbi Meir who said, "One suspected of a matter, we do not judge him and we do not testify against him," and Rabbi Meir said: One suspected in one matter is suspected in the entire Torah, are the priests not sufficient for the judgment? And it is written, "And according to their mouth shall every controversy and every plague be."

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר לַחֲשָׁשָׁא, לְאַחְזוֹקִינְהוּ מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: say that Rabbi Meir says that a concern did he say to establish them
llm_translation: Said that Rabbi Meir to the concern, to strengthen them who said?

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, מַהוּ לְעֵדוּת בְּכוֹר? רַב אַסִּי אָסַר, וְרַב אָשֵׁי שָׁרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַסִּי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא תָּנָא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה: אֵין עֵד מִפִּי עֵד כָּשֵׁר אֶלָּא לְעֵדוּת הָאִשָּׁה!
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before testimony hearsay, what is in testimony firstborn Rav Asi deems prohibited and Rav Ashi deems permitted. Rav Asi said to Rav Ashi: But isn’t it taught in school of Menashe hearsay testimony is valid only for testimony of a woman,
llm_translation: He asked them: A witness from the mouth of a witness, what about testimony regarding a firstborn? Rav Assi prohibited it, and Rav Ashe permitted it. Rav Assi said to Rav Ashe: But didn't the Mishnaic school of Menashe teach: A witness from the mouth of a witness is valid only for testimony regarding a woman!

hebrew_text: תְּנִי: אֶלָּא לְעֵדוּת שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁרָה לָהּ בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: teach only for testimony for which a woman is valid.
llm_translation: The text states: Rather, as testimony that the woman is fit for him alone.

hebrew_text: רַב יֵימַר אַכְשַׁר עֵד מִפִּי עֵד בִּבְכוֹר, קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ מָרִימָר: ״יֵימַר שָׁרֵי בּוּכְרָא״. וְהִלְכְתָא: עֵד מִפִּי עֵד כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar deemed fit testimony hearsay with regard to firstborn Mareimar called him: Yeimar permits firstborn And the halakha testimony hearsay is valid of a firstborn
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar: A valid witness from the mouth of a witness regarding a firstborn, Marimar calls out: "Yeimar permits the firstborn." And the halakha is: A witness from the mouth of a witness is valid for testimony regarding a firstborn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: לֹא הָיוּ מוּחְזָקִין בּוֹ שֶׁהוּא בְּכוֹר, וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר שֶׁהוּא בְּכוֹר וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ — נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a says: was not established as being a firstborn, and one came and said that it is a firstborn and its blemish is with it, he is deemed credible,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai said: They were not established in him that he is a firstborn, and one came and said that he is a firstborn and his blemish is with him - he is believed.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר? תְּנֵינָא: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה ״אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ הָיִיתִי וּגְרוּשָׁה אֲנִי״ נֶאֱמֶנֶת, שֶׁהַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר הוּא הַפֶּה שֶׁהִתִּיר!
human_translation: What is teaching us? that the mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted we learn a woman who said: I was a married woman and I am a divorcée, she is deemed credible as the mouth that prohibited is the mouth that permitted
llm_translation: What is it teaching us, that the mouth that forbade is the mouth that permitted? We learned: A woman who said, "I was the wife of a man and now I am divorced," is believed, for the mouth that forbade is the mouth that permitted!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא לָא אָמְרָה. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא סַגִּיא דְּלָא אָמְרָה, דְּקָדָשִׁים בְּחוּץ לָא אָכֵיל,
human_translation: lest you say it is there, as, if she wants she not say But here, as, it not sufficient not to say as he would not eat sacrificial outside
llm_translation: What is the reason? There, because if she wants, she does not say. But here, since it is not a significant matter that she did not say, consecrated items may not be eaten outside.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: לָא הַפֶּה שֶׁאָסַר הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאִי מִשּׁוּם הָכִי — הֲוָה שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא דְּנִיכָּר וְאָכֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: I say this is not The mouth that prohibited teaches us because if it due to that he would have caused a blemish that obvious to all.
llm_translation: Mother: The mouth that prohibited it, is teaching us, that if for this reason — he would throw into it a blemish that is recognizable and feed it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאוֹגַר לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תֵּיזִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד דְּאִיכָּא מַיָּא, זִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דְּנַרֶשׁ דְּלֵיכָּא מַיָּא. אֲזַל בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד וּמִית חֲמָרָא, וַאֲתָא וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד אָזְלִי, וּמִיהוּ מַיָּא לָא הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi objects to this: What is different that a certain man who rented a donkey to another? said to Look, do not go on the path of Nehar Pekod, where there is water go on the path of Neresh, where there is no water. went on the path of Nehar Pekod and the donkey died. When he came he said: I went on the path of Nehar Pekod, but there was no water
llm_translation: The Master, Bar Rav Ashi, raised an objection to him: What is different about that man who stores wine for his friends, and said to him: Do not go on the path of the river Pekod where there is water, go on the path of the river Nares where there is no water. He went on the path of the river Pekod and the wine died, and he came and said to him: I went on the path of the river Pekod, but there was no water.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר רָבָא: מָה לוֹ לְשַׁקֵּר, אִי בָּעֵי אָמַר: בְּאוֹרְחָא דְּנַרֶשׁ אֲזַלִי. וַאֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״מָה לוֹ לְשַׁקֵּר״ בִּמְקוֹם עֵדִים לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: And Rava said: Why would he lie if wanted he told I went on the path of Neresh, And Abaye said to We do not say Why would he lie, in a place witnesses.
llm_translation: And Rava said: What does he have to lie, if he wants he can say: "I went on the path of the eagle." And Abbaye said: "What does he have to lie" - in a place where there are witnesses we do not say.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם וַדַּאי אִיכָּא מַיָּא, הָכָא וַדַּאי שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא — חֲשָׁשָׁא הוּא, וּבִמְקוֹם חֲשָׁשָׁא אָמְרִינַן ״מָה לוֹ לְשַׁקֵּר״. יָתֵיב רָבִינָא וְקָאָמַר לְהַאי שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּלָא גַּבְרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא זוּטֵי לְרָבִינָא: אֲנַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אִילְעָא מַתְנִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, there is certainly water there, but that caused a blemish in is a concern, and in a place of concern we say Why would he lie? Ravina was sitting and saying this halakha anonymously. Rava Zuti said to Ravina: We learned this in the name of Rabbi Ile’a.
llm_translation: So is this the question?! There, certainly there is water, here certainly there is a blemish in it - it is a concern, and in a place of concern we say "why should he lie." Ravina was sitting and saying to this matter without a man, Rava said to him: "We learn this from the name of Rabbi Ilai."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי צָדוֹק הֲוָה לֵיהּ בּוּכְרָא, רְמָא לֵיהּ שְׂעָרֵי בְּסַלֵּי, בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאָכֵיל אִיבְּזַע שִׂיפְתֵּיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר לוֹ: כְּלוּם חִילַּקְנוּ בֵּין חָבֵר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Tzadok, had a firstborn He placed barley in baskets for it, while it was eating, its lip split, came before Rabbi Yehoshua, said to him: Didn’t we differentiate between a ḥaver , and an ignoramus, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tzadok had a boil on his thigh, he placed barley hairs in baskets, while he was eating, his lips would become soiled. Rabbi Yehoshua came before him, he said to him: Have we not distinguished between a colleague and an am ha'aretz? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: Yes.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אָמַר לוֹ: חִילַּקְנוּ בֵּין חָבֵר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ? אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לָא. אָמַר לוֹ: (והא) [וַהֲלֹא] רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר לִי הֵן! אָמַר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלוּ בַּעֲלֵי תְרִיסִין לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: came before Rabban Gamliel, said to him: we differentiate between a ḥaver and an ignoramus Rabban Gamliel said to him: No, said to him: But Rabbi Yehoshua said to me yes, said to Wait until the masters of the shields [ ba’alei terisin ], enter the study hall,
llm_translation: He came before Rabban Gamliel, he said to him: Did we divide between a colleague and an am ha'aretz? He said to him Rabban Gamliel: No. He said to him: Didn't Rabbi Yehoshua say to me yes! He said to him: Wait until the owners of the balconies come to the study hall.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, עָמַד הַשּׁוֹאֵל וְשָׁאַל: כְּלוּם חִילַּקְנוּ בֵּין חָבֵר לְעַם הָאָרֶץ? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לָאו. אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: וַהֲלֹא מִשִּׁמְךָ אָמְרוּ לִי הֵן!
human_translation: When entered the study hall, the questioner stood and asked: didn’t we differentiate between a ḥaver and an ignoramus? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, Rabban Gamliel said to him: But they said to me in your name yes,
llm_translation: When they entered the study hall, the inquirer stood and asked: Have we not distinguished between a colleague and an am ha'aretz? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No. Rabban Gamliel said to him: Did they not say to me, "Yes," in your name!

hebrew_text: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, עֲמוֹד עַל רַגְלֶיךָ, וְיָעִידוּ בְּךָ. עָמַד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: הֵיאַךְ אֶעֱשֶׂה? אִילְמָלֵי אֲנִי חַי וְהוּא מֵת — יָכוֹל הַחַי לְהַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַמֵּת, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֲנִי חַי וְהוּא חַי — הֵיאַךְ חַי יָכוֹל לְהַכְחִישׁ אֶת הַחַי?
human_translation: Yehoshua, stand on your feet and they will testify against you Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: How should I act If I were alive and were dead, the living can contradict the dead, Now that I am alive and he is alive, how can the living contradict the living?
llm_translation: Joshua, stand on your feet, and they shall testify against you. Rabbi Joshua stood on his feet and said: How can I do this? If I am alive and he is dead - the living can contradict the dead; now that I am alive and he is alive - how can the living contradict the living?

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עוֹמֵד וְדוֹרֵשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עוֹמֵד עַל רַגְלָיו, עַד שֶׁרִינְּנוּ כׇּל הָעָם וְאָמְרוּ לְחוּצְפִּית הַמְתוּרְגְּמָן: עֲמוֹד! וְעָמַד.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel was standing and lecturing, and Rabbi Yehoshua was standing on his feet, until all of the people murmuring and said to Ḥutzpit the disseminator: Stop and he stopped.
llm_translation: And it was that Rabban Gamliel was standing and expounding, and Rabbi Yehoshua was standing on his feet, until all the people fell silent, and they said to the interpreter: "Stand up!" And he stood.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נֶאֱמָן הַכֹּהֵן לוֹמַר: הֶרְאֵיתִי בְּכוֹר זֶה וּבַעַל מוּם הוּא.
human_translation: A priest is deemed credible to say: I showed this firstborn and it is blemished.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A Kohen is believed to say, "I have seen this firstborn and he is blemished."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: נֶאֱמָן הַכֹּהֵן לוֹמַר ״בְּכוֹר זֶה נָתַן לִי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמוּמוֹ״. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקְּרִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, נֶאֱמָן הַכֹּהֵן לוֹמַר ״הֶרְאֵיתִי בְּכוֹר זֶה וּבַעַל מוּם הוּא״. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקְּרִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A priest is deemed credible to say: An Israelite gave me this firstborn with its blemish What is the reason? any matter that is likely to be revealed, people do not lie about it. Rav Ashi said: We learn as well: A priest is deemed credible to say: I showed this firstborn and it is blemished. What is the reason Is it not because we say any matter that is likely to be revealed, people do not lie about it?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: A priest is believed to say, "This firstborn was given to me by Israel with its blemish." What is the reason? Every matter that a person does not benefit from, people do not lie about it. Rav Ashi said: We also learned, a priest is believed to say, "I have seen this firstborn and it is blemished." What is the reason? Not because we say, every matter that a person does not benefit from, people do not lie about it.

hebrew_text: הָתָם הוּא דְּקָדָשִׁים בְּחוּץ לָא אָכֵיל, אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲשִׁידִי — חֲשִׁידִי.
human_translation: there, he not eat sacrificial outside But here, since are suspected they are suspected
llm_translation: There, that which is holy outside may not be eaten, but here, once it is deemed suspect - it is suspect.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁיזְבִי: הָאוֹמֵר לְמִי שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱמָן עַל הַמַּעֲשֵׂר ״קַח לִי מִמִּי שֶׁהוּא נֶאֱמָן״ אוֹ ״מִמִּי שֶׁהוּא מְעַשֵּׂר״ — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. אַמַּאי? נֵימָא: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקְּרִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי!
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi raises an objection one who says to someone who is not trusted with regard to tithe: Purchase for me from someone who is trusted or from someone who tithes, is not deemed credible why Say any matter that is likely to be revealed, people do not lie about it.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheizbi raised an objection: One who says to someone who is not trusted regarding tithes, "Take from someone who is trusted," or "Take from someone who tithes," he is not trusted. Why? Let us say: People do not lie about anything that will be revealed!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם,
human_translation: It is different there,
llm_translation: The years there,

hebrew_text: דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְאִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי.
human_translation: as he has of extricating himself
llm_translation: There is for him to lean on.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא וַדַּאי מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי — הֲרֵי זֶה נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: latter clause certainly supports from so-and-so, this is deemed credible
llm_translation: The continuation (Seifa) certainly supports him: "From a certain man" - this one is trustworthy.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ תּוֹבֵעַ, מִירְתַת.
human_translation: There, since has a claimant, he is afraid
llm_translation: There, since there is to him he claims, he is afraid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: מְנָא לֵיהּ לִיהוּדָה הָא? אֲנָא בְּגִידּוּל קְבַעְתָּיהּ, וְגִידּוּל קְבַע בְּדִידֵיהּ. וְהָכִי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: נֶאֱמָן יִשְׂרָאֵל לוֹמַר ״בְּכוֹר זֶה נָתַתִּי לְכֹהֵן בְּמוּמוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: From where does Yehuda this I taught this to Giddul and Giddul, taught it to But this is how I said it to him: An Israelite is deemed credible to say: I gave this firstborn to a priest with its blemish
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: How do we know that Judah is reliable? I, through his greatness, have established him, and his greatness he has established in his own right. And thus they say to him: "Israel is trustworthy to say, 'I have given this firstborn to the priest with a blemish.'"

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל? פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא בְּקָטָן וְהִגְדִּיל, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָא קִים לֵיהּ? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: An Israelite? obvious No, necessary, to young and it grew older lest you say does not recognize it teaches us
llm_translation: Israel? Obviously! Not necessary in a minor and then grew, what do you say: did not establish it? It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא מַתְנוּ כְּלִשָּׁנָא בָתְרָא, בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא כְּלִשָּׁנָא קַמָּא, וְהִלְכְתָא אֲפִילּוּ כְּלִשָּׁנָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: In Sura, they teach in accordance with the latter version, In Pumbedita, in accordance with the first version, And the halakha in accordance with even the first version.
llm_translation: In Surah, they taught like the latter language, in Pumbedita like the former language, and the halakha follows even like the former language.

hebrew_text: רַפְרָם בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ בּוּכְרָא, וְיַהֲבֵיהּ לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן בְּלָא מוּמָא. אֲזַל שְׁדָא בֵּיהּ מוּמָא. יוֹמָא חַד חֲלַשׁ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, אַיְיתְיֵהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּכוֹר זֶה נָתַן לִי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמוּמוֹ. אַרְפְּסִינֵיהּ לְעֵינֵיהּ, חַזְיֵיהּ בְּשִׁקְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אֲנָא דִּיהֵיבְתֵּיהּ לָךְ?
human_translation: Rafram, in Pumbedita, had a firstborn and he gave it to a priest an unblemished went and caused a blemish in it. One day, had an affliction in his eyes, brought it before him, said to him: An Israelite gave me this firstborn with its blemish forced his eyes open saw recognized it [ bashkerei ] said to Is it not I who gave this to you?
llm_translation: Rafrām in Pumbedītha had a blemished firstborn animal, and he gave it to a priest without a blemish. The blemish went away from it. One day it became weak in its eyes, he brought it before him. He said to him: "This firstborn that Israel gave me with its blemish." He turned it towards him, he saw its falsehood. He said to him: "Wasn't it I who gave it to you?"

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא חַשׁ לַהּ לְמִילְּתָא, הַאי הוּא דַּחֲצִיף, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא חֲצִיפִי.
human_translation: And even so, was unconcerned by the matter this who is impudent, all other are not impudent.
llm_translation: And even so, he did not pay attention to the matter, this is the one who is brazen, the whole world does not pay attention.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שָׂרוּעַ דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אָמַר: לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לֵיהּ? אִי כֹּהֵן הוּא, אִי יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא — הֲרֵי בְּכוֹר וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: a certain one was larger than the other, whose came before Rav Ashi said: For what should we be concerned with regard to this whether it is a priest whether it is an Israelite, this is a firstborn whose blemish with it
llm_translation: That official who came before Rav Ashi, said: "For what is he suspected?" If he is a Kohen, if he is an Israelite - behold, his firstborn and his blemish are with him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְדִלְמָא יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֵין רוֹאִין בְּכוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן כֹּהֵן עִמּוֹ!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But perhaps it is an Israelite and Rav Yehuda says one may not examine the firstborn of an Israelite unless a priest is with him
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "And perhaps he is an Israelite," and Rav Yehudah said: "We only consider the firstborn of Israel if a Kohen is with him!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, נְהִי דְּקָדָשִׁים בְּחוּץ לָא אָכֵיל, אַמָּמוֹנֵיהּ דְּכֹהֵן חֲשִׁיד.
human_translation: said to How can be compared? There, granted will not eating sacrificial outside he is suspected with regard to the property of a priest.
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it so now?! There, the consecrated items may not be eaten outside, the trusted ones of the priest are suspected.

hebrew_text: הָכָא, מִכְּדֵי יָדַע דְּהַאי מוּם מוּבְהָק הוּא, מַאי טַעְמָא אַתְיוּהּ קַמֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן? מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְּחָכָם; עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ דְּחָכָם לָא עָבֵיד, אִיסּוּרָא עָבֵד?!
human_translation: here, since knows that this is a clear-cut blemish what is the reason he brought before the Sages out of respect for the Sage. does not neglect the respect due a Sage, he commit a transgression
llm_translation: Here, since he knows that this blemish is conspicuous, what is the reason that the Rabbis brought him before them? Because of the honor of the wise; for the honor of the wise, he did not do it, did he do it for the prohibition?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִין עַל מוּמֵי מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Everyone is deemed credible about the blemishes of tithe
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All are trusted regarding blemishes of tithes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאִי בָּעֵי שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא! מִי יָדַע הֵי נָפֵיק?
human_translation: What is the reason that had he wanted, he could have caused a blemish in it initially, does he know which will emerge
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Because if he wants, he can find a blemish in it from the outset! Who knows if it will come out?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ בְּרֵישׁ עַשְׂרָה, ״לֹא יְבַקֵּר בֵּין טוֹב לָרַע״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא! אֶלָּא דְּאִי בָּעֵי שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא (בכולי) [בְּכוּלֵּיהּ] עֶדְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say he leads out as the head of the ten, the Merciful One states: “He shall not search whether it be good or bad” Rather, that had he wanted, he could have caused a blemish in his entire flock,
llm_translation: And if you will say, he takes it out at the beginning of the ten, "He shall not inquire between good and bad," the Merciful One said! Rather, if it requires a blemish in all its members.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּכוֹר שֶׁנִּסְמֵית עֵינוֹ, וְשֶׁנִּקְטְעָה יָדוֹ, וְשֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה רַגְלוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה יִשָּׁחֵט עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי הַכְּנֶסֶת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ שָׁם עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אֵינוֹ נִשְׁחָט אֶלָּא עַל פִּי מוּמְחֶה.
human_translation: a firstborn whose eye was blinded or whose foreleg was severed or whose hind leg was broken, may be slaughtered on the basis of three who attend the synagogue, Rabbi Yosei says: Even if there is twenty-three there, it may be slaughtered only on the basis of an expert
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A firstborn animal that had its eye gouged out, its hand severed, or its leg broken - it may be slaughtered by three members of the synagogue. Rabbi Yosei says: Even if there are twenty-three members present, it is only slaughtered by a skilled individual.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמְרִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה אָמְרִי: הַתָּרַת בְּכוֹר בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי הַכְּנֶסֶת. אָמַר רָבָא: וּבְמוּמִין מוּבְהָקִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai and Rabbi Yehuda Nesia both say in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and some say Rabbi Simlai and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi both say in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: The permitting of a firstborn outside Eretz on the basis of three who attend the synagogue. Rava said: And of clear-cut blemishes,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Shmuelai and Rabbi Yehudah Nesi'ah both said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and they said to him: Rabbi Shmuelai and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi both said in the name of Rabbi Yehudah Nesi'ah: The permission for a firstborn outside the Land is according to the opinion of three members of the assembly. Rava said: And with blemishes that are examined.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: בְּכוֹר שֶׁנִּסְמֵית עֵינוֹ, וְשֶׁנִּקְטְעָה יָדוֹ, וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּבְּרָה רַגְלוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה יִשָּׁחֵט עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי הַכְּנֶסֶת!
human_translation: What is teaching us We learn a firstborn whose eye was blinded or whose foreleg was severed or whose hind leg was broken, may be slaughtered on the basis of three who attend the synagogue.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: If his eye was gouged out, his hand was cut off, or his leg was broken - he may be slaughtered by the testimony of three members of the assembly!

hebrew_text: אִי מִמַּתְנִיתִין הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ אֲפִילּוּ מוּמִין שֶׁאֵין מוּבְהָקִין, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי מוּבְהָקִין — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from the mishna I would say outside Eretz even blemishes that are not clear-cut. And that teaches clear-cut to convey the far-reaching nature of Rabbi Yosei, teaches us
llm_translation: From the Mishnah, I would say: In the public domain, even blemished animals that are not fit for offering, and this that it teaches animals fit for offering - to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Yosei, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא, סָפֵק מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב, סָפֵק מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַתִּירִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מוּמְחֶה. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הֲרֵי זֶה יִשָּׁחֵט עַל פִּי שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי הַכְּנֶסֶת!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says uncertain in the name of Rav uncertain in the name of Shmuel: Three may permit a firstborn in a place where there is no expert. What is teaching us We learn may be slaughtered on the basis of of three who attend the synagogue.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba: A doubt from the name of Rav, a doubt from the name of Shmuel: Three permit the firstborn in a place where there is no blemish. What does this teach us? We learned: Behold, this one shall be slaughtered in the presence of three members of the assembly!

hebrew_text: אִי מִמַּתְנִיתִין הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בִּמְקוֹם מוּמְחֶה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מוּמְחֶה — אִין, בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מוּמְחֶה — לָא.
human_translation: If from the mishna I would say in a place an expert. teaches us in a place where there is no expert, yes, in a place where there is an expert, not
llm_translation: From the Mishnah, I would say: In a place of blemish, it is heard for us: in a place where there is no blemish - no, in a place where there is blemish - yes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר עַמְרָם: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַתִּירִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מוּמְחֶה, שְׁלֹשָׁה מַתִּירִין אֶת הַנֶּדֶר בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין חָכָם. שְׁלֹשָׁה מַתִּירִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מוּמְחֶה
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Amram says: three permit firstborn in a place where there is no expert three dissolve a vow in a place where there is no Sage. three permit firstborn in a place where there is no expert
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Amram said: Three permit the firstborn in a place where there is no blemish, three permit the vow in a place where there is no sage. Three permit the firstborn in a place where there is no blemish.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, שְׁלֹשָׁה מְפִירִין אֶת הַנֶּדֶר בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין חָכָם לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: הֲפָרַת נְדָרִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מֵהֶם חָכָם.
human_translation: to the exclusion of of Rabbi Yosei three dissolve a vow in a place where there is no Sage to the exclusion of of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Dissolution of vows three. Rabbi Yehuda says: one of them a Sage.
llm_translation: To dispute from Rabbi Yosei, three nullify the vow in a place where there is no sage. To dispute from Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Nullification of vows requires three. Rabbi Yehuda says: One of them must be a sage.

hebrew_text: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין חָכָם. כְּגוֹן מַאן? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מֵהֶן חָכָם, מִכְּלָל דְּהָנָךְ כֹּל דְּהוּ? אָמַר רָבִינָא: דְּמַסְבְּרִי לֵיהּ וְסָבַר.
human_translation: in a place where there is no Sage. Who, for example, Rav Naḥman said: For example, me. Rabbi Yehuda says: one of a Sage. by inference that those anyone, Ravina said to whom is explained and he comprehend
llm_translation: In a place where there is no wise person. Such as who? Rav Nachman said: Such as me. Rabbi Yehuda says: Is one of them wise, from the fact that the other one is not? Ravina said: He thinks and thinks.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ שָׁם עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. פְּשִׁיטָא, יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא נִמּוּקוֹ עִמּוֹ? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even if there is twenty-three there, Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. obvious, an individual and many halakha in accordance with many lest you say his reasoning [ nimmuko ] is with him, teaches us
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even if there are twenty-three. Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yosei. It is obvious, the law follows the majority! Lest you say, perhaps he reasoned it out with him? It is clear to us.

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט מֵהָא, דְּהָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אִיתְּמַר, דְּאִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב — תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Resolve from this that that first, was stated in the name of Shmuel. As, if in the name of Rav, why do I two
llm_translation: "Take off from there, for in front of him you have the name of Shmuel Itmar, for if it were in the name of Rav - why do I need two?"

hebrew_text: חֲדָא (מכלל) [מִכְּלָלָא] דַּחֲבִירְתַּהּ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: one was stated from the other, by inference.
llm_translation: One (from all) of her friends was said.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַבְּכוֹר, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁלֹּא הֶרְאָהוּ — מַה שֶּׁאָכְלוּ אָכְלוּ, וְיַחְזִיר לָהֶם הַדָּמִים, וּמַה שֶּׁלֹּא אָכְלוּ — הַבָּשָׂר יִקָּבֵר, וְיַחְזִיר אֶת הַדָּמִים.
human_translation: one who slaughters a firstborn and it was discovered that he did not show it what ate, they ate, and he must return the money to them, And that which they did not eat, meat must be buried, and he must return the money
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who slaughters the firstborn animal, and it becomes known that he did not show it to the priest — whatever they have eaten, they have eaten, and he shall return the blood to them. And whatever they have not eaten, the flesh shall be buried, and he shall return the blood.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפָּרָה וּמְכָרָהּ, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהִיא טְרֵפָה — מַה שֶּׁאָכְלוּ אָכְלוּ, וּמַה שֶּׁלֹּא אָכְלוּ — הֵם יַחֲזִירוּ לוֹ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר, וְהוּא יַחֲזִיר לָהֶם אֶת הַדָּמִים. מְכָרוּהוּ לְגוֹיִם, אוֹ הִטִּילוּהוּ לִכְלָבִים — יְשַׁלְּמוּ דְּמֵי טְרֵפָה.
human_translation: And likewise, one who slaughters a cow and sells it, and it was discovered that it is a tereifa , what ate, they ate, and what they did not eat, they must return the meat to and he must return the money to sold it to gentiles or cast it to the dogs, they pay the value of a tereifa ,
llm_translation: And so one who slaughters the cow and sells it, and it becomes known that it is a treifah - whatever they have eaten, they have eaten, and whatever they have not eaten, they shall return to him the meat, and he shall return to them the blood. If they sold it to gentiles, or they threw it to the dogs - they shall pay for the blood of the treifah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹכֵר בָּשָׂר לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְנִמְצָא בְּשַׂר בְּכוֹר, פֵּירוֹת וְנִמְצָא טְבָלִים, יַיִן וְנִמְצָא יֵין נֶסֶךְ — מַה שֶּׁאָכְלוּ אָכְלוּ, וְיַחְזִיר לָהֶם אֶת הַדָּמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught one sells meat to another and it was discovered meat a firstborn produce and it was discovered untithed produce, wine and it turns out wine a libation what ate, they ate, and reimburses them money.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who sells meat to his fellow and it is found to be firstborn meat, fruits and it is found to be untithed, wine and it is found to be libation wine - whatever they ate, they have eaten, and he must return to them the money.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: דְּבָרִים שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ קָצָה בָּהֶן — יַחֲזִיר לָהֶן אֶת הַדָּמִים, וְשֶׁאֵין הַנֶּפֶשׁ קָצָה בָּהֶם — יְנַכֶּה לָהֶם אֶת הַדָּמִים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן דְּבָרִים שֶׁהַנֶּפֶשׁ קָצָה בָּהֶן: נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין הַנֶּפֶשׁ קָצָה בָּהֶן: בְּכוֹרוֹת, טְבָלִים וְיֵין נֶסֶךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, items from which one is repulsed, he must reimburse them money, But items from which one is not repulsed, he deducts for them the value And the following are items from which one is repulsed: Carcasses and tereifot , repugnant creatures, and creeping animals. And the following are items from which one is not repulsed: Firstborn untithed produce, and wine a libation
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Words that the soul is repulsed by - one should return their blood, and words that the soul is not repulsed by - one should spill their blood. And these are the words that the soul is repulsed by: carcasses and torn animals, abominations and creeping things. And these are the words that the soul is not repulsed by: firstborn animals, ritual immersion, and libation wine.

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר — וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַאי אַפְסֵדְתָּךְ?
human_translation: a firstborn Let say to What loss have I caused you
llm_translation: Firstborn - And why not say to him: What is your loss?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, כְּגוֹן דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ מִמְּקוֹם מוּמָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּאָכְלַתְּ הֲוָה מַחְזֵינָא לֵיהּ וְשָׁרֵי נִיהֲלֵיהּ, כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: No, necessary where he sold him from an area a blemish, that say to Had you not eaten I would have shown and he deemed it permitted in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Not necessary, for example, if they slaughter it from a blemished place, he said to him: If you did not eat, we would see it and allow it to him, like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: טְבָלִים — הֲוָה מַתְקֵינְנָא לְהוּ וְאָכֵלְנָא לְהוּ, יֵין נֶסֶךְ — עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת, וּכְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: untithed produce, I would have remedied it, and eaten it. wine a libation in a mixture in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: "Tevalim - havah matkeinan lehu ve'achelna lehu, yayin nesekh - al yedei ta'arovet, u'k'Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: יֵין נֶסֶךְ שֶׁנָּפַל לַבּוֹר — כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יִמָּכֵר כּוּלּוֹ לְגוֹיִם, חוּץ מִדְּמֵי יֵין נֶסֶךְ שֶׁבּוֹ.
human_translation: As we learned wine a libation that fell into cistern, prohibited derive benefit all Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: All of the may be sold to a gentile, except for the value of the wine a libation in it.
llm_translation: We have learned: Wine of libation that fell into a pit - all of it is forbidden for benefit. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It should all be sold to non-Jews, except for the value of the wine of libation within it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כׇּל פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין.
llm_translation: We will return to you, all the disqualifications of the consecrated items.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַל אֵלּוּ מוּמִין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר: נִפְגְּמָה אׇזְנוֹ מִן הַחַסְחוּס, אֲבָל לֹא הָעוֹר, נִסְדְּקָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָסְרָה, נִיקְּבָה מְלֹא כַרְשִׁינָה, אוֹ שֶׁיָּבְשָׁה. אֵיזֶהוּ יְבֵשָׁה? כֹּל שֶׁתִּנָּקֵב וְאֵינָהּ מוֹצִיאָה טִיפַּת דָּם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם אוֹמֵר: יְבֵשָׁה שֶׁתְּהֵא נִפְרֶכֶת.
human_translation: For these blemishes, one may slaughter the firstborn ear was damaged from the cartilage [ haḥasḥus ], but not the skin was split, although it is not lacking; was pierced the size of a bitter vetch, or that desiccated. What is a desiccated any that it is pierced it does not discharge a drop of blood. Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: Desiccated that it will crumble
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On these blemishes one may slaughter the firstborn: if its ear was damaged from the chaschus, but not the skin; if it was split even though it did not diminish; if it was pierced the size of a sela, or if it dried up. What is considered dried up? Any blemish that is pierced and does not emit a drop of blood. Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: It is considered dried up when it can be crumbled.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? פִּסֵּחַ וְעִוֵּר כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Why a lame and a blind written
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Gemara: 'Amai?' Pesach ve'ivar ktiv!"

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בוֹ מוּם״, וְאֵימָא: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בּוֹ מוּם״ — כָּלַל, ״פִּסֵּחַ אוֹ עִוֵּר״ — פָּרַט, כְּלָל וּפְרָט אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מָה שֶׁבַּפְּרָט; פִּסֵּחַ וְעִוֵּר — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא!
human_translation: It is also written “If there be any blemish therein,” But say “if there be any blemish therein” a generalization, “lameness, or blindness” a detail. a generalization and a detail the generalization includes only that which is in the detail. lameness and blindness, yes, another matter, not
llm_translation: It is written: "If there is a blemish in it," but why not say: "If there is a blemish in him" — this is a generalization. "A Passover offering or a blind one" — this is a specification. In a generalization and specification, there is nothing in the generalization except what is in the specification; Passover offering and blind one — no, it is from another source — no!

hebrew_text: ״כֹּל מוּם רָע״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל, כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל — אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט; מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ — מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִין, אַף כֹּל מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִין.
human_translation: “Any ill blemish,” it then generalized a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. Just as the detail, defined as blemishes that are exposed and do not regenerate, so too, all blemishes that are exposed and do not regenerate
llm_translation: "Every blemish evil" — he repeated and included, general and specific and general — if you judge only like the specific; just as the specific is explicit — blemishes that are visible and do not return, so too all blemishes that are visible and do not return.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ — מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי, וּבוֹטֵל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר, אַף כֹּל — מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי, וּבוֹטֵל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר. אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: נִפְגְּמָה אׇזְנוֹ מִן הַחַסְחוּס וְלֹא מִן הָעוֹר?
human_translation: But say just as the detail, defined as blemishes that are exposed and desist from its labor, and do not regenerate, so too, all blemishes that are exposed and desist from its labor and do not regenerate Why did we learn ear was damaged from the cartilage, but not from the skin,
llm_translation: And why? What is the explicit detail? — Blemishes that are visible, and he ceases from his work, and does not return. So too, all — blemishes that are visible, and he ceases from his work, and does not return. Why do we learn: If his ear was damaged from the earlobe and not from the skin?

hebrew_text: כֹּל מוּם רָע רִיבּוּיָא הוּא, אִי הָכִי, מוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר נָמֵי? אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: חוּטִין הַחִיצוֹנוֹת שֶׁנִּפְגְּמוּ וְשֶׁנִּגְמְמוּ, וְהַפְּנִימִיּוֹת שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ —
human_translation: “any ill blemish” is an amplification, If so, blemishes that are hidden also Why did we learn external gums that were damaged or that were scratched [ veshenigmemu ] and internal that were extracted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Every blemish is a bad mixture, if so, are the blemishes in secret not considered? Why do we learn: 'The outer threads that were damaged and tangled, and the inner threads that were uprooted—'"

hebrew_text: נֶעְקְרוּ אִין, נִפְגְּמוּ וְנִגְמְמוּ לָא? בָּעֵינָא ״מוּם רָע״, וְלֵיכָּא! אִי הָכִי, מוּם עוֹבֵר נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: וְלֹא מִן הָעוֹר?
human_translation: were extracted yes, were damaged or were scratched, not, I require an “ill blemish,” and is not If so, a temporary blemish also Why did we learn but not from the skin,
llm_translation: They were uprooted, are they not blemished and blemished not? I require "a bad blemish," and there isn't! If so, a blemish passes in front! Why do we learn: "And not from the skin"?

hebrew_text: מוּם עוֹבֵר סְבָרָא הוּא, הַשְׁתָּא מִיפְרָק לָא פָּרְקִינַן עִלָּוֵיהּ, מִשְׁחָט שָׁחֲטִינַן עִלָּוֵיהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִם כׇּל בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה קׇרְבָּן לַה׳״ — בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: A temporary blemish is logical reasoning: Now, we do not redeem due to will we slaughter due to As it is taught “And if it be any impure animal, of which they may not bring an offering to the Lord” The verse is speaking of blemishes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mum over sabara hu, hashta mifraq la parqinan ilaveih, mishchat shachatinan ilaveih? Detanya: 've'im kol behemah teme'ah asher lo yakrivu mimenna korban laHashem' — be'alei mumim hakatuv medaber." English translation: "A blemish that passes through, now that it has been separated, do we slaughter for it? For it was taught: 'And if any unclean animal that they shall not offer of it a sacrifice to the Lord' — the Scripture speaks of animals with blemishes."

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בִּבְהֵמָה טְמֵאָה מַמָּשׁ? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְאִם בִּבְהֵמָה הַטְּמֵאָה״, הֲרֵי בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה״? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ.
human_translation: Do you say that the verse is speaking of blemishes that were redeemed, or only an actual impure animal, When states: “And if it be of an impure animal” a non-kosher animal is mentioned. So how do I realize “Of which they may not bring an offering”? You must say this blemished that were redeemed,
llm_translation: You say in regard to blemished animals that the Scripture speaks of those that have been redeemed, or is it specifically referring to an actual unclean animal? When it says "or if it is an unclean animal," it is indeed speaking of an unclean animal. How then do I fulfill the requirement "which they shall not offer of it"? You must say: this is referring to blemished animals that have been redeemed.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִפָּדוּ עַל מוּם עוֹבֵר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַקְרִיבוּ מִמֶּנָּה קׇרְבָּן לַה׳״ — מִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה כׇּל עִיקָּר, יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה הַיּוֹם אֶלָּא לְמָחָר.
human_translation: might may be redeemed due to a temporary blemish the verse states: “Of which they may not bring an offering to the Lord” that is not sacrificed at all excludes this which is not sacrificed today, rather tomorrow.
llm_translation: One might have thought that they can redeem for a blemish that is transgressed? The Torah teaches: "which they shall not offer to the Lord" - one who does not offer it at all, this one who does not offer it today, will offer it tomorrow.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִם כֵּן פִּסֵּחַ וְעִוֵּר לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: If you wish, say If so, why do I a lame and a blind
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iba'it Eima: Im kein Pisach ve'Iver lama li?" English translation: "It was asked: If so, why do I need Passover and blindness?"

hebrew_text: נִסְדְּקָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָסְרָה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַסֶּדֶק — כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, הַפְּגִימָה — בֵּין בִּידֵי אָדָם בֵּין בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם. מִכְּלָל דְּסֶדֶק בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם לָא?
human_translation: was split, although it is not lacking, the Sages taught The split any size. the damage, whether by the hand of a person or by the hand of God, by inference that a split, by the hand of God not
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It was repaired even though it was not lacking. The Rabbis taught: 'The crack - any size it may be, the blemish - whether by the hands of man or by the hands of Heaven.' From the principle that if it was repaired by the hands of Heaven, is it not considered repaired?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, סֶדֶק וּפְגִימָה — בֵּין בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם בֵּין בִּידֵי אָדָם. וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר פְּגִימָה? כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּחְגּוֹר בָּהּ צִיפּוֹרֶן.
human_translation: Rather, a split and damage, whether by the hand of God or by the hand of a person, And what is the measure of the damage that a fingernail will be retained [ shetaḥgor ] on it,
llm_translation: Rather, righteousness and blemish — whether in the hands of Heaven or in the hands of man. And how much is the measure of a blemish? The amount that one can wrap a bandage with it.

hebrew_text: נִקְּבָה מְלֹא וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה נְקִיבַת הָאוֹזֶן? מְלֹא כַרְשִׁינָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא יְבֵשָׁה? שֶׁאִם תִּינָּקֵב וְאֵינָהּ מוֹצִיאָה טִיפַּת דָּם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם אוֹמֵר: יְבֵשָׁה כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא נִפְרֶכֶת.
human_translation: was pierced the size of the Sages taught How large the piercing of the ear the size of a karshina . Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Like a lentil, And what is a desiccated that if it is pierced, it does not discharge a drop of blood. Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: Desiccated so that it will crumble
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Female full etc. The Rabbis taught: How much is the cavity of the ear? Full karsinah. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Like a lentil. And which one is dry? That if it is pierced and does not emit a drop of blood. Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam says: Dry enough to crumble."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: קְרוֹבִין דִּבְרֵיהֶן לִהְיוֹת שָׁוִין. דִּבְרֵיהֶן דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם — טוּבָא אִיכָּא! אֶלָּא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: taught: Their statements are close to being identical The statements of whom If we say of the first tanna and Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam there is a significant Rather, of the first tanna and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Mishna: Their words are close to being equal. Whose words are they? If you say it is the first Tanna and Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshullam - there is a good reason! Rather, it is the first Tanna and Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: כַּעֲדָשָׁה — אִין, בְּצִיר מִכַּעֲדָשָׁה — לָא? וּרְמִינְהִי: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַרְצֵעַ, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת הַסּוֹל, וְהַסִּירָה, וְהַמַּחַט, וְהַמַּקְדֵּחַ, וְהַמַּכְתֵּב?
human_translation: like a lentil, yes, less than of a lentil, not And raise a contradiction awl I have only an awl From where to include the palm thorn [ hassol ], a thorn, a needle, and a gimlet, and a stylus
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Like a lentil" — no, in regards to harvesting, from "like a lentil" — no? And it was raised: "Marzea" — I have only "marzea," how do I know to include the shovel, the hoe, the sickle, the plow, and the scythe?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ — כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּלְקָח בַּיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ — מָה מַרְצֵעַ מְיוּחָד שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת, אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: the verse states: “And you shall take,” anything that can be taken by hand the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: an “awl,” just as an awl is distinct of metal, so too, anything of metal
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And you shall take" - anything that is taken by hand, the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: "Marzea" - just as marzea is a unique tool of metal, so too, anything of metal.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמַר רַבִּי, יוּדָן בְּרִבִּי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ: כְּשֶׁהֵן רוֹצְעִין, אֵין רוֹצְעִין אֶלָּא בַּמִּילָת.
human_translation: And the latter clause teaches: Rabbi said that Yudan the Distinguished would teach When they pierce they pierce only in the earlobe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is taught in the latter part: Rabbi said, Yudan son of Rabbi used to expound: When they are pleased, they are only pleased with the word.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן נִרְצָע, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה בַּעַל מוּם. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: בַּמִּילָת הָיוּ רוֹצְעִין, הֵיאַךְ עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן נַעֲשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם? הָא אֵין רוֹצְעִין אֶלָּא בְּגוֹבַהּ שֶׁל אוֹזֶן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: a Hebrew slave a priest is not pierced, because renders him blemished And if you say they pierced in the earlobe, how does a Hebrew slave a priest become blemished This they pierce only on the upper part of the ear,
llm_translation: The Sages say: A Hebrew slave who is a Kohen does not become blemished, because he has acquired a blemish. And if you say: They were referring to circumcision, how can a slave who is a Kohen become blemished? They only refer to the height of the ear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר קַטִּינָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא — כָּאן לִשְׁחוֹט, כָּאן לִפְסוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Ketina said: not difficult, here, with regard to slaughtering There, with regard to disqualifying
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanā bar Qatīnā said: Not difficult - here for slaughtering, here for disqualifying.

hebrew_text: מַאי כַּרְשִׁינָה? אָמַר רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא: הִינְדָּא.
human_translation: What is a karshina ? Rav Sherevya says: hinda
llm_translation: What is Karshina? Rav Sheravya said: Hin'da.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא מֵרַב הוּנָא רַבָּה: כַּרְשִׁינָה הַנִּכְנֶסֶת וְיוֹצְאָה, אוֹ כַרְשִׁינָה הָעוֹמֶדֶת? אָמַר לוֹ: זוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי, כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ שָׁמַעְתִּי.
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya asked Rav Huna the Great: a bitter vetch that enter and exit Or a bitter vetch that is stationary said to him: I did not hear this I heard a similar to it,
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Hoshaya from Rav Huna Rabba: Is it like the Persian woman who enters and exits, or like the Persian woman who stands? He said to him: I have not heard this, but I have heard something similar to it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַשִּׁדְרָה וְהַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת שֶׁחָסְרוּ, כַּמָּה חֶסְרוֹן בַּשִּׁדְרָה וְלֹא יְהֵא מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי חוּלְיוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: חוּלְיָא אַחַת. וּבַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: כִּמְלֹא מַקְדֵּחַ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּנָּטֵל מִן הַחַי וְיָמוּת.
human_translation: As we learned The spine and the skull that incomplete How much a deficiency in the spine so that it will not impart impurity in a tent? Beit Shammai say: two vertebrae, and Beit Hillel say: one vertebra, And in the skull: Beit Shammai say like the size of a drilled hole, and Beit Hillel say: an amount that if removed from a living he would die.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If the stove or the potbelly stove are lacking, how much must they be lacking for it not to render impure in a tent? Beit Shammai says: two fistfuls, and Beit Hillel says: one fistful. And regarding the potbelly stove, Beit Shammai says: like the size of a hole, and Beit Hillel says: enough that if taken from a living creature, it would die.

hebrew_text: וְיָתֵיב רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: ״כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּנָּטֵל מִן הַחַי״ — וְכַמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל — כְּסֶלַע.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda was sitting, and he raised a dilemma: An amount that if removed from a living how much Rav Taḥlifa bar Avudimi said to him: This is what Shmuel says: like a sela
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisdah sat and asked him: "How much must be taken from the living?" — And how much? Rav Taḥlifa son of Avudimi said to him: So said Shmuel — like a rock.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתְּמַר: רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר: שְׁמַעְתְּתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מַתְנִיתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְסִימָנָיךְ: תָּנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And it was stated Rav Safra says he told him a halakha And Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda says he told him a baraita And your mnemonic Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda teaches [ tanei ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was stated: Rav Safra said: You heard what he said, and Rav Shmuel son of Yehuda said: The Mishnah said to him, and your mnemonic: Teachings of Rav Shmuel son of Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, עָשִׂיתָה דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל אֶחָד! דִּתְנַן: מָאוֹר שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשָׂה בִּידֵי אָדָם, שִׁיעוּרוֹ מְלֹא אֶגְרוֹף גָּדוֹל, וְזֶהוּ אֶגְרוֹפוֹ שֶׁל בֶּן אֲבַטִּיחַ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְיֶשְׁנוֹ כְּרֹאשׁ גָּדוֹל שֶׁל אָדָם.
human_translation: And said to If so, you have made the statement of Beit Shammai and the statement of Beit Hillel one As we learned a window that was not fashioned by the hands of a person, its measure the size of a large fist. And this is the fist of Ben Avatiaḥ, Rabbi Yosei said: And is like a large human head.
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, you have made the words of Beit Shammai and the words of Beit Hillel one! For we learned: A light that was not made by human hands, its measure is a large fistful, and this is the fistful of Ben Avtich. Rabbi Yosei said: And it is like the head of a great person.

hebrew_text: נַעֲשָׂה בִּידֵי אָדָם, שִׁיעֲרוּהוּ כִּמְלֹא מַקְדֵּחַ גָּדוֹל שֶׁל לִשְׁכָּה, שֶׁהוּא כְּפוּנְדְּיוֹן (שֶׁל) הָאִיטַלְקִי, וּכְסֶלַע נִירוֹנִית, וְיֶשְׁנוֹ
human_translation: was made by the hand of a person, its measure like the size of the drilled hole large of the chamber which is like the Italian pundeyon and like a sela of Nero. And its is
llm_translation: It was made by human hands, they combed it like a large comb of the chamber, which is a spongy (of) the Italian, and like a neronite rock, and there is

hebrew_text: כִּמְלֹא נֶקֶב שֶׁל עוֹל! אִישְׁתִּיק, וְאָמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: שֶׁמָּא מַקְדֵּחַ וְחִיסּוּמוֹ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: like the size of the hole of a yoke was silent. And Rav Ḥisda said to him: Perhaps we learned a drilled and its obstruction,
llm_translation: Like the size of a hole of a weasel! He was silent, and Rav Ḥisdah said to him: Perhaps he is drilling and his hole is changing.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב תַּחְלִיפָא: לָא תֵּימָא שֶׁמָּא, אֶלָּא וַדַּאי מַקְדֵּחַ וְחִיסּוּמוֹ, צָרִיךְ לְהִתָּלוֹת עָלֶיהָ כְּחִזְקִיָּה אֲבִי עִקֵּשׁ.
human_translation: And Rav Taḥlifa said to him: Do not say: Perhaps. Rather, definitely a drilled and its obstruction, can rely on this as Ḥizkiyya, the father of Ikkesh,
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rav Tahalifa: Do not say perhaps, rather certainly he grinds and sifts, one must rely on it like Hezekiah the father of Aqesh.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: זוֹ עֵדוּת הֵעִיד חִזְקִיָּה אֲבִי עִקֵּשׁ לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּיַבְנֶה, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ בִּכְלִי חֶרֶס — אֵין לוֹ אֲחוֹרַיִם לַחֲלִיקָה. נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ — נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: As we learned Ḥizkiyya, the father of Ikkesh, testified this testimony before Rabban Gamliel in Yavne, which he said in the name of Rabban Gamliel the Elder: With regard to earthenware vessels, any that does not have a receptacle has no distinction with regard to its sides. its inside, became impure, its outside becomes impure. its outside became impure, its inside becomes impure.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: This is the testimony that Hezekiah testified before Rabban Gamliel in Yavneh, that he said in the name of Rabban Gamliel the Elder: Anyone who does not have an interior in a clay vessel - does not have a back for impurity. If its interior becomes impure, its exterior becomes impure; if its exterior becomes impure, its interior becomes impure.

hebrew_text: כְּלִי חֶרֶס, בְּתוֹכוֹ תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא — אִית לֵיהּ תּוֹךְ — אִיטַּמִּי לֵיהּ, לֵית לֵיהּ תּוֹךְ — לָא אִיטַּמִּי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: an earthenware vessel, the Merciful One rendered dependent on a receptacle, if there is a receptacle, it will become impure, there is no receptacle, it not become impure.
llm_translation: A vessel of clay, within it hangs a mercy - if it has a cavity - immerse it, if it does not have a cavity - do not immerse it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אָבִין: הָכִי קָאָמַר, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ בִּכְלִי חֶרֶס — כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בִּכְלִי שֶׁטֶף אֵין לוֹ אֲחוֹרַיִם לַחֲלִיקָה, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ — נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avin said this is saying: With regard to earthenware vessels, any that does not have a receptacle corresponding with regard to a vessel rinsing, there is no distinction with regard to the its sides. its inside, became impure, its outside becomes impure. if its outside became impure, its inside becomes impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avin said: Thus he said, anyone who does not have an interior in an earthenware vessel — corresponding to him is a vessel of flowing water, he does not have a back for sliding, if its inside becomes impure — its back becomes impure, if its back becomes impure — its inside becomes impure.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְלְיֵיהּ בִּכְלִי חֶרֶס? נֵימָא: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ בִּכְלִי שֶׁטֶף — אֵין לוֹ אֲחוֹרַיִם לַחֲלִיקָה!
human_translation: Why do I to render dependent on an earthenware vessel? Let us say: With regard to a vessel rinsing, any that does not have a receptacle has no distinction to the its sides.
llm_translation: "Why for me to immerse it in a clay vessel? Say: Any vessel that does not have a hollow - it does not have a back for smoothness!"

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּיֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹךְ — הֲרֵי הוּא כִּכְלִי חֶרֶס; מָה כְּלִי חֶרֶס, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, לֹא נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — לֹא נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ; אַף כְּלִי שֶׁטֶף, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ, לֹא נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — לֹא נִטְמָא גַּבּוֹ.
human_translation: This teaches us that has a receptacle, it is like an earthenware vessel. just as an earthenware vessel, its inside became impure, its outside becomes impure, its inside did not become impure, its outside does not become impure, so too, a vessel rinsing, its inside became impure, its outside becomes impure. if its inside did not become impure, its outside does not become impure.
llm_translation: This is what we heard: if it has an interior - it is like an earthenware vessel; just as an earthenware vessel, its interior becomes impure - its exterior becomes impure, if its interior does not become impure - its exterior does not become impure. So too, a vessel that is rinsed, if its interior becomes impure - its exterior becomes impure, if its interior does not become impure - its exterior does not become impure.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כְּלִי חֶרֶס, גַּלִּי בֵּיהּ רַחֲמָנָא ״תּוֹכוֹ״, אֶלָּא כְּלִי שֶׁטֶף, מִי גַּלִּי בֵּיהּ רַחֲמָנָא תּוֹכוֹ?
human_translation: Granted an earthenware vessel, the Merciful One revealed it “inside” But a vessel rinsing, did the Merciful One reveal with regard to it inside?
llm_translation: In Shlama, a clay vessel, the Merciful One revealed its "inside," but in a metal vessel, who revealed its "inside"?

hebrew_text: אִי בְּטוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָכִי נָמֵי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּטוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין — אֲחוֹרָיו טְמֵאִין, תּוֹכוֹ אׇגְנוֹ אׇזְנוֹ וְיָדָיו טְהוֹרִין, נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — כּוּלּוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: If to ritual impurity by Torah law, indeed here we are dealing with ritual impurity of liquids, by rabbinic law. As we learned a vessel whose outside became ritually impure by liquids, its outside is impure, its inside, its rim, its ear-shaped handle, and its handle are pure. its inside became impure, impure its entirety.
llm_translation: In the case of impurity from the Torah — thus it was stated, here with what are we dealing? With the impurity of liquids of the Rabbis, as we learned: "A vessel that became impure from behind with liquids — its back is impure, its inside, rim, handle, and spout are pure; if its inside became impure — all of it is impure."

hebrew_text: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֵין אוֹכֶל מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי, וְאֵין מַשְׁקֶה מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזוּר מִשּׁוּם מַשְׁקֵה זָב וְזָבָה.
human_translation: By Torah law, food does not transmit impurity a vessel, and a liquid does not transmit impurity a vessel. And it was the Sages who decreed because the liquid of a zav and a zava ,
llm_translation: From the Torah, one does not eat that which imparts impurity to a vessel, and one does not drink that which imparts impurity to a vessel. And it is the Rabbis who decreed this due to the impurity of a male and female zav.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ, שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן כְּטוּמְאָה דִּכְלִי חֶרֶס, וְלָא שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן כְּטוּמְאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Therefore, the Sages deemed like the impurity of an earthenware vessel, But the Sages did not deem like the impurity of itself, by Torah law,
llm_translation: Therefore, the Sages have established it like the impurity of an earthenware vessel, and not like the impurity of biblical impurity which is inherent in itself.

hebrew_text: עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן הֶיכֵּירָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִישְׂרוֹף עֲלֵיהּ תְּרוּמָה וְקָדָשִׁים. אִי הָכִי, אֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ נָמֵי, לֶיעְבֵּיד נָמֵי הֶיכֵּירָא!
human_translation: the Sages employed an indicator so that will not burn teruma and consecrated due to those If so, has no receptacle as well, should employ an indicator.
llm_translation: The sages instructed: Recognize the chamber, so that the Terumah and holy items will not be burned. If not, there is no middle ground, recognize the chamber!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דַּעֲבַדוּ הֶיכֵּירָא בְּיֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹךְ, יְדִיעַ דְּאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Since employed an indicator with regard to have a receptacle, known that does not have a receptacle by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: As they did recognize the inner chamber, knowledge that the Sages do not have an inner chamber.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ בִּכְלִי שֶׁטֶף, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בַּר קַבּוֹלֵי טוּמְאָה הוּא? דּוּמְיָא דְּשַׂק בָּעֵינַן, מָה שַׂק מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָן, אַף כֹּל מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָן.
human_translation: And with regard to a vessel rinsing, is it susceptible to ritual impurity by Torah law, it is required similar to a sack, Just as a sack is carried full and empty, so too, any carried full and empty
llm_translation: "And does it not have an interior in a vessel that is immersed, for is it a biblical acceptance of impurity? We require the likeness of a sack, just as a sack can be moved when full and when empty, so too, everything can be moved when full and when empty."

hebrew_text: בְּהָנָךְ דַּחֲזוּ לְמִדְרָסוֹת. אִי הָכִי, חֶרֶס נָמֵי! אֵין מִדְרָס בִּכְלִי חֶרֶס.
human_translation: to these that are suited for treading, If so, an earthenware also There is no treading with regard to earthenware vessels.
llm_translation: In the case of a balcony that they saw in the study halls. If so, it is a broken shard! A balcony is not considered a vessel of earthenware.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַקְדֵּחַ גָּדוֹל שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says a large drill we learned
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A large drill we have learned.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּמַקְדֵּחַ סְתָם זוּטַרא נָמֵי מִכְּסֶלַע. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: by inference, the unspecified drill also smaller than the size of a sela This works out well according to Rabbi Meir But according to the the Rabbis, what is there to say?
llm_translation: From the principle of "one who digs a pit will fall into it," a small pebble is more effective than a large rock. It is fitting for Rabbi Meir, but what can the Rabbis say?

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: בְּאֵיזֶה מַקְדֵּחַ אָמְרוּ? בְּקָטָן שֶׁל רוֹפְאִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּגָדוֹל שֶׁל לִשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: As we learned With regard to which drill did state with regard to a small of doctors, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: with regard to a large in the chamber.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: In what type of perforator did they say? In a small one of physicians, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: In a large one of the chamber.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִי נִיחָא? הָוֵה לֵיהּ מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. וַאֲנַן דִּתְנַן — תְּנַן, דְּלָא תְּנַן — לָא תְּנַן!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Meir, does it work out well? this is of the leniencies of Beit Shammai and of the stringencies of Beit Hillel, And we That which we learned we learned, that which we did not learn we did not learn.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Meir, is it good? He had from the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel. And we, who have taught - we have taught, and if we have not taught - we have not taught!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: סֶלַע נִירוֹנִית שָׁנִינוּ, כְּמַקְדֵּחַ גָּדוֹל, סֶלַע סְתָם זוּטַרא מִמַּקְדֵּחַ סְתָם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: a sela of Nero that we learned like a large drilled the unspecified sela smaller than an unspecified drilled
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: We learned a hard flintstone, like a large slingstone, a sealed flintstone is more effective than a sealed slingstone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָרִיס שֶׁל עַיִן שֶׁנִּיקַּב, שֶׁנִּפְגַּם, שֶׁנִּסְדַּק, הֲרֵי בְּעֵינוֹ דַּק, תְּבַלּוּל, חִלָּזוֹן, נָחָשׁ, עָצָב. אֵיזֶהוּ תְּבַלּוּל? לָבָן הַפּוֹסֵק בַּסִּירָא וְנִכְנָס בַּשָּׁחוֹר. שָׁחוֹר נִכְנַס בַּלָּבָן — אֵינוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: The eyelid that was pierced, that was damaged that was split; if in his eye a cataract, a tevallul , a snail, a snake, a berry What is a tevallul ? a white that bisects the iris and enters the black a black enters the white is not a blemish.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A white spot in the eye that was punctured, damaged, or cracked, is considered a fine spot, a mixture, a blemish, a serpent, or a sorrow. What is considered a mixture? White that enters into a black pot. If black enters into white - it is not a blemish.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי הָרִיס? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תּוֹרָא בָּרָא דְּעֵינָא. דַּק תְּבַלּוּל, תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דַּק מְשׁוּקָּע — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, צָף — אֵינוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: What The ris ? Rav Pappa says: the outer line, of the eye, A cataract, a tevallul . the Sages taught: A sunken cataract, is a blemish, a floating is not a blemish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the definition of "haris"? Rav Papa said: A clod of mud in the eye. When it is fine, the Rabbis taught: If it is embedded - this is a blemish, if it floats - it is not a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בַּשָּׁחוֹר הָא בַּלָּבָן. וְהָא: אֵין מוּמִין בַּלָּבָן! אֶלָּא, הָא בְּדוּק לָבָן, הָא בְּדוּק שָׁחוֹר.
human_translation: But isn’t the opposite taught not difficult, this to the black that to the white But there are no blemishes in the white Rather, this to a white cataract, that to a black cataract.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: The contradiction! It is not difficult, this one is in the black wool, this one is in the white wool. And this is the resolution: Blemishes are not found in the white wool! Rather, this is referring to thoroughly white, this is referring to thoroughly black.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: סָח לִי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּמִן אוּשָׁא: דַּק שָׁחוֹר מְשׁוּקָּע — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, צָף — אֵינוֹ מוּם. דַּק לָבָן מְשׁוּקָּע — אֵינוֹ מוּם, צָף — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, וְסִימָנָיךְ: בַּרְקָא.
human_translation: as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: Yoshiya from Usha told me a black cataract, sunken it is a blemish, floating it is not a blemish. a white cataract, sunken it is not a blemish, floating it is a blemish. And your mnemonic barka ,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: "I have a tradition from Usha: A black mole that is sunken - this is a blemish; if it is raised - it is not a blemish. A white mole that is sunken - it is not a blemish; if it is raised - this is a blemish. And your sign is: a lightning bolt."

hebrew_text: חִלָּזוֹן נָחָשׁ וְעָצָב. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: חִלָּזוֹן הוּא נָחָשׁ, אוֹ דִלְמָא חִלָּזוֹן אוֹ נָחָשׁ?
human_translation: a snail, a snake, or a berry A dilemma was raised before Is the snail the snake, or perhaps a snail or a snake?
llm_translation: Vision of a snake and sorrow. The question was asked: Is a vision a snake, or perhaps a vision or a snake?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: סָח לִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, זָקֵן אֶחָד הָיָה בִּשְׁכוּנָתֵינוּ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹסֵי לָקוֹנְיָא שְׁמוֹ, וּמִיָּמַי לֹא עָבַרְתִּי לְפָנָיו. פַּעַם אַחַת עָבַרְתִּי לְפָנָיו, אָמַר לִי: שֵׁב בְּנִי, שֵׁב. חִלָּזוֹן זֶה מוּם קָבוּעַ לִשְׁחוֹט עָלָיו, וְזֶהוּ נָחָשׁ שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Elazar told me: There was a certain elder in our neighborhood, and Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei Lakonya his name, and in my days I did not pass before him. once I did pass before him, he said to me: Sit, my son, sit, This snail a permanent blemish, to slaughter on its account. And this is the snake mentioned by the Sages
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: "Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Elʿazar was a respected elder in our neighborhood, and Rabbi Shim'on ben Yosei Lakonya was his name, and I had never passed before him. Once I passed before him, and he said to me: 'Sit, my son, sit. This blemished one is fit to be slaughtered upon, and this is the snake about which the Sages spoke.'"

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ: אֵין אָדָם רוֹאֶה מוּמִין לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל מוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה לַתַּלְמִידִים, וְתַלְמִידִים מוֹרִין לוֹ.
human_translation: And even though said a person cannot see blemishes for himself, even so may issue a halakhic ruling to students, and the students may issue ruling for him
llm_translation: And even though they said: "A person does not see his own blemishes," but a teacher teaches halakha to the students, and the students teach it to him.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה וּבָא, אִם קוֹדֶם מַעֲשֶׂה אֲמָרָהּ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ! אִיהוּ נָמֵי מוֹרֶה וּבָא הֲוָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Abba say Rav Huna says: any Torah scholar who is engaged in issuing halakha if he stated before the incident, one listens to him; and if not, does not listen to him? he too, was engaged in issuing at the outset,
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Abba said, Rav Huna said: Every Torah scholar who teaches a halacha and it comes to pass, if he said it before the action - we listen to him, and if not - we do not listen to him! He himself taught and it came to pass from the outset.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ תְּבַלּוּל? לָבָן הַפּוֹסֵק אֶת הַסִּירָא. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: לָבָן וְנִכְנָס בַּשָּׁחוֹר, שָׁחוֹר וְנִכְנָס בַּלָּבָן — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לָבָן וְנִכְנָס בַּשָּׁחוֹר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, שָׁחוֹר וְנִכְנָס בַּלָּבָן — אֵינוֹ מוּם, שֶׁאֵין מוּמִין בַּלָּבָן.
human_translation: What is a tevallul ? a white that bisects the iris Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught a white enters the black, a black enters the white, is a blemish; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: a white enters the black, it is a blemish, a black enters the white, it is not a blemish, as there are no blemishes in the white
llm_translation: Which is the mixture? White that cuts the black. What is the Mishnah teaching? It is Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught: White that enters into black, black that enters into white - this is a blemish, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: White that enters into black - this is a blemish, black that enters into white - is not a blemish, for there are no blemishes in white.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? דִּכְתִיב: ״יָצָא מֵחֵלֶב עֵינֵימוֹ״, תַּרְבָּא דְּעֵינָא — אִיקְּרִי, ״עֵינֵימוֹ״ סְתָמָא — לָא אִיקְּרִי. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ? מָה לְשׁוֹן ״תְּבַלּוּל״? דָּבָר הַמְבַלְבֵּל אֶת הָעֵינַיִם.
human_translation: Rav says: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? As it is written: “Their eyes stand forth from fatness” is called the fat of the eye, it is not called simply: Their eyes. And Rabbi Meir, what is his reason? What is expression tevallul ? a substance that mixes [ hamevalbel ] the eyes,
llm_translation: Rav said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei? As it is written: "He went out from the fat of his eyes," when the eye is saturated — it is called "his eyes," when the eye is not saturated — it is not called "his eyes." And what is the reason for Rabbi Meir? What is the meaning of "confusion"? A matter that confuses the eyes.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲוַרְוָור וְהַמַּיִם הַקְּבוּעִין. אֵיזֶהוּ חֲוַרְוָור הַקָּבוּעַ? כֹּל שֶׁשָּׁהָה שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אֹמֵר: בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים בְּתוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם.
human_translation: Pale spots and tears that are constant Which are the pale spots that are constant? any that persisted eighty days. Rabbi Ḥananya ben Antigonus said: One examines it three times within eighty days.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A pit and water that is fixed. What is a fixed pit? Any pit that remains filled for eighty days. Rabbi Chananya ben Antigonus says: One must inspect it three times within eighty days.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מַיִם הַקְּבוּעִין: אָכַל לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים, לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל שְׁלָחִים, אוֹ אָכַל הַיָּבֵשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ הַלַּח — אֵינוֹ מוּם, עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל הַלַּח וְאַחַר כָּךְ הַיָּבֵשׁ.
human_translation: And these are the constant tears, ate, moist and dry from rain, moist and dry from irrigated or ate the dry and thereafter the moist it is not a blemish. unless eats the moist and thereafter the dry
llm_translation: These are the waters that are established: the moist and dry of rains, the moist and dry of snow, or if one ate the dry and afterwards the moist - it is not a blemish until one eats the moist and afterwards the dry.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: חֲוַרְוָור קָבוּעַ — אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם, וּמַיִם הַקְּבוּעִים — שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֲוַרְוָור — שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught constant pale spots forty days, and constant tears eighty days; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yehuda says: pale spots eighty days.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Matnitin Mani? Rabbi Yehuda Hi, Detanya: Chavurvar Kavu'a - Arba'im Yom, Umayim Hakvu'im - Shemonim Yom, Divrei Rabbi Meir. VeRabbi Yehuda Omer: Chavurvar - Shemonim Yom. English translation: Gemara: "From which Mishnah is this? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: A pit that is dug - forty days, and water that is collected - eighty days, the words of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yehuda says: A pit - eighty days."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מַיִם הַקְּבוּעִים: אָכַל לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין, אוֹ שֶׁאָכַל יָבֵשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָכַל הַלַּח — אֵין מוּם עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל יָבֵשׁ אַחַר הַלַּח, וְיֶשְׁנוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: And these are the constant tears, ate moist and dry from irrigated or ate the dry and thereafter ate the moist a blemish is not unless eats the dry after the moist And the duration of three months.
llm_translation: These are the fixed waters: if one ate moist and dry from the bathroom, or if one ate dry and then ate the moist - there is no blemish until one eats dry after the moist, and this is for three months.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ תְּנַנְהִי: אָכַל לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים, לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין!
human_translation: But We learned two ate moist and dry from rain moist and dry from irrigated
llm_translation: And this, both of them, we shall teach: He ate moist and dry food of rainwater, moist and dry food of the bathroom!

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אָכַל לַח וְיָבֵשׁ שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין — אֵינוֹ מוּם, וְהַגְּשָׁמִים נָמֵי, אָכַל יָבֵשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָכַל לַח — אֵינוֹ מוּם, עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל יָבֵשׁ אַחַר הַלַּח.
human_translation: is incomplete and this it is teaching, ate moist and dry from rain, it is a blemish. irrigated it is not a blemish. And rain as well, ate the dry and thereafter ate the moist it is not a blemish. until eats the dry after the moist
llm_translation: The lacking from the lacking, and thus it was taught: One who ate moist and dry of rainwater - this is a blemish; the latrine - it is not a blemish, and the rainwater is still considered moist. If one ate dry and afterwards ate moist - it is not a blemish, until one eats dry after the moist.

hebrew_text: וְיֶשְׁנוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. אִינִי? וְהָתַנְיָא — וְהָא רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן: אֲדָר וְנִיסָן — לַח, אֱלוּל וְתִשְׁרִי — יָבֵשׁ! אֵימָא: אֲדָר וַחֲצִי נִיסָן — לַח, אֱלוּל וַחֲצִי תִשְׁרֵי — יָבֵשׁ.
