human_translation: And the duration of three months, Is that so? But isn’t it taught that Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashiyan Adar and Nisan moist Elul and Tishrei dry say Adar and half of Nisan moist Elul and half of Tishrei dry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are three months. Is it not so? And it was taught — And Rav Idi bar Avin said Rav Yitzchak bar Ashyasan: Adar and Nissan — moist, Elul and Tishrei — dry! Say: Adar and half of Nissan — moist, Elul and half of Tishrei — dry.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לַח בִּזְמַן לַח, וְיָבֵשׁ בִּזְמַן הַיָּבֵשׁ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: לַח וְיָבֵשׁ בִּזְמַן הַלַּח?
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before moist at the time of moist and dry at the time of dry Or perhaps moist and dry at the time of moist
llm_translation: He asked them: Wet in its proper time, and dry in its proper time, or perhaps: wet and dry in the time of wet?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן: אֲדָר וְנִיסָן — לַח, אֱלוּל וְתִשְׁרִי — יָבֵשׁ. דִּלְמָא פֵּירֵי דֶּאֱלוּל וְתִשְׁרִי מַאֲכִילִנַן לֵיהּ בַּאֲדָר וְנִיסָן!
human_translation: Come hear, as Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashiyan said: Adar and Nisan moist Elul and Tishrei dry perhaps one feeds it the produce of Elul and Tishrei in Adar and Nisan.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Yitzchak bar Ashyaya: "Adar and Nissan - moist, Elul and Tishrei - dry. Perhaps the fruits of Elul and Tishrei sustain it in Adar and Nissan!"

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן עָרוֹבָא: כִּגְרוֹגֶרֶת. אָמַר רָבָא: (בָּעֵי) [בָּעַן] בְּמַעְרְבָא: כִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת בִּסְעוּדָה רִאשׁוֹנָה,
human_translation: And how much does one feed it? Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Pineḥas ben Arova: of a fig-bulk. Rava says: They raise a dilemma in the West, of a fig-bulk at first meal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how much do they feed him? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Pinchas ben Arova: Like a dried fig. Rava said: (They need) in Ma'arva: Like dried figs at the first meal.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּכׇל סְעוּדָה וּסְעוּדָה? אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר בִּסְעוּדָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — קוֹדֶם אֲכִילָה אוֹ לְאַחַר אֲכִילָה? קוֹדֶם אֲכִילָה וַדַּאי מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ כְּסַמָּא, לְאַחַר אֲכִילָה מַאי? קוֹדֶם שְׁתִיָּה אוֹ לְאַחַר שְׁתִיָּה? וְקוֹדֶם שְׁתִיָּה וַדַּאי מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ כִּשְׂעָרֵי, לְאַחַר שְׁתִיָּה מַאי?
human_translation: or perhaps at each and every meal? If you say at the first meal, before eating or after eating? Before eating, certainly effective for it like a medicine, after eating, what before drinking or after drinking? Before drinking it is certainly effective for it, like barley, after drinking, what
llm_translation: Or perhaps at every meal and meal? If you might say at the first meal — before eating or after eating? Before eating and certainly it is like a potion, after eating what? Before drinking or after drinking? And before drinking and certainly it is like hairs, after drinking what?

hebrew_text: קָשׁוּר אוֹ מוּתָּר? מוּתָּר — וַדַּאי מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ, קָשׁוּר מַאי? לְבַדּוֹ אוֹ עִם חֲבֵירוֹ? עִם חֲבֵירוֹ — וַדַּאי מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ, לְבַדּוֹ מַאי?
human_translation: tied or untied? untied, certainly effective for this tied, what by itself, or with another with another is certainly effective for by itself, what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kasher o mutar? Mutar - vada'i me'alei lei, kasher mai? Levado o im chaveiro? Im chaveiro - vada'i me'alei lei, levado mai? English translation: Bound or permitted? Permitted - and certainly he is liable, bound what? Alone or with his fellow? With his fellow - and certainly he is liable, alone what?

hebrew_text: בָּעִיר (וּבַשָּׂדֶה) [אוֹ בַּשָּׂדֶה]? בַּשָּׂדֶה — וַדַּאי מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ, בָּעִיר — מַאי? בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר בַּשָּׂדֶה — גִּינָּה הַסְּמוּכָה לָעִיר מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: in the city or in the field? in the field, is certainly effective for in the city, what Rav Ashi raises dilemma: If you say in the field, what a garden adjacent to the city? shall stand
llm_translation: In the city (and in the field) or in the field? In the field - certainly it is considered a transgression. In the city - what is the law? Rav Ashi raised a question: If you want to say in the field - what is the law regarding a garden adjacent to the city? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהוּ מְשׁוּלָּשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Antigonus says: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: And provided that they are divided into thirds,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananya ben Antigonus says. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: And only if they are thirty.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ פִּנְחָס, אֲחוּהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, מִשְּׁמוּאֵל: אֲכַל וְלָא אִיתַּסִּי — לְמַפְרֵעַ הָוֵי מוּמָא, אוֹ מִיכָּן וּלְהַבָּא הָוֵי מוּמָא?
human_translation: Pineḥas, the brother of Mar Shmuel, raises a dilemma before Shmuel: ate and was not healed, is it a retroactive blemish or is it a blemish from that point forward?
llm_translation: Inquired of him Pinchas, brother of Mar Samuel, from Samuel: "If one eats and does not find satisfaction - is it considered a blemish for the purpose of redemption, or is it considered a blemish for the future?"

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִימְעַל בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְמַפְרֵעַ הָוֵי מוּמָא — מָעֵיל,
human_translation: What is the difference? with regard to misuse concerning its redemption If you say it is a retroactive blemish, misuses
llm_translation: For what does it come out? To redeem his pledge. If you say it is considered as a form of misappropriation, it is a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִיכָּן וּלְהַבָּא הָוֵי מוּמָא — לָא מָעֵיל, מַאי? קָרֵי שְׁמוּאֵל עֲלֵיהּ: ״פִּסְחִים בָּזְזוּ בַז״.
human_translation: But if it is a blemish from that point forward, not misused What, Shmuel read with regard to his “The lame take the prey”
llm_translation: From here and onwards, and for the future, it is considered a blemish - not a cloak. What is the reason? It is called by the name of Shmuel: "They have desecrated the Passover offerings."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוֹטְמוֹ שֶׁנִּיקַּב, וְשֶׁנִּפְגַּם, וְשֶׁנִּסְדַּק. שְׂפָמוֹ שֶׁנִּיקְּבָה, שֶׁנִּפְגְּמָה, שֶׁנִּסְדְּקָה.
human_translation: Its nose that was pierced, or that was damaged or that was split. its lip that was pierced, that was damaged, that was split
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If his nostril was pierced, and it was torn, and it was split. If his lip was pierced, it was torn, it was split.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נִיקְּבוּ חֳוטָמִין זֶה לְתוֹךְ זֶה — מִבַּחוּץ הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, מִבִּפְנִים אֵינוֹ מוּם. שְׂפָתוֹ שֶׁנִּיקְּבָה וְשֶׁנִּפְגְּמָה וְשֶׁנִּסְדְּקָה, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תּוֹרָא בָּרָא דְּשִׂיפְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught its nostrils were pierced one into the other, on the outside this is a blemish; on the inside it is not a blemish. Its lip that was pierced or that was damaged or that was split, Rav Pappa says: the outer row, of its lip.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If the intestines were perforated into each other - from the outside, it is a blemish; from the inside, it is not a blemish. If its lip was perforated, or was chafed, or was split, Rav Papa said: The Creator of the world created it with its lips.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוּטִין הַחִיצוֹנוֹת שֶׁנִּפְגְּמוּ, וְשֶׁנִּגְמְמוּ, הַפְּנִימִיִּם שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין מִן הַתְּיוֹמֶת וְלִפְנִים, וְאַף לֹא אֶת הַתְּיוֹמֶת.
human_translation: The external gums that were damaged or that were scratched, the internal that were extracted. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: One does not examine from the double teeth, and inward, and not even the double teeth
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The outer threads that were damaged, and those that were completely damaged, the inner ones that were uprooted. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: We do not inspect from the outside inwards, nor even the inside.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַתְּיוֹמֶת, אֵיזֶהוּ תְּיוֹמֶת? מִן הַתְּיוֹמֶת וְלִפְנִים, וּתְיוֹמֶת עַצְמָהּ כְּלִפְנִים. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹצַאי אוֹמֵר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶלָּא עַל הַחִיצוֹנוֹת בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין עַל הַתְּיוֹמֶת כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught the double teeth, what are the double teeth? from the double teeth and inward, and the double teeth themselves, are like the inward Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefutzai says: One slaughters only for the outer alone. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: One does not consider the double teeth at all.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: What is the "teyomet"? From the "teyomet" and inward, and the "teyomet" itself is like inward. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kappotzai says: One may only slaughter on the outer parts. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: One should not pay much attention to the "teyomet" at all.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? וְתוּ, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹצַאי הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: What is saying? And furthermore, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefutzai is the first tanna ,
llm_translation: What is it saying? And yes, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kappotzai is the same as the first Tanna!

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵיזֶהוּ הַפְּנִימִית? מִן הַתְּיוֹמֶת וְלִפְנִים, וּתְיוֹמֶת עַצְמָהּ כְּלִפְנִים. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁנִּפְגְּמוּ וְשֶׁנִּגְמְמוּ, אֲבָל נֶעְקְרוּ — שׁוֹחֲטִין.
human_translation: is incomplete and this it is teaching: What the inner from the double teeth and inward, and the double teeth themselves are like the inward In what is this statement, said? where were damaged or were scratched. But they were extracted, one does slaughter
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra ve'hachi katanei: Eizehu hapenimit? Min hatyomet ve'lifnim, uteyomet atzmah kelifnim. Bamah devarim amurim? Shenifgemu ve'shenigmemu, aval ne'ekru — shochtin." Translation: "The lacking from the lacking, and thus it is taught: What is the inner one? From the south and to the inside, and the south itself is like the inside. In what circumstances are these matters said? When they were damaged and when they were cracked, but if they were uprooted — one may slaughter."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קַפּוֹצַאי אוֹמֵר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶלָּא עַל הַחִיצוֹנוֹת, אֲבָל פְּנִימִיּוֹת שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ — מִישְׁחָט עֲלַיְיהוּ לָא שָׁחֲטִינַן, אֲבָל אִפְּסוֹלֵי מִיפְּסֵל. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין עַל הַתְּיוֹמֶת כׇּל עִיקָּר, וַאֲפִילּוּ אִיפְּסוֹלֵי לָא אִיפְּסִיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kefutzai says: One slaughters only for the outer But inner that were extracted, one does not slaughter for them, but it is disqualified Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: One does not pay attention to the double teeth at all, and does not even disqualify
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Kappotzai says: One may only slaughter on the outer part of the animal, but if the inner organs were removed - if one slaughters on them, we have not slaughtered, but the invalid slaughter renders the animal invalid. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: One does not need to inspect the trachea at all, and even if it is invalid, it does not render the animal invalid.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: יֵשׁ מְחוּסַּר אֵבֶר מִבִּפְנִים, אוֹ אֵין מְחוּסַּר אֵבֶר מִבִּפְנִים? לְמַאי? אִי לִבְכוֹר — ״פִּסֵּחַ אוֹ עִוֵּר״ כְּתִיב,
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami raises a dilemma: there the lack of a limb internal, or is there no the lack of a limb internal? With regard to what If with regard to a firstborn it is written: “Lameness or blindness”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ba'ei Rav Achadbuy bar Amei: Yesh mechusar ever mibifnim, o ein mechusar ever mibifnim? Lemai? Iy livchor - "Pisach o iver" k'tiv. English translation:

hebrew_text: אִי לְקָדָשִׁים, ״עַוֶּרֶת אוֹ שָׁבוּר״ כְּתִיב! לְאִישְּׁחוֹטֵי וּלְאִיפְּרוֹקֵי לָא אִיבַּעְיָא לַן, כִּי מִיבַּעְיָא לַן לְאִיפְּסוֹלֵי — מַאי?
human_translation: If with regard to sacrificial it is written: “Blind or broken” we do not raise dilemma with regard to slaughtering or redeeming we raise the dilemma with regard to disqualifying What
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If regarding consecrated items, "blind or broken" is written! For those who spin and those who weave, it is not necessary for us, for it is necessary for us for those who dye — what is it?

hebrew_text: ״תָּמִים יִהְיֶה לְרָצוֹן״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, תָּמִים — אִין, חֶסְרוֹן — לֹא. אוֹ דִלְמָא ״תָּמִים יִהְיֶה לְרָצוֹן״, ״כׇּל מוּם לֹא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ״ — מָה מוּם מֵאַבָּרַאי, אַף חֶסְרוֹן מֵאַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: The Merciful One states: “It shall be complete to be accepted” a complete yes, lacking not Or perhaps “It shall be complete to be accepted,” “There shall be no blemish therein.” Just as a blemish is on the outside, so too, lacking on the outside.
llm_translation: "Tamim yihyeh le'ratzon" amar rachamana, tamim - ein, chesron - lo. O dilma "tamim yihyeh le'ratzon," "kol mum lo yihyeh bo" - mah mum me'abbarai, af chesron me'abbarai.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְאֶת שְׁתֵּי הַכְּלָיוֹת״ — וְלֹא בַּעַל כּוּלְיָא אַחַת, וְלֹא בַּעַל שָׁלֹשׁ כּוּלְיוֹת. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״יְסִירֶנָּה״ — לְרַבּוֹת בַּעַל כּוּלְיָא אַחַת.
human_translation: Come hear “And the two kidneys” but not has one kidney, nor has three kidneys. And is taught another he shall take it away,” to include has one kidney,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And the two kidneys' — not the owner of one kidney, and not the owner of three kidneys. And it was taught in another place: 'He shall remove it' — to include the owner of one kidney."

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין בְּרִיָּה בְּאַחַת, דְּהָא מִיחְסָר חָסַר. לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר, חֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן, וּמָר סָבַר, חֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים לָא שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן.
human_translation: assumed that everyone no entity with one because became lacking let us say they disagree about this: That Sage, holds a lack an internal is considered a lack, and Sage, holds a lack an internal is not considered a lack.
llm_translation: They thought, for the whole world is not created in one, for from a deficiency it is deficient. Let us say in this it is disputed: for Master holds, a deficiency from within its name is a deficiency, and Master holds, a deficiency from within is not its name a deficiency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ בְּרִיָּה בְּאַחַת, וְחֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — כְּשֶׁנִּבְרְאָה בִּשְׁתַּיִם וְחָסְרוּ, כָּאן — כְּשֶׁנִּבְרְאָה בְּאַחַת מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: as everyone agrees there is an entity with one and lack of an internal is considered a lack And not difficult: Here, where it was created with two and is lacking, there, where it was created with one from the outset,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Yosef said: In the entire world, there is a creature created in one way, and its name is lacking from within, its name is lacking, and it is not difficult: here — when it was created in two and they were lacking, here — when it was created initially in one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דּוּמְיָא דְּשָׁלֹשׁ קָתָנֵי, מָה שָׁלֹשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא, אַף אַחַת מֵעִיקָּרָא!
human_translation: But teaches similar of has three kidneys. Just as three from the outset, so too, one from the outset.
llm_translation: And this that is similar to three, it is like three from the outset, just as one from the outset!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּיֵשׁ בְּרִיָּה מֵעִיקָּרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: יֵשׁ בְּרִיָּה בְּאַחַת, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין בְּרִיָּה בְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Rather, here disagree with regard to there is an entity from the outset. Sage, holds there is an entity with one And Sage, holds there is no entity with one
llm_translation: Rather, here there is a dispute in a living being from the outset. Master holds: there is a living being in one, and Master holds: there is no living being in one.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין בְּרִיָּה בְּאַחַת, וְחֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁחָסְרָה קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָה, כָּאן שֶׁחָסְרָה לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה. וּלְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה קוֹדֶם קַבָּלָה מִי שְׁרֵי?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Everyone agrees no entity with one and a lack of an internal is considered a lack, and not difficult. Here, where it lacked before slaughter. there, where it lacked after slaughter, And after slaughter before collection is it permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The entirety of the world, there is no creature in one, and a deficiency from within, its name is deficiency. And it is not difficult: here where it lacked before slaughter, here where it lacked after slaughter. And after slaughter before receiving, who permits?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: הַצּוֹרֵם אֹזֶן הַפָּר וְאַחַר כָּךְ קִיבֵּל דָּמוֹ — פָּסוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְלָקַח מִדַּם הַפָּר״ — הַפָּר שֶׁהָיָה כְּבָר! אֶלָּא: כָּאן שֶׁחָסְרָה קוֹדֶם קַבָּלָה, כָּאן שֶׁחָסְרָה לְאַחַר קַבָּלָה.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Zeira say Rav says: one who slits the ear of the bull and thereafter collects its blood disqualified, as it is stated: “And shall take from the blood of the bull” bull it already was Rather, here, where it lacked before the collection there, where it lacked after the collection
llm_translation: And it was said, Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: One who cuts off the ear of the cow and then receives its blood afterward — it is invalid, as it is stated, "And he shall take from the blood of the cow" — the cow that was already there! Rather, here where it lacked before acceptance, here where it lacked after acceptance.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַחַר קַבָּלָה קוֹדֶם זְרִיקָה, מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״שֶׂה תָּמִים זָכָר בֶּן שָׁנָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״, שֶׁיְּהֵא תָּמִים בֶּן שָׁנָה בִּשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: And after collection before sprinkling is it permitted But isn’t it taught “Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male in its year” that it shall be unblemished in its year at the time of slaughter?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And after receiving the blood before sprinkling, is it permitted? And it was taught: "A perfect male lamb, a year old, shall be for you," meaning that it should be a year old at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן בְּקַבָּלָה וְהוֹלָכָה וְהַזָּיָיה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִהְיֶה״, שֶׁיְּהוּ כׇּל הֲוָיוֹתָיו תָּם וּבֶן שָׁנָה.
human_translation: And from where of collection and conveying and sprinkling The verse states: “Shall be,” that all are it shall be unblemished and in its year.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive the laws of receiving, walking, and throwing on Shabbat through tradition? The Talmud teaches: "Yihyeh," that all His states should be complete and without change.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבֶּן שָׁנָה, הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵהֶן כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר אוֹ כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב — זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Interpret in its year So, too, it is reasonable as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all offerings in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of flesh or an olive-bulk of fat, sprinkles the blood Learn from
llm_translation: "He translated the stone of the year, thus it was fittingly arranged, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: All sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them the size of an olive of flesh or the size of an olive of fat - one should sprinkle the blood, learn from it."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי, דְּבִשְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה הָוֵי בֶּן שָׁנָה, וּבִשְׁעַת קַבָּלָה וְהוֹלָכָה הָוֵי בֶּן שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים? אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת שָׁעוֹת פּוֹסְלוֹת בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But is there anything where at the time of slaughter is in its year but at the time of collection and conveying is in its second year? Rava says: That is to say hours disqualify of sacrificial
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is there that is capable of performing the act of slaughtering from the age of one year, and at the time of receiving the blood and walking with it, he must be two years old? Rava said: This means that hours disqualify the offering in matters of sanctity." English translation: "And who is there that is capable of performing the act of slaughtering from the age of one year, and at the time of receiving the blood and walking with it, he must be two years old? Rava said: This means that hours disqualify the offering in matters of sanctity."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״וּמָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת וְנָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ — כּוּלָּן בַּבֵּיצִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , “And that whose stones are bruised, or crushed, or torn, or cut All are in the testicles; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: "Uma'uch, vekhatut, venatuk, vekharut" - all of these in eggs, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: בַּבֵּיצִים וְלֹא בַּגִּיד? אֵימָא: אַף בַּבֵּיצִים — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן בַּגִּיד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ — אַף בַּבֵּיצִים, ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ — בַּגִּיד אִין, בַּבֵּיצִים לָא.
human_translation: in the testicles and not in the penis? say also to the testicles; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: All of them are on the penis. Rabbi Yosei says: “bruised, or crushed” also to the testicles, while “torn or cut,” on the penis, yes, on the testicles not
llm_translation: In eggs and not in sinew? Say: Even in eggs - the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: All of them are in sinew. Rabbi Yosei says: "Crushed and crushed" - even in eggs, "pulled and cut" - in sinew there is not, in eggs there is not.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: חֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן?
human_translation: What, is it not disagree about this: That Sage, holds the lack of internal is called a lack. And Sage, holds is not called a lack.
llm_translation: What is the reason he does not agree with this? For Mar holds: if there is a deficiency from within, its name is a deficiency. And Mar holds: is its name not a deficiency?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר חֶסְרוֹן מִבִּפְנִים שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן — אֲפִילּוּ ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ נָמֵי! וְאִי קָסָבַר לָא שְׁמֵיהּ חֶסְרוֹן — אֲפִילּוּ ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: And can you understand what does Rabbi Yosei hold? If he holds the lack an internal is called a lack, even “torn or cut” And if he holds is not called a lack, even “bruised, or crushed,” not
llm_translation: "And was it created? Rabbi Yosei, what does he hold? If he holds that there is a deficiency from within, its name is deficient — even 'detached and cut off' also! And if he holds that its name is not deficient — even 'blunted and crushed' also not!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמוּמִים שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ הָוֵי מוּמָא, דְּמִיכַּוְוצָן, ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ הָוֵי מוּמָא, דְּהָא תַּלְיָין. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי זִמְנִין דְּמִיכַּוְוצָן, ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי זִימְנִין דְּתַלְיָין.
human_translation: Rather, here they disagree with regard to exposed blemishes. Rabbi Yehuda holds “bruised or crushed” are blemished, as shrink “torn or cut” are blemished, as hanging, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov holds “bruised or crushed” are not blemishes, as initially, there are times that also shrink. “torn or cut” are not blemished as initially, there are times that also hang.
llm_translation: Rather, here in the case of visible blemishes they disagree. Rabbi Yehuda holds: "Blotched and cut" constitutes a blemish, as they are permanent. "Torn and severed" constitutes a blemish, as they are hanging. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: "Blotched and cut" is not a blemish, as sometimes they heal from the root like the permanent ones. "Torn and severed" is not a blemish, as sometimes they heal from the root like the hanging ones.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ הָוֵי מוּמָא — דְּהָא לֵיתַנְהוּ, ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא — דְּהָא אִיתַנְהוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei holds “bruised or crushed” are blemished, as they are no present “torn or cut” are not blemished, as they are present
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: "Ma'uch and Katush" is a blemish - because they are not listed, "Natuk and Karut" is not a blemish - because they are listed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִפְגַּם הַזּוֹבָן, הָעֶרְיָה שֶׁל נְקֵבָה בַּמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, נִפְגַּם הַזָּנָב מִן הָעֶצֶם, אֲבָל לֹא מִן הַפֶּרֶק, אוֹ שֶׁרֹאשׁ זָנָב מְפַצֵּל, נִקְלְפָה הָעוֹר וְהַבָּשָׂר וְהָעֶצֶם נִשְׁאַר, אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּשָׂר מֵחוּלְיָא לְחוּלְיָא מְלֹא אֶצְבַּע.
human_translation: the pouch [ hazoven ] the genitalia of a female sacrificial were damaged the tail was damaged from the tailbone, but not from the joint, or where the end of the tail is split, the skin and the flesh were removed and the bone remained or where there is a full fingerbreadth of flesh between one joint and another joint;
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the male organ is damaged, the female's forbidden area in the Temple is damaged. If the tail is damaged from the bone, but not from the joint, or if the head of the tail is split, if the skin peels and the flesh and bone remain, or if there is flesh from one ailment to another ailment, the size of a finger.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: נִפְגַּם וְלֹא נִיטַּל, כִּיס וְלֹא זַכְרוּת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נִפְגַּם וְלֹא נִיטַּל, כִּיס וְלֹא זַכְרוּת. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן הַמְשׁוּלָּם: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּעִינְבָּל אֶחָד שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ זְאֵב וְחָזַר לְאֵיתָנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: was damaged, but not was removed. the pouch but not the male this is also taught was damaged, but not was removed, the pouch but not the male Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: An incident involving one in Inbal, where a wolf removed and it returned to its strength,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Rabbi Elazar said: It was damaged but not removed, a purse but not a memory. It was taught in a baraita similarly: It was damaged but not removed, a purse but not a memory. Rabbi Yosei ben Hameshulam said: There was an incident with a certain grapevine that a wolf took and returned to its place."

hebrew_text: נִפְגְּמָה הַזָּנָב מִן הָעֶצֶם וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: אֶצְבַּע שֶׁאָמְרוּ — אֶחָד מֵאַרְבָּעָה בְּטֶפַח שֶׁל כׇּל הָאָדָם. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: לְעִנְיַן תְּכֵלֶת, דְּתַנְיָא: כַּמָּה חוּטִין הוּא נוֹתֵן? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אַרְבָּעָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: the tail was damaged from the tailbone… taught: fingerbreadth which spoke one-fourth of a handbreadth of any person. With regard to what halakha Rabba says: with regard to tekhelet , As it is taught How many strings does one place Beit Shammai say: Four and Beit Hillel say: Three
llm_translation: The tail was dislocated from the bone, etc. It was taught: A finger that they said - one of four by a handbreadth of every person. For what halakha? Rabba said: For the matter of tekhelet, as it was taught: How many threads does one give? Beit Shammai say: Four, and Beit Hillel say: Three.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה תְּהֵא מְשׁוּלֶּשֶׁת? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אַרְבָּעָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלֹשָׁה. וּשְׁלִישׁ שֶׁבֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים — אֶחָד מֵאַרְבַּע בְּטֶפַח שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: And how much should be hanging Beit Shammai say: Four and Beit Hillel say: Three And three that Beit Hillel say one-fourth of a handbreadth of any person.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And how much should the width of the alleyway be? Beit Shammai say: four cubits, and Beit Hillel say: three cubits. And the third opinion of Beit Hillel says — one of four cubits in the span of every person."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: לִשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, דִּתְנַן: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת הָיוּ
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says to the two cubits as we learned There were two cubits
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: "For two cubits," as we learned: "They were two cubits."

hebrew_text: בְּשׁוּשַׁן הַבִּירָה, אַחַת עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית וְאַחַת עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית, שֶׁעַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית הָיְתָה יְתֵירָה עַל שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה חֲצִי אֶצְבַּע, וְשֶׁעַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית הָיְתָה יְתֵירָה עָלֶיהָ חֲצִי אֶצְבַּע, נִמְצֵאת יְתֵירָה עַל שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה אֶצְבַּע.
human_translation: in Shushan the capital, one in the northeast corner and one in the southeast corner. that was in the northeast corner was longer than by Moses half a fingerbreadth, that was in the southeast corner was longer than half a fingerbreadth. finds it longer than Moses’ fingerbreadth.
llm_translation: In Shushan the capital, one on the horn of the northeast and one on the horn of the southeast, that on the horn of the northeast was protruding over that of Moses half a finger, and that on the horn of the southeast was protruding over it half a finger, it was found to be protruding over that of Moses a finger.

hebrew_text: וְלָמָה הָיוּ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה? (כשהיו) [שֶׁהָיוּ] אוּמָּנִין נוֹטְלִין בַּקְּטַנָּה, וּמַחְזִירִין בַּגְּדוֹלָה, שֶׁלֹּא יָבוֹאוּ לִידֵי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: And why did say one large and one small? so that the artisans would take by the small and return by the large so they would not come to misuse consecrated property.
llm_translation: And why were there one large and one small? When they were skilled, they would take from the small one, and return to the large one, so as not to come to deceit.

hebrew_text: תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? חֲדָא — דְּכַסְפָּא וְזַהֲבָא, וַחֲדָא — דְּבִנְיָינָא.
human_translation: Why do I two One, to silver and gold. And one, in construction
llm_translation: Two reasons why do I need? One — for silver and gold, and one — for buildings.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן, לְאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּשָׂר בֵּין חוּלְיָא לְחוּלְיָא מְלֹא אֶצְבַּע.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, and some say Rav Huna bar Natan, to that which we learned where there is a full fingerbreadth of flesh between one joint and another joint.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak, and if you wish, say Rav Huna son of Nathan, regarding that which we learned: that there is flesh between one wound and another wound, the size of a finger.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין לוֹ בֵּיצִים, אוֹ אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי כִּיסִין — יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי בֵּיצִים, אֵין לוֹ שְׁנֵי כִּיסִין — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מוֹשִׁיבוֹ עַל עַכּוּזוֹ וּמְמַעֵךְ, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּיצָה — סוֹפָהּ לָצֵאת. מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁמִּיעֵךְ וְלֹא יָצָא, נִשְׁחֲטָה וְנִמְצֵאת דְּבוּקָה בַּכְּסָלִים, וְהִתִּיר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָסַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: it has no testicles or it has only one testicle. Rabbi Yishmael says: If has two sacs, it has two testicles; does not have two sacs, it has only one testicle. Rabbi Akiva says: One seats on its rump and mashes if there is a testicle, ultimately to emerge. an incident where one mashed and did not emerge. was slaughtered and was discovered attached to the loins. And Rabbi Akiva permitted and Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri prohibited
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he does not have testicles, or if he has only one testicle. Rabbi Yishmael says: If he has two pouches - he has two eggs, if he does not have two pouches - he has only one egg. Rabbi Akiva says: Place it on its back and press it, if there is an egg - its end will come out. There was an incident where it was pressed and did not come out, it was slaughtered and found to be attached to the kidneys, Rabbi Akiva permitted it and Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri forbade it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַשְׁתָּא אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת אָמְרַתְּ הָוֵי מוּמָא, אֵין לוֹ כְּלָל מִיבַּעְיָא? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין לוֹ שְׁתֵּי בֵּיצִים בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיסִין אֶלָּא בְּכִיס אֶחָד, אִי נָמֵי שְׁתֵּי כִּיסִין וּבֵיצָה אַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: Now it has only one testicle you said it is a blemish, is necessary it has no at all? is incomplete and this it is teaching: it does not have two testicles in two sacs, but in one sac, alternatively, two sacs and one testicle, it is a blemish.
llm_translation: Gemara: If he has only one testicle, she said, it is a blemish. Does he not lack a requirement? The Gemara answers: He lacks from the place of lacking, and thus it teaches: If he has two testicles in two pouches, but in one pouch, or if he has two pouches and one testicle — this is a blemish.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי כִּיסִים — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי בֵּיצִים, אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא כִּיס אֶחָד — כְּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת דָּמֵי, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְמֵימַר: בְּיָדוּעַ לָא אָמְרִינַן, אֶלָּא מוֹשִׁיבוֹ עַל עַכּוּזוֹ וּמְמַעֵךְ, אִם יֵשׁ בֵּיצָה סוֹפוֹ לָצֵאת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: has two sacs, it is known that it has two testicles, has only one sac it is considered like one that has only one testicle, And Rabbi Akiva comes to say: we do not say It is known. Rather, one seats on its rump and mashes if there is a testicle, ultimately to emerge.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: If one has two pockets - it is known that he has two eggs. If he has only one pocket - it is as if he has only one egg. Rabbi Akiva came and said: When it is known, we do not say, rather, he places it on his thigh and shakes it, if there is an egg, it will eventually come out.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁמִּיעֵךְ וְלֹא יָצָא וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּפָירָן שֶׁל בֵּית מְנַחֵם, שֶׁמִּיעֵךְ וְלֹא יָצָאת, וְנִשְׁחֲטָה וְנִמְצֵאת דְּבוּקָה בַּכְּסָלִים, וְהִתִּיר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְאָסַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: And an incident where one mashed and did not emerge. It is taught Rabbi Yosei said: an incident in Piran of Beit Menaḥem where mashed and did not emerge. And was slaughtered and was discovered attached to the loins. And Rabbi Akiva permitted and Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri prohibited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the incident of 'your maidservant' and she did not go out, etc." It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident in the attic of the house of Menachem, where 'your maidservant' and she did not go out, and she was slaughtered and found to be clinging to the intestines, and Rabbi Akiva permitted it, while Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri prohibited it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מְכַלֶּה מָמוֹנָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מַאֲכִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל נְבֵילוֹת! לָאו מִישְׁחָט שַׁחְטֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri: Until when will you consume the property of the Jewish people Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said to Rabbi Akiva: Until when will you feed the Jewish people carcasses? aren’t they slaughtered?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva to Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri: Until when are you diminishing the wealth of Israel! He said to him Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri to Rabbi Akiva: Until when are you feeding Israel carcasses! Isn't it better to slaughter it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: טְרֵיפוֹת. לָא אִיסּוּר טְרֵיפוֹת הוּא?! אֶלָּא: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מַאֲכִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ!
human_translation: Rather, animals with a wound that will cause them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ]. it is not a prohibition of tereifot . Rather, Until when will you feed the Jewish people sacrificial outside
llm_translation: Rather: Treifot. Is it not the prohibition of treifot?! Rather: Until when will you feed Israel holy offerings outside!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּעַל חָמֵשׁ רַגְלַיִם, אוֹ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ, וְשֶׁרַגְלָיו קְלוּטוֹת כְּשֶׁל חֲמוֹר, וְהַשָּׁחוּל וְהַכָּסוּל. אֵיזֶהוּ שָׁחוּל? שֶׁנִּשְׁמְטָה יְרֵיכוֹ. וְכָסוּל? שֶׁאַחַת מִירֵיכוֹתָיו גְּבוֹהוֹת.
human_translation: with five legs, or that has only three, or whose legs were closed like of a donkey or the shaḥul , or the kasul What is a shaḥul ? a thighbone that was dislocated. And a kasul ? that one of its thighs is higher
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has five legs, or one who has only three, and his legs are smooth like those of a donkey, he is considered a shahul and a kasul. What is a shahul? One whose thigh has slipped. And what is a kasul? One of whose thighs is higher.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁחָסֵר וְיָתֵר בַּיָּד, אֲבָל בָּרֶגֶל — טְרֵפָה נָמֵי הָוֵי, דְּכֹל יָתֵיר כְּנָטוּל דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: taught only where was missing or had an additional foreleg. But an hind leg, it is also a tereifa . that any extra is like a removed
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav Huna: They only taught that there is a deficiency and an excess in the hand, but in the foot — it is indeed considered a treifah, for all the excess is like detached blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא דַּעֲגִילָן וְלָא סְדִיקָן, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דַּעֲגִילָן, אַף עַל גַּב דִּסְדִיקָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Do not say where round and not split Rather, when they are round, even though they are split,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Do not say "let us be like the aged and the righteous," rather, once we become aged, we will also be considered righteous.

hebrew_text: וְהַשָּׁחוּל וְהַכָּסוּל וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ כָּסוּל וְאֵיזֶהוּ שָׁחוּל? שָׁחוּל — שֶׁנִּשְׁמְטָה יְרֵיכוֹ, כָּסוּל — שֶׁרַגְלוֹ אֶחָד בְּתוֹךְ הַכֶּסֶל, וְרַגְלוֹ אֶחָד עַל גַּבֵּי הַכֶּסֶל. תָּנָא: הַשָּׂרוּעַ וְהַקָּלוּט — שָׂרוּעַ שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּרְבֵּב לוֹ יְרֵיכוֹ, קָלוּט — שֶׁרַגְלָיו קְלוּטוֹת כְּשֶׁל חֲמוֹר וּכְשֶׁל סוּס.
human_translation: Or the shaḥul , or the kasul the Sages taught: What is kasul and what is shaḥul ? shaḥul a thighbone that was dislocated. kasul that one of its legs is inside the loin, and one of its legs above the loin. taught the saru’a and kalut saru’a whose thigh is longer kalut whose its legs are closed like of a donkey and like of a horse.
llm_translation: The thorn and the splinter, etc. The Rabbis taught: What is a splinter and what is a thorn? A splinter - when his thigh slipped out, a thorn - when one foot is inside the splinter, and one foot is on top of the splinter. It was taught: The bandaged and the wrapped - bandaged when his thigh swells, wrapped - when his legs are wrapped like a donkey's and like a horse's.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִשְׁבַּר עֶצֶם יָדוֹ וְעֶצֶם רַגְלוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיכָּר. מוּמִין אֵלּוּ מָנָה אִילָא בְּיַבְנֶה, וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: the bone of its foreleg or the bone of its hind leg was broken, even though it is not conspicuous. these blemishes Ila, enumerated in Yavne, and the Sages deferred to his
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If a bone of his hand or a bone of his foot was broken, even though it is not recognizable. These blemishes are counted as one of the forty categories of blemishes in a blemished animal, and the Sages acknowledged it.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד שְׁלֹשָׁה הוֹסִיף, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ. שֶׁגַּלְגַּל עֵינוֹ עָגוֹל כְּשֶׁל אָדָם, וּפִיו דּוֹמֶה כְּשֶׁל חֲזִיר, וְשֶׁנִּיטַּל רוֹב הַמְדַבֵּר בִּלְשׁוֹנוֹ. בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אַחֲרֵיהֶן אָמְרוּ: הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: And added three additional said to him: We did not hear those. whose eye is round like of a person, or whose mouth is similar to of a pig, or where most of its tongue speech was removed. The court that followed them said That is a blemish
llm_translation: And three more he added, they said to him: we did not hear these. That his eye is round like that of a human, and his mouth resembles that of a pig, and he removes most of what he says in his language. The court behind them said: behold, this is a blemish.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֵינוֹ נִיכָּר, מִי קָא הָוֵי מוּמָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵינוֹ נִיכָּר מֵחֲמַת עַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל נִיכָּר מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: it is not conspicuous, is it a blemish? Rav Pappa says: it is not conspicuous on its own account, But it is conspicuous on account of work,
llm_translation: Gemar, he is not recognizable, who is causing a blemish? Rav Papa said: He is not recognizable due to himself, but he is recognizable due to the work.

hebrew_text: מוּמִין אֵלּוּ מָנָה וְכוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּלָאו הַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמַּפֶּלֶת מִין בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה וָעוֹף, בֵּין טְמֵאִין בֵּין טְהוֹרִין, אִם זָכָר תֵּשֵׁב לְזָכָר.
human_translation: these blemishes enumerated to say that it is not the manner And raise a contradiction who miscarries a type of domesticated animal, undomesticated animal, or bird, whether it is a non-kosher or whether it is a kosher if it is male, observes for a male.
llm_translation: Defects, these are the kinds, etc. To say, is this not its way? And it was asked: If a species of animal, wild beast, or bird miscarries, whether they are ritually impure or pure, if it is male, it shall be seated for a male.

hebrew_text: אִם נְקֵבָה — תֵּשֵׁב לִנְקֵבָה, אֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ — תֵּשֵׁב לְזָכָר וְלִנְקֵבָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: If female, observes for a female. is unknown, observes of a male and of a female: the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: If female — sit for female, if not known — sit for male and female, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? הוֹאִיל וְגַלְגַּל עֵינוֹ עָגוֹל כְּשֶׁל אָדָם! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּאוּכָּמָא, הָא בְּחִיוָּורָא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? Since the eye is round like of a person, Rav Yosef said not difficult; this to the black that to the white
llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? Since the eye of a human is round like a wheel! Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult, this one is in the light, this one is in the shadow.

hebrew_text: וּפִיו דּוֹמֶה כְּשֶׁל חֲזִיר. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא דִּשְׁפִיד וּפְרִוס, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דִּפְרִוס אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שְׁפִיד.
human_translation: Or its mouth is similar to of a pig. Rav Pappa says: Do not say where pointed and overlaps Rather, when it overlaps, even though it is not pointed,
llm_translation: "And his mouth is like that of a pig." Rav Papa said: Do not say 'split and torn,' rather, once it is torn, even though it is not split."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁנִּיטַּל רוֹב הַמְדַבֵּר שֶׁבִּלְשׁוֹנוֹ. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: וְאֶת שֶׁנִּיטַּל רוֹב הַלָּשׁוֹן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רוֹב הַמְדַבֵּר שֶׁל לְשׁוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Or that most of its tongue speech was removed. Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Or that most of its tongue was removed; Rabbi Yehuda says: Most of its tongue speech
llm_translation: And that which most of the speaker in his language is removed. Mishnah from where? Rabbi Yehuda it is, as it was taught: And that which most of the language is removed, Rabbi Yehuda says: Most of the speaker of his language.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהַלְּחִי הַתַּחְתּוֹן עוֹדֵף עַל הָעֶלְיוֹן, וְשָׁאַל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים, וְאָמְרוּ: הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: And an incident where the lower jaw protruded beyond the upper and Rabban Gamliel asked the Sages and they said: That is a blemish
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: And there was an incident where the lower lobe of the liver was larger than the upper lobe, and Rabban Gamliel asked the sages, and they said: "This is a blemish."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי ״וּמַעֲשֶׂה״? מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנַן ״פִּיו דּוֹמֶה לַחֲזִיר״, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי, וְקָאָמְרִינַן: כִּי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי בִּשְׂפָתוֹ עֶלְיוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, אֲבָל שֶׁהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: What taught that teaches And an incident? Since we learned its mouth is similar to of a pig, and the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi we say when the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi where its upper lip overlaps the lower But where the lower protrudes beyond the upper this is a blemish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason that the Tanna teaches "and the deed"? Because we learned: "His mouth resembles that of a pig," and the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi on this, and we say: When the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi in his superior lip, the lower lip is still in excess, but when the lower lip is in excess over the upper lip — this is a blemish.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי שֶׁלְּחִי הַתַּחְתּוֹן עוֹדֵף עַל הָעֶלְיוֹן, שָׁאַל רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים וְאָמְרוּ: הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: And also an incident where the lower jaw protruded beyond the upper Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel asked the Sages and they said: That is a blemish
llm_translation: And the incident of Namai the son-in-law of the lower one, he exceeded the upper one, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel asked the sages and they said: "Behold, this is a blemish."

hebrew_text: וְהָא גַּבֵּי אָדָם הוּא דִּתְנַן: שְׂפָתוֹ הָעֶלְיוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, אוֹ שֶׁתַּחְתּוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. גַּבֵּי אָדָם הוּא דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן״, אִישׁ שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, אֲבָל בִּבְהֵמָה לָא!
human_translation: But with regard to a person that we learned his upper lip protrudes beyond the lower or lower protrudes beyond the upper that is a blemish. it is with regard to a person that it is written: “Whatever man of the seed of Aaron” a man who is equal to the seed of Aaron, But not with regard to an animal,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And is that so regarding a person? But didn't we learn in a Mishnah: If his upper lip is longer than his lower lip, or if his lower lip is longer than his upper lip — this is a blemish. Regarding a person, as it is written: "Each man from the seed of Aharon," a man who is similar in his seed to that of Aharon, but not in an animal!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאִית בַּהּ עֶצֶם, הָא דְּלֵית בַּהּ עֶצֶם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said not difficult; this where contains a bone that where does not contain a bone,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is not difficult, this one that has in it a bone, this one that does not have in it a bone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹזֶן הַגְּדִי הָיְתָה כְּפוּלָה, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא עֶצֶם אֶחָד — מוּם, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ עֶצֶם — אֵינוֹ מוּם. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: זְנַב הַגְּדִי שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְשֶׁל חֲזִיר, וְשֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שְׁלֹשׁ חוּלְיוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם.
human_translation: the ear of the kid was doubled the Sages said: When is one bone, a blemish; when it does not have bone it is not a blemish. Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel says: the tail of a kid that is similar to of a pig or that it does not have three joints, that is a blemish.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the ear of a goat was folded, the sages said: when it has one bone - it is a blemish, when it does not have a bone - it is not a blemish. Rabbi Chananya ben Gamliel says: the tail of a goat that resembles that of a pig, and does not have three vertebrae - this is a blemish.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פִּיו בָּלוּם וְרַגְלָיו מְבוּלָּמוֹת, מֵחֲמַת הָרוּחַ — אֵינוֹ מוּם, מֵחֲמַת הָעֶצֶם — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. אׇזְנָיו כְּפוּלוֹת, בְּחַסְחֲסוּת אַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, בִּשְׁתֵּי חַסְחֲסֻיוֹת — אֵינוֹ מוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the mouth swollen, and its legs are swollen, due to the wind, it is not a blemish. due to bone, this is a blemish. its ears are doubled, where one cartilage, this is a blemish; where two cartilages, this is not a blemish.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "His lips are swollen and his feet are swollen, due to the wind - it is not a blemish; due to the bone - this is a blemish. His ears are folded, with one fold - this is a blemish, with two folds - it is not a blemish."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: זְנַב הַגְּדִי שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְשֶׁל חֲזִיר. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא דְּקַטִּינָא, אֶלָּא דִּכְרִיכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲלִימָא.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: the tail of a kid that is similar to of a pig, Rav Pappa says: Do not say where thin rather, round, even though it is thick,
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: The tail of a goat resembles that of a pig. Rav Papa said: Do not say "a young goat," but rather "a ram," even though it is woolly.

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁלֹשׁ חוּלְיוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בַּגְּדִי — שְׁתַּיִם הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, שָׁלֹשׁ אֵינוֹ מוּם. בַּטָּלֶה — שָׁלֹשׁ הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, אַרְבַּע אֵינוֹ מוּם. מֵיתִיבִי: בַּגְּדִי — אַחַת הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, שְׁתַּיִם אֵינוֹ מוּם. בַּטָּלֶה — שְׁתַּיִם הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם, שָׁלֹשׁ אֵינוֹ מוּם. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Or that it does not have three joints, Rav Huna says: In a kid, two that is a blemish; three it is not a blemish. With regard to a lamb, three that is a blemish; four it is not a blemish. raises an objection In a kid, one that is a blemish; two it is not a blemish. With regard to a lamb, two that is a blemish; three it is not a blemish. a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or that it does not have three illnesses, etc. Rav Huna said: In a garment - two, this is a blemish, three is not a blemish. In a cloak - three, this is a blemish, four is not a blemish. It was taught: In a garment - one, this is a blemish, two is not a blemish. In a cloak - two, this is a blemish, three is not a blemish. The refutation of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא, מַתְנִיתִין אַטְעִיתֵיהּ; אִיהוּ סָבַר: מִדְּרֵישָׁא בִּגְדִי — סֵיפָא נָמֵי בִּגְדִי, וְלָא הִיא — רֵישָׁא בִּגְדִי, וְסֵיפָא בְּטָלֶה.
human_translation: And Rav Huna the mishna misled him. He thought from that the first clause to a kid, the latter clause, also to a kid. But it is not so. the first clause to a kid, but the latter clause to a lamb,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, a Tanna, planted it; he holds: from the first clause "garment" — the last clause is also "garment," and it is not; the first clause is "garment," and the last clause is nullified.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אֶת שֶׁיַּבֶּלֶת בְּעֵינָיו, וְשֶׁנִּפְגַּם עֶצֶם יָדוֹ וְרַגְלוֹ, וְשֶׁנִּפְרַק עַצְמוֹ שֶׁל פִּיו, עֵינוֹ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה, אׇזְנוֹ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה, בַּמַּרְאֶה אֲבָל לֹא בַּמִּדָּה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי בֵּיצָיו, אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה כִּשְׁתַּיִם שֶׁבַּחֲבֶירְתָּהּ, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says that has a wart in its eyes; and where the bone of its foreleg or hind leg was damaged; and where the bone of its mouth, was dislocated; one of its eyes large and one small, one of its ears large and one small by sight, but not by being measured. Rabbi Yehuda says: its two testicles, one is as large as two of the other, but the Rabbis did not agree with his
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: One whose stomach is full, whose hand and leg are injured, whose bone of his mouth is broken, one eye is large and one eye is small, one ear is large and one ear is small, in appearance but not in measure. Rabbi Yehuda says: Two of its eggs, one is large like two of its companions, and the sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּיַבֶּלֶת הָוֵי מוּמָא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן לֹא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ וְלֹא בַּמְּדִינָה — בַּעַל גָּרָב וּבַעַל יַבֶּלֶת!
human_translation: to say that a wart is a blemish? And raise a contradiction And these that one does not slaughter due to them, neither in the Temple nor in the country, with boils and with warts.
llm_translation: Gemara: Is a blemish considered a disqualification for a firstborn animal? And they asked: And which are those that one does not slaughter upon them, neither in the Temple nor in the province? — A Baal Garav and a Baal Yavelet!

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? הָא כְּתִיבָא ״יַבֶּלֶת״ בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּגוּפוֹ, הָא — בְּעֵינוֹ.
human_translation: And you understand a wart is written in the Torah Rather, not difficult, that on body, this in its eye.
llm_translation: And will it be created? Is it not written "Yavelet" in the Torah! Rather, it is not difficult: here - in its essence, here - in its appearance.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי קְרָא סְתָמָא, מָה לִי בְּגוּפוֹ וּמָה לִי בְּעֵינוֹ? אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאִית בַּהּ עֶצֶם, הָא דְּלֵית בַּהּ עֶצֶם.
human_translation: Now the verse an unspecified What to me on its body, and what to me in its eye? Rather, not difficult, this that has a bone, that that does not have a bone.
llm_translation: From the verse itself, what do I need with his body and what do I need with his eye? Rather, it is not difficult: this one that has a bone in it, and this one that does not have a bone in it.

hebrew_text: דִּקְרָא — דְּאִית בַּהּ עֶצֶם, מַתְנִיתִין — דְּלֵית בַּהּ עֶצֶם; בְּעֵינוֹ — הָוֵי מוּמָא, בְּגוּפָא — לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא.
human_translation: in the verse that has a bone, the mishna that does not have a bone. in its eye, it is a blemish, on body, it is not a blemish,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Dikra - de'it bah etzem, matnitin - de'leit bah etzem; be'eino - havei mumah, begufa - lo havei mumah." English translation: "A hole - if it has a bone in it, it is susceptible to impurity; a mat - if it does not have a bone in it; in its eye - it is considered blemished, in its body - it is not considered blemished."

hebrew_text: וְלֵית לַהּ עֶצֶם בְּגוּפָא פְּסוּלָה? הֲרֵי תִּלְתּוּל בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בַּעֲלֵי הַתִּילּוּלִין פְּסוּלִין בָּאָדָם וּכְשֵׁירִין בַּבְּהֵמָה! אֶלָּא, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּעֵינוֹ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בַּשָּׁחוֹר, הָא — בַּלָּבָן.
human_translation: And does not have a bone on the body, disqualified It is merely hanging as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: with hangs disqualifies a person, but with regard to an animal, fit. Rather, this and that in the eye, and not difficult, this in the black that in the white
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does it not have a bone in its body that renders it unfit? It is merely a trifling matter, as we learned: Rabbi Eliezer says: Those who are castrated are unfit for a man but fit for an animal! Rather, it depends on the appearance, and it is not difficult: this one — in black, this one — in white."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֵין מוּמִין בַּלָּבָן! אֶלָּא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּלָּבָן, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — דְּאִית בַּהּ שֵׂעָר, הָא — דְּלֵית בַּהּ שֵׂעָר.
human_translation: But there are no blemishes in the white Rather, this and that in the white And Reish Lakish says: not difficult; this that has a hair, that where does not have a hair.
llm_translation: And this, is not blemished in white! Rather: both are in white, and Reish Lakish said: It is not difficult, this - that has hair, this - that does not have hair.

hebrew_text: עֵינוֹ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: גְּדוֹלָה כְּשֶׁל עֵגֶל, קְטַנָּה כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז.
human_translation: one of its eyes large taught large, as of a calf, small, as a goose.
llm_translation: One eye is large etc. It was taught: Large like that of a calf, small like that of a goose.

hebrew_text: אׇזְנוֹ אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְכוּ׳. וְרַבָּנַן עַד כַּמָּה? תַּנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ אֵינָהּ לַשְּׁנִיָּה אֶלָּא כְּפוֹל — כְּשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: one of its ears large And the Rabbis, how large is taught Aḥerim say: Even the second, no than a bean, is fit.
llm_translation: One large ear and so forth. And the sages, how much? It was taught: Others say, even if it is not for the second time, but for the third - it is considered like a song.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זְנַב הָעֵגֶל — שֶׁאֵינָהּ מַגַּעַת לָעַרְקוֹב, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: כֹּל מַרְבִּית עֲגָלִים כֵּן, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיְּהוּ מְגַדְּלִין — הֵן נִמְתָּחוֹת. אֵיזֶהוּ עַרְקוֹב שֶׁאָמְרוּ? רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: בְּעַרְקוֹב שֶׁבְּאֶמְצַע הַיָּרֵךְ.
human_translation: the tail of a calf that does not reach the leg joint [ la’arkov ], the Sages said: all growth of calves this As long as they grow, are extended Which is the leg joint which spoke? Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: to leg joint that is in the middle of the thigh.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The tail of a calf - that does not reach the ground, the sages said: any increase of calves, similarly, as long as they are being raised - they are considered detached. What is the tail that they said? Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: the tail in the middle of the thigh.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: קֶפֶץ הָעֶלְיוֹן וְלֹא קֶפֶץ הַתַּחְתּוֹן, וּכְנֶגְדּוֹ בְּגָמָל נִיכָּר.
human_translation: taught the upper joint, and not the lower joint, And the corresponding in a camel is conspicuous,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Keptz ha'elyon v'lo keptz ha'tachton, u'k'negdo b'gamal nikar." English translation: "Gemara: The upper one contracted but the lower one did not contract, and opposite it a camel is recognizable."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַל אֵלּוּ מוּמִין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר, וּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין נִפְדִּין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: For these blemishes one slaughters the firstborn and disqualified consecrated may be redeemed on their account.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On these blemishes they slaughter the firstborn, and disqualified consecrated animals are redeemed with them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: עַל אֵלּוּ מוּמִין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר! סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא: פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין נִפְדִּין עֲלֵיהֶן. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא — מִישְׁחָט שָׁחֲטִינַן, מִיפְרָק מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Why do I this additional taught the first clause, For these blemishes, one may slaughter the firstborn the latter clause necessary: Disqualified consecrated may be redeemed due to this too obvious; one may slaughter is necessary one may redeem them?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why do I need this? The first part teaches: For these blemishes they slaughter the firstborn! The latter part is necessary: Those disqualified for Temple service are redeemed with them. Isn't it obvious — if we slaughter, do we not require redemption?" English translation: "Why do I need this? The first part teaches: For these blemishes they slaughter the firstborn! The latter part is necessary: Those disqualified for Temple service are redeemed with them. Isn't it obvious — if we slaughter, do we not require redemption?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁלֹשָׁה הוֹסִיף, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ, וְקָתָנֵי וְאָתֵי דִּיחִידָאָה, וְקָא סָתֵים לַהּ בְּכוּלְּהוּ: עַל אֵלּוּ מוּמִין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַבְּכוֹר וּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין נִפְדִּין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rather, since taught added three and said to him: We did not hear those, and proceeded to teach of individual an unattributed with regard to all their For these blemishes one slaughters the firstborn, and disqualified consecrated may be redeemed due to them.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason is that a Tanna added three cases, and they said to him: "We did not hear these." And the Gemara came and reconciled them all: Regarding these blemishes, one may slaughter the firstborn animal, and disqualified consecrated items are redeemed with them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶן, לֹא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ וְלֹא בַּמְּדִינָה: חֲוַורְוָר, וְהַמַּיִם שֶׁאֵין קְבוּעִין, וְחוּטִין הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת שֶׁנִּפְגְּמוּ — אֲבָל לֹא שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ, וּבַעַל גָּרָב, וּבַעַל יַבֶּלֶת, וּבַעַל חֲזָזִית, זָקֵן, וְחוֹלֶה, וּמְזוֹהָם, וְשֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בּוֹ עֲבֵירָה, וְשֶׁהֵמִית אָדָם — עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי הַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: And these that one does not slaughter due to them, neither in the Temple nor in the country: Pale spots and tears that are not constant; and internal gums that were damaged but that were not extracted; and with boils [ garav ]; and with warts; and with boils [ ḥazazit ]; an old or sick or a foul odor; and with which a transgression was performed, and that killed a person. on the basis of one witness or on the basis of the owner.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the cases where one does not slaughter on their account, neither in the Temple nor in the provinces: A chicken with a perforated crop, and water that is not fixed, and inner threads that are damaged — but not if they are uprooted, and a goring ox, and a runaway slave, and a leper, an elder, a sick person, one who is defiled, one who has engaged in a transgression with him, and one who has killed a person — based on the testimony of one witness or based on the testimony of the owners.

hebrew_text: וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, לֹא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ וְלֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ מוּם גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר, אֶלָּא נִגְזָז וְנֶעֱבָד.
human_translation: And a tumtum , and a hermaphrodite [ ve’anderoginos ], neither in the Temple nor in the country. Rabbi Shimon says: You have no blemish greater than that, And the Rabbis say: is not a firstborn; rather, be shorn and utilized for labor.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Tumtum and Androgynous, not in the Temple and not in the province. Rabbi Shimon says: You have no greater blemish than this, and the Sages say: He is not a firstborn, rather he is cut and castrated." English translation: "And Tumtum and Androgynous, not in the Temple and not in the province. Rabbi Shimon says: You have no greater blemish than this, and the Sages say: He is not a firstborn, rather he is cut and castrated."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְגָרָב לָא? וְהָכְתִיב ״גָּרָב״ בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! וַחֲזָזִית לָא? וְהָכְתִיב ״יַלֶּפֶת״ בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! וְתַנְיָא: ״גָּרָב״ — זֶה הַחֶרֶס, ״יַלֶּפֶת״ — זוֹ חֲזָזִית הַמִּצְרִית, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״יַלֶּפֶת״? שֶׁמְּלַפֶּפֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת עַד יוֹם הַמִּיתָה.
human_translation: And is garav not But isn’t it written “ garav ” in the Torah, And is ḥazazit not But isn’t it written “ yalefet ” in the Torah, and it is taught “ Garav ”; this is earthenware [ ḥeres ]; “ yalefet ”; this is the ḥazazit the Egyptians And Reish Lakish says: Why is it called yalefet ? that it grabs [ melapefet ] continuously until the day of death,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it "g'ma" and "garav" not? And it is written "garav" in the Torah! And "chazazit" not? And it is written "yaletet" in the Torah! And it was taught: "garav" - this is earthenware, "yaletet" - this is Egyptian glassware. And Reish Lakish said: Why is it called "yaletet"? Because it smooths and continues until the day of death.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲזָזִית אַחֲזָזִית לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּחֲזָזִית הַמִּצְרִית, כָּאן בַּחֲזָזִית דְּעָלְמָא. אֶלָּא גָּרָב אַגָּרָב קַשְׁיָא! גָּרָב אַגָּרָב נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּלַח, הָא בְּיָבֵשׁ. לַח — אִיתַּסִּי, יָבֵשׁ — לָא מִיתַּסֵּי.
human_translation: Granted, between the ḥazazit the ḥazazit not difficult, here to an Egyptian ḥazazit , there to a regular ḥazazit . But between the garav the garav difficult. between the garav the garav also not difficult: This to moist that to dry Moist heal dry not heal.
llm_translation: In Shelmah, Chazazit Achazazit is not difficult: here in the Egyptian Chazazit, here in the Chazazit of the world. Rather, a wet rag is difficult! A wet rag is indeed not difficult, whether wet or dry. Wet - it absorbs, dry - it does not absorb.

hebrew_text: וְלַח מִיתַּסֵּי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״יַכְּכָה ה׳ בִּשְׁחִין מִצְרַיִם וְגוֹ׳״, וּמִדִּכְתִיב ״וּבְחֶרֶס״ הֲרֵי גָּרָב לַח אָמוּר, וְקָאָמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תוּכַל לְהֵרָפֵא״!
human_translation: And a moist heal? But isn’t it written: “The Lord will smite you with the boil of Egypt, And since it is written: “And with ḥares ,” moist garav is stated, and states: “From which you cannot be healed.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for what reason does he suffer? And it is written: 'The Lord will strike you with the boils of Egypt, etc.', and from the fact that it is written 'and with a potsherd', behold, it is a harsh remedy, and it is stated: 'which cannot be healed'!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תְּלָתָא הֲווֹ: דִּקְרָא — יָבֵשׁ בֵּין מִבִּפְנִים בֵּין מִבַּחוּץ, דְּמַתְנִיתִין — לַח מִבַּחוּץ וּמִבִּפְנִים, דְּמִצְרַיִם — יָבֵשׁ מִבִּפְנִים וְלַח מִבַּחוּץ, דִּכְתִיב ״וַיְהִי שְׁחִין פּוֹרֵחַ אֲבַעְבּוּעוֹת בָּאָדָם״.
human_translation: Rather, there are three of the verse dry both on the inside and on the outside. of the mishna, moist on the outside and inside. of Egypt, dry on the inside but is moist on the outside, as it is written “And it became a boil breaking forth with avabu’ot upon man
llm_translation: Rather, there are three: Scripture — dry inside and outside, Mishnah — moist inside and outside, Egypt — dry inside and moist outside, as it is written, "And there was a boil breaking forth with blains upon man."

hebrew_text: וְהַזָּקֵן וְהַחוֹלֶה וְהַמְזוֹהָם. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מִן הַצֹּאן וּמִן הַכְּשָׂבִים וּמִן הָעִזִּים״ — פְּרָט לַזָּקֵן וְלַחוֹלֶה וְלַמְזוֹהָם.
human_translation: And an old or a sick or a foul odor. From where are these matters as the Sages taught: from [ min ] the flock, whether from the sheep or from the goats” exclude the old, and the sick, and the a foul odor,
llm_translation: The elder, the sick, and the defiled. Are they eligible for the Passover lamb? For the Rabbis taught: "From the flock and from the sheep and from the goats" - excluding the elder, the sick, and the defiled.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמַעוֹטֵי זָקֵן, דְּלָא הָדַר בָּרֵיא, אֲבָל חוֹלֶה, דַּהֲדַר בָּרֵיא — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי כְּתַב לְמַעוֹטֵי חוֹלֶה, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחֵיהּ, אֲבָל זָקֵן, דְּהַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And are necessary. As, had the Merciful One written to exclude an old which will not become healthy again, But sick which become healthy again, say not And, had written to exclude a sick as not the manner But an old as this is the manner say not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote "to exclude the healthy," that he did not return healthy, but the sick, that he did return healthy — say no. And if He wrote "to exclude the sick," that it is not his way, but the elderly, that is his way — say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא תְּרֵי, לְמַעוֹטֵי הָנֵי דִּכְחִישִׁי, אֲבָל מְזוֹהָם דְּלָא כְּחִישׁ — אֵימָא לָא, וְאִי נָמֵי לְמַעוֹטֵי מְזוֹהָם מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיס, אֲבָל הָנֵי דְּלָא מְאִיסִי — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written two to exclude these weak But a foul odor, which is not weak, say not And alternatively, to exclude a foul odor, as repulsive. But these which are not repulsive, say not are necessary.
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote two cases, to exclude those who deny, but those who do not deny - say no. And if also to exclude those who do not deny because they despise, but those who do not despise - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בּוֹ עֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: And with which a transgression was performed, From where are these matters
llm_translation: And if it was performed with it a transgression, etc. Whence these words?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מִן הַבְּהֵמָה״ — לְהוֹצִיא רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע, ״מִן הַבָּקָר״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנֶּעֱבָד, ״מִן הַצֹּאן״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַמּוּקְצֶה, ״וּמִן הַצֹּאן״ — לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנּוֹגֵחַ.
human_translation: as the Sages taught “from the cattle” to exclude an animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality. “from the herd” to exclude worshipped “from the flock” to exclude set aside “or from the flock” to exclude gored
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "From the animal" - to exclude a quarter and a half, "from the cattle" - to exclude that which is consecrated, "from the flock" - to exclude that which is designated, "and from the flock" - to exclude that which gores.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי בְּנֵי קְטָלָא נִינְהוּ! עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי הַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: these they are liable to death on the basis of one witness or on the basis of the owner.
llm_translation: These are the sons of Katala! Based on the testimony of one witness or based on the testimony of the owners.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא טוּמְטוּם, בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ לָא — דִּילְמָא נְקֵבָה הִיא, בַּמְּדִינָה לָא — דִּילְמָא זָכָר הוּא וְלֵית בֵּהּ מוּמָא.
human_translation: Granted, a tumtum , neither in the Temple, perhaps it is a female nor in the country, perhaps it is a male and it does not have a blemish,
llm_translation: In Sh'lama Tumtum, in the Temple not — perhaps it is a female; in the province not — perhaps it is a male and has no blemish.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ לָא, דִּלְמָא נְקֵבָה הִיא. אֶלָּא בַּמְּדִינָה נָמֵי, נְהִי דְּזָכָר הוּא — תֵּעָשֶׂה נַקְבוּת חָרִיץ, וְיִשְׁחוֹט עָלֶהָ!
human_translation: But a hermaphrodite, granted not in the Temple, perhaps it is a female. But with regard to the country, even let it be a male; female should be considered a crack [ ḥaritz ], and one slaughter due to
llm_translation: Rather, Androgynos, indeed in the Temple not, perhaps it is a female. Rather, in the province it is said, since it is male — it shall be made a perforated female, and one shall slaughter upon it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא ״אוֹ חָרוּץ אוֹ שָׁבוּר״, חָרוּץ דּוּמְיָא דְּשָׁבוּר, מָה שָׁבוּר בִּמְקוֹם עֶצֶם, אַף חָרוּץ בִּמְקוֹם עֶצֶם.
human_translation: Abaye said The verse states: “Or cracked or broken” cracked is similar to broken: Just as broken in the location of a bone, so too, cracked in the location of a bone,
llm_translation: Abaye said: The verse says, "or crushed or torn," crushed is similar to torn, just as torn is in the place of a bone, so too crushed is in the place of a bone.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא שָׁבוּר נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ חָרוּץ בִּמְקוֹם בָּשָׂר הָוֵי מוּמָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הָוֵי מוּמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״גָּרָב״ זֶהוּ חֶרֶס, מִיחְרָץ חֲרִיץ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמַרְאֵהוּ עָמוֹק מִן הָעוֹר״, כְּמַרְאֵה חַמָּה הָעֲמוּקָּה מִן הַצֵּל.
human_translation: Rava said: without “broken,” you cannot say that a crack in the location of flesh, is a blemish. As, if enter your mind it is a blemish, since said “ garav ” this is earthenware [ ḥeres ], a crack as it is written “And its appearance is deeper than the skin” It is similar to the appearance of sun that deeper than the shade,
llm_translation: Rava said: Without a break, a blemish is not found. You said, "Earthenware in the place of flesh is a blemish," for if it were your intention, it would be a blemish. Since he said "garav" - this is earthenware, from "michratz charitz," as it is written: "And his appearance was deeper than the skin," like the appearance of the sun, deep from the shade.

hebrew_text: וְלִיכְתֹּב רַחֲמָנָא ״חָרוּץ״ וְלָא בָּעֵי ״גָּרָב״, וְאָמֵינָא: ״חָרוּץ״ דְּלָא מְאִיס — הָוֵי מוּמָא, ״גָּרָב״ דִּמְאִיס — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״גָּרָב״ לְמֵימַר דְּחָרוּץ בִּמְקוֹם בָּשָׂר — לָא הָוֵי מוּמָא.
human_translation: And let the Merciful One write: Crack, and not need garav , and I say: cracked, which is not repulsive, is a blemish, garav , which is repulsive, not all the more so the Merciful One writes garav , to say that a crack in the location of flesh is not a blemish.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And to write 'charutz' and not 'garav,' and I say: 'charutz' that is not despised — it is a blemish, 'garav' that is despised — not even more so? The Merciful One wrote 'garav' to say that if it is charutz in a place of flesh — it is not a blemish."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ מוּם גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה. כְּאַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר, חָרוּץ דּוּמְיָא דְּשָׁבוּר לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: You have no blemish greater than that, not state like Abaye, we do not say cracked is similar to broken.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: You have no greater blemish than this. Like Abbaye did not say, a broken shard is not considered equal to a whole vessel.

hebrew_text: כְּרָבָא נָמֵי לָא אָמַר, דִּילְמָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא מִינַּכְרָא, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּמִינְּכַר — ״מוּם רָע״ קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: also not state like Rava, perhaps where it is not conspicuous. But where it is conspicuous, we call it “an ill blemish”
llm_translation: As Ravah said, perhaps where it is not recognizable, but where it is recognizable, it is called a "blemish."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס בְּכוֹר הוּא וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ, אוֹ דִילְמָא סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, וְ״אִם תִּימְצָא לוֹמַר״ קָאָמַר — אִם תִּימְצָא לוֹמַר בְּכוֹר הוּא, הֲרֵי מוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ!
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael obvious to him a hermaphrodite is firstborn and with its blemish, Or perhaps is uncertain and he says If you say. if you say is a firstborn, with its blemish,
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rava: What is the reason for Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? Perhaps Androginos is a firstborn and his blemish is with him, or maybe there are doubts that cause uncertainty, and "if you can say" he is saying — if you can say he is a firstborn, then his blemish is with him!

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִילְקֵא עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם גִּיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה, אִי נָמֵי לְמִיתְּבֵהּ לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: What is the difference to being flogged on account of due to shearing and labor Alternatively, to giving it to a priest.
llm_translation: For what purpose does it emerge? For the act of sprinkling upon it due to shearing and labor, or alternatively for it to be given to a priest.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי אִילְעַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס בְּכוֹר הוּא, וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ! וְדִילְמָא ״אִם תִּימְצָא לוֹמַר״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Ilai says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: A hermaphrodite is a firstborn, and with its blemish. Learn from obvious to Rabbi Yishmael But perhaps he said If you say,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Ilai says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: Androgynos is a firstborn, and his blemish is with him. Learn from it a clear proof! Perhaps it is saying, "If you find him."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: זָכָר — וְלֹא נְקֵבָה. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לְמַטָּה ״זָכָר״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְהוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: Come hear “A male” But not a female. When it says below, “A male” as no the verse to state Why the verse state to exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: zakhar - v'lo nekevah. K'shehu omer lematah 'zakhar', she'ein Talmud lomar, mah Talmud lomar? Lehotzi tumtum v'androginos." English translation: "Come and hear: male - and not female. When he says below 'male', that there is no Talmud to say, what Talmud to say? To exclude the tumtum and androgynos."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא — סְפֵיקָא הוּא, וְאָתֵי קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי סְפֵיקָא?
human_translation: Whose If we say the first tanna is uncertain, But a verse come to exclude uncertainty?
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna? If you say the first Tanna - it is a doubt, and does the verse come to exclude doubts?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי מֵחַד קְרָא נָפְקִי, דְּהָא גַּבֵּי בְּכוֹר חַד ״זָכָר״ הוּא דִּכְתִיב, (קא) [וְקָא] מְמַעֲטִי כּוּלְּהוּ מִינַּיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Rather, the latter Rabbis derived from one verse As with regard to a firstborn, it is one “male” alone that is written, exclude all from
llm_translation: Rather, the Rabbis derived it from one verse, for regarding a firstborn, it is written "male," and thereby they exclude all other types!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, פְּשִׁיטָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ — הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ — אִצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי סְפֵיקָא?
human_translation: Rather, obvious Rabbi Yishmael. And granted, if you say obvious to Rabbi Yishmael that is a verse was necessary to exclude But if you say is uncertain necessary the verse to exclude uncertainty?
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious, Rabbi Yishmael, and if you say in peace Rabbi Yishmael from obviousness obvious to him — that is, that it requires a verse for exclusions, rather if you say it is uncertain to him — it requires a verse for uncertain exclusions?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי, וְגַבֵּי בְּכוֹר תַּרְתֵּי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיב: ״הַזָּכָר״ וְ״הַזְּכָרִים״.
human_translation: Actually, the latter Rabbis, And With regard to a firstborn two verses written: “Males” “That is a male”
llm_translation: The sages always hold in the latter case, and regarding the firstborn animals, two verses are written: "the male" and "the males."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְטוּם — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל סְפֵיקָא הוּא, וְקָדוֹשׁ מִסְּפֵיקָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: does not firstborn Rav Ḥisda says: dispute to a hermaphrodite, But with regard to a tumtum , everyone agrees it is an uncertain And consecrated due to uncertainty,
llm_translation: The sages say: He is not a firstborn. Rav Ḥisda said: The dispute is in the case of an androgynos, but in the case of a tumtum - everyone's words are a doubt, and holy due to the doubt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בַּעֲרָכִין יֵעָרֵךְ?
human_translation: Rava said to If that is so, with regard to valuations, it should be valuated,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Rather, from now on, should he evaluate in appraisals?

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: ״הַזָּכָר״ — וְלֹא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס! סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: Why, is taught the male” but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite? Omit from a tumtum ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Alma tanya: 'hazachar' — v'lo tumtum v'androgynos! Semi mikkan tumtum." English translation: Why is it taught: "the male" — and not a tumtum or an androgynos! Learn from here a tumtum.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא בְּעֵרֶךְ אִישׁ, אֲבָל יְהֵא בְּעֵרֶךְ אִשָּׁה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַזָּכָר... אִם נְקֵבָה״, וְלֹא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס! סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: Come hear might shall not be the valuation of a man, but shall be the valuation of a woman. the verse states: “The male,” if a female, but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, Omit from a tumtum ,
