llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: Can it be that there should not be a distinction between a man, but there should be a distinction between a woman? The Talmud teaches us to say: 'male... if female,' and not hermaphrodites and androgynous! From here is the proof of a hermaphrodite."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אִם זָכָר אִם נְקֵבָה״ — זָכָר וַדַּאי נְקֵבָה וַדָּאִית, וְלֹא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: Come hear “Whether male or female” a definite male a definite female, but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite. Omit from a tumtum .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: 'Im zachar im nekevah' — zachar vada'i nekevah vada'it, v'lo tumtum v'androgynos. Semi mikkan tumtum." English translation: "Come and hear: 'Whether male or female' — male is definitely male, and female is definitely female, not intersex or androgynous. The proof is from here: intersex."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הַזָּכָר״ — וְלֹא נְקֵבָה. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לְמַטָּהּ ״זָכָר״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר; מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְהוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: Come hear “A male” But not a female. When it says below, “A male” as no the verse to state Why the verse state to exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite, Omit from a tumtum .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'male' — and not female. When he says to her 'male,' there is no Talmudic teaching; what teaching is there? To exclude hermaphrodites and tumtum. The source is from here: tumtum."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַנֶּעֱבָד, וְהַמּוּקְצֶה, וְהָאֶתְנַן, וְהַמְּחִיר, וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — כּוּלָּן מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה.
human_translation: Come hear that is worshipped or one set aside or one payment or one the price and a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, they all render garments ritually impure with the throat
llm_translation: Come and hear: The ne'evad, and the muktzeh, and the etnan, and the mecheir, and tumtum and androgynos — all of them render garments susceptible to ritual impurity in the house of swallowing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס אֵין מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה״ אַתָּה מוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס מִבֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, it does not render the garments ritually impure in the throat, As Rabbi Eliezer would say: Wherever it is stated “Male,” and: “Female,” you exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite from among them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Tumtum and Androgynos do not render garments susceptible to impurity in the house of swallowing, for Rabbi Eliezer used to say: In every place where it is stated "male and female," you exclude Tumtum and Androgynos from among them.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹף, הוֹאִיל וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה״, אֵין אַתָּה מוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס מִבֵּינֵיהֶם! סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: But a bird since “male” and “female” are not stated with regard to it, you do not exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite from among them, Omit from a tumtum .
llm_translation: And bird, since it was not stated regarding it "male and female," you do not bring out tumtum and androgynous from among them! Smi from here tumtum.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַטְּרֵיפָה, וְהַכִּלְאַיִם, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — לֹא קְדוֹשִׁים וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Elazar says: An animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], and diverse kinds and born by caesarean section, a tumtum or a hermaphrodite do not become consecrated and do not render consecrated
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Elazar says: A treifah, and a castrated animal, and a hermaphrodite, a tumtum, and an androgynous - they are neither holy nor sanctify.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא קְדוֹשִׁים בִּתְמוּרָה, וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּמוּרָה! סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם.
human_translation: And Shmuel says They do not become consecrated by substitution, And they do not render consecrated to render a substitute Omit from a tumtum .
llm_translation: And Samuel said: Not holy in exchange, and not sanctifying to do an exchange! Semai from here is confused.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: חֲמִשָּׁה לֹא קְדוֹשִׁים וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַטְּרֵיפָה, וְהַכִּלְאַיִם, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, וְטוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם — הָווּ לְהוּ אַרְבָּעָה! אַפֵּיק טוּמְטוּם, וְעָיֵיל יָתוֹם.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Elazar says: five do not become consecrated and do not render consecrated, and they are: A tereifa , and diverse kinds and born by caesarean section, and a tumtum , and a hermaphrodite. And if you would say: Here too, omit from this a tumtum , there are four Remove a tumtum and insert an orphan,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Elazar says: Five are not holy and do not sanctify, and these are they: a treifah, a kilayim, a yotzei dofen, a tumtum, and an androgynos. And if you should say here it is stated "tumtum" — there would be four! Remove "tumtum" and bring in "orphan."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי? רַבִּי אִילְעַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס בְּכוֹר הוּא וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין קְדוּשָּׁה חָלָה עָלָיו. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״הַזָּכָר״, וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״זָכָר״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְהוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: Let us say is the subject of tanna’im . Rabbi Ilai says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: A hermaphrodite is a firstborn, and with its blemish; and the Rabbis say: It is not imbued with sanctity. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: states: “Males” and wherever it is stated: Male,” to exclude only a tumtum and a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim? Rabbi Ilai says in the name of Rabbi Ishmael: Androgynos is a firstborn and his blemish is with him, and the sages say: holiness does not apply to him. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Behold, he says "male," and wherever it says "male," it is only to exclude tumtum and androgynos.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: סְמִי מִיכָּן טוּמְטוּם, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה הַיְינוּ רַבָּנַן! אֶלָּא לָאו טוּמְטוּם אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אֵין קְדוּשָּׁה חָלָה עָלָיו אַאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, אֲבָל טוּמְטוּם סְפֵיקָא הוּא וְקָדוֹשׁ מִסְּפֵיקָא, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן
human_translation: And if you would say: omit from a tumtum , Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda is the Rabbis, Rather, not between them a tumtum , as the first tanna , holds: It is not imbued with sanctity, to a hermaphrodite, but a tumtum is an uncertain and it is sacred due to uncertainty. And Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Smay from here is Tumtum, Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda are the Rabbis!" Rather, there is no Tumtum between them, for the first Tanna holds: Androginos is not susceptible to holiness, but Tumtum is a doubt and holiness is a doubt, and Rabbi Shimon came.

hebrew_text: בֶּן יְהוּדָה לְמֵימַר: טוּמְטוּם בְּרִיָּה הוּא וְלֹא קָדוֹשׁ! לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טוּמְטוּם בִּבְרִיָּה לָא מְסַפְּקָא, זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה הוּא דִּמְסַפְּקָא.
human_translation: ben Yehuda comes to say: A tumtum is entity, and it is not sacred No, everyone with regard to a tumtum is entity there is no doubt Where doubt is a male or a female.
llm_translation: Son of Judah said in the name of Maimar: Tumtum is a creature and not holy! No, for everyone in the world, a Tumtum in a creature is not in doubt, it is male and female, which is in doubt.

hebrew_text: מֵטִיל מַיִם בִּמְקוֹם זַכְרוּת — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּזָכָר הוּא, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמֵטִיל מַיִם בְּמָקוֹם נַקְבוּת: מָר סָבַר חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא נֶהֶפְכָה זַכְרוּתוֹ לְנַקְבוּתוֹ, וּמַר סָבַר לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. כִּי הָא דְּהוֹרָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בִּבְהֵמָה מֵטִיל מַיִם בְּמָקוֹם נַקְבוּת — חוּלִּין.
human_translation: urinates from the place of the male everyone agrees that it is a male. When they disagree of urinates from the place of the female Sage, holds we are concerned perhaps its male was inverted toward its female And Sage, holds we are not concerned in accordance with that which Rabbi Elazar ruled: With regard to animal urinates from the place the female non-sacred,
llm_translation: He who pours water in a place of memory - the entire world does not dispute that it is permissible, for they only dispute when one pours water in a place of a cavity: one Sage thought we should be concerned that perhaps its male status will be transformed into female status, and the other Sage thought we should not be concerned. For this is what Rabbi Elazar taught: with regard to an animal, if one pours water in a place of a cavity - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּהֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאן דְּלָא חָשׁ לְתַנָּא קַמָּא וּלְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? וְלֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָמֵי: מַאן דְּלָא חָשׁ לְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי? דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְטוּם — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל סְפֵיקָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan wondered Who who is not concerned about the first tanna and about Rabbi Yishmael, And let Rabbi Yoḥanan also say: Who who is not concerned about the latter Rabbis as Rav Ḥisda says: dispute to a hermaphrodite; but with regard to a tumtum , everyone agrees it is an uncertain
llm_translation: Let it be with him, Rabbi Yochanan: Whoever does not pay attention to the first Tanna and to Rabbi Yishmael? And let Rabbi Yochanan also say: Whoever does not pay attention to the Rabbis in the latter generations? For Rav Chisda said: Dispute in Androginos, but in Tumtum - everyone's words are uncertain!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, אִי לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, לֵימָא הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי? הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: מַאן שָׁבֵיק תְּרֵי וְעָבֵיד כְּחַד!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan does not hold of Rav Ḥisda; If Rabbi Yoḥanan does not hold Let him say that said in accordance with the latter Rabbis. That is indeed what he is saying: Who who leaves two and acts in accordance with one
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan does not agree with Rabbi Chisda. If he does not agree with him, should we say that he follows the opinion of the later scholars? This is also what he meant: Who leaves two and makes them as one!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כְּמַאן סָבְרַהּ? כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא אָמְרוּ טוּמְטוּם סָפֵק אֶלָּא בְּאָדָם, הוֹאִיל וְזַכְרוּתוֹ וְנַקְבוּתוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד, אֲבָל בְּהֵמָה — מֵטִיל מַיִם בְּמָקוֹם זַכְרוּת זָכָר, מֵטִיל מַיִם בְּמָקוֹם נַקְבוּת נְקֵבָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, in accordance with whose he hold? in accordance with that which Reish Lakish says: said that a tumtum is an uncertain only with regard to a person, since the male and the female are in one place, But animal, urinates from the place the male a male; urinates from the place of the female a female.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, according to whom does he hold? Like this that Reish Lakish said: They only said "Tumtum Safek" regarding a person, since his male and female organs are in one place, but regarding an animal - if one pours water in the place of the male organ of a male animal, or in the place of the female organ of a female animal.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא נֶהֶפְכָה זַכְרוּתוֹ לְנַקְבוּתוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא?!
human_translation: Rav Oshaya objects to this: And let us be concerned perhaps its male was turned round to its female said to him: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who is concerned about the minority
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Oshaya raised an objection: But should we not be concerned that perhaps his memory will be transformed into a female memory? He said to him: According to whom? According to Rabbi Meir, who is concerned about a minor detail?!

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חֲנַנְיָא בַּר אָבִין דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי. אִית דְּאָמַר אִישְׁתַּנִּי, וְאִית דְּאָמַר לָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rav Ḥananya bar Avin both say: You even say the Rabbis, since has changed changed There are who say changed, and there are who say changed not
llm_translation: Abaye son of Avin and Rav Chananya son of Avin both said: Even if you were to say they are scholars, since each one has his own opinion. There is one who says "he has his own opinion," and there is one who says "he does not have his own opinion."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי וְלָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי תַּנָּאֵי? דְּתַנְיָא: טוּמְטוּם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ — קִדּוּשָׁיו קִדּוּשִׁין, נִתְקַדֵּשׁ — קִדּוּשָׁיו קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Let us say changed or not changed, tanna’im . As it is taught a tumtum who betrothed betrothal is a betrothal, was betrothed betrothal is a betrothal
llm_translation: Let's say it was taught and not taught, who taught it? As it was taught: If it was sealed when sanctified - its sanctity is sealed; if it was opened when sanctified - its sanctity is open.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹלֵץ, וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמְיַבְּמִים לְאִשְׁתּוֹ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵשֶׁת טוּמְטוּם חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: And performs ḥalitza , And performs ḥalitza with the wife of or enters into levirate marriage with the wife of And it is taught another The wife of a tumtum performs ḥalitza and does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: "And he performs chalitzah, and they perform chalitzah for his wife, and they perform yibum for his wife. And it was taught in another place: A wife of a mute performs chalitzah but is not subject to yibum."

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: סְרִיס חַמָּה לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: assumed that everyone in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: A eunuch naturally, does not perform ḥalitza and does not enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: They thought, that everyone is like Rabbi Akiva, who said: "A eunuch of the sun does not perform chalitzah nor does he perform levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹלֵץ, וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וּמְיַבְּמִים אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, לָא אָמְרִינַן הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי;
human_translation: What, is it not disagree about this, that the one who says performs ḥalitza and performs ḥalitza with the wife of or enters into levirate marriage with the wife of we do not say since changed changed
llm_translation: What is the reason he does not engage in halitzah with her? Because whoever says "halitzah" and they perform halitzah with his wife and they do yibum with his wife, we do not say, "Since he has given his wife, he has given his wife."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת, אָמְרִינַן הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי?
human_translation: And the one who says performs ḥalitza and does not enter into levirate marriage we say since changed, changed,
llm_translation: The one who says "Chalitzah" and not "Yibum," we say: Since she has refused, let her refuse.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָמְרִינַן הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי, הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְהָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: No; everyone we say since changed, changed, this Rabbi Eliezer, and that Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Not, that all the world we say since and he taught, he taught, this Rabbi Eliezer, and this Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — הָא וַדַּאי סָרִיס מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And who is the tanna in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva If we say Rabbi Yehuda, he deems him a definite eunuch
llm_translation: And who is the Tanna according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva? If you say Rabbi Yehuda - but surely a eunuch invalidates it!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם שֶׁנִּקְרַע וְנִמְצָא זָכָר — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַחְלוֹץ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּסָרִיס!
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: a tumtum who was torn and he was found a male, must not perform ḥalitza , because he is like a eunuch
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: If a tumtum that was torn open is found to be male - this one may not be circumcised, because he is like a eunuch!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם לֹא חוֹלֵץ, שֶׁמָּא יִקָּרַע וְיִמָּצֵא סָרִיס חַמָּה.
human_translation: Rather, it is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, As it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A tumtum does not perform ḥalitza perhaps will be torn and he will be found a eunuch naturally,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, it is, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: "A concealed blemish is not removed, lest it tear and a eunuch be found."

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ כֹּל דְּמִיקְּרַע זָכָר מִשְׁתְּכַח, נְקֵבָה לָא מִשְׁתְּכַח? שֶׁמָּא קָאָמַר, שֶׁמָּא יִקָּרַע וְיִמָּצֵא נְקֵבָה.
human_translation: Is that to say every whose was torn is found a male not found a female? said Perhaps, perhaps he will be torn and found a female,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Atu kol de'mikra zakẖar mishtekẖaḥ, nekevah lo mishtekẖaḥ? Shema ka'amar, shema yiḵara ve'yimmatze nekevah." English translation: "Now, anyone who is called male is forgotten, but is a female not forgotten? Perhaps it means, perhaps a female will be called and found."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי זָכָר נָמֵי, שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא סָרִיס חַמָּה. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Alternatively, a male, also perhaps he will be found a eunuch naturally. what is between Rava said:
llm_translation: If he is indeed male, then he is male; perhaps a eunuch of the sun will be found. What is the difference between them? Rava said:

hebrew_text: לִפְסוֹל בִּמְקוֹם אַחִים,
human_translation: with regard to disqualifying in a case brothers.
llm_translation: To disqualify in the place of brothers,

hebrew_text: וְלַחְלוֹץ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם אַחִים, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And between their with regard to performing ḥalitza in a case where there are no brothers
llm_translation: And to remove not in the place of brothers, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ עַל אֵלּוּ מוּמִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding these blemishes.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מוּמִין אֵלּוּ , בֵּין קְבוּעִין בֵּין עוֹבְרִים — פּוֹסְלִין בָּאָדָם, וְיָתֵר עֲלֵיהֶן: הַכִּילוֹן, וְהַלַּפְתָּן, וְהַמַּקָּבָן, וְשֶׁרֹאשׁוֹ שָׁקוּט, וּסְקִיפַת.
human_translation: these blemishes whether permanent or transient, they disqualify in a person, And in addition to those One whose is pointed, and one whose is turnip-like, and one whose is hammer-like, and whose head an indentation; and wherein the back of his head protrudes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Mumim, these are, whether they are permanent or temporary - disqualify in a person, and more than them: the bald one, the smooth one, the hunchback, one whose head is sunken, and the one with a wound."

hebrew_text: וּבַעֲלֵי חֲטָרוֹת — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִין. הַקֵּרֵחַ פָּסוּל. אֵיזֶהוּ קֵרֵחַ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ שִׁיטָה שֶׁל שֵׂעָר מוּקֶּפֶת מֵאוֹזֶן לְאוֹזֶן, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And those with humped Rabbi Yehuda deems fit and the Rabbis deem disqualified. The kere’aḥ is disqualified What is a kere’aḥ ? anyone who does not have a row of hair encircling from ear to ear. If he has that fit
llm_translation: Owners of a razor — Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid, and the Sages deem it invalid. The bald one is invalid. Who is considered bald? Anyone who does not have a hairline encircling from ear to ear. If he has one — he is considered valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? וְהָאִיכָּא יַבֶּלֶת, דְּלָא כְּתִיב בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּאָדָם! וְתוּ: דַּק תְּבַלּוּל, דְּלָא כְּתִיבִי בִּבְהֵמָה!
human_translation: Why But there is a wart, which is not written in the Torah with regard to a person And furthermore, a cataract a tevallul , which are not written with regard to an animal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, ammai? Vehaikka Yavelet, de'lo k'tiv b'orayta b'adam! Ve'tu: dak tevalul, de'lo k'tivi b'beheima!" English translation: "Gemara, why? But there is the Yavelet, for it is not written in the Torah regarding a person! And furthermore: 'a fine flour offering,' for it is not written regarding an animal!"

hebrew_text: מֵילָף יָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: בָּאָדָם לֹא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ יַבֶּלֶת, בַּבְּהֵמָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר דַּק תְּבַלּוּל, מִנַּיִן לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְאֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גָּרָב״ ״גָּרָב״, ״יַלֶּפֶת״ ״יַלֶּפֶת״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: are derived from one another, as it is taught In a person, it is not stated of him a wart in an animal, it is not stated a cataract a tevallul From where applies that which is said of this to that and that which is said of this to that The verse states: “Scabbed” “scabbed,” “scurvy” “scurvy,” to a verbal analogy
llm_translation: From where do we derive that one may mix the statement of one with the statement of another? The verse states: "Gerav Gerav, Yalafet Yalafet" to equate the decree.

hebrew_text: מַפְנֵי, דְּאִי לָא מַפְנֵי, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: אָדָם מִבְּהֵמָה לָא יָלֵיף, שֶׁכֵּן הִיא עַצְמָהּ קְרֵיבָה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ; בְּהֵמָה מֵאָדָם לָא יָלְפָא, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בְּמִצְוֹת.
human_translation: free, As, if they are not free, can be refuted cannot derive a person from an animal, because itself is sacrificed upon the altar. cannot derive an animal from a person, since was included in mitzvot.
llm_translation: Because if not because, there is to distinguish: a man from an animal does not ascend, for so it is its bone close to the altar; an animal from a man does not ascend, for so it has multiplied in commandments.

hebrew_text: לָאיֵי, אַפְנוֹיֵי מַפְנֵי, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״יַלֶּפֶת״ וְלָא בָּעֵי ״גָּרָב״, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה יַלֶּפֶת דְּלָא מְאִיסָא הָוֵי מוּמָא, גָּרָב דִּמְאִיס לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? ״גָּרָב״ ״גָּרָב״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Indeed, are free. Let the Merciful One write scurvy and unnecessary a scab I would say: And if scurvy, which is not repulsive, is blemish, a scab, which is repulsive, not all the more so “scabbed” “scabbed,” which the Merciful One writes why do I to free
llm_translation: To Aiyei, because of Afnoyei, to write "Yalpeit" and not "Garav," and I say: And what is Yalpeit that if it is not despised it is a blemish, Garav that is despised, all the more so? "Garav" "Garav" that the Merciful One wrote, why do I need it? For Afnoyei.

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתְּבִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא כּוּלְּהוּ בְּחַד, וְגָרָב וְיַלֶּפֶת הָכָא וְהָכָא, וְלֵילְפוּ מֵחֲדָא!
human_translation: But let the Merciful One write all the with regard to one and a scab and scurvy here and here, and let be derived from one,
llm_translation: To write them, the Merciful One combined all of them into one, and He scraped and attached here and there, and they emerged from one.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא בְּהֵי לִיכְתֹּב רַחֲמָנָא? אִי כְּתַב בְּאָדָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כֹּל דְּפָסוּל בְּאָדָם פָּסוּל בִּבְהֵמָה, קָלוּט וְחוּטִין דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּאָדָם, בִּבְהֵמָה נָמֵי לָא לִיפַּסְלוּ.
human_translation: To which in which should the Merciful One write If written with regard to a person I would say: All that disqualify in a person disqualify in an animal. closed and gums, which are not with regard to a person In an animal as well they should not disqualify.
llm_translation: Ahayya asked: Is it possible for the Merciful One to write? If it were written in a person, I would say: Anyone who is disqualified in a person is disqualified in an animal; things that are absorbed and threads that are not absorbed in a person, in an animal they are not disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא כּוּלְּהוּ בִּבְהֵמָה, הָוֵה אָמֵינָא: כֹּל דְּפָסוּל בִּבְהֵמָה פָּסוּל בְּאָדָם, גִּבֵּן וְחָרוּם דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בִּבְהֵמָה — בְּאָדָם נָמֵי לָא לִיפַּסְלוּ.
human_translation: And Let the Merciful One write all with regard to an animal, I would say: All that disqualify in an animal disqualify in a person. a gibben , or a ḥarum , which are not with regard to an animal In a person as well they should not disqualify.
llm_translation: To write, "The Merciful One included all in the category of animals," I would say: I would say: Anyone who is disqualified in an animal is disqualified in a human. A castrated man or a eunuch, who are not found among animals, are indeed not disqualified in a human.

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתְּבִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא כּוּלְּהוּ בְּחַד, וְהָנָךְ דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּאִידַּךְ — לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בִּבְהֵמָה, וְהָנָךְ דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּאִידַּךְ — לִכְתּוֹב בְּאָדָם, וְגָרָב וְיַלֶּפֶת — הָכָא וְהָכָא, וְלֵילְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: But Let the Merciful One write all of them in one and those that are not for the other, let the Merciful One write with regard to an animal, and those that are not for the other, let write with regard to a person. And a scab and scurvy here and there, and let be derived from one another.
llm_translation: To write them all together in one, and where you do not write them together — to write in an animal, and where you do not write them together — to write in a human, and a raven and a young dove — here and here, and do not differentiate between them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כְּתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כׇּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִשְׁנֵית — לֹא נִשְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Every passage that was stated and repeated was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
llm_translation: Rather, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any portion that was stated and repeated - it was only repeated for the sake of a matter that was newly introduced therein.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא מוּם בְּאָדָם, מוּם בְּקָדָשִׁים, מוּם בִּבְכוֹר?
human_translation: Rava says: Why do I the Merciful One to write a blemish in a person, a blemish in sacrificial a blemish in a firstborn
llm_translation: Rava said: Why do I need that the Merciful One wrote a blemish in a person, a blemish in holy things, a blemish in firstborns?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מוּם בְּאָדָם, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבָּה בְּמִצְווֹת. אָדָם מִבְּכוֹר בְּהֵמָה לָא אָתֵי, שֶׁכֵּן הוּא עַצְמוֹ קָרֵב לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: necessary. As, had the Merciful One written a blemish in a person, since was included in mitzvot. cannot derive a person from a firstborn animal, since it itself is sacrificed upon the altar.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if the Merciful One wrote a blemish in a person, so too did He increase in commandments. A person does not come from the firstborn of an animal, for he himself is close to the altar.

hebrew_text: קָדָשִׁים מִבְּכוֹר לָא אָתֵי, שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מֵרֶחֶם.
human_translation: cannot derive sacrificial from a firstborn since sanctity of from the womb,
llm_translation: Holy things do not come from the firstborn, for its holiness is from the womb.

hebrew_text: אָדָם מִקֳּדָשִׁים לָא אָתֵי, שֶׁכֵּן הֵן עַצְמָן קְרֵיבִין. בְּכוֹר מִקֳּדָשִׁים לָא אָתֵי, שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ מְרוּבָּה.
human_translation: cannot derive a person from sacrificial as themselves are sacrificed. cannot derive a firstborn from sacrificial as the sanctity is greater
llm_translation: Man from sanctities not comes, for so they themselves close. Firstborn from sanctities not comes, for so his holiness is greater.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי? מֵהֵי תֵּיתֵי?! לָא לִכְתֹּב רַחֲמָנָא בִּבְכוֹר, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ? מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתָן מְרוּבָּה, וְנוֹהֲגִין בִּפְשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: one cannot be derived from one. let one be derived from two. From which should be derived? Let the Merciful One not write that a firstborn and derive from these, What about these? in that their sanctity is greater Moreover, apply to regular,
llm_translation: One from one does not come, to give one from two? Give from two?! Not to write "compassion" in the firstborn, and to give from elsewhere? What from elsewhere? What is their elsewhere that their holiness is greater, and they are treated simply.

hebrew_text: בְּקָדָשִׁים, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ? מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן קְדוּשָּׁתָן מֵאֲלֵיהֶן!
human_translation: sacrificial and derive from these What about these? in that their sanctity is automatic
llm_translation: In holy things, and you derive benefit from them? What about deriving benefit, since their holiness is greater than them!

hebrew_text: בְּאָדָם, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ? מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן הֵן עַצְמָן קְרֵיבִין לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ! צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: a person and derive from these What about these? in that they themselves are sacrificed upon the altar, are necessary,
llm_translation: In man, and you give from Hanoch? What to Hanoch that their bones are brought close to the altar! Necessary.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עֲלֵיהֶן בְּאָדָם. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כֹּל אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ מוּם מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן״, אִישׁ שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: in addition to those to a person From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said: that the verse states: “No man among the seed of Aaron the priest who has a blemish a man who is equal among the seed of Aaron,
llm_translation: Excess over them in man. From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: "Any man in whom there is a blemish shall not come near to offer the food of his God" - a man who is equal in his seed to that of Aaron.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין מוּמָא לְשֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן? אִיכָּא מִשּׁוּם אַחוֹלֵי עֲבוֹדָה: מוּמָא מַחֵיל עֲבוֹדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״מוּם בּוֹ וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל״, שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן לָא מַחֵיל עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: What is there between blemish he is not equal among the seed of Aaron? There is with regard to profaning service. blemish profanes service as it is written: “He has a blemish; that he not profane who is not equal among the seed of Aaron not profane service
llm_translation: What is the difference between a blemished priest and one who is not fit for the service of the altar? There is a difference due to the concerns of the Temple service: a blemished priest permits the service, as it is written: "He has a blemish, he shall not desecrate" (Leviticus 21:17), whereas one who is not fit for the service of the altar, from the descendants of Aaron, does not permit the service.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, וּמִשּׁוּם מַרְאִית הָעַיִן? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: What is there between he is not equal among the seed of Aaron, and due to the appearance of There is between them a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: What is the difference between one that is not fitting for the seed of Aaron, and due to the appearance of the eye? There is a difference between them - action.

hebrew_text: כִּילוֹן — דְּדָמֵי רֵישֵׁיהּ לְאַכְלָא, ״לַפְתָּא״ — דְּדָמֵי רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַדְגָּלִידָא דְּלִיפְתָּא, תָּנָא: וְצַוָּארוֹ עוֹמֵד בְּאֶמְצַע רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: One whose is pointed [ kilon ], whose head resembles the cover of a barrel, One whose is turnip-like, whose head resembles the top of a turnip, taught And his neck stands in the middle of his head,
llm_translation: Kilon - whose blood is for consumption, "Lapta" - whose blood is for the gizzard of the bird called Lapta, a Tanna taught: "And his neck stands in the middle of his head."

hebrew_text: מַקָּבָן — דְּדָמֵי רֵישֵׁיהּ לְמַקָּבָן, ״וְשֶׁרֹאשׁוֹ שָׁקוּט״ — מִלְּפָנָיו, ״וּסְקִיפָת״ — מֵאֲחוֹרָיו, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: שְׁקִיל פִּיסָּא. תָּנָא: וְצַוָּארוֹ שָׁקוּט וְשָׁמוּט. ״שָׁקוּט״ — דַּחֲבִיס מִחְבָּס, ״שָׁמוּט״ — דַּאֲרִיךְ וּשְׁמִיט.
human_translation: One whose is hammer-like [ makkavan ], whose head resembles a hammer, And whose indented [ shakut ], in the front of his And wherein the back of his head protrudes [ sekifat ] from the back of his as people say: A piece has been taken [ shakil pisa ]. taught And whose neck is short, or is narrow, a short whose is hidden a narrow whose is long and narrow.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Makaban - dedamei reishei l'makaban, "ve'sherosho shakut" - milfanav, "u'skifat" - me'achorav, kid'amri inashei: shakil pisa. Tanah: ve'tzavarav shakut ve'shamut. "Shakut" - dachavis m'chavas, "shamut" - da'arich u'shemit.

hebrew_text: וּבַעֲלֵי חֲטָרוֹת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כּוּ׳. דְּאִית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּפָסְלָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ עֶצֶם: מָר סָבַר — הָא אֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, וּמָר סָבַר — קִרְקוּרָא דְּבִישְׂרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And those with humped Rabbi Yehuda where there is a bone in everyone agrees that disqualified They disagree when there is no bone. Sage, holds this is not equal among the seed of Aaron and Sage, holds it is merely a piece of flesh
llm_translation: Owners of a needle, Rabbi Yehuda says: If it has a bone in it, everyone agrees that it is not disqualified. When do they disagree? When it does not have a bone in it. One Master holds: This is not similar to the seed of Aaron. And one Master holds: It is merely a common occurrence in the world.

hebrew_text: הַקֵּרֵחַ פָּסוּל. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין לוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו וְיֵשׁ לוֹ לְפָנָיו, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו — כָּשֵׁר, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵין לוֹ לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: the kere’aḥ , is disqualified Rava says: taught only if he does not have in the back his but he has in the front. But he has in the back, fit And all the more so, when he has in the back but he does not have in the front
llm_translation: The bald one is disqualified. Rava said: They only said this when he has no hair behind but has hair in front, but if he has hair behind - he is valid, and certainly if he has hair behind and no hair in front.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי אַסֵּיפָא, וְאִם יֵשׁ לוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו וְאֵין לוֹ לְפָנָיו, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּין לְאַחֲרָיו בֵּין לְפָנָיו — פָּסוּל, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לְפָנָיו וְאֵין לוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו, וּדְאֵין לוֹ כְּלָל — דְּפָסוּל.
human_translation: And there are those who teach with regard to the latter clause And if he has that fit Rava says: taught only when he has in the back but he does not have in the front. But he has both in the back and in the front, disqualified And all the more so, who has in the front and does not have in the back, or who does not have at all, disqualified.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches in the latter part, and if he has knowledge — this one is valid. Rava said: They only taught this when he has knowledge for those after him and not for those before him, but if he has knowledge both for those after him and for those before him — he is invalid, and all the more so if he has knowledge for those before him and not for those after him, and he has nothing at all — he is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַקַּרְחָנִין וְהַנַּנָּסִין וְהַזַּבְלְגָנִין — פְּסוּלִין, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן שָׁוֶה בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן. קַרְחָנִין — תְּנֵינָא! נַנָּסִין — תְּנֵינָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The bald and the dwarves, and the leaky disqualified since they are not equal among the seed of Aaron. bald we learn dwarves, we learn
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The Karchanin, the Nannasin, and the Zavleganin - disqualified, because they are not similar to the seed of Aharon. Karchanin - we have learned! Nannasin - we have learned!

hebrew_text: זַבְלְגָנִין אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן, וּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא מִשּׁוּם מַרְאִית הָעַיִן.
human_translation: It was necessary for him to teach us leaky And lest you say due to the appearance
llm_translation: "Zavleganin is needed for us to hear, and what if you say because of the appearance of the eye."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מִשּׁוּם מַרְאִית הָעַיִן (אִיתְנָא) [מִיתְנָא] קָתָנֵי, וְשֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ רִיסֵי עֵינָיו פָּסוּל מִפְּנֵי מַרְאִית הָעַיִן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: תָּנֵי חֲדָא, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: But anywhere that due to the appearance tanna teaches And one whose eyelashes have fallen out is disqualified due to the appearance lest you say taught one but the same is true with regard to all of
llm_translation: The Gemara: And this, wherever there is a concern of "mar'it ha'ayin" (it was taught) it was taught, and if the hairs of his eyes are entangled, he is disqualified due to "mar'it ha'ayin"! Lest you say: Teach one, and it is the same for all.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מִיהְדָּר וּמִיתְנָא, קָא הָדַר וְתָנֵי: וְשֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ שִׁינָּיו פָּסוּל מִשּׁוּם מַרְאִית הָעַיִן! אֶלָּא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַקַּרְחָנִין וְהַנַּנָּסִין וְהַזַּבְלְגָנִין כְּשֵׁרִים, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ פָּסוּל אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם מַרְאִית הָעַיִן.
human_translation: But anywhere that there is repeats and teaches repeats and teaches And one whose teeth fell out is disqualified due to the appearance Rather, to exclude that which is taught as it is taught The bald the dwarves, and the leaky are fit and said disqualified only due to the appearance
llm_translation: And this, wherever there is a dwelling and a teaching, he returns and teaches: And if his teeth were removed, he is disqualified because of the appearance of the eye! Rather, to go out from what was taught, as it was taught: The bald ones, the toothless, and the bald ones are valid, and they did not say they are disqualified except because of the appearance of the eye.

hebrew_text: מַאן הַאי תַּנָּא? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״הַכֹּהֲנִים״ — לְרַבּוֹת הַקַּרְחָנִין.
human_translation: Who is this tanna It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: the priests, to include the bald
llm_translation: Who is this Tanna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: "The priests" - to include the bald ones.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין לוֹ גְּבִינִין, אוֹ אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא גְּבִין אֶחָד — זֶהוּ גִּבֵּן הָאָמוּר בְּתוֹרָה. רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: (שֶׁגְּבִינִין) [שֶׁגְּבִינָיו] שׁוֹכְבִין. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי גַּבִּין וּשְׁתֵּי שִׁדְרָאוֹת.
human_translation: has no eyebrows, or he has only one eyebrow, that is the gibben that is stated in the Torah Rabbi Dosa says: whose eyebrows lie Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: who has two backs and two spines.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one does not have cheeses, or if he only has one cheese - this is the cheese mentioned in the Torah. Rabbi Dosa says: that his cheeses are lying down. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: that he has two cheeses and two whey vessels.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְגִבֵּן — דְּאֵין לוֹ מַשְׁמַע? וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״גִּבֵּן״ — שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ גְּבִינִין הַרְבֵּה, אֵין לוֹ גְּבִינִין, אוֹ אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא גְּבִין אַחַד — מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ גִבֵּן״. אָמַר רָבָא: זֶהוּ מִדְרָשׁ ״אוֹ גִּבֵּן״.
human_translation: But gibben mean who does not have And raises a contradiction a gibben who has many eyebrows. who has no eyebrows or who has only one eyebrow, from where The verse states: “Or a gibben .” Rava said this is the exposition “or a gibben .”
llm_translation: Gemar and Gibben - that he does not have a hearing? And they raised a dilemma: "Gibben" - that he has many cheeses, he does not have cheeses, or he only has one cheese - from where? The Talmud teaches to say: "Or Gibben." Rava said: This is the interpretation of the verse "Or Gibben."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּחָיֵי? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: הַמַּפֶּלֶת בְּרִיָּה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ שְׁנֵי גַּבִּין וּשְׁתֵּי שִׁדְרָאוֹת, וְאָמַר רַב: בָּאִשָּׁה — אֵינוֹ וָולָד, בַּבְּהֵמָה — אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says to say that living? But it was stated one who miscarries an entity that has two backs and two spines, and Rav said in a woman is not an offspring, in an animal prohibited for consumption.
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: What is the ruling regarding the fetus of a living creature? And it was stated: A creature that has two backs and two spinal columns, and Rav said: In a human - it is not considered a viable offspring, in an animal - it is forbidden for consumption!

hebrew_text: כְּבָר רְמָא נִיהֲלֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא לְרַב, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁימִי אֶת! אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁשִּׁדְרָתוֹ עֲקוּמָּה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya already raised this contradiction to Rav, and said to him: you Shimi? but to whose spine is crooked,
llm_translation: As Rabbi Shimi son of Hiyya was conversing with Rav, he said to him: "Shimi, eat!" Rather, in his sixteenth year he stood up.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָרוּם פָּסוּל. אֵיזֶהוּ חָרוּם? הַכּוֹחֵל שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו כְּאַחַת. שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה, וּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה, עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה, רוֹאֶה אֶת הַחֶדֶר וְאֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה כְּאֶחָד, סָכֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ, וְהַזַּגְדָּן, וְהַצַּיְרָן, וְשֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ רִיסֵי עֵינָיו — פָּסוּל מִפְּנֵי מַרְאִית הָעַיִן.
human_translation: The ḥarum is disqualified What is a ḥarum ? one who paint both of his eyes as one, both of one’s eyes above or both of his eyes below; one of his eyes above and one of his eyes below; he sees the room and the upper story as one, look at the sun; and one whose eyes are different; and one whose eyes tear constantly, And one whose eyelashes have fallen out disqualified due to the appearance
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person with a "cherum" is disqualified. Who is considered "cherum"? One whose two eyes are equal. His two eyes are level, and his two eyes are level, one eye is upward and one eye is downward, he sees the room and the upper story as one, cataracts, and a cataract, and a film, and if the lashes of his eyes are entangled - he is disqualified due to the appearance of the eye.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״חָרוּם״ — שֶׁחוֹטְמוֹ שָׁקוּעַ, חוֹטְמוֹ סוֹלֵד, חוֹטְמוֹ בּוֹלֵם, חוֹטְמוֹ נוֹטֵף, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ חָרוּם״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין ״חָרוּם״ אֶלָּא הַכּוֹחֵל שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו כְּאַחַת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הִפְלַגְתָּ,
human_translation: The Sages taught a ḥarum whose nose is sunk. his nose retreats, his nose blocked, his nose droops, from where The verse states: “Or a ḥarum .” Rabbi Yosei says: A ḥarum is only one who paint both of his eyes as one. They said to him: You have gone far
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Cherum" - one who seals it, seals it with a hammer; one who seals it, solders it; one who seals it, inflates it; one who seals it, drips it. From where? The Talmud teaches: "Or cherum." Rabbi Yosei says: "Cherum" is only the weasel that has two eyes as one. They said to him: You have divided.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ כּוֹחֵל שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: even if he does not paint both of his eyes as one,
llm_translation: Even though he does not have the ability to see with both his eyes as one.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה. מָה ״שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה״ ״שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה״? אִילֵּימָא שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה — דְּחָזֵי לְמַעְלָה, שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה — דְּחָזֵי לְמַטָּה, עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה — דַּחֲזַאי עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה, הַיְינוּ ״רוֹאֶה אֶת הַחֶדֶר וְאֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה כְּאֶחָת״!
human_translation: both of his eyes below, What both of his eyes above both of his eyes below? If we say Both of his eyes above, that he gazes upward, Both of his eyes below, that gazes downward, one of his eyes above and one of his eyes below that he gazes one of his eyes downward and one of his eyes upward. this is sees the room and the upper story as one.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shetay einav lemat'a. Mah 'shetay einav lema'alah' 'shetay einav lemat'a'? Ileima shetay einav lema'alah - dechazei lema'alah, shetay einav lemat'a - dechazei lemat'a, einav achat lema'alah ve'einav achat lemat'a - dachazai einav achat lemat'a ve'einav achat lema'alah, hainu 'ro'eh et hacheder ve'et ha'aliyah ke'achat'!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה — דְּקָיְימָן לְמַעְלָה, שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה — דְּקָיְימָן לְמַטָּה, עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה — דְּקָיְימִי עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה, וְקָיְימִי כְּסִדְרָן נָמֵי, וְרוֹאֶה אֶת הַחֶדֶר וְאֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: Rather, Both of his eyes above, where are situated above Both of his eyes below, where are situated below one of his eyes above and one of his eyes below where one of his eyes is situated above and one of his eyes below. And are situated in their arrangement as well, but he sees the room and the upper story as one,
llm_translation: Rather, his two eyes are above - he stands above, his two eyes are below - he stands below, one eye above and one eye below - he stands with one eye above and one eye below, and he stands in their proper order, and he sees the room and the upper chamber as one.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּעֵינוֹ — כׇּל מָה שֶׁבְּעֵינוֹ, מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה, שְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה, עֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְעֵינוֹ אַחַת לְמַטָּה, וְרוֹאֶה אֶת הַחֶדֶר וְאֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה כְּאֶחָת, אוֹ שֶׁמְּדַבֵּר עִם חֲבֵירוֹ וְאַחֵר אוֹמֵר: לִי רוֹאֶה.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught “in his eye” any that is in his eye From here stated: both of his eyes below both of his eyes above, one of his eyes above and one of his eyes below, he sees the room and the upper story as one, or when he speaks with his friend another says: He is looking at me,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei milei? D'tanu rabanan: Be'eino - kol mah shebe'eino, mikkan amru: shtei einav le'mata, shtei einav le'ma'alah, eino achad le'ma'alah ve'eino achad le'mata, ve'ro'eh et hacheder ve'et ha'aliyah ke'achat, o she'medaber im chaverav ve'acher omer: li ro'eh." English translation: "What are these matters? The Rabbis taught: In his eye - whatever is in his eye, from here they said: his two eyes below, his two eyes above, one eye above and one eye below, and he sees the room and the upper floor as one, or if he is speaking with his friend and another says: 'I see.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עִוֵּר — בֵּין סוֹמֵא בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו, בֵּין סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו. חֲוַרְוָור וְהַמַּיִם הַקְּבוּעִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ עִוֵּר״.
human_translation: The Sages taught a blind man [ iver ] whether blind in both of his eyes or blind in one of his eyes. pale spots or tears that are constant, from where The verse states: “A blind man [ ish iver ].”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Blind - whether blind in both eyes, or blind in one of his eyes. How do we know that a hole and water that is fixed in the ground are considered a valid ritual bath (mikveh)? The Talmud teaches: "A man who is blind."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִישׁ״, ״עִוֵּר״, ״דַּק״, ״תְּבַלּוּל״, ״בְּעֵינוֹ״? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עִוֵּר״ מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ כְּלָל, אֲבָל חֲוַרְוָור וְהַמַּיִם הַקְּבוּעִין דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בֵּיהּ — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִישׁ״.
human_translation: Rava says: Why do I the Merciful One to write “man,” “blind,” “cataract,” “ tevallul ,” “in his eye” are necessary, as had the Merciful One written “blind,” because are not in at all, But pale spots or tears that are constant, where are in not the Merciful One wrote “man”
llm_translation: Rava said: Why do I need that the Merciful One wrote "man," "blind," "fine," "confusion," "in his eyes"? I need it, for if the Merciful One had written "blind" alone, because He did not include them all, but the hole and the fixed water that are included in it - no, the Merciful One wrote "man."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִישׁ״ — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קָא חָזֵי כְּלָל, אֲבָל מַחְסוֹרַיְיתָא — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״דַּק״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״דַּק״ — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְחַסְּרָן, אֲבָל מְבַלְבְּלִיתָא — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״תְּבַלּוּל״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “man,” because he cannot see at all. But impaired not the Merciful One wrote “cataract” And had the Merciful One written a cataract because impaired. But mixed, not the Merciful One wrote “ tevallul .”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "אִישׁ" - because it does not appear as a general term, but "מַחְסוֹרַיְיתָא" - no, the Merciful One wrote "דַּק". And if the Merciful One wrote "דַּק" - because it is lacking, but "מְבַלְבְּלִיתָא" - no, the Merciful One wrote "תְּבַלּוּל".

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״תְּבַלּוּל״ — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְבַלְבְּלָן, אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם מְשַׁנְּיוּתָא — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּעֵינוֹ״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “ tevallul ,” because mixed. But not due to a deviation the Merciful One wrote “in his eye.”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "tevalul" - because they confuse, but because of a change - no, the Merciful One wrote "be'eino."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכָּךְ, כֹּל מֵחֲמַת כַּהְיוּתָא — אָתְיָא מֵ״אִישׁ״, מַחְסוֹרַיְיתָא — מִ״דַּק״, מְבַלְבְּלִיתָא — מִ״תְּבַלּוּל״, מְשַׁנְּיוּתָא — מִ״בְּעֵינוֹ״.
human_translation: Rava says: Therefore, all on account of dimness, are derived from “man.” impairment from “cataract.” intermingled from “ tevallul .” deviations from “in his eye.”
llm_translation: Rava said: Therefore, all due to existence — comes from "ish" (man), due to deficiency — from "dak" (thin), due to confusion — from "tebulul" (mud), due to change — from "be'eino" (in his eyes).

hebrew_text: סָכֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״סָנֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ״. זַגְדְּיָין. מַחְוֵי רַב הוּנָא: חַד מִדִּידַן וְחַד מִדִּידְהוּ, וְאִיקְּפַד רַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: look at the sun [ sakhei shemesh ] Rav Yosef taught hate the sun [ sanei shemesh ], one whose eyes are different Rav Huna pointed one ours and one theirs. And Rav Yehuda took offense.
llm_translation: "Sukkah of the sun." It was taught by Rav Yosef: "Hatred of the sun." Zagdayin. Rav Huna said: One from our side and one from their side, and Rav Yehudah was strict.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שָׁכְבָנָא — שֶׁגְּבִינָיו שׁוֹכְבִים, זַגְדּוֹם — אֶחָד שָׁחוֹר וְאֶחָד לָבָן. תַּנָּא: כֹּל זוּגָא דְּלָא שָׁוֵי לַהֲדָדֵי, ״זַגְדּוֹם״ קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection a shekhavna whose eyebrows lie shokhvim one whose eyes are different [ zagdum ] one black and one white. any pair that are not identical to one another, tanna calls different.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: "Shakvanah" - when his ribs are lying, "Zagdom" - one black and one white. It was taught: Any pair that is not equal in color, is not considered a pair; it is called "Zagdom."

hebrew_text: הַצַּיְרָן. עֵינָיו תְּרוּטוֹת, וְצִירָנִיּוֹת, דּוֹמְעוֹת, דּוֹלְפוֹת, טוֹרְדוֹת.
human_translation: one whose eyes tear constantly His eyes, droop or round; tear, stream flow
llm_translation: The Tzayran. His eyes are protruding, and his eyelashes are dripping, flowing, and tearing.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא: הַזִּדֵּיר וְהַלּוּפְיָן (וְהַתָּמִיר) [וְהַתִּימְיָן]. זִוֵּיר — דִּמְזַוַּר עֵינֵיהּ, לוּפְיָן — דִּנְפִישִׁין זִיפֵיהּ, (תָּמִיר) [תִּימְיָן] — שֶׁתַּמּוּ (זִיפִין) [זִיפָיו]. וְהָנֵי גַּבֵּי מוּמִין תָּנוּ לְהוּ? וְהָתְנַן: שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ רִיסֵי עֵינָיו פָּסוּל מִפְּנֵי מַרְאִית הָעַיִן! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאִשְׁתְּיוּר גַּרְדּוּמֵי, הָא דְּלָא אִישְׁתְּיוּר גַּרְדּוּמֵי.
human_translation: The zadir , and the lupin , and the tamir Zadir whose eyes are strange. Lupin with an abundance of eyelashes. Tamir to one whose eyelashes are depleted. And teach these with blemishes? But didn’t we learn One whose eyelashes have fallen out is disqualified due to the appearance not difficult. This where the roots remain, that where the roots do not remain.
llm_translation: Mishna: One who is meticulous and one who is negligent (and one who is meticulous). Meticulous - who trims his eyes, negligent - who lets his hair grow long, (meticulous) - who trims (his hair). And these blemishes, do they render him unfit? But didn't we learn: If the eyelashes of his eyes were plucked out, he is disqualified because of the appearance of the eye! It is not difficult: this refers to eyelashes that are plucked out, and that refers to eyelashes that are not plucked out.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֵינָיו גְּדוֹלוֹת כְּשֶׁל עֵגֶל, אוֹ קְטַנּוֹת כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז. גּוּפוֹ גָּדוֹל מֵאֵבָרָיו, אוֹ קָטָן מֵאֵבָרָיו. חוֹטְמוֹ גָּדוֹל מֵאֵבָרָיו, אוֹ קָטָן מֵאֵיבָרָיו. הַצִומֵּם וְהַצִּומֵּעַ — אֵיזֶהוּ צִומֵּעַ? כֹּל שֶׁאׇזְנָיו קְטַנּוֹת, וְהַצִּומֵּם — כֹּל שֶׁאׇזְנָיו דּוֹמוֹת לִסְפוֹג. שְׂפָתוֹ הָעֶלְיוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה עוֹדֶפֶת עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּם. וְשֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ שִׁינָּיו — פָּסוּל מִפְּנֵי מַרְאִית הָעַיִן.
human_translation: eyes are large like those of a calf or small like those of a goose; his body is large to his limbs or small to his limbs; his nose is large to his limbs or small to his limbs, the tzomem and the tzome’a What is a tzome’a ? anyone whose ears are small. And the tzomem ? anyone whose ears are similar to a sponge. his upper lip protrudes beyond the lower lower protrudes beyond the upper that is a blemish. And one whose teeth fell out is disqualified due to the appearance
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "His eyes are large like those of a calf, or small like those of a goose. His body is large compared to his limbs, or small compared to his limbs. His nose is large compared to his limbs, or small compared to his limbs. If his nostrils are closed or pinched - what is considered pinched? Any person whose ears are small, and his nostrils are pinched - anyone whose ears resemble a sponge. If his upper lip protrudes over his lower lip, and his lower lip protrudes over his upper lip - this is a blemish. And if his teeth are missing - he is disqualified due to the appearance of his eye."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּפְרֹשׂ אֶת הָאֹהֶל עַל הַמִּשְׁכָּן״, מִי פְּרָשׂוֹ? מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ פְּרָשׂוֹ, וּכְתִיב: ״עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת אוֹרֶךְ הַקָּרֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rav says: Moses, our teacher, was ten ammot as it is stated: “And he spread the tent over the Tabernacle” Who spread Moses, our teacher, spread it, and it is written “Ten ammot shall be the length of a board”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Rabbi said: Moses our teacher was ten cubits tall, as it is stated: 'And he spread the tent over the Tabernacle.' Who spread it? Moses our teacher spread it, and it is written: 'The length of each board was ten cubits.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא לְרַב: אִם כֵּן עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם! דִּתְנַן: גּוּפוֹ גָּדוֹל מֵאֵבָרָיו אוֹ קָטָן מֵאֵבָרָיו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁימִי! בְּאַמָּה שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said to Rav: If so, you have rendered Moses, our teacher, a blemished as we learned one’s body is large to his limbs or small to his limbs, said to him: Shimi, said in cubit [ amma ] of a board
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shimi bar Chiya said to Rav: "If so, you have made our teacher Moses blemished!" For we learned: "If his body is larger than his limbs or smaller than his limbs." He said to him: "Shimi! I am speaking about a cubit of holiness."

hebrew_text: חוֹטְמוֹ גָּדוֹל וכו׳. תָּנָא: כְּאֶצְבַּע קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: one’s nose is large taught of small finger.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "ḥoṭmo gadol vekhu. Tanā: ke'etsba' qetannah." English translation: "His nostril is large, etc. It was taught: Like a small finger."

hebrew_text: הַצִּומֵּם וְהַצִּומֵּעַ. תָּנָא: אַף הַצִּימֵּחַ. לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי ״צִימֵּחַ״, שְׁמַעוּ לְהָהוּא טַיָּיעָא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר: ״מַאן דְּבָעֵי צִימֵּחַ״, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח גַּדְיָא חֲזִיזָא.
human_translation: the tzomem and the tzome’a taught The tzime’aḥ also The Sages did not know what a tzime’aḥ They heard a certain Arab who was saying: Who wants a tzime’aḥ , and it was found a long-eared goat.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The one who prunes and the one who cuts off. It was taught: Also the one who trims. The Rabbis did not know what 'trimming' means. Listen to that argument that was stated: 'Whoever wants to trim,' and a young goat was found."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: עֵז שֶׁאֵין לָהּ קַרְנַיִם, וְרָחֵל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ קַרְנַיִם — כְּשֵׁרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: A female goat that has no horns and a female lamb that has horns are fit for upon the altar,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A goat that does not have horns, and a ewe that has horns - are valid for the altar.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כְּמוּמִין, וְאֵינָן כְּמוּמִין, וְשׁוֹחֲטִין עֲלֵיהֶם בְּמִקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: עֵז שֶׁאֵין (לוֹ) [לָהּ] קַרְנַיִם, וְרָחֵל שֶׁיֵּשׁ (לוֹ) [לָהּ] קַרְנַיִם, וְהַצִּימֵּחַ, וְהַצִּימֵּם, וְהַצִּימֵּעַ.
human_translation: this is also taught There are matters that like blemishes but they are not like blemishes, and slaughter on them in the Temple, but not in the country And these are A female goat that has no horns, and a female lamb that has horns, and the tzime’aḥ , and the tzomem , and the tzome’a .
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: There are things that are blemished and not blemished, and one may slaughter them in the Temple, but not in the provinces. And these are they: a goat that does not have horns, and a sheep that has horns, and the hermaphrodite, and the androgynous, and the tumtum.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: נִטְּלוּ קַרְנוֹתָן וְזַכְרוּתָן עִמָּהֶן — פְּסוּלָה, וְאֵין פּוֹדִין עֲלֵיהֶם. נִטְּלוּ טְלָפַיִים וְזַכְרוּתָם עִמָּהֶן — פְּסוּלִין, וְנִפְדִּין עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Ameimar says: the horns were removed, and their bones, with them, is unfit But one may not redeem on account of the hooves were removed, and their bones, with them, they are unfit and they are redeemed on account of
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Amemar: If their horns and their memories were removed with them - it is disqualified, and one does not redeem them. If their ornaments and their memories were removed with them - they are disqualified, and one redeems them.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נִטְּלוּ קַרְנַיִין וּטְלָפַיִין וְזַכְרוּתָן עִמָּהֶן — פְּסוּלִין וְנִפְדִּין עֲלֵיהֶן! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיתְעֲקוּר אִיתְעֲקוֹרֵי, הָא דְּאִיגּוּם אִיגּוֹמֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection the horns or the hooves were removed, and their bones with them, they are unfit and they are redeemed on account of them. not difficult. This where was uprooted, That where were cut
llm_translation: Challenger: They took the horns and the hooves and their memory with them - they are disqualified and redeemed upon them! It is not difficult: this one that is uprooted, its uprooting is effective, this one that is grafted, its grafting is effective.

hebrew_text: וּדְאִיגּוּם אִיגּוֹמֵי, פָּסוּל? וּרְמִינְהוּ: פָּרָה שֶׁקַּרְנֶיהָ וּטְלָפֶיהָ שְׁחוֹרִים — יָגוֹד! תַּרְגְּמַהּ זְעֵירִי: מֵעִילָּוֵי זַכְרוּת.
human_translation: But where were cut, unfit? And raises a contradiction heifer whose horns and hooves are black, one should cut Ze’eiri interpreted from above the bone
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if their tips are blunted, are they disqualified? And they raised a dilemma: If a cow has black horns and black eyelids — it is kosher! The translator rendered it as: From the remembrance of his cloak." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דַּדִּין שׁוֹכְבִין כְּשֶׁל אִשָּׁה, כְּרֵיסוֹ צָבָה, טִיבּוּרוֹ יוֹצֵא, נִכְפֶּה — אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת לְיָמִים, רוּחַ קְצָרָה בָּאָה עָלָיו, הַמְאוּשְׁבָּן, וּבַעַל גֶּבֶר.
human_translation: breasts sag like of a woman; one’s belly is swollen one’s navel protrudes; an epileptic, even once in while; who is afflicted with a melancholy temper; one whose scrotum is long; or one whose penis is long
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one lies with a woman like the thickness of a barleycorn, his act is considered complete, his impurity is discharged, and he is liable — even if it was only for one day. A short breath comes upon him, the one who is settled, and the husband of a woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: מַשְׁתִּינִין מַיִם בִּפְנֵי רַבִּים, וְאֵין שׁוֹתִין מַיִם בִּפְנֵי רַבִּים. וְתַנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מַשְׁתִּינִין מַיִם בִּפְנֵי רַבִּים, וְאֵין שׁוֹתִין מַיִם בִּפְנֵי רַבִּים. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לְהַשְׁתִּין מַיִם וְלֹא הִשְׁתִּין, וְנִמְצָא כְּרֵיסוֹ צָבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, says may urinate in public But they may not drink water in public, And this is also taught may urinate in public, but they may not drink water in public. And there was an incident involving one who sought to urinate, and he did not urinate, and his belly was found to be swollen.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Abba son of Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: We may draw water in public, but we may not drink water in public. And it was taught similarly: We may draw water in public, but we may not drink water in public. And there was an incident with one who needed to urinate but did not urinate, and his bladder burst.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִגְלָא, נְגַדוּ לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶתֵּן לָךְ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי וְזִיל אַהְדַּר עוֹבָדָא. אַתְּ — דְּאֶפְשָׁר לָךְ, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ — לִיסְתַּכַּן.
human_translation: was necessary for Shmuel on the Shabbat to the Festival. they spread a sheet for him. came before his father, said to him: I will give you four hundred dinars go retract incident, you you can who cannot for him, should he endanger
llm_translation: Samuel needed him on the Sabbath of the festival, opposite him a cloak, he came before his father, he said to him: I will give you four hundred zuz and go perform the task. You - if you can, if you cannot - be silent.

hebrew_text: מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אִיצְטְרִיךְ אַגּוּדָּא גַּמְלָא, אַשְׁתֵּין. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: חֲמָתָךְ קָאָתְיָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּאוּדְנַהּ.
human_translation: was necessary Mar bar Rav Ashi on the beams a bridge, urinated. They said to him: Your mother-in-law is coming. said to them: in her ear.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi needed a rope of camel hair, he said: two. They said to him: your anger is coming! He said to them: in its time.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי מִשּׁוּם עַלְקָא! בְּשׁוֹתֵת.
human_translation: And let me derive, due to a leech where drip
llm_translation: "And she shall be acquitted from the charge of adultery! When she drinks."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנֵי נְקָבִים יֵשׁ בּוֹ בָּאָדָם, אֶחָד מוֹצִיא שֶׁתֶן וְאֶחָד מוֹצִיא שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה אֶלָּא כִּקְלִיפַּת הַשּׁוּם. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָדָם נִצְרָךְ, אִם נִקְּבוּ זֶה לְתוֹךְ זֶה — נִמְצָא עָקָר.
human_translation: the Sages taught There are two orifices in a man. One expels urine and one expels semen, and there is only about a garlic peel between them. When a man needs if were punctured this into that he found barren,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There are two cavities in a person, one emits urine and one emits semen, and there is no difference between them except like the peel of garlic. When a person is in need, if these were punctured into each other, he is found to be sterile.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יִהְיֶה בְךָ עָקָר וַעֲקָרָה וּבִבְהֶמְתֶּךָ״? אֵימָתַי לֹא יִהְיֶה בְךָ עָקָר? בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״בִּבְהֶמְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “There shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your cattle” When will there not be a barren among you? At a time that among your cattle,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of the verse, "There shall be no barren male or female among you, or among your livestock"? When will there be no barren among you? When there is "among your livestock."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה בְךָ עָקָר״ — מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים, ״וַעֲקָרָה״ — שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא תְּפִלָּתֶךָ עֲקוּרָה לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם. אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁאַתָּה מֵשִׂים עַצְמְךָ כִּבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says, “There shall not be male barren among you” of students, “or female barren” that your prayers will not be barren, before the Omnipresent, when At a time when you place yourself an animal,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: "There shall be no 'akar' among you" - from the students, "ve'akarah" - that your prayer should not be uprooted before the Omnipresent. When? When you make yourself like an animal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא יַשְׁתִּין אָדָם מַיִם לֹא עַל כְּלֵי חֶרֶס, וְלֹא עַל מְקוֹם קָשֶׁה, דְּאָמַר רַב: הָנֵי מְדוֹרֵי דְּבָבֶל מְהַדְּרִי מַיָּא לְעֵין עֵיטָם. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָא אִיתְּתָא לָא תְּקוּם לְהֶדְיָא בְּאַנְפֵּי יָנוֹקָא, אַגִּיסָא לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: A person should not urinate either on an earthenware vessel or on a hard place, As Rav says: Those inclines of Babylonia return the water to the Spring of Eitam Abaye says: A woman should not stand openly in front of a child sideways, we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A person should not urinate neither on earthenware vessels, nor in a hard place, as Rav said: The residents of Babylon are careful to bring water to the Eye of Etam. Abbaye said: A woman should not squat in front of a child's cradle, as we do not have any merit in it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עַמּוּד הַחוֹזֵר מֵבִיא אָדָם לִידֵי הִדְרוֹקָן, סִילוֹן הַחוֹזֵר מֵבִיא אָדָם לִידֵי יֵרָקוֹן. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: דָּם רָבֶה — שְׁחִין רָבֶה, שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע רָבָה — צָרַעַת רָבָה, צוֹאָה רָבָה — הִדְרוֹקָן רָבֶה, מֵי רַגְלַיִם רָבִין — יֵרָקוֹן רָבֶה.
human_translation: is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A mass that is held back causes a person from dropsy [ hidrokan ], a stream that is held back causes a person from jaundice. Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rav Ketina says Reish Lakish says: blood increase boils increase semen increase leprosy increase feces increase dropsy increase urine increase jaundice increase
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A pillar that returns brings a person to the punishment of the stake, a lintel that returns brings a person to the punishment of stoning. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said, Rav Katina said, Reish Lakish said: Much bloodshed—much plague, much seminal emission—much leprosy, much spitting—much stake, much foot washing—much stoning.

hebrew_text: רוּחַ קַצְרִית בָּאָה עָלָיו. מַאי נִינְהוּ? תָּנָא: רוּחַ בֶּן נְפָלִים בָּאָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: who is afflicted with a melancholy temper What is this A tanna A fallen spirit, has come upon him.
llm_translation: A short spirit came upon him. What are they? It was taught: A spirit of a fallen angel came upon him.

hebrew_text: הַמְאוּשְׁבָּן וּבַעַל גֶּבֶר. תָּנָא: מְשׁוּבָּן בַּבֵּיצִים, וּבַעַל גֶּבֶר בַּגִּיד. תָּנָא: מְשׁוּבָּן — זֶה הַקַּיָּין, הַגְרַבְתָּן — זֶה בַּעַל קִיק; קַיָּין — בַּבֵּיצִים, גְּרַבְתָּא — בַּגִּיד.
human_translation: one whose scrotum is long [ me’ushban ] and one whose penis is long [ ba’al gever ] taught A meshuban with testicles, and a ba’al gever with penis. taught A meshuban , this is the kayyan . The garbetan , this is a ba’al kik . A kayyan of the testicles, a garbeta of the penis.
llm_translation: The one who is sitting and the master of a man. It was taught: "The one who is sitting with eggs, and the master of a man with sinew." It was taught: "The one who is sitting - this is the priest, the master of a man - this is the owner of a thigh; sitting - with eggs, sinew - with sinew."

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה? מַחְוֵי רַב יְהוּדָה: עַד רְכוּבָּה. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: עַד רְכוּבָּה — פָּסוּל, לְמַעְלָה מִן רְכוּבָּה — כָּשֵׁר. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: עַד רְכוּבָּה — כָּשֵׁר, לְמַטָּה מִן הָרְכוּבָּה — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And how much Rav Yehuda pointed Until knee. It is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: until knee disqualified above knee fit. Some say until knee fit, below the knee disqualified.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And until when? Like the statement of Rav Yehudah: until its rider. It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: until its rider - invalid; above its rider - valid. There are those who say: until its rider - valid; below its rider - invalid." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין לוֹ בֵּיצִים, אוֹ אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה ״מְרוֹחַ אָשֶׁךְ״ הָאָמוּר בְּתוֹרָה. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁנִּימּוֹחוּ אֲשָׁכָיו. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁרוּחַ בַּאֲשָׁכָיו. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁמַּרְאָיו חֲשׁוּכִין.
human_translation: one has no testicles, or he has only one testicle, that is mero’aḥ ashekh that is stated in the Torah Rabbi Yishmael says: anyone whose testicles were crushed. Rabbi Akiva says: anyone that wind in his testicles, Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: anyone whose appearance [ marav ] is dark [ ḥashukhin ].
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he has no testicles, or if he has only one testicle, this is "a crushed testicle" as mentioned in the Torah. Rabbi Yishmael says: Any case where his testicles are crushed. Rabbi Akiva says: Any case where there is a bruise on his testicles. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: Any case where his appearance is darkened.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הָא ״חֲסַר אָשֶׁךְ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי: שֶׁנִּמְרְחוּ אֲשָׁכָיו. קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הַאי ״מַמְרוֹחַ אָשֶׁךְ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי: שֶׁהָרוּחַ בַּאֲשָׁכָיו.
human_translation: difficult for Rabbi Yishmael: should have Ḥasar ashekh , teaches whose testicles were crushed. difficult for Rabbi Akiva: should have Mimro’aḥ ashekh , teaches who wind in his testicles.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara questions it to Rabbi Yishmael: This "missing your fire" what does he need it for! It was taught: that his feet were rubbed. It questions it to Rabbi Akiva: This "smelling your fire" what does he need it for! It was taught: that the wind entered his feet.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס: הַאי ״רוּחַ אָשֶׁךְ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי שֶׁמַּרְאָיו חֲשׁוּכִין, קָסָבַר גּוֹרְעִין וּמוֹסִיפִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: difficult for Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus: should have Ruaḥ ashekh , teaches whose appearance is especially dark. He holds subtract and add and interpret homiletically.
llm_translation: The difficulty was for Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus: This "wind of the east" he sought! It teaches: His nails are black, he believes in diminishing, adding, and interpreting.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ כּוּשִׁי! רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס לָא תָּנֵי ״כּוּשִׁי״.
human_translation: this is black, Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus does not teach black
llm_translation: This is the Kushite! Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus does not teach "Kushite."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַקִּישׁ בְּקַרְסוּלָּיו, וּבְאַרְכֻבּוֹתָיו,
human_translation: knock his ankles or his knees
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He compares it to his beams and to his boards.

hebrew_text: וּבַעַל הַפִּיקִים, הָעִיקֵּל. אֵיזֶהוּ הָעִיקֵּל? כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מַקִּיף פַּרְסוֹתָיו וְאֵין אַרְכֻּבּוֹתָיו נוֹקְשׁוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ. פִּיקָּה יוֹצֵא מִגּוּדָּלוֹ, עֲקֵיבוֹ יוֹצֵא לַאֲחוֹרָיו, פַּרְסוֹתָיו רְחָבוֹת כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז.
human_translation: and a ba’al happikim , the ikkel . What is the ikkel ? anyone who places his feet together and his knees do not knock into each other, a protuberance emerging the thumb of his whose heel emerges back his whose feet are wide like of a goose
llm_translation: The master of the orchard, he lightened. Who is the one who lightened? Anyone whose branches encompass his trunk and his branches are not entangled with each other. A branch goes out from its trunk, its top goes backward, its branches are wide like those of a goose.

hebrew_text: אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו מוּרְכָּבוֹת זוֹ עַל זוֹ, אוֹ קְלוּטוֹת לְמַעְלָה עַד הַפֶּרֶק — כָּשֵׁר, לְמַטָּה מִן הַפֶּרֶק וַחֲתָכָהּ — כָּשֵׁר, הָיְתָה בָּהּ יְתֶרֶת וַחֲתָכָהּ, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהּ עֶצֶם — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: whose fingers are configured one upon the other, or attached, above until the joint, fit. below the joint, and he cut fit. there was an extra on and he cut it, if contains a bone, disqualified and if no fit.
llm_translation: His fingers intertwined with each other, or overlapping above the knuckle - valid; below the knuckle and cut - valid. If there was an extra part and it was cut, if it has a bone - invalid, and if not - valid.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו, שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ — עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹסְלִין. הַשּׁוֹלֵט בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו — רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: an extra on his hands and on his feet, six on each twenty-four, Rabbi Yehuda deems fit and the Rabbis deem disqualified. who has control of both of his hands, Rabbi deems disqualified, and the Rabbis deem fit.
llm_translation: Excess in his hands and in his feet, six and six - twenty-four, Rabbi Yehuda deems it valid, and the sages disqualify it. One who holds with both his hands - Rabbi posits disqualification, and the sages deem it valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁבֶר רָגֶל — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁבֶר רֶגֶל, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת הַקִּישָׁן וְהָעִיקֵּל וְהַקִּילְבָּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ שֶׁבֶר רָגֶל״. תָּנָא: בַּעַל הַקִּיפִּין וְהַשּׁוּפְנָר. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּעַל הַפִּיקִּין — שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ כְּסָתוֹת הַרְבֵּה, שׁוּפְנָר — שֶׁאֵין לוֹ כְּסָתוֹת כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Broken-footed” I have only a broken leg From where to include the kishan , the ikkel ; and the kilvan The verse states: “Or broken-footed.” taught A ba’al hakippin and the shufnar Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A ba’al happikin who has large protuberances a shufnar who has no protuberances at all.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Shattered foot" - I only have "shattered foot," how do I know to include the "crushed," the "pulverized," and the "fractured"? The Talmud teaches: "Or a shattered foot." It was taught: The owner of the "kippin" and the "shufnar." Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The owner of the "pikkin" - who has many coverings, the "shufnar" - who has no essential coverings.

hebrew_text: פִּיקָּה יוֹצָא מִגּוּדָּלוֹ, וַעֲקֵיבוֹ יוֹצֵא לַאֲחוֹרָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שׁוֹקוֹ יוֹצֵא בָּאֶמְצַע רַגְלוֹ. פַּרְסוֹתָיו רְחָבוֹת כְּשֶׁל אַוָּוז. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא דִּטְרִיפָה וְלָא סְדִיקָא, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דִּטְרִיפָה, אַף עַל גַּב דִּסְדִיקָא.
human_translation: a protuberance emerging the thumb of his and whose heel emerges back his Rabbi Elazar says: his calf, emerges from the middle his foot. whose feet are wide like of a goose Rav Pappa says: Do not say that are flat and are not split. Rather, once are flat even though are split.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Pikah yotze mi'gudalo, va'akeivo yotze la'achorav." Amar Rabbi Elazar: "Shoko yotze ba'emtsa raglo. Parsotav rechavot k'shel avaz." Amar Rav Papa: "La teima d'tripa v'la sdika, ela keivan d'tripa, af al gav d'sdika." Translation: "The heel protrudes from his sandal, and his ankle from behind." Rabbi Elazar said: "His leg extends in the middle of his foot. His calves are wide like those of a goose." Rav Papa said: "Do not say 'tripa' and not 'sdika,' but once 'tripa,' even though 'sdika.'"

hebrew_text: אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו מוּרְכָּבוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, אוֹ קְלוּטוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שֶׁבֶר יָד״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁבֶר יָד.
human_translation: whose fingers are configured one upon the other, or attached, The Sages taught “Broken-handed” I have only a broken hand
llm_translation: His fingers intertwined this on that, or interlocked. The Rabbis taught: "A broken hand" - I have nothing except a broken hand.

hebrew_text: אֶצְבָּעוֹת מוּרְכָּבוֹת לְמַעְלָה אוֹ קְלוּטוֹת לְמַעְלָה מִן הַפֶּרֶק, וְהָאָמְרַתְּ כָּשֵׁר! אֶלָּא וְלֹא חֲתָכָן, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ שֶׁבֶר יָד״.
human_translation: his fingers are configured upon or attached above the joint and he cut them But didn’t you say fit? Rather, and he did not cut them. From where The verse states: “Or broken-handed.”
llm_translation: Fingers intertwined above or fingers intertwined below from the edge, and the statement is: "fit!" Rather, and not cut, from where? The Talmud teaches: "or a broken hand."

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה בּוֹ יְתֶרֶת וַחֲתָכָהּ, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהּ עֶצֶם — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּסְפֶּרֶת עַל גַּבֵּי הַיָּד.
human_translation: there was an extra on and he cut it, if contains a bone, disqualified and if not, fit. Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And this where it can be counted along the back of the hand
llm_translation: There was in it excess and it was cut, if there is in it bone — invalid, and if not — valid. Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: And this is when it is counted on the back of the hand.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יְתֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ עֶצֶם, וְאֵין בָּהּ צִפּוֹרֶן — מְטַמָּא בְּמַגָּע וּבְמַשָּׂא, וּמְטַמָּא בְּאֹהֶל, וְעוֹלָה לְמִנְיַן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּבְנִסְפֶּרֶת עַל גַּב הַיָּד.
human_translation: the Sages taught: an extra which contains a bone, it does not have a nail imparts ritual impurity through contact and by carrying and it imparts impurity in a tent, And included in the count of 125 Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And when it can be counted along the back of the hand
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: An extra bone that has marrow in it, but does not have a joint - it imparts impurity through contact and through carrying, and it imparts impurity in a tent, and it counts towards the total of one hundred and twenty-five. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: And it is considered with the bone of the hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּבָר זֶה רַבֵּינוּ הַגָּדוֹל אֲמָרוֹ, הַמָּקוֹם יִהְיֶה בְּעֶזְרוֹ: יְתֶרֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ עֶצֶם וְאֵין בָּהּ צִפּוֹרֶן — מְטַמָּא בְּמַגָּע וּבְמַשָּׂא, וְאֵין מְטַמָּא בְּאֹהֶל. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּבְשֶׁאֵינָהּ נִסְפֶּרֶת עַל גַּב הַיָּד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: This matter was stated by our great rabbi, may the Omnipresent to his assistance.
