An extra that contains a bone and does not have a nail imparts ritual impurity through contact and by carrying, but it does not impart impurity in a tent. Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And when it is not counted along the back of the hand
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This matter, our great Rabbi said: If there is a bone in it but no nail, it imparts impurity through contact and carrying, but does not impart impurity in a tent. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: And if it is not counted on the back of the hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָשׂוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם כְּדִבְרֵי נְבִיאוּת, מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי אֵבֶר הוּא — בְּאֹהֶל נָמֵי תְּטַמֵּא, וְאִי לָאו אֵבֶר הוּא — בְּמַגָּע וּבְמַשָּׂא נָמֵי לָא לִיטַמֵּי!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: rendered their statements like statements of prophecy, whichever way you If is a limb, it should impart impurity in a tent as well; and if it is not a limb, it also should not impart impurity through contact or by carrying.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: They made their words like the words of prophecy, what is your opinion? If it is a limb — in a tent it will become impure, and if it is not a limb — through contact and carrying it will not become impure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: מִשּׁוּם עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: because touched upon it, a bone a barley grain
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Rav Ika: They touched it due to a bone like a barleycorn.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִסְפֶּרֶת, אַטּוּ נִסְפֶּרֶת. אִי הָכִי, שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִסְפֶּרֶת בְּאֹהֶל נָמֵי תְּטַמֵּא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: decree that is not counted due to counted If so, that is not counted should impart impurity in a tent as well.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A decree that is not counted, eventually will be counted. If so, a decree that is not counted will render the tent impure!

hebrew_text: עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן הֶיכֵּירָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִישְׂרְפוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ תְּרוּמָה וְקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: The Sages implemented a distinction in order that will not to burn teruma , or consecrated on
llm_translation: The scholars should recognize, so that they do not mistakenly burn Terumah and holy items upon them.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: רוֹב בִּנְיָנוֹ וְרוֹב מִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל מֵת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רוֹבַע — טְמֵאִין. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ רוֹב בִּנְיָנוֹ? שְׁנֵי שׁוֹקַיִים וְיָרֵךְ אֶחָד, הוֹאִיל וְרוֹב גּוֹבְהוֹ בְּגָדוֹל. אֵיזֶהוּ רוֹב מִנְיָנוֹ? מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: we learned there A majority of the structure or a majority of the number dead even when there is not a quarter are impure. the Sages taught What is a majority of the structure two calves and one thigh, since a majority of the height of an adult. What is a majority of the number One hundred and twenty-five
llm_translation: We learned there: The majority of the structure and the majority of the contents of a corpse, even though it does not have a majority of a quarter - they are impure. The Sages taught: What is considered the majority of the structure? Two thighs and one leg, since the majority of its height is in the larger one. What is considered the majority of the contents? One hundred and twenty-five.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: תַּנָּא מִנְיָינָא אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְתַנְיָא: חָסֵר, שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא מָאתַיִם, וְיָתֵר, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מָאתַיִם וּשְׁמוֹנִים וְאֶחָד — כּוּלָּן עוֹלִין לְמִנְיַן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה, זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא דְאִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: tanna coming to teach us a number? teaches us as it is taught lacks has only 200 or extra has 281 all of them are included in the count of 125. follows the majority of people,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: From where do we derive this teaching? He is inferring for us as it was taught: If it is lacking, having only two hundred, and if it is in excess, having two hundred and eighty-one - all of them are included in the count of one hundred and twenty-five. Go and learn the majority of people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִידָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל שֶׁשָּׁלְקוּ זוֹנָה אַחַת שֶׁנִּתְחַיְּיבָה שְׂרֵיפָה לַמֶּלֶךְ, בָּדְקוּ וּמָצְאוּ בָּהּ מָאתַיִם וַחֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁנַיִם, אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא בְּאִשָּׁה בְּדַקְתֶּם, שֶׁהוֹסִיף לָהּ הַכָּתוּב שְׁנֵי צִירִים וּשְׁנֵי דְּלָתוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Shmuel says: an incident involving the students of Rabbi Yishmael, who boiled a prostitute who was sentenced by the king to burning, They examined and found she 252 said to them: Perhaps you examined a woman, as the verse added to her two hinges and two doors,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: There was an incident with the students of Rabbi Yishmael, where they brought forth one prostitute who was liable for burning by the king. They examined her and found in her two hundred and fifty-two coins. He said to them: Perhaps you have examined her in a woman, for the Scripture added to her two beams and two doorposts.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁצִּירִים לַבַּיִת — כָּךְ צִירִים לָאִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּכְרַע וַתֵּלֶד כִּי נֶהֶפְכוּ עָלֶיהָ צִרֶיהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁדְּלָתוֹת לַבַּיִת — כָּךְ דְּלָתוֹת לָאִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא סָגַר דַּלְתֵי בִטְנִי״.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Elazar says: Just as a house has hinges [ tzirim ], so too, a woman has hinges, as it is stated: “And she bowed herself and brought forth, for her pains [ tzireha ] came suddenly upon her” Rabbi Yehoshua says: Just as a house has doors, so too, a woman has doors, as it is stated: “Because it did not shut the doors of my womb”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar says: Just as beams are to a house, so are supports to a woman, as it is stated: "She crouched and gave birth, for her supports were overturned." Rabbi Yehoshua says: Just as doors are to a house, so are doors to a woman, as it is stated: "For he did not close the doors of my womb."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמַּפְתֵּחַ לַבַּיִת, כָּךְ מַפְתֵּחַ לָאִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּפְתַּח אֶת רַחְמָהּ״. לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קַשְׁיָא דְּתַלְמִידֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל! דִּלְמָא אַיְּידֵי דְּזוּטַר אִתְּמוֹחֵי מִתְּמַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Just as a key to a house, so too, a key to a woman, as it is stated: “And He opened her womb” involving the students of Rabbi Yishmael, a difficulty for Rabbi Akiva. Perhaps since small, it dissolved
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Just as the key is to the entrance of the house, so is the key to the woman, as it is stated: "And he opened her womb." Rabbi Akiva's students found a difficulty in this matter, for perhaps through this verse they will be comforted from their studies.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: וְכוּלָּן אֵין מְטַמְּאִין בְּאֹהֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֹאת הַתּוֹרָה אָדָם כִּי יָמוּת בְּאֹהֶל״, דָּבָר הַשָּׁוֶה לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rav says: And all of them, do not impart impurity in a tent, as it is stated: “This is the law: When a person dies in a tent” an item that is equal for all people,
llm_translation: Rav said: And all of them do not become impure in a tent, as it is stated: "This is the Torah when a man dies in a tent," a matter that is applicable to every man.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּבְאִישׁ לֵיכָּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״צִירִים אֲחָזוּנִי כְּצִירֵי יוֹלֵדָה״! צִירֵי בָשָׂר. וְהָכְתִיב: ״אֲדֹנִי בַּמַּרְאָה נֶהֶפְכוּ צִירַי״! הָכָא נָמֵי צִירֵי בָשָׂר. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, מָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? לָא בְּאִישׁ וְלָא בְּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: And are there no in a man? But isn’t it written: “Pangs [ tzirim ] have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman in travail” hinges of flesh, But isn’t it written: “My lord, by reason of the vision my pains [ tzirai ] come” Here too, hinges of flesh. So too, it is reasonable as if you do not say so, 248 how can you find Neither in a man nor in a woman.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: And in a man, is there a case? And it is written: "They have surrounded me like bees" - bees of flesh. And it is written: "My lords, in the appearance they have turned away" - here also referring to bees of flesh. This is reasonable, for if you do not say so, how do you account for the number 248? Not in a man and not in a woman.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, וַתְּהִי עוֹד מִלְחָמָה, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אִישׁ מָדוֹן אֶצְבַּע יָדָיו וְאֶצְבַּע רַגְלָיו שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ״, מָר סָבַר בִּגְנוּתֵיהּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי, וּמָר סָבַר בִּשְׁבָחֵיהּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי.
human_translation: an extra on his hands and on his feet, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: And both derived from one verse, “And there was again war and it is written “And there was a champion, who had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, Sage, holds speaks of negative Sage, holds speaks in his praise,
llm_translation: Excess in his hands and in his feet. Rabbi Yitzchak said: And both of them expounded one verse, and there was still war, and it is written: "And there was a man of strife from his fingers, his hands, and his feet six and six." One Master thought he was praised for his virtues, and one Master thought he was praised for his merits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מָה לִי דִּכְתִיב ״שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע מִסְפָּר״? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שֵׁית דִּידֵיהּ וְשֵׁית דְּכַרְעֵיהּ, כְּתַב ״עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע״. וְאִי כְּתַב ״עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הוּא חֲמֵשׁ מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וּשְׁבַע מֵהַאי גִּיסָא, כְּתַב ״שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ״. ״מִסְפָּר״ — בְּנִסְפֶּרֶת עַל גַּבֵּי הַיָּד.
human_translation: Rabba says: Why do I which is written six and six twenty-four in number”? are necessary, as, had the Merciful One written six and six, I would say six of his hand and six of his foot, wrote “twenty-four.” And had written “twenty-four,” I would say five on this side and seven on that side. wrote six and six. “in number” to were counted on the back of the hand.
llm_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason for it being written "six and six twenty and four number"? I need it, for if the Merciful One had written "six and six," I would say: six of its sides and six of its corners. He wrote "twenty and four." And if He had written "twenty and four," I would say: it is five from this angle and seven from that angle. He wrote "six and six." "Number" - with a sapphire on the back of the hand.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, יָתֵר בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו שֵׁשׁ וָשֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע. אָמַר לוֹ: כְּמוֹתְךָ יִרְבּוּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה? כָּךְ אָמַר לוֹ: כְּמוֹתְךָ יִתְמַעֲטוּ מַמְזֵירֵי וּנְתִינֵי מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: an incident involving one man who came before Rabbi Tarfon, extra on his hands and on his feet, six and six, twenty-four said to him: There should increase among the Jewish people like you, Rabbi Yosei said to a proof from there? This said to him: mamzerim and Gibeonites should be like you, they should decrease from the Jewish people.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident involving a certain man who came before Rabbi Tarfon, with sixty-six boils on his hands and feet. He said to him: May those like you increase among the people of Israel! Rabbi Yosei said to him: Is this a proper response? He said to him: May those like you decrease from the tax collectors and tribute collectors of Israel!

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹלֵט בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן — אִיטֵּר, בֵּין בַּיָּד בֵּין בָּרֶגֶל — פָּסוּל. הַשּׁוֹלֵט בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדָיו — רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וַחֲכָמִים מַכְשִׁירִין. מָר סָבַר — כְּחִישׁוּתָא אַתְחִלָא בְּיָמִין, וּמָר סָבַר — בְּרִיּוּתָא אַתְחִלָא בִּשְׂמֹאל.
human_translation: who has control of both of his hands, the Sages taught left whether hand or foot, disqualified one who has control of both of his hands, Rabbi deems disqualified and the Rabbis deem fit. Sage, holds a weakness began in right And Sage, holds a strength began in left
llm_translation: The one who holds with both his hands. The Rabbis taught: If he tied, whether with his hand or with his foot, it is invalid. The one who holds with both his hands - Rabbi disqualifies, and the sages validate. One Master holds - the strength is primarily in the right, and one Master holds - the strength is primarily in the left.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכּוּשִׁי, הַגִּיחוֹר, וְהַלַּבְקָן, וְהַקִּפֵּחַ, וְהַנַּנָּס, וְהַחֵרֵשׁ, וְהַשּׁוֹטֶה, וְהַשִּׁיכּוֹר, וּבַעֲלֵי נְגָעִים טְהוֹרִים — פְּסוּלִין בְּאָדָם וּכְשֵׁרִים בַּבְּהֵמָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹטָה מִן הַבְּהֵמָה אֵינָהּ מִן הַמּוּבְחָר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּעֲלֵי הַדִּלְדּוּלִין פְּסוּלִין בָּאָדָם וּכְשֵׁרִין בַּבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: the kushi , the giḥor , the lavkan , the kipe’aḥ , the dwarf, the deaf-mute, the imbecile, the drunk, and with ritually pure marks, disqualify a person and are valid, in an animal. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: An imbecile among animals is not optimal Rabbi Elazar says: Even with hangs disqualifies in a person and is valid in an animal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Kushite, the Gihor, the Lavkan, the Kippeach, the Nannas, the Cheresh, the Shotah, the Shikor, and those who are pure from skin diseases - they are disqualified in a person but are valid in an animal. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A Shotah from an animal is not of the elite. Rabbi Elazar says: Even those with diladulin are disqualified in a person but are valid in an animal.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כּוּשִׁי — אוּכָּמָא, גִּיחוֹר — חִיוָּורָא, לַבְקָן — סוּמָּקָא. אִינִי? וְהָא הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״מַאן בָּעֵי לוּקְיָאנֵי״, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח חִיוָּורָא! אֶלָּא: כּוּשִׁי — אוּכָּמָא, גִּיחוֹר — סוּמָּקָא, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״סוּמָּקָא גִּיחְיָא״, לַבְקָן — חִיוָּורָא, כְּהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״מַאן בָּעֵי לוּקְיָאנֵי״, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח חִיוָּורֵי.
human_translation: A kushi black, a giḥor white, lavkan red. Is that so? But a certain who said to Who wants a lukiyani and was found white. Rather, a kushi black; a giḥor red, as people say Giḥia red; a lavkan white, as that person who said: Who wants a lukiyani , and it was found white.
llm_translation: Gemar Kushi - Ukama, Gichor - Chivvara, Lavkan - Summaka. Ini? Veha hu da'amar lehu "Man ba'ei lukiyanai," ve'ishtakach Chivvara! Ela: Kushi - Ukama, Gichor - Summaka, kid'amri inashei: "Summaka gichya," Lavkan - Chivvara, keha hu da'amar lehu "Man ba'ei lukiyanai," ve'ishtakach Chivvarei.

hebrew_text: קִפֵּחַ. תָּנֵי רַב זְבִיד: גָּבוֹהַּ. אִינִי? וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִשְׁתַּבֵּחַ בְּבַעֲלֵי קוֹמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָנֹכִי הִשְׁמַדְתִּי אֶת הָאֱמֹרִי מִפְּנֵיהֶם אֲשֶׁר כְּגֹבַהּ אֲרָזִים גׇּבְהוֹ״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּאֲרִיכָא שְׁמִיטָה סַנְיָא.
human_translation: a kipe’aḥ Rav Zevid taught tall. Is that so, But didn’t Rabbi Abbahu teach: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, is praised through those of stature? As it is stated: “Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars” Rav Pappa said long, emaciated, ugly.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kipach. Tanei Rav Zevid: Gaboha. Ini? Ve'hatanei Rabbi Avahu: Minayin shehakadosh baruch hu mishtabech b'ba'alei koma, she'ne'emar: "Ve'anochi hishmadtí et ha'Emori mipneihem asher kegova arazim govho." Amar Rav Papa: Ba'aricha shemita sanya. English translation: Kipach. Rav Zevid taught: Its height. Is it not so? And Rabbi Avahu taught: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, praises the tall ones, as it is said: "And I destroyed the Amorite from before them, whose height was like the height of cedar trees." Rav Papa said: In a long sabbatical year, a dispute arises.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גָּבוֹהַּ לֹא יִשָּׂא גְּבוֹהִית — שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא מֵהֶן תּוֹרֶן, נַנָּס לֹא יִשָּׂא נַנֶּסֶת — שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא מֵהֶם אֶצְבָּעִי, לָבָן לֹא יִשָּׂא לְבָנָה — שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא מֵהֶם בּוֹהֵק, שָׁחוֹר לֹא יִשָּׂא שְׁחוֹרָה — שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא מֵהֶן טָפוּחַ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: tall should not marry tall, lest emerge from them extremely tall. a dwarf should not marry a dwarf, lest emerge from them exceptionally short. pale should not marry pale, lest emerge from them extremely pale. dark should not marry dark, lest emerge from them extremely dark.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: A tall one should not marry a tall woman, lest a crane come out of them. A short one should not marry a short woman, lest a finger come out of them. A white one should not marry a white woman, lest a leper come out of them. A black one should not marry a black woman, lest a bald one come out of them.

hebrew_text: הַחֵרֵשׁ, הַשּׁוֹטֶה, וְהַשִּׁכּוֹר. שִׁכּוֹר מַחֵיל עֲבוֹדָה, בַּהֲדֵי מוּמֵי דְּמַחֲילִי עֲבוֹדָה בָּעֵי לְמִיחְשַׁב!
human_translation: the deaf-mute, the imbecile, and the drunk drunk profanes the service, should have been counted together with blemishes that profane the service.
llm_translation: The deaf, the imbecile, and the drunkard. A drunkard invalidates labor, as it is through those with blemishes that they invalidate labor, he requires consideration!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁאָר דְּבָרִים הַמְשַׁכְּרִים. וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית, וְשָׁתָה חָלָב אוֹ דְּבַשׁ, נִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: through other intoxicating agents, And not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught ate figs from Ke’ila or drank milk or honey, entered the Sanctuary liable
llm_translation: In other matters that are purchased. And not like Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: If one ate a kezayit of a fat tail and drank milk or honey, and then entered the Temple - he is liable.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ כְּשֵׁרִין בָּאָדָם וּפְסוּלִין בַּבְּהֵמָה: אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ, טְרֵיפָה, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, וְשֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בָּהֶן עֲבֵירָה, וְשֶׁהֵמִית אֶת הָאָדָם.
human_translation: These do not disqualify a person but disqualify an animal itself and its offspring a tereifa ; born by caesarean section; with which a transgression was performed; and one that killed a person.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are valid in a person and invalid in an animal: that one and his son, a treifah, one who emits semen without ejaculation, one that was used for a sin, and one who killed a person.

hebrew_text: וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא נָשִׁים בַּעֲבֵירָה — פָּסוּל עַד שֶׁיַּדִּירֶנָּה הֲנָאָה, וְהַמִּטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים — פָּסוּל עַד שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל עָלָיו שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים.
human_translation: And who marries women by a transgression, disqualified until he vows benefit from her. And who becomes impure to corpses disqualified until he accepts upon himself that he will no become impure to corpses.
llm_translation: The one who marries women through transgression — disqualified until he divorces her for the sake of pleasure, and one who defiles himself for the dead — disqualified until he accepts upon himself not to defile himself for the dead.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאֵלּוּ כְּשֵׁירִין בָּאָדָם, מַאי (באותו) [״אוֹתוֹ] וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״?
human_translation: these do not disqualify a person what with regard to Itself and its offspring?
llm_translation: Gemara: And these are the things that are like songs in a person, what is "with him" and "with his son"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו, דִּכְוָתֵיהּ תַּיִישׁ וּבְנוֹ, מִי נָהֵיג? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ נוֹהֵג בִּנְקֵבוֹת, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בִּזְכָרִים! אֶלָּא תְּיָישָׁה וּבְנָהּ, דִּכְוָותַהּ הָכָא כֹּהֶנֶת וּבְנָהּ, כֹּהֶנֶת בַּת עֲבוֹדָה הִיא?
human_translation: If we say Aaron and his sons, in the corresponding goat and its offspring. does apply? But isn’t it taught itself and its offspring applies to female but it does not apply to males, Rather, goat and its offspring, in the corresponding here, a female priest and her son. is a female priest fit for service
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If we were to say that Aharon and his sons, whose lineage is pure, are fit to serve, what about Taiyish and his son, who are not of pure lineage? And it was taught in a Baraita: "He and his sons" are fit for service in the case of females, but are not fit for service in the case of males! Rather, Taiyish and his son, whose lineage is impure, here it is like the case of a Kohenet and her son, for she is a Kohenet by virtue of her service?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו, דִּכְוָותַהּ הָכָא תַּיִישׁ וּבְנוֹ. אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין: עֲדָא אָמְרָה חֲנַנְיָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ נוֹהֵג בִּנְקֵבוֹת וְאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בִּזְכָרִים, חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹהֵג בִּזְכָרִים וּבִנְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: Actually, Aaron and his sons, in the corresponding here, goat and its offspring. they said in the West, in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Avin: That is to say, is Ḥananya, as it is taught itself and its offspring applies to female but it does not apply to male Ḥananya says: It applies to male and female
llm_translation: Forever Aaron and his sons, as it is written here "tayish and bno." They said in the West in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Avin: Until Hananiah said, as it is taught: "He and his son" applies to females and does not apply to males, Hananiah says: It applies to males and females.

hebrew_text: וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא נָשִׁים כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: נוֹדֵר וְעוֹבֵד, יוֹרֵד וּמְגָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: who marries women taught he vows and perform he descends and divorces
llm_translation: The one who marries women, etc. It was taught: One who vows and fulfills, divorces and separates.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי חָכָם וְשָׁרֵי לֵיהּ! קָסָבַר: צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר.
human_translation: But let us be concerned perhaps he will go before a Sage dissolve his holds must delineate the vow
llm_translation: And he might think to go to a sage and permit it! He holds: One must specify the vow.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵט אֶת הַנֶּדֶר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּמַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ בְּרַבִּים.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says must delineate the vow. But according to the one who says not need to delineate the vow, what can be said? that we administer the vow in public.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says one needs to specify the vow, rather for the one who says one does not need to specify the vow, what can be said? Because we make it known publicly.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בְּרַבִּים אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּמַדְּרִינַן
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a vow that was taken in public has no nullification but according to the one who says it has nullification, what can be said? that we administer the vow
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says a vow that was made in public does not have annulment, but for the one who says there is annulment, what can be said? For we learn

hebrew_text: לֵיהּ אַדַּעַת רַבִּים.
human_translation: to on the consent of the public,
llm_translation: To him the knowledge of the many.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִלְכְתָא, אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶדֶר שֶׁהוּדַּר בָּרַבִּים יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה, עַל דַּעַת הָרַבִּים אֵין לוֹ הֲפָרָה. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, אֲבָל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה יֵשׁ לוֹ הֲפָרָה. כִּי הָהוּא דְּמַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי, אַדְּרֵיהּ רַב אַחָא דְּקָא פָשַׁע בְּיָנוֹקֵי, וְאַהְדְּרֵיהּ רָבִינָא, דְּלָא אַשְׁכַּח דַּהֲוָה דָּיֵיק כְּוָותֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar says: halakha Even according to the one who says a vow that was taken in public has nullification, on the consent of the public has no nullification. And this matter applies to an optional matter, but to a matter of a mitzva it has nullification. As a certain teacher of children, whom Rav Aḥa administered a vow on the consent of the public, as he was negligent with regard to the children and Ravina reinstated him, as they did not find who was as meticulous as he
llm_translation: Ammar Amemar: Halakha, even according to the one who says a vow made in public has a way out, he does not have a way out according to the consensus of the public. And these matters are regarding matters of permission, but regarding matters of commandment, he has a way out. For that one called Dardakei, Rav Aha released him for he sinned with young children, and Ravina released him, for he did not find that it was in accordance with his character.

hebrew_text: וְהַמִּטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים כּוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּסַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּקַבָּלָה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּמַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ? הָתָם יִצְרוֹ תְּקָפוֹ.
human_translation: who becomes impure to corpses What is different here that it is sufficient for him accept and what is different there, that we administer a vow to him? There his desire seizes him,
llm_translation: "And one who becomes impure through contact with the dead, etc." What is the difference here that it is sufficient for him with tradition, and what is the difference there that we expound it? There, his inclination is strong."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מוּמִין אֵלּוּ.
llm_translation: We will return to you, Mumim, these.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה , וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן; בְּכוֹר לִכְהֵן, וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה; בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְלַכֹּהֵן, וְיֵשׁ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לֹא לַנַּחֲלָה וְלֹא לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: There is a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest. a firstborn with regard to a priest but is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance. a firstborn with regard to inheritance and with regard to a priest. And there is who is not a firstborn neither with regard to inheritance nor with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is a firstborn for inheritance, but he is not a firstborn for the Kohen; a firstborn for the Kohen, but he is not a firstborn for inheritance; a firstborn for inheritance and for the Kohen, and there is one who is not a firstborn for either inheritance or for the Kohen.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן? הַבָּא אַחַר נְפָלִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיָּצָא אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ חַי, וּבֶן תִּשְׁעָה שֶׁיָּצָא רֹאשׁוֹ מֵת, הַמַּפֶּלֶת כְּמִין בְּהֵמָה חַיָּה וָעוֹף — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Which is a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest? who came after miscarriage even where head emerged alive; or nine- -old whose head emerged dead. who miscarried a type of domesticated animal, undomesticated animal, or bird, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Which is a firstborn for inheritance but not a firstborn for the priest? One who comes after the miscarriage, even though his head came out alive, and a nine-month fetus whose head came out dead, the miscarriage is like a living animal and bird - these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בּוֹ מִצּוּרַת אָדָם. הַמַּפֶּלֶת סַנְדָּל, אוֹ שִׁלְיָא, אוֹ שַׁפִּיר מְרוּקָּם, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מְחוּתָּךְ — הַבָּא אַחֲרֵיהֶם בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה, וְאֵין בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: unless that takes the form of a person. who miscarries a sandal fish or an afterbirth or a gestational sac tissue developed or that emerged in pieces, who follows these is a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: The sages say: Until he has the form of a person. One who drops a sandal, or a cloak, or a kerchief, and one who comes after them is the firstborn for inheritance, but not the firstborn for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים, וְנָשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּבָר יָלְדָה, עוֹדָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְנִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה, עוֹדָהּ נׇכְרִית וְנִתְגַּיְּירָה, מִשֶּׁבָּאת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל יָלְדָה — בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְאֵין בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: one who did not have sons and he married a woman who had already given birth; she was still maidservant and she was emancipated; she was still a gentile and she converted, when came to the Jewish people she gave birth a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: One who did not have sons, and he married a woman who had already given birth, she was still a maidservant and was freed, she was still a non-Jew and converted, when she came to Israel she gave birth - the child is a firstborn for inheritance but not a firstborn for the priest.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְלַכֹּהֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — עַד שֶׁיִּפְטְרוּ רֶחֶם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: a firstborn with regard to inheritance and with regard to a priest, as it is stated: opens the womb among Israel” unless it opens the womb from the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The firstborn belongs to the inheritance and to the priest, as it is stated: "The first issue of the womb among the people of Israel" - until the wombs of the people of Israel are opened.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים וְנָשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא יָלְדָה, נִתְגַּיְּירָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, נִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: one who had sons and married a woman who had not given birth; converted while pregnant, was emancipated while pregnant
llm_translation: One who had sons and married a woman who did not give birth, she converted while pregnant, the fetus is considered a freed slave.

hebrew_text: וְיָלְדָה הִיא וְכֹהֶנֶת הִיא, וּלְוִיָּה הִיא, וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּבָר יָלְדָה, וְכֵן מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהֲתָה לְאַחַר בַּעְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְנִשֵּׂאת וְיָלְדָה, וְאֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ אִם בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן אִם בִּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן — בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה.
human_translation: And and a priest, and a Levite, and a woman who had already given birth, gave birth and likewise who did not wait three months after her husband and she married and gave birth, and it is unknown whether nine months son of the first whether seven months son of the latter a firstborn with regard to a priest but is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance.
llm_translation: And she gave birth, and she is a Kohenet, and she is a Leviah, and a woman who has already given birth, and so too one who has not waited after her husband for three months and marries and gives birth, and it is not known whether the first one is a son of nine months or the latter a son of seven months - the firstborn is for the Kohen and is not a firstborn for inheritance.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הָרֹאשׁ פּוֹטֵר בִּנְפָלִים.
human_translation: Shmuel says: the head does not exempt in miscarriage,
llm_translation: Gemara, Shmuel said: The head does not exempt in the case of miscarriage.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁמַת רוּחַ חַיִּים בְּאַפָּיו״ — כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּנִשְׁמַת רוּחַ חַיִּים בְּאַפָּיו הוּא דַּחֲשִׁיב רֵישֵׁיהּ, אִידַּךְ לָא חֲשִׁיב רֵישֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason “All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life” Anywhere that the breath of the spirit of life, by its nostrils, its head is considered significant. another its head is not considered significant.
llm_translation: What is the reason? "All that has the breath of the spirit of life in its nostrils" - wherever there is the breath of the spirit of life in its nostrils, it is considered the head; otherwise, it is not considered the head.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַבָּא אַחַר נְפָלִים, שֶׁיָּצָא רֹאשׁוֹ חַי, וּבֶן תִּשְׁעָה שֶׁיָּצָא רֹאשׁוֹ מֵת. קָתָנֵי מִיהָא ״רֹאשׁוֹ!״ מַאי ״רֹאשׁוֹ?״ רוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: We learned who came after the miscarriage where head emerged alive; and nine- -old whose head emerged dead. in any event teaches its head What Its head? most of
llm_translation: We learned: One who comes after Nefalim, if his head emerges alive, and if he is nine months old and his head emerges dead. It was taught in a Baraita: "His head!" What is "his head"? His majority.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״רוּבּוֹ״! בְּדִין הוּא דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנֵי רוּבּוֹ, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה שֶׁיָּצָא רֹאשׁוֹ מֵת — טַעְמָא דְּרֹאשׁוֹ מֵת, הָא רֹאשׁוֹ חַי — הַבָּא אַחֲרָיו בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: But let teach: Most of it. By right, should have taught: Most of it, but since the latter clause needs to teach: nine- -old whose head emerged dead. reason that head dead, but - - head alive, that comes after it is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance either. taught the first clause also the head
llm_translation: And it should have taught "Rubo"! It is proper that it should have taught "Rubo," and since it seeks to teach the end, that a child whose head emerged first is dead - the reason being that his head is dead, but if his head is alive - if one born after him is the firstborn for inheritance, it is not so. The first part of the Mishnah is in agreement with his head.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ רֵישֵׁיהּ הָוֵה [לֵיהּ] לֵידָה? תְּנֵינָא: הוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהֶחְזִירוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה כְּיָלוּד!
human_translation: And what is teaching us? that once reached out its head it is a birth? We learn reached out its head, although it returned that like a newborn,
llm_translation: And what does it teach us, that since he brought out its head, it is considered a birth? We learned: If he brought out its head, even though he returned it - this is considered as a birth!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן בְּהֵמָה, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן בְּאָדָם, דְּאָדָם מִבְּהֵמָה לָא יָלֵיף — דְּלֵית לַהּ פְּרוֹזְדוֹר.
human_translation: And if you would say teaches us animals, and teaches us to a human, that a human cannot be derived from an animal, as has no concealed opening,
llm_translation: And if you will say: We hear regarding an animal, and it is inferred to us regarding a person, that a person is not liable for an animal - for it does not have a foreskin.

hebrew_text: בְּהֵמָה מֵאָדָם לָא יָלְפָא — מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲשִׁיב פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: animals cannot be derived from a human because the countenance of face is significant,
llm_translation: An animal from a human may not be redeemed - because the appearance of its face is considered significant.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: יָצָא כְּדַרְכּוֹ — מִשֶּׁיָּצָא רוֹב רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאֵיזֶהוּ רוֹב רֹאשׁוֹ? מִשֶּׁתֵּצֵא פַּדַּחְתּוֹ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל, תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: We learn that also, emerged in usual manner, when most of its head emerges. And what is most of its head? from when its forehead emerges. The refutation of Shmuel a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha na'mei tenina: yatza k'darko - misheyatza rov rosho, ve'eizehu rov rosho? Mishtetzei padachtei. Teivbata dishmuel, teivbata!" English translation: "Here is what we learned: if he went out in his usual manner - when most of his head has emerged, what is considered most of his head? When his temple has emerged. The statement of Shmuel is excellent, excellent!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: פַּדַּחַת פּוֹטֶרֶת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, חוּץ מִן הַנַּחֲלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״יַכִּיר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לַנַּחֲלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: a forehead exempts, in all cases, except with regard to inheritance. What is the reason? The Merciful One states: he shall recognize And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even with regard to inheritance
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: A breach exempts everywhere, except from inheritance. What is the reason? "He shall recognize," the Merciful One said, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even for inheritance.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: גִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁיָּצְאָה פַּדַּחַת וְלָדָהּ בְּגַיּוּתָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְגַּיְּירָה — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לָהּ יְמֵי טוּמְאָה וִימֵי טׇהֳרָה, וְאֵינָהּ מְבִיאָה קׇרְבַּן לֵידָה.
human_translation: in all cases, what to include? to include that which the Sages taught: a female convert whose offspring reached out its forehead in her gentile state, and then she converted one does not assign to her the days of ritual impurity and the days of ritual purity And she does not bring the offering birth,
llm_translation: In every place, for what purpose? For the purpose of what the Rabbis taught: A convert who went out impure and gave birth in her impurity, and afterwards converted - we do not give her the days of impurity and purity, and she does not bring a birth offering.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״יַכִּיר״ — זוֹ הַכָּרַת פָּנִים, וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא הַכָּרַת פָּנִים? פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים עִם הַחוֹטֶם. תָּנֵי: ״עַד הַחוֹטֶם״. תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין מְעִידִים אֶלָּא עַל פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים עִם הַחוֹטֶם. תְּנִי: ״עַד הַחוֹטֶם״.
human_translation: raises an objection to “He shall recognize” this the recognition of the face. And what is the recognition of the face? the countenance of the face with the nose. Teach Up to, the nose. Come hear One can testify only to the countenance of the face with the nose, teach: Up to, the nose.
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: "Recognize" - this refers to recognizing the appearance of the face, and what is considered recognizing the appearance of the face? A face with a nose. It was taught: "Up to the nose." Come and hear: One can only testify regarding a face with a nose. It was taught: "Up to the nose."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פַּדַּחַת בְּלֹא פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים, פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים בְּלֹא פַּדַּחַת — אֵין מְעִידִין עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם עִם הַחוֹטֶם. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״הַכָּרַת פְּנֵיהֶם עָנְתָה בָּם״! שָׁאנֵי עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה, דְּאַחְמִירוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Come hear the forehead without the countenance of the face, the countenance of the face without the forehead, they cannot testify until both with the nose. And Abaye says, and some say Rav Kahana What is the verse “The recognition of their countenance does witness against them” Testimony a woman is different, as the Sages were stringent with regard to it.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A wound without a bandage, a bandage without a wound - they do not testify until both are present. And Abaye said, and it was stated by Rav Kahana: What is the verse? "The incision of their faces testifies against them"! This is different from the testimony of a woman, for the Rabbis were stringent with her.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אַחְמִירוּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: הוּחְזְקוּ לִהְיוֹת מַשִּׂיאִים עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, מִפִּי אִשָּׁה, מִפִּי עֶבֶד, מִפִּי שִׁפְחָה! כִּי אַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן בְּסוֹפָהּ, בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ לָא אַקִּילוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And were the Sages stringent But didn’t we learn established would marry testimony hearsay, from a woman’s testimony, from slave’s testimony, or from maidservant’s testimony? when the Sages were lenient with regard to the end the Sages were not lenient with regard to its beginning,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is more stringent? But didn't we learn: They were stringent to accept testimony from the mouth of a witness, from the mouth of a woman, from the mouth of a slave, from the mouth of a maidservant! For the Rabbis were lenient at the end, but at the beginning the Rabbis were not lenient."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא:
human_translation: And if you wish, say
llm_translation: And if you will say:

hebrew_text: ״יַכִּיר״ לְחוּד, וְהַכָּרַת פָּנִים לְחוּד.
human_translation: “He shall recognize” and the recognition of face, discrete
llm_translation: "Yakir" lechud, vehakarat panim lechud.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּגַיּוּתוֹ וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה — דְּהָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ ״רֵאשִׁית אוֹנוֹ״, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה — גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: It was stated had children when he a gentile and he converted: Rabbi Yoḥanan says he does not have a firstborn with regard to inheritance, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: He does have a firstborn with regard to inheritance. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He does not have a firstborn with regard to inheritance, as had “the first of his strength” And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: He does have a firstborn with regard to inheritance, a convert who converted like a child born.
llm_translation: It was stated: If he had sons in his gentile state and he converted - Rabbi Yochanan says: He does not have a firstborn for inheritance, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: He has a firstborn for inheritance. Rabbi Yochanan says: He does not have a firstborn for inheritance - because he had "Reishit Ono," and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: He has a firstborn for inheritance - a convert is like a newborn in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּגַיּוּתוֹ וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קִיֵּים — ״לֹא תֹהוּ בְרָאָהּ לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And follow their reasoning, as it was stated: had children when he a gentile and he converted, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He has fulfilled be fruitful and multiply, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: not fulfilled Rabbi Yoḥanan says he has fulfilled “He did not create it to be a waste; He formed it to be inhabited” And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says he has not fulfilled be fruitful and multiply, a convert who converted like a child born,
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for it was stated: If one had children in his youth and they converted - Rabbi Yochanan said: He fulfilled "be fruitful and multiply," and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: He did not fulfill. Rabbi Yochanan said: He fulfilled - "He did not create it to be empty; He formed it to be inhabited," and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: He did not fulfill "be fruitful and multiply" - a convert is like a newborn infant in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, מִשּׁוּם דִּבְגַיּוּתָן לָאו בְּנֵי נַחֲלָה נִינְהוּ, אֲבָל בְּהָא אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּ״לֹא תֹהוּ בְּרָאָהּ לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״, וְהָא עֲבַד לֵיהּ שֶׁבֶת.
human_translation: And necessary As, if it were stated in that first in that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says because in their gentile state they are not subject to inheritance. But with regard to that say he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan that “He did not create it to be a waste; He formed it to be inhabited,” and he has performed inhabited,
llm_translation: The matter is, that if it was stated in this case before you, in this case Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, because their creation was not of inheritance, but in this case say to Rabbi Yochanan, "God did not create it to be desolate," and in this case He made it desolate.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲבָל בְּהָא אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if were stated with regard to this in this Rabbi Yoḥanan says But with regard to that say he concedes to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in this one, in this one Rabbi Yochanan is saying, but in this one why not concede to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים, וְנָשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּבָר יָלְדָה, עוֹדָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְנִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה, עוֹדָהּ גּוֹיָה וְנִתְגַּיְּירָה, וּמִשֶּׁבָּאתָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל יָלָדָה — וְלָדָהּ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: We learned One who did not have sons and he married a woman who had already given birth; she was still maidservant and she was emancipated; she was still a gentile and she converted, and when came to the Jewish people she gave birth offspring is a firstborn with regard to inheritance but is not a firstborn with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who did not have children, and he married a woman who had already given birth, while she was still a maidservant and was freed, while she was a gentile and converted, and when she came to Israel she gave birth - and she gave birth to a firstborn for inheritance, but he is not a firstborn for the priest.

hebrew_text: יָלְדָה מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים — מַאי אִירְיָא גִּיּוֹרֶת וְשִׁפְחָה? אֲפִילּוּ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי!
human_translation: from whom, did she bear If we say from a Jew who did not have sons, why specifically a gentile or a maidservant, even a Jewish woman
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Who is she born from? If you say from a non-Israelite who did not have children - what is the status of a convert and a maidservant? Even the daughter of an Israelite as well!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו מִגֵּר שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, וְקָתָנֵי בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה!
human_translation: Rather, is not from a convert who had sons and converted. And teaches is a firstborn with regard to inheritance,
llm_translation: Rather, not a convert who had children and then converted, and it is taught in a Baraita regarding the status of the firstborn for inheritance!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים, וְ״אֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן״ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: No; actually, from a Jew who did not have sons, and was necessary for is not a firstborn with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: Not, forever, from Israel that not were to him sons, and "he is not firstborn to the priest" necessary to him.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְלַכֹּהֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — עַד שֶׁיִּפְטְרוּ רֶחֶם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: is a firstborn with regard to inheritance and with regard to a priest, as it is stated: opens the womb among Israel” unless he opens the womb from the Jewish people, teaches us that not
llm_translation: To go out from Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: "The firstborn for inheritance and for the Kohen, as it is stated: 'The first issue of the womb among the Israelites' — until the wombs of the Israelites are opened, it is implied to us that not.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּגַיּוּתוֹ וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה! אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אַחָא: הָא וַדַּאי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הִוא, דְּאָמַר ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — עַד שֶׁיִּפְטְרוּ רֶחֶם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וְיָלֵיף אִיהוּ מִינַּהּ דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: Come hear If had sons when he was a gentile and he converted, he has a firstborn with regard to inheritance. Ravina says, and some say Rav Aḥa This is certainly Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says opens the womb among Israel” unless it opens the womb from the Jewish people. And derives his from her
llm_translation: Come and hear: If he had sons in his gentile state and he converted, he has a firstborn for inheritance! Ravina said, and some say Rav Acha: This is certainly Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said, "The womb first opens in Israel" - until the wombs of Israel open, and he will add to his own.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: לְוִיָּיה שֶׁיָּלְדָה — בְּנָהּ פָּטוּר מֵחֲמֵשׁ סְלָעִים. דְּאִיעַבַּר מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא דְּאִיעַבַּר מִכֹּהֵן וּמִלֵּוִי, מַאי אִירְיָא לְוִיָּיה? אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרְאֵלִית נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: a Levite who gave birth her son is exempt from five sela From whom did she become pregnant? If we say that she became pregnant from a priest or a Levite, why specifically a Levite? even an Israelite woman
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: If his wife gave birth — her son is exempt from five shekels. Who is the one who exempts him? If you say it is the kohen and the levi, what is the relevance of her being a levi's wife? Even if she is an Israelite woman!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאִיעַבַּר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, ״לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם לְבֵית אֲבֹתָם״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Rather, where became pregnant from an Israelite. it is written: “By their families, by their fathers’ houses”
llm_translation: Rather, it is derived from the Jewish people, "according to their families, by their ancestral houses" is written!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּאִיעַבַּר מִגּוֹי. וְלָא תֵּימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְזַהֲמִין אֶת הַוָּלָד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְזַהֲמִין אֶת הַוָּלָד, לֵוִי פָּסוּל מִיקְּרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: who became pregnant from a gentile. And do not say according to the one who says one does not disqualify the child Rather, even according to the one who says one does disqualify the child and he is called a Levite flawed
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: That which is born from a non-Jew. And do not say according to the one who says they do not circumcise the child, rather even according to the one who says they do circumcise the child, Levi is disqualified from being called.

hebrew_text: מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיעַבַּר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וְשָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״פֶּטֶר רֶחֶם״ — בְּפֶטֶר רֶחֶם תְּלָא רַחְמָנָא.
human_translation: Mar, son of Rav Yosef, says in the name of Rava: Actually, where became pregnant from an Israelite. And there, it is different, as the verse states: opens the womb the Merciful One renders dependent upon the opening of the womb,
llm_translation: Mar, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: Always should one pass over from Israel, and the difference there is, as the verse says, "the opening of the womb" - in the opening of the womb, the Merciful One suspends mercy.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים וְנָשָׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא יָלָדָה, נִתְגַּיְּירָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, נִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: We learned One who had sons and married a woman who had not given birth; converted while pregnant, was emancipated while pregnant
llm_translation: We learned: One who had sons and married a woman who did not give birth, if she converted while pregnant, the fetus is considered a convert; if she was freed while pregnant, the fetus is considered a freed person.

hebrew_text: וְיָלְדָה הִיא וְכֹהֶנֶת הִיא, וּלְוִיָּה הִיא, וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּבָר יָלָדָה. וְכֵן מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהֲתָה אַחֲרֵי בַּעְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְנִשֵּׂאת וְיָלָדָה, וְאֵין יָדוּעַ אִם בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן אִם בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן — בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן וְאֵינוֹ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה.
human_translation: And and a priest, and a Levite, and a woman who had already given birth, gave birth, and likewise who did not wait three months after her husband and she married and gave birth, and it is unknown whether nine months the son of the first whether seven months the son of the latter a firstborn with regard to a priest but is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance.
llm_translation: And she gave birth, and she is a priestess, and she is a Levite, and a woman who has already given birth. And similarly, one who did not wait after her husband for three months and got married and gave birth, and it is not known whether the first one is a nine-month-old son or the latter is a seven-month-old son - the firstborn is for the priest and is not a firstborn for inheritance.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל (דִּכְהוּנָּה) [דְּכֹהֶנֶת] וּלְוִיָּה פְּטוּרִין, דְּאִיעַבַּר מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא דְּאִיעַבַּר מִכֹּהֵן וְלֵוִי — אִי הָכִי מַאי אִירְיָא כֹּהֶנֶת וּלְוִיָּה? אֲפִילּוּ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי!
human_translation: by inference that a priest and a Levite exempt from whom did she become pregnant? If we say that she became pregnant from a priest or a Levite, if so, why specifically a priest and a Levite? even an Israelite woman
llm_translation: From the principle (of priesthood) of the Levites and Levites are exempt, for who is it derived from? If you say it is derived from a Kohen and a Levi - if so, what is the meaning of "Kohenet" and "Leviyah"? Even a daughter of Israel as well!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאִיעַבַּר מִגּוֹי — כֹּהֶנֶת פְּטוּרָה? וְהָאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בָּדֵיק לַן רַבָּה, כֹּהֶנֶת שֶׁנִּתְעַבְּרָה מִגּוֹי מַהוּ? וְאָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: לָאו הַיְינוּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, דְּאָמַר: לְוִיָּה שֶׁיָּלְדָה בְּנָהּ פָּטוּר מֵחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים?
human_translation: Rather, where became pregnant from a gentile, the daughter of a priest exempt? But didn’t Rav Pappa say: Rabba tested us a priest who became pregnant from a gentile, what is And we said to him: Isn’t this by Rav Adda bar Ahava, who says: a Levite who gave birth her son is exempt from five sela
llm_translation: Rather, if a Kohenet is impregnated by a non-Jew, is she exempt? But didn't Rav Papa say: Rabba inquired of us, if a Kohenet who was impregnated by a non-Jew, what is the law? And I said to him: Is this not like what Rav Adda bar Ahava said, that Leviyah who gave birth to her son is exempt from five sela'im?

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לִי: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא לְוִיָּה בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּהּ קָיְימָא, דְּתַנְיָא: לְוִיָּה שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית אוֹ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה בְּעִילַת זְנוּת — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר וְאוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: And said to me: How can be compared? Granted, a Levite retains her sanctity. As it is taught a Levite woman who was captured, or if engaged in licentious sexual intercourse, gives her tithe and she may eat
llm_translation: And he said to me: Is this the case now?! For Leviyah in her holiness is established, as it was taught: Leviyah, whether she was captured or engaged in illicit intercourse - we give her from the tithe and she eats.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כֹּהֶנֶת, כֵּיוָן דְּאִי בָּעֵיל לַהּ, הָוְיָא זָרָה!
human_translation: But a priest, since if engages in intercourse with her she becomes a non-priest
llm_translation: Rather, as a Kohenet, since if he desires her, she becomes a zarah!

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר דְּאִיעַבַּר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, מוֹקֵי לַהּ בִּדְאִיעַבַּר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, אֶלָּא לְרַב פָּפָּא בְּמַאי מוֹקֵי לָהּ?
human_translation: This works out well according to Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, who says where became pregnant from an Israelite. interpret as to who became pregnant from an Israelite. But according to Rav Pappa, with regard to what interpret
llm_translation: The master, son of Rav Yosef, left a message in the name of Rava, saying that if one transgresses from the people of Israel, he is punished for it; but what is the punishment for one who transgresses against Rav Papa?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיעַבַּר מִכֹּהֵן, וְהִיא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לַהּ ״כֹּהֶנֶת״? דִּבְנָה כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Actually, who became pregnant from a priest. and she an Israelite woman. And why does call her a priest [ kohenet ]? Because her son is a priest.
llm_translation: "To the world that a Kohen marries, and she is a daughter of Yisrael, and why is she called 'Kohenet'? Because of her father, a Kohen."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: כֹּהֵן שֶׁמֵּת וְהִנִּיחַ בֵּן חָלָל — רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ, רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵין חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ. כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּמֵת הָאָב לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי זָכָה אָבִיו בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: was stated a priest who died and left a son a priest disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalal ] Rav Ḥisda says: The son is obligated to redeem himself. Rabba bar Rav Huna says: He is not obligated to redeem himself. In any that the father died after thirty everyone agrees that the son is not obligated to redeem himself, as his father acquired his redemption
llm_translation: It was stated: A priest who died and left a son who is a ḥalal—Rav Ḥisdah said: The son is obligated to redeem himself, Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The son is not obligated to redeem himself. Wherever the father dies after thirty days, everyone agrees that the son is not obligated to redeem himself, because his father already acquired his redemption.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דְּמֵת הָאָב בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ, דְּהָא לֹא זָכָה אָבִיו (לְפִדְיוֹנוֹ) [בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ]. רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵין הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת עַצְמוֹ, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָתֵינָא מִכֹּחַ גַּבְרָא דְּלָא מָצֵית לְאִשְׁתַּעוֹיֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: They disagree when the father died within thirty days Rav Ḥisda says the son is obligated to redeem himself, as his father did not acquire his redemption Rabba bar Rav Huna says the son is not obligated to redeem himself, as say to I come due to the strength of a man with whom you cannot enter into judgment,
llm_translation: When they disputed here where the father died within thirty days, Rav Ḥisda said: The son is obligated to redeem himself, for his father did not merit redemption. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: The son is not obligated to redeem himself, as he said to him: I come from the power of a man who did not find favor in the eyes of the court in his lifetime.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נִתְגַּיְּירָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן, וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אָתֵינָא מִכֹּחַ גַּבְרָא דְּלָא מָצֵית לְאִשְׁתַּעוֹיֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ! שָׁאנֵי גּוֹי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ חַיִיס.
human_translation: We learned converted while pregnant, a firstborn with regard to a priest But why Let say to I come due to the strength of a man with whom you cannot enter into judgment, a gentile is different, as he has no lineage [ ḥayis ],
llm_translation: We learned: If a convert is pregnant - the firstborn belongs to the Kohen. And why? Let us say to him: I have come from the power of a man who did not find favor in the eyes of the court in his case! It is different with a non-Jew who does not have a share.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן יָאסִינְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כֹּהֵן שֶׁמֵּת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים וְהִנִּיחַ בֵּן חָלָל — הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא זָכָה הָאָב בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ. מֵת לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — אֵין הַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי זָכָה הָאָב בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Yasinia says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says, a priest who died within thirty and left a son a ḥalal , the son is obligated to redeem himself, as the father not acquire his redemption died after thirty days the son is not obligated to redeem himself, as his father acquired his redemption
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon Ya'asinya, said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: A priest who died within thirty days and left a son who is a halal - the son is obligated to redeem himself, as the father did not merit through his redemption. If he died after thirty days - the son is not obligated to redeem himself, as the father already merited through his redemption.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהֲתָה אַחֲרֵי בַּעְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And likewise who did not wait three months after her husband
llm_translation: And so too, one who did not wait after her husband for three months, etc.

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה הוּא דְּלָא הָוֵי, הָא כְּפָשׁוּט שָׁקֵיל. וְאַמַּאי? לֵיזִיל לְגַבַּי הַאי וְלִידְחֲיֵיהּ, וּלְגַבַּי הַאי וְלִידְחֲיֵיהּ!
human_translation: is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance, but he takes like an ordinary But why Let him go to that and he will reject him, and to that and he will reject him
llm_translation: Firstborn for inheritance he is not, this as it is straightforward. And why? To go to this one's side and push him, and to go to that one's side and push him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לַבָּא אַחֲרָיו, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּכוֹר לַכֹּהֵן, וְהַבָּא אַחֲרָיו אֵין בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: is necessary only with regard to the follows him, And this is saying: a firstborn with regard to a priest, and the who follows him, is not a firstborn with regard to inheritance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: It is only necessary for the one who comes after him, and thus he said: "Firstborn to the kohen, and the one who comes after him is not a firstborn for inheritance."

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתְּבוּ הַרְשָׁאָה לַהֲדָדֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַתְנִיתִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַרְשָׁאָה — הָא מוֹקְמִינַן לַהּ קַמַּן דִּבְהַרְשָׁאָה!
human_translation: And let write an authorization to one another, And if you would say the mishna where no authorization, we interpret it later on to where an authorization.
llm_translation: And to write a permit for Hadadei! And if you will say: Mishnaic teachings not with a permit - here we establish for it later with a permit!

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יַנַּאי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: הוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ — כּוֹתְבִין הַרְשָׁאָה זֶה לָזֶה,
human_translation: supports of Rabbi Yannai, as Rabbi Yannai says: were recognized and were ultimately intermingled, each writes an authorization to the other,
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yannai, for Rabbi Yannai said: "They recognized and in the end they intermingled" - they write a permission to each other.

hebrew_text: לֹא הוּכְּרוּ וּבְסוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ — אֵין כּוֹתְבִין הַרְשָׁאָה זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: they were not recognized and were ultimately intermingled, each does not write an authorization to the other,
llm_translation: They were not recognized, and in the end they became mixed - one does not write permission of this one to that one.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵי זֶהוּ בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וְלַכֹּהֵן? הַמַּפֶּלֶת שַׁפִּיר מָלֵא מַיִם, מָלֵא דָּם, מְלֵא גְּנִינִין, הַמַּפֶּלֶת כְּמִין דָּגִים וַחֲגָבִים שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, וְהַמַּפֶּלֶת לְיוֹם אַרְבָּעִים — הַבָּא אַחֲרֵיהֶם בְּכוֹר לַנַּחֲלָה וּלְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: Which is that is a firstborn with regard to inheritance and with regard to a priest? who miscarried a gestational sac full of water, full of blood, full of pieces of flesh; who miscarries resembling a fish, or grasshoppers, repugnant creatures, or creeping animals, or who miscarries on the fortieth day the who follows them is a firstborn with regard to inheritance and with regard to a priest.
llm_translation: It was taught: What is considered a firstborn for inheritance and for the priest? A miscarriage that is filled with water, filled with blood, filled with embryos. If the miscarriage is like fish, locusts, creeping things, and the miscarriage lasts for forty days - one who comes after them is considered a firstborn for inheritance and for the priest.

hebrew_text: יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, וְהַבָּא אַחֲרָיו — שְׁנֵיהֶן אֵינָן בְּכוֹר, לֹא לַנַּחֲלָה וְלֹא לַכֹּהֵן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹן לַנַּחֲלָה, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לְחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים.
human_translation: born by caesarean section and the who follows him, both of them are not firstborn, neither with regard to inheritance nor with regard to a priest. Rabbi Shimon says: The first with regard to inheritance and the second for five sela
llm_translation: One who goes out first, and the one who comes after him - both of them are not firstborn, neither for inheritance nor for the priest. Rabbi Shimon says: The first one is for inheritance, and the second for five shekels.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רִאשׁוֹן לַנַּחֲלָה לֹא — ״וְיָלְדוּ לוֹ״ בָּעֵינַן, לְחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים נָמֵי לָא — ״פָּטַר רֶחֶם״ בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: first not with regard to inheritance, we require “And they have borne him with regard to five sela also not we require opens the womb”
llm_translation: First Talmudic text: "If the firstborn does not inherit - 'and they shall bear for him' we require, for five rocks we do not require - 'he shall open the womb' we require."

hebrew_text: שֵׁנִי לַנַּחֲלָה לֹא — ״רֵאשִׁית אוֹנוֹ״ בָּעֵינַן, לְחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים נָמֵי לָא — קָסָבַר: בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד לָא הָוֵי בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: second not with regard to inheritance, we require the first of his strength, also not with regard to five sela holds: A firstborn for one matter, is not considered a firstborn
llm_translation: Second to the inheritance not — "beginning of his strength" we require, to five rocks near not — he holds: firstborn for one thing not is firstborn.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹן לַנַּחֲלָה, וְהַשֵּׁנִי לְחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: ״תֵּלֵד״ לְרַבּוֹת יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The first with regard to inheritance and the second for five sela Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he says she bears to include born by caesarean section,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The first born for inheritance, and the second born for five rocks. Rabbi Shimon according to his reasoning, as he said: "She shall give birth" to include a double portion.

hebrew_text: וְהַשֵּׁנִי לְחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים, קָסָבַר: בְּכוֹר לְדָבָר אֶחָד הָוֵי בְּכוֹר.
human_translation: And the second for five sela maintains: A firstborn for one matter, is a firstborn
llm_translation: And the second opinion is that with five rocks, he holds: "Firstborn for one matter is considered a firstborn."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְּרָה אִשְׁתּוֹ וְיָלְדָה שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לְכֹהֵן. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — הָאָב פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one whose wife had not given birth and gave birth two males, he gives five sela to the priest one of them dies within thirty days the father is exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One whose wife did not give birth to a firstborn son and then she gave birth to two males - he gives five shekels to the Kohen. If one of them dies within thirty days - the father is exempt.

hebrew_text: מֵת הָאָב וְהַבָּנִים קַיָּימִים, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אִם נָתְנוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָלְקוּ — נָתָנוּ, וְאִם לָאו — פְּטוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נִתְחַיְּיבוּ נְכָסִים. זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: the father died and the sons are alive, Rabbi Meir says: If they gave before they divided they gave But if not, exempt Rabbi Yehuda says: The obligation took effect on the property a male and a female the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: The father died and the sons are alive, Rabbi Meir says: If they gave before they divided - they gave, and if not - they are exempt. Rabbi Yehuda says: The assets are obligated. Male and female - there is nothing here for the priest.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דְּמִית הָאָב אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִית לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — בְּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר כִּי חָלְקוּ פְּטוּרִין? וְהָא אִשְׁתַּעְבַּדוּ לְהוּ (לנכסי) [נִכְסֵי]!
human_translation: When did the father die? If we say that he died after thirty days Rabbi Meir say in this if they divided exempt But the property is on lien
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemara: When did the father die? If you say he died after thirty days - with this, Rabbi Meir said: When they divided, they are exempt? But they have already been used for him (for the estate)!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּמִית בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מַאי שְׁנָא כִּי חָלְקוּ — דְּאָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וּמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ, דְּאָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וּמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ; כִּי לֹא חָלְקוּ נָמֵי — לֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וְלִידַחֲיֵיהּ, וְלֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וְלִידַחֲיֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, where died within thirty days what is different where they divided that will go to this and will reject him he will go to that and he will reject him even where they did not divide Let go to this and he will reject him, and let him go to that and he will reject him.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was within thirty days, what is the difference when they divided? — For then he goes to this one and pushes him away, and he goes to that one and pushes him away; but if they did not divide, he goes to this one and pushes him away, and he goes to that one and pushes him away, and he goes to this one and pushes him away, and he goes to that one and pushes him away!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ בְּעִיר אַחַת, וְלָקְחוּ שָׂדֶה בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת — בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אוֹתָהּ מֵהֶם, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּדִידָךְ מַסֵּיקְנָא — מְנָתָא דִּידָךְ קָא שָׁקֵילְנָא, וְאִי בְּחַבְרָךְ מַסֵּיקְנָא — מְנָתָא דְּחַבְרָךְ קָא שָׁקֵילְנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: That is to say, two Yosef ben Shimon who were of one city, and they acquired a field in partnership, a creditor can collect from them, that he can say to If I have a claim against you, I am taking the one hundred dinars your and if I have a claim against the other I am taking the one hundred dinars that
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: This means, two Yosefs, sons of Shimon, who were in one city, and they took a field in partnership - a creditor collected it from them, for he said to them: If I collect from you alone, I am taking what is yours, and if I collect from your friend, I am taking what belongs to your friend.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי נִכְסֵי דְּבַר אִינִישׁ אִינּוּן עָרְבִין בֵּיהּ, מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּלְדִידֵיהּ לָא מָצֵי תָּבַע לֵיהּ, וּלְעָרֵב מָצֵי תָּבַע לֵיהּ? וְהָתְנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל יְדֵי עָרֵב — לֹא יִפָּרַע מִן הֶעָרֵב, וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּלֹא יִתְבַּע מִן הֶעָרֵב תְּחִלָּה!
human_translation: Rava said Now a person’s property is a guarantee for him, Is there any where one cannot claim himself, and he can claim from a guarantor? But didn’t we learn one who lends to another with a guarantor, cannot claim from the guarantor? And we maintain that cannot claim from the guarantor at the outset,
llm_translation: Rava said: Because of the property of a person, they do not become sureties for him. If there is something from his own, he cannot demand it, but if there is something from a surety, he can demand it. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who lends to his fellow through a surety - he should not collect from the surety, and it is established for us that one should not initially demand from the surety!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם שֶׁמֵּת לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְאִי דְּאִיכָּא נִכְסֵי טוּבָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּשָׁקֵיל, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: Actually, where died after thirty days And if where there is a lot of property, so too, that takes And what are we dealing with here? where there is only five sela
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Always one should wait after thirty days, and if there are valuable assets — so it is said, as he took, and here, with what are we dealing? For example, if there are only five rocks.

hebrew_text: וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב אַסִּי, דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ — מֶחֱצָה יוֹרְשִׁין וּמֶחֱצָה לָקוֹחוֹת, וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִלְוֶה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה
human_translation: And everyone accepts of Rav Asi, as Rav Asi says: brothers who divided half heirs and half purchasers And everyone a loan written in the Torah,
llm_translation: And all the people of the world have a support from Rav Assi, as Rav Assi said: The brothers who divided - half inherit and half buy, and all the people of the world lend according to the written Torah.

hebrew_text: לָאו כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִלְוָה עַל פֶּה גּוֹבֶה מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: is not like written in a document, And everyone accepts of Rav Pappa, as Rav Pappa says: a loan by oral collect from the heirs but he cannot collect from the purchasers
llm_translation: Not as written in the document of the debt, and all the people have a Rabbi Papa, as Rabbi Papa said: A loan on the mouth is collected from the heirs but is not collected from the purchasers.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּחָמֵשׁ וְלֹא בַּחֲצִי חָמֵשׁ קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חָמֵשׁ וְלֹא חֲצִי חָמֵשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: חָמֵשׁ וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲצִי חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: And here disagree of: Five, but not with half of five. As Rabbi Meir holds five but not half of five; And Rabbi Yehuda maintains five and even half of five.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, with five and not with half of five, they disagree. For Rabbi Meir holds: five and not half of five. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: five, and even half of five."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר נִתְחַיְּיבוּ נְכָסִים, נִתְחַיֵּיב גַּבְרָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ, אִם יֵשׁ עֲשָׂרָה זוּז לָזֶה וַעֲשָׂרָה זוּז לָזֶה — חַיָּיבִין, וְאִם לָאו — פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: If so, Rabbi Yehuda says: The obligation took effect the property he should the obligation took effect the man, And furthermore, it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: where the brothers divided if there are ten dinars, for this and ten dinars for that they are obligated and if not, they are exempt.
llm_translation: So it is, Rabbi Yehuda says: If assets are obligated, a man is obligated to pay them! Furthermore, it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Brothers who divided, if there are ten coins for this one and ten coins for that one - they are obligated, but if not - they are exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי עֲשָׂרָה זוּז לָזֶה וַעֲשָׂרָה זוּז לָזֶה? אִילֵּימָא בֵּין דִּירוּשָּׁה בֵּין דְּלָקוֹחוֹת, וְחָמֵשׁ וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲצִי חָמֵשׁ — אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא עֲשָׂרָה? אֲפִילּוּ בְּצִיר מֵעֲשָׂרָה נָמֵי!
human_translation: What Ten dinars for this and ten dinars for that If we say both of the inheritance with regard to purchasers and five and even half of five, If so, why specifically ten even fewer than ten
llm_translation: What is ten zuz for this and ten zuz for that? If you say whether for a dwelling or for purchases, and five and even half of five - if so, what is the meaning of ten? Even for produce from ten, also!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא, עֲשָׂרָה זוּז דִּירוּשָּׁה לָזֶה, וַעֲשָׂרָה זוּז דִּירוּשָּׁה לָזֶה, אַלְמָא: חָמֵשׁ וְלֹא חֲצִי חָמֵשׁ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, it obvious ten dinars of inheritance for this and ten dinars of inheritance for that Evidently, maintains five but not half of five,
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious, ten zuz for this courtyard, and ten zuz for that courtyard, implying: five and not half of five seems reasonable to him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חָמֵשׁ וְלֹא חֲצִי חָמֵשׁ, וְהָכָא בִּדְרַב אַסִּי וְרַב פָּפָּא קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rather, everyone, five but not half of five. And here they disagree with regard to of Rav Asi and Rav Pappa
llm_translation: Rather, the entire world is five and not half of five, and here in the case of Rav Assi and Rav Papa they disagree.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לֵיהּ אַסֵּיפָא, נִתְחַיְּיבוּ הַנְּכָסִים, דְּמִית הָאָב אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִית לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר כִּי חָלְקוּ פְּטוּרִין? הָא אִישְׁתַּעְבַּדוּ לְהוּ נִכְסֵי!
human_translation: And there are who teach with regard to the latter clause obligation took effect on the property When did the father die? If we say that he died after thirty by inference that Rabbi Meir maintains if they divided exempt But the property is on lien
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches it in the latter part: the properties are liable, for when did the father die? If you say after thirty days, does Rabbi Meir hold in general that when they divided, they are exempt? They have done it with their properties!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים, כִּי חָלְקוּ, אַמַּאי מְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? לֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי לִידַחֲיֵיהּ, וְגַבֵּי הַאי וְלִידְחֲיֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, where died within thirty why does Rabbi Yehuda obligate when divided Let go to this he will reject him, and to that and he will reject him
llm_translation: Rather within thirty, for they have divided, why does Rabbi Yehuda obligate? Let him go to this one to exempt, and to this one to exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ בְּעִיר אַחַת, וְלָקַח אֶחָד מֵהֶם שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה מִמֶּנּוּ, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּדִידָךְ מַסֵּיקְנָא — מְנָתָא דִּידָךְ קָא שָׁקֵילְנָא, וְאִי בְּחַבְרָךְ מַסֵּיקְנָא — מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדָא לִי מִקַּמֵּי דִּידָךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: That is to say: two Yosef ben Shimon, who were of one city, and one of them purchased a field from the other, creditor can collect from because he can say If you are indebted to me I am taking the one hundred dinars your and if the other indebted to me, was on lien to me before you
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: This means, there were two Yosefs, sons of Shimon, who were in one city, and one of them took a field from his fellow — a creditor is collecting from him, for he said to him: If I am collecting from you alone — I am taking what is yours, and if I am collecting from your friend — it is as if I am collecting from you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי נִכְסוֹהִי דְּבַר אִינִישׁ אִינּוּן עָרְבִין בֵּיהּ, וְכוּלַּהּ כְּלִישָּׁנָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: Now a person’s property is a guarantee for him, And all as the first version
llm_translation: Rava said: Because of the concealment of a matter, a person's friends are not his guarantors, and all of it is like the first flax.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁלֹּא בִּכֵּרוּ וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן עֲשָׂרָה סְלָעִים לַכֹּהֵן. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אִם לְכֹהֵן אֶחָד נָתַן — יַחֲזִיר לוֹ חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים, וְאִם לִשְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים נָתַן — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיא מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: two wives whom had not given birth, and they gave birth two males, gives ten sela to the priest one of them dies within thirty days if he gave to one priest, must return five sela to him, And if he gave to two priests, he cannot reclaim from the possession
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two women who did not give birth to firstborn sons and gave birth to two male children - he gives ten shekels to the priest. If one of them dies within thirty days, if he gave to one priest - he shall return to him five shekels, and if he gave to two priests - he cannot retract from their hands.

hebrew_text: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, אוֹ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבָה — נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לַכֹּהֵן; שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת וְזָכָר, אוֹ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּשְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: a male and a female, two males and female, gives five sela to the priest: two females and a male, or two males and two females, the priest has nothing here,
