llm_translation: Male and female, or two males and a female - he gives five sela to the priest; two females and a male, or two males and two females - here the priest receives nothing.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בִּכֵּרָה וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּכֵּרָה, וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לַכֹּהֵן, מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — הָאָב פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one had given birth and one had not given birth and gave birth two males gives five sela to the priest, one of them dies within thirty days the father is exempt
llm_translation: One is a firstborn and one is not a firstborn, and they gave birth to two males - he gives five shekels to the priest, if one of them dies within thirty days, the father is exempt.

hebrew_text: מֵת הָאָב וְהַבָּנִים קַיָּימִים, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אִם נָתְנוּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא חָלְקוּ נָתְנוּ, וְאִם לָאו פְּטוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נִתְחַיְּיבוּ נְכָסִים, זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה אֵין לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: the father died and the sons are alive, Rabbi Meir says: If they gave before they divided they gave But if not, exempt Rabbi Yehuda says: obligation took effect the property a male and a female the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: The father died and the sons are alive, Rabbi Meir says: If they gave while they did not divide, they gave, and if not, they are exempt. Rabbi Yehuda says: The assets are obligated, male and female, the kohen receives nothing.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁלֹּא בִּכֵּרוּ, וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — זֶה נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לַכֹּהֵן וְזֶה נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים — אִם לַכֹּהֵן אֶחָד נָתָנוּ, יַחֲזִיר לָהֶם חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים. אִם לִשְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים נָתָנוּ — אֵינָן יְכוֹלִין לְהוֹצִיא מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: two women who had not given birth, to two men, and they gave birth two males this gives five sela to a priest and that gives five sela one of them dies within thirty if gave to one priest, must return five sela to them. But if they gave to two priests they cannot reclaim from the possession of
llm_translation: Two women of two men who are not firstborn, and they gave birth to two males - this one gives five shekels to the priest and this one gives five shekels. If one of them dies within thirty days - if they gave to one priest, he shall return to them five shekels. If they gave to two priests - they cannot withdraw from their hands.

hebrew_text: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — הָאָבוֹת פְּטוּרִין, וְהַבֵּן חַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ; שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת וְזָכָר, אוֹ שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת וּשְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: a male and a female the fathers are exempt, but the son is obligated to redeem himself, two females and a male or two females and two males, the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: Male and female - the fathers are exempt, and the son is obligated to redeem himself; two females and one male, or two females and two males - here the Kohen has nothing.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בִּכֵּרָה וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא בִּכֵּרָה, שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים — זֶה שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְּרָה אִשְׁתּוֹ נוֹתֵן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לַכֹּהֵן; זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: one had given birth and one had not given birth, to two men and they gave birth to two males, this whose wife had not given birth gives five sela to the priest. a male and a female the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: One is a firstborn and one is not a firstborn, of two men, and they bore two males - this one who is not a firstborn, his wife gives five shekels to the priest; male and female - the priest receives nothing here.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא שְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים, דְּאָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וּמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ, וְאָזֵיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וּמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: What is different two priests, that will go to this and he will reject him, and he will go to that and he will reject him
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between two priests, that one goes to this one and pushes him away, and goes to that one and pushes him away?

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן אֶחָד נָמֵי לֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וְלִידַחֲיֵיהּ, וְלֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי הַאי וְלִידַחֲיֵיהּ! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: also one priest: This will go to and will reject him, and that will go to and he will reject him Shmuel says:
llm_translation: A single priest should go and stand before this one and argue with him, and go and stand before that one and argue with him! Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: בְּבָא בְּהַרְשָׁאָה.
human_translation: where comes with authorization
llm_translation: In the gate of Harsha'ah.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: לָא כָּתְבִינַן אַדְרַכְתָּא אַמִּטַּלְטְלִי! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּכַפְרֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא כַּפְרֵיהּ — כָּתְבִינַן.
human_translation: But didn’t of Neharde’a say: We do not write an authorization document [ adrakhta ] concerning movable property? This statement, when denied But did not deny we write
llm_translation: The Gemara says: We did not write the path of the Amittaltili! Those words were written where he atoned, but where he did not atone - we write.

hebrew_text: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם. תָּנָא רַב הוּנָא: שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּנְקֵבָה — אֵין כָּאן לַכֹּהֵן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: a male and a female the priest has nothing here. Rav Huna teaches: two males and a female the priest has nothing here,
llm_translation: Male and female - there is nothing here for the priest. It was taught in a Baraita: Rav Huna says: Two males and a female - there is nothing here for the priest.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, כֵּיוָן דְּבִשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים הוּא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — לָא מִתְּנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the tanna of our Since you find that where two men, you do not find it of one man and two wives, does not teach
llm_translation: Our Tanna teaches: Since it is with two men that she is involved, if it is with one man and two women, she does not receive a divorce.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מֵת הַבֵּן בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנָּתַן לַכֹּהֵן — יַחְזִיר. לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן — יִתֵּן. מֵת בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים — כְּיוֹם שֶׁלְּפָנָיו. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אִם נָתַן — לֹא יִטּוֹל, וְאִם לֹא נָתַן — לֹא יִתֵּן.
human_translation: the son dies within thirty days although gave to the priest, must return after thirty days even if did not give he must give dies on the thirtieth day, like day that preceded it, Rabbi Akiva says: if gave he cannot take but if he did not give he does not give
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a son dies within thirty days, even though he was given to the Kohen, he shall return. After thirty days, even though he was not given, he shall be given. If he dies on the thirtieth day, it is as if he died on the day before. Rabbi Akiva says: If he was given, he shall not take back, and if he was not given, he shall not be given.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? גָּמְרִי ״חֹדֶשׁ״ ״חֹדֶשׁ״ מִמִּדְבָּר, מָה הָתָם ״וָמַעְלָה״ אַף הָכָא נָמֵי וָמַעְלָה.
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis, they derive “month” from “month” the wilderness Just as there, and upward” so too here, And upward, as well,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason of the Rabbis? They learned "month" "month" from the wilderness. Just as there, it says "and above," so too here, "and above."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, מִדְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״וָמַעְלָה״ גַּבֵּי עֲרָכִין, וְלָא גָּמְרִי מִמִּדְבָּר — הָווּ לְהוּ שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד,
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva is uncertain From that it was necessary to write “and upward” with regard to valuations: and is not derived from wilderness are two verses that come as one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva was in doubt, as it is necessary to have the word "and above" regarding valuations, and we did not learn it from the wilderness — they should be like two Scriptures that come as one.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד — אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And all two scriptures that come as one - not teach.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: כִּי אֵין מְלַמְּדִין — לְעָלְמָא, אֲבָל לְגוּפַיְיהוּ — מְלַמְּדִין, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps When not teach with regard to general But with regard to themselves, they do teach. And due to that uncertain
llm_translation: Or perhaps: when they do not teach - for the world, but for themselves - they teach, and therefore it is doubtful to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים לְעִנְיַן אֲבֵילוּת, יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים כְּיוֹם שֶׁלְּפָנָיו. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: All concede with regard to mourning the thirtieth day is like the preceding day, And Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Everyone agrees regarding the matter of mourning, the thirtieth day is like the day before it. And Shmuel said: The halakha follows the lenient opinion in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מֵת הָאָב בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים — בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדָּה, עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁנִּפְדָּה; לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁנִּפְדָּה, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדָּה. הוּא לִפְדּוֹת וּבְנוֹ לִפְדּוֹת — הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ; רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּנוֹ קוֹדְמוֹ, שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ עַל אָבִיו וּמִצְוַת בְּנוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: the father dies within thirty the presumptive status of that he was not redeemed, until will bring proof that he was redeemed. after thirty days the presumptive status of that he was redeemed, until will tell him that he was not redeemed. himself to redeem and his son to redeem, his takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: his son takes precedence, as the mitzva upon his father, and the mitzva his son upon him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a father dies within thirty days of his son's birth, the child is assumed not to have been redeemed until evidence is brought that he has been redeemed. After thirty days, the child is assumed to have been redeemed until it is declared that he has not been redeemed. If both the father and his son need redemption, the father takes precedence. Rabbi Yehudah says: The son takes precedence, as the father's obligation is upon him, and the son's obligation is upon the father.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת בְּנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, רַב אָמַר: בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ — אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם וְאִיתַנְהוּ לְמָעוֹת — וַדַּאי בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי.
human_translation: was stated: one who redeems his son within thirty days Rav says his son is redeemed and Shmuel says his son is not redeemed. Everyone from now, his son is not redeemed, after thirty days, and the money is there, his son is certainly redeemed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Ha-podeh et b'no b'toch shloshim yom, Rav amar: B'no paduy, u'Shmuel amar: Ein b'no paduy. D'chulei alma "me'achshav" — ein b'no paduy, l'achar shloshim yom v'itanhu l'ma'ot — va'dai b'no paduy. English translation: It was stated in the Gemara: One who redeems his son within thirty days, Rav said: His son is redeemed, and Shmuel said: His son is not redeemed. The consensus of the world is "from now" — his son is not redeemed, after thirty days and he gives him money — and certainly his son is redeemed.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְנִתְעַכְּלוּ הַמָּעוֹת, רַב אָמַר: בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקִּידּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה, הָתָם לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּנִתְעַכְּלוּ הַמָּעוֹת — הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי,
human_translation: They disagree where after thirty days but the money was squandered away Rav says his son is redeemed, just as is with regard to the betrothal of a woman there, not even though the money was squandered away it is betrothal?
llm_translation: When they argued after thirty days, and the intestines became discolored, Rav said: "He is redeemed, since it is as if he had betrothed a woman." There, even though the intestines became discolored, the betrothals were valid.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Here, too, is no different.
llm_translation: Here, it is taught: "Lo shna"

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לָךְ: הָתָם — בְּיָדוֹ לְקַדְּשָׁהּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, הָכָא — אֵין בְּיָדוֹ לִפְדּוֹתוֹ מֵעַכְשָׁיו. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַיְימָא לַן, דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דִּפְלִיגִי רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל — הִלְכְתָא כְּרַב בְּאִיסּוּרֵי וְכִשְׁמוּאֵל בְּדִינֵי, הָכָא הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: And Shmuel say to you: There, in his power to betroth her from now, here, not in his power to redeem from now. And even though we maintain that wherever Rav and Shmuel disagree the halakha in accordance with Rav in ritual matters and in accordance with Shmuel in monetary matters, here the halakha in accordance with of Shmuel,
llm_translation: Samuel said to you: There — in his hand to sanctify it from now, here — not in his hand to redeem it from now. And even though we hold, wherever Rav and Samuel disagree — the halacha follows Rav in matters of prohibition and Samuel in matters of law, here the halacha follows the opinion of Samuel.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנָּתַן לַכֹּהֵן — יַחְזִיר לוֹ חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים. טַעְמָא דְּמֵת, הָא לֹא מֵת — בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דְּאִיתַנְהוּ לְמָעוֹת.
human_translation: We learned dies within thirty days although gave to the priest, must return five sela to him. The reason that died. But not die his son is redeemed Here we are dealing with where money is extant,
llm_translation: We learned: If one died within thirty days, even though he had given it to the priest, he shall return to him five sela. The reason for his death, if he did not die, his son is redeemed! What are we dealing with here? That they were given for coins.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדָּה עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ שֶׁנִּפְדָּה! הָתָם נָמֵי דְּאִיתַנְהוּ לְמָעוֹת בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Come hear the presumptive status of that he is not redeemed, until will tell him that he is redeemed. There too, to where money is extant,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: In the case of one who has not been redeemed until they say to him that he has been redeemed! There, they stand with coins in their eyes."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת בְּנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי?! וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַיְימָא לַן כְּרַב בְּאִיסּוּרֵי וְכִשְׁמוּאֵל בְּדִינֵי, הָכָא הִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: a tanna taught in the presence of Rav Yehuda: one who redeems his son within thirty days his son is redeemed. said to him: Shmuel said his son is not redeemed, and you say his son is redeemed? And even though we maintain in accordance with Rav in ritual matters and in accordance with Shmuel in monetary matters, here the halakha in accordance with of Shmuel.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Yehudah: One who redeems his son within thirty days - his son is redeemed. He said to him: Samuel said his son is not redeemed, and you say his son is redeemed?! Even though he stands for us like Rav in matters of prohibition and like Samuel in matters of law, here the halakha follows the opinion of Samuel.

hebrew_text: הוּא לִפְדּוֹת וּבְנוֹ לִפְדּוֹת — הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא לִפְדּוֹת וּבְנוֹ לִפְדּוֹת — הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּנוֹ קוֹדְמוֹ, שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ עַל אָבִיו, וּמִצְוַת בְּנוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: himself to redeem and his son to redeem, his takes precedence over his son. The Sages taught himself to redeem and his son to redeem, his takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: his son takes precedence, as the mitzva upon his father, and the mitzva his son upon him.
llm_translation: He to torches and his son to torches - he precedes his son, etc. The Sages taught: He to torches and his son to torches - he precedes his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: His son precedes him, because his obligation is upon his father, and the obligation of his son is upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים — הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּמִצְוָה דִּידֵיהּ עֲדִיף. כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא חָמֵשׁ מְשׁוּעְבָּדוֹת וְחָמֵשׁ בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: Everyone concedes where there are only five sela his takes precedence over his son, What is the reason? that his own mitzva is preferable Where they disagree where there is five liened and five unsold
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Everyone agrees where there are only five stones - it takes precedence over the building. What is the reason? Because our mitzvah is more important. When do they argue? Where there are five slaves and five free men.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מִלְוָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה — כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, וְדִידֵיהּ אָזֵיל וְטָרֵיף מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי, וּבְהָנֵי חָמֵשׁ בְּנֵי חוֹרִין — פָּרֵיק לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda maintains a loan that is written in the Torah, considered as though it is written in a document, And goes and repossesses five liened for his and with those five unsold he redeems his son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: A loan that is written in the Torah is like a loan written in a document of money, and according to his opinion, he goes and tears it up in front of his creditor, and with the benefit of five free men, he exempts himself from it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מִלְוָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה — לָאו כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, הִלְכָּךְ מִצְוָה דִּידֵיהּ עָדִיף.
human_translation: And the Rabbis maintain: A loan that is written in the Torah is not considered as though it is written in a document, his own mitzva is preferable.
llm_translation: The sages hold: A loan that is written in the Torah - is not like a loan that is written in a document of money, therefore, our commandment is superior.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שֶׁל בֵּן — בְּמָנֶה צוֹרִי.
human_translation: five sela of the son, using a Tyrian maneh .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Five rocks of Ben - in a Tyrian Maneh."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל עֶבֶד, חֲמִשִּׁים שֶׁל אוֹנֵס וְשֶׁל מְפַתֶּה, וּמֵאָה שֶׁל מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע — כּוּלָּם בְּשֶׁקֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ, בְּמָנֶה צוֹרִי. וְכוּלָּן נִפְדִּין בְּכֶסֶף וּבְשָׁוֵה כֶּסֶף, חוּץ מִשְּׁקָלִים.
human_translation: thirty of slave fifty by a rapist and by a seducer and one hundred by the defamer all of them, in the shekel of the Sanctuary, using a Tyrian maneh . And all are redeemed, with or with the equivalent money, except for the shekels
llm_translation: Thirty of a slave, fifty of one who is coerced and of a deceiver, and one hundred of one who defames — all in the holy shekel, in the Tyrian mina. And all are redeemed with silver and with the value of silver, except for weights.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מָנֶה צוֹרִי. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: מָנֶה שֶׁל צוֹר. רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: דִּינָרָא (ערבא) [עַרְבָיָא]. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר: אִיסְתֵּרָא סֻרְסְיָא דְּמִיזְדַּבְּנָא תְּמָנְיָא בְּדִינָרָא, חֲמֵשׁ מִינַּיְיהוּ לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן.
human_translation: a Tyrian maneh . Rabbi Asi says: the maneh in Tyre. Rabbi Ami says: Arabian dinar. Rabbi Ḥanina says: a Syrian sela [ istera ], eight which are sold for dinar. five of these for the redemption of the son.
llm_translation: Gemar Maneh Tzori. Rabbi Assi said: A maneh of Tzor. Rabbi Amei said: A dinara (Arva). Rabbi Chanina said: A hidden treasure found in a ditch worth eight dinars, five of them for redeeming the son.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: דִּינָרָא הַדְרִיָּינָא טִרְיָינָא שְׁיָיפָא דִּמְזַבְּנָא בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְחַמְשָׁה זוּזֵי, דַּל מִינַּיְיהוּ שְׁתוּתָא וְהָנָךְ לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן. הָנֵי עֶשְׂרִין וְחַד נְכֵי דַּנְקָא הָוֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the worn-out dinars of Hadrian Trajan, which are sold at twenty-five dinars, deduct from them one-sixth. And these for the redemption of the son, is twenty-one less one-sixth [ danka ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says: A dinar in Hadriyana is worth two and a half sela that are sold for twenty-five zuz, since it is poorer in quality than them by a sixth, and the rest is for redeeming the son. Those twenty-five are considered as if they were twenty-four!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דַּל שְׁתוּתָא וְזוּזָא, וְהָנָךְ לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן. אַכַּתִּי עֶשְׂרִין נְכֵי דַּנְקָא הָוֵי! אֶלָּא, דַּל זוּזָא וּשְׁתוּתָא, וְהָנָךְ לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן, דְּהָוֵי לְהוּ עֶשְׂרִין מַתְקָלֵי בְּמַתְקָלֵי דִּינָרָא, דְּאִינּוּן עֶשְׂרִין וּתְמָנְיָא זוּזֵי וּפַלְגֵי וּפַלְגָא דַּנְקָא.
human_translation: Rather, deduct one-sixth and dinar, and these for the redemption of the son. still twenty less one-sixth Rather, deduct dinar, and one-sixth, and these for the redemption of the son. that these are twenty matkalei of dinars matkalei , which are twenty-eight and a half dinars, and half of a sixth
llm_translation: Rather, a small amount of wine and money, and there is the redemption of the son. For twenty denarii of a small jug it shall be! Rather, a small amount of money and wine, and there is the redemption of the son, for there are twenty coins in the value of a dinar, which are twenty-eight zuzim and a half and a half of a denar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: סִילְעִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תְּלָתָא וְתִילְתָּא הָוֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶשְׂרִים גֵּרָה הַשֶּׁקֶל״, וּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן: ״עֶשְׂרִין מָעִין״, וְתַנְיָא: שֵׁשׁ מָעָה כֶּסֶף דִּינָר.
human_translation: Rava says: The biblical sela are three and one-third As it is written: “The shekel is twenty gera ” and we translate twenty ma’a . And it is taught Six silver ma’a a dinar.
llm_translation: Rava said: The coins of the Torah are three and thirty, as it is written: "twenty gerahs shall be the shekel," and we translate it as: "twenty ma'in," and it was taught: six ma'ah of silver is a dinar.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וַהֲלֹא סֶלַע שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה פּוּנְדְּיוֹנִין.
human_translation: raises an objection But the sela of the Sanctuary forty-eight pundeyon ,
llm_translation: Challenger: But isn't the rock of the Holy of Holies forty-eight cubits?

hebrew_text: פּוּנְדְּיוֹן זֶה מָה טִיבוֹ? קִילְבּוֹן לַפְּרוֹטְרוֹט!
human_translation: This pundeyon , what is its function? a premium [ kilbon ] for exchanging
llm_translation: Pundeyon, what is its nature? Kilbon for the protruding.

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּאוֹסִיפוּ עִילָּוַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֶשְׂרִים גֵּרָה הַשֶּׁקֶל״ — לָמַדְנוּ לַשֶּׁקֶל שֶׁהוּא עֶשְׂרִים גֵּרָה, וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם רָצָה לְהוֹסִיף יוֹסִיף? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִהְיֶה״, יָכוֹל יִפְחוֹת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הוּא״.
human_translation: after added to As it is taught “Twenty gera the shekel” We learn with regard to the shekel that it is twenty gera . And from where that if one wants to add he may add? The verse states: shall be might may reduce the verse states: “The same
llm_translation: After they added their opinions, as it was taught: "Twenty gerahs the shekel" - we have learned that the shekel is twenty gerahs. And from where do we know that if one wants to add, he may add? The Talmud teaches us: "It shall be," could it decrease? The Talmud teaches us: "It is."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ שִׁבְסַר זוּזֵי לְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא בְּפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: לִישַׁדַּר לִי מָר תִּלְתָּא יַתִּירְתָּא דְּאִיכָּא עִלָּוַיְיהוּ. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: לְשַׁדַּר לִי מָר תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינָא דְּאוֹסִיפוּ עִילָּוַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Rav Ashi sent seventeen dinars to Rav Aḥa, son of Ravina, for the redemption of the son. sent him Let the Master send me the extra one-third that is in sent him Let the Master send me the other three that added to them,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi sent thirteen coins to Rav Acha, son of Ravina, for the redemption of his son. He sent to him: "Send me, sir, three more coins that are needed for their value." He sent to him: "Send me, sir, three other coins that will add to their value!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל כֶּסֶף הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם — סֶלַע, דִּנְבִיאִים — לִיטְרִין, דִּכְתוּבִין — קִינְטְרִין, חוּץ מִן כַּסְפּוֹ שֶׁל עֶפְרוֹן, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם — קִינְטָרִין, דִּכְתִיב ״אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף עוֹבֵר לַסֹּחֵר״, וְאִיכָּא דּוּכְתָּא דְּקָא קָרוּ לְקִינְטָרָא ״תִּיקְלָא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: Any silver that is stated in the Torah unspecified sela . in the Prophets litra , in the Writings centenaria [ kintarin ], except for the silver of Ephron, where even though it is written in the Torah: without specification, centenaria, as it is written: “Four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant” and there is a place where they call a centenarius a shekel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: All silver mentioned in the Torah - is a sela, in the Prophets - litrin, in the Writings - qintirin, except for the silver of Ephron, for even though it is written in the Torah - qintarin, as it is written "four hundred shekels of silver, passing to the merchant," and there is a place where it is called qintara "tikla."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: בִּיקְּשׁוּ לִגְנוֹז כׇּל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי כַּסְפָּהּ וּזְהָבָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, עַד שֶׁמָּצְאוּ לוֹ מִקְרָא מִן הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁהוּא מוּתָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבָאוּ בָהּ פָּרִיצִים וְחִלְּלוּהָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya says: wished to sequester all the silver and gold in the world because of the silver and gold of Jerusalem, until they found a verse in the Torah that it is permitted, as it is stated: “And robbers shall enter into it, and profane it”
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: They sought to confiscate all the silver and gold in the world because of the silver and gold of Jerusalem, until they found for it a verse from the Torah that it is permitted, as it is stated: "And the violent shall enter it and profane it."

hebrew_text: וִירוּשָׁלַיִם הָוְיָא רוּבָּא דְּעָלְמָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בִּקְּשׁוּ לִגְנוֹז דִּינָרָא הַדְרִיָּינָא טִירְיָיאנָא שְׁיָיאפָא, מִפְּנֵי טִבְעָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, עַד שֶׁמָּצְאוּ לָהּ מִקְרָא מִן הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁהוּא מוּתָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבָאוּ בָהּ פָּרִיצִים וְחִלְּלוּהָ״.
human_translation: And is Jerusalem the majority of the world Rather, Abaye said: wished to sequester all the worn-out dinars of Hadrian and Trajan because of the coins of Jerusalem, until they found a verse in the Torah that it is permitted, as it is stated: “And robbers shall enter into it, and profane it.”
llm_translation: Jerusalem is the majority of the world? Rather, Abaye said: They sought to store away a dinar, they found a Tyrian coin that was good, because of the nature of Jerusalem, until they found for it a verse from the Torah that it is permitted, as it is said: "And the violent shall enter it and profane it."

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כׇּל ״כֶּסֶף״ הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם — כֶּסֶף צוֹרִי, וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם — כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda Rav Asi says: Every money stated in the Torah without specifying Tyrian coinage, And statements of provincial coinage,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said Rav Assi: All "kesef" mentioned in the Torah without specification - Kesef Tzori, and regarding their words - Kesef Medinah.

hebrew_text: וּכְלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲרֵי טַעֲנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵלִים לִשְׁמוֹר״,
human_translation: And is principle But there is a claim that it is written: “If a man deliver to his neighbor money or vessels to guard
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it a general principle? But behold, there is an objection, as it is written: 'If a man gives his neighbor money or goods to watch.'"

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין — הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף!
human_translation: And we learned The oath by the judges the claim two silver
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: "The oath of the litigants - the claim is two silver coins!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵלִים״, מָה כֵּלִים שְׁנַיִם — אַף כֶּסֶף שְׁנַיִם, וּמָה כֶּסֶף דָּבָר חָשׁוּב — אַף כֵּלִים דָּבָר חָשׁוּב.
human_translation: There, similar to “vessels”: Just as “vessels” two, so too, “money” two And just as money is a significant item, so too, vessels a significant item.
llm_translation: The matter is similar there, as it is written: "silver or vessels." Just as vessels are two, so too silver is two. And just as silver is considered a significant matter, so too vessels are considered a significant matter.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״, וּתְנַן: הַפּוֹרֵט סֶלַע בִּמְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי! ״כֶּסֶף״ ״כֶּסֶף״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: But there is tithe, as it is written: “And bind up the money in your hand” And we learned one who exchanges of second-tithe money a sela , “Money,” “money,” serves as an amplification.
llm_translation: And behold, regarding Ma'aser, as it is written: "And you shall tighten the money in your hand," and we learned: One who separates a coin for the redemption of the second tithe! "Silver" "Silver" is repeated.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מְחוּלָּל! הֶקְדֵּשׁ נָמֵי יָלֵיף ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: But consecrated as it is written: “And he will give the money and it will be assured to him” And Shmuel says: consecrated worth one hundred dinars, which was redeemed for worth one peruta , it is redeemed. There too, he derives “holy” “holy” from tithe
llm_translation: Behold the case of Hekdesh, as it is written "and he shall give the money and it shall be his," and Shmuel said: Hekdesh is equivalent to a Maneh, for he has profaned it with something equivalent to a Perutah! Hekdesh also derives sanctity from tithe.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי קִידּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם אֵין כָּסֶף״, וּתְנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּדִינָר וּבְשָׁוֶה דִּינָר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְרוּטָה וּבְשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, לֵימָא רַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?
human_translation: But the betrothal of a woman, as it is written: “Then shall she go out for nothing, without money” And we learned Beit Shammai say that with one dinar or with worth one dinar, and Beit Hillel say with one peruta or with worth one peruta . shall we say Rav Asi, stated in accordance with Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: Behold, the sanctification of a woman, as it is written: "And she shall go out freely, without money." And we learned in a Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: with a dinar and with the value of a dinar, and Beit Hillel say: with a perutah and with the value of a perutah. Shall we say that Rav Asi said in accordance with Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כׇּל כֶּסֶף קָצוּב הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה — כֶּסֶף צוֹרִי, וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם — כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated like this: Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: Every set money stated in the Torah, Tyrian coinage, and by rabbinic law provincial coinage.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: Any specified silver mentioned in the Torah is Tyrian silver, and regarding their words, it is the currency of the country.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שֶׁל בֵּן וְכוּ׳!
human_translation: what is teaching us? We learn five sela for son,
llm_translation: What is the implication for us? We have learned: "Five stones of Ben and so on!"

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לַחֲבֵירוֹ נוֹתֵן לוֹ סֶלַע, וְלָא תֵּימָא סֶלַע אַרְבַּע זוּזֵי, אֶלָּא פַּלְגָא דְּזוּזָא, דְּקָרוּ אִינָשֵׁי ״סֶלַע״ פַּלְגָא דְּזוּזָא.
human_translation: It was necessary for statements of provincial coinage, As we learned one who strikes another must give him a sela And Do not say sela four dinars. Rather, one-half a dinar, as people call a one-half dinar sela .
llm_translation: And of their words, money of the country is necessary for him, as we learned: One who strikes his fellow, gives him a stone, and do not say a stone worth four zuz, but half of a zuz, for people call a "stone" half of a zuz.

hebrew_text: חָנָן בִּישָׁא תְּקַע לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא דְּזוּזָא. הֲוָה אִיכָּא
human_translation: Ḥanan the wicked struck a certain man. He came before Rav Huna said to him: Go give him half a dinar, had
llm_translation: Hanin Bisha struck him to that man, came before Rav Huna, said to him: Give him half a zuz. There was.

hebrew_text: זוּזָא מָאכָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ דְּלָא נָפֵיק, תְּקַע לֵיהּ אַחֲרִינָא וְיַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: an impaired dinar with him, which was not circulation, struck him another and gave him
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "The coin in his hand that did not come out, strike it with another and give it to him."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל עֶבֶד, חֲמִשִּׁים שֶׁל אוֹנֵס וְשֶׁל מְפַתֶּה וְכוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא!
human_translation: thirty of slave fifty by a rapist and by a seducer, Why do I this additional taught this the first clause.
llm_translation: Thirty of a slave, fifty of a rapist and seducer, etc. Why do I need this? The first part was taught to him!

hebrew_text: אוֹנֵס וּמוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ ״שְׁקָלִים״, אֵימָא זוּזֵי בְּעָלְמָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמֵילָף קָא יָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: was necessary the rapist and the defamer, enter your mind to say: Since shekels is not written with regard to them, say merely dinars, teaches us that are derived from one another,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one is coerced and utters a derogatory name, it is necessary. As your mind ascends, I say: Since it is not written in it "shekels," say it is mere coins, it is evident to us that it is different from Hadadezer. English translation:

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הַשְּׁקָלִים. תָּנָא: חוּץ מִן הַשְּׁקָלִים, וּמַעֲשֵׂר, וְהָרֵאָיוֹן.
human_translation: except for the shekels taught except for the shekels, and tithe, and the appearance,
llm_translation: Outside of the shekels. It was taught: Outside of the shekels, and tithe, and appraisal.

hebrew_text: שְׁקָלִים — דִּתְנַן: מְצָרְפִין שְׁקָלִים לְדַרְבּוֹנוֹת, מִפְּנֵי מַשּׂאוֹי הַדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: as we learned they combine shekels for darics [ darbonot ], due to carrying on the journey.
llm_translation: Shekalim - as we learned: they would exchange shekalim for darvonot, due to the burden of the road.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהָרֵאָיוֹן — תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיא סִיגָה לָעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: tithe as it is written: “And bind up [ vetzarta ] the money in your hand” And the appearance, Rav Yosef teaches, that one may not bring base to the courtyard.
llm_translation: Tithe — as it is written: "And the silver shall be in your hand," and the exposition — Rav Yosef taught: that one should not bring a blemish to the Altar.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹדִין לֹא בַּעֲבָדִים, וְלֹא בִּשְׁטָרוֹת, וְלֹא בְּקַרְקָעוֹת, וְלֹא בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת. כָּתַב לְכֹהֵן שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לִיתֵּן חֲמִשָּׁה סְלָעִים — חַיָּיב לִיתֵּן לוֹ, וּבְנוֹ אֵינוֹ פָּדוּי. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם רָצָה הַכֹּהֵן לִיתֵּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — רַשַּׁאי.
human_translation: One may not redeem neither with slaves, nor with notes, nor with land, nor with consecrated items. wrote to the priest that he is obligated to give five sela obligated to give to him but his son is not redeemed. Therefore, if the priest wished to give to him as a gift permitted
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not redeem a firstborn donkey neither with slaves, nor with promissory notes, nor with real estate, nor with consecrated items. If one wrote in his will for a Kohen that he must give him five sela coins, he must give them to him, and his son is not redeemed. Therefore, if the Kohen wishes to give it to him as a gift, he is permitted to do so.

hebrew_text: הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּדְיוֹן בְּנוֹ, וְאָבַד — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִהְיֶה לָּךְ״ וּ״פָדֹה תִפְדֶּה״.
human_translation: one who designates redemption of his son and he lost bears responsibility for their as it is stated shall be yours”; and “You shall redeem
llm_translation: The one who separates redemption of his son, and it is lost - is liable in his responsibility, as it is stated: "It shall be for you" and "you shall surely redeem."

hebrew_text: גּמ׳ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּכֹּל פּוֹדִין בְּכוֹר אָדָם, חוּץ מִן הַשְּׁטָרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי?
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi As it is taught Rabbi says: One can redeem firstborn son with anything except for notes. What is the reason for Rabbi
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Matnitin d'lo k'Rabbi, d'tanya: Rabbi omer: Bakol podin b'chor adam, chutz min hash'tarot. Mai ta'ama d'Rabbi? English translation: Gemara: The Mishnah that is not like Rabbi, as it was taught: Rabbi says: In all cases, we redeem the firstborn son, except from the documents. What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion?

hebrew_text: דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי, ״וּפְדוּיָו מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ תִּפְדֶּה״ — רִיבָּה, ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ כֶּסֶף חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים״ — מִיעֵט, ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: he interprets amplifications and restrictions, “and its redemption from one month,” amplified “according to the valuation of five silver shekels,” restricted “You shall redeem,” again amplified
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Darash ribbuyei u'mi'utei, 'ufduyav miben chodesh tifdeh' — ribah, 'be'erkecha kesef chameshet shkalim' — mi'etei, 'tifdeh' — ribah." English translation: "He expounded the inclusive and exclusive laws, 'you shall redeem his redemption from a month old' — inclusive, 'according to your valuation, five shekels of silver' — exclusive, 'you shall redeem' — inclusive."

hebrew_text: רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה, רִיבָּה הַכֹּל. מַאי רַבִּי? רַבִּי כֹּל מִילֵּי, וּמַאי מַיעֵט? מַיעֵט שְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: amplified and restricted and amplified, it amplified everything What it amplified? everything. And what it restricted? It restricted notes,
llm_translation: Dispute and diminish and dispute, dispute prevails. What is the meaning of "Rabbi"? Rabbi everything, and what is "diminish"? Diminish documents.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָל וּפְרָט: ״ופְדוּיָו מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ״ — כָּלַל, ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ כֶּסֶף חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים״ — פָּרַט, (פדה) ״תִּפְדֶּה״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: And the Rabbis expound a generalization and a detail. “and its redemption from one month” a generalization “according to the valuation of five silver shekels” a detail, “You shall redeem,” again makes a generalization.
llm_translation: The sages expounded general and specific: "And his redemption from a month old" - general, "according to your valuation, five shekels of silver" - specific, (redeem) "you shall redeem" - he repeated and included.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ — דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן. יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת — שֶׁאֵין מִטַּלְטְלִין, יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים — שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת, יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת — שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as the detail, is explicitly something that is movable and has intrinsic monetary so too, anything that is movable and has intrinsic monetary excludes land, which is not movable property; excludes slaves, who are compared to land; excludes notes, even though they are movable property they do not have intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general, if you judge only like the specific. What is the specific that is explicit - an item that is movable and its body is money, so too, any item that is movable and its body is money. If stones came out - because they are not movable, if slaves came out - because they are attached to the ground, if documents came out - even though they are movable, their body is not money.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְמָרִימָר: וְרַבִּי, רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי דָּרֵישׁ? וְהָא רַבִּי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרֵישׁ בְּמַרְצֵעַ!
human_translation: Ravina said to Ameimar: Rabbi expound amplifications and restrictions? But doesn’t Rabbi expound generalizations and details with regard to an awl?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Marimar: And, Rabbi, the inclusions and exclusions of interpretation? But Rabbi interprets general and specific in the marketplace!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַרְצֵעַ, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת הַסּוֹל וְהַסִּירָא וְהַמַּחַט וְהַמַּקְדֵּחַ וְהַמַּכְתֵּב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ — לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּלְקָח בַּיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ — מָה מַרְצֵעַ מְיוּחָד שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת, אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: as it is taught awl I have only an awl from where to include the thorn of a palm, and a thorn, a needle, and a gimlet, and a stylus The verse states: “And you shall take,” anything that can be taken by hand the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: “awl,” just as an awl is distinct of metal, so too, anything of metal
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Marzea" - I have only "Marzea," how do I know to include the shovel, the fork, the hoe, the pickaxe, and the writing tool? The Torah teaches, "And you shall take" - to include anything that is taken by hand, the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: "Marzea" - just as Marzea is a specific metal tool, so too, all metal tools.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי, ורבי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: And we say About what do they disagree? Rabbi expounds generalizations and details, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, expounds amplifications and restrictions.
llm_translation: And we say: With what do they disagree? Rabbi interprets general and specific, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, interprets inclusively and exclusively.

hebrew_text: אִין בְּעָלְמָא רַבִּי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרֵישׁ, וְהָכָא כִּדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Yes, generally expounds generalizations and details, but here, this is the reason in accordance with that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught.
llm_translation: In the world, Rabbi does not expound general principles and specific details, and here, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בְּמַיִם״ ״בַּמַּיִם״ שְׁתֵּי פְעָמִים, אֵין זֶה כְּלָל וּפְרָט, אֶלָּא רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט.
human_translation: As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “in the water,” “in the water,” twice, are not a generalization and a detail, rather amplified and restricted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tana d'bei Rabbi Yishmael: 'B'mayim' 'ba'mayim' shtei pe'amim, ein zeh k'lal u'prat, ela ribah u'mi'et." English translation: "It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: 'In water' 'into the water' two times, this is not general and specific, but rather amplification and limitation."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: כִּדְאָמְרִינַן בְּמַעְרְבָא, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁתֵּי כְלָלוֹת הַסְּמוּכִים זֶה לָזֶה — הַטֵּל פְּרָט בֵּינֵיהֶם, וְדוּנֵם בִּכְלָל וּפְרָט.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, say: like they say in the West, Wherever you find two generalizations juxtaposed to each other, place detail between and expound them as a generalization and a detail
llm_translation: The sages said: As we say in the West, wherever you find two general principles adjacent to each other - apply a specific detail between them, and analyze them in terms of general and specific.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא, לָאו דִּידֵיהּ נִינְהוּ! אֵימָא:
human_translation: And not with consecrated items. obvious? are not his. Say
llm_translation: "And not in consecrated items. It is obvious, they are not his! Say:..."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת בְּכׇל אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Nor consecrated items with any of these
llm_translation: And not consecrated in all these.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לְכֹהֵן שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה סְלָעִים חַיָּיב לִיתֵּן לוֹ כּוּ׳. אָמַר עוּלָּא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי, מַאי טַעְמָא אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ פּוֹדִין בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: wrote to the priest that he is obligated to him five sela obligated to give to him Ulla says: By Torah law, his son is redeemed what is the reason his son is not redeemed? decree lest say redeem with note
llm_translation: He wrote to a Kohen that he owes him five sela, he must give him thus. Ulla said: A matter of Torah, his son is redeemed, what is the reason his son is not redeemed? A decree lest they say they redeem with a document.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה (סתימתא) [סְתִימְתָּאָה], וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי. וְהִלְכְתָא: אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי.
human_translation: A tanna taught in the presence of Rav Naḥman: His son is redeemed when gives Rav Naḥman said to him: This the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, unattributed. And some say: This the statement of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, unattributed. But the Rabbis say his son is not redeemed. And the halakha his son is not redeemed.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: "His son is redeemed when he gives." Rav Nachman said to him: "This is the statement of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda (conclusion), and some say: this is the statement of Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Shimon (conclusion), but the sages say: his son is not redeemed." And the halakha is: his son is not redeemed.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אִם רָצָה הַכֹּהֵן לִיתֵּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — רַשַּׁאי. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: נְתָנוֹ לַעֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים בְּבַת אַחַת — יָצָא, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — יָצָא, נְטָלוֹ וְהֶחְזִירוֹ לוֹ — יָצָא.
human_translation: Therefore, if the priest wished to give to him as a gift permitted We learn that which the Sages taught gave to ten priests all at once, fulfilled one after the other, fulfilled took and returned it to fulfilled
llm_translation: Therefore, if the kohen wishes to give it to him as a gift - he is permitted. We learned in the Mishnah that the Sages taught: If they gave it to ten kohanim at once - he has fulfilled his obligation; if one after the other - he has fulfilled his obligation; if they took it and returned it to him - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, שֶׁהָיָה נוֹטֵל וּמַחְזִיר. וּכְשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר אָמְרוּ: קִיֵּים זֶה הֲלָכָה זוֹ. הֲלָכָה זוֹ וְתוּ לָא? אֶלָּא, קִיֵּים זֶה אַף הֲלָכָה זוֹ.
human_translation: And this was the practice of Rabbi Tarfon, as he would take and return it. And when the Sages heard of matter they said: This has fulfilled this halakha . this halakha and nothing more? Rather, This fulfilled even this halakha .
llm_translation: And so was the custom of Rabbi Tarfon, that he would take and return. And when the sages heard about this matter, they said: "This halakha is upheld." Is this halakha upheld and not this one? Rather, this one is upheld as well as this halakha.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הֲוָה רְגִיל (ושקיל) [דְּשָׁקֵיל] וּמַהְדַּר, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל וְאָתֵי קַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא גְּמַרְתְּ וִיהֵיבְתְּ — מִידַּעַם בִּישׁ, הִילְכָּךְ אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, was accustomed take and return it. he saw that a certain man was passing to and fro before him, said to him: you did not conclusively give a bad matter, therefore his son is not redeemed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina used to weigh and measure, he saw that man who was going and coming before him, he said to him: "You have not completed and given - from their knowledge you are ashamed, therefore your son is not redeemed."

hebrew_text: הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּדְיוֹן בְּנוֹ וְאָבַד — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אָתְיָא ״עֵרֶךְ״ ״עֵרֶךְ״ מֵעֲרָכִין.
human_translation: one who designates redemption of his son and he lost bears responsibility for its From where do we Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: derived “valuation” and “valuation,” from valuations.
llm_translation: The one who separates redemption of his son and it is lost - is liable in his responsibility. From where do we derive this? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "The word 'value' is repeated, teaching us that we assess values."

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: ״וְכֹל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״, וְיָלֵיף ״רֵיקָם״ ״רֵיקָם״ מֵעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה, מָה עוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, אַף פִּדְיוֹן הַבֵּן חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Dimi says Rabbi Yonatan “And every firstborn of your sons you shall redeem, and none shall appear before Me empty” And derived “empty” “empty,” from the burnt offering of appearance, Just as burnt offering of appearance one bears responsibility so too, redemption of the firstborn one bears responsibility
llm_translation: Rav Dimi said Rabbi Yonatan: "And all your firstborn sons you shall redeem, and they shall not appear before Me empty-handed." And he derived "empty-handed" "empty-handed" from the burnt offering. Just as the burnt offering is obligated in its aftermath, so too the redemption of the son is obligated in its aftermath.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: קְרָא לִקְרָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא — ״יִהְיֶה לָּךְ... אַךְ פָּדֹה תִפְדֶּה״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: verse in verse? Rather, Rav Pappa says: this the reason that teaches: shall be yours; yet you shall redeem
llm_translation: Rav Papa objected to her: "From verse to verse?" Rather, Rav Papa said: This is as it is taught in the tradition - "It shall be for you... however, you shall surely redeem."

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיתְּמַר דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ — אַרֵישָׁא אִיתְּמַר: מֵת לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן — יִתֵּן. מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: אָתְיָא ״עֵרֶךְ״ ״עֵרֶךְ״ מֵעֲרָכִין.
human_translation: And when of Reish Lakish was stated, was stated with regard to the first clause dies after thirty days even if did not give he must give From where do we Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: derived “valuation” “valuation,” from valuations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And when it was stated that Reish Lakish expounded: Initially it was stated: One dies after thirty days, even if he has not given, he shall give. How do we know? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It comes from the word 'value,' they evaluate."

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: ״וְכֹל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״, מָה לְהַלָּן יוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין, אַף כָּאן יוֹרְשִׁין חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: Rav Dimi says Rabbi Yonatan “And all the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem, and none shall appear before Me empty” Just as there, the heirs are obligated so too here, the heirs are obligated
llm_translation: Rav Dimi said Rabbi Yonatan: "And all your firstborn sons you shall redeem, and they shall not appear before Me empty-handed." Just as there, heirs are obligated, so too here, heirs are obligated.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבְּכוֹר נוֹטֵל פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּנִכְסֵי הָאָב, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּנִכְסֵי הָאֵם, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל בַּשֶּׁבַח, וְלֹא בְּרָאוּי כִּבְמוּחְזָק.
human_translation: The firstborn takes a double when the property of the father, but he does not take twice when the property of the mother. And neither does he take in enhancement nor in due as in possessed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The firstborn son takes a double portion in the father's estate, but does not take a double portion in the mother's estate, and he does not take from the enhancement, nor from what is considered as firmly established.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָאִשָּׁה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, וְלֹא הַבָּנוֹת בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן, וְלֹא אֶת הַיָּבָם, וְכוּלָּם אֵין נוֹטְלִין בַּשֶּׁבַח וְלֹא בָּרָאוּי כְּבַמּוּחְזָק.
human_translation: And neither does a woman for her marriage contract nor the daughters for their sustenance, Nor a man whose married brother died childless [ yavam ] And all of them do not take in enhancement nor in due as in possession.
llm_translation: The woman not in her writ, and the daughters not in their sustenance, and not the yavam, and all of them do not take in praise and not in fitting as in a strong hold.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלוֹ מִשְׁפַּט הַבְּכוֹרָה״ — מִשְׁפַּט הַבְּכוֹרָה לָאִישׁ, וְאֵין מִשְׁפַּט הַבְּכוֹרָה לָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: What is the reason? the verse states: “The law of primogeniture is his” a law of primogeniture for a man, and there is no law of primogeniture for a woman.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? The verse says, "And for him is the right of the firstborn" - the right of the firstborn is for a man, and the right of the firstborn is not for a woman.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל בַּשֶּׁבַח. דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִמָּצֵא לוֹ״, וְלֹא בָּרָאוּי כְּבַמּוּחְזָק, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִמָּצֵא לוֹ״.
human_translation: And neither does he take in enhancement because it is written: of all that he has” Nor due as in possession because it is written: “Of all that he has”
llm_translation: "And he does not take with praise. As it is written: 'In all that he finds for himself,' and not in what is suitable like a strong one, as it is written: 'In all that he finds for himself.'"

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָאִשָּׁה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח! אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מִקּוּלֵּי כְתוּבָּה שָׁנוּ כָּאן.
human_translation: And neither does a woman for her marriage contract. Is that so? But doesn’t Shmuel say a creditor collects the enhancement Rabbi Abba says: taught here of the leniencies a marriage contract:
llm_translation: "And not the woman in her script. Is it not so? And Samuel said: 'A debtor collects praise!' Rabbi Abba said: From the leniencies of the script they taught here."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הַבָּנוֹת בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן. מַאי טַעְמָא? תְּנַאי כְּתוּבָּה כִּכְתוּבָּה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Nor the daughters for their sustenance, What is the reason a stipulation in the marriage contract, is comparable to the marriage contract
llm_translation: The buildings not in their sustenance. What is the reason? It is a Tannaitic teaching: "Like the written law, so too the monetary value."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא (אֶת) הַיָּבָם. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״בְּכוֹר״ קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁבַח שֶׁשָּׁבְחוּ נְכָסִים בֵּין מִיתָה לְיִבּוּם, אֲבָל דְּבֵין יִבּוּם לַחֲלוּקָּה — שָׁקֵיל. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו הַמֵּת״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַהֲרֵי קָם.
human_translation: Nor the yavam What is the reason the Merciful One calls a firstborn, Abaye says: taught only with regard to an enhancement by the property enhanced between the death and the levirate marriage. But that between the levirate marriage and the distribution he does take What is the reason? The Merciful One states: “Shall succeed in the name of his brother who is dead” and he has succeeded
llm_translation: "And not the yavam. What is the reason? 'Firstborn' the Merciful One calls him. Abaye said: They only taught this in praise of those who praised assets between death and yibum, but regarding yibum for inheritance - he should take. What is the reason? 'That his name may not be blotted out from Israel' the Merciful One said, and indeed he arose."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ דְּבֵין יִבּוּם לַחֲלוּקָּה נָמֵי לָא שָׁקֵיל, מַאי טַעְמָא? כִּבְכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר אֵין לוֹ קוֹדֶם חֲלוּקָּה, אַף יָבָם נָמֵי אֵין לוֹ קוֹדֶם חֲלוּקָּה.
human_translation: Rava says: Even with regard to between the levirate marriage and the distribution does not take What is the reason? to a firstborn: Just as a firstborn does not have before distribution, so too, a yavam does not have before distribution.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even in the case where the yavam came for division, he also does not take precedence. What is the reason? Just as a firstborn has no precedence before division, so too a yavam has no precedence before division.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּם אֵין נוֹטְלִין בַּשֶּׁבַח,
human_translation: And all of them do not take in enhancement.
llm_translation: And all of them do not take in praise,

hebrew_text: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי שְׁבָחָא דְּמִמֵּילָא: חֲפוּרָה וַהֲווֹ שׁוּבְלֵי, שַׁלְפּוּפֵי וַהֲווֹ תַּמְרֵי.
human_translation: to include an enhancement that by itself fodder [ ḥafura ], becomes full ears, date flowers [ shalpufei ] become dates.
llm_translation: For the praise of the word: Chafura and Havu Shublei, Shalpufei and Havu Tamrei.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בָּרָאוּי כְּבַמּוּחְזָק, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי נִכְסֵי דַּאֲבִי אַבָּא.
human_translation: Nor in due as in in possession, to include property of the father’s father,
llm_translation: "And not fitting like a well-fortified structure, for the heirs of the property of Abba Abba."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין חוֹזְרִין בַּיּוֹבֵל — הַבְּכוֹרָה, וְהַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהַמְיַיבֵּם אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו.
human_translation: And these whose do not return in the Jubilee primogeniture and one who inherits his wife’s and one who consummates the levirate marriage with the wife of his brother
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the cases where one does not return in the Jubilee year - the firstborn, and one who inherits his wife, and one who performs the levirate marriage with his brother's wife.

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּתָּנָה — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַמַּתָּנָה כַּמֶּכֶר, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּם חוֹזְרִין בַּיּוֹבֵל, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ יַחְזִיר לִבְנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה, וִינַכֶּה מֵהֶן אֶת הַדָּמִים.
human_translation: And a gift the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: a gift like a sale, Rabbi Elazar says: All these return in the Jubilee Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: Even one who inherits his wife’s must return to the members of family and should deduct from them the monetary
llm_translation: The gift — the words of Rabbi Meir, and the Sages say: A gift is like a sale. Rabbi Eliezer says: All of them return in the Jubilee. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: Even one who inherits his wife shall return her to her family, and he shall take the blood from them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? מֶכֶר הוּא דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לֶיהְדַּר בַּיּוֹבֵל, מַתָּנָה וִירוּשָּׁה לָא. וְהָנֵי מִיְּרוּשָּׁה — יְרוּשָּׁה, דְּמַתָּנָה — מַתָּנָה. בְּכוֹר — ״לָתֶת לוֹ פִּי שְׁנַיִם״, מַתָּנָה קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir, It is a sale that the Merciful One states should be returned during the Jubilee a gift and an inheritance not And these from an inheritance an inheritance, and those from a gift a gift. a firstborn, “By giving him a double portion” the Merciful One calls a gift,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? It is a sale, as the Merciful One said to make it return in the Jubilee year, but not a gift or inheritance. And these, regarding inheritance — it is inheritance, regarding gift — it is a gift. Regarding the firstborn — "to give him a double portion," the Merciful One calls it a gift.

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְהַמְיַיבֵּם אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו — ״בְּכוֹר״ קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: And one who inherits his wife’s the inheritance of a husband by Torah law, And one who consummates the levirate marriage with the wife of his brother the Merciful One calls a firstborn,
llm_translation: The inheriting his wife, the inheritance of the husband is biblical, and the levirate marrying his brother's wife - "firstborn" is what the Merciful One calls it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מַתָּנָה כְּמֶכֶר. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? ״תָּשׁוּבוּ״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמַּתָּנָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: a gift like a sale, What is the reason of the Rabbis? “you shall return” to include a gift,
llm_translation: The sages say: A gift is like a sale. What is the reason of the Rabbis? "Return" - to include the gift.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי כּוּלְּהוּ יְרוּשָּׁה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And these are all an inheritance,
llm_translation: And these all are inheritance they.

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר אָמַר קְרָא: ״לָתֶת לוֹ פִּי שְׁנַיִם״, מַקִּישׁ חֵלֶק בְּכוֹרָה לְחֵלֶק פָּשׁוּט — מָה חֵלֶק פָּשׁוּט יְרוּשָּׁה, אַף חֵלֶק בְּכוֹרָה יְרוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: a firstborn, the verse states: “By giving him a double portion” juxtaposes the portion of the firstborn to the portion an ordinary Just as the portion an ordinary an inheritance, so too the portion of the firstborn an inheritance,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "The verse says regarding the firstborn: 'to give him a double portion,' equating the portion of the firstborn to the simple portion - just as the simple portion is inheritance, so too the portion of the firstborn is inheritance."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּם חוֹזְרִים בַּיּוֹבֵל. סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: ״תָּשׁוּבוּ״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמַּתָּנָה, וְהָנֵי כּוּלְּהוּ מַתָּנָה נִינְהוּ. בְּכוֹר — ״לָתֶת לוֹ פִּי שְׁנַיִם״, מַתָּנָה קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: All these return in the Jubilee holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who say “you shall return” to include a gift, and these are all gifts. a firstborn “By giving him a double portion.” the Merciful One calls a gift.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: All of them return in the Jubilee. He holds like the Rabbis who say: "Return" to include the gift, and all of them are considered gifts. Regarding the firstborn - "to give him double," the gift is called a mercy.

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ — יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּרַבָּנַן, וְהַמְיַיבֵּם אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו — ״בְּכוֹר״ קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: And one who inherits his wife’s the inheritance of a husband by rabbinic law, And one who consummates the levirate marriage with the wife of his brother the Merciful One calls a firstborn,
llm_translation: The one who inherits his wife - the inheritance of the husband according to the Rabbis, and one who performs levirate marriage with the wife of his brother - he is called "firstborn" by the Merciful One.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ לָקוֹחוֹת הֵן, וּמַחְזִירִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּיּוֹבֵל. מוֹתֵיב רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין חוֹזְרִין בַּיּוֹבֵל — הַבְּכוֹרָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Brothers who divided are purchasers And they must return to each other in the Jubilee Rav Hoshaya raises an objection And these whose do not return in the Jubilee the primogeniture.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Brothers who divided inheritances, they return to each other in the Jubilee. Rav Hoshaya objected: And these that do not return in the Jubilee - the birthright!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי ״אֵין חוֹזְרִין״ — אֵין חוֹזְרִין לְבַטָּלָה. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מִכְּלָל דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״חוֹזְרִין״ — חוֹזְרִין לְבַטָּלָה קָאָמַר?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to What They do not return? they do not return for naught, Rav Sheshet objects to this: By inference that the one who says returns is saying it returns for naught?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Elazar: What is "they do not return" - they do not return for nullification. Rav Sheshet objected to him: From the fact that one who says "they return" - they return for nullification, is he speaking?

hebrew_text: קָרֵי רַב חָמָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״טוֹבָה חׇכְמָה עִם נַחֲלָה״, וְלָא שְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ הָא דְּכִי אָתֵי רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ: מַאי ״חוֹזְרִין״ — חוֹזְרִין לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama read about Rav Sheshet: “Wisdom is good with an inheritance” Didn’t hear this that when Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan and some say Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua, What They return they return for naught,
llm_translation: Rav Chama read regarding Rav Sheshet: "Good is wisdom with an inheritance," but they did not accept from him. This is as when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said, and some say Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua: What is "they return"? - They return to nullity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַיּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ יַחְזִיר לִבְנֵי וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — אַמַּאי יַחְזִיר לִבְנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה? וְאִי קָסָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּרַבָּנַן — דָּמִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: Even one who inherits his wife’s must return to the members of What does hold? If he holds the inheritance of a husband by Torah law, why must he return to the members of family? And if he holds the inheritance of a husband by rabbinic law, what is the purpose of the money
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: Even one who inherits his wife shall return to the sons, etc. What does he hold? If he holds the inheritance of the husband is from the Torah - why should he return to the sons of the family? And if he holds the inheritance of the husband is Rabbinic - what can be done with the blood?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר יְרוּשַּׁת הַבַּעַל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹרִישַׁתּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וּמִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: לִשְׁקוֹל דְּמֵי וְלַיהְדַּר.
human_translation: Actually, holds the inheritance of a husband by Torah law, and what are we dealing with here? where his wife bequeathed to him graveyard. And due to a family flaw, the Sages said he should take money and return
llm_translation: Always he holds, inheritance of the husband of the Torah, and here with what are we dealing? For example, that he inherited his wife the burial chamber, and because of a blemish in the family, the Rabbis say: to take the money and to return.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹכֵר קִבְרוֹ, וְדֶרֶךְ קִבְרוֹ, מְקוֹם מַעֲמָדוֹ, וּבֵית הֶסְפֵּדוֹ — בָּאִים בְּנֵי מִשְׁפָּחָה וְקוֹבְרִים אוֹתוֹ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ, מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה. וּמַאי ״יְנַכֶּה לָהֶם מִן הַדָּמִים״? דְּמֵי קֶבֶר אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: And as it is taught one who sells his grave, or the path his grave, the place stand or the place of his eulogies, the members of family may come and bury him against wishes, due to a family flaw, And what And deduct for them of the monetary the monetary of his wife’s grave
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And as it was taught: One who sells his burial plot, and the path to his burial plot, the place of his standing, and his funeral house — the members of his family come and bury him against his will, due to the disgrace to the family. And what is meant by "let them take from the blood"? The value of his wife's burial plot. English translation:

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יֵשׁ בְּכוֹר.
llm_translation: We will return to you, there is a Bechor.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה נוֹהֵג בָּאָרֶץ וּבְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת, בַּחוּלִּין אֲבָל לֹא בַּמּוּקְדָּשִׁין. וְנוֹהֵג בַּבָּקָר וּבַצֹּאן, וְאֵינָן מִתְעַשְּׂרִים מִזֶּה עַל זֶה. בַּכְּבָשִׂים וּבָעִזִּים וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: animal tithe is in effect in Eretz and outside of Eretz in the presence of, the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple. with regard to non-sacred but not with regard to sacrificial And it is in effect with regard to the herd and the flock, but they are not tithed from one for the other; with regard to sheep and goats, and they are tithed from one for the other.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Tithing of animals is practiced both in the land of Israel and outside the land, whether in front of the house or not in front of the house, with common animals but not with consecrated animals. Tithing is practiced with cattle and with sheep, and they are not tithed from one upon the other. With regard to lambs and goats, they are tithed from one upon the other.

hebrew_text: בֶּחָדָשׁ וּבַיָּשָׁן, וְאֵינָן מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה. שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין, וּמָה אִם הֶחָדָשׁ וְהַיָּשָׁן שֶׁאֵינָן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה אֵינָם מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים שֶׁהֵן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְצֹאן״, מַשְׁמַע כׇּל צֹאן אֶחָד.
human_translation: with regard to the new and with regard to the old but they are not tithed from one for the other. As by right, it should be If new and the old which do not diverse kinds with each other are not tithed from one for the other, sheep and goats, which do diverse kinds with each other, is it not right that they will not be tithed from one for the other? the verse states: or the flock, all flock one
llm_translation: In the new and in the old, and they do not tithe from one on the other. Because it was in the judgment, and what if the new and the old that are not like each other, they do not tithe from one on the other, sheep and goats that are not like each other — is it not a judgment that they should not tithe from one on the other? The Talmud teaches: "And flocks," implying any flock is one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַעֲלֶה אָדָם מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ וְיַקְרִיבֶנּוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַהֲבֵאתֶם שָׁמָּה עֹלֹתֵיכֶם וְזִבְחֵיכֶם וְאֵת מַעְשְׂרֹתֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: might a person bring up animal tithe from outside of Eretz and sacrifice it the verse states: “And you shall bring there your burnt offerings, and your offerings, and your tithes,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, let us say the Mishnah is not like Rabbi Akiva? As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, "Is it possible for a person to bring tithes from an animal outside the land and offer it?" The Torah teaches: "And you shall bring there your burnt offerings and sacrifices and your tithes."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁתֵּי מַעַשְׂרוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אֶחָד מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן, מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, וּמִמְּקוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן אִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה!
human_translation: the verse is speaking of two tithes; one animal tithe, and one tithe of grain, from the place where you bring up tithe of grain, you bring up animal tithe; but from a place where you do not bring up tithe of grain, you do not bring up animal tithe
llm_translation: In two tithes the Scripture speaks, one tithe of livestock and one tithe of grain. From the place where you bring up the tithe of grain, you bring up the tithe of livestock, and from the place where you do not bring up the tithe of grain, you do not bring up the tithe of livestock!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כָּאן לִיקְרַב, כָּאן לִיקְדַּשׁ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָא נָסֵיב לַהּ תַּלְמוּדָא ״וַהֲבֵאתֶם שָׁמָּה״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Akiva, there to be sacrificed here to be consecrated. is also precise, adduces a derivation “and you shall bring there.” Conclude from
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva, here for proximity, here for sanctification. Precisely stated, for he engaged in the study of Torah, "And you shall bring there," learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָרֵב, אַמַּאי קָדוֹשׁ? לְנֶאֱכָל בְּמוּמוֹ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: If so, since is not sacrificed why is it consecrated? to be eaten by its owner when a blemish.
llm_translation: If so, since it is not close, why is it considered holy? To be eaten with its blemish by the owners.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי הַבַּיִת. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי! כִּדְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם יָתוֹם.
human_translation: in the presence of the Temple and not in the presence of the Temple. If so, even nowadays in accordance with of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: decree due to an orphan,
llm_translation: Before the house and not before the house. If so, even now also! Like Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: A decree due to the orphan.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי לָא! אֶלָּא, אֶפְשָׁר בְּהַכְרָזָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר בְּהַכְרָזָה!
human_translation: If so, originally, also not Rather, possible by an announcement Here too, possible by an announcement
llm_translation: So it is not so, from the outset, indeed not! Rather, it is possible through proclamation. Here too, it is possible through proclamation!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּלָה, וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְתַקָּלָה? דִּתְנַן: אֵין מַקְדִּישִׁין, וְאֵין מַעֲרִיכִין, וְאֵין מַחְרִימִין בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba says: due to a mishap And from where do you say that we are concerned for a mishap As we learned One may neither consecrate nor valuate nor dedicate in the present
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: Because of a concern, and where do we say that we are concerned about a concern? For we learned: One does not consecrate, and one does not appraise, and one does not declare something as cherem in this time.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הִקְדִּישׁ וְהֶעֱרִיךְ וְהֶחְרִים, בְּהֵמָה — תֵּיעָקֵר, פֵּירוֹת כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים — יֵרָקְבוּ, מָעוֹת וּכְלֵי מַתָּכוֹת — יוֹלִיךְ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח. וְאֵיזֶהוּ עִיקּוּר? נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת בְּפָנֶיהָ וְהִיא מֵתָה מֵאֵילֶיהָ.
human_translation: And if one did consecrate, or valuate, or dedicate an animal it should be destroyed. produce, garments, or vessels they decompose. money or metal vessels, he should take them into the Dead Sea. And what uprooting? He locks the door before it, and it dies on its own
llm_translation: And if he consecrated and appraised and banned, an animal — it shall be uprooted, its fruits, garments, and vessels — shall rot, coins and metal vessels — shall be thrown into the Dead Sea. And what is considered uprooting? Locking a door in its face while it is dying from within.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּכוֹר נָמֵי לָא לִיקְדֹּשׁ! בְּכוֹר בְּדִידַן תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא? בְּרֶחֶם קָדוֹשׁ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לִיקְנִינְהוּ לְאוּדְנַיְיהוּ לְגוֹיִם, דְּלָא לִיקְדֹּשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא!
human_translation: If so, a firstborn should also not be consecrated, matter a firstborn depend on us? consecrated upon the womb. this is saying: Let us sell the ears to gentiles that they are not consecrated from the outset.
llm_translation: So it is, a firstborn that is blemished is not fit for sanctification! Is the status of a firstborn dependent on this matter alone? In the womb it is holy! This is what he is saying: Let them be sold to non-Jews, for they are not fit for sanctification from the outset!

hebrew_text: אֶפְשָׁר כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מוּתָּר לוֹ לָאָדָם לְהַטִּיל מוּם בִּבְכוֹר קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם. הָכָא נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר דְּשָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא!
human_translation: possible in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, as Rabbi Yehuda says: permitted for a person to inflict a blemish upon a firstborn before it emerges into the air of the world. here too, it is possible to inflict a blemish from the outset,
llm_translation: It is possible according to Rav Yehudah, as Rav Yehudah said: It is permitted for a person to inflict a blemish on a firstborn before it emerges into the air of the world. Here too, it is possible that a blemish was inflicted upon it from the outset!

hebrew_text: מִי יָדַע הֵי נָפֵיק? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ בְּרֵישׁ עַשְׂרָה — ״לֹא יְבַקֵּר בֵּין טוֹב לָרַע״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: How know which emerge And if you would say that bring out at the head of ten the Merciful One states: “He shall not inquire whether it be good or bad”
llm_translation: Who knows if he will succeed? And if you will say that he will succeed within ten days - "He shall not inquire between good and bad," said the Merciful One.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אֶפְשָׁר דְּשָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ עֶדְרֵיהּ — מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּבָעֵינַן בְּהֵמָה לְהַקְרָבָה וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And if you would say it is possible to inflict a blemish on the entire herd soon the Temple will be rebuilt and we require animals for offerings, and none
llm_translation: And if you will say: Perhaps it is possible that a blemish is found in all its limbs, its organs - the Temple will quickly be rebuilt, and we need an animal for sacrifice, and there is none.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי בִּבְכוֹר בְּהֵמָה, מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּבָעֵינַן בְּהֵמָה לְהַקְרָבָה וְלֵיכָּא! אֶפְשָׁר בִּפְשׁוּטִין.
human_translation: here too, with regard to a firstborn animal, soon the Temple will be rebuilt and we require animals for offerings and none possible from ordinary
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: Regarding a firstborn animal, it shall be promptly built the Temple, and we require an animal for offering, and it is not available! It is possible to understand this straightforwardly.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר בִּלְקוּחִין! כֵּיוָן דְּאִיהוּ שָׁדֵי בֵּיהּ מוּמָא בְּכוּלֵּיהּ עֶדְרֵיהּ, וּשְׁכִיחִי מוּמֵי דְּפָסְילִי בְּקָדָשִׁים, דַּאֲפִילּוּ דּוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן נָמֵי פָּסְלִי — לָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: Here too, it is possible from purchased Since inflicts a blemish on all of his herd And blemishes that disqualify sacrificial are common, as even on the eyelid, it disqualifies not common
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Here, it is possible with purchases! Since he checks it for a blemish in all its limbs, and the blemishes that disqualify sacrifices are common, for even if they are as thin as a hair, they disqualify - they are not common.

hebrew_text: בַּחוּלִּין אֲבָל לֹא בַּמּוּקְדָּשִׁין. מוּקְדָּשִׁין — פְּשִׁיטָא, לָאו דִּידֵיהּ נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: with regard to non-sacred but not with regard to sacrificial obvious sacrificial they are not his.
llm_translation: In profane matters, but not in matters of sanctity. Matters of sanctity - it is obvious, they are not his!
