hebrew_text: בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים הֵם. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּמָעֲלָה מַעַל בַּה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים שֶׁהֵן מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא לִיעַשְּׂרוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: to offerings of lesser sanctity, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: Offerings of lesser sanctity are the monetary property of their owners, As it is taught “And he commits a trespass against the Lord” to include offerings of lesser sanctity which are the property of their owners. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. enter your mind to say should be tithed. teaches us
llm_translation: In holy things light, and in the view of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: Holy things light are the property of the owners. As it was taught: "And he shall be guilty in the Lord" - to include light holy things which are the property of the owners, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Would you think I would say they should tithe? This implies to us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! ״יִהְיֶה קֹּדֶשׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: But say it is indeed so, the Merciful One states: shall be sacred but not that is already sanctified,
llm_translation: And why not say it like this! "It shall be holy," said the Merciful One, and not that it is already holy.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״יִהְיֶה קֹּדֶשׁ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא חָיְילָא קְדוּשַּׁת מַעֲשֵׂר עִילָּוַיְהוּ? הַשְׁתָּא קְדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה אַקְּדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה לָא חָיְילָא, קְדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה אַקְּדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: The reason that the Merciful One writes: shall be sacred were that not I would say the sanctity of tithe take effect on now stringent sanctity does not take effect with regard to lesser sanctity, is necessary lesser sanctity does not take effect with regard to lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: Reason for which wrote Merciful One "shall be holy", this not so was I would say army holiness tithe its elevation? Now holiness severe holiness light not army, holiness light severe holiness light from where?!

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן: אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, אֵין מְשַׁנִּין אוֹתָם מִקְּדוּשָּׁה לִקְדוּשָּׁה, אֲבָל מַקְדִּישִׁין אוֹתָן הֶקְדֵּשׁ עִילּוּי, וּמַחְרִימִין אוֹתָן.
human_translation: What is this As we learned Both consecrated for the altar and consecrated for Temple maintenance, one cannot alter their from sanctity to sanctity. But one can consecrate consecration of its value, And one can dedicate
llm_translation: What is it? As we learned: One animal is consecrated for the altar and one animal is consecrated for the Temple courtyard; we do not interchange them from one sanctity to another sanctity, but we consecrate them with a higher sanctity and we render them devoted.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם, דְּכׇל בְּהֵמָה לָאו לְעוֹלָה קָיְימָא, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּכׇל בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר קָיְימָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאַקְדְּשַׁהּ — לָא פָּקַע אִיסּוּרָא דְּמַעֲשֵׂר מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: lest you say there, that not every animal stands to a burnt offering, But here, where every animal stands to tithe even though it is consecrated prohibition, of tithe is not abrogated from it.
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? There, because every animal is not designated for a burnt offering, but here, because every animal is designated for tithe, even though it has been consecrated, it does not annul its tithe prohibition.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? בְּ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ וּבְ״לֹא יִמָּכֵר״ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What difference is of: “It shall not be redeemed” and of: It shall not be sold teaches us
llm_translation: Regarding what does this matter arise? With regard to "he shall not redeem" and with regard to "he shall not sell," we have learned.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹהֵג בַּבָּקָר וּבַצֹּאן, וְאֵין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, בַּכְּבָשִׂים וּבָעִזִּים וְכוּ׳. וְיִהְיוּ חָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים שֶׁהֵם כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה — מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, חָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן שֶׁאֵינָן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּתְעַשְּׂרוּ מִזֶּה עַל זֶה?
human_translation: And is in effect with regard to the herd and the flock, but they are not tithed from one for the other; with regard to sheep and goats, Let the new the old can be tithed from one for the other, by an a fortiori And if sheep and goats, which are with each other diverse kinds, are tithed from one for the other, new and old which are not with each other diverse kinds, is it not logical that they should be tithed from one for the other?
llm_translation: And one may tithe from cattle and from sheep, and they do not tithe from one upon the other, in sheep and in goats, etc. And new and old animals tithe from one upon the other by way of analogy: And just as sheep and goats, which are similar to each other — they tithe from one upon the other, new and old which are not similar to each other — it is not the law that they should tithe from one upon the other.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר״ בִּשְׁתֵּי מַעַשְׂרוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אֶחָד מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן, וּמַקִּישׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן: מָה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן מֵחָדָשׁ עַל הַיָּשָׁן לֹא, אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה מֵחָדָשׁ עַל הַיָּשָׁן לֹא.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall tithe a tithe the verse is speaking of two tithes; one the animal tithe and one the grain tithe. And juxtaposes animal tithe to grain tithe, just as grain tithe not from the new for the old so too, animal tithe not from the new for the old
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Tithe you shall tithe" - the Scripture speaks of two tithes, one tithe of animals and one tithe of grain, and it compares the tithe of animals to the tithe of grain: Just as the tithe of grain does not renew upon the old, so too the tithe of animals does not renew upon the old.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים נָמֵי לֵימָא: מַקִּישׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן — מָה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן מִמִּין עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ לֹא, אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה מִמִּין עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ לֹא? רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״צֹאן״.
human_translation: If so, let us say sheep and goats too juxtaposes animal tithe to grain tithe: Just as grain tithe not from type for that is not its type, so too, animal tithe not from type for that is not its type. the Merciful One has amplified “flock”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, sheep and goats also let us say: He compares tithing of livestock to tithing of grain - just as tithing of grain is from its own species, not from a different species, so too tithing of livestock is from its own species, not from a different species? Rabbi Rachmana "flock."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן נָמֵי! הָא כְּתִיב ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר״. וּמָה רָאִיתָ? אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״שָׁנָה שָׁנָה״ — לְשָׁנָה הִקַּשְׁתִּיו, וְלֹא לְדָבָר אַחֵר.
human_translation: If so, also new old it is written: “You shall tithe a tithe” And what did you see Rava said the verse states: “Year by year” I have juxtaposed with regard to the year but not with regard to another matter.
llm_translation: So it is, new and old before him! Is it not written, "Tithe you shall tithe"? And what did you see? Rava said: The verse says, "Year by year" - I have compared it to a year, and not to something else.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין תּוֹרְמִין מִמִּין עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ, וְאִם תָּרַם — אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב יִצְהָר וְכׇל חֵלֶב תִּירוֹשׁ וְדָגָן״ — אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: תֵּן חֵלֶב לָזֶה וְחֵלֶב לָזֶה.
human_translation: We learned there One may not separate the portion of the produce designated for the priest [ teruma ] from type to that is not its type, and if one did separate teruma his teruma is not teruma . From where is this matter Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yannai says, and some say Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says, “All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the grain, The Torah says: Give the best, of this, and the best of that,
llm_translation: We learned there: One does not separate terumah from one species onto another species, and if one separated — his terumah is not terumah. From where do we derive these matters? Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yannai, and some say he said in the name of Rabbi Ammi who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: "All the fat of oil, and all the fat of new wine, and grain" — the Torah said: "Give the fat to this one and the fat to that one."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן תִּירוֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר, תִּירוֹשׁ וְדָגָן דָּגָן וְדָגָן מִנַּיִן? קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה תִּירוֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר שֶׁאֵינָן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה — אֵין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, תִּירוֹשׁ וְדָגָן דָּגָן וְדָגָן שֶׁהֵם כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעַשְּׂרוּ מִזֶּה עַל זֶה?
human_translation: We found wine and oil from where wine and grain grain and grain an a fortiori And if wine and oil, which are not diverse kinds with each other, may not be tithed from one for the other, wine and grain grain and grain, which are diverse kinds with each other, is it not logical that they may not be tithed from one for the other?
llm_translation: We find wine and oil, wine and grain, grain and grain, from where? A fortiori: And just as wine and oil, which are not similar to each other, do not tithe from one upon the other, wine and grain, grain and grain, which are similar to each other, it is not proper that they should not tithe from one upon the other.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיִּזְרַע חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְחַרְצָן בְּמַפּוֹלֶת יָד, הֵיכִי מַיְיתֵי לַהּ?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoshiya, who says until he sows wheat and barley and seed with a single hand motion. how does he derive
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yoshiyah, who said: Until one sows wheat, barley, and spelt in a hand's depth of a furrow, how does one fulfill it?

hebrew_text: מַיְיתֵי לַהּ הָכִי: וּמָה תִּירוֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר, שֶׁאֵינָן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה אֲפִילּוּ עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר — אֵין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה. תִּירוֹשׁ וְדָגָן דָּגָן וְדָגָן, שֶׁהֵן כִּלְאַיִם זֶה בָּזֶה עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעַשְּׂרוּ מִזֶּה עַל זֶה?
human_translation: he derives it in this manner: And if wine and oil, which are not diverse kinds with each other even by means of something else, they may not be tithed from one for the other, wine and grain grain and grain, which are diverse kinds with something else, is it not logical that they may not be tithed from one for the other?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection to this: And what about grape juice and olive oil, which are not similar to each other, yet even through another substance, they do not tithe from one on the other. Grape juice and wheat, wheat and wheat, which are similar to each other through another substance, it is not the law that they should not tithe from one on the other?

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵי מִינִין בְּעָלְמָא, מְנָלַן? הָנֵי דְּרַבָּנַן נִינְהוּ, וְכֹל דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּקִּינוּ: מָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא שְׁנֵי מִינִין אֵינָן מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, דְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי.
human_translation: but from where do we two species in general these by rabbinic and all that the Sages instituted, they instituted parallel to Torah law. just as by Torah law two species may not be tithed from one for the other, too, by rabbinic law
llm_translation: And two species in the world, from where are they? Those are of the Rabbis, and all that the Rabbis have instituted, they have instituted like the Torah: Just as the Torah, two species do not tithe from one upon the other, so too the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי מַעֲשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״וְכׇל מַעְשַׂר בָּקָר וּמַעֲשֵׂר צֹאן״,
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: If that is so, with regard to animal tithe, where it is not written And all the tithe of the herd or the tithe of the flock,
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, regarding tithe of an animal, since it is not written "and all the tithe of the herd and of the flock,"

hebrew_text: יִתְעַשְּׂרוּ מִזֶּה עַל זֶה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״הָעֲשִׂירִי״, תֵּן עֲשִׂירִי לָזֶה וְתֵן עֲשִׂירִי לָזֶה. אִי הָכִי, כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים נָמֵי? ״וָצֹאן״ מַשְׁמַע כׇּל צֹאן אֶחָד.
human_translation: let them be tithed from one for the other. said to him the verse states: “The tenth give the tenth from this, and give the tenth from that, If so, sheep and goats also “Or the flock,” means all are one flock
llm_translation: They should tithe from one upon the other! He said to him: The verse says "the tenth," give a tenth to this one and give a tenth to that one. If so, should sheep and goats also be mixed? "And flocks" implies all flocks are one.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי לֵימָא מַשְׁמַע כׇּל דָּגָן אֶחָד! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״רֵאשִׁיתָם״, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: ״רֵאשִׁיתָם״.
human_translation: Here too, let us say means all one grain, Abaye said “The first part of them” And Rabbi Ile’a says likewise “the first part of them”
llm_translation: Here it is taught: Let us say, it implies all one grain! Abaye said: "Their firstfruits," and so said Rabbi Ilai: "Their firstfruits."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא ״רֵאשִׁיתָם״ נָמֵי מַשְׁמַע כׇּל דָּגָן אֶחָד — לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ. בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם אָמְרִינַן: ״וָצֹאן״ מַשְׁמַע כׇּל צֹאן אֶחָד, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים נָמֵי — לִכְתּוֹב ״וְכׇל מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: Rava said without “the first part of them” also you cannot say means all one grain. Granted, there, we say “or the flock” means all are one flock. Because if it enters your mind sheep and goats also let write: And all the animal tithe,
llm_translation: Rava said: Without the word "reishit" also implies all one grain - you did not find it said. Granted there, we say: "and flock" implies all one flock, for if it entered your mind that sheep and goats also - it should have been written "and all tithe of cattle."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי כְּתִיב ״כׇּל מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה״, הֲוֵי אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ חַיָּה — ״תַּחַת״ ״תַּחַת״ מִקֳּדָשִׁים גָּמַר.
human_translation: And if you would say if had written: All the animal tithe, I would say even to undomesticated animals, derives from sacrificial under under
llm_translation: And if you will say: If it is written "every tithe of cattle," I might say even a wild animal - "under" "under" from holy things concludes.

hebrew_text: וְאָתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵחָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן, ״בָּקָר וָצֹאן״ לְמָה לִי? בָּקָר וָצֹאן הוּא דְּאֵין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, אֲבָל כְּבָשִׂים וְעִזִּים מִתְעַשְּׂרִין.
human_translation: And derive by an a fortiori from new and old why do I “The herds or the flock”? herds and flocks may not be tithed from one for the other, but sheep and goats, may be tithed
llm_translation: And comes with a fortiori from new and old, "cattle and sheep" - why do I need them? Cattle and sheep, for they do not tithe from one on the other, but lambs and goats tithe.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, מִי סַגִּיא דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״דָּגָן״? לְמַעוֹטֵי שְׁאָר מִינִין.
human_translation: But here, would it suffice if had not written: “Grain,” to exclude other types
llm_translation: But here, who is the great one that it is not written "grain"? To exclude other species.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אֵימָא לְעָרְבוּ לְבָקָר בְּצֹאן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרָבָא: אִית לֵיהּ נָמֵי ״הָעֲשִׂירִי״.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Naḥman, objects to this say that intermingle the herd with flock Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rava also accepts “The tenth
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rav Huna, son of Rav Nahman, objected to her: "Say that they should mix in the evening for the morning with the flock!" Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nahman, said to Rava: "It has the word 'the tenth' in it."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: בְּלֹא ״עֲשִׂירִי״ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ בָּקָר וָצֹאן מִתְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן — מָה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן מִמִּין עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ לָא, אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה מִמִּין עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ לָא.
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: without “The tenth you also cannot say a herd and a flock be tithed from one for the other, as animal tithe is juxtaposed to grain tithe: Just as grain tithe not from type for that is not its type, so too, animal tithe not from type for that is not its type.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava said: Without "a tenth" also, you did not find that you said, "cattle and sheep tithe from one upon the other," for the tithe of an animal is connected to the tithe of grain - just as the tithe of grain is not from its own species, so too the tithe of an animal is not from its own species.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: ״שָׁנָה״ לְשָׁנָה הִקַּשְׁתִּיו, וְלֹא לְדָבָר אַחֵר! הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵהַהִיא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: חֲדָא (מיניה) [מִינַיְהִי] רַב פָּפָּא אַמְרַהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t Rava who said “Year I have juxtaposed with regard to the year but not with regard to another matter, Rava retracted that And if you wish, say one of said Rav Pappa,
llm_translation: Rava said: "Year" to year I have challenged him, and not for another matter! Rava retracted from that. And if you wish, say: One of the students of Rav Papa said.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה מִצְטָרֵף כִּמְלֹא רֶגֶל בְּהֵמָה רוֹעָה, וְכַמָּה הִיא רֶגֶל בְּהֵמָה רוֹעָה? שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל. הָיוּ בֵּין אֵלּוּ לְאֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁנַיִם מִיל — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. הָיוּ לוֹ בָּאֶמְצַע — מֵבִיא וּמְעַשְּׂרָן בָּאֶמְצַע. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַיַּרְדֵּן מַפְסִיק לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: animal tithe join together than the distance that a grazing animal walk And how much is the distance that a grazing animal walks? sixteen mil . between these and those was thirty-two mil they do not join together. he had in the middle he brings and tithes them in the middle. Rabbi Meir says: The Jordan divides with regard to animal tithe,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Tithe of an animal combines like the filling of the foot of a grazing animal, and how much is the foot of a grazing animal? Sixteen mil. If there were between these and those thirty-two mil - they do not combine. If it was in the middle - one brings and tithes it in the middle. Rabbi Meir says: The Jordan River serves as a boundary for tithing animals.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: From where are these matters
llm_translation: Gemara: Gemara, who counts these words?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״עוֹד תַּעֲבֹרְנָה הַצֹּאן עַל יְדֵי מוֹנֶה״, וְקִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּשִׁיתְּסַר מִיל קָא שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא דְּרוֹעֶה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila said that the verse states: the flock shall again pass under the hands of him who counts them, And the Sages have tradition that the eye of the shepherd can see sixteen mil .
llm_translation: Rabba bar Sheilah said: As the verse states, "Yet the flocks shall pass again under the hands of the counter," and the Sages established that a span of twelve mil is the distance within which a shepherd may oversee.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ בֵּין אֵלּוּ לְאֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁנַיִם מִיל אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין וְכוּ׳. שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁנַיִם הוּא דְּאֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, הָא בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי מִצְטָרְפִין? וְהָא קָתָנֵי: שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל, טְפֵי לָא! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא סֵיפָא: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּאֶמְצַע — מֵבִיא וּמְעַשְּׂרָן בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: between these and those was thirty-two mil they do not join together. It is thirty-two that they do not join together, less than this join together. But teaches: Sixteen mil , And no more. because it wants to teach the latter clause: he had in the middle he brings and tithes them in the middle.
llm_translation: They were between these to these thirty and two mil do not combine, etc. Thirty and two that is that they do not combine, this in a field, from here do they combine? And this teaches: sixteen mil, it is not enough! Because it wants to teach the end: if he had in the middle — he brings and tithes them in the middle.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב: חָמֵשׁ מִכָּאן וְחָמֵשׁ מִכָּאן וְחָמֵשׁ מֵאֶמְצַע, דְּהָנֵי חָמֵשׁ חַזְיָא לְהָכָא וְחַזְיָא לְהָכָא.
human_translation: And how many Rav says: Five from here and five from there and five in the middle. that these five are fit with here and are fit with there,
llm_translation: And how much? Rav said: Five from here and five from here and five from the middle, for those five are seen here and seen here.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חָמֵשׁ מִכָּאן וְחָמֵשׁ מִכָּאן וְאֶחָד בָּאֶמְצַע, חָזֵינַן לְרוֹעֶה כְּמַאן דְּקָאֵי הָכָא, וְקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״מוֹנֶה״.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: Even five from here and five from there and one in the middle we see the shepherd as one who stands here and we apply “Who counts them”
llm_translation: Samuel said: Even if five are here and five are there, and one is in the middle, we regard the shepherd as if he were standing here, and we recite in it "Moneh."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיָה לוֹ חָמֵשׁ בִּכְפַר חֲנַנְיָה וְחָמֵשׁ בִּכְפַר עוֹתְנַי — אֵין מִצְטָרְפוֹת עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא לוֹ אַחַת בְּצִיפּוֹרִי. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב!
human_translation: raises an objection one had five in the village of ananya and five in the village of Otnai, they do not combine, unless he has one in Tzippori. a conclusive refutation of Rav
llm_translation: Challenger: He had five in the village of Hananya and five in the village of Otnai - they do not combine until he has one in Tsippori. A strong argument for Rav!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ תֵּשַׁע מִכָּאן וְתֵשַׁע מִכָּאן וְאַחַת בָּאֶמְצַע, דְּהַהִיא חַזְיָא לְהָכָא וְחַזְיָא לְהָכָא.
human_translation: Shmuel interpreted in accordance with of Rav. where he had nine from here and nine from there and one in the middle. as that is fit with here and is fit with there,
llm_translation: Samuel translated it in the house of Rav: For example, there were nine from here and nine from here and one in the middle, for that one sees here and that one sees here.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ רוֹעֶה מְצָרְפָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל רוֹעֶה מְצָרְפָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: And according to Shmuel even the shepherd combines And even the implements of the shepherd combine
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And according to Shmuel, even if one tends to the flock in Tzarfpan, and even if it is the vessel of one who tends to the flock in Tzarfpan.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: כַּלְבָּא דְּרוֹעֶה מַאי? כֵּיוָן דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ וְאָתֵי לָא מִצְטָרְפִי, אוֹ דִלְמָא זִימְנִין דְּלָא אָתֵי, וּמִצְטָרֵךְ אִיהוּ לְמֵיזַל וְאֵתֹיֵיהּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: What the dog of the shepherd Since call and it comes, not combine Or perhaps, sometimes does not come and himself must go and bring it, shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rav Ashi: What is the law regarding a dog that herds? Is it considered as if it is calling out to the animal and it comes, but they do not join together, or perhaps there are times when it does not come, and it needs to go and bring it? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַיַּרְדֵּן מַפְסִיק לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין שָׁם גֶּשֶׁר, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם גֶּשֶׁר — גֶּשֶׁר מְצָרְפָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: The Jordan divides to animal tithe, Rabbi Ami says: They taught only when there is no bridge there, but there is a bridge there, the bridge combines
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: The Jordan River separates for tithing of animals. Rabbi Ammi said: They only said this when there is no bridge there, but if there is a bridge there - the bridge joins them.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְיקָרְבָן הוּא. מֵיתִיבִי: הָיוּ לוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי עֶבְרֵי הַיַּרְדֵּן אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ, אוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אַבְטִילָאוֹת כְּגוֹן שֶׁל נָמֵר וְנָמוֹרִי — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ וָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Apparently, because is not close raises an objection one had on both sides of the Jordan here and there; or in two counties [ avtilaot ], e.g., Namer and Namori, do not combine, And needless to say, outside of Eretz and Eretz
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it not because they do not come close? The Gemara raises an objection: If one had animals on both sides of the Jordan River, going in opposite directions, or on two islands, such as a leopard and a tiger, they do not combine. Needless to say, it is unnecessary to mention if they are on opposite sides of the land and the land.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ וָאָרֶץ כִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ גֶּשֶׁר דָּמֵי, וְקָתָנֵי: לֹא מִצְטָרְפִין!
human_translation: But outside of Eretz and Eretz like a place that has a bridge, And teaches do not combine.
llm_translation: And this case of outside the land and the land is like a place that there is a bridge similar, and it teaches: they do not combine!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַיְינוּ טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיַּרְדֵּן יִגְבֹּל אֹתוֹ לִפְאַת קֵדְמָה״, הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאוֹ גְּבוּל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir: As the verse states: “And the Jordan was to be its border on the east side. the verse renders a border in and of itself.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is the reason of Rabbi Meir, as the verse states: "And the Jordan will be its border on the eastern side," the verse made it a boundary by itself.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וְתָאַר הַגְּבוּל״ ״וְעָלָה הַגְּבוּל״, הָכִי נָמֵי הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאוֹ גְּבוּל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: if that is so, “And the border was drawn “And the border went up also, the verse renders a border by itself.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, "and he shall draw the boundary" "and the boundary shall go up," thus the verse indeed made the boundary by itself!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״זֹאת תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם הָאָרֶץ לִגְבֻלֹתֶיהָ סָבִיב״, כּוּלַּהּ אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גְּבוּל אֶחָד הִיא.
human_translation: There, is different, as the verse states: this shall be your land according to its borders round about” all of Eretz Yisrael is one border,
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "This shall be to you the land with its borders all around," meaning the entire Land of Israel is one border.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, יַרְדֵּן נָמֵי! ״אֶרֶץ״ — וְלֹא יַרְדֵּן.
human_translation: If so, the Jordan also land,” but not Jordan
llm_translation: If so, the Jordan is also considered! "Eretz" - and not the Jordan.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״יַרְדֵּן״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי — לִיתְנִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ נְהָרוֹת! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, this that the teaches: The Jordan But according to Rabbi Ami, let teach with regard to all rivers difficult.
llm_translation: In Shlama to Rabbi Chiya bar Abba - that is what is taught "Yarden", rather to Rabbi Amei - it should have taught all rivers to them! Difficult.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״כִּי אַתֶּם עֹבְרִים אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן אַרְצָה כְּנָעַן״, ״אַרְצָה״ — אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, וְלֹא הַיַּרְדֵּן אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan” “into the land” the land of Canaan but the Jordan is not the land of Canaan; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: "When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan," "land" - the land of Canaan, and not the Jordan is the land of Canaan, the words of Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״מֵעֵבֶר לְיַרְדֵּן יְרֵחוֹ קֵדְמָה מִזְרָחָה״, מָה יְרֵחוֹ אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן, אַף יַרְדֵּן אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: states beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise” Just as Jericho the land of Canaan, so too, the Jordan the land of Canaan.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: "Behold, it says, 'From beyond the Jordan, towards the east, Jericho' - just as Jericho is part of the land of Canaan, so too is the Jordan part of the land of Canaan."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין ״יַרְדֵּן״ אֶלָּא מִבֵּית יְרֵחוֹ וּלְמַטָּה. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אִילֵּימָא לְנוֹדֵר — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ ״יַרְדֵּן״ אִיתְּסַר לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Jordan only from Beit Jericho and below, With regard to what halakha If we say for one who takes a vow, follow language of people. And anywhere that call Jordan, it is prohibited for him Rather, for animal tithe.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The Jordan River is only from Jericho and below. For what practical halakha is this relevant? If you say for a vow — one should follow the language of people, and wherever they call it "Jordan," it is considered as such! Rather, it is for tithing animals.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יַרְדֵּן יוֹצֵא מִמְּעָרַת פַּמְיָיס, וּמְהַלֵּךְ בְּיַמָּהּ שֶׁל סִיבְכִי, וּבְיַמָּהּ שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא, וּבְיַמָּהּ שֶׁל סְדוֹם, וְהוֹלֵךְ וְנוֹפֵל לַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל, וְאֵין ״יַרְדֵּן״ אֶלָּא מִבֵּית יְרִיחוֹ וּלְמַטָּה.
human_translation: That is also taught Jordan issues forth from the Cave of Pamyas and flows via the Sea of Sivkhi, and via the Sea of Tiberias, and via the Sea of Sodom, and continues and falls to the Great Sea. But it is Jordan only from Beit Jericho and below,
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The Jordan River emerges from the cave of Pamias, and it flows through the sea of Sivkhi, and through the sea of Teverya, and through the sea of Sedom, and it continues and falls into the great sea, and the term "Jordan" refers only to the area from Beit Yericho and southward.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״יַרְדֵּן״? שֶׁיּוֹרֵד מִדָּן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַתּוּן מֵהָתָם מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן מֵהָכָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ, ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ (לוֹ) לְלֶשֶׁם דָּן בְּשֵׁם דָּן אֲבִיהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לֶשֶׁם זוֹ פַּמְיָיס, וְתַנְיָא: יוֹצֵא יַרְדֵּן מִמְּעָרַת פַּמְיָיס.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why is called Jordan? Because it descends [ yored ] from Dan. Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: You learned from there, We learn it from here: and called Leshem: Dan, after the name of Dan their father” And Rabbi Yitzḥak says this Leshem Pamyas. And it is taught the Jordan emerges from the Cave of Pamyas.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Why is it called "Jordan"? Because it descends from Dan. Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: You learn it from there, and we learn it from here, "And they called (him) Dan in the name of Dan their father." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Dan is Pamyas, and it was taught: Jordan emerges from the cave of Pamyas.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: זַכְרוּתֵיהּ דְּיַרְדְּנָא מִמְּעָרַת פַּמְיָיס, הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר: ״לָא שָׁתֵינָא מַיִם מִמְּעָרַת פַּמְיָיס״ — אִיתְּסַר לֵיהּ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ יַרְדְּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: The source of the Jordan from the Cave of Pamyas. where says: I will not drink water from the Cave of Pamyas, it is prohibited for him from the entire Jordan
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: The remembrance of the Jordan River is from the cave of Pamais, where it is said: "We did not drink water from the cave of Pamais" - the Jordan River is forbidden in all its entirety.

hebrew_text: זַכְרוּתָא דִּדְמָא — כַּבְדָּא, כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כָּבֵד שֶׁנִּימּוֹחַ — מְטַמֵּא בִּרְבִיעִית.
human_translation: The source of blood is the liver. in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A liver that dissolved, imparts impurity of a quarter-
llm_translation: Memory of blood - like the liver, as Rabbi Yitzchak said: Rabbi Yitzchak said: A liver that is removed - renders impure in the fourth degree.

hebrew_text: זַכְרוּתָא דְּמַיָּא — פְּרָת, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַנּוֹדֵר מִמֵּימֵי פְּרָת — אָסוּר בְּכׇל מֵימוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: The source of the water Euphrates as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one who takes a vow the waters of the Euphrates it is prohibited from any water in the world.
llm_translation: Memory of water - Euphrates, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who vows from the waters of the Euphrates - is prohibited in all the waters of the world.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר ״לָא שָׁתֵינָא מִמֵּימֵי דִּפְרָת״ — מֵי פְרָת הוּא דְּלָא שָׁתֵינָא, הָא מִנַּהֲרָא אַחֲרִינָא שָׁתֵינָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where he says: I will not drink from the water of the Euphrates it is the waters of the Euphrates that he may not drink, he may drink from another river,
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say, 'We did not drink from the waters of the Euphrates' - it is the waters of the Euphrates that we did not drink, but we drank from another river."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּאָמַר: ״לָא שָׁתֵינָא מִמַּיִם דְּאָתוּ מִפְּרָת״, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַנְּהָרוֹת לְמַטָּה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה נְהָרוֹת, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה נְהָרוֹת לְמַטָּה מִפְּרָת. וְהָאִיכָּא
human_translation: Rather, where he says: I will not drink from water that comes from the Euphrates as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: All the rivers are below, from, three rivers: And three rivers are below from the Euphrates But there are
llm_translation: Rather, as it was stated: "I did not drink from the waters that came from the Euphrates," as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: All rivers below three rivers, and three rivers below the Euphrates. And what is the reason?

hebrew_text: עֵינָתָא דְּמִידַּלְּיָין! אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הָנְהוּ סוּלָּמֵי דִּפְרָת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: springs that are higher Rav Mesharshiyya said: These are ladders of the Euphrates,
llm_translation: The spring of wine! Rav Mesharshya said: These are the ladders of Persia.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְהַנָּהָר הָרְבִיעִי הוּא פְרָת״!
human_translation: But isn’t it written: And the fourth river is the Euphrates”
llm_translation: And behold, it is written: "And the fourth river is the Euphrates"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הוּא פְּרָת דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said, and some say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov It is the Euphrates that initially
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and some say Rav Acha bar Yaakov: He is the cow of the main city.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: ״יוּבַל״ שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה כְּעֵץ שָׁתוּל עַל מַיִם וְעַל יוּבַל יְשַׁלַּח שׇׁרָשָׁיו״, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״פְּרָת״? שֶׁמֵּימָיו פָּרִים וְרָבִים.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Meir says: Yuval is the name of as it is stated: “For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, and that spreads out its roots by the river [ yuval ], And why is it named Euphrates [ perat ]? Because its waters are fruitful [ parim ] and multiply
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: "Yovel" is its name, as it is stated: "And he shall be like a tree planted by streams of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season." And why is it called "Perat"? Because its waters bear fruit abundantly.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נַהְרָא מִכֵּיפֵיהּ מִיבְּרִיךְ. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב אַמֵּי אָמַר רַב: מִיטְרָא בְּמַעְרְבָא סָהֲדָא רַבָּה פְּרָת.
human_translation: supports of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: The river is blessed from its riverbed; And disagrees of Rav, as Rav Ami says Rav says: rain in the West, the great witness the Euphrates,
llm_translation: He assists him to Shmuel, for Shmuel said: The river from its banks blesses. And it is a dispute of Rav, for Rav Ammi said in the name of Rav: Rain in the west is a great testimony.

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל עָבֵיד לְהוּ לִבְנָאתֵיהּ מִקְוֶה בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן, וּמַפָּצֵי בְּיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי. מִקְוֶה בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן — סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב אַמֵּי אָמַר רַב: מִיטְרָא בְּמַעְרְבָא סָהֲדָא רַבָּה פְּרָת, שֶׁמָּא יִרְבּוּ נוֹטְפִין עַל הַזּוֹחֲלִין, וְהָווּ לְהוּ מֵי גְשָׁמִים רוּבָּא.
human_translation: Shmuel’s father fashioned a ritual bath for his daughters during the days of Nisan, and mats during the days of Tishrei a ritual bath during the days of Nisan, he holds in accordance with Rav, as Rav Ami says Rav says: rain in the West, the great witness the Euphrates. perhaps that fell would exceed flowing and the rainwater would be the majority.
llm_translation: The father of Shmuel would make a mikveh for his son in the days of Nisan, and he would spread it out in the days of Tishrei. Making a mikveh in the days of Nisan - he thought like Rav, for Rav Amei said in the name of Rav: If rain falls in the west, a large amount of water will gather, lest the drops fall on the creeping creatures, and they will have mostly rainwater.

hebrew_text: וּמַפָּצֵי בְּיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And mats during the days of Tishrei,
llm_translation: And they spread out in the days of Tishrei.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דִּידֵיהּ אַדִּידֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הַמַּיִם נִטְהָרִים בְּזוֹחֲלִין אֶלָּא פְּרָת בְּיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And of disagrees himself As Shmuel says: Waters purify when flowing, only Euphrates during the days of Tishrei.
llm_translation: And the dispute between them, between him and him, for Samuel said: The water does not become purified by a worm except for the Euphrates in the days of Tishrei.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַלּוֹקֵחַ, אוֹ שֶׁנִּיתַּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — פָּטוּר מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: One who purchases or that was given to him as a gift exempt from animal tithe.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who acquires, or to whom is given as a gift — is exempt from tithing on livestock.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּתֶּן לִּי כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְשֹׁרְךָ לְצֹאנֶךָ״,
human_translation: From where is this matter Rav Kahana says that the verse states: The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me. So you shall do with your oxen, and with your sheep:
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of these words? Rav Kahana said: As the verse states, "The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me, so you shall do with your ox, with your sheep."

hebrew_text: מָה בָּנֶיךָ — אֵין בְּלָקוּחַ וּבְמַתָּנָה, אַף צֹאנְךָ וּבְקָרְךָ — אֵינוֹ בְּלָקוּחַ וּבְמַתָּנָה.
human_translation: Just as your son not purchased or as a gift, so too, your flock and your herd not to purchased or as a gift.
llm_translation: Your sons - not in a document and in a gift, also your flocks and your cattle - not in a document and in a gift.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בִּבְכוֹר כְּתִיב! אָמַר קְרָא: ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה״, אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לִבְכוֹר, דְּלָא אִיתֵיהּ בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה, דִּבְרֶחֶם קָדוֹשׁ — תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: But this is written with regard to a firstborn, the verse states: “So you shall do If is not for matter of firstborn which do not any action as consecrated when the womb, apply it to the matter of animal tithe,
llm_translation: And this case of the firstborn is it written! The verse says: "So you shall do," if it is not a matter for the firstborn, for it is not included in the action, for it is a matter of sanctity — give it the status of tithing for animals.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְחַטָּאת וּלְאָשָׁם! דּוּמְיָא דְּבִנְךָ — מָה בִּנְךָ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּא עַל חֵטְא, אַף צֹאנְךָ וְשׁוֹרְךָ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּא עַל חֵטְא.
human_translation: But say apply the matter of a sin offering and a guilt offering similar to Your son. Just as your son does not come for a sin, so too, Your sheep and your oxen, which does not come for a sin.
llm_translation: And why not? Give it the status of a sin offering and a guilt offering! Similar to your son - just as your son who does not come upon sin, so too your flock and your cattle that do not come upon sin.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְעוֹלָה וְלִשְׁלָמִים! דּוּמְיָא דְּבִנְךָ — מָה בִּנְךָ שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּא בְּנֶדֶר וּנְדָבָה, אַף צֹאנְךָ וְשׁוֹרְךָ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: But say apply the matter of a burnt offering and a peace offering, similar to Your son. Just as your son cannot come of a vow or a gift, so too, Your sheep and your oxen,
llm_translation: And why not? Give it as a matter for a burnt offering and for peace offerings! Resembling your son - just as your son who does not come with a vow and a freewill offering, so too your flock and your cattle, etc.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה! דּוּמְיָא דְּבִנְךָ — מָה בִּנְךָ שֶׁאֵין קָבוּעַ לוֹ זְמַן, אַף שׁוֹרְךָ וְצֹאנְךָ שֶׁאֵין קָבוּעַ לוֹ זְמַן.
human_translation: But say apply the matter of a burnt offering of appearance, similar to Your son. Just as your son does not have a fixed time so too: Your oxen and your sheep, which does not have a fixed time
llm_translation: And why not? Give it the status of an elevation offering for the purpose of appearance! Similar to your son - just as your son, for whom a fixed time is not established, so too your ox and your sheep, for which a fixed time is not established.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה בִּנְךָ אֵינוֹ בְּלָקוּחַ כְּלָל, אַף שׁוֹרְךָ וְצֹאנְךָ אֵינוֹ בְּלָקוּחַ כְּלָל, אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָקַח עֲשָׂרָה עוּבָּרִין בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן — כּוּלָּם נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר?
human_translation: If Just as your son cannot be purchased at all, so too, your oxen and your sheep not be purchased at all. why Rabbi Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: purchased ten fetuses in their mothers’ wombs they all enter the pen to be tithed?
llm_translation: If what is your son not in the purchase at all, also your ox and your sheep not in the purchase at all, why did Rabbi Assi say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one takes ten unborn animals in the womb of their mother - all of them enter the pen to become wealthy?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״ — בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה מִיעֵט הַכָּתוּב.
human_translation: Rava said the verse states: you shall do The verse excludes at the time of doing,
llm_translation: Rava said, the verse says: "You shall make" - at the time of making, the Scripture limits.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָקַח עֲשָׂרָה עוּבָּרִים בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן — כּוּלָּן נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ אוֹ שֶׁנִּיתַּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה פָּטוּר מִן מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה!
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: purchased ten fetuses in their mothers’ wombs they all enter the pen to be tithed. But didn’t we learn One who purchases or that was given to him as a gift exempt from animal tithe?
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan said: If one takes ten unborn animals in the womb of their mother - all of them enter the pen to become tithed. But we learned: One who takes or receives as a gift is exempt from tithing on livestock!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲזַאי בְּחֶילְמָא, מִילְּתָא מְעַלְּיָא אָמֵינָא. אָמַר קְרָא ״תַּעֲשֶׂה״, בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה מִיעֵט הַכָּתוּב. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַלָּקוּחַ חָל עַל מְחוּסַּר זְמַן!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: I saw Rabbi Yoḥanan in a dream, I am saying a proper matter The verse states: you shall do” the verse excludes at the time of doing, Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim raised an objection to Rabbi Elazar a purchased applies to whose time has not yet
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yochanan saw in a dream, a matter beyond me I say. The verse says "you shall make," at the time of making, the Scripture minimizes. Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer raised an objection to Rabbi Elazar: A purchase is effective even with a lack of time!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זוֹ אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה, וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר מִשְׁנָה — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה הִיא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: מְחוּסַּר זְמַן נִכְנָס לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, וַהֲרֵי הוּא כִּבְכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ — אַף מְחוּסַּר זְמַן קָדוֹשׁ לִפְנֵי זְמַנּוֹ וְקָרֵב לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: said to This is not a tannaitic source And if you say is a tannaitic source it is Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda in the name of Rabbi Shimon, who says whose time has not yet enters the pen to be tithed, and like a firstborn Just as a firstborn is sanctified before its time but is sacrificed after its time, so too, whose time has not yet is sanctified before its time but is sacrificed after its time,
llm_translation: He said to him: This is not a Mishnah, and if you find to say Mishnah - Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda it is from Rabbi Shimon, for he said: One who is lacking time enters the chamber to become wealthy, and he is like a firstborn. Just as a firstborn is holy before his time and close after his time, so too one lacking time is holy before his time and close after his time.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: אֵיזֶהוּ אֶתְנַן שֶׁנִּכְנָס לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר? כֹּל שֶׁנְּתָנוֹ לָהּ וְחָזַר וּלְקָחוֹ הֵימֶנָּה. וְהָא אִיפְּסִיל לֵיהּ בְּלוֹקֵחַ!
human_translation: A tanna taught in the presence of Rav: Which payment that it enters the pen to be tithed? Any that he gave to her and subsequently purchased from her. But doesn’t it disqualified as a purchased
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav: Who is a person that enters the chamber to become wealthy? Anyone who gives to her and then takes from her. But if he takes without giving, he will be invalidated as a buyer!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָקַח עֲשָׂרָה עוּבָּרִין בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן — כּוּלָּם נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר.
human_translation: this escaped As Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: purchased ten fetuses in their mothers’ wombs they all enter the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "His wife's jewelry, that which Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one places ten coins in his mother-in-law's entrails - all of them enter the chamber to become enriched."

hebrew_text: וְתִיעַשְּׂרֵהּ אִיהִי! בְּזוֹנָה גּוֹיָה.
human_translation: But Let her tithe it to a gentile prostitute,
llm_translation: "And she shall be redeemed! With a non-Jewish prostitute."

hebrew_text: וְלוֹקְמַהּ בְּזוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית, וְתִיעַשְּׂרֵהּ אִיהִי! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּזוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית לָא הָוֵי אֶתְנַן.
human_translation: But let establish involving a Jewish prostitute, and let she tithes it teaches us that a Jewish prostitute does not payment
llm_translation: And he shall be fined for a Jewish prostitute, and she shall be tithed! It is heard to us that a Jewish prostitute is not given.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה — אֶתְנַנָּהּ אָסוּר, וְכֹהֵן הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״. זוֹנָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִית — אֶתְנַנָּהּ מוּתָּר, וְכֹהֵן הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״.
human_translation: in accordance with of Abaye, as Abaye says: a gentile prostitute payment prohibited And a priest who engages in intercourse with is not flogged due to And he shall not profane his seed a Jewish prostitute payment permitted But a priest who engages in intercourse with is flogged due to “And he shall not profane his seed
llm_translation: As Abaye said: A non-Jewish prostitute - her payment is forbidden, and a priest who engages with her is not liable for the prohibition of "he shall not profane his offspring." An Israelite prostitute - her payment is permitted, and a priest who engages with her is liable for the prohibition of "he shall not profane his offspring."

hebrew_text: זוֹנָה גּוֹיָה אֶתְנַנָּהּ אָסוּר — גָּמַר ״תּוֹעֵבָה״ ״תּוֹעֵבָה״ מֵעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: a gentile prostitute payment prohibited derives “abomination” “abomination” in those with whom relations are forbidden:
llm_translation: A gentile prostitute, her hire is forbidden - he concluded "abomination" "abomination" from forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: מָה עֲרָיוֹת, דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשֵׁי — אַף זוֹנָה, בְּהָךְ דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשֵׁי.
human_translation: Just as those with whom relations are forbidden upon betrothal does not take effect, so too, prostitute is one upon betrothal does not take effect,
llm_translation: The forbidden relationships that do not acquire through them sanctity - also a prostitute, in that she does not acquire through her sanctity.

hebrew_text: וְכֹהֵן הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״, דְּלֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהַאי לָאו זַרְעֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: And a priest who engages in intercourse with her is not flogged due to “And he shall not profane his seed the Merciful One states that he should not profane his seed, and this are not his seed,
llm_translation: The kohen who has relations with her is not lashed on account of "he shall not profane his offspring," for "he shall not profane his offspring" the Merciful One has said, and this one is not his offspring.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאַחִין וְהַשּׁוּתָּפִין, שֶׁחַיָּיבִין בַּקָּלְבּוֹן — פְּטוּרִין מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, חַיָּיבִין בְּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַקָּלְבּוֹן.
human_translation: brothers and partners, when they are obligated to the premium [ bakalbon ] they are exempt from animal tithe. are obligated to animal tithe are exempt from the premium.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Brothers and partners, who are obligated in the calf - are exempt from tithing animals; those obligated in tithing animals - are exempt from the calf.

hebrew_text: קָנוּ מִתְּפִיסַת הַבַּיִת — חַיָּיבִין, וְאִם לָאו — פְּטוּרִין. חָלְקוּ, חָזְרוּ וְנִשְׁתַּתְּפוּ — חַיָּיבִין בַּקָּלְבּוֹן וּפְטוּרִין מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: acquired from the possession of house they are obligated but if not, they are exempt. they divided and then reentered a partnership, they are obligated to the premium and are exempt from animal tithe.
llm_translation: They acquired from the enclosure of the house - obligated, and if not - exempt. They divided, returned, and intermingled - obligated in the penalty and exempt from tithing of animals.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יִהְיֶה לְךָ״ — וְלֹא שֶׁל שׁוּתָּפוּת. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ קָנוּ בִּתְפִיסַת הַבַּיִת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִהְיֶה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught shall be yours but not by partners. might even if acquired from the possession of house. verse states: “Shall be,”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "It shall be for you" — and not for partnership. Could one even acquire with the grasp of the house? The Talmud teaches: "It shall be."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בִּבְכוֹר כְּתִיב! אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לִבְכוֹר, דְּהָא אִיתֵיהּ בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְכוֹרוֹת בְּקַרְכֶם וְצֹאנְכֶם״, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: But this written with regard to firstborn If it is not for the matter of firstborn as does in partnership, as it is written, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock” apply to the matter of animal tithe,
llm_translation: And this, the firstborn, it is written! If it is not a matter for the firstborn, because it is included in partnership, as it is written: "And the firstborn of your herd and flock," give it the status of tithe for animals.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: פְּעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיבִין בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁפְּטוּרִין מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, פְּעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיבִין בַּקָּלְבּוֹן וּפְטוּרִין מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיבִין בְּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקָּלְבּוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: times when they are obligated in this, and in that, And times when they are exempt from this and from that. times when they are obligated to the premium and are exempt from animal tithe; and times when they are obligated in animal tithe and are exempt from the premium.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Sometimes they are obligated in this and this, and sometimes they are exempt from this and this, sometimes they are obligated in the "kalbon" and exempt from tithing animals, and sometimes they are obligated in tithing animals and exempt from the "kalbon."

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבִין בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה — שֶׁחָלְקוּ בַּכְּסָפִים וְלֹא חָלְקוּ בַּבְּהֵמָה, פְּטוּרִין מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה — שֶׁחָלְקוּ בַּבְּהֵמָה וְלֹא חָלְקוּ בַּכְּסָפִים.
human_translation: they are obligated in this, and in that, when they divided the money but did not divide the animals they are exempt from this and from that when they divided the animals but did not divide the money.
llm_translation: Obligated in this and in this - that they divided in the money and did not divide in the animal, exempt from this and from this - that they divided in the animal and did not divide in the money.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבִין בַּקָּלְבּוֹן וּפְטוּרִין מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה — שֶׁחָלְקוּ בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: they are obligated to the premium and are exempt from animal tithe when they divided this and that,
llm_translation: They are obligated in the calf and exempt from tithing of animals - because they divided in this and in this.

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבִין בְּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקָּלְבּוֹן — שֶׁלֹּא חָלְקוּ בְּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: they are obligated in the animal tithe and are exempt from the premium who have not divided this or that,
llm_translation: Obligated in tithe in animal and exempt from penalty - for they did not share in this and in that.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! חָלְקוּ בַּבְּהֵמָה וְלֹא חָלְקוּ בַּכְּסָפִים אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּחָלְקוּ בַּבְּהֵמָה, גַּלּוֹ דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ דִּלְמִיפְלַג קָיְימִי, וְלִיחַיְּיבוּ בְּקָלְבּוֹן — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? was necessary for they divided the animals but did not divide the money. enter your mind to say since they divided the animals they revealed their intent stands to be divided, and they should be obligated the premium. teaches us
llm_translation: The Gemara states: "It is obvious! If they divided the animal but did not divide the money, it is necessary for him. It is evident in your mind, I say: Since they divided the animal, it is revealed that their minds are not in agreement, and they are liable for damages - this is what is implied to us."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁחָלְקוּ גְּדָיִים כְּנֶגֶד תְּיָישִׁים וּתְיָישִׁים כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִים.
human_translation: Rav Anan says: taught only where they divided kids for goats and goats for kids,
llm_translation: Rav Anan said: They only taught that they divided the goats opposite the ewes, and the ewes opposite the goats.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חָלְקוּ גְּדָיִים כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִים וּתְיָישִׁים כְּנֶגֶד תְּיָישִׁים — אוֹמֵר זֶה חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: But they divided kids for kids and goats for goats, say this, is his share to which he is entitled from the outset,
llm_translation: But divided goats against goats and lambs against lambs - says this is his portion who arrives from the first hour for this.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חָלְקוּ גְּדָיִים כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִים וּתְיָישִׁים כְּנֶגֶד תְּיָישִׁים — אֵין אוֹמְרִים זֶה הוּא חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says: Even they divided kids for kids and goats for goats, we do not say this, is his share to which he is entitled from the outset.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even if the goats were divided, corresponding to goats, and the sheep corresponding to sheep - we do not say, "This is his portion that reaches him from the first hour for this."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁחָלְקוּ תִּשְׁעָה כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה, וַעֲשָׂרָה כְּנֶגֶד תִּשְׁעָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: taught only when they divided nine for ten and ten for nine
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: They only taught that they divided nine against ten, and ten against nine.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חָלְקוּ תִּשְׁעָה כְּנֶגֶד תִּשְׁעָה וַעֲשָׂרָה כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה — אוֹמֵר זֶה חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: But they divided nine for nine and ten for ten say this, is his share to which he is entitled from the outset,
llm_translation: But they divided nine against nine and ten against ten - this one says, "This is the portion that reaches from the first hour, therefore."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חָלְקוּ תִּשְׁעָה כְּנֶגֶד תִּשְׁעָה, וַעֲשָׂרָה כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה, אֵין אוֹמֵר זֶה חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even they divided nine for nine and ten for ten not say this, is his share to which he is entitled from the outset.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if they divided nine against nine, and ten against ten, one does not say, "This is his portion that reaches from the first hour and on."

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ — לָקוֹחוֹת הֵן, וּמַחְזִירִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּיּוֹבֵל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning As Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Brothers who divided are purchasers and they must return to each other in the Jubilee
llm_translation: And it was established, Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning, as Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The brothers who divided - they are considered as purchasers, and they return one to the other in the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דּוּמְיָא דְּבִנְךָ, מָה בִּנְךָ בְּבָרוּר לָךְ, אַף שׁוֹרְךָ וְצֹאנְךָ בְּבָרוּר לָךְ; אֲבָל שָׂדֶה מֶכֶר הוּא דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לֶיהְדַּר בְּיוֹבֵל, יְרוּשָּׁה וּמַתָּנָה לָא!
human_translation: And are necessary. As, if he had taught us here, in this Rabbi Yoḥanan says similar to your son, Just as your son is clear to you so too, your cattle and your sheep is clear to you, But a field, it is sold that the Merciful One states should return it in the Jubilee is an inheritance or a gift not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear here, in this case, what Rabbi Yochanan said, "Similar to your son," just as your son is clear to you, so too your ox and your sheep are clear to you; but a field of sale is what the Merciful One said should return in the Jubilee, inheritance and gift, no!

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שָׂדֶה — לְחוּמְרָא, אִי נָמֵי לְכַתְּחִלָּה, אֲבָל הָכָא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us a field to be stringent. Alternatively, in the beginning. But here, say not is necessary
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear 'field' - to be stringent, if you will, to begin with, but here - I would say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְכֵן הַשּׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ, אֶחָד נָטַל עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶחָד נָטַל תִּשְׁעָה וָכֶלֶב — שֶׁכְּנֶגֶד הַכֶּלֶב אֲסוּרִין, שֶׁעִם הַכֶּלֶב מוּתָּרִים. וְאִם אָמְרַתְּ יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה, לִיבְרוֹר חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ לְבַהֲדֵי כֶלֶב וְלִשְׁקוֹל, וְהָנָךְ לִישְׁתְּרוֹ!
human_translation: raises an objection And similarly partners who divided one took ten and one took nine and a dog, in exchange for the dog is prohibited. that with the dog are permitted And if you say there is designation, Let him select one of to correspond to the dog and take it and these should be permitted.
llm_translation: Challenger: And similarly, partners who divided, one took ten and one took nine and a dog - that against the dog are forbidden, that with the dog are permitted. And if you say there is free choice, to choose one of them for the dog and to weigh, and the rest to be released!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי דְּשָׁווּ כּוּלְּהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי — הָכִי נָמֵי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דְּלָא שָׁווּ כּוּלְּהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי, וְשָׁוֵי הַאי כַּלְבָּא חַד וּמַשֶּׁהוּ, וְהַאי מַשֶּׁהוּ מָשֵׁיךְ וְאָתֵי בְּכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: If where they are all equal to each other, indeed Here, we are dealing with where they are not all equal to each other, but the value of this dog is one and amount and draws this amount, between all of
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: If they were all equal to Hadadei - it is so said, here with what are we dealing? That they were not all equal to Hadadei, and this one equal to one dog and something, and this something pulls and comes with all.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, חוּץ מִן כִּלְאַיִם, וּטְרֵפָה, וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, וּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן, וְהַיָּתוֹם. וְאֵיזֶהוּ יָתוֹם? כֹּל שֶׁמֵּתָה אִמָּהּ שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ יָלְדָה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נִשְׁחֲטָה אִמָּהּ וְהַשֶּׁלַח קַיָּים — אֵין זֶה יָתוֹם.
human_translation: All enter the pen to be tithed, except for from diverse kinds, a tereifa ; born by caesarean section; whose time has not yet and an orphan. And what is an orphan? any whose mother died was slaughtered and thereafter giving birth Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even if its mother was slaughtered but its hide exists this is not an orphan.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All may enter the chamber to become wealthy, except for Kilayim, and a Tereifah, and a Yotzei Dofen, and one lacking time, and an orphan. And who is considered an orphan? Anyone whose mother died after she was slaughtered and then gave birth. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even if his mother was slaughtered and his father is alive — he is not considered an orphan.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שׁוֹר אוֹ כֶשֶׂב״ — פְּרָט לְכִלְאַיִם, ״אוֹ עֵז״ — פְּרָט לְנִדְמֶה, ״כִּי יִוָּלֵד״ — פְּרָט לְיוֹצֵא דוֹפֶן, ״וְהָיָה שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ — פְּרָט לִמְחוּסַּר זְמַן, ״תַּחַת אִמּוֹ״ — פְּרָט לְיָתוֹם.
human_translation: From where are these matters, As the Sages taught “a bull or a sheep” exclude from diverse kinds; “or a goat” exclude resembles “when…is born” exclude born by caesarean section; “then it shall be seven days” exclude whose time has not yet “under its mother” exclude an orphan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What do these words come to include? For the Rabbis taught: "An ox or a sheep" - excluding hybrids, "or a goat" - excluding a substitute, "when it is born" - excluding a stillborn, "and it shall be seven days" - excluding a premature, "under its mother" - excluding an orphan.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״תַּחַת הַשָּׁבֶט״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״תַּחַת אִמּוֹ״. מָה לְהַלָּן — פְּרָט לְכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אַף כָּאן — פְּרָט לְכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ. וּמָה כָּאן — פְּרָט לִטְרֵפָה, אַף לְהַלָּן — פְּרָט לִטְרֵפָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says is stated here, under the rod” and is stated there, “Under its mother” Just as there, exclude all these categories, so too here, exclude all these categories. And just as here, exclude a tereifa , so too there, exclude a tereifa .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: It is stated here "under the rod," and it is stated there "under his mother." Just as there, it is a specific exclusion for all these names, so too here, it is a specific exclusion for all these names. And just as here, it is a specific exclusion for a treifah, so too there, it is a specific exclusion for a treifah.

hebrew_text: ״הַכֹּל״, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹבֵעַ, וְהַנִּרְבָּע, וְהַמּוּקְצֶה, וְהַנֶּעֱבָד, וְהָאֶתְנַן, וְהַמְחִיר, וְטוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — כּוּלָּן נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס אֵין נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר.
human_translation: What All, to include? to include this that the Sages taught an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, or set aside or was worshipped or payment or price or a tumtum , or a hermaphrodite, all of these enter the pen to be tithed Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: A tumtum and a hermaphrodite do not enter the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: "The all", for what? For the what of this that the Rabbis taught: the square, and the round, and the cornered, and the woven, and the twisted, and the priced, and the sealed, and the Androginus - all of them enter into the chamber to become rich. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: the sealed and the Androginus do not enter into the chamber to become rich.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, אִי גָּמַר ״תַּחַת״ ״תַּחַת״ מִקֳּדָשִׁים — הָנֵי נָמֵי לָא, וְאִי לָא יָלֵיף — הָנֵי מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: But the tanna of our if he derives “Under” “Under” from sacrificial these also not And if he does not derive from where these
llm_translation: Our Mishnaic source, if one learned "tachat" "tachat" from the holy texts - these are fitting, and if not, what will they derive from them?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם גָּמַיר, וְהָנֵי רַחֲמָנָא רַבִּינְהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מׇשְׁחָתָם בָּהֶם מוּם בָּם לֹא יֵרָצוּ לָכֶם״, וְתָאנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ הַשְׁחָתָה, אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Actually, derive but these are included by the Merciful One As it is written because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them” and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Anywhere that Corruption, is stated, is nothing other than a matter of licentiousness and idol worship.
llm_translation: Forever learn, and these are the words of the Merciful, as it is written: "For their corruption is in them, blemish is in them, they are not pleasing to you." And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any place where corruption is mentioned, it is nothing but a matter of illicit relations and idol worship.

hebrew_text: דְּבַר עֶרְוָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הִשְׁחִית כׇּל בָּשָׂר אֶת דַּרְכּוֹ עַל הָאָרֶץ״, עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״פֶּן תַּשְׁחִיתוּן וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לָכֶם פֶּסֶל תְּמוּנַת כׇּל סָמֶל תַּבְנִית זָכָר אוֹ נְקֵבָה״.
human_translation: a matter of licentiousness, as it is written for all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth” And idol worship, as it is written: “Lest you deal corruptly, and make you a graven image, the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The matter of forbidden relationships — as it is written: "For all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth." The matter of idolatry — as it is written: "Lest you corrupt yourselves and make a graven image, the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female."

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁהַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בּוֹ — דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה פּוֹסְלִין בּוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין הַמּוּם פּוֹסֵל בּוֹ — אֵין דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה פּוֹסְלִין בּוֹ, וְהַאי מַעֲשֵׂר הוֹאִיל וְלָא פָּסֵיל בֵּיהּ מוּמָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יְבַקֵּר בֵּין טוֹב לָרַע וְלֹא יְמִירֶנּוּ״ — דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נָמֵי לָא פָּסֵיל בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And any where a blemish disqualifies a matter of licentiousness or idol worship also disqualifies it. And where a blemish does not disqualify a matter of licentiousness or idol worship does not disqualify it. And this tithe, since a blemish does not disqualify it, as it is written: “He shall not inquire whether it be good or bad, neither shall he change it” a matter of licentiousness or idol worship also does not disqualify it.
llm_translation: "And all that the blemish disqualifies in it — a matter of nakedness and foreign worship disqualify in it, and all that the blemish does not disqualify in it — a matter of nakedness and foreign worship do not disqualify in it. And this tithe, since it is not disqualified by a blemish, as it is written: 'He shall not inquire whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it' — a matter of nakedness and foreign worship indeed do not disqualify in it."

hebrew_text: רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע — דְּבַר עֶרְוָה, מוּקְצֶה וְנֶעֱבָד — עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְאֶתְנַן — דְּבַר עֶרְוָה, וּמְחִיר אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְאֶתְנַן,
human_translation: An animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality a matter of licentiousness. set aside and was worshipped idol worship. And payment a matter of licentiousness, and price is juxtaposed to payment
llm_translation: Quarter and half - a matter of nakedness, measured and mixed - foreign worship, and Etanan - a matter of nakedness, and the price is attached to Etanan.

hebrew_text: טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — קָסָבַר: סְפֵיקָא הוּא.
human_translation: a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, holds it is uncertain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tumtum ve'androgynos — kasavar: sefekah hu.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר. קָסָבַר סְפֵיקָא הוּא, מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי קָדָשִׁים — זָכָר וַדַּאי וּנְקֵבָה וַדָּאִית, וְלֹא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. מַעֲשֵׂר נָמֵי גְּמַר ״תַּחַת״ ״תַּחַת״ מִקֳּדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says He holds that uncertainty, the Merciful One excluded with regard to sacrificial a definite male or a definite female but not a tumtum or a hermaphrodite. tithe too, derives “under” “under” from sacrificial
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says: He holds that it is a doubt, the Merciful One is stringent regarding holy things - male and definitely female, and not hermaphrodites and tumtums. Regarding tithes, he concludes "under" "under" from holy things.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר, חוּץ מִן הַכִּלְאַיִם וְהַטְּרֵפָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִישׁ כְּפַר בַּרְתּוֹתָא שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲנִי שָׁמַעְתִּי הֵימֶנּוּ אַף יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן וּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן וְיָתוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught All enter the pen to be tithed except for from diverse kinds, and a tereifa ; the statement of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yehuda, of the village of Bartota, who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Akiva said: I heard from that born by caesarean section and whose time has not yet and an orphan also
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All may enter the chamber to become wealthy, except for the forbidden mixtures and the torn animals, the words of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yehuda of Kefar Bartota who said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Akiva said: I have heard from him even the case of a double-sided coin, and one lacking time, and an orphan.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, אִי גָּמַר ״תַּחַת״ ״תַּחַת״ מִקֳּדָשִׁים — הָנֵי נָמֵי לָא, וְאִי לָא גָּמַר, בִּשְׁלָמָא טְרֵפָה — ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲבֹר תַּחַת הַשָּׁבֶט״ כְּתִיב, פְּרָט לִטְרֵפָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת, אֶלָּא כִּלְאַיִם מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And the first tanna of If he derives “under” “under” from sacrificial these also not And if he does not derive granted, a tereifa it is written: “Whatever passes under the rod” excludes a tereifa , as it does not pass But from where from diverse kinds
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna, if he completed "under" "under" from the holy things - those are valid, and if he did not complete, with regard to a treifah - "whatever passes under the rod" is written, excluding a treifah that does not pass under, rather how does he establish it?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם גָּמַר, וּבְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן —
human_translation: Actually, he does derive But born by caesarean section
llm_translation: Forever finish, and in the going out of the dove —

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: יוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן — וָלָד מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: he holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says born by caesarean section is a full-fledged offspring And not in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: He thought according to Rabbi Shimon, who said: "One who produces a dove - it is a child from above, and not like Rabbi Yochanan."

hebrew_text: בִּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה, יָתוֹם — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהַשֶּׁלַח קַיָּים, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שָׁחַט אֶת אִמּוֹ וְהַשֶּׁלַח קַיָּים — אֵין זֶה יָתוֹם.
human_translation: with regard to whose time has not yet holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, an orphan where hide exists And Rabbi Yehoshua, to his reasoning, as he says: Even if its mother was slaughtered but its hide exists this is not an orphan.
llm_translation: In a case of lacking time, he holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, an orphan - for example, where the messenger is established, and Rabbi Yehoshua agrees with his reasoning, as he said: Even if he slaughtered his mother and the messenger is established - this is not considered an orphan.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן סַתְרִיאֵל מֵעַרְקַת לִבְנָה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי: בִּמְקוֹמֵנוּ מַפְשִׁיטִין אֶת הַמֵּתָה וּמַלְבִּישִׁין אֶת הַחַי. אָמַר רַבִּי: נִתְגַּלָּה טַעְמָהּ שֶׁל מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael ben Satriel, from Arkat Leveina, testified before Rabbi In our locale, they flay the dead and clothe the living Rabbi said: reveals the reason for the mishna
llm_translation: The Rabbi Ishmael ben Satriel testified from the town of Livnah before the Rabbi: "In our place, we undress the dead and dress the living." The Rabbi said: "The reason for our Mishnah has been revealed."

hebrew_text: חֲזֵירִין שֶׁבִּמְקוֹמֵנוּ יֵשׁ לָהֶם שִׁשִּׁים רִבּוֹא קְלָפִים בְּבֵית הֶמְסֵס שֶׁלּוֹ, פַּעַם אַחַת נָפַל אֶרֶז אֶחָד שֶׁבִּמְקוֹמֵנוּ, וְעָבְרוּ שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה קְרוֹנוֹת עַל חוּדּוֹ אַחַת.
human_translation: The lettuce in our locale has 600,000 leaves in its omasum, Once one cedar fell in our locale, and sixteen wagons passed over its back, one,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Pigs in our place have sixty myriads of litters in his dungheap, once one cedar fell in our place, and sixteen of its branches passed over one pit."

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת נָפְלָה בֵּיצַת בַּר יוֹכָנִי, וְטִבְּעָה שִׁשִּׁים כְּרַכִּים, וְשִׁבְּרָה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת אֲרָזִים. וּמִי שָׁדְיָא לֵיהּ? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״כְּנַף רְנָנִים נֶעֱלָסָה״! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָהוּא מוּזַרְתָּא הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Once an egg of bar yokhani fell, and drowned sixty cities and broke three hundred cedar And does throw But isn’t it written: “The kenaf renanim bird rejoices, Rav Ashi said That was unfertilized,
llm_translation: Once, the egg of Bar Yochnai fell, and it submerged sixty kor of water, and it broke three hundred cedars. And who could withstand it? But isn't it written: "As the wing of fowls that fly"? Rav Ashe said: That was a rare occurrence.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שָׁלֹשׁ גֳּרָנוֹת לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה: בִּפְרַס הַפֶּסַח, וּבִפְרַס הָעֲצֶרֶת, וּבִפְרַס הֶחָג, וְהֵן גֳּרָנוֹת שֶׁל מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: three gathering for animal tithe: Adjacent to Passover, and adjacent to Shavuot , and adjacent to Sukkot . And those are the gathering for animal tithe; the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three granaries for tithing animals: at the Pesach festival, at the Shavuot festival, and at the Sukkot festival. And these are the granaries for tithing animals, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בַּאֲדָר, בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן, בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן, בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל. וְלָמָה אָמְרוּ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל וְלֹא אָמְרוּ בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעַשֵּׂר בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לְפִיכָךְ הִקְדִּימוּהוּ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל.
human_translation: Ben Azzai says On the twenty-ninth of Adar, on the first of Sivan, on the twenty-ninth of Av. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say On the first of Nisan, on the first of Sivan, on the twenty-ninth of Elul. And why did say the twenty-ninth of Elul, and did they not say the first of Tishrei? due to that is festival and one cannot tithe on a Festival. Consequently, they brought it earlier, to the twenty-ninth of Elul.
llm_translation: Ben Azai says: On the twenty-ninth of Adar, on the first of Sivan, on the twenty-ninth of Av. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: On the first of Nissan, on the first of Sivan, on the twenty-ninth of Elul. Why did they say on the twenty-ninth of Elul and not on the first of Tishrei? Because it is a festival day, and it is not possible to fast on a festival day — therefore they advanced it to the twenty-ninth of Elul.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בְּאֶחָד בֶּאֱלוּל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: הָאֱלוּלִים מִתְעַשְּׂרִים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: the new year for animal tithe is on the first of Elul. Ben Azzai says: Elul are tithed by themselves,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: On the first of Elul is the New Year for tithing animals. Ben Azzai says: The Elulites tithe themselves.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַנּוֹלָדִים מֵאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִצְטָרְפִין. חֲמִשָּׁה לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה לְאַחַר רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — אֵינָן מִצְטָרְפִין. חֲמִשָּׁה לִפְנֵי הַגּוֹרֶן וַחֲמִשָּׁה לְאַחַר הַגּוֹרֶן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִצְטָרְפִין. אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרוּ שָׁלֹשׁ גֳּרָנוֹת לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה? שֶׁעַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ הַגּוֹרֶן — מוּתָּר לִמְכּוֹר וְלִשְׁחוֹט, הִגִּיעַ הַגּוֹרֶן — לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט, וְאִם שָׁחַט — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: all that are born from the first of Tishrei until the twenty-ninth of Elul, those join together. five before Rosh HaShana and five after Rosh HaShana, do not join together. five before gathering and five after gathering, those join together. If so, why were three stated gathering for animal tithe? that until the gathering arrives permitted to sell and slaughter the gathering arrives one may not slaughter but if he slaughtered exempt.
llm_translation: All born from the first of Tishrei until the twenty-ninth of Elul — they combine. Five before Rosh Hashanah and five after Rosh Hashanah — they do not combine. Five before the threshing floor and five after the threshing floor — they combine. If so, why were three threshing floors mentioned regarding tithing animals? Because until it reaches the threshing floor — it is permitted to sell and slaughter, once it reaches the threshing floor — it may not be slaughtered, and if it was slaughtered — one is exempt.
