hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא תְּלָת? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: לָקֳבֵל חוּרְפֵי, וְאַפְלֵי, וְקַיְיטֵי.
human_translation: What is different three Rabba bar Sheila said: to collect early and later and summer.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between three? Rabba bar Sheilah said: To receive insults, and to befall, and to cut.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּהָנֵי זִימְנֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִיָּיא אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ:
human_translation: And what is different about these times, Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rav Ḥiyya, of the village of Akko, says:
llm_translation: "What is different about these times?" Rabbi Tanhum son of Rav Hiyya, a man of Kefar Akko, said:

hebrew_text: כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא בְּהֵמָה מְצוּיָה לְעוֹלֵי רְגָלִים.
human_translation: so that animals will be available to ascending for the pilgrimage Festivals.
llm_translation: According to the Talmudic text: "In order that there should be an animal available for the festival pilgrims."

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּתְנַן: עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ הַגּוֹרֶן מוּתָּר לִמְכּוֹר וְלִשְׁחוֹט — נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיתְעֲבִיד מִצְוָה בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר לִזְבּוֹן וְלֵיכוֹל.
human_translation: And even though we learned Until the gathering arrives, permitted to sell and slaughter prefers to perform a mitzva with his money, and afterward sell or eat
llm_translation: And even though we learned: until the threshing floor is reached, it is permitted to sell and slaughter - it is preferable for him not to perform a mitzvah with his money, and instead to buy and eat.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״גּוֹרֶן״? דְּטָבְלָה כְּגוֹרֶן.
human_translation: And why does call goren , that renders untithed produce on a threshing floor,
llm_translation: And why is it called "Goren"? Because it is immersed like a goren.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה ״פְּרָס״? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵין פְּרָס פָּחוֹת מֵחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם.
human_translation: And how much is adjacent [ peras ]? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, explained adjacent not less than fifteen days.
llm_translation: "And how much is a 'pars'? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, explained: A 'pars' is no less than fifteen days."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: ״פְּרוֹס״ — פַּלְגָא. פַּלְגָא דְּמַאי? פַּלְגָא דְּהִלְכוֹת פֶּסַח, כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹאֲלִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין בְּהִלְכוֹת פֶּסַח קוֹדֶם לְפֶסַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: From where inferred? Rabbi Abbahu said peros half. Half of what? Half of the halakhot of Passover, like that which is taught One asks and teaches the halakhot of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two weeks
llm_translation: What is implied? Rabbi Avahu said: "Peros" - half. What is the half of what? The half of the laws of Passover, as it was taught: One may inquire and expound on the laws of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two Sabbaths.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בַּאֲדָר, בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וּבֶן עַזַּאי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לְנִיסָן זִימְנִין מָלֵא וְזִימְנִין חָסֵר, זִימְנִין דְּמִיקְּלַע בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים וְזִימְנִין דְּמִיקְּלַע בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן. וּבֶן עַזַּאי סָבַר: אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לְנִיסָן לְעוֹלָם חָסֵר, הִילְכָּךְ קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בַּאֲדָר.
human_translation: ben Azzai says on the twenty-ninth of Adar, on the first of Sivan, With regard to what do Rabbi Akiva, and ben Azzai, disagree? Rabbi Akiva holds Adar that precedes Nisan is sometimes a full and sometimes a defective sometimes occurs on the thirtieth and sometimes it occurs on the twenty-ninth Due to that does not fix a time And ben Azzai holds Adar that precedes Nisan is always defective. Therefore, he fixes a time on the twenty-ninth of Adar.
llm_translation: Ben Azzai says: On the twenty-ninth of Adar, on the first of Sivan. With what do Rabbi Akiva and Ben Azzai disagree? Rabbi Akiva holds: Adar, which is adjacent to Nisan, sometimes has a full count of days and sometimes lacks, sometimes it occurs on the thirtieth day and sometimes on the twenty-ninth, and therefore its time is not fixed. Ben Azzai holds: Adar, which is adjacent to Nisan, always lacks, therefore its time is fixed on the twenty-ninth of Adar.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן — אַיְּידֵי דְּלָא נְפִישִׁי, אִי אָמְרַתְּ לִיקַדֵּים לִיעַשַּׂר — עַד דְּמָטֵי רֶגֶל שָׁלְמִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: the first of Sivan, since not many if you say that should tithe earlier, before the pilgrimage Festival arrives completed.
llm_translation: On the first of Sivan - since they are not inferior, if you say to sanctify, to tithe - until the completion of the entire foot to them.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב וְכוּ׳. בֶּן עַזַּאי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: הָאֱלוּלִין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: on the twenty-ninth of Av, ben Azzai to his reasoning, as he said: The in Elul are tithed by themselves,
llm_translation: On the twenty-ninth of Av, etc. Ben Azzai according to his reasoning, as he said: "These gourds tithe themselves."

hebrew_text: וְלִיעַשְּׂרִינְהוּ בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים! זִימְנִין דִּמְחַסְּרִין לֵיהּ לְאָב, וּבָעֵינַן לְמִיעְבַּד הֶכֵּירָא בְּחָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן.
human_translation: But let one tithe on the thirtieth day Sometimes of Av is defective, And we are required to implement a distinction between the new and the old
llm_translation: And to tithe them on the thirtieth day! Sometimes they are lacking for the father, and we need to recognize the new and the old wine.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן וְכוּ׳. בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן — כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת. בְּאֶחָד בְּסִיוָן — כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say on the first of Nisan, on the first of Sivan, On the first of Nisan, in accordance with of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says two weeks on the first of Sivan, as we said
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: On the first of Nisan, on the first of Sivan, etc. On the first of Nisan - like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said: two Sabbaths. On the first of Sivan - as we have said.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאָמְרִי: בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: on the twenty-ninth of Elul, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon to their reasoning, as they say: On the first of Tishrei new year for animal tithe.
llm_translation: On the twenty-ninth of Elul - Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon according to their reasoning, as they said: On the first of Tishrei is the New Year for tithing of animals.

hebrew_text: וְלָמָה אָמְרוּ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב וְכוּ׳. וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ, דְּבָעֵינַן לְמֶעְבַּד הֶכֵּירָא בְּחָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן!
human_translation: And why did say the twenty-ninth of Elul and did they not say the first of Tishrei? due to that is festival But let derive it that we require a distinction between the new and the old
llm_translation: And why did they say on the twenty-ninth of Elul, and not on the first of Tishrei? Because it is a festival day, and so forth. And let it come out, for we require to make the recognition of the new moon both fresh and old!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר, חֲדָא — דְּבָעֵינַן לְמִיעְבַּד הֶכֵּירָא בְּחָדָשׁ וְיָשָׁן, וְעוֹד — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעַשֵּׂר בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִשּׁוּם סְקַרְתָּא.
human_translation: states one and another. One that we require a distinction between the new and the old And another because it is festival and one cannot tithe on a Festival, due to the sakreta ,
llm_translation: One and furthermore he said, one - that we require to distinguish between new and old wine, and furthermore - because it is a festival day, and it is impossible to tithe on a festival day due to suspicion.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בְּאֶחָד בֶּאֱלוּל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי: הוֹאִיל וְהַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים כָּךְ, וְהַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים כָּךְ — הָאֱלוּלִין מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: the new year for animal tithe is on the first of Elul. Ben Azzai says: it is taught ben Azzai said: Since these say this, and those, say that the Elul are tithed by themselves.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: On the first of Elul is the New Year for tithing animals. Ben Azzai says, etc. It was taught: Ben Azzai said: Since these say this, and those say that - these tithe for themselves.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּמַאן מִסְתַּבַּר! וְכִי תֵּימָא: לָא מָצֵי קָאֵי אַטַּעְמַיְיהוּ, וְהָתַנְיָא: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דּוֹמִין עָלַי כִּקְלִיפַּת הַשּׁוּם חוּץ מִן הַקֵּרֵחַ הַזֶּה!
human_translation: But let see whose opinion reasonable, And if you would say it is not possible to establish their reasoning, But it is taught ben Azzai says: All the Sages of Israel appear to me as garlic peel, except for this bald
llm_translation: And to see the reason of whom it is logical! And if you will say: he cannot stand to their taste, and it was taught: Ben Azzai says: All the sages of Israel are like the peel of garlic except for this bald one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה אֲמָרוּהָ, מִפִּי חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says they said by tradition, from Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: From the tradition it was said, from the mouth of Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: בְּאֵיזֶה צַד אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי הָאֱלוּלִים מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְעַצְמָן? נוֹלְדוּ לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה בְּאָב וַחֲמִשָּׁה בֶּאֱלוּל — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, חֲמִשָּׁה בֶּאֱלוּל וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּתִשְׁרִי — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, חֲמִשָּׁה בְּתִשְׁרִי וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּאָב מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: It is taught In what manner ben Azzai say Elul are tithed by themselves? five were born in Av and five in Elul, they do not combine five in Elul and five in Tishrei, they do not combine. five in Tishrei and five in Av, they do combine.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: On which side did Ben Azzai say that the Elulians tithe for themselves? If five were born to him in Av and five in Elul — they do not combine; five in Elul and five in Tishrei — they do not combine; five in Tishrei and five in Av do combine.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּמַפְסְקִי שָׁנִים, מַפְסְקִי גֳּרָנוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious; lest you say just as years separate gathering separate teaches us
llm_translation: "Interjection! What is the reasoning, that just as they separate years, they separate throats, it is heard to us."

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה לְאַחַר רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, חֲמִשָּׁה לִפְנֵי הַגּוֹרֶן וַחֲמִשָּׁה לְאַחַר הַגּוֹרֶן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: as we learned five before Rosh HaShana and five after Rosh HaShana, do not combine five before gathering and five after gathering, those combine
llm_translation: As we have learned: Five before Rosh Hashanah and five after Rosh Hashanah - do not combine. Five before the winepress and five after the winepress - these do combine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְדִבְרֵי בֶּן עַזַּאי, נוֹלְדוּ לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה בְּאָב וַחֲמִשָּׁה בֶּאֱלוּל וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּתִשְׁרִי, כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר,
human_translation: Rava says: According to the statement of ben Azzai, five were born in Av and five in Elul and five in Tishrei, gathers them in a pen to be tithed,
llm_translation: Rava said: According to the words of Ben Azai, he was born on the fifth of Av, and five on Elul, and five on Tishrei, he gathers them into the barn to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹטֵל אֶחָד מִן הָאֱלוּלִין וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִין, מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי בְּאֶחָד בֶּאֱלוּל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — דֶּאֱלוּל וְתִשְׁרִי מִצְטָרְפִין וּדְאָב פְּטוּרִים, וְאִי בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — דְּאָב וֶאֱלוּל מִצְטָרְפִין דְּתִשְׁרִי פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: and he takes one of in Elul and the remainder are exempt, whichever you If the new year is on the first of Elul, in Elul and Tishrei combine and in Av are exempt, And if the new year is on the first of Tishrei, in Av and Elul combine in Tishrei are exempt.
llm_translation: And he takes one from the Elulin and the rest are exempt, from what is your soul: if on the first of Elul Rosh Hashanah - for Elul and Tishrei combine and Adar are exempt, and if on the first of Tishrei Rosh Hashanah - Adar and Elul combine and Tishrei are exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרַתְּ: לִצְטַרְפוּ לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר? עֲשִׂירִי וַדַּאי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא סָפֵק.
human_translation: What are you saying? Let them combine another gathering the Merciful One states: a definite tenth and not an uncertain tenth,
llm_translation: What do you say: to join another threshing floor? The tenth, for sure, the Merciful One said, and not a doubt.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לִגְזוֹר, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְמִישְׁקַל מֵהָנָךְ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious lest you say should decree perhaps he come to take from those teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What is the reasoning for decreeing, perhaps it will come to be weighed against this, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּאֵי זֶה צַד מְעַשְּׂרִין? כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר, וְעוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם פֶּתַח קָטָן כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ שְׁנַיִם יְכוֹלִין לָצֵאת כְּאֶחָת, וּמוֹנִין: אֶחָד, שְׁנַיִם, שְׁלֹשָׁה, אַרְבָּעָה, חֲמִשָּׁה, שִׁשָּׁה, שִׁבְעָה, שְׁמוֹנָה, תִּשְׁעָה, וְהַיּוֹצֵא עֲשִׂירִי סוֹקֵר בְּסִיקְרָא וְאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי זֶה מַעֲשֵׂר״. לֹא סְקָרוֹ בְּסִיקְרָא, וְלֹא מְנָאָן בַּשֵּׁבֶט, אוֹ שֶׁמְּנָאָן רְבוּצִים אוֹ עוֹמְדִים — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מִתְעַשְּׂרִין.
human_translation: In what manner does one tithe He gathers them in a pen and provides them with a small, opening, so that two will not be able to emerge together. And he counts One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine; and he paints that emerges tenth with red paint and declares: This is tithe. he did not paint it with red paint, or if he did not count with a rod or if he counted prone or standing these are tithed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In what case are tithes gathered? When one gathers them into a chamber and makes for them a small opening, so that two bundles can exit at once. And one counts: one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, and the tenth one who exits examines in a basket and says, "Behold, this is a tithe." If he did not examine in a basket, and did not count with a rod, or if he counted while lying down or standing — these are considered as having tithed.

hebrew_text: הָיָה לוֹ מֵאָה וְנָטַל עֲשָׂרָה, עֲשָׂרָה וְנָטַל אֶחָד — אֵין זֶה מַעֲשֵׂר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַעֲשֵׂר. קָפַץ אֶחָד מִן הַמְּנוּיִין לְתוֹכָן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין, מִן הַמְעוּשָּׂרִין לְתוֹכָן — כּוּלָּם יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיֵאָכְלוּ בְּמוּמָן לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: if he had one hundred and he took ten ten and he took one that is not tithe, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: tithe. one of counted jumped among all those are exempt of tithed, among all must graze until they become unfit and may be eaten in its blemished by owner
llm_translation: He had a hundred and took ten, ten and took one - this is not a tithe. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: it is a tithe. If one of the designated animals jumped into them - they are exempt, if one of the tithed animals jumped into them - all of them shall graze until they develop a blemish, and then they shall be eaten by the owners.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּאֵי זֶה צַד מְעַשֵּׂר? כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר, וְעוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם פֶּתַח קָטָן כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ שְׁנַיִם יְכוֹלִין לָצֵאת כְּאֶחָד, אִימּוֹתֵיהֶם מִבַּחוּץ וְהֵם מִבִּפְנִים, וְגוֹעוֹת, וְיוֹצְאוֹת לִקְרַאת אִמָּן.
human_translation: The Sages taught In what manner does tithe He gathers them in a pen and provides them with a small, opening so that two will not be able to emerge together. The mothers outside, and are inside And bleat and emerge toward their mothers.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In what case is one considered to have fulfilled his obligation of tithing? When he gathers them into a chamber, and makes for them a small opening so that two of them cannot leave together as one, their mothers are outside while they are inside, and they moo and go out to meet their young.

hebrew_text: וְלַפְּקִינְהוּ אִינְהוּ! ״יַעֲבוֹר״ כְּתִיב, וְלֹא שֶׁיַּעֲבִירוּהוּ.
human_translation: But make them emerge written: passes and not that will cause it to pass
llm_translation: And to examine them, they are! "He shall pass" is written, and not that they should make him pass.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁדֵּי לְהוּ יַרְקָא וְלִיפְּקוּ לְוָתֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם לָקוּחַ וּמִשּׁוּם יָתוֹם.
human_translation: But throw a vegetable and they will go out toward it Rav Huna said: decree due to a purchased and due to an orphan,
llm_translation: "And for the demons to have vegetables and for them to leave! Rav Huna said: It is a decree due to theft and due to the orphan."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲבֹר תַּחַת״ — פְּרָט לַטְּרֵיפָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת תַּחַת הַשָּׁבֶט. מִצְוָה לִמְנוֹתָן בְּשֵׁבֶט. לֹא מְנָאָן בְּשֵׁבֶט, אוֹ שֶׁמְּנָאָן רְבוּצִים אוֹ עוֹמְדִים, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הָעֲשִׂירִי קֹדֶשׁ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Whatever passes under excluding a tereifa , as it does not pass “under the rod” a mitzva to count them with a rod. If one did not count them with a rod, or he counted them prone or standing, from where The verse states: “The tenth shall be sacred,” in any case,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Anything that passes underneath" - this excludes a treifah that does not pass underneath the rod. It is a mitzvah to count them with the rod. If one did not count them with the rod, or if he counted them while they were lying down or standing, from where do we derive this? The verse teaches: "The tenth one shall be holy" - in any case.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁקְּרָא שְׁמוֹ ״עֲשִׂירִי״, לֹא קְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״עֲשִׂירִי״ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִהְיֶה קֹּדֶשׁ״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. יָכוֹל הָיוּ לוֹ מֵאָה וְנָטַל עֲשָׂרָה, עֲשָׂרָה וְנָטַל אֶחָד, יָכוֹל יִהְיוּ מְעוּשָּׂרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְאֵין זֶה עֲשִׂירִי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And I have only that one called name of tenth From where one did not call the tenth The verse states: “Shall be sacred.” in any case, might one had one hundred and took ten ten and took one might they should be tithed. the verse states: “The tenth,” and this is not the tenth, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: tithe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And I have only that it called his name 'Rich', did it not call his name 'Rich' from where? The Talmud teaches to say 'It shall be holy' from every place. Could he have had a hundred and taken ten, ten and taken one, could they be tithed? The Talmud teaches 'Rich', and this is not 'Rich'. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Tithe."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּאַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גּוֹמֵל, דְּתַנְיָא: אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גּוֹמֵל אוֹמֵר: ״וְנֶחְשַׁב לָכֶם תְּרוּמַתְכֶם״ — בִּשְׁתֵּי תְרוּמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אַחַת תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְאַחַת תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? He holds in accordance with Abba Elazar ben Gomel. As it is taught Abba Elazar ben Gomel says “And your teruma shall be reckoned to you the verse speaks about two terumot . One is standard teruma , and one is teruma of the tithe.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? He holds like Abba Elazar ben Gomel, as it was taught: Abba Elazar ben Gomel says: "And it shall be counted to you as your contribution" - the Scripture speaks of two contributions, one a large contribution, and one a tithe contribution.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה נִיטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה —
human_translation: Just as standard teruma is taken by estimate, and by thought,
llm_translation: As the terumah is taken with estimation and calculation, so too is the tithe taken with estimation and calculation.

hebrew_text: אַף תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר נִטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה, וּמַעֲשֵׂר קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא תְּרוּמָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֶת מַעְשַׂר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר יָרִימוּ לַה׳ תְּרוּמָה נָתַתִּי לַלְוִיִּם לְנַחֲלָה״, וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן, מָה מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן נִיטָּל בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה — אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה נִיטָּל בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: so too, teruma of the tithe may be taken by estimate and by thought. And the Merciful One calls tithe “ teruma ,” as it is written: “For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they set apart as teruma for the Lord, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance” And animal tithe is juxtaposed to grain tithe, Just as grain tithe is separated by estimate and by thought, so too, animal tithe is separated by estimate and by thought.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The terumah of ma'aser is taken with estimation and with intent, and ma'aser is called terumah by the Merciful One, as it is written: "For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they offer as a terumah to the Lord, I have given to the Levites as an inheritance." And the comparison is made between the tithe of animals to the tithe of grain, just as the tithe of grain is taken with estimation and with intent — so too the tithe of animals is taken with estimation and with intent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עֲשִׂירִי מֵאֵלָיו הוּא קָדוֹשׁ. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁקָּרָא שְׁמוֹ ״עֲשִׂירִי״, לֹא קָרָא שְׁמוֹ ״עֲשִׂירִי״ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֲשִׂירִי יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rava says: tenth it is sacred of its own From where does Rava this If we say from that which is taught I have only that one called name of tenth From where one did not call the tenth The verse states: “The tenth shall be sacred,” in any case,
llm_translation: Rava said: "The tenth from him is holy." How does Rava know this? If you say from what is taught: "I have only that it is called 'tenth,' how do I know that it is called 'tenth'? From where? The Talmud teaches: 'The tenth shall be holy' - in any case.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הוּא דְּלָא קַרְיֵיהּ, ״קֹדֶשׁ״ קַרְיֵיהּ! אֶלָּא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְיָצָא הָעֲשִׂירִי וְלֹא דִּבֵּר — הַתְּשִׁיעִי נֶאֱכָל בְּמוּמוֹ, וְהָעֲשִׂירִי מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: But perhaps he did not call tenth, he did call it sanctified. Rather, from that which is taught one called the ninth the tenth, and the tenth emerged but did not speak, the ninth eaten a blemish. And the tenth tithe.
llm_translation: And perhaps "tenth" it is that he does not call, "holy" he calls! Rather from that which it was taught: he called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth went out and did not speak — the ninth is consumed with its blemish, and the tenth is tithed.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיבָּרַר לֵיהּ עֲשִׂירִי, אִי נָמֵי, דְּאַחְוִי עִילָּוֵיהּ!
human_translation: But perhaps it is different there, as the tenth was selected Alternatively, that he pointed at it
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, for it was clarified to him the tenth, if we say, that it should be on top of it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וּמֵת עֲשִׂירִי בַּדִּיר — תְּשִׁיעִי נֶאֱכָל בְּמוּמוֹ, וְכוּלָּם פְּטוּרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא כּוּלָּם פְּטוּרִין, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּקְדַשׁ לֵיהּ עֲשִׂירִי?
human_translation: Rather, from that which is taught one called the ninth tenth, and tenth died in the pen, ninth eaten a blemish, and all are exempt What is the reason all are exempt? not because tenth is sanctified
llm_translation: Rather, from what is taught: He called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth died in the chamber - the ninth is consumed with its blemish, and all are exempt. What is the reason that all are exempt? Not because the tenth was sanctified for it?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא דְּאִיפְּטַרוּ בְּמִנְיָן הָרָאוּי, דְּהָאָמַר רָבָא: מִנְיָן הָרָאוּי פּוֹטֵר!
human_translation: But perhaps are exempt in a tally that is fit As doesn’t Rava say: A tally fit exempts
llm_translation: Perhaps they were exempt in the appropriate count, for Rava said: The appropriate count exempts!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא דְּתַנְיָא: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְנִשְׁתַּיֵּיר עֲשִׂירִי בַּדִּיר — הַתְּשִׁיעִי נֶאֱכָל בְּמוּמוֹ, וְהָעֲשִׂירִי מַעֲשֵׂר. וְהָתַנְיָא: תְּשִׁיעִי חוּלִּין!
human_translation: Rather, from that which is taught one called the ninth tenth, and tenth remained in the pen, the ninth eaten a blemish, and the tenth is tithe. But isn’t it taught ninth is non-sacred?
llm_translation: Rather, from what is taught: It called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth remains in the pen - the ninth is consumed with its blemish, and the tenth is tithed. And it was taught: The ninth is mundane!

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן:
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: whose is this? is Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon:
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: Is this a dispute? It is Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אַף הַתְּשִׁיעִי אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ, וְהַדִּין נוֹתֵן.
human_translation: Even the ninth is not sanctified unless the name of the tenth is removed from And logical leads
llm_translation: The ninth is not holy unless the name of the tenth is removed from it, and the judgment is given.

hebrew_text: וּמָה אַחַד עָשָׂר שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב, אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ, תְּשִׁיעִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאִם נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא?
human_translation: And if the eleventh which becomes sanctified to be sacrificed is sanctified only if the name tenth is removed from ninth which does not become sanctified to be sacrificed is it not logical that if the name tenth is removed from yes, but if not, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the case of one who is making a sanctification to bring near, he is not holy unless the name "tenth" is removed from him, the ninth that is not making a sanctification to bring near — is it not the case that if the name "tenth" is removed from him — yes, if not — no?

hebrew_text: הִיא הַנּוֹתֶנֶת! אַחַד עָשָׂר שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב, אִי נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא; תְּשִׁיעִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: That provides the eleventh which becomes sanctified to be sacrificed if the name tenth is removed from yes, if not not ninth which does not become sanctified to be sacrificed, even though the name of tenth is not removed from
llm_translation: She who gives! Eleven that he makes sanctification to come close, if the name of the tenth is not uprooted from it - yes, if not - no; the ninth that does not make sanctification to come close, even though the name of the tenth is not uprooted from it.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, אַחַד עָשָׂר, דְּאִיבָּרַר לֵיהּ עֲשִׂירִי — אִי נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, eleventh which tenth selected, if the name tenth is removed from yes, if not not
llm_translation: If yes, eleven, that it was clarified to him tenth - if the name of the tenth is uprooted from him - yes, if not - no.

hebrew_text: תְּשִׁיעִי, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא אִיבָּרַר לֵיהּ עֲשִׂירִי, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ, תּוּ לָא מִידִּי.
human_translation: ninth which when tenth has not yet been selected, and even though the name tenth is not removed from nothing more
llm_translation: Ninth, that I have not clarified to him tenth, and even though the name "tenth" has not been uprooted from it, it is not from my hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִנְיָן הָרָאוּי פּוֹטֵר. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: קָפַץ אֶחָד מִן הַמְּנוּיִין לְתוֹכָן — כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין. מְנוּיִין גּוּפַיְיהוּ דְּאִיפְּטַרוּ — לָאו בְּמִנְיָן הָרָאוּי?
human_translation: Rava says: A tally fit exempts From where Rava this If we say from that which we learned one of counted jumped among all those are exempt counted themselves are exempt, not a tally fit
llm_translation: Rava said: From where is it fitting exempt. From where to him to Rava this? If say from that which we learned: One of the designated ones jumped into them — all of them are exempt. Designated ones themselves that exempted — not from where is fitting?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא דְּעַשַּׂר עִילָּוַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: But perhaps where tithed on behalf
llm_translation: And perhaps they should tithe their wool!

hebrew_text: הָהִיא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, הָא תָּנֵי: מִן הַמְעוּשָּׂרִין לְתוֹכָן!
human_translation: You cannot say teaches: of tithed among
llm_translation: That one did not find, she said, "Behold, it teaches: from the tithes within them!"

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מַאי ״מְעוּשָּׂרִין״? מַעֲשֵׂר דַּוְקָא, דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי ״יִרְעוּ״!
human_translation: But perhaps, what tithed? specifically tithe. is also precise, as it teaches: must graze
llm_translation: And perhaps what is "me'usarin"? Tithes specifically, specifically as it is taught "they shall pasture"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״יַעֲבוֹר״, וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר עָבַר. מַאי שֶׁכְּבָר עָבַר? אִי דְּעַשַּׂר עִילָּוַיְיהוּ — צְרִיכָא לְמֵימְרָא? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאִיפְּטַרוּ לְהוּ בְּמִנְיָן הָרָאוּי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says the verse states: passes but not that already passed What that already passed? If that one has separated tithe for it, is it necessary to state Rather, not where have become exempt through a tally fit Conclude from this
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The verse said "he shall pass," and not that he has already passed. What does it mean that he has already passed? If they have already counted their elevations - is it necessary to say? Rather, is it not that they were exempted from the appropriate count? Learn from this.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָיוּ לוֹ עֲשָׂרָה טְלָאִים וְהִכְנִיסָן לַדִּיר, וּמָנֶה חֲמִשָּׁה, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם — אִם מִן הַמְּנוּיִים מֵת — מוֹנֶה וּמַשְׁלִים עֲלֵיהֶם, וְאִם מִשֶּׁאֵינָן מְנוּיִים מֵת — מְנוּיִים פְּטוּרִין, וְשֶׁאֵינָן מְנוּיִים מִצְטָרְפִין לַגּוֹרֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rava: one had ten lambs and he brought them into the pen and counted five, and one of them died, if of those that had been counted died, he count and completes for them. But if of that had not been counted died, been counted are exempt, and that not been counted combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rava: If one had ten lambs and he brought them into a pen, and he counted five of them, and one of them died - if the dead one was from those that were counted, he counts and compensates for them. But if the dead one was not among those that were counted, the counted ones are exempt, and the uncounted ones are joined to another flock.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָיוּ לוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר טְלָאִים וְהִכְנִיסָן לְדִיר, וְיָצְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְאַרְבָּעָה נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ שָׁם. אוֹתָם אַרְבָּעָה, אִם בְּפֶתַח הַשִּׁשָּׁה יָצְאוּ — נוֹטֵל אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וְהַשְּׁאָר מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר;
human_translation: And Rava says: one had fourteen lambs and brought them into the pen, and six emerged through this opening and four through that opening and four remained there, if those four by the opening the six emerged, he takes one of them And the remainder, combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: And Rava said: If he had fourteen bundles of produce and he brought them into a pen, and six went out through this opening, and four through this opening, and four remained there. Those four, if they went out through the opening of the six, he takes one of them, and the rest join with another pile.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו — שִׁשָּׁה פְּטוּרִין, וְאַרְבָּעָה אַרְבְּעָה מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: But if not, six are exempt and four four, combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: And if not — six exempt, and four four combine to another threshing floor.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ אַרְבָּעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְשִׁשָּׁה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְנִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ שָׁם אַרְבָּעָה — אִם אוֹתָם אַרְבָּעָה בְּפֶתַח הַשִּׁשָּׁה יָצְאוּ — נוֹטֵל מֵהֶם אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִים; וְאִם לָאו — אַרְבָּעָה וְשִׁשָּׁה פְּטוּרִים, וְאַרְבָּעָה מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: four emerged through this opening and six through that opening, and four remained there, if those four by the opening the six emerged, takes one of them and the remainder, are exempt, But if not, four and six are exempt, And four combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: They went out four at this entrance, and six at this entrance, and four remained there - if those four went out at the entrance of the six, he takes one from them, and the rest are exempt; but if not - the four and the six are exempt, and four join another threshing floor.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ אַרְבָּעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, וְנִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ שָׁם שִׁשָּׁה — אִם אוֹתָן שִׁשָּׁה יָצְאוּ בְּפֶתַח אֶחָד — נוֹטֵל מֵהֶם אֶחָד וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִים; וְאִם לָאו — אַרְבָּעָה פְּטוּרִים, וְשִׁשָּׁה מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: four emerged through this opening, and four through that opening, and six remained there, if those six through one opening, he takes one of them and the remainder, are exempt, But if not, four are exempt. And six combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: They went out four at this entrance, and four at that entrance, and six remained there. If those six went out at one entrance, one of them takes from them one, and the rest are exempt; but if not, four are exempt, and the six join another threshing floor.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּמִנְיָן הָרָאוּי פּוֹטֵר? וְהָאַמְרַהּ רָבָא חֲדָא זִמְנָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: וַדַּאי מִנְיָן הָרָאוּי אָמְרִינַן, סְפֵק מִנְיָן הָרָאוּי, דַּחֲזֵי לְהָכָא וְדַחֲזֵי לְהָכָא — לָא אָמְרִינַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What is teaching us? that a tally fit exempt? But didn’t Rava say once? lest you say a tally definitely fit we say a tally uncertain fit where are fit to here and are fit to there, we do not say teaches us
llm_translation: What is it teaching us, that from what number is fitting exempt? And Rava said once! What might you say: and certainly from what number fitting we say, from a doubtful fitting, that it looks here and looks there - we do not say, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָיוּ לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר טְלָאִים, לֹא יֹאמַר: אֶבְרוֹר עֲשָׂרָה וְאַכְנִיסֵם לַדִּיר וְאֶטּוֹל מֵהֶם אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִים, אֶלָּא כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר, וּמוֹצִיא עֲשָׂרָה, וְנוֹטֵל מֵהֶם אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הָיוּ לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר טְלָאִים,
human_translation: And Rava says: had fifteen lambs, he may not say: I will separate ten and bring them into the pen, and I will take one of them and the rest exempt. Rather, bring into the pen, and remove ten and take one of them, And the remainder combine in another gathering. This is also taught had fifteen lambs,
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one had fifteen bundles, he should not say: I will combine ten and bring them into the chamber, and take one from them, and the rest are exempt. Rather, he should gather them into the chamber, bring in ten, take one from them, and the rest join with another granary. It was also taught in a baraita likewise: If one had fifteen bundles,

hebrew_text: לֹא יֹאמַר: אֶבְרוֹר עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶטּוֹל מֵהֶן אֶחָד וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִים, אֶלָּא כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר, וּמוֹצִיא עֲשָׂרָה, וְנוֹטֵל מֵהֶן אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר מִצְטָרְפִין לְגוֹרֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: he may not say: I will separate ten and I will take one of them and the rest exempt. Rather, bring into the pen and remove ten and take one of them, And the remainder combine in another gathering.
llm_translation: Do not say: I will gather ten and take one from them and the rest are exempt, rather gather them into the pen, bring out ten, take one from them, and the rest join together in another pen.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: תִּשְׁעָה עָשָׂר טְלָאִים, לֹא יֹאמַר: אֶבְרוֹר עֲשָׂרָה וְאֶטּוֹל מֵהֶן אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִין, אֶלָּא כּוֹנְסָן לַדִּיר, וּמוֹצִיא עֲשָׂרָה וְנוֹטֵל מֵהֶן אֶחָד, וְהַשְּׁאָר פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught nineteen lambs he may not say: I will separate ten and I will take one of them and the rest exempt; rather, bring into the pen and remove ten and take one of them, and the remainder are exempt?
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If there are nineteen bundles, one should not say: "I will designate ten and take one from them, and the rest are exempt." Rather, one should gather them into the pen, and designate ten, and take one from them, and the rest are exempt.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר סְחוֹרָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא בְּרִיגְלָא: בְּדִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים עָסְקִינַן, וְיָצְאוּ תִּשְׁעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה וְתִשְׁעָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, דְּהַאיְךְ חַד חָזֵי לְהָכָא וּלְהָכָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Seḥora interpreted before Rava at Festival We are dealing with a pen that has two openings. And nine emerged this opening and nine that opening, and this one is fit to here or to there.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of S'chora translated before Rava on foot: In a chamber that has two entrances we are dealing, and nine exited through this entrance and nine through that entrance, for how can one see here and there.

hebrew_text: וְלִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁמָּנָה תִּשְׁעָה, וְכִי מְטָא עֲשָׂרָה קָרֵי ״חַד״ מֵרֵישָׁא! קָסָבַר: עֲשִׂירִי מֵאֵלָיו קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: But let him teach where he counted nine, and when the tenth arrived he called one from the start. holds tenth is sanctified of its own
llm_translation: And to answer him: For example, if he counted nine, and when he reaches ten, he calls it "one" from the beginning! He holds: The tenth is sanctified from the first.

hebrew_text: וְלִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ בְּגוֹרֶן, וּמְנָאָן זוּגוֹת זוּגוֹת! קָסָבַר: עֲשִׂירִי לְמִנְיָן בְּהֵמוֹת הוּא קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: But let him teach to gathering but he counted them pair by pair, holds tenth according to the number of animals is sanctified,
llm_translation: And to count for him in the threshing floor, and he counted pairs, pairs! He thought: The tenth for counting of animals is holy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: זְכַאי אִימֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּר סְחוֹרָה, דְּשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּרִיגְלָא כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said The mother of Rav Huna bar Seḥora merited who explained the halakha at the Festival in accordance with own halakha .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: The merit of the mother of Rav Huna son of Sichra, who taught him Mishnah with his feet as she taught him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם כְּאַחַת — מוֹנֶה אוֹתָם שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם, מְנָאָן אֶחָד — תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי מְקוּלְקָלִין.
human_translation: two emerged as one, one counts them as twos, counted one, ninth and tenth are flawed,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If two witnesses went out together - one counts them as two, two counts them as four, but one counts them as nine and ten counts them as unreliable."

hebrew_text: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — שְׁלָשְׁתָּן מְקוּדָּשִׁין: הַתְּשִׁיעִי נֶאֱכָל בְּמוּמוֹ, וְהָעֲשִׂירִי מַעֲשֵׂר, וְאַחַד עָשָׂר קָרֵב שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: called ninth: Tenth, and tenth: Ninth, and the eleventh: Tenth, three of them are sacred, The ninth is eaten in its blemished and the tenth is tithe, and eleventh is sacrificed as a peace offering, And renders a substitute the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "ninth," and the eleventh "tenth" - three of them are sanctified: the ninth is eaten with its blemish, and the tenth is tithed, and the eleventh brings peace offerings and makes an exchange - these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי יֵשׁ תְּמוּרָה עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה? אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִילּוּ הָיָה תְּמוּרָה — לֹא הָיָה קָרֵב. קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר מְקוּדָּשׁ. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי מִמֶּנּוּ, אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר מְקוּדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: and does a substitute render a substitute? said in the name of Rabbi Meir: if it were a substitute it would not be sacrificed, one called the ninth Tenth, and the tenth: Tenth, and the eleventh: Tenth, the eleventh is not consecrated. This is the principle: any where the name tenth was not removed from eleventh is not consecrated.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Is there a substitution that makes a substitution? They said in the name of Rabbi Meir: If there was a substitution - it was not brought near. It called the ninth "the tenth," and the tenth "the tenth," and to the eleventh ten - the eleventh is not sanctified. This is the principle: anything that does not remove the name of the tenth from it, the eleventh is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְנָאָן זוּגוֹת זוּגוֹת, קִינְטָרִין קִינְטָרִין — עֲשִׂירִי לְמִנְיָנוֹ הוּא קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: counted pair by pair, hundred [ kinteran ] hundred, tenth to his number is sanctified.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Where are pairs, pairs, and cinctarins, cinctarins - the tenth to its count is holy."

hebrew_text: ״לְמִנְיָנוֹ״ מַאי? רַב מָארִי אָמַר: לַמִּנְיָן שֶׁלּוֹ הוּא קָדוֹשׁ, רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: לְמִנְיַן בְּהֵמוֹת הוּא קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: to his number, what Rav Mari says: It is sanctified according to his counting, Rav Kahana says: It is sanctified according to the number of animals,
llm_translation: "Regarding 'leminyano,' what is it? Rav Mari said: for the counting of it is holy, Rav Kahana said: for the counting of animals it is holy."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם כְּאַחַת — מוֹנֶה אוֹתָן שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. מְנָאָן אֶחָד — תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי מְקוּלְקָלִין.
human_translation: We learned two emerged as one, one counts them as twos. counted one ninth and tenth are flawed,
llm_translation: We learned: if two went out together - count them as two, two. If one of them is missing - the ninth and tenth are disqualified.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לַמִּנְיָן שֶׁלּוֹ הוּא קָדוֹשׁ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי הָווּ תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי מְקוּלְקָלִין, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְמִנְיַן בְּהֵמוֹת הוּא קָדוֹשׁ, לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״ קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״ קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says: It is sanctified according to his counting, due to that the ninth and tenth are flawed, and he called the tenth ninth, and the eleventh tenth. But according to the one who says is sanctified according to the number of animals he called the ninth ninth, and the tenth he called: Tenth.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says: "For the count of his own, he is holy," therefore the ninth and tenth are interchanged, and for the tenth, it is called "ninth," and for the eleventh, it is called "tenth." But according to the one who says: "For the count of animals, he is holy," for the ninth, it is called "ninth," and for the tenth, it is called "tenth"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כִּי אָמֵינָא אֲנָא — הֵיכִי דְּאִיכַּוֵּין לְאַפּוֹקֵי זוּגוֹת זוּגוֹת, הֵיכָא דִּנְפַק מִמֵּילָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: When I said where he intended to take out pair by pair, where emerged by itself not
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: "For I say - how that to match up pairs, where that to come out from the word - no."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנָאָן לְמַפְרֵעַ — עֲשִׂירִי שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן הוּא קָדוֹשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְמִנְיַן בְּהֵמוֹת הוּא קָדוֹשׁ — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לַמִּנְיָן שֶׁלּוֹ הוּא קָדוֹשׁ, עֲשִׂירִי ״חַד״ קָרֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Come hear counted them backward, tenth in the numbering, is sanctified. Granted, according to the one who says is sanctified according to the animals well, But according to the one who says it is sanctified to his counting, he called tenth one.
llm_translation: Come and hear: From where do we know that one who is extravagant is considered holy? It is the tenth in the count. Granted, according to the one who says that in the count of animals it is considered holy - it is fine. But according to the one who says that his own count is holy, the tenth is called "one"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתֵיהּ בְּמִנְיָנָא פָּרְסָאָה, דְּקָרוּ לְעַשְׂרָה ״חַד״.
human_translation: Rava said: because it in Persian counting, as they call the tenth one,
llm_translation: Rava said: Since it is included in the count of ten, they read it as "one."

hebrew_text: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״, שֶׁשְּׁלָשְׁתָּן מְקוּדָּשִׁין?
human_translation: called ninth: Tenth, and tenth: Ninth, and the eleventh: Tenth, The Sages taught: From where that if called the ninth Tenth, and the tenth Ninth, and the eleventh Tenth, that three of them are sanctified?
llm_translation: He called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "ninth," and the eleventh "tenth." The Rabbis taught: From where do we know that if he called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "ninth," and the eleventh "tenth," that all three are sanctified?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל מַעְשַׂר בָּקָר וָצֹאן כֹּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲבוֹר תַּחַת הַשָּׁבֶט הָעֲשִׂירִי יִהְיֶה קֹּדֶשׁ״, יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף שְׁמִינִי וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר?
human_translation: The verse states: “And all the tithe of the herd or the flock, whatever passes under the rod, the tenth shall be sacred to the Lord” might that I include even eighth or twelfth
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And all the tithe of the herd or the flock, whatever passes under the rod, the tenth one shall be holy." (Leviticus 27:32) Could I perhaps increase even to the eighth and the twelfth?

hebrew_text: אָמְרַתְּ: הוֹאִיל וְהוּא קָדוֹשׁ, וְטָעוּתוֹ מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת, מָה הוּא אֵינוֹ מְקוּדָּשׁ אֶלָּא בְּסָמוּךְ, אַף טָעוּתוֹ אֵינָהּ מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת אֶלָּא בְּסָמוּךְ.
human_translation: You said since is sanctified and mistake is sanctified, Just as is sanctified only with close so too, mistake is sanctified only if it is close
llm_translation: Statement: Since he is holy, and his mistake becomes sanctified, what is it? It is only sanctified when adjacent, so too his mistake is only sanctified when adjacent.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מָה הוּא מְיוּחָד, אַף טָעוּתוֹ מְיוּחֶדֶת!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught just as itself is unique, so too, mistake is unique,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Just as he is unique, so too is his mistake unique!

hebrew_text: תָּאנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר קָדוֹשׁ עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁתּוֹק בַּתְּשִׁיעִי, וְיִקְרָא לָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״.
human_translation: a tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The eleventh is never sanctified unless is silent the ninth and he calls the tenth ninth and the eleventh tenth.
llm_translation: The figs of the Mishna stood before Rabbi Yochanan. Is this a contradiction? It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: One should always not designate one as holy until he reaches the ninth year, and he should be called the tenth, and not the tenth, but the ninth.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: טָעוּת מַעֲשֵׂר תְּמוּרָה הָוֵי, וְסָבַר לַהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֵין מֵימֵר חוֹזֵר וּמֵימֵר.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: a mistake tithe, a substitute And holds in accordance with his father, who says: One cannot effect substitution and again effect substitution,
llm_translation: He thought according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: A mistaken tithe exchange it is, and he thought according to Abuh, who said: One does not say "retract and say."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בַּתְּשִׁיעִי, קְרָאָן ״תְּשִׁיעִי״ — עֲשִׂירִי וְחוּלִּין מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, עֲשִׂירִי מֵאֵלָיו קָדוֹשׁ, לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״ קָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava says: two emerged as the ninth, he called them ninth, tenth, and a non-sacred are intermingled with each other. tenth is sanctified of its own ninth he called it the ninth.
llm_translation: Rava said: Two offerings went out on the ninth day of Sukkot, their designation is "ninth" - the tenth day and the common offerings are mixed with each other, the tenth day is holy from itself, for the ninth day "ninth" is what it is called.

hebrew_text: קְרָאָן ״עֲשִׂירִי״, עֲשִׂירִי וּתְשִׁיעִי מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״עֲשִׂירִי״ קָא קָרֵי לְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: he called them tenth, tenth, and ninth are intermingled with each other. What is the reason? He called both of them tenth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'ra'an 'asiri', 'asiri u'teshii m'oravin zeh bazeh. Mai ta'ama? 'Asiri' ka karei lehu l'tarvayehu." English translation: "It is called 'tenth', the tenth and the ninth are mixed with each other. What is the reason? 'Tenth' is called to both of them."

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בָּעֲשִׂירִי וּקְרָאָן ״עֲשִׂירִי״, עֲשִׂירִי וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה. קְרָאָן ״אַחַד עָשָׂר״, עֲשִׂירִי וְחוּלִּין מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: two emerged as the tenth, and he called them tenth, tenth, and eleventh are intermingled with each other. he called them eleventh, the tenth and a non-sacred are intermingled with each other.
llm_translation: Two went out on the tenth day and they read "tenth," the tenth and one more are mixed with each other. They read "eleven," the tenth and non-consecrated items are mixed with each other.

hebrew_text: הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּכֹל בַּת אַחַת תַּרְוַויְיהוּ קָא קָדְשִׁי, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Why do I this additional This identical that This teaches us that every as one they are both sanctified, and even though the name tenth was not removed from
llm_translation: This, what to me? That is it! This, it is teaching us: that all in one daughter they are equal, and even though the name "rich" is not removed from him.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ, וּתְנַן זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ — אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר מְקוּדָּשׁ! הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, אֲבָל בְּבַת אַחַת — תַּרְוַיְיהוּ קָא קָדְשִׁי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana sat and recited this halakha . Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: But the name tenth has not been removed from it. And didn’t we learn this is the principle: any where the name tenth was not removed from eleventh is not consecrated? This statement, one after the other. But at the same time, both of them are sanctified.
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Kahana and saying to him that thing heard, said to him Rav Ashei to Rav Kahana: And not uprooted name "tenth" from it, and we learned this principle: As long as not uprooted name "tenth" from it — not one ten sanctified! Those words one after another, but in one instance — both are sanctified.

hebrew_text: זֶה אַחַר זֶה — בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר מְקוּדָּשׁ. ״זֶה הַכְּלָל״ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵיתוֹיֵי בְּבַת אַחַת?
human_translation: one after the other? teaches explicitly: one called the ninth Tenth, and the tenth: Tenth, and the eleventh: Tenth, the eleventh is not consecrated. What This is the principle, to include? to include at the same time?
llm_translation: This one after this — indeed it teaches it: it called the ninth "tenth," and the tenth "tenth," and the eleventh "tenth" — the eleventh is not sanctified. "This is the principle" — what does it come to include? Not to include in one group?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי יָצָא עֲשִׂירִי וְלֹא דִּבֵּר, דְּהָא לֹא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם ״עֲשִׂירִי״ הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: No; to include the tenth emerged and did not speak as he did not remove the name tenth from
llm_translation: Not, to the witnesses went out rich and not spoke, for the name "rich" was not uprooted from him.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בָּעֲשִׂירִי, וְלֹא קָדַם אֶחָד מֵהֶן אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וּקְרָאָן ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — עֲשִׂירִי וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: כֹּל בְּבַת אַחַת תַּרְוַיְיהוּ קָא קָדְשִׁי.
human_translation: because if you do not say this that which is taught two emerged as the tenth, and one not before the other, and he called them tenth, tenth and eleventh are intermingled with each other. He did not remove the name tenth from Rather, is it not due to that we say: any at the same time both of them are sanctified?
llm_translation: If you don't say it like this, but rather as it was taught: Two went out on the tenth, and neither of them preceded his fellow, and they are called "tenth" - the tenth and the eleventh are mixed with each other, and yet the name "tenth" is not removed from it! Rather, it is not because we say: Both are sanctified with one utterance.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא אִירְיָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דִּקְדֵים חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וְאַפֵּיק לְרֵישֵׁיהּ, וְקַרְיֵיהּ ״אַחַד עָשָׂר״, וַהֲדַר אִיעָרוּב וּנְפוּק בַּהֲדָדֵי, וּקְרִינְהוּ ״עֲשִׂירִי״, דְּהָא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: If it is due to that there is no argument. Here we are dealing with where one of before and brought its head out and called eleventh, and afterward it became intermingled and came out together, and he called them tenth as name tenth was removed from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If not for this, would it not be called, what are we dealing with here? He took one of them and brought it to the head, and he called it "eleven," then he mixed it up and took it out with the other, and called it "tenth," for the name "tenth" was removed from it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״לֹא קָדַם״ קָתָנֵי! מַאי ״לֹא קָדַם״? דַּהֲדַר אִיעָרוּב.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one not before What one not before that it returned and became intermingled
llm_translation: And this, "Lo kadam" is taught! What is "Lo kadam"? That it is subsequently mixed.

hebrew_text: וּכְמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי, דְּאִי רַבִּי — הָאָמַר: ״אַחַד עָשָׂר״ לָא הָוֵי עֲקִירָה!
human_translation: And in accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi As, if Rabbi Doesn’t say: eleventh, it is not a removal
llm_translation: And according to whom? Not like Rabbi, for if it were like Rabbi - he said: "eleven" is not considered uprooting!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי, כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּהֵמוֹת טוּבָא, דְּאָמְרִינַן: חַד עִישּׂוּרָא קָאָמַר, הָכָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ בְּהֵמוֹת טְפֵי.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi when Rabbi said where has many animals that we say say: Ḥad issura , Here where he does not have many animals
llm_translation: Even if you say "Rabbi," when Rabbi said, "Where there is a large animal," as we say: He is talking about a large coin, here where there is no small animal.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי? דְּתַנְיָא: קָרָא לַעֲשִׂירִי ״אַחַד עָשָׂר״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר קָדוֹשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַד עָשָׂר קָדוֹשׁ. כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֱקַר שֵׁם עֲשִׂירִי הֵימֶנּוּ — אֵין אַחַד עָשָׂר קָדוֹשׁ. אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּהֵמוֹת טוּבָא, דְּאָמְרִינַן: חַד עִישּׂוּרָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: what Rabbi As it is taught called the tenth eleventh and the eleventh tenth, eleventh not sanctified; the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: eleventh is sanctified. Rabbi said a principle: As long as the name tenth has not been removed from eleventh is not sanctified. Rava said: Here we are dealing with where he has many animals, that we say say: Ḥad issura .
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi? As it was taught: The verse calls the eleventh "one of eleven," and not "eleventh" - the eleventh is not holy, these are the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: The eleventh is holy. Rabbi said in general: As long as the name "tenth" is not removed from it, the eleventh is not holy. Rava said: What are we dealing with here? For example, if he has very good animals, as we say: he is speaking of one tenth.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בָּעֲשִׂירִי, תָּנֵי חֲדָא: יִרְעוּ, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יִקְרְיבוּ, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: יָמוּתוּ.
human_translation: two emerged as the tenth, One tanna graze And one tanna be sacrificed. And is taught another must die.
llm_translation: They went out on the tenth. One teaching: they shall graze, and another teaching: they shall bring near, and another teaching: they shall die.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּתַנְיָא יִרְעוּ — רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: אֵין מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל״
human_translation: not difficult: This who taught graze is the Rabbis, who say: One may not bring sacrificial to a situation the disqualification.
llm_translation: Not difficult, this that it was taught: "They shall graze" — it is the Rabbis, for they say: "One does not bring sacrifices to a disqualified house."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתָנֵי יִקְרְיבוּ — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל.
human_translation: And this who teaches: be sacrificed, is Rabbi Shimon, who says one may bring sacrificial to a situation the disqualification
llm_translation: And this that it teaches "they shall bring near" - Rabbi Shimon, he said: "They bring holy things to the disqualified house."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתָנֵי יָמוּתוּ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: טָעוּת מַעֲשֵׂר, תְּמוּרָה הָוְיָא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: תְּמוּרַת מַעֲשֵׂר מֵתָה.
human_translation: And this who teaches: must die, is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: a mistake tithe, a substitute Rabbi Yehuda holds a substitute for tithe must die.
llm_translation: And this that it teaches "they shall surely die" - Rabbi Yehuda, it is, as he said: a mistaken tithe, it shall be exchanged, for Rabbi Yehuda holds: the exchange of a tithe is nullified.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה תְּמוּרַת מַעֲשֵׂר מֵתָה? וְהָתְנַן, אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִילּוּ הָיָה תְּמוּרָה לֹא הָיָה קָרֵב, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר קָרֵב!
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda hold a substitute for tithe must die? But didn’t we learn said in the name of Rabbi Meir, if it were a substitute it would not be sacrificed, By inference, Rabbi Yehuda holds sacrificed,
llm_translation: And he holds, Rabbi Yehuda, the exchange of tithe is invalid? And we learned in a Mishnah in the name of Rabbi Meir: If it were an exchange, it would not be brought near, implying that Rabbi Yehuda holds it is brought near!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְמַאי דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ קָאָמַר, וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין אַחַד עָשָׂר לִשְׁלָמִים, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב, וְזֶה אֵין עוֹשֶׂה קְדוּשָּׁה לִיקְרַב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. קָדוֹשׁ לִיקְרַב הוּא דְּלָא הוּא עָבֵיד, הָא אִיהוּ גּוּפֵיהּ קָרֵיב!
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Meir is saying to what he holds, but isn’t it taught The difference between eleventh and a peace offering is only that this, renders sanctified to be sacrificed, but that, not render sanctified to be sacrificed; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda? It is does not render sanctified to be sacrificed, itself is sacrificed
llm_translation: And if you will say: What is Rabbi Meir explaining in his reasoning? And it was taught: There is no difference between one who is eleven years old and one who is twelve, except that this one performs sanctification to bring near, and this one does not perform sanctification to bring near, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. It is sanctification to bring near that he does not perform, but he himself brings near!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם מִן הַבָּקָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אַחַד עָשָׂר לִשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: And furthermore, as it is taught If of the herd, to include eleventh as a peace offering.
llm_translation: And furthermore, as it was taught: "If from the cattle" - to include eleven for peace offerings.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף הַתְּשִׁיעִי? אָמַרְתָּ: וְכִי הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְפָנָיו מְקַדֵּשׁ אוֹ לְאַחֲרָיו מְקַדֵּשׁ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר — לְאַחֲרָיו מְקַדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: might that I include even the ninth You say But does consecration sanctify before or sanctify after You must say sanctifies after
llm_translation: I might say that I should also increase the number of cups of wine to nine? You said: Does one sanctify before Him or after Him? You should say - after Him sanctifies.

hebrew_text: סְתָם סִיפְרָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְקָתָנֵי: ״מִן הַבָּקָר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אַחַד עָשָׂר לִשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: who is unattributed Sifra ? Rabbi Yehuda. And is teaching of the herd, to include eleventh as a peace offering.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "S'tam sifra mani? Rabbi Yehuda, ve'katanei: 'Min ha'boker' - le'rabot echad asar lishlamim." English translation: "A random book, who is it from? Rabbi Yehuda, and the Tanna teaches: 'From the morning' - to include the eleventh for peace offerings."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי אַבָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּמַעֲשֵׂר בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם תַּקָּלָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Abba, interpreted before Rabbi Yoḥanan: We are dealing with tithe in the present and due to a mishap
llm_translation: Instead, Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi Abba, translated it before Rabbi Yochanan: "We are dealing with tithes in this time, and because of a difficulty."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא תְּרֵי? אֲפִילּוּ חַד נָמֵי! לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא חַד דְּלֵית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא, אֲבָל תְּרֵי, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפִישִׁי פְּסֵידָא — לִישַׁהִינְהוּ עַד דְּנִיפּוֹל בְּהוּ מוּמָא וְלֵיכְלִינְהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, why specifically two even one is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary one as there is no loss. But two since the loss is great he should leave them until they develop a blemish, and eat them. teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning of "two"? Even one is not necessary! He is not saying: One that does not have a blemish is not necessary, but two, since if one becomes blemished, they can lean on the other until it becomes blemished and they can eat it, this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״צֵא וְעַשֵּׂר עָלַי״, רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — קָדוֹשׁ, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ. וְרַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁדַּרְתָּיךָ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי.
human_translation: was stated: one who says to his agent: Go and separate tithe on my Rav Pappi says in the name of Rava: called the ninth tenth, it is sanctified But eleventh tenth it is not sanctified And Rav Pappa says: Even called the ninth tenth it is not sanctified, as say to him: I sent you to my benefit and not to my detriment.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who says to his emissary, "Go and tithe for me," Rav Pappi in the name of Rava said: If he called it the ninth tithe, it is holy, but if he called it the eleventh tithe, it is not holy. And Rav Papa said: Even if he called it the ninth tithe, it is not holy, for he said to him: "For the purpose of fixing you, not to distort you."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״צֵא וּתְרוֹם״ — תּוֹרֵם כְּדַעַת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And what is different from that which we learned one who says to his agent: Go and separate separates in accordance with the intention of the homeowner.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from what we learned: One who says to his messenger, "Go and lift up" - he lifts up according to the will of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת — תּוֹרֵם בְּבֵינוֹנִית, אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשִּׁים. פִּיחֵת עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ הוֹסִיף עֲשָׂרָה — תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה?
human_translation: If he does not know the intention of homeowner he separates an intermediate one-fiftieth he subtracted ten or added ten his teruma teruma .
llm_translation: If he does not know the mind of the homeowner - he contributes in moderation, one out of fifty. He added ten or subtracted ten - is his contribution a contribution?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא דְּתָרֵים בְּעַיִן יָפָה, וְאִיכָּא דְּתָרֵים בְּעַיִן רָעָה, אָמַר: לְהָכִי אֲמַדְתִּיךְ. הָכָא טָעוּתָא הִיא, אָמַר: לָא אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִיטְעֵי.
human_translation: say There, since there are who separate teruma generously and there are who separate teruma sparingly, say: I estimated that you such as this, here, it is a mistake, say: I did not want you to make a mistake.
llm_translation: They said: There, since there are some who require a good eye, and there are some who require a bad eye, he said: Therefore I have instructed you. Here it is a mistake, he said: I will not instruct you to plant.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת בְּכוֹרוֹת.
llm_translation: We will now deal with the tithe of an animal, and we conclude with the tractate of Bechorot.
